column2: Craig Davis, MD - Granger Medical Clinic
column3: Craig Davis, MD at Granger Medical Clinic serves patients throughout West Jordan, Utah and the surrounding Salt Lake County area. As a dedicated physician with Granger Medical Clinic, Dr. Davis provides comprehensive medical care with a patient
column38: Kaye Willesen|Terrie Johnson|Teresa "TJ" Ball|Natalia Lopes|Jeanette Gillman|Gene Vought|Michael Moore|Donna Carpenter
column40: How many of you see Dr. Davis when you go to him.  I always have my face in a hole and my back expertly prepared for the injection when he walks in with a friendly greeting with that deep calm voice and we move right along with the injections.  Before I know it it's over, he tells me I did great and the mystery man is gone.  I leave feeling great.  Kyle, my PA always knows when it's time to see Dr. Davis.  Great team.  Great service|I have been a patient of Dr. Craig Davis for many years.  My experience always has been a positive one because he cares about me and wants to help make my life better.  I have literally been given my life back through his procedures to help me with what has been excruciating pain over more than 12 years.  Because of his expertise and knowledge, I now can live a better and more fulfilling life.  There really aren't sufficient words to express my gratitude to Dr. Davis and his staff for all they have done to relieve pain in my back, my hips, and my knees.  I recommend Dr. Craig Davis to everyone I meet who struggles with back and joint pain because of my own personal experiences.  I give them 5 stars for excellence in every way!|Dr. Davis & his assistant are cordial & professional. Good at explaining procedures & options. Able to make an appointment within a week. My only regret was not taking a photo of Dr. D's colorful socks! Signage could be clearer outside the building - had to make a few loops around. (But then, I'm directionally impaired.) Reception wall very high - seeing tops of heads only, with the exception of one lower desk. Needs a little color in the all shades of gray interior. Overall, treated well and not feeling pain, which was the purpose of my visit!|They called me the day after I saw my primary doctor. They set up an appointment for next day. They sent me all the paper work to investigate about my health life. They saw me on my set up time. The NP was super nice. The doctor examed me quickly. He is a very nice man. They gave me the referral to physiotherapist.  They will see me in two weeks.|Very good experience. I have seen Dr Davis a few times for back pain and his procedure is very effective and helps get out of the constant pain for a while. Friendly staff would recommend him.|Dr Craig Davis has been exceptionally patient with me and has always been very supportive and caring of my medical needs. He has gone beyond my expectations with communicating my medical situation and help me plan the best possible treatment and direction for recovery. The whole staff has been very supportive and patient with my medical care. Thank you so much for everything you all do!|Hope nobody has to get a steroid injection, but, if you do, this place was great. Staff was very helpful, upbeat, and just made a very anxious me more relaxed and comfortable. They were very efficient and the online registration forms were not bad, paperwork sucks and can get repetitive, but they actually had them and all I had to do was read, sign, and initial a few things and before I knew it I was back in the car heading home.|Dr Davis is so friendly and personable that it is easy to talk with him. I was taking a Med that when I first took it, it made me dizzy and throw up, so I had greatly reduced what I was taking. With him being thorough in talking with me, this was brought up and made me realize that this is the med that is to help with my leg issue. So I will be taking it at night...I did last night and it actually helps me sleep, and believe it started to help with my leg issue. I give him a full 10 rating!

column2: Granger Medical Clinic - Pain & Spine, West Jordan
column3:
Granger Medical Clinic - Pain & Spine serves West Jordan, Utah and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management and spine care services. Established as part of the larger Granger Medical network, this specialized clinic focuses on diagnosing and treating acute and chronic pain conditions through evidence-based approaches and personalized treatment plans. Their team of board-certified physicians combines extensive clinical experience with advanced medical technologies to address a wide spectrum of pain-related disorders affecting the spine, joints, and nervous system.

At Granger Medical Clinic - Pain & Spine, patients receive access to multidisciplinary treatment options including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and minimally invasive techniques. The clinic specializes in treating conditions such as herniated discs, spinal stenosis, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Their approach emphasizes improving functionality and quality of life while minimizing reliance on opioid medications whenever possible.

Patient-Centered Approach

The clinical team prioritizes patient education and shared decision-making, ensuring that individuals understand their diagnosis and participate actively in their treatment journey. New patients benefit from comprehensive evaluations that consider medical history, physical examination findings, and appropriate diagnostic imaging to develop targeted intervention strategies. The clinic's modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology in a comfortable, supportive environment.

Location and Accessibility

Conveniently located at 9001 3200 W, West Jordan, UT 84088, the clinic provides easy access for residents throughout Salt Lake County. The facility offers ample parking and is designed for accessibility. For appointments or inquiries, patients can contact the clinic directly at +1 801-569-5520 or visit their website at https://www.grangermedical.com/specialties/pain-spine/ to learn more about available services and treatment options.

column40:
The front desk staff are knowledgeable, respectful and prompt.
A very short wait and on into procedures where I was greeted and warmly by the prep nurse.
Another very short wait and I was escorted to the room where my procedure was to take place.
There I took instructions from two of Dr. Davis's assistance.
Each step of the procedure.
I was made very comfortable as I heard the kind voice of Dr Davis enter the room. Again step by step information was given.
A painless procedure was performed.
From the time of my first appointment with Dr Davis he has treated me like I am his best friend.
I quickly noticed that he treats all of his patience the same way.|I was experiencing severe lower back pain and called to get an appt to see Dr Davis, Kyle Harmer. Not only were they able to get me in quick but got my MRI approved quick and had my epidural injection  shortly after !! Dr Davis has ALL the qualities you hope for  caring, compassionate, knowledgeable , reassuring and a sense of humor! My injection tremendously helped relieve the pain immediately! Did I mention, I love his goofy socks ! His techs are also VERY friendly! Thanks  Dr Davis !! You ROCK !!|I had a challenging experience with this Dr. Ashleigh Byrne. And come to find out other people feel this way to. While I believe she is skilled in her field, I felt that my concerns and questions were not adequately addressed during my visit. I left feeling overwhelmed and as though I was taking up her time, which made it difficult for me to engage in a meaningful conversation about my results. I think it would be beneficial if she spent more time with her patients to ensure all their questions are answered. Based on this experience, I will seek care elsewhere in the future.|Jared Mathis is an amazing physician. I have seen him for nearly a decade now. He has always been kind, compassionate, knowledgeable...he doesn't just listen to you, but he truly HEARS you. He is resourceful & puts in every effort to care for his patients. HIGHLY recommended from a patient with an extensive & complex medical history.|First visit with Ahleigh Byrne and she was amazing!  I didn't feel rushed at all and she explained everything clearly.

The office staff was all very friendly... so much so that I didn't realize I'd arrived an hour early for my appointment until after I was leaving thinking it was so much earlier in the day than it should be.  They were so kind, didn't make me feel foolish at all for the mistake.   Not looking forward to any injections, but i feel I'm in safe hands for the journey ahead.|I can't say enough great thing about Granger Pain and Spine. I have been going here for years and they have been there for me. They treat the whole patient not just your pain. They take the time when you are there for your appointments, if you have questions or needs anytime and they follow up with everything you need with a few hours of asking. I would highly recommend this office if you need a pain specialist because they get it and there whole purpose is to make you feel better.|I'm an established client here. I'm very pleased and grateful for the responsiveness of the providers and the quality care they provide me. I've had procedures and medications provided, all of which have been very helpful in allowing me to just live my life. Don't know where I'd be without them.|Dr. Ashleigh Byrne and her team are amazing.  They  take the time to listen and understand the discomfort or pain client is feeling. They are kind, caring and exhibit great bedside matter. I  was in a lot of pain as a result of a disc that was pressing against my sciatic nerve.  I was struggling to walk and do day to day activities. After meeting with Dr Byrne and coming up with a plan to address my pain. The team went to work!  The results have been an 85% reduction in pain. I am able to go to work, and complete  day to day activities. Thank you so much for all your care and help.

column3:
Interventional Spine & Pain Management - Provo serves patients throughout Provo, Utah and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Devan Partridge, our clinic has established itself as a leading destination for those seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. We combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address each patient's unique circumstances and develop personalized treatment plans that deliver meaningful results.

At our state-of-the-art facility, we offer specialized treatments for a diverse range of conditions including persistent headaches, debilitating neck and back discomfort, cancer-related pain, joint issues, and numerous other pain disorders. Dr. Partridge brings extensive expertise as an Interventional Pain Physician to every consultation, ensuring patients receive the highest standard of care tailored to their specific needs.

Advanced Treatment Approaches

Our practice specializes in FDA-approved, minimally invasive spine procedures that provide effective pain relief with reduced recovery time. These innovative techniques allow many patients to avoid more invasive surgical interventions while still achieving significant improvement in their symptoms and functionality.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

We believe in a comprehensive approach to pain management that addresses not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of discomfort. Our mission extends beyond temporary relief—we're committed to providing enduring pain management solutions that promote overall well-being and enhance quality of life for our patients. Every treatment plan is developed with careful consideration of the individual's specific circumstances, goals, and lifestyle needs.

Schedule Your Consultation Today

Don't allow pain to limit your life any longer. Contact Dr. Partridge and our compassionate team to begin your journey toward effective pain management. We welcome new patients and look forward to helping you regain comfort and mobility.

Website: https://www.utahpaincenter.com/

Phone: +1 385-476-7830

Location: 1055 N 300 W #316, Provo, UT 84604, United States
column11:
Experience relief with Dr. Devan Partridge, your trusted Interventional Pain Physician, committed to delivering personalized therapy. Our clinic specializes in tailored treatments for a wide range of conditions, including headaches, neck and back discomfort, cancer pain, joint issues, and more. Discover the safety and effectiveness of FDA-approved, minimally invasive spine procedures, and our comprehensive approach to pain management.

Our mission is to provide enduring pain relief, promote well-being and enhance your quality of life. Count on us for compassionate, personalized care that caters to your unique needs.

Don't let pain hold you back any longer. Get in touch today to schedule a consultation with Dr. Partridge.
column38: Kaylee Butler|Abby Washburn|Ryan DeNiro|Clarice Wayman|Robin|Anita Del Val|David Wilson|Todd Ashton
column40:
Dr. Partridge and his staff are the dream team. He makes you feel SO comfortable. He REASSURES you throughout the procedure and lets you know where he's at and how much longer. They have soft music playing and their conversations in the room distract you from what's happening. McKenna was so good afterwards at making sure I was 100% okay to leave without any issues she wanted to make sure I was fully relaxed before she let me go. I can't thank this team enough. Thank you for all you do. Making lives better one patient at a time!|I've been experiencing chronic back pain for years. Dr partridge is the most caring, knowledgeable, helpful doctor I've been too. He doesn't just want to put a bandaid over your pain, he wants to find a solution and wants to see you live a pain free meaningful life. His staff are always SO kind and helpful, we're always greeted with smiling faces. I cannot recommend this office more. Thank you Dr partridge and McKenna for always being so helpful and welcoming.|I went to the Murray Office for 6 years...before coming to the Provo Office. I wish I would have came here first there is no comparison between the two. The Provo office rocks! They have always been friendly, easy to make appointments with, they answer their phone unlike the other place. They are professional, clean office and waiting area, nice atmosphere. I had a lumbar injection today by Dr. P and it actually didn't hurt. I'm so used to feeling like I'm being stabbed at the murray office I was shocked by the amazing job he did. The staff has always been professional and friendly. If I could give this place and all it's employees 10 stars I would..
Thanks to everyone at the Provo office you all have earned the highest rating by far!!|I got into a car wreck, in  which I had a lower back injury (L5) I was in severe pain. I had an ablasion done by Devon  Partridge DO. less than a week ago. My back pain is almost non-existent. Dr. Partridge definitely has magical hands. Dr.Partridge and his staff are wonderful to deal with they truly care about their patients.|Dr Partridge and staff are so humble!  And they are so good and thorough at their jobs that humility is not what you'd expect.  Seriously, so trustworthy.  And friendly.  Excellent people to trust your health with.|This is the first time I'm genuinely excited about going to the doctor! Everyone is so warm and friendly, and I absolutely love seeing their smiles. It makes a world of difference! I've never felt this comfortable sharing everything with my doctor. Usually, I struggle to express myself and forget what I want to say, but this time it's different!

And let me tell you, my doctor is fantastic! I wouldn't drive all the way f,rom Moab if he wasn't. My pain has significantly reduced, and it lasts much longer compared to when I visited another doctor. He's not only friendly but also explains everything so clearly, making sure I understand it all.

The nurses are simply the best! They are so sweet and caring, it's hard not to smile when I'm around them. Macally is incredibly nice and has always been flexible with me, whether I'm running late or need to reschedule an appointment. I truly appreciate their support and kindness! It's such a joyful experience to be there!|The choice to visit a clinic for chronic pain is obviously intensely personal. Pain clinics by their nature may have inherent tensions. Patients with chronic pain may also be dependent on certain medications. The clinic is required to provide the highest level of professional and ethical care, while under stringent rules of regulatory oversight.
The clinic (not just Dr. Partridge, but also his medical and administrative team) meets these objectives exactly. You will not be judged for medical or medicinal realities. You won't be assumed to be there for motives other than chronic pain. As they (the physician and staff) come to know you, they will assess on the basis of your medical needs the quality of your life. As they approach the task with integrity, they will expect the same from patients, resulting a personal relationship that exceeds and is a relief from many standard assembly line specialty clinics. They will certainly treat your physical pain, and treat the difficulty of being in pain as well.
The office's organization is superb, and processes procedures and prescriptions efficiently in a highly transparent manner.
In short, while current science may only be able to respond to part of your pain, this clinic applies the best of current science to heal as much of it as possible, and provides support and encouragement in the course of treatment.|If there was a way to give Dr. Devon Partridge, DO with the Interventional Spine and Pain Management clinic in Provo, Utah 10 Stars, I would. He is simply outstanding. I have been dealing with nerve pain due to a benign cervical tumor that was found and removed in early 2012. Unfortunately, it hasn't been an easy diagnosis to remedy the numerous resulting pain issues that I have dealt with over the past 12+ years. Dr. Partridge has been able to "crack the code" and identify some unique remedies where other pain specialists have failed.

In addition to his outstanding professionalism,  his entire staff is exceptional. A few of his staff members that I have recently worked with, McKenna, Sienna, and Emma,  reflect the kindness, patience,  empathy, and understanding that is a hallmark of their office.

Anyone who is seeking real solutions to their individual pain management requirements need to look no further.

column3:
Interventional Spine & Pain Management serves Logan, Utah as the region's premier pain management clinic, offering advanced therapeutic solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team combines cutting-edge medical techniques with compassionate care to provide relief and improve quality of life for residents throughout Cache Valley and surrounding areas. With a focus on non-surgical interventions, we've established ourselves as trusted specialists in addressing complex pain issues that impact daily functioning and overall wellbeing.

At our Logan pain management clinic, we specialize in treating a wide spectrum of chronic pain conditions including:

  • Low back pain and neck pain

  • Peripheral neuropathy

  • Migraines and chronic headaches

  • Thoracic pain

  • Herniated disc pain

  • Failed back surgery syndrome

  • Whiplash and car accident injuries

Our approach emphasizes treatments that are safe, FDA-approved, and evidence-based. Each intervention is carefully selected to not only alleviate pain but also to stimulate the body's natural healing processes.

Advanced Treatment Options

We offer pioneering treatments including stem cell therapy in Utah, providing regenerative medicine options that can help patients avoid surgery while addressing the root causes of their pain. Our interventional techniques target specific pain sources with precision, offering lasting relief where conventional treatments have failed.

Expert Medical Team

Our clinic is staffed by board-certified physicians with fellowship training in pain management. This specialized expertise ensures that our patients receive the highest standard of care using the most current and effective treatment protocols available in the field.

Visit our Logan pain management clinic at 286 N Gateway Dr # 201, Providence, UT 84332, or learn more about our services at www.utahpaincenter.com. For appointments or questions, call us at +1 435-932-6125.
column11:
Logan Pain Management Clinic

Stem cell therapy Utah

Interventional Spine & Pain Management is the leading pain management clinic in Logan, Utah.

Our Logan pain management clinic offers specialized medical care techniques for most chronic pain conditions that are:

* Safe
* FDA-Approved
* Fellowship Trained Providers
* Board Certified
* Non-Surgical
* Compassionate
* Evidence-Based

Our specialized treatments not only help with pain, but also create a healing response in our patients.

As Logan pain management doctors, we see patients looking for a solution to their low back pain, neck pain, peripheral neuropathy, migraines and headaches, thoracic pain, herniated disc pain, failed back surgery, whiplash, car accident injuries, etc.

column40:
I cannot speak highly enough of Interventional Spine & Pain Management clinic. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warmth and professionalism. The staff were incredibly attentive, and Dr. Measom provided exceptional care, taking the time to listen to my concerns and thoroughly explain the treatment options available. The facility itself is modern, clean, and comfortable, creating a calming atmosphere. Thanks to their expertise and dedication, I have experienced significant relief from my chronic pain. I highly recommend Interventional Spine & Pain Management to anyone seeking compassionate and effective pain management solutions.|I don't typically leave reviews but over the past two years I have had only positive experiences with Dr. Measom and his staff.

My previous pain doctor never seemed to have the time of day and was often booked out for several months. Dr. Measom and his staff have been able to get me into the clinic much quicker.

Each visit I feel heard and my pain has been reduced significantly. I have dealt with chronic pain for the better half of a decade and Dr. Measom has suggested new procedures that haven't even been mentioned at other clinics. I'm confident he's up to date with the lastest treatments and they've seen to be very helpful for me.

Highly recommend these guys!|I have been a patient at Dr. Measom's clinic for some time now, and I am consistently impressed by the exceptional care provided by Tyson (MA) and Dr. Measom. Tyson is always friendly, attentive, knowledgeable, making me feel comfortable and well-cared for during my visits. Dr. Measom is a skilled and compassionate physician who takes the time to listen to my concerns and provides effective pain management solutions. I highly recommend this clinic to anyone seeking compassionate and effective pain management care.|I was a patient here for 15 years and NEVER broke the rules.  When the dose was not managing the pain they told me another doctor would be willing to increase it. One visit and the new Dr. said they were lying and had done the same to several others. I called Interventional Spine & Pain Management a dozen times to get an appointment and was told they would call me back. They never did. So I went in to the office to get one.  The staff then told me they were instructed to refuse me an appointment.
Money has been their only goal!
Avoid this place like the plague!!|I couldn't praise this office and their Drs and staff enough! I have suffered silently with chronic pain for years because my diagnosis is a little different than their everyday stuff. I tried another place previously and felt unheard and stuck between a rock and a hard place when it came to my medication and care so I decided to switch and from day one I felt heard, I felt like they genuinely CARED. Dr Measom is one of the most knowledgeable people I've met and his staff are so incredible! The receptionist has always called back immediately if she hasn't answered the first time, she answers any questions or concerns I have anytime I call and if she doesn't have the answer she gets in touch with who she needs to and they take care of it as soon as they can! Amy has personally called to resolve an issue the same exact day even when she was in a different location than when I even seen her. The MA is INCREDIBLE and their whole staff is knowledgeable I just can't say enough good about a staff who generally cares about people suffering everyday! Their procedure side is just as amazing and their MAs helped me when I was a wreck for my first injection not knowing what to expect they handled it so professionally and compassionately. Thank you so much to the providence office for not making others feel weak or unheard for their chronic pain. You guys rock!!|I am hands down one of the most critical people you will ever meet. Particularly when I am paying for healthcare. Dr. Garg is a good Dr. But this review is to highlight the staff more than anything. I have never had to wait for a room. I have never waited to be seen more than 5 minutes or so after i have been taken back and my appointments have been at all hours of the day mornings to afternoons. The PA here is phenomenal she listens and answers all of my questions in detail without rushing through my appointments. Their office has hands down the best MA i have ever dealt with she is very sincere, accurate, and helpful. The receptionist is great as well. Dr. Garg is VERY fortunate to have the staff he has now. They have all played a big role in improving my quality of life considering how bad my back injury is.|Dr. Garg and his staff are amazing! They are so friendly, knowledgeable and very professional!|The doctor was great. As a veteren I was really excited. He seemed to know more than most doctors. His office supposidely sent the va my prescription which was never recieved. I talked to the front desk and they seem unwilling to do what is required to connect with the va and get my prescription authorized. Ive been waiting weeks and am very dissapointed in his staff. If i had go without my pain medication this would be a huge problem that they were unwilling to resolve in a timley manner.

column3:
Utah Pain & Rehab serves Ogden, Utah with comprehensive pain management and rehabilitation services. Our integrated healthcare facility combines medical expertise, chiropractic care, and therapeutic massage to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions. Whether you're suffering from chronic pain, recovering from an auto accident, dealing with fall-related injuries, or facing other health challenges, our dedicated team creates personalized treatment plans designed to restore your quality of life and help you return to the activities you love.

At Utah Pain & Rehab, we believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Our collaborative team of medical providers, chiropractors, and massage therapists work together to develop customized treatment protocols that address the root causes of your pain. We utilize evidence-based techniques and modern therapeutic approaches to provide relief while promoting long-term healing and wellness.

Services We Offer

Our multidisciplinary clinic provides a range of services including medical pain management, chiropractic adjustments, therapeutic massage, rehabilitation exercises, and comprehensive care for accident recovery. Each treatment plan is tailored to your specific condition, health history, and personal goals.

Convenient Location

We are conveniently located at 1276 Wall Avenue, Suite 1 in Ogden, UT 84404, just south of 12th Street. Our facility offers free parking and is fully handicap accessible to ensure all patients can access the care they need without additional stress or difficulty.

Your Path to Recovery

Our patient-centered approach means we take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment strategies that align with your health objectives. We're committed to supporting you throughout your healing journey with compassionate care and professional expertise.

Contact Information

Ready to take the first step toward pain relief and improved function? Contact us today at (801) 337-4000 to schedule your initial consultation. You can also visit our website at www.utahpainandrehab.com to learn more about our services and team.

We look forward to meeting you and helping you achieve your health goals at Utah Pain & Rehab.
column11:
Welcome to Utah Pain & Rehab where our goal is to help you do the things you love to do in life. Some patients come to us with pain issues related to chronic pain, poor health, falls, or auto accidents. No matter the situation our team of medical providers, chiropractors, and massage therapists are committed to providing you the care that will help you reach your goals.

We are conveniently located in Ogden, UT on Wall Avenue just south of 12th Street. It is easy to find us. We offer free parking and we are handicap accessible. Click on the directions button to find an easy route to Utah Pain & Rehab. We really look forward to meeting you and helping with your health goals.

Dr. Stevenson and Sage were so amazing to work with. I did cupping and acupuncture and both were very helpful. I like to visit the office regularly to help with lower back and planter fasciitis.|See the intake lady and told her the truth about my past. She said they believe everybody deserves to get their pain managed. Went in to see the doctor and they told me I haven't been clean long enough blah blah. Wouldn't thee other lady have told me that. I was 100% honest about my past and got ab appointment too finally get help. The day I was finally going to get relief they said they made a mistake and nothing they can do for me other than BS. I tried everything with multiple issues and was lied to and sent away. Waste of time and money. These guys are the worst. Don't be honest if you hurt cause they will turn crap around. Said I needed to be clean for 5 years before they help me. Been a year and a half. Middle finger to this place. You guys don't care about people and it shows.|I highly recommend dr Stevenson work!
I have had relief from my issues after the first visit!
Thank you for taking the time to address where my alignment is needed and to help the healing begin:)|They killed my wife with the headache medication they gave her. They ordered xrays thought out her body but never cared to do a cat scan of her head.|Been coming here for a few years for pain management. Dr. Stevenson takes good care of you and the staff is always welcoming and pleasant. They also offer acupuncture, and they have a LMT onsite, which has added value to my pain management therapy. They never push unnecessary treatments on you as I've experienced with other chiropractic offices.|Great Dr. Gigi is her name. Bur the office dpt. Have had nothing but issues with them especially dropping the ball more often then not, extremely poor listening skills and could care less about the people whom go there I think there's judgment on the patients cuz pain meds. But I refuse pain meds. & see this clinic simply 4 injections & cannabis license is all.|I had a great experience with 2 different providers, they both ended up leaving the practice. I was under April's care afterwards and it was terrible. Maybe it was my younger age, but she treated me like I was a liar and just trying to get pills so I could "get high and lay in bed all day" (HER words). I was really just trying to be able to function and sleep at night - the pills she did give me helped very much, but I never got to the point that I could actually sleep, and she acted like tolerance wasn't a thing. Holding down a job and studying high level math seems impossible to me when you're up almost all night every night and daydreaming about suicide.

The previous two recognized my pain and tried giving me whatever those shots are that help immediately. April was condescending, rude, and overall made getting relief so stressful that it made my pain worse. She canceled on an appointment right before, and when I used other means to avoid WD and TOLD HER she had me tested and warned for failing. She never talked to me about how horrible WD are. She didn't care or didn't believe me. Haven't stepped foot back into the building because of her treatment.|If you're in chronic pain go see Gigi. She will help manage your pain. Understanding, compassionate and judgement free!

column40: Sent me a letter stating I owed them money 3 years and 3 months after an accident (not my fault accident) and it didn't even state why.  It had been over 3 years so I didn't even remember going to their offices/buildings. I got a poorly typed letter that looked so unauthentic and bland,  I thought it was fake and a scam for sure, until I went to the address in the letter. Letter states I owed nearly 950 dollars, but when I went to the office, I was told there is a cash incentive of 400 dollars to pay what I supposedly owed.  I contacted my insurance and my insurance gave me a claim number and updated billing address. I again went to the address of the letter and gave them a printed copy of my insurance information and claim number with instructions on how to to bill my insurance with the updated address.  Intermountain Pain and Injury never contacted me again and 1 month later I was sent to collections.  I'll add a picture of the actual letter-- what a joke.|It's been 8 months since my car accident, and I have seen over 10 different doctor's for my injury. Dr. Edson was by far the best yet! He took the time to ask questions and dug below the surface, he really wanted to help me. I love that he asked the questions, did an exam and came up with what he thought was going on, THEN read my MRI results & previous treatment. He spent a long time going over everything, and is determined to keep me out of surgery.  I got some trigger point injections & although it was painful, they were the least painful injections I have yet to have. Very tender handed & fantastic bedside manner. This doctor has a heart and truly cares about every person he sees. I'm so glad to have found him!|This place is amazing. Dr Edison and the nurse Allison are extremely kind, very compassionate and you know that they truly want to help you. I never imagined having to go to a place like this but not by my choice I was in a bad car accident and I needed help. I'm very thankful to Dr Edison for his kindness and for everyone at Intermountain pain and injury. If you go here you truly won't regret it.|Worst place ever, do not go to them.. went in to have some mri sent out and instead got sent to another place just to be seen by them..Dr's excuse was I was in so much pain he couldn't properly do his exam. If that's the case wouldn't you want to get your clients in quick as possible not bounce them around everywhere? They lied about everything they would do for me basically just looked at me and sent me on my way with the impression I would be in contact with someone to schedule my mri's. They are liars and not looking to help people .|I have been to this clinic a few times.. I had one appointment i literally had to wait in the hall for 15 minutes until the doctor and staff came back from lunch... They acted like it was no big deal to just keep me and another patient waiting until they felt like coming back. I also don't feel like the doctor really listens to my problem. He just keeps giving me the same injection that helps for 2-3 days and that's after 2-3 days of being in excruciating pain from the injections. Not really worth my time if they don't really help me. On my last appointment i waited for and hour past when my appointment was to even get taken back to a room. They only had one other patient other than me.. I would not recommend!|So disappointed here... Twice received temporary nerve blocking injections in hopes of getting a long term solution, which I was told would be done once the temporary injections were complete because that is what insurance required. Had an appointment scheduled, after calling insurance on my own the day before, that the claim had never even been submitted. Now I am being told that his procedure is "elective" and that the doctor knew this all along (which is why he told me he had a plan B lined up from day 1). Have been going in circles with them from almost 2 months and now am being told I need to find another doctor to perform the procedure and that will be my responsibility to do so. So, a complete waste of time and money.|After having a car accident I was sent here. I gained a lot of weight due to not being able to move and work out. These doctors knowing I needed surgery drained what they could of the lawsuit. I was told to try a procedure and the first three were free. I was billed 200.00 for it! Never did the other two thank goodness. I became depressed with the pain and weight gain, but instead of compassion I was told to do the "push away" push away from the table...I have worked in the medical field a long time. This was rude and I did not find it funny. I was muscle and fit when I was in the car accident. My life was turned up side down. To say some thing like this hurt so bad. I did report this as I feel my attorney should be sending clients to a professional doctor. Side note, if they do an injection make sure the doctor is not side tracked and on the phone. First injection that I was not able to stand and walk away from!! Glad experience is over!!!|I was so grateful for the referal to Intermountain Pain after my car accident. My first appointment with David covered all the areas of my wellness. Because of the in-depth questions, a plan for my wellness was made. They take the time to make sure you are comfortable with the treatment options.

column2: Alta Pain Physicians Michael Chen, DO
column3:
Alta Pain Physicians in Sandy, Utah provides comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout the Salt Lake Valley. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Michael Chen, DO, our practice combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. We specialize in treating chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative approaches tailored to each individual's needs.

At Alta Pain Physicians, we offer a wide range of interventional pain management techniques designed to target the source of your pain. Our treatments include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options. Dr. Chen's extensive training allows him to address complex pain conditions affecting the back, neck, joints, and nervous system with precision and care.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in creating personalized treatment plans that address not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain. During your consultation, Dr. Chen takes the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, medical history, and previous treatments to develop a comprehensive strategy for pain relief. Our goal is to improve your quality of life while minimizing reliance on opioid medications whenever possible.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 11449 S 1000 E #102, Sandy, UT 84094, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. We serve patients from across the greater Salt Lake area, offering flexible scheduling options to accommodate your needs. Free parking is available on-site for your convenience.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Michael Chen, please call us at (801) 462-2205 or visit our website at http://altapainphysicians.com/. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you with insurance verification and appointment scheduling. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to all patients.

column40:
DR. Chen found the answers i had several other Doctor's fail to find. I'm now fully functional and able to work. The environment is always pleasant and the massage chairs are great! I appreciate Dr. Chen giving the top notch care you can't get anywhere now days!|I have had an incredible experience with Alta Pain Physicians. Doctor Chen took the time to answer all of my questions and listened to my concerns without rushing me. He has been understanding, kind, and helpful. My procedure went very well and he was even understanding about my anxiety and never pushed or rushed me. I can't say enough about how great my experience with this doctor and his team has been.|I changed pain management clinic this last month because my previous pain management office absolutely failed me. Phusion wellness is a pill mill. They contradict themselves. Constantly. They really didn't care about anything, just money. Anyhow, I won't go on about them, but wow what a difference. I saw Shane, the PA. I feel so cared for. He has a plan on how to address my pain. Dr. Chen did come in and introduced himself. It was such a nice feeling. I felt safe. Shane is just amazing. I haven't had someone address my pain like that since I moved here from California 9 years ago. It felt legit. Safe. Clean. I feel like my quality of life may improve tremendously. We have a plan. WE have a plan. I don't know why it took this long to find them. Wait, I know why!! Phusion dominates google. They pay to be all over the first page of google. Freaking pill mill. They should be shut down.

For the record my correct name is
Diane Mohlman. Lawless was from my previous marriage|Living with chronic pain is not easy, nor is finding a Dr. Who will not dismiss this fact. All the Dr.'s in this practice have shown nothing but respect and genuine concern for both my mental and physical health. I am blessed to have found them, and feel it even more strongly after each visit as they spend more time with me than I could ever ask. Highly recommend Alta and all that practice within.|Dr.Chen has made me see that it is possible to feel good again. The experience I get when going to Alta Pain Physicians is by far outstanding. You don't receive this type of customer service anymore.  Everyone there listens, and is patient. I'm always leaving there with a smile on my face!|Dr Chen is an amazing Doctor.  He takes time to listen and asks questions to accurately diagnose your pain.  He clearly explains the procedures that needs to be performed.  I have had 98% pain relief since going to him.

The only negative remark I have is his billing department.  After numerous efforts of leaving messages regarding billing problems I have yet to receive a call back. Im still waiting and it's been 5 months.|Dr. Chen is a great listener, brilliant Dr. and diagnostician, very personable and likeable, explains everything in detail, and has helped my chronic pain immensely. I'm so comfortable with him and trust his decisions for my treatment. Shane Green and Dr Chen both TRULY care about your pain and treat you so well. Highly recommend Alta Pain! Go there FIRST. Don't waste time at the U of U pain mgt Ctr! They're dismissive, rude, get you out the door fast as possible, don't believe you're in pain even when you have a documented diagnosis for a legal disability that causes crippling pain that makes it super hard to even do normal tasks like make dinner, vacuum, do dishes or laundry, basically hard to take care of my kids or my house and I have MRIs showing my neck and back injuries from a car accident and they still dismissed me very quickly and didn't believe me. Alta will NEVER do that to you! They're friendly and caring and treat you like a human who is suffering! Empathetic and thorough and just 5 stars all the way! You will love Dr. Chen and Shane Green. They treat you like family.|I didn't have a hard time getting an appointment and the wait time was very minimal. I really feel that I was listened to and cared about and included in the decision making of my medical care. This is an excellent pain management clinic. I highly recommend Dr Chen and his group.

column2: Park City Specialty Clinic Pain Management
column3:
Park City Specialty Clinic Pain Management serves Park City, UT with comprehensive pain management solutions. As an integral part of Intermountain Healthcare's extensive network, this specialized clinic delivers evidence-based treatments for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. The dedicated team of board-certified pain specialists employs a multidisciplinary approach, combining interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies to address the unique needs of each patient.

At Park City Specialty Clinic Pain Management, patients receive personalized care for a wide range of conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. The clinic offers advanced diagnostic and therapeutic interventions such as epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Their holistic approach focuses not only on pain relief but also on improving functionality and quality of life.

Part of a Trusted Healthcare Network

As one of 180 medical clinics within the Intermountain Healthcare system, Park City Specialty Clinic Pain Management benefits from the resources and expertise of a network that includes 22 hospitals across the region. This connection ensures patients receive coordinated care with seamless referrals to other specialists when needed. The clinic maintains the highest standards of patient care, adhering to evidence-based protocols and the latest advancements in pain medicine.

Location and Contact Information

column40:
Dr Cole is a very knowledgeable and caring physician. Works with you, helps in anyway to determine the plan of care best suited to your health needs. I recommend him and his staff highly as a retired RN. I always get treated respectfully and as if my needs matter. You can't go wrong if you need a good Doctor who actually puts your best interest at heart.  This Quality's hard to find these days. You know laws dictate what Drs can treat you with. Be respectful and follow rules.|I love Dr Coles, such a great experience every time I see him. He treats me with the utmost respect, listens intently, takes the time to take care of my needs, doesn't make me feel like I need to beg for help. I've told him a very personal thing and he remembered it long after and related to me, made me feel seen, heard, and truly helping me through my pain struggles so I can focus and enjoy on the important things in life. I truly appreciate being under his care and the effort he puts into me.|Dr. Coles was wonderful -- he's compassionate, understanding, and took the time to listen.  He explained clearly the details of my condition.  His understanding was such a relief and comfort.  I greatly appreciate his competence and commitment to an effective treatment plan.  Thank you doc!!|He is very kind and was truly concerned for my needs and my health. I would definitely recommend Dr. Cole's. Especially since kind, caring and knowledgeable. I'm glad I found him and I have hope that he'll be able to help me while I face my never ending challenges with breast cancer. /audrey|Go here if you want to pay for weekly visits and experience discrimination/be treated as an addict.

The doctor has been forcing weekly visits for more than a year. Then, finally moved to biweekly appointments. Guess what? Canceled an appointment the day before and they used this as their justification to move back to weekly appointments. They lied and said it was a no call no show even though the appointment was canceled the day before. One of the assistants did call the day before and hung up right away. A phone call was made back to them immediately and they answered. I'm not sure if it's intentional or the assistants are incompetent but I do believe it's their incompetency. They also sent prescriptions to the wrong pharmacy after confirming the right one and continue to gouge off of weekly appointments.

Then, during the appointments they imply that the patient could snort certain drugs and that's why they recommend moving drugs when you ask to go to biweekly appointments. Why would someone move to a less effective drug they know doesn't work for them? Especially when they are on one that currently works. FYI the doctor was told this drug doesn't work because we have been on it in the past. This clinic does not listen to their patients and judges their patients heavily. I'm not sure if this is based on race or other factors but it is disturbing nonetheless. My friend who is white use to attend this clinic and was treated far better. They were prescribed two opioids at once. When asked if this was an option the doctor denied it and said it is not an option at all.

Conclusion: The weekly appointments are too expensive. If the service was non-discriminatory and more compassionate then maybe it would be worth it. However, they do not base their pain management recommendations on pain management therapy at all. Instead, they base their recommendations on what will keep the patient coming in weekly and what is least effective. There are other pain management clinics/doctors that offer monthly appointments without discrimination. Please save yourself time, money, and dignity and visit another clinic.|Very understanding and assured me that he and his team could get my pain in check. Great experience and I really felt that Dr. Coles cares and listened to me. I'm looking forward to the future and his continued help!|Dr. Coles came in and introduced himself and Staff to me shook my hand. He went over my history before coming into the examining room. Ask my questions about why I was there, he was very thorough caring and knowledgeable and my history.  I felt heard and knew this is where I needed to be.|I met with Dr Coles for the first time today. He really truly made me feel like he actually cares about how I'm feeling and is taking steps to help fix my health problems. I would say he is one of the most caring and knowledgeable Dr's Tanner Clinic has!!

column3:
University of Utah Pain Management Center in Salt Lake City, Utah offers comprehensive pain management services for patients throughout the Intermountain West. Our multidisciplinary team specializes in treating both acute and chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located at the University of Utah Health Sciences campus, our clinic combines cutting-edge research with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

At the University of Utah Pain Management Center, we provide a wide range of treatments including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, psychological support, and complementary therapies. Our specialists are experts in addressing complex pain conditions such as:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Headache and migraine management

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our team works collaboratively to develop individualized treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional aspects of pain. This integrated approach helps patients develop effective coping strategies while working toward meaningful pain reduction and functional improvement.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Address: 615 Arapeen Dr, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, United States

Phone: +1 801-581-7246

Website: https://healthcare.utah.edu/pain-center

The University of Utah Pain Management Center is affiliated with University of Utah Health, consistently ranked among the nation's top academic medical centers for quality and innovation in patient care.

column38: Savi Williams|Chris Reid|Holly DeVries|Pauleen Brammer|Gunnar Dicou|Michelle Wester|Matthew Backlund|Lian Ulbrich
column40:
I was sent to this clinic for nerve pain following some botched surgeries in my hand. I struggle because I think the providers here are knowledgeable and compassionate, but scheduling is atrocious. It takes months to get seen, months to schedule treatments, and then if you ask a question over my chart they respond with things like "that sounds like a great question to ask at your next appointment" which may be months away. I've heard great things about the U healthcare, but my doctors at Intermountain are so much more helpful and will actually answer simple questions over message between appointments. I have to keep going here because it's a workers comp claim, but I would change providers if I could simply because it's ridiculous to ask people in severe pain to wait 4 months to even try a treatment. Hire more providers, lengthen hours, or find a solution to not make patients wait 3 months between appointments to ask questions and get help.|I have been to dozens of doctors trying to get relief from my neck pain, none of which have really helped. But I must say if you are going to see a doctor that doesn't eliminate your pain this clinic is the most expensive one.|Oh, my!
Dr. Abdullah lied that I was bipolar ( I never had been), lied that I had hallucinations ( I never had), lied that I was getting ECT treatments ( absolutely a lie ).  When confronted, they said it was in my chart, but couldn't show me where!  ( That's because it was never in there!)
No apology.  Then, the lies continued about other things.
They said that I couldn't have an increase on my Morphine as I didn't have cancer.
They refused to consider an ablation even though my insurance gave it go.  They wouldn't even discuss it.  Please go elsewhere.  These folks are NOT caring or helpful.
The other staff at the University are phenomenal!  NOT these.
There are several caring, professional places to go.  Run away from this place.  Shame on the University!|All the staff at the pain clinic are kind and compassionate. They take the necessary time to listen to me so that they fully understand my health concerns. I have never before felt more heard and cared for than I have at the pain clinic.|They don't care about people with chronic pain they are unwilling to help them in any meaningful way. They know best all the time they will screw with meds not relating to pain. They will ask questions that will be dehumanizing and have no bearing on your pain.|I have been so happy with my treatment at the Pain Management Center. I suffered with severe vertigo for years. I work with Tami, a physical therapist at the clinic who has continued to offer me solutions and treatments to mitigate my vertigo almost entirely. Both Tami and Dr. Bokat have helped identify the cause of my vertigo to provide me with solutions that have improved my life enormously!|Physical therapy team is absolutely rude. I'd say that going here pushed recovery backwards. Avoid at all costs.|I accompanied a close friend to an appointment so I could drive her home. We arrived and were informed that the appointment was scheduled for the wrong day by an employee who no longer worked with the institution. My friend is severely disabled by chronic pain, and after begging with front desk staff for anything to be done for today, we were met with rolling eyes, insincere platitudes, and apathetic apologies. The service we received was akin to speaking with a robotic kiosk devoid of empathy. The interaction absolutely devastated my friend, and the poor scheduling completely ruined my friend's plans for her family and multiple other medical appointments she has scheduled next week.

column38: Nick Stanger|Madi Bartholomew|Seadad|Nisa Hancock|Zak Shepherd|Anastasia St. Clair|Joseph Delgado|Gissell Rice
column40:
Doctor Nelson immediately accused me of Narc shopping. Told me I need to workout. And said "if you look hard enough you can find someone to dope you up". I don't want narcs. I want to get better. I had two spine surgeries last year, one of which failed. Shame on this doctor. I waited two months to get into this place. My doctor said they could help me get better. I'm out of options now to manage my pain. I cannot express how uncomfortable the doctor made me feel and how absolutely devastated and depressed I am now. I don't know how much longer I can handle this pain in my spine.|Reading other people's one star reviews I understand that I am not alone. Trying to contact Interventional Spine and Pain Management is a joke. They never answer my calls, and don't get back to my messages I leave on their voice machine. I was referred to this office and went to my appointment weeks ago. The front desk lady was rushing me even though there was no one else in the waiting room. The doctor that helped me didn't want to spend the time to get to know what I needed. The doctor was supposed to send the prescription I need to my pharmacy. It was never sent and I've been trying to contact this office for awhile because I do not live close by and don't have the time to drive out of my way to ask them to send my prescription when it should have been done in the first place and could have been easily solved if they bothered to pick up the phone.|Staff is nice enough. However, I called just after 9AM Monday morning when I was in extreme pain with difficulty walking, didn't get a call back till the next day, and told me to call back .  They never answer the calls, always going to voicemail.   On my first visit  there, I showed up in extreme pain to the point of being barely able to walk and sweating profusely from pain and told to come in the next week.  This place has no consideration of someone's discomfort and would not stay open one minute after closing hours to help someone in great pain . Dr. Nelson needs to train his staff for more considerate staff practices.  I would avoid this business!|Dr Nelson and his staff are amazing! Very professional and prompt! His front desk was very helpful in getting me scheduled quickly. I've had low back pain for years and Dr Nelson helped come up with a treatment plan that best suited me and best part is it's working great. Highly recommend!|Dr Nelson & his staff have been amazing to work with. In 2017 I was in a car wreck and him and his team did multiple epidural injections in my lower back (herniated/bulged disks) to try and prevent surgery. Unfortunately those injections only helped a little bit but did not work all that well and I had a discectomy done that took away some pain but I had to get a different job that was more of a desk type job.

In 2020 the pain came back and was causing issues with daily life and work. I was put on muscle relaxers and painkillers to help with the pain and spasms in my low back and legs along with some neuropathy in my left leg/foot.

In 2022 I started working at a more physically demanding job and the pain, spasms & neuropathy started to get even worse. That doctor's office referred me back to Dr Nelson to explore my options in regards to injections, ablations etc and to see if surgery was needed once again.

This has been a long process of having multiple different kinds of injections that tend to have only helped for a very short amount of time. His office and staff work their magic and got me into a neurological surgeon to go over all of my MRI information and see if another surgery was needed. Being 34 years old that doctor did not want to do a fusion because once you get one the stats show your going to have more every 5 to 10 years.

With all that being said Dr Nelson suggested a spinal cord stimulator and I just got done with the 7-Day trial. During that trial the first two days I was pretty sore however the last 5 days were the best 5 days in regards to the chronic pain that I've had in years! I was finally able to sleep more than 4 hours at night. I definitely did not want this trial to end because now I have to wait for insurance to approve the real one to be installed.

So many people think that this process can be fixed very quickly and that does happen for a very small amount of people however for the most of us it is a long process of elimination and Dr Nelson and his team have been very helpful through this journey of getting out of chronic pain and lowering/potentially getting off of my opioid medication.

Dr Nelson, thank you and your team!! I am so looking forward to the operation day of that spinal cord stimulator!!|Dr. Alex Nelson is to me and my husband a miracle worker! I had horrible nerve pain in my ribs for almost 3 years. When we met with him, he said a spinal cord stimulator would help me the most. He was correct! I had my stimulator placed on June 6th of this year and now my pain levels are in the 2-4 range rather than the 7-9 range they had been. We absolutely recommend Dr. Nelson to anyone who is having nerve pain.|This place is a joke.. I contacted them to make arrangements to see if they would be a good fit for me. I gave them all of my information going back to 2017 my social security number all my past Doctors information everything. I was told I would be contacted with a few days to a week. 4 weeks go by with no update or follow up call/email. I contacted them today to find out why they would not accept me for a initial appointment m
Let alone as a patent? After speaking to ShyLicia I was informed that things have been pretty crazy there with everyone going on summer vacation & pretty much I fell through the cracks. & I was informed that they had sent my (File?) to another company that they felty would be a better fit for me. All of this without notifying me. I also found out that this place
(((.  Interventional Spine & Pain Management - Ogden. ))) They are not even a pain management clinic??? They do steroid shots in your back and that is it. The way I see it this place leads people to think they are one thing when indeed they are absolutely not. I give my experience with this Pop Up Stand ZERO STARS! there is no excuse for deceiving people or wasting there time. I would not have ever contacted this place or given them any of my information had I know they were in fact NOT a pain management clinic like they claim to be. On top of that if you are bought in by there false name do not be surprised if you never hear back from them. Cause you will not get a call or email from them letting you know why they are not accepting you as a patient or to ask you if its ok if they send your name and number to another completely different company.  If you are looking for a dependable reliable pain management Doctor keep looking cause this place is definitely not that.|I am writing this review regarding the highly unsatisfactory experience I endured at Dr. Nelson's medical practice. The series of incidents, ranging from initial appointment scheduling to the handling of my appointments, reflects a profound lack of professionalism and patient care.

Following Dr. Nelson's recommendation, I underwent various medical studies, including blood tests, X-rays, and an MRI. Unfortunately, despite these extensive tests, no diagnosis was provided, necessitating my intervention to obtain my medical file from my general doctor.

The first red flag emerged during my attempt to schedule an appointment by phone. Multiple voicemails were left unanswered, prompting an in-person visit. The receptionist's tardiness and subsequent misplacement of my information showcased a concerning lack of organizational efficiency and communication.

The culmination of these issues transpired during my second appointment. Despite receiving a confirmation for a 12:30 pm slot, my husband and I arrived at 12:28 pm to find the office locked. Despite our attempts to seek clarification, the staff chose to ignore us and even turned off the lights. This behavior was both unprofessional and unacceptable.

Contacting the neighboring office revealed that blame was placed on a new staff member. However, my appointment was confirmed days before by an older staff member, and the inexcusable treatment persisted even after providing evidence of the scheduled time.

Subsequent interactions with Dr. Nelson's receptionist were marked by extreme rudeness and a lack of accountability. The threatening and mocking tone, combined with an attempt to deflect responsibility, intensified my dissatisfaction.

Following a formal complaint, the manager, Sarah, issued a superficial apology, attributing the lapse to a new staff member. Additionally, she issued a warning regarding my conduct towards her staff, without addressing the core issues raised.

At Spinal Interventions, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. That's why we offer a multidisciplinary approach that includes:

  • Minimally invasive procedures targeting specific pain sources

column38: Mark Long|Knute Sorensen|Rick Squires|Trevor M|Bonnie GT|Jacque Peterson|Kirsten Turnbow|Michael McKinnon
column40:
I can't say enough great things about Spinal Interventions.  I had been struggling with chronic back pain for years, and after trying multiple treatments with little success, I finally found relief here. From the moment I walked in, the staff made me feel welcome and cared for. The team of professionals is incredibly knowledgeable, patient, and dedicated to finding the right treatment plan for each individual.

The personalized approach made all the difference. They took the time to understand my pain and tailored a treatment that worked wonders. After just a few sessions, I noticed a significant improvement, and now, I feel like I have my life back! The facility is clean, well-equipped, and has a relaxing atmosphere that makes every visit a positive experience.

If you're struggling with back pain, I highly recommend [Clinic Name]. Their expertise, compassion, and effective treatments are truly top-notch!|Spinal Interventions is awesome. They are well organized, quick to get you in and the staff knows what they're doing. I've only gone to Dr. Stringham and he's the best. He explains everything he's going to do and answers all your questions. I haven't had any procedures done by any of the other doctors but I'm sure they're good. I highly recommend them.|After a year of being in so much pain after a wicked car wreck, and my doctor unable and unwilling to help me get any relief, I had lost hope.  I met with Dr Clint Olsen and he knew exactly what to do and helped me manage my chronic pain.

On my second appointment, I literally gave him a big hug. He asked what we were doing? With tears in my eyes, I told him that he dramatically changed the quality of my life.

We've worked together for over 2 years now and it's been slow but it's been progress! Dr Donaldson has been a huge help as well. She has given me Epidural cervical and lumbar spine injections every few months, which has helped me to be able to reduce the opioid usage as I continue to fight to get my life and lifestyle back.

It's been wonderful to have a solid team that has supported me through this incredibly difficult challenge. It's so nice to have hope and be optimistic about my future. Thank You Spinal Interventions for helping me manage my pain and medications. Thank you Clint and thank you Ashley!

Sincerely,
Rick|Dr. Stringham is one of the best healthcare providers I have ever had the privilege of working with. He is empathetic, caring, and has excellent listening skills. He shows a great understanding of a ever changing landscape of clinical care and new technology. I have a many back produces by Dr Stringham.  He has excellent hands and takes great care to make sure I am comfortable and well prepared for the process ahead. I would highly recommend Dr. Stringham to anyone who is seeking a pain management physician.|Dr stringham and his staff are the most amazing kind and intelligent professionals ever. They have gave me back my quality of life and able to live a pain free life doing things I love to do . Thank you much|Normally I get good results from the treatments at SI.  There has been a difference this time.  It has been 7 days since my visit.  I have experienced greater pain than I had before the visit.  Possibly a nerve was hit.  I do not know.  I will call them when the Christmas break ends.  They are good people.  I am sure they will assist me.|I was seen a few months ago, so maybe things are different. I saw someone who listened to what I had to say in about ten minutes, went out to the doctor, told her what I said in a minute or two, and then they both came back and the doctor told me some options. It was like playing telephone.
After I had a scan done, the receptionist called me to tell me that I needed surgery. I had questions, but instead of talking to someone who had an education about the issue, I didn't get any information. I could have made another appointment, but was hesitant to go in and have another game of telephone, especially since they gave me zero other options over the phone besides a surgery. Luckily I had a second opinion that went into more detail (and I only talked to one doctor!) and did not get the surgery that likely would not have fixed the problem.
Perhaps a messaging system to ask the doctor questions would be helpful. Or a medical assistant who can ask the doctor relevant questions after. I don't want to talk to a receptionist about my questions. Maybe the doctors also need to look into more options besides automatically going for surgery.|Dr. Donaldson, her nurse, and the MA's are all top notch!!  They made me feel very comfortable, they did a great job at explaining every step of the process and medical procedure I had done. The Doc. is amazing, she did an amazing job, her tableside manor was impeccable. She made me feel feel welcomed yet she is also very professional. I definitely recommend Spinal Interventions for any pain relieve shots or procedures you need to have done. Definitely 10 out of 10 score!!

column2: Utah Valley Pain Management, Physical Therapy
column3:
Utah Valley Pain Management serves Orem, Utah and surrounding communities throughout Utah County with comprehensive pain management and physical therapy services. Our specialized clinic combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to help patients overcome chronic pain conditions and recover from injuries. Located conveniently in northern Orem, our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and treatment rooms designed for patient comfort and optimal therapeutic outcomes.

Under the direction of Dr. Roger E. Pack and our team of pain specialists, Utah Valley Pain Management offers a multidisciplinary approach to treating acute and chronic pain. Our services include interventional pain procedures, medication management, diagnostic evaluations, and coordinated care with other specialists when needed. We specialize in treating back and neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic conditions, post-surgical pain, and complex regional pain syndromes.

Comprehensive Physical Therapy Services

Our integrated physical therapy department works closely with our pain management team to provide seamless care. Our licensed physical therapists develop customized rehabilitation programs that may include manual therapy, therapeutic exercise, ultrasound treatments, electrical stimulation, and education on proper body mechanics. We focus on restoring function, improving mobility, and teaching self-management techniques for long-term pain control.

Patient-Centered Approach

At Utah Valley Pain Management, we believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual's specific needs, goals, and lifestyle. We take time to listen to our patients and involve them in decision-making about their care. Our affiliation with Intermountain Healthcare ensures our patients benefit from the latest research and treatment protocols in pain management.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 801-235-7246. Our clinic is located at 412 W 800 N, Orem, UT 84057. For additional information about Dr. Roger E. Pack and his qualifications, visit our provider profile on the Intermountain Healthcare website.
