column38: Devon Myslinski|Brian S|Rachel Wilkes|Nicole Duke|Kyle Phillips|Alisha|Forrest Baker|Kristl Johnson
column40:
The people at the physical therapy office are awesome! Dani and Jeanne are very helpful and friendly. Roger has been so great in helping me with my pain and getting me back to health. I am so grateful for this center and their goals to help their patients. I love their complete approach. They include you in the process. I love that I am able to give feedback. I love that psychology, physical therapy, and doctors are involved. This is seriously a great clinic to go to!|**Update** I have continued to see Adam at UVPM. The office staff has been great, there haven't been anymore billing concerns, and things have gone smoothly. I can honestly say I would recommend them to a friend now.

At first, I had a hard time getting used to the level of scrutiny and incredulity with which they treat most of their patients. I definitely felt I was treated like someone just convicted of a drug offense. However, after 2.5 years, I feel I've built a pretty good relationship with my PA Adam, and would recommend him. Because of him, I've continued to commute to Orem, despite living about an hour away.

However, 6 of my last 8 appointments have been disappointing to me. They've messed something up, and it seems every time I try to give them another chance, something else happens that makes me irritated again. It seems they mess up more than they get right.

Over the last 2.5 years, I have had a lot of problems with their billing. It seems every month is another issue. They have lost multiple payments of mine, tried to increase my co-pay, tried to charge for no-show appointments that they mention 10 months later (this has happened twice at least) and after you pay anything, it seems you have to remind them of it next time you go in. ALWAYS get your receipt, and I'd recommend keeping them in your car to show them.

It's not just their billing though, there are issues in other aspects too. There have been missed appointments, rude receptionists, lost requests for procedures, and other things. This week I went in for my monthly visit and there was debate as to what pain med they'd prescribe me. After deciding they wanted to confer with another doctor first, I was told they'd call in the prescription when they decided, so I left the office. When they called, they told me that they couldn't actually call in a prescription to a pharmacy like most doctors, so I would need to come pick it up. When I told them I live in Salt Lake, and work in Davis County till late most days, they offered to mail it for only $7.

It isn't the incident this week that has made them lose my business, it's the combination of everything from the last 2.5 years, and especially all the headache from the last 6 months. I'd recommend people go to other pain clinics though or continue to see their specialist.|This place is amazing! The staff are so great, and the doctors are even moreso. I never feel like just a number being pushed through appointments- they really care, which yes means they enforce their guidelines but they truly help manage your pain. Adam Wright is one of the best physicians I've ever had.|I've only been going here for about 3 months but I am so impressed!! They are understanding and the entire staff is so nice. Rob Harkness is an amazing guy. He has always treated me with respect and never belittle me or made me feel stupid or like I shouldn't be in pain. Dr. Ockey and Dr. Dana are amazing physicians and they really understand chronic pain more than the other clinic I went to years back called Nexus. They treat you like a real person here. Definitely would recommend if you have any type of pain. I have a super rare condition and they even understand it and have always been so nice and knowledgeable.|I have worked with a couple different pain management clinics and other providers and no one has worked as hard as Doctor Norma Bowers has for me. He was honestly the first Doctor to actually listen to what I was going through and worked to help me get better, he treated me like a human being. Not just another patient paying his Bill's. He treats everyone he talks to with respect. I have nothing but respect for him and his staff and would recommend him to anyone struggling with pain. It's nice to be a normal human being again.|I've been going to UVPM for 4 months, so I'm just starting to get to know them. I have fibromyalgia and chronic fatigue syndrome and chronic back pain. I do feel very scrutinized regarding legitimate medication use, but I also understand that they have to cover their bases legally. The medical professionals I've worked with there are nice but do seem to think their office knows all and that other doctors you might have seen don't have the expertise or knowledge to help you. The reception staff, excluding one very nice woman who I wish was the only one I ever had to deal with, is a joke. I've been quoted different co-pay costs several times, and it once took 2 weeks to get a message to my doctor and a refill printed off. Two weeks, and it wasn't even a new prescription, just a problem with insurance that required them to call my pharmacy. Such a nightmare.

I also don't appreciate having to wait so long to see my doctor at each appointment, as I've had to do a few times. I definitely feel that sense of being judged when it comes to medications, and I kind of wish they could walk in my shoes for just one day. Sure, they're experts in pain, but if you haven't actually experienced it, you can't truly understand.

All things considered, I'd give the office as a whole 3/5 stars.|Why two stars. They are a standard pain clinic. What they offer you can get just about any where, they are literally nothing special and people who think that they are great most likely have not had many other places for comparison. As far as pain management they are fine. However what they lack is really caring about their patients. The first visit we went and they reviewed our case ( my wife was the patient ) and did not listen to us as far as what we suggested, instead they had their own suggestions, which is fine I am coming to a doctor to get advice, regardless we tried their suggested procedure knowing that it had a small likelihood for success.

It did not help ( no surprise but we figured this would clear the air for an actual conversation ) We went back for our follow up visit expecting to have real conversation about our options at that point in time. Instead we have a Physicians assistant who said, oh that did not help, well lets get you into biofeedback and psychological counseling.

This is simply stupid, my wife has had this issue for years and if either of those two options would have helped we would not be coming to the pain clinic in the first place, in the second place I wanted to TALK to the doctor about real options moving forward in treatment. The PA was combative, as though the suggestion that there may be additional forms of treatment was impossible but they would review records from other doctors ( they can't simply accept what we are telling them we did they have to have the actual notes from other doctors in order to even consider additional treatment options. ) Fine, we make another appointment, call the myriad of other doctors to send in documents to them, simply to have another appointment to TALK about what we wanted to do when we originally came in the first place.

Then the day of the appointment we hit traffic on the way down. We call to let them know we are going to be 15 minutes. It took me an hour to leave work, pick up my wife, and get to their location, and they cancel the appointment.

In summary, they did not listen, wasted our time, money and everything else with the first three appointments, and then finally on the fourth decided we were wasting too much of their time and cancelled on us.

I do not recommend this pain clinic. They can manage pain just fine and if you do not have other choices I say go to them, but I think you will find them disingenuous and myopic in thought processes. Bad Experience. I give them two stars because in fairness they are a pain clinic and they will manage your pain.|This business has the absolute WORST customer service I have ever experienced!  We have experienced multiple delays in service due to a lack of decent in-house communication.  On MULTIPLE occasions,  orders for physical therapy or MRIs have been lost in their system and never sent.  The situation never rectifies itself until an appointment is made to go in, and then we get profuse apologies, but still get less than par service.  I DO NOT recommend this company as a source of pain management or as a source of decent customer service.  In the 4 months we have attended their office, my husband has not received any sort of pain management assistance. Part time employees who can't even remember who you are or what your situation is until you have wasted an extra 30 minutes re-telling the story every visit.

I also observed an act of kindness from one of the receptionist, who aided a distort lady who came in anxious, because the building next door was locked and she had an appointment. So this sweet receptionist walked with her to the next building and assisted her. Kindness in action|I've been going to Southwest Spine And Pain for four years. Over that time I have been treated by three different doctors For pain that resulted in an accident. I have been treated extremely well and with respect and understanding and compassion By each of the Doctors. My current doctor is in a word awesome. His staff is always friendly. They are always very thorough and have made this process through pain more endurable. I can't thank them enough for all that they've done. I would recommend Southwest Spine And Pain and Logan Utah to anybody and everybody.. I gave him five stars for a good reason they deserve it.|My initial consult with Dr Sabin was outstanding. He took his time to get to know me and understand my medical needs. He was personable and had some important recommendations. I would highly recommend this doctor.

Established with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions, this specialized medical facility combines advanced treatment modalities with compassionate care. Their Park City location provides convenient access to state-of-the-art pain management solutions for residents throughout northern Utah.

At Southwest Spine & Pain Center, double-board certified pain management specialists utilize a multidisciplinary approach to address various pain conditions. Their treatment options include:

  • Advanced injection therapies

  • Minimally invasive surgical procedures

  • Careful medication management

  • Coordinated physical therapy programs

  • Advanced diagnostic imaging

Specialized Care for Diverse Pain Conditions

The medical team specializes in treating both acute injuries and chronic pain conditions affecting the spine, joints, and nervous system. Whether patients are dealing with sports injuries, degenerative conditions, or post-surgical pain, the specialists develop personalized treatment plans designed to maximize function and minimize discomfort.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Southwest Spine & Pain Center is their commitment to patient-centered care. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual's specific needs, with a focus on improving overall quality of life and restoring function. The team works collaboratively with patients to establish realistic goals and implement effective pain management strategies.

Visit Southwest Spine & Pain Center at 1122 Center Dr Ste. D-350, Park City, UT 84098, or call +1 435-714-7277 to schedule a consultation. Additional information about services and treatment options is available at https://www.southwestspineandpain.com/locations/park-city.

Dr. Talbot takes time listen to me he asks on how my  family is doing, he is not in a hurry to rush you out the door, Sarah is truly amazing, and Holly takes time to listen. Dr Talbot only hires the best.|Highly recommend this location worth the drive
Doctor Talbott is amazing, explained everything simply for me to understand. His course care help with my pain. His staff is also amazing Sarah put me at ease with the procedure and Tyler and Beth also were great.  If i could give more stars i would. If you're having any back pain,neck pain or any chronic pain this is the location to help you.|I can't say enough positive things about Dr. Andrew Talbott at Southwest Spine and Pain.  From the moment I walk in until I leave I am treated with kindness and enthusiasm by each person from the receptionist to the MA to the nurse to the Dr. Dr Talbott cares genuinely and has an amazing bedside manner. He is very knowledgeable about my pain and I know I am in good hands in my treatment whether it's the medication or the procedures. He performs them expertly and with precision. The vibe in the clinic is really good. Everyone smiles. The patients in the waiting room are always in a good  mood because of the vibe fostered and they know that Dr Talbott is the reason for their visit. I'm so grateful for the pain relief I have had for the last 4 years from him.|I had a very easy experience. I was thankful that the Dr took extra care to look at a recent MRI. No one else will look at it for 3 weeks. He was able to reach a spot that seems to help with my extreme pain. I think the procedure was 15 minutes and I was able to walk out right away. It's day one, no pain. Incredible.|Dr Talbot is the most caring  Dr I have ever come across ,break every bone in yur body from a industrial accident 3 stories up and a slip and fall to earth landing on cocrete,thank God we have a  Dr out there that can inject the right spot,block the most outrageous pain that a man can have ,and perscribe  the right medicines you can carry on on life. Thank you to all the great people at Southwest Spine and Pain Clinic, for all the loving care and compassion.|I played professional hockey, so I have extreme pain in my back. I know Dr Talbot is overwhelmed with patients. But there is one person in his office that is a miracle worker. That person is Malia. Whenever I have an issue, Malia solves the problem. She is the best employee that Dr Talbot has and I problably would have left for another DR if it wasn't for Malia!!!!!|While the PA's and Doctors in the practice are fabulous, the business practices of the ownership has gone downhill since I've been a patient.

They will now force you to pay for office visits even if your insurance doesn't require prior authorization. They are also now forcing office visits or virtual visits for medication renewals that are also just a money grab with no medical necessity for the visit itself.

Great example of what happens when medical practices are managed by accountants and the money grab process is put into effect. Buyer beware with these folks. I'll be looking around for alternatives.|This was my second visit and was not as good S my first. My appt was at 1:50 and I didn't get called back until 2:05 and then waited in the room until 2:25 saw Dr Talbot for like 5 minutes. The nurse that helped was not friendly at all. Not real happy with this visit. I could have done it over the phone.

column3:
Braden Jex, DO serves Vineyard, Utah and surrounding communities as a dedicated pain management specialist committed to helping patients regain function and improve quality of life. With comprehensive training in osteopathic medicine and specialized expertise in pain management, Dr. Jex brings a patient-centered approach to treating chronic pain conditions through customized treatment plans that address both symptoms and underlying causes.

Dr. Jex's extensive medical background includes a Bachelor's Degree in Public Health Administration from Utah Valley University, providing him with a strong foundation in healthcare systems and population health. He earned his medical degree from Des Moines University College of Osteopathic Medicine, where he developed expertise in the osteopathic approach to medicine that emphasizes the body's natural ability to heal itself.

His clinical training continued with an internship and anesthesia residency at Froedtert Hospital & The Medical College of Wisconsin in Milwaukee, followed by subspecialty fellowship training in pain management at the same prestigious institution. This comprehensive training equips Dr. Jex with advanced techniques for diagnosing and treating complex pain conditions.

Treatment Philosophy

At the core of Dr. Jex's practice is a belief in multidisciplinary approaches to chronic pain management. Rather than relying on a single treatment modality, he integrates various therapeutic options to create comprehensive care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. This holistic approach aims to achieve optimal pain control while helping patients restore functionality and improve their overall well-being.

Services and Specialties

As a pain management specialist, Dr. Jex offers a range of interventional and non-interventional treatments for acute and chronic pain conditions. His osteopathic background informs his approach to patient care, considering the interconnections between physical symptoms and overall health.

Location and Contact Information

Dr. Jex welcomes new patients at his Vineyard office located at 691 E 400 N Ste. 110, Vineyard, UT 84059. To schedule a consultation or learn more about available treatment options, patients can call +1 385-203-0246 or visit his professional profile at https://www.vista-hc.com/braden-jex-do.
column11:
Braden Jex, DO received his Bachelor's Degree in Public Health Administration from Utah Valley University and his medical degree from Des Moines University College of Osteopathic Medicine. He completed his internship, anesthesia residency, and subspecialty fellowship training in pain management with Froedtert Hospital & The Medical College of Wisconsin in Milwaukee.

Dr. Jex believes in a multidisciplinary approach to treating chronic pain to help achieve the best pain control and return to function.

Peak Health and Wellness Now serves Davis, Weber, Box Elder, Cache, and surrounding counties in Utah with three specialized pain clinics strategically located throughout the region. Our comprehensive approach to pain management and addiction treatment has established us as a leading healthcare provider in Northern Utah. With a team of board-certified physicians and specialists, we deliver personalized care plans designed to address chronic pain conditions, injury recovery, and substance dependency with compassion and clinical excellence.

At Peak Health and Wellness, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our clinics offer advanced diagnostic capabilities and innovative treatment options including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy integration, and holistic approaches. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation to identify the root cause of their pain, allowing our physicians to develop targeted treatment strategies that minimize medication dependence while maximizing functional improvement.

Comprehensive Addiction Treatment

Our addiction recovery programs provide medically-supervised treatment for those struggling with dependency issues. We combine evidence-based medication protocols with counseling support and lifestyle modifications to create sustainable recovery pathways. Our physicians are specially trained in addiction medicine and work closely with patients to address both the physical and psychological aspects of dependency.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Peak Health and Wellness is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Our doctors take the time to listen, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and collaborate with you to develop a treatment plan aligned with your goals. We emphasize education, empowerment, and ongoing support throughout your recovery journey.

Visit Our Clinics

Our main location is conveniently situated at 890 Heritage Park Blvd #101, Layton, UT 84041. With two additional clinics throughout the region, we ensure accessible care for residents across Northern Utah. Contact us at +1 801-889-1790 to schedule a consultation or learn more about our services. For comprehensive information about our treatment options and approach, visit our website at https://peakhealthandwellness.com/.
column11: Now with three pain clinics open serving Davis, Weber, Box Elder, Cache and surrounding counties, Peak Health and Wellness is ideal for those who want a highly skilled doctor to accurately diagnose your pain or addiction and tailor a treatment plan that restores your life.

column40:
I have had nothing but the best experiences with peak health and wellness. I regularly refer patients and family to peak health and they receive outstanding care. Thanks for offering a destigmatizing and comprehensive patient experience.|The treatment was great. Doctor hainesworth is fantastic. But when money becomes more important than care, it's wrong. Thank you for the pain and misery of withdrawals.|I really appreciate PA Hainsworth for all his help and support for the years he's treated me! He always takes the time to address any new issues or concerns. He's really smart, and I am thankful that he's always willing to be helpful anyway he can.
I just moved, and I'm hoping to be able to return to peak health and wellness to be seen by PA Hainsworth again.
I've definitely missed having my life be more easy/enjoyable because of PA Hainsworth because he has always attempted to find ways to help me.|I used to go to Lifesprings and it was awful. They treated me like an addict and used my prescriptions as leverage for more money. I switched to Peak Health and Wellness about 2 years ago and its been life changing. PA Hainsworth is such a good human. He really cares about me and i can tell. He addressed all issues i was having not just pain but those things that can affect pain like loss of sleep and anxiety. I lost my son last year and i dont know how i couldve gotten through it without his help. All the staff treats me like a person instead of a patient. Theyre all so kind and understanding.  Ill be a patient of theirs for life. I refer everyone i know there that suffers with chronic pain. If youre looking for a place that actually helps you this is it.|This is not my real name. I wanted to post something for Them. I've been with  Peak about 3 years now. They've been great.
Brian Hainesworth is awesome to work with and has a full scope of knowledge and experience in the pain management arena. He's extremely knowledgeable about medications and you are in good hands in his care! He listens to his patients. He doesn't always agree, but he understands the importance and value of paying attention and hearing what his patients have to say. After all, we are the first stop, any problems that exists, will be manifested by or noticed from first. Besides, who knows our bodies better than we, the patients?
Garrett, his nurse, is the best! He's extremely kind and patient, which is a big plus for people like me, who have a little bit of anxiety. He gives pain free shots!!! Truly!!!!
He's also very reliable and always follows through. He works extremely hard to take good care of every patient.|Love this place. PA Hainsworth is fantastic!! He might be the best PA I have ever seen. I highly recommend this place for your healthcare needs!!|Peak Health and Wellnes was gtreat with me, Doctor Bryan addressed my every need,He was thorough and went over everything I believed He genuinely cared about me and gave me my best options,I have had many doctors over the years and really really apprecite the time he spent  going over everything and not rushing|I just started going here. But the staff is amazing and Dr Hainsworth really listens and understands his patients. I highly recommend this place.

Dr. Baca's practice combines interventional procedures with multi-modal treatment approaches to provide personalized care tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Baca's Expertise

column40:
Similar to other reviews, Alayna Emmerling and nurses are petty, have high school behavior, bad attitudes, and aren't personable. Dr. Baca is personable and attentive, Joy Tolman is nice, and the receptionists are kind.

Update: I wrote a negative review a couple months ago about PA Alayna Emmerling, her nurse, and nurse Myka. (And my opinion stands on those 3) Afterwards MD Kirsten Baca spoke with me personally regarding my experience. MD Kirsten Baca has always been kind, and takes the time to make sure my procedures get the best results as possible. She also took the time to listen to my experience and apologized for my negative experiences with other providers in the clinic.|Office stuff is sub par at best. Can't schedule correct services/appointments. Also very slow to respond to messages. No info given on post procedure expectations or care by the nurses. Patients shouldn't be expected to pry info out of staff. It should be the standard to give that info.

I shouldn't have to Google after care for procedures to try and guess what's best practices.|Went for the first time. We were running late because of construction and I live an hour away. I called to let them know I would be a few minutes late because ofthe construction being done around them,they said ok. I was there 15 min late. They said they would not see me. Then I find out today they lied to my regular dr. Said I was 30 min late!! That I didn't want to do the p. Test!!! I did!! You guys are terrible!!! Im so glad it didn't work out !! Because they expect you to be there in 24 hrs anytime they want to count your pills even if you live an hour away!! That's what I was not willing to do . We are busy and cant be at their back and call. A friend of my husband's used to go there and said I dodged a bullet. Very rude staff high school mean girl style. And they lied to my dr??!!! I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. If I could give no stars I would!!!|Staff is friendly. Doctor are Great! Waiting room is nice and clean. Exam and treatment rooms are clean.|I guess my review is more a the office staff since I didn't even get to see a doctor. I Thought I had everything set up for  my appointment- which I waited over 6 weeks for. I had an appointment scheduled for a Monday. I got online to fill out the new patient paperwork the Saturday before and their system wouldn't let me do it. I went 15 minutes early thinking I could do the paperwork then but the receptionist told me that wasn't enough time and I'd need to reschedule. Turns out they entered my date of birth wrong in my chart. They acknowledged it was their mistake but still refused to see me. The next appointment is another 6 weeks out! That's not acceptable when I'm in pain and the mistake was their fault. I can't believe they are a pain clinic and have zero compassion for people in pain.|This office is the best I've been to. The staff is friendly. The doctor and the PA are very much in tuned with how you feel And concerned about what you're going through. They go above and beyond with pain management with injections and meds. I highly recommend this place. There is no better place.|This clinic is hands down the best pain management clinic I have been able to find.
From the moment you walk into the nice clean facility, you are greeted by a wonderful staff. They are polite, and make you feel like they care.
Dr. Baca is very skilled and knows what she is doing! She has done an amazing job working with me to build a recovery plan. Every procedure has been masterfully done.
It's a great change from going to places where they don't care to help you other than give you medicine and send you on your way.
I would highly recommend this clinic to anyone that wants to beat their pain.|This is an amazing clinic, and Dr. Baca is an amazing doctor. She's spent allot of time with me during my initial visit. She asked allot of of questions and explained, in detail, the causes of my pain. I also had an injection done in my hip..... And she was awesome!! The staff is also very nice. The clinic is beautiful and they have all the equipment needed for most pain relief procedures. I would highly recommend Glacier Peak.... As a matter of fact, my mom is going to in tomorrow.

Rajiv R. Shah, MD in Cottonwood Heights, Utah provides comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout Salt Lake County and surrounding areas. With a patient-centered approach, Dr. Shah combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with evidence-based medical therapies to address chronic and acute pain conditions. His practice focuses on creating individualized treatment plans that improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence and promoting functional recovery.

At his clinic located at 6750 S Highland Dr, Cottonwood Heights, UT 84121, Dr. Shah offers a wide range of specialized treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and targeted medication management. His expertise extends to treating complex conditions such as failed back surgery syndrome, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and cancer-related pain.

Patient-Focused Care

Dr. Shah's practice stands out for its commitment to thorough evaluation and personalized care. New patients receive comprehensive assessments that consider medical history, previous treatments, and current pain patterns. The clinic maintains strong relationships with referring physicians, physical therapists, and other specialists to ensure coordinated care. With convenient scheduling options and a responsive staff, patients can reach the office at +1 801-685-7246 for appointments and questions.

Advanced Training and Facilities

Board-certified in pain medicine and anesthesiology, Dr. Shah brings extensive training from prestigious institutions to his practice. The clinic features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, modern setting. For more information about services, insurance acceptance, or to schedule a consultation, patients can visit www.utahpain.com or call the office directly.

column40:
Dr. Shah is an excellent Dr in every way.  He really listens and cares about my pain.  He always remembers me and is so easy and o talk to.  Most of all, I fully trust him to test my pain in a way that works.  He has helped me so much with my Osteoarthritis pain, keeping me pain free for almost a year at a time.  He also has an amazing staff.  Positive experience for every time. I highly recommend Dr.Shah.|Originally Dr. Raj was My Dr. He was wonderful.  After he moved away, Dr. Rajiv Shah became my dr and I was hoping he was as good as Dr Raj.  I was so happy  when I first met him because he was so caring, and making sure I was informed of  the procedures , what to expect, and how to prepare so that I am calm and comfortable.  He has a great sense of humor, and makes me feel like I'm his only patient, totally focused on me.  I'm so happy with Dr Shah and recommend him to anyone who needs a pain specialist.

I also love the staff.  They are so kind, and render me when I come in.  There is nothing but good things to say about Dr Shah and his staff.  Thanks Dr Shah.|Dr Shah is the best all the NP and other doctors and all the nurses are great.

The office staff and billing people just are so awful. Accusing me of lying. I made an appointment spoke to billing and receptionist they took my copay and made an appointment for 9:30. I arrived at 9:25 today for my appointment.
They tell me I don't have an appointment and I needed to pay more. I had clarified the payment and appointment twice with office staff tomorrow for today.
They were rude and have no COMPASSION!!!

I love my doctor or I would change doctors.

I am a nurse for 34 years and know the business. What has happened to kindness in America???

Sad day.|I consider Doctor Rajiv one of my Angels..
Suffering from pain is something so scary and even frightening... To know that he's there available every time I'm in pain it's so comforting.. He is so mindful and emphatic..
I couldn't be more luckier.. Thanks Doctor Rajiv for taking care for me for the last 10 years.. I remember the first time I was so desperate.. And he took care of me right away.. So professional and full of humanity.
Best doctor ever.|Excellent service. I no longer live in constant fear of pain. Support staff are polite and efficient. You must pay a $25 fee if you miss an appointment, so you can't reschedule until you've paid it. They have some flexibility, but it leaves an impression that profit comes first. They are firm in refusing to recommend marijuana as possibly helpful, which is disappointing. Exam rooms are stark white with black chairs---not at all calming or inviting. Some personal info is given in a way where anyone can hear, so some privacy is violated. I still love being treated here cuz they will help with pain.|

His expertise encompasses a wide range of pain conditions, offering both interventional procedures and medical management strategies tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Benfield's practice focuses on diagnosing and treating various pain conditions, including chronic back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Using evidence-based approaches, he develops personalized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications to improve patients' quality of life and functional abilities.

Education and Credentials

As a Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO), Dr. Jonathan A. Benfield brings a holistic perspective to pain management, considering how the body's systems work together. His comprehensive medical training and specialized fellowship in Pain Medicine have equipped him with advanced techniques to address complex pain conditions. Dr. Benfield maintains board certifications and active memberships in professional medical organizations, demonstrating his commitment to the highest standards of patient care.

Patient Care Philosophy

Dr. Benfield believes in collaborative care, working closely with patients to understand their pain experiences and develop effective management strategies. He takes time to educate patients about their conditions and treatment options, empowering them to participate actively in their recovery journey. column40:
DR Benfield is more than amazing as a Dr and a friend.  I really feel like a patient he cares about and not a number!  He is very knowledgeable, kind, helpful and wants me to enjoy life without so much pain!  He is the best ever.
The procedure helped a lot that I had done yesterday.   The best part to me is how concerned Dr Benfield is that it works and we are not in pain while he is giving me the shots!!!
I love being really active and he is helping me stay that way at 79

Dr Benfield is the most caring doctor I have had in my entire life. I will be 80 July 13 and he has kept me feeling so much better being a pain specialist so I can ride my bike. I can hike and I can work out and do all the physical things that I love to do. Especially my hobby of working in my yard!   He is amazing and cares so much to make this happen for me 

I had the three, four and five of the lumbar  shot with steroids yesterday and Dr Benfield does such a fantastic job and it is not painful the way he does it. He is amazing and cares so much about me as a human being and wanting to do all the physical things that I love to do. I especially love to hike steep hills and he makes it possible for me to do that without paying in the back. I also love to paddleboard and that can be hard on the back, but it isn't with the help that he gives me. Again, a fantastic doctor.

Yesterday I had the nerves in 3, 4  and 5 of the lumbar burnt.  Dr Benfield is so thorough and makes sure it is done the best possible to take away the pain in the lower back. He is amazing and makes the procedure not so uncomfortable with great conversation and I know he cares. He is the best doctor I believe I have ever been to that cares as much as he does. Today it feels great already. I don't even think I will have to wait for two weeks like it sometimes can. He is so knowledgeable and keeps up with the latest and best for all of us patients.

I have had horrible headaches for most of my life at least since age 30 and now I'm 80! Dr Benfield suggested an MRI on the neck and we did a block and it is amazing. I have not had any more headaches. He is the best and always wants to help us all to feel good.|Dr. Benfield was awesome. I had a problem unrelated to the procedure during my visit and he was so kind and concerned.  He stayed with me until I could be taken to the ER.  He even called me the next day to make sure I was doing ok.|Dr Benfield spent a long time with me and answered lots of questions.  He gave me detailed info about my options.  He had reviewed my extensive history.  I was very impressed.|Dr. Benfield was amazing! He was so personable and easy to talk to. He listened to our concerns and explained everything very well. We had a clear game plan moving forward. I would recommend him any day!|It was a great experience!  Dr Benfield was very kind and understanding.  He explained every step of the procedure to make sure I felt comfortable.  I would highly recommend his care.|Dr Benfield is very professional. Very thorough with your healthcare. You leave his office knowing your exact diagnosis and what the next steps are. I give him a 10 not just a 5!|Dr Benfield a staff were fantastic!!  The procedure went well, they explained everything before they proceeded.  Very compassionate and professional.|He gave me a shot in each hip to temporarily relieve pain. It was one of two temporary shots so the insurance company will pay for more permanent shots that will relieve pain a lot longer.

Southwest Spine and Pain serves Vineyard, Utah and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Bryan Hoelzer, MD. Our specialized clinic offers comprehensive treatment options for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions, combining advanced medical techniques with compassionate care. Dr. Hoelzer brings his prestigious Mayo Clinic training and experience to provide residents of Utah County with world-class pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Bryan Hoelzer completed his medical degree at Tulane University in New Orleans, establishing a strong foundation for his specialized career in pain medicine. Following medical school, he pursued comprehensive training at the prestigious Mayo Clinic in Minnesota, where he completed his internship, residency, and fellowship training in pain management.

Dr. Hoelzer's exceptional skills and dedication earned him a staff position at the Mayo Clinic, where he worked in the Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine. During his tenure, he served as the Director for the Pain Medicine Fellowship and the Director of Neuromodulation. His commitment to patient care was recognized with the esteemed Karis Award, highlighting his compassionate approach to medicine.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Southwest Spine and Pain, we are proud to have Dr. Hoelzer bringing his extensive expertise to our patients. His specialized knowledge in neuromodulation and comprehensive pain management techniques allows us to offer advanced treatment options for various chronic pain conditions, including:

- Spinal pain and injuries

- Joint pain

- Neuropathic pain

- Complex regional pain syndrome

- Post-surgical pain

Contact Information

Phone: +1 385-203-0246

Website: [https://www.vista-hc.com/bryan-hoelzer-md](https://www.vista-hc.com/bryan-hoelzer-md)

Location: 691 E 400 N Ste. 110, Vineyard, UT 84058, United States

We welcome new patients and referrals. Please contact our office to schedule a consultation with Dr. Hoelzer and take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.
column11:
Bryan Hoelzer completed his medical degree at Tulane University in New Orleans. While at Mayo he served as the Director for the Pain Medicine Fellowship, the Director of Neuromodulation, and was the recipient of the Karis Award.

We are proud to have Dr. Hoelzer at Southwest Spine and Pain.

Southwest Spine & Pain Center serves Vineyard, Utah with exceptional pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our state-of-the-art facility at 691 E 400 N in Vineyard provides comprehensive care for residents throughout Utah County suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. What sets our practice apart is our team of double-board certified pain management specialists who combine advanced medical expertise with a compassionate approach to treatment. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we offer a multidisciplinary approach that addresses both the physical and emotional components of pain management.

At Southwest Spine & Pain Center, we utilize a wide spectrum of treatment modalities designed to address pain at its source. Our specialists are skilled in administering various injection therapies, including epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, and nerve blocks that provide targeted relief. For patients requiring more advanced interventions, we offer minimally invasive surgical procedures that can significantly reduce recovery time while maximizing pain relief outcomes. Our integrated approach also includes careful management of appropriate pain medications, coordination with physical therapy providers, and access to advanced imaging services to ensure accurate diagnosis and treatment planning.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe that effective pain management requires a personalized treatment plan that evolves with your condition. During your initial consultation, our specialists take the time to thoroughly evaluate your medical history, conduct a comprehensive physical examination, and review any previous diagnostic studies. This detailed assessment allows us to develop a customized treatment strategy that addresses your specific pain concerns while considering your overall health and wellness goals. Our commitment to patient education ensures you understand all available options and can actively participate in decisions about your care.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management experts, please call us at +1 385-203-0246. Our Vineyard office is conveniently located at 691 E 400 N, Vineyard, UT 84059. For more information about our services and other locations throughout Utah, visit our website at southwestspineandpain.com/locations/vineyard. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to helping you navigate the administrative aspects of your care.

column3:
Southwest Spine and Pain Center in Vineyard, Utah serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management services throughout Utah County. Established as part of the Vista Healthcare network, this specialized clinic has built a reputation for excellence in treating both acute and chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches and innovative techniques. Patients throughout Vineyard and surrounding communities benefit from the center's multidisciplinary approach to pain relief and management.

Under the skilled direction of Bryan Hoelzer, MD and Eric Freeman, MD, Southwest Spine and Pain Center delivers exceptional care through personalized treatment plans. Dr. Freeman brings extensive expertise in interventional pain management, while the entire medical team remains dedicated to addressing the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Their combined experience ensures patients receive cutting-edge treatments based on the latest advancements in pain medicine.

Comprehensive Services

The center specializes in treating a wide spectrum of pain disorders, including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Sports injuries

  • Work-related injuries

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

Advanced Treatment Options

Patients benefit from access to state-of-the-art interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and minimally invasive techniques designed to improve quality of life while minimizing reliance on opioid medications.

Visit Our Vineyard Location

Southwest Spine and Pain Center welcomes new patients at their convenient Vineyard location:

691 E 400 N

Vineyard, UT 84058

United States

Phone: +1 385-203-0246

Website: https://www.southwestspineandpain.com/locations/vineyard

The facility offers a comfortable, modern environment with the latest diagnostic and treatment technologies. New patients are encouraged to call for consultation appointments to discuss personalized pain management solutions with the expert medical team.

Compass Pain and Wellness serves Salt Lake City, Utah and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services. Located in the heart of Salt Lake Valley, our clinic has become a trusted destination for individuals seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team combines medical expertise with a holistic approach to address the complex nature of pain, helping patients navigate their path to improved well-being and functionality.

At Compass Pain & Wellness, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our patient-centered approach blends advanced medical treatments with conventional therapies to create personalized care plans that address both symptoms and underlying causes. We specialize in treating various pain conditions, including back pain, joint disorders, neuropathy, and post-surgical discomfort, utilizing evidence-based interventions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Our Compassionate Approach

What sets us apart is our commitment to treating every patient like family. From your first consultation through ongoing care, our experienced team guides you through each step with empathy and expertise. We take time to listen, understand your concerns, and develop strategies that align with your goals for pain relief and improved quality of life. This personalized attention ensures you never feel like just another appointment on our schedule.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our clinic offers a comprehensive range of treatments, from medication management and minimally invasive procedures to physical therapy and complementary approaches. By combining traditional medical interventions with innovative techniques, we provide multiple pathways to pain relief and functional improvement, always focusing on sustainable results rather than temporary fixes.

Visit Our Salt Lake City Location

Ready to take control of your pain? Our modern facility is conveniently located at 6360 S 3000 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84121. Contact us at (801) 851-1105 to schedule your consultation, or visit compasspainandwellness.com to learn more about our services. At Compass Pain & Wellness, we're committed to being your trusted partner in pain management, helping you rediscover comfort and reclaim the activities you love.

column40:
Dr. Jex and his team were awesome! Dr. Jex was able to get my mom in for a same day appointment which was such a relief. He explained her MRI to us and gave us options on how to move forward. I so appreciate his multi-modal approach.|Brittney is always genuinely  concerned for her patients needs and well being she always goes above and beyond to find the best treatment available for her patients. Thank you Brittney for your awesome care and attention.|Dr. Hemingway is AMAZING and is very professional in handling my pain management. I would recommend her and Southwest Spine and Pain to anyone in need of pain management.|Brittany really was nice and a one on one had good bedside manners and really explained a lot about my back so I'm really happy I went to her|Craig is so detailed and thorough. Always double checks my medications. And offers different suggestions to handle a problem|Update: Waited over 25 minutes past my appointment to see the provider today. Southwest gave a generic response to the review and took no accountability.

I've been a patient at Southwest Spine and Pain for over four years and have generally had a very positive experience.

Today, I had a 9:50 AM appointment. I called ahead to let them know I was running late and was informed that I had a 10-minute grace period, so it was no problem. However, when I arrived at 10:02 AM, just as I was walking up the steps, I received a text saying my appointment had been canceled by the provider.

I've often had to wait for extended periods to see providers, yet today I couldn't even be given the courtesy of an additional two minutes.

Positives:
Their billing personnel, especially Karen in the St. George location has gone above and beyond to help me fight my insurance. She is truly a patient advocate!
Multiple locations with providers working at various sites make scheduling convenient.
A wide range of treatment plans are available, and the ones they create are highly effective.
The clinics are always clean, and about 75% of the staff are incredibly kind and friendly.
Every medical assistant I've interacted with has been exceptional.

Negatives:
Doctors and staff are frequently running behind, though this is common in most medical offices.
Due to the volume of patients and locations, there are delays in medication refills.
I've received inconsistent information from different providers at times.

Update: saw a new provider after having to reschedule. Provider asked questions that would have been well answered in my chart. Addressed problems I had been having and was told to use more ice, heat and stretching.|I love Britney Hemingway and her team! Best doctor I've ever had|Been a patient with Southwest for several years now. I've seen a few of the Nurse Practitioners and Dr Freeman. They treat me so well. If I ever have a pain or increased problem they are willing to try what I think is the best approach. They listen and I never feel rushed. Update** New Saratoga Springs office! And it's a nice chair wise as the Linden office is! Actually it has better seating than Linden. Thanks for getting updated seating it's a big deal when waiting!!

column40:
Thank you again Dr. Urie. Today my epidural  reduced the pain in my head and neck substantially. You are the best. So is your staff and family. You are helping me live through the most difficult time of my life.  Thank you all.  Dr. Urie is in Layton Utah.|Staff was kind, but Dr. Urie was rude and judgmental. I am a recovering addict that was self medicating for a 42% crooked angle in my lumbar spine. I chose to get clean and go to the Dr and get surgery to fix my back rather than self medicating with fentanyl and my spine is still not feeling better. He immediately started judging me and acting like my surgeon is just washing his hands of me! I left his office bawling because of the things he said to me. I had major back surgery 3 months ago and he told me my pain was fake and I just have a substance abuse issue! I have done substance abuse treatment in the past and if it's just a substance abuse issue, why would I choose to get clean and do it the right way to get my back fixed?! Sure made me feel hopeless when I left his office. Weird thing is he was still willing to treat me... what a jerk.|My wife was referred to this doctor for pain management. He told her he could fix her, did a whole bunch of different types of treatments on her! Epidurals and recommended physical therapy. This doctor is a scam and horrible!! We went somewhere else to get MRIs done and found out my wife has a bulged disc in her lower back and other issues in her upper back. Well we showed him the results just to see what he would say without telling him the results. He told my wife there was nothing wrong with her back that all she had was "tense muscles "  needless to say we WILL NEVER GO BACK TO HIM or recommend him to ANYONE!!!|Dr. Urie and his staff are excellent. He listened to my concerns and created a plan for healing and relief. I truly felt listened to and cared for while I was discussing my pain issues. The professionalism and patient care are amazing!|I have been having alot of different medical issues for many years now and have seen and received referrals to more than a dozen doctors and specialists. All of them have diagnosed me with many different illnesses and ailments including blood cancer which i began getting treatments for and did for 6 weeks until they decided i DID NOT have leukemia. I have been living with severe pain in my whole body for the past 5 years and have had numerous surgeries to replace several of my deteriorating joints. I was tired of all of the surgeries and misdiagnosis's and just wanted someone to tell me what is truly wrong with me. I came across Dr. Bradley Urie while looking for specialists in my area and made an appointment with him. First of all i was able to to get in very quickly and im so glad i did because he was the VERY 1ST doctor to actually listen to everything i had to say he asked me all the questions regarding my health that all the others did not and he is truly a godsend. He did a bunch of testing on my 1st appointment and at my 2nd appointment he had all the answers and a true diagnosis for me. Since i began seeing him he has been able to get my severe pain under control and has given me back some real quality of life. He has been truly amazing and his whole office staff are the sweetest and most helpful people you will ever meet. He is by far the best doctor i have ever seen and im so happy to have finally been able to have a true diagnosis and end my search for help. Dr. Urie is brilliant when it comes to pain issues and the body and has truly given me hope for my future. If you are looking for a true way to get your life back with severe medical pain issues you 100% need to have Dr. Urie as your doctor.|Dr Urie was kind, understanding and treated me with respect, He listened to what I had to say and didn't mind that I had questions.. I have been looking for a  solution and got one.. Thanks to you and your great Staff..|I had a good experience with Dr. Bradley A. Urie.
My experience is that Dr. Bradley A. Urie is willing to listen to his patients and interested in helping.|Dr Urie does a excellent job on pain management! If you need a great doctor, he's your guy!

column3:
Jeremiah Nathan West, MD serves the Layton, UT community as a distinguished specialist in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation. With a patient-centered approach, Dr. West provides comprehensive care focused on restoring function and improving quality of life for individuals suffering from various physical impairments and disabilities. His practice combines evidence-based treatments with personalized rehabilitation plans to address each patient's unique needs and goals.

At his Layton practice, Dr. West offers specialized treatments for musculoskeletal conditions, neurological disorders, sports injuries, and post-surgical rehabilitation. His expertise includes pain management, therapeutic injections, electrodiagnostic medicine, and developing customized exercise programs. Dr. West emphasizes a holistic approach to rehabilitation, considering both physical recovery and overall wellness in his treatment plans.

Education & Credentials

Dr. Jeremiah Nathan West completed extensive medical training and holds board certification in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation. His professional memberships and ongoing education ensure he remains at the forefront of rehabilitation medicine, implementing the latest advancements in his practice. Patients benefit from his comprehensive knowledge and specialized training in restorative care techniques.

Location & Contact Information

Dr. West's practice is conveniently located at 2075 University Park Blvd, Layton, UT 84041. The modern facility offers a comfortable environment equipped with advanced rehabilitation technology. For appointments or inquiries, patients can call +1 801-779-6330. Additional information about Dr. West's services, educational background, and certifications is available on the Intermountain Health website at doctors.intermountainhealth.org.

Once in a while life brings us little miracles, I received one 5 years ago when I found these guys. Changed my life for the better and I can't thank them enough. Keep up the good work! God bless all of you!
Robert|Best pain management Doctor office! Dr. West is the great! He listens to you and can help in every way! He has the best team! Everyone is super friendly and very helpful! I recommend them to everyone I know!|My appointment was scheduled for 1pm. Because of traffic congestion and the landscaping crew (their vehicles were parked as to not allow the parking spaces to be  reached) at the clinic I walked in the clinic doors at 1:01pm. Walked in, there were 7 people in line at the reception desk so I took the elevator to where Dr. West's off ice was located. It was no longer there. I took the elevator back down  to the 1st floor. It was now 1:07pm I stood in line to talk to the receptionist. There were 3 persons in line at that time. I made it to the receptionist and was told it is now 1:19pm. I was told I had to to reschedule because Dr. West was with his final appointment of the day. Which means I would still be waiting for my appointment either way if I had been early. I usually wait approximately 10 minutes prior to seeing the doctor before I am called into the office to wait in the room. So it would not have made any difference. I rescheduled.
I suggest finding a solution in parking, scheduling, line and waiting room waiting policies and also stop moving Dr. West's office. I can not rate an appointment that did not happen.|I appreciate Dr. West so much! Over the last few years in his care my quality of life has improved significantly. He never dismisses my complaints, and he's willing to work together to find multifaceted solutions that work for me personally. He has taken the time to understand my genetic condition, which many medical professionals fail to take time to do. His entire team is so professional. Having physical therapy, counseling, and pharmacology as part of a chronic pain management team is essential!  He even has a walking group.
Care that centers on the whole person seems to have a better outcome. Bravo!|I love Dr. West and his staff. They are efficient and kind and caring. He's thorough and is willing to do what needs to be done to understand why are you feel the pain you feel and how we can work together to help eliminate as much pain as possible without doing detriment to my health .

column2: Wasatch Pain Solutions, Interventional Spine & Orthopedics
column3:
Wasatch Pain Solutions serves Pleasant Grove, Utah and surrounding communities with comprehensive interventional spine and orthopedic care. Our state-of-the-art facility offers advanced pain management solutions using equipment that rivals most hospitals and surgical centers. As Utah's first Regenexx Provider, we specialize in cutting-edge regenerative orthopedic procedures designed to address chronic pain conditions, sports injuries, and degenerative disorders without resorting to invasive surgeries.

At Wasatch Pain Solutions, we provide a comprehensive range of interventional treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our specialized services include:

  • Platelet-rich plasma (PRP) therapy for tissue healing

  • Stem cell therapy using bone marrow concentrate

  • Advanced treatments for arthritis and joint pain

  • Sports injury rehabilitation and recovery

  • Interventional spine procedures for back and neck pain

  • Non-surgical approaches to degenerative conditions

The Regenexx Advantage

As Utah's pioneering Regenexx Provider, we utilize proprietary protocols that yield higher concentrations of regenerative cells compared to standard procedures. This advanced approach allows us to effectively treat conditions affecting joints, spine, and soft tissues with minimal downtime and reduced reliance on pain medications or surgical interventions.

Our Facility

Located at 1988 W 930 N, Suite B in Pleasant Grove, our modern facility is equipped with cutting-edge diagnostic and treatment technology. Our environment is designed for patient comfort while maintaining the highest standards of medical care and safety.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our innovative approaches to pain management and orthopedic care, contact us today:

Phone: (801) 302-2690

Website: http://wasatchpainsolutions.com/

Address: 1988 W 930 N, Suite B, Pleasant Grove, UT 84062, United States
column9: Medical clinic|Pain control clinic|Physiatrist|Sports medicine physician
column11: At Wasatch Pain Solutions, we provide the most advanced interventional spine and pain treatments on state of the art equipment that rivals most hospitals and surgical centers. We are Utah's first Regenexx Provider of regenerative orthopedic procedures, including platelet rich plasma and stem cell therapy (bone marrow concentrate) for arthritis, injuries, degenerative conditions, and sports-related injuries and conditions.

column40:
So far I'm thrilled with this office and the staff. I've previously been with a pain clinic and now that I've been to Wasatch Pain I know the previous doctor didn't care. From the first initial call to having injections done it's all been good. Lots of follow up, which I love and need. My injection today was quick and painless.|All the staff have been wonderful; Shannel has been especially kind and helpful to me. Am so grateful to all of them, and very happy to have finally gotten my injections!!  (However, I missed meeting Dr. Kahn. Guess I was too "out of it". Was really looking forward to meeting him.) All these people have been so nice! God bless them all!|I was in a bad car accident. I also have MS and rheumatoid arthritis and that's a lot. I love the doctors and the nursing staff. They Make me feel very comfortable. I don't know what I would do without help ...  They have positively changed my life forever|I have come to Wasatch Pain Solution for several issues over the years and I've always had good experiences with great results. They have treated my knees with Regenexx stem cell procedure. My shoulders with steroid injection. Given me advice on physical therapy locations. I've even sent several family members to Wasatch who have also had great results for back pain, foot problems, hip and knee pains. I would 10/10 recommend Wasatch to anyone.|I love Wasatch Pain Solution! After years of going to other pain clinics and receiving  unsuccessful treatments and injections, I finally have had 50% pain relief from Wasatch! The staff is exceptionally kind and Shawn, my PA, always listens, understands and actively tries to find ways to help me. The whole experience is always positive and hopeful.|I have been going here for a few months, and so far I've been impressed. I have gotten several injections trying to pinpoint where my pain is coming from. I think we've figured out one part of the solution. Shawn Pendleton PA has listened to me and taken me seriously.
I would love to actually be introduced to Dr. Qamar Khan before a procedure. I'm actually unsure if it's him giving me the injections or not.
The office staff at both the Pleasant Grove and South Jordan offices have been kind and caring as well.|I really can't understand these reviews but I can just tell you what I experienced. I have had shots before in Florida and nothing compares to the first class treatment this clinic offers.
From the time I made my appointment, meeting  Chad (who is the PA) and the nurse, meeting the front desk employee EVERYONE has been super organized, extremely friendly and very professional. They really did care about how much pain I was in. My appointments are emailed an texted to me, remind me and they follow up with me.
Yesterday I went for my first shot in Jordon address, AGAIN EVERYONE extremely professional, organized and caring towards my pain. I got my shot  and today I FEEL FANTASTIC!!! I haven't felt this good in years.
I can not say enough good things about everyone there. Didn't even meet Dr Khan (well except when I was facing down to get my shot) lol
but he did a fantastic job I would say!! I am so pleased I feel like I am 20 again. Thanks to everyone there!!|I have been a client of Wasatch Pain Solutions for several years. This office is in the business of making money. I thought they were trying to help me. But after 2+ years, the pain that I suffer from, keeps returning. They have not offered stem cell services or anything that would provide a permanent solution. They are happy that I keep returning for more treatment. I keep their wallets well padded. I am beyond frustrated with this office. You would think that a place where I pay as much money as I do they would be friendly when I call. Half the time, they act like they don't know who I am. There is no personalization by anyone besides Colin, the PA or Anna, one of the receptionists. It is because of these two individuals that they get a 2 star rating from me and not a 0 star. I WILL NOT be returning, or giving Wasatch Pain Solutions any more money or any of my business.

column3:
Skyline Pain Clinic in Washington Terrace, Utah serves patients throughout Weber County with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded on the principle that chronic pain requires personalized, multifaceted treatment approaches, our clinic brings together a team of specialized medical professionals dedicated to improving quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain conditions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Imani, MD, alongside Adult Nurse Practitioner Marinda Paskett and Physician Assistant David G. Jones, we offer evidence-based interventions tailored to each patient's unique circumstances.

At Skyline Pain Clinic, we understand that chronic pain can be debilitating and often misunderstood. Our providers specialize in developing comprehensive treatment plans that go beyond simply masking symptoms. Whether you're dealing with back pain, joint issues, neuropathy, or other chronic conditions, our team works diligently to identify root causes and implement effective management strategies.

Patient-Centered Approach

We recognize that many patients come to us believing surgery or medication are their only options for relief. Our philosophy centers on patient education and collaborative care planning. Dr. Imani and our clinical team take the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, explain treatment options, and develop personalized care plans that may include innovative interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications.

Our Location and Contact Information

Skyline Pain Clinic is conveniently located at 5315 S 500 E A, Washington Terrace, UT 84405. We welcome new patients and referrals from throughout the region. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (801) 475-7707. Additional information about our practice and treatment approaches can be found on our website at https://skylinepainandhorm.wixsite.com/skylinepain.
column11: Guided by Dr. Imani, MD, Adult Nurse Practitioner Marinda Paskett, and Physician Assistant David G.Jones specializes in chronic pain management. We are here to help those who want help managing their chronic pain. If you believe the only way to alleviate the suffering is through surgery or medication, our providers can help you with a patient-centered care plan.

column38: Jordan Miller|Amanda Harsin|S S|Jennifer Ziebach|Shane Toro|Mrs. Catherine|Deana Rupe (XenaScully5150)|See'ya Later
column40:
I see PA. Marinda paskett for pain managment. She has been extremely helpful in helping me manage my pain. She helps find what best works for you. I see DR. Jahan Imanhi I see him as my neurologist. He is a very smart man that really wants to help his patients.
The only way you'll have a bad experience is if you don't take you medication responsibly and lie to your Drs.|I have been a patient of Mirinda's for a year now. If wasn't for her I wouldn't know what is really going on with my body. I would recommend her to anyone.
I am also a patient of Dr imani. Last September we found out I have a pseudotumor cerebri. Imani had been amazing at helping me to figure out what is wrong. On numerous occasions he has wanted me in that day for a procedure. But to my amazement his "nurse" does not follow instructions. I was told in February after my second spinal tap that I needed to have a Shunt placed immediately. So after a week I called back because I had not heard anything. And I got yelled at by his nurse Sharon for calling. So since February after finding out that the referral they sent out was not covered on my insurance. I asked for her help and she replied with it is the patients responsibility to find a nuersugeon. So for the last 3 months I've been trying to get into imani to see what our options are. Every time I schedule an apt with the front desk sharon calls and says imani doesn't want to see me, or that I have an outstanding bill that no one told me about every month I go in. Or any other excuse she can come up with. I've talked to my pain dr and there is nothing she can do. And she doesn't understand why Sharon is so cold and rude to me. I have been very patient in dealing with this woman. But a couple weeks ago we found out my mother has the same pseudotumor. And of course I was like go see imani. With her first apt our car over heated and we were 5 minutes late and they would not see her. She was then rescheduled for Monday. At that time I scheduled my apt right after hers in hopes we could kill 2 birds with 1 stone. So we went in and I was told I could not be seen. Again. So my mother is getting checked in and they tell her she has a $50 deductible. They take her papers back to Sharon and a few minutes later the girl at the front desk was on the phone with someone saying "yeah it's Amanda's mom" . Then she came back out and told my mom she had to pay $100 or could not be seen. My mom was extremely upset seems how her being a patient has nothing to do with me being a patient. We left. Got down the road and mom realized she didn't get her papers back so we turn around. She goes in and Sharon refuses to give back her papers saying she needs them. At this point I'm upset. It's one thing to bully me but why are you bullying my mom. So I made some calls to find out what can be done with this nurse that has made my life a living hell. I've had to call drs from ogden to provo and get a copy of my referral from Sharon because she refused to send it off. So I had to fax my referral of to numerous drs trying to get a Shunt put in my head. I'm suffering from extreme headaches, losing my vision and hearing because if the pressure in my head from this pseudotumor. And she will not let me see Dr imani. Yesterday I spoke to someone at Utah department of professional licensing. He then tried to contact Sharon because how I'm being treated is illegal for a licensed nurse. Come to find out she is not even a nurse. But she is giving shots and drawing blood? Scary now that I know the truth. I have called several times to speak with imani and she won't let me. And as of today my apts with my pain dr have been canceled. With no one answering me as to why. Pretty sure it's illegal to cut a patient on pain meds off like that? I have absolutely no problems or issues with anyone in this office besides Sharon. But my mother was discriminated against by Sharon. And I've been treated poorly. We are contacting lawyers because of this. We will be filing a discrimination lawsuit against Sharon. I hope to hear from mirinda and imani to get this matter fixed. Again my only problem is being treated poorly by Sharon while I'm in need of a very serious surgery and can go blind at any moment. Thank you. Hope to settle this and have my drs back I need them.|Run for your life!  I would ask around to find a clinic better than this one.  If you want to be degraded, and humiliated and treated like a druggie, then by all means go here.  Jennifer the nurse assistant is one of the WORST people I've ever had to work with in the medical community.  You will be made to feel awful for having chronic pain or disease. Marinda is good, but only when you have access to her which is during your appointment.  If you have ANY issues in between that time you are screwed because they have gatekeepers who will treat you terrible.  No one should be made to feel the way these people treat you.|Best clinic we've ever been to. They actually LISTEN to their patients & don't try to tell their patients how they feel. We highly recommend this place & we tell all our family when they need a pain clinic. Love Skyline.|I'm the type of person that gives everyone a chance regardless of what others say about them. So I decided to give them a shot even after reading all of the terrible reviews on google and yelp. Horrible mistake. Almost lost coverage of my medications because they made me sign something that said I was being treated for something I wasn't being treated for. I went their for pain management and they treated me like an addict. Called me in every week to count my pills and I had to show up within 24hours of them calling me or they were going to cut me off? They also made me see a social worker which they claimed everyone had to see which is total bs. They also made me pay for it twice. They said it would be $X but it was $X+$Y they make you do urine screens every time you go In. They literally make you do urine screens every time you go in which I was okay with but once they started making me call out of work to go in and count my pills that's when enough was enough. If you want pain management go to dr coles at tanner clinic. They treat you with compassion and respect and they are sincere. You can tell they actually care and will do anything to make you feel welcome and comfortable and a patient instead of some addict. Horrible experience please save your time and money. Take it from someone who gives everyone a chance. Learn from my mistake. Good luck.|Unfortunately, being in chronic pain is a hard thing to live with.  I am grateful for the Dr.'s at Skyline Pain  Clinic  to help me live the best active lifestyle I can achieve at this moment!
They offer many non-narcotics options for my pain which is extremely nice! If you are in real major and chronic pain, you shouldn't have a problem adhering to their rules to protect themselves and you.
The staff is generally friendly and lighthearted, ready to great you with a smile!|I have never had anything go wrong with them. They are real nice to me. I went to Utah pain and rehab for 2 years and they out of no where treated me like dirt. My Dr. had her tech let me go in front of the whole waiting room. Unprofessional and illegal. Skyline took me right away and have been nothing but kind to me. I've been nothing but satisfied with them.|I have been going here for years I have seen multiple doctor there, there was only 1 I didn't like but she is gone now. I see  Dr Jared Abrams now he is really nice and truly cares his med assistant Alex she is so nice and they want to help  I have been to alot of different doctors in my life and I really like Dr Jared if I have a problem with my meds he wants to help i just went there yesterday and I had a terrible migraine for 2 days while I was waiting Dr Jared gave me this thing to try and help my head feel better and with in seconds I felt so much better. I love skyline pain clinic, u have to remember everywhere u go there might be someone or something u might not like but u get that n e where u go. Skyline is a good pain management Dr if u need one, this is the place!

column3:
Mathew L. Romankowski, MD serves the Salt Lake City, UT area as a distinguished specialist in Pain Medicine. With a patient-centered approach, Dr. Romankowski has established himself as a trusted healthcare provider dedicated to helping individuals manage chronic pain and improve their quality of life. His practice combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care, offering comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At his practice located at 389 S 900 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, Dr. Romankowski provides expert diagnosis and treatment for various pain conditions. His approach integrates multiple modalities including interventional procedures, medication management, and collaborative care with other specialists. Patients benefit from his thorough evaluations and personalized treatment plans designed to address both symptoms and underlying causes of pain.

Education and Credentials

Dr. Romankowski brings impressive qualifications to his practice. His educational background includes rigorous medical training and specialized focus in pain medicine. He maintains board certifications in his field and regularly participates in continuing education to stay current with the latest advancements in pain management techniques and treatments. His professional memberships connect him with leading experts in pain medicine, ensuring his patients receive care informed by current best practices.

Patient Care Philosophy

What distinguishes Dr. Romankowski's practice is his commitment to treating the whole person, not just the pain condition. He takes time to understand each patient's medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals before developing treatment strategies. This comprehensive approach helps patients achieve meaningful improvements in function and comfort while minimizing medication dependence.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Mathew L. Romankowski, patients can call +1 385-282-2600. His office welcomes new patients and accepts various insurance plans. For more detailed information about Dr. Romankowski's practice, including his educational background, training, board certifications, and professional affiliations, visit his profile at Intermountain Health.
