column2: Southwest Spine & Pain Center - Saint George
column3:
Southwest Spine & Pain Center in Saint George, Utah serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management services. Operated by Vista Healthcare, this specialized medical facility brings together a team of double-board certified pain management specialists dedicated to addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions. Their patient-centered approach combines cutting-edge treatments with compassionate care, making them a trusted resource for residents throughout Southern Utah seeking relief from debilitating pain.

At Southwest Spine & Pain Center, patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. The center offers a wide spectrum of treatment options including advanced injection therapies, minimally invasive surgical procedures, careful medication management, and coordinated physical therapy programs. Their specialists work closely with patients to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique aspects of each individual's pain condition.

Expert Medical Team

The center's double-board certified physicians bring extensive training and experience to every patient interaction. These specialists possess advanced qualifications in pain management and related medical disciplines, ensuring patients receive the highest standard of care. The team stays at the forefront of pain management innovations, implementing evidence-based approaches that maximize effectiveness while minimizing risks.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 2891 E Mall Dr #101, St. George, UT 84790, the center provides a modern, comfortable environment equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. The facility is designed to support the full range of pain management services offered, from initial consultations to specialized procedures.

Patient-Focused Approach

Southwest Spine & Pain Center distinguishes itself through its unwavering commitment to helping patients "live life to the fullest." Understanding that pain can significantly impact quality of life, the team focuses not just on symptom management but on comprehensive solutions that address underlying causes when possible. This holistic philosophy guides all aspects of patient care.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, patients can call +1 435-656-2424 or visit their website at https://www.southwestspineandpain.com/locations/st-george-medical-center-dr.
column11:
At Southwest Spine & Pain Center by Vista Healthcare, our double-board certified pain management specialists provide comprehensive pain care by using a wide variety of treatment options. This includes injection therapies, minimally invasive surgery, management of appropriate pain medications, and coordinating physical therapy and advanced imaging.

Whether you are suffering from acute or chronic pain, the pain management doctors at Southwest Spine & Pain Center are dedicated to helping you live life to the fullest.

column40: I absolutely love Southwest Spine and Pain Center. The doctors are caring, compassionate, and are truly interested in my health and well being. Jenna Summerhays is an amazing practitioner who listens and focuses on my specific needs and recommends treatment plans specifically for me. I would recommend these doctors to anyone who deals with long term pain issues.|I have been patient of Jeffrey Wright for almost 8 years now. I will forever have him as my doctor. He has a compassionate bedside manner and takes the time to listen to you. The office staff has also Amazing and it's nice to not have to wait for a callback when you need any type of assistance. his appointments are in and out so you're not stuck around waiting. 10 out of 10 stars!|I was 11 minutes late today. I waited a few minutes because they were taking care of someone. When it was finally my turn I was told they called my name at 10 after and they Canceled me. It was not, let's see if we can squeeze you in. It was "you will need to come back". I have waited over 30 minutes to been seen, but one minute passed their policy and canceled. I am very disappointed in this policy and when I mentioned this I was told every Doctor's office has this policy. I never did! My partners never did! I understand they are very large and personal touch is not a priority. This was not for a sore thumb, but a serious issue. Very sad this is their approach to Customer Service.|Jenna Summerhays is one of the APPS at this office and she is absolutely wonderful. She is so kindhearted, soft spoken, cares and actually listens. She remembers me and what we talked about personally each time I see her; as well as all my medical issues and what we are working on. I planned to go back to my old doctor when I moved back home, but Jenna and her staff changed my mind. I feel so cared about here at their office, and they can do everything with their surgical side, which means I don't have to go to multiple places, which saves me time and money.|I love Dr. Jenna Summerhayes. Desert Pain Specialists serves Hurricane, Utah and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating both acute and chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. With our state-of-the-art facility located in Hurricane, we combine advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment options to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Desert Pain Specialists, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and treatment modalities designed to provide lasting relief. Our physicians are experts in conditions affecting the spine, joints, nerves, and musculoskeletal system. We utilize precision-guided injections, minimally invasive techniques, medication management, and physical therapy recommendations to create personalized treatment plans that maximize function and quality of life.

Patient-Centered Approach

Our physicians take time to listen, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and explain treatment options in clear, understandable terms. Contact Information

UTAH Pain Management Center in Bountiful, Utah provides comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout the greater Salt Lake City area. Our specialized medical facility focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches and personalized treatment plans. With a team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for patients seeking relief from persistent pain issues that affect their quality of life.

At UTAH Pain Management Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and pain resulting from injuries or surgical procedures.

Our Facility and Approach

Located at 520 Medical Dr, Bountiful, UT 84010, our modern medical facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient, focusing not just on pain relief but on improving overall function and quality of life. Our goal is to help patients return to their daily activities with minimal discomfort and reduced reliance on pain medications.

Patient-Centered Care

We pride ourselves on delivering compassionate, patient-centered care in a supportive environment. Our staff works closely with referring physicians and other healthcare providers to ensure coordinated care. New patients are welcomed with comprehensive evaluations to determine the most effective treatment approach for their specific condition.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 801-299-6824 or visit our website at www.utahpaincenter.com. Our office is conveniently located just minutes from I-15, making us accessible to patients throughout Davis County and the greater Salt Lake City metropolitan area.
column38: Audrey Workman|Mike Belcher|Michelle Allen|Todd West
column40:
The doctor and team did great. But I got billed incorrectly. They charged my insurance over $8,000 for botox to treat my migraines. I tried talking to Lakeview hospital, this clinic, and the billing company.
Only one person said she would help me. By giving me number and emails to use to contact the correct person to talk to. But after multiple attempts and months and hours of my time. I could not get a hold of that person.  And every other person said they could help me with payment plans but that all.
They billed the wrong codes so I couldn't even use the botox reimbursement program. And I tried to tell them but they refused.
I called multiple other clinic and got quotes for this procedure and they were all around $2,000. And those clinics also verified the codes that would be billed were not the ones I got billed for.
You will get good care here from the providers. But you are risking having fraudulent billing done and being forced to pay thousands of dollars more. I would recommend looking elsewhere that will provide accurate billing, good customer service, along with there great medical care.|Dr. Nelson & team are absolutely the best. They have been taking CARE of me for many years.
PT. Des Hammer has helped myself in many ways. Her Suggestions have helped me tremendously. .|I don't have a problem with the doctor I saw.  It was a normal doctor visit.  The reason for the low rating is the extra bill I received on top of the doctor's bill.  I wish I was informed prior to the visit and not in the waiting room when  I was required to sign several documents that I was going to be billed from both the doctor and Lakeview Hospital for my appointment.  Apparently Lakeview hospital bills an additional $200 just for using "their facilities" and by using "their facilities" it means you have an appointment at the center.  Lakeview hospital performed no other services.  The hospital bill was almost the same price as the doctor's bill. I noticed that the Utah Pain Management Center's official website does not include the Bountiful site as a place to leave feedback. I'm guessing that in order to keep their 5 star rating they don't want patients leaving feedback about this dishonest double billing practice agreement that they have going on between them and Lakeview Hospital.|Thank you for helping me with a chronic pain problem I've had since I was little! Lovely people and great doctors.

column40: Very welcoming environment right when I walked in it smelled wonderful , all front desk receptionists were very pleasant & kind. Gabe was such a sweetheart he dimmed the lights for me because my eyes hurt from the brightness. Dr. Burnn looks like she's a model, I've never seen anyone so stunning as her. She is very helpful & informative  &  went out of her way to help me with my severe headaches even though that wasn't my reason for my visit. Overall process was fast I was an hour and a half early, sat down for 5 minutes & was called back & I had such a wonderful experience everyone there was so beautiful & had great attitudes &  very helpful it is a wonderful atmosphere it was also my 1st time there!|I was a little anxious about letting a doctor stab a needle into my spine...but from the moment I arrived at Granger Medical, I felt like I was with family. Highly recommend this team if you need your spine stabbed. :)|I had a challenging experience with this Dr. Ashleigh Byrne. While I believe she is skilled in her field, I felt that my concerns and questions were not adequately addressed during my visit. I think it would be beneficial if she spent more time with her patients to ensure all their questions are answered. I really get the feeling that they care about me as a patient and as a person.  I don't usually have to wait very long, and I have always had my questions and concerns addressed very respectfully.  Dr. Byrne is extremely knowledgeable and friendly, which don't always go together!   I would definitely recommend this office.|Dr. Byrne is easy to talk to and throughly explains the issues I have. Lisa J. Hrushka, DO serves the Salt Lake City, Utah community as a distinguished specialist in Pain Medicine. With a patient-centered approach, Dr. Hrushka provides comprehensive pain management solutions at her practice located at 389 S 900 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84102. Her expertise encompasses a wide range of pain conditions, offering both interventional procedures and holistic treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Hrushka's practice focuses on diagnosing and treating various chronic pain conditions, including but not limited to back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. She employs evidence-based approaches that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies designed to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Education and Credentials

As a Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO), Dr. Hrushka brings a unique perspective to pain management, combining traditional medical knowledge with osteopathic principles that emphasize the body's natural ability to heal. Her extensive training and board certifications in Pain Medicine ensure patients receive the highest standard of care based on the latest advancements in the field. Dr. Hrushka maintains active memberships in several professional medical organizations, allowing her to stay at the forefront of pain management innovations.

Patient Care Philosophy

Dr. Hrushka believes in developing collaborative relationships with her patients, taking time to understand their pain experiences and goals for treatment. This personalized approach helps create effective management strategies that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Her compassionate care model has earned her the trust and respect of patients throughout the Salt Lake City area.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Lisa J. Hrushka, patients can call +1 801-235-7246. Her practice is affiliated with Intermountain Health, providing patients access to a comprehensive healthcare network. For more detailed information about Dr. Hrushka's qualifications and services, prospective patients can visit her profile at Intermountain Health Providers.

column40:
I am most grateful that Dr Huntsman now has Dr Hong as an associate in his Institute.  Dr Hong has been fabulous in taking the time required to evaluate my previous years of extensive surgery.  His pain management strategy combines tuning a forgotten spinal stimulator with interventional radiological injections. Within minutes he had Boston Scientific interacting and tuning programs to my relief. It is unprecedented to receive Dr Hong's personal touch and remarkable skills.|Dr. Hong is very thorough and took time to find out the best treatment plan for me. He is very kind, caring and concerned about relieving my chronic pain.|The amount of care Dr. Hong provides is unmatched. Managing chronic pain takes an immense toll, but Dr. Hong seemed to make it so much easier to handle.|Utah patients. You have received a doctor of immense skill, compassion and dedication.
Dr John Hong was my pain doctor in the Chicago area for nearly 15 years. I dearly miss him.
The practice here in Chicago is pushing away older patients in favor of taking Pain Management backwards instead of forwards by changing to an "Interventional" practice. Taking a cookie cutter, one size rules. I know Dr Hong will provide the utmost care for his patients.|I was Dr. Hong's first patient when he began his practice. He is helpful, kind and understanding. I am sad that he has left this practice, but am grateful for the wonderful care he gave to me.|I have observed Dr. Hong performing numerous pain management procedures.  He is one of the most meticulous and careful pain doctors I have met.  He is a great listener and will not push for any procedure that is not in a patients best interest.|I suffered from severe back pain for years after an accident until I was referred to Dr. Hong. Prior to that, I was treated solely with only medication for years as well. Dr. Hong developed a treatment plan specific to my needs and we cut back on my medication by over half, which was one of my goals. Physical therapy and other non evasive methods with the treatment plans Dr. Hong developed for me, I was finally able to start enjoying activities I haven't been able to for years and improved my quality of life. Dr. Hong really listens to his patients and put his patients first. I would highly recommend him to anyone. Jan M.|Dr.Hong has managed my chronic pain for the past three years. He is an amazing physician who listens to me, and through many avenues made my pain tolerable. Thank you to Dr.Hong, and staff

So even though they are close and can get you in quick, they're just not on the ball enough for me to go back.|Jody is one of my favorite people! Not only is she completely focused on me, as a patient, but as a person with thoughts and questions. She is the best!|Jody is wonderful. I was not seen by jody this last time, and did not feel as comfortable as I do with Jody. There were items I needed to discuss and the doctor did not come back in to talk with me after ordering a UA. He simply ordered it and left. Jody spends time with me. I was trying to explain that I spent 4 days in the hospital for voluntary detox from alcohol. Other medications will show in screening. I also wanted to tell Jody that I have an appointment with a hand specialist that may have to repair my middle finger surgically. I trust Jody and would have rather rescheduled my appointment then had someone else who does not know my situation visit with me. Since opening our Cedar City location, we have established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider dedicated to improving quality of life for those suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our team works collaboratively to address the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain.

After having been injured since 1994, moving to six different states and seeing countless doctors and surgeons, I must say Dr Casey Muir and his entire staff in Cedar City have been the most professional and most pleasant office to visit of all!  They never waste my time with endless waiting everyone has consistently been so nice and efficient that I am always amazed. I am so grateful I found them. Thanks very much Dr. Muir!|As a patient of Dane Johnson, he is an amazing practitioner over the years with him he has definitely helped me secure my health and secured a better more comfortable life helping me get my surgeries needed so I'm always a step closer to being able to live a life of less pain. I believe we work well together. I'm truly grateful to have him as a doctor.  SWSP CENTER is the very best Utah and cedar city has to offer.|I am so thankful I found my Doctor Dayne and all of the ones that help me under his care their. I am now walking. Talking. And feeding my self again. Thank you south west and spine   thank you for saving my life. D. P.|Dayne and his assistants are well informed. He listens and is always trying to make the most of our visits. They are interested in the problems and solutions.|I've been going to this pain clinic for a few years. Wendy who checks you in is very polite Datne and his MAs are great. They listen to you and care about you. I've had steroud injections and RFA in my lower back which helps a lot.|I have had a great experience at South West Spine and Pain. Great doctors, great physicians assistant great nurses great staff. It wasn't for South West Pain. I would never have been able to go back to work. I Give them 10 out of 10.|I've been seeing Dayne at SWSP for over a year now and really appreciate the care he provides.  He understands my chronic illness and treats me with respect and works with me to keep me as pain feee as possible.|I had a cortisone injection in my back performed by Dr. Muir and it was a terrible experience. I've never had a Dr not take the time to go over procedure with me before just diving into it. There was zero compassion and care taken with me. I wasn't given a chance to ask any questions, my clothes were just yanked out of the way without giving me a heads up, and the moment the needle was inserted into my back was a painful surprise. Then I was out of the room and the next patient was heading in before I'd even sat down to have my vitals checked. I asked the nurse checking my vitals about possible side effects or things I needed to watch out for and was only told not to put heat on my back, and that there was a possibility that I might pee my pants later. I've been having muscle cramps all over my body since then (even in my face), and during my follow-up was told it's a side effect of the steroid and was prescribed a muscle relaxer.

Also, each time I've gone there the receptionist wants me to pay what I have left on my deductible. And each time I would have to tell her that I was going to only pay my office visit co-pay and please bill my insurance. I'll never set foot again in this clinic.

Joshua J. Minori, DO serves Park City, Utah, as a distinguished pain medicine specialist dedicated to improving quality of life for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach, Dr. Minori combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address complex pain management needs for residents throughout Summit County and surrounding areas.

At his practice located at 900 Round Valley Dr #200, Park City, UT 84060, Dr. Minori offers specialized interventions for various pain conditions including back pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical discomfort. His integrative approach may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and collaborative care plans tailored to each patient's unique circumstances.

Education and Credentials

Dr. Joshua J. Minori completed extensive medical training specializing in Pain Medicine. His educational background and ongoing professional development ensure patients receive care aligned with the latest advancements in pain management techniques. As a Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO), he brings a holistic perspective to treatment, considering how pain affects the entire body and overall wellness.

Patient Care Philosophy

Patients appreciate Dr. Minori's thorough approach to diagnosis and treatment planning. He takes time to understand each individual's pain experience, functional goals, and concerns before developing comprehensive management strategies. This personalized attention has established him as a trusted provider within the Intermountain Health network.

For consultations or to schedule an appointment with Dr. Minori, patients can call +1 435-658-7400. Additional information about his practice, including educational background, board certifications, and professional memberships can be found on the Intermountain Health website at doctors.intermountainhealth.org.

Southwest Spine & Pain Center - Mt. Pleasant serves residents throughout Mt. Pleasant, Utah and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Founded on principles of comprehensive care and patient-centered treatment, this premier medical facility has established itself as a trusted resource for those suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions. The center's approach integrates multiple treatment modalities to address the complex nature of pain, ensuring patients receive customized care plans tailored to their specific needs.

At Southwest Spine & Pain Center, patients benefit from the expertise of double-board certified pain management specialists who utilize evidence-based approaches to pain relief. The center offers a diverse range of treatment options including:

  • Advanced injection therapies

  • Minimally invasive surgical procedures

  • Responsible medication management

  • Coordinated physical therapy programs

  • State-of-the-art diagnostic imaging

Patient-Centered Approach

The dedicated team at Southwest Spine & Pain Center understands that pain affects each person differently. Their philosophy centers on helping patients regain functionality and improve quality of life through personalized treatment plans. Whether addressing back pain, joint issues, neuropathy, or complex regional pain syndromes, the specialists work collaboratively with patients to develop effective pain management strategies.

Location and Contact Information

Southwest Spine & Pain Center's Mt. Pleasant facility is conveniently located at 1125 Blackhawk Blvd, Mt Pleasant, UT 84647. Patients seeking consultation or treatment can schedule appointments by calling +1 435-986-7156. For additional information about services and other locations, visit their website at www.southwestspineandpain.com/locations/mt-pleasant.

At Southwest Spine & Pain Center, our double-board certified pain management specialists provide comprehensive pain care by using a wide variety of treatment options. Whether you are suffering from acute or chronic pain, the pain management doctors at Southwest Spine & Pain Center are dedicated to helping you live life to the fullest.

Alta Pain Physicians - Bountiful serves the Bountiful, Utah community with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Established as a trusted healthcare provider in the region, our Bountiful clinic represents our commitment to bringing specialized pain management services closer to residents of Davis County. At Alta Pain Physicians, we understand that pain not only affects you physically, but it can negatively impact your relationships at home, work, and in the community. Our board-certified physicians and dedicated staff work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

Employing a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, we're here to help you manage your pain and regain control of your life. Our team combines advanced interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health strategies to address pain from multiple angles. This integrated approach allows us to treat not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain, providing more effective and lasting relief for our patients.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience treating a wide range of pain conditions, including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. Using state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and evidence-based treatments, we develop targeted interventions that minimize discomfort and maximize quality of life.

Convenient Locations

With locations in Sandy and Bountiful, Alta Pain Physicians serves patients in Salt Lake, Utah, and Davis counties. Our Bountiful office is conveniently located at 557 W 2600 S, Bountiful, UT 84010, making quality pain care accessible to residents throughout the northern Salt Lake metropolitan area.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please visit our website at www.altapainphysicians.com or call us directly at +1 801-462-2205. Our compassionate staff is ready to assist you on your journey toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.

column38: Valerie Cornish|Chris Clark|Ricky Sutherland|Lezli Budge|Danielle White|Daniel Soulia|KrisTina Albrecht|Norm
column40:
I've been dealing with chronic lower back pain for the past 10 years and within the last year it has gotten immensely worse to the point where my quality of life has been affected in every way possible. NO doctor will take the time to ever listen to me, they look at me and immediately so "no you're too young to be having these problems" or "there's not much we can do about back pain these days". When i met with Dr. Urie i immediately felt seen and HEARD. His bedside manner is incredible and Mrs. Urie was so kind. He took the time to listen to me and come up with a pain management plan that worked for the both of us. I am so incredibly grateful for Dr. Urie!! I feel like he gave me my life back. I would highly recommend this practice to anyone struggling with pain. He is highly professional and very knowledgeable. Everyone in this office is just kind and caring and they treat you with respect.|So I have been dealing with chronic back pain since about 2010. I have had injections, resotomy, I've tried different shoes, physical therapy, I had my SI joint fused and I've had my lower L4, L5 and S1 fused back in November 2023. We thought that would help.  I've been so frustrated with the pain that I didn't have a good quality of life.  So one day I meet Dr. Urie and his wife Sandra and talk to them. Really nice people. I made an appointment to go talk to him about different things that we could try. So back in June I decided to go with an injection with this medication I had never heard of.  It worked. I couldn't believe it. Well then I decided to have a pain pump put in. I cannot tell you how happy I am with the results.  Dr. Urie did a wonderful job and took good care of me.  I would definitely recommend him. If your having back pain or any other kind of issues. Go see Dr. Urie.  They have been so kind to me.
Thank you Dr. Urie and Sandra.

Christine spillman|Thank you again Dr. Urie. Today my epidural  reduced the pain in my head and neck substantially. You are the best. So is your staff and family.|I have a rare disease that causes me severe and almost constant pain. I've been treated unkindly by even pain management specialists and have experienced their unscrupulous practices including prescribing "breakthrough" pain meds which promptly made my long term pain med ineffective.
Dr Urie is the first doctor that I've ever felt totally safe with. He's knowledgeable, kind and compassionate. When I'm at my appointment he's completely devoted to me, I'm never rushed, he's very thorough and listens to every thing I want to discuss. He is the expert so I ask him questions about what might best for my treatment and I take his advice because I know he knows what he's doing and if I feel strongly about something and he feels it's safe for me then we'll try it, but if he knows it's not going to be good or safe for me then he explains why and we find an alternative.
Dr Urie has been slandered here beyond description by what looks to me people who were unhappy that they weren't able to control this doctor into prescribing meds in an unhealthy manner or people who were unwilling to pay their bill. The office staff has always been very kind and professional and have never been dishonest in their billing practices with me. If you've been a patient of his even once it's clear that he truly cares for his patience and their suffering. I would recommend him to my family and would know they were in great hands.|I have been coming here since March. I love Dr. Urie and his Wife Sandra and everyone else in the office. I have been to many doctors and they have all made me feel like a bad person or a pill seeker. So yes at first I was worried that again I would not be heard. But to my amazement that did not happen. Both I and my husband see him. They always schedule us together. During covid-19 we lost our jobs. No money to pay for our visits they never turned us away. Dr. Urie and Sandra are both very good, understanding, caring and compassionate. I highly recommend this Doctor to anyone struggling with pain and never being taken seriously by many other doctors. I will forever be grateful for them giving us our lives back and make it possible to be happier and better parents to our children. THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR NEVER GIVING UP ON MY FAMILY. Danielle White from Wyoming|I could not have found a better doctor for my pain management. Dr Urie has been great for me: he even came to my house with his nurse for a home visit! What doctors do that nowadays?!? He's been very responsive to my needs, and he really listens to me when I speak with him.|I first started seeing Dr Urie nearly a year ago and things have just gone downhill since. First notable reason for the 1 star is that although most doctors would worry about a patient having withdrawals from being taken off a medication they had prescribed them, he does not care whatsoever. He insists on watching the time as patients are supposed to be arriving and if you're even fifteen seconds late he makes you reschedule.  He insists on patients driving themselves even if said patient has such severe spinal and nerve problems that they are constantly randomly losing complete control of their limbs. He also gets angry with patients if they need to reschedule even if rescheduling is done in advance.  I originally had problems with him due to him not listening very well about my pain problems and what caused my pain and other symptoms. He instead wanted to just immediately do injections and when that didn't work he insisted on just throwing some heavy medicine at me to get me to go home.  I am the type of person that tries to give everyone a fair chance so decided I'd give him the benefit of the doubt and try working with him for a bit to see how good of a doctor he really was as there were some traits to him that made me think he might be nice. I sure was wrong for doing that though as I learned the hard way. If you're considering seeing him please be sure to weigh your options and check out other doctors first as he is not one that you will enjoy unless of of course you enjoy being yelled at and treated like garbage by a doctor in a formal setting as he would literally gey upset and as my mother said(she went with me to witness how terrible he treated me) he liked to rip off my head over simple things like me not being able to urinate in a timely manner or things out of my control such as whata neurosurgeo said about working on my spine.  Also be warned if you're an overweight person that he does discriminate and treat you worse if you're overweight even if you're working really hard on losing weight.
On top of the way he treats you his nurse is just as rude. Any time I would even try to strike up a friendly conversation she would simply scowl at me. The one time I showed up late to an appointment by exactly 15 minutes which she said would be fine she instead got upset with me because it took me 2 minutes to wait for her( I called for a medical assist and she just let it ring and ring until I was officially too late by 2.5 minutes) and by the time she walked outside I was considered too late. She then proceeded to argue with me stating I supposedly did not call in spite of me showing her on my phone that I had. She also would constantly treat me like I was garbage compared to her because I am an overweight broke single mom who doesn't have much family or friends nearby and had to bring my son with me to appointments. They both treated him like he was an absolute nuisance.
Don't go to this doctor unless you're willing to put up with being treated so poorly.|In 2015 I broke my neck back and pelvis in a semi accident in Alaska. I have been in constant pain since the accident and have been to many pain managing Dr.'s to no avail. In 2017 I moved to Utah and have been to 3 different places to get this under control. I met Dr. Bradly Urie in 2018 and I am happy to have my life back and my pain under control. I am able to travel and play with my grandchildren again. My pain has been under control with just some minor adjustments made to my medication. Amazing what adjustments can do from a dr who listens to your concerns and is truly there to help!! Thank you thank you thank you Doc!! You have no idea

Eastern Utah Spine & Pain serves Price, Utah and surrounding communities with specialized spine and pain management services. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Russ Beecher, our clinic has established itself as a premier destination for patients seeking effective relief from chronic pain conditions. We combine compassionate care with evidence-based treatments to address a wide range of spinal and pain-related disorders that impact quality of life.

At Eastern Utah Spine & Pain, Dr. Beecher employs cutting-edge technology and innovative techniques to diagnose and treat complex pain conditions. Our approach is patient-centered, focusing on creating customized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each individual. We understand that chronic pain affects not just the body, but every aspect of a person's life, which is why we're committed to finding solutions that provide meaningful, lasting relief.

Specialized Services

Our practice offers a comprehensive range of interventional procedures and treatments designed to target pain at its source. Dr. Beecher specializes in advanced diagnostic techniques, spinal injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and other minimally invasive procedures that help patients avoid unnecessary surgery while achieving significant pain reduction. Each treatment plan is developed with the goal of improving function and enhancing overall quality of life.

Patient-Focused Care

We pride ourselves on creating a supportive environment where patients feel heard and valued. Our team takes the time to thoroughly evaluate each case, explain treatment options, and answer questions, ensuring that patients are active participants in their care journey. This collaborative approach has helped countless individuals find the relief they've been searching for, often after years of unsuccessful treatments elsewhere.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Beecher, please call us at +1 435-613-7246 or visit our website at www.drrussbeecher.com. Our clinic is conveniently located at 335 Hospital Dr, Price, UT 84501, where we welcome patients from across Eastern Utah seeking specialized spine and pain management care.
column11: Dr. Beecher specializes in spine and pain management. He offers cutting edge technology to help patients find the relief they have been searching for.

column40:
Blamin everything on "short staffed". My wife received EXCELLENT AND QUALITY SERVICE, company called and went over the read with her then Dr Beecher went over it with her in person when I took her for an MRI in mid December, I go in early February and have the EXACT SAME MRI and the paperwork they sent the read company was wrong and then basically told me oh well Dr Beecher didn't order it so he won't be going over it with you. $549 won't be spent again ill pay the UNBELIEVABLY HIGH price the hospital gits from now on|Dr. Beecher listens, cares, and is extremely professional. He understands pain and genuinely does all he can to help ease it!|Dr. Beecher is the best!! He cares so much about his patients and goes above and beyond!|Absolute worst office staff to work with and very unfriendly. When casket view hospital is a better option you know this place is no good.|Dr Beecher and Trent and all the assistants are some of the greatest medical professionals I have ever encountered and I owe them my life thank you all you are the finest examples of human compassion and understanding.
It is now 2 years since I first posted .I now am adding to it in April 2024.My initial experience was great and the beauty of this additional post is the fact that this Clinic has even gotten better.I am listened to,respected,and feel treated as " family".I am 70 years old,worked in a hospital once upon a time and have, unfortunately had many serious physical mishaps.Dr.Beecher,Trent Greenhaugh, and all the others there are truly #1" Best in the West".Thank you all|If your there for pain management, your treated like dirt. They don't care about you at all. Not many people understand what people on pain management go through, but a Dr should. And neither Drs at this clinic care. it's only about the $$$$. You can be harassed by a nurse and tell them and it's your fault not hers.
I'll be looking for a new Dr on the other side of the mountain.|I was seen locally by an Ortho specialist who was unable to do a hip injection, something I was receiving previously in another state. I was referred to this clinic for the injection.

The earliest appointment for a new patient was June of 2024, I was seen by the Ortho doctor December 2023.

After trying to wait I spoke with the receptionist who informed me that there is no way to be seen sooner. After expressing my frustration at being in pain and waiting this long seems awfully cruel to do to a person, that I was not trying to be mean or difficult but I am tired of hurting I was told I was coming across rude/mean and there was nothing that could be done.

I tried to keep my business local but obviously they have plenty of business.

It's nice to have this type of clinic here but to make a person wait, who's had a diagnosis already made, been receiving injections elsewhere be given a wait time like this before even being seen is cruel and lacking in empathy. I have options, thankfully, and will drive north and not waste my time in the future.|He treats everyone as they are pill addicts, also to make an appointment with him it takes over three months because he is the only one in town. I will definitely go over the mountain it's worth the extra money to do so!

Our dedicated team of specialists combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address acute and chronic pain conditions. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving quality of life for patients throughout Weber County and beyond, offering both interventional procedures and conservative management approaches.

At Intermountain Pain & Injury, we provide a multidisciplinary approach to treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and sports injuries. column3:
Utah Pain Center serves Murray, Utah and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services under the direction of Dr. Vikas Garg. Established to address the critical need for comprehensive pain treatment in the valley, Utah Pain Center offers evidence-based interventions and personalized care plans for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. The practice combines cutting-edge techniques with compassionate patient-centered approaches to improve quality of life and functional outcomes.

Dr. Vikas Garg brings exceptional credentials to his practice as a double-board certified physician specializing in pain management. After completing his fellowship at the University of Washington in Seattle – widely recognized as one of the nation's premier pain management programs – Dr. Garg chose to establish his practice in Utah to address the significant need for specialized pain care in the region.

His academic journey includes a Master's degree in Health Care Administration from Michigan University, where he focused specifically on health policy and administration. This unique combination of clinical expertise and administrative knowledge allows him to deliver both exceptional medical care and efficiently managed patient services.

Comprehensive Training & Expertise

Dr. Garg completed residency training in both Anesthesiology at the Medical University of Ohio in Toledo and Family Practice in Erie, Pennsylvania. This dual training provides him with a holistic understanding of patient care that extends beyond symptom management to address overall wellness and functionality.

As an active member of pain societies at local, national, and international levels, Dr. Garg remains at the forefront of pain management advancements. His contributions to the field include authoring articles for the curriculum of an international spine society, demonstrating his commitment to education and evidence-based practice.

Visit Utah Pain Center

The Utah Pain Center welcomes new patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Their comprehensive approach addresses various pain syndromes with individualized treatment plans designed for long-term success.

Location: 5801 Fashion Blvd, Suite 180, Murray, UT 84107

Phone: (801) 262-7246

Website: www.utahpaincenter.com/utah-doctor-dr-garg
column11:
Vikas Garg, MD, MSA is a double boarded physician, who completed his fellowship in pain management from the University of Washington, Seattle, WA, recognized as one of the best programs in country and moved to Utah to provide the most needed specialty in the valley and surrounding area. After completing medical school, Dr Garg spent time in Michigan University, MI obtaining a master's in health care administration focusing on health policy and administration. He is residency trained in Anesthesiology from medical University of Ohio, Toledo OH and in Family Practice from Erie, PA.

He is very active in pain societies at local, national and international level and has written article for curricula of international spine society.
column38: Forrest Markham|Dave Pontious|Candice Reichenberg|Emily F|Greg Pack|bkr mom|Mark O. Jarvis|Christi Holker
column40:
I am the spouse of a patient. Dr Garg is competent and the staff are friendly enough. Prices are what you can expect from US healthcare.

The waits are terribly long even for simple procedures. Crummy scheduling and time management. They are always behind with little care to update patients on when they will be attended to. After waiting for over an hour and a half we got a simple "sorry to keep you waiting". I know that not everything can be done on schedule in the medical world but it's just ridiculous.

On my most recent visit the restroom available to patients was devoid of any toilet paper and only a few scraps of paper towels left. Very disappointing!

I would NOT recommend this practice.|this is not the clinic to go to if you need help. I came to Dr. Garg with the hopes that he could try something new. He pressured me into a steroid back injection which did not work. Then during my post visit, he pressured me to state that the procedure worked so that way insurance would pay for it. then he encouraged me that the second injection would fix the problem. I had the same experience. On my post visit once again, he pressured me to state that it was at least 50% better so that way the insurance would pay for it and then try to schedule me for two other injections . I scheduled a follow up at the front desk for 30 days later, and I tried to come in for my appointment and I was told that there was never an appointment made and that they would need to schedule me out for another month. The woman I spoke to at the front desk was extremely rude and had zero empathy. Which is surprising because she works in a field. Where empathy is virtually required to do your job. The nurse practitioner I was seeing on one of my follow-ups spent the whole time telling me how she was leaving the practice because it was not a good place To work, and we spent no time discussing new options. I'm really tired of healthcare Facilities, taking advantage of people in need and treating them so terribly, especially when we're spending so much money for our healthcare and office visits and supporting everybody in that clinic. It should've been obvious in the beginning based upon the experience I had where literally you're just a number and you're just money in their pockets and procedures are just a pathway to Make money and not a means of solving any problems, other than the financial problems of the doctor. I'm considering going to the state and also my insurance company discussing insurance fraud and Malpractice. It is not appropriate to treat people people so poorly and expect them to spend so much money For, hope, And leaving the patient with no support and once again, Dr shopping to find somebody who actually cares About their patients. This is not the place to go for healthcare. Dr. Garg is not the kind of medical practitioner I would ever refer out to any friends or family.|I have been in the care of Dr. Garg since March of 2016. He is an amazing doctors and has helped me with my whole entire spine and wrists pain. He is so nice, friendly, caring, and treats you like family as do his staff. I would not go anywhere else. I appreciate everything he and his staff do for us.|Called to make an appointment and the lady who answered was very rude. She continually cut me off when I was trying to provide my information. She asked me to verify my insurance and once I did she was silent for 5 minutes. I asked if she had what she needed and she said oh (like she forgot I was there) no I need to send your info to referrals. And hung up. No information or when to expect a call from referrals and no appointment scheduled.|Dr Garg is an amazing pain specialist, if it wasn't for him I wouldn't have any quality of life at all. I've broken my lower back 3 times, was in constant pain with debilitating episodes a few time a year. I get 4 injections in my SI joint one a year and live a normal active life in construction. I tried another doctor about 8 years ago and the procedure took almost 2 hrs from waiting room to finished, with dr Garg I'm in and out in 20 min. He is the best and a super nice guy
Pain free Greg Pack|Not a fan of Garg. He's not friendly and only pops in quickly to give an injection then he disappears spending only a couple mintues with the patient. He makes a ton of money off these injections too. Every injection I've had with him has been extremely painful and not once have they provided any relief so I saw another doctor from different office that gave me my next injection and there was no pain what so ever and I  experienced good pain relief. I've been seeing the PA's in Gargs office for a few years but there have been a few times my regular PA has been out on vacation when my medication is due for refill so I've had to schedule my next appointment one week later and I've been instructed to call the office to have one weeks worth of medication called into the pharmacy to get me through until my next appointment. Each and every time Garg has refused to call the prescriptions in and has never given me the courtesy of returning my calls to discuss it. In my opinion Garg is more interested in earning the almighty dollar and less interested in providing the best quality of life possible for his patients.|Very frustrating experience.

My daughter has fibromyalgia and ME/CFS, so she can only work a couple of hours per week and cannot support herself.  In order for her to stay on my insurance after she turns 26, our insurance company (Blue Cross Blue Shield) requires a doctor to fill out a form assessing her level of incapacitation.  We have gotten the runaround from everyone we've spoken with about this, and the deadline is quickly approaching, so when I called Dr. Garg's office, I was very clear with the appointment scheduler about what we needed and asked if any of the doctors there could help with this--with the approaching deadline, we cannot afford to wait for an appointment, only to be told at that appointment that they cannot help us.  The scheduler assured me that Dr. Garg could help and scheduled us for the following week, which felt like a small miracle.  I sent the office a follow-up email to reiterate what we needed (and with the insurance form attached) right after our conversation, and she responded that they had received it.

At our appointment, we went through the standard intake procedure of filling out forms, repeating the same information to the triage person, repeating the same information a second time to the RN, and then waiting for the doctor.  It was clear that no one had read the email or reviewed the form, and when Dr. Garg arrived, he surprised us by saying that he probably cannot help us--he said he would look over the form in a few days and get back to us.

This was extraordinarily frustrating because I was very careful to make this clear on the phone with the scheduler.  Like I said, we don't have time to waste on this issue.  In addition, I took time off of work to get my daughter there, and most importantly, my daughter's health issues mean that there is a "cost" of her physically going to any appointment.  Usually (we hope), that cost is offset by the benefit of receiving treatment.  Here, the cost was entirely wasted, and they seemed completely oblivious to that, even though they specialize in chronic issues/pain.

They refunded our copay and promised to better train the appointment scheduler.  Hopefully they do that before they put someone else through this.

I'll update my rating if Dr. Garg is able to help us.  That won't change what happened, of course, but it would mean that the cost to my daughter would be offset by the benefit that brought us to him in the first place.

UPDATE: It's been over a month and we have not heard one word back from Dr. Garg's office.|I had neck pain for almost a year.  I tried everything that I could think of and had no relief.  I came here on a recommendation from a friend and they were able to get rid of the pain with some injections.

Dr. Garg went out of his way to help me. I needed one last injection in a series of 3 before it would be complete.  It was the end of the year, the last of December, the last day they were going to be open until the new year.  I wanted to get it done by the end of the year because my insurance would go up and I'd have to start over with meeting my deductible  and he and his staff worked it with my insurance to get me seen the very same day. So thanks to him I am pain-free now without having to pay extra money.

Kind, friendly doctor.  I'd recommend him to anyone.

column3:
Jeffrey Pence, DO serves West Valley City, Utah and surrounding communities as a dedicated Interventional Spine and Pain Physician. With a comprehensive approach to pain management, Dr. Pence specializes in treating discomfort throughout the body, including the head, neck, back, hip, knee, and abdomen. His practice is built on the fundamental belief that accurate diagnosis forms the cornerstone of effective pain treatment, enabling patients suffering from chronic or acute pain conditions to reclaim their quality of life.

Dr. Pence's extensive medical training includes earning his Osteopathic Medicine degree from Des Moines University, followed by completing his Anesthesia residency and Multidisciplinary Pain Medicine fellowship at the prestigious University of Florida. This comprehensive educational background has equipped him with the specialized knowledge and techniques needed to address complex pain conditions using both interventional procedures and holistic approaches.

Treatment Philosophy

At the core of Dr. Pence's practice is his commitment to helping every patient who suffers from pain live their best life. He understands that pain is not merely a physical sensation but can profoundly impact all aspects of a person's wellbeing. By taking time to establish accurate diagnoses and develop personalized treatment plans, Dr. Pence empowers his patients to overcome limitations imposed by chronic pain conditions.

Personal Interests

Beyond his professional dedication, Dr. Pence maintains an active lifestyle that reflects his belief in holistic wellness. He enjoys traveling with his family, exploring hiking trails, and giving back to the community through coaching youth sports. These personal pursuits complement his professional approach to treating the whole person, not just the pain.

Practice Location and Contact Information

Dr. Pence welcomes new patients at his West Valley City office located at 3336 S 4155 W, Suite 102, West Valley City, UT 84120. To schedule a consultation, patients can call (801) 964-3925. Additional information about Dr. Pence's practice and services can be found on the CommonSpirit Health provider directory at mountain.commonspirit.org.
column11:
Jeffrey Pence, DO, is an Interventional Spine and Pain Physician who believes in helping every patient who suffers from pain live their best life. He assists with pain related to the head, neck, back, hip, knee, abdomen, among other areas of the body.

Dr. Pence earned his Osteopathic Medicine degree at Des Moines University and then his Anesthesia residency and Multidisciplinary Pain Medicine fellowship at the University of Florida.

He strongly believes establishing the correct diagnosis is the key to pain management.

Outside of work, Dr. Pence enjoys traveling with family, hiking, and coaching youth sports.

column2: Eastern Utah Spine & Pain, Dr. Russell Beecher, D.O.
column3:
Eastern Utah Spine & Pain serves Price, Utah and the surrounding Eastern Utah region with specialized pain management services. Led by Dr. Russell Beecher, D.O., this practice offers comprehensive care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Dr. Beecher's approach emphasizes functional improvement and non-surgical interventions, helping patients regain mobility and quality of life without unnecessary medications or invasive procedures. The clinic combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address each patient's unique needs.

As a physical medicine and rehabilitation specialist, Dr. Beecher brings extensive knowledge of the nerve, muscle, and bone systems that affect movement and pain. His additional fellowship training in interventional pain management enhances his ability to provide targeted treatments that minimize reliance on narcotics or surgical interventions. This dual expertise allows him to address both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain conditions.

Services Offered

Eastern Utah Spine & Pain offers a comprehensive range of diagnostic and treatment options, including specialized interventional procedures, rehabilitation protocols, and pain management strategies. Dr. Beecher's function-focused approach aims to improve patients' mobility and daily activities while effectively managing pain. The practice serves individuals with various conditions, from sports injuries to chronic spinal disorders.

Location and Contact Information

Located at 335 N Fairgrounds Rd, Price, UT 84501, Eastern Utah Spine & Pain welcomes patients from throughout the region. For consultations or appointments, patients can call +1 435-613-7246 or visit the practice website at http://www.drrussbeecher.com/ for more information about services and treatment options.
column11: Dr. Beecher brings a function-focused, non-surgical approach to diagnosing and treating individuals with pain. Physical medicine and rehabilitation specialists are nerve, muscle, and bone experts who treat illnesses and injuries that affect how you move. The additional interventional pain fellowship training has built upon this foundation by adding tools to help individuals control their pain while minimizing need for narcotics or surgery.

Dr Beecher is very helpful and takes time to listen to all your concerns. He is very knowledgeable and caring. You won't find better.|I was recently seen for some concerns I had by Dr beecher. Normally I see Trent. Dr beecher was extremely rude. His nurse was extremely rude. They both acted like I was a burden. A bane of their existence. Then he proceeded to tell me that he didn't think that my chronic illness (elhers danlos syndrome) was "painful". Every person is different. Especially regarding eds. Doctor's like him are the reason people who are chronically Ill don't see doctors. He needs a serious lesson on bedside manner and empathy. I will go see someone over the mountain from now on rather than go to him.|$300+ just for a consultation...... there was some kind of mix up with my insurance. I didn't want to deal with the insurance run around, so I wanted to pay out of pocket. They couldn't pull up my bill for some reason so I couldn't pay. They said they would call me as soon as they found the issue, for months I didn't hear a word from them.
So, I went in again to see if they figured it out and yup, they did yet no call, email nada. I paid my bill and asked if I could possibly get a letter from one of the Doctors suggesting I go to a gym to lose some weight, so my HSA will cover it. Something that would take literally 5 minutes. They said they would call me, again.
Surprisingly they did call this time, a week later.
Now considering I have been visiting them off and on since I was 15, you'd think they would have a good idea of my back issues, but they said since I haven't been seen in a little over a year, I'd have to get another consultation! If you would have called me the first time, it would have been under a year. Regardless, seems to me that they just want to squeeze me for more cash and my time.

Seriously concerning and disappointing.|I posted previously how excellent a clinic this is. somehow it disappeared. Dr Beecher, Trent Greenhalgh,and all the staff are the best I have ever received care from.I am wheelchair bound and they give me something you can't buy..HOPE AND GOOD HUMOUR.
I thank them all.posted 2024|Below I've listed my first review of one star. I'm updating this to three stars because Russ was much kinder to me and a he seemed less judgemental on our return visit.

Its like Dr Beecher was having a contest with me the last and only three times I've seen him. He wanted me to get another steroid shot, which my surgeons told me not to do since I've had two bad reactions the only two times I had them. Dr Beecher wouldn't recommend anything else. When I asked about a medical marijuana card, which I'm a text-book candidate for with my severe chronic pain and nausea, he turned me down because I have depression, even though he said right before that, "almost everyone with chronic pain has depression". In the end, I think he is just upset that I wouldn't get a steroid shot.|I would not recommend Dr. Beecher. I have to pay for two different doctor visits because Dr. Beecher does not listen or take his patients seriously.  Please save yourself the time and money and see someone who will take your injury seriously and will complete the necessary tests to help identify the problem!!
Dr. Beecher dismissed my husbands symptoms and blamed his pain on a past injury. As he described his situation as "muddy" even though both nerves in the arm was showing abnormal signs (which he stated). His recommendation was further imaging that is expensive and the type of test is not common.
Our doctor couldn't even use his results and required us to see another specialist in the field; who immediately identified the problem. Now we are headed for surgery.|Super friendly, very knowledgeable and understanding. Dr and his staff always have a way of making you feel comfortable. column3:
Dr. Jeremy Joyal serves the Draper, Utah community and surrounding areas with exceptional pain management services. As the lead physician at ASAP Pain Clinic, Dr. Joyal combines his extensive medical expertise with a compassionate approach to help patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. His practice has become a trusted healthcare resource for residents throughout Salt Lake County seeking effective, personalized pain solutions.

At ASAP Pain Clinic, Dr. Joyal offers a wide range of treatment options tailored to each patient's specific needs. His approach integrates advanced medical techniques with holistic care strategies, addressing not just symptoms but underlying causes of pain. Patients benefit from thorough evaluations and customized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modification guidance.

Specialized Treatment Areas

Dr. Joyal's expertise encompasses numerous pain conditions, including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain. His commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in pain medicine ensures patients receive the most effective and up-to-date care available.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Joyal's practice is his dedication to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. He takes time to explain conditions and treatment options thoroughly, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach has earned him numerous positive reviews from grateful patients who have found relief under his care.

Practice Information

Dr. Jeremy Joyal welcomes new patients at his conveniently located office at 96 Kimballs Lane, Suite 408, Draper, UT 84020. The modern facility offers a comfortable environment designed with patient comfort in mind. For appointments or consultations, patients can call +1 801-572-1186 or visit the clinic's website at www.asappainclinic.com for more information about services and to access patient resources.

The UGLY:
You can't talk to a real nurse.  The line tells you to wait 48 hours, I waited and received no call back. Twice.|Glines is the best.  See him about every 2 years when the back flares up. I receive a call one day, saying I would no longer be seeing that doctor, that Dr Glines and Chuck Jarvis, would be treating me from now on, and that they were moving to a new bigger Clinic. In my first visit with dr. Glines he decided, that he was going to uproot everything, that I had been doing, and that was working for the past 10 years, that he was going to, have me start all over, by doing expensive invasive procedures, that I had already done, that did not work. I do not recommend the St Mark's Interventional pain clinic to anybody. They forget to file for pre-approvals etc., etc....  Then tell you less than the truth when you call to ask about them.  After you call your insurance company you find they have the exact time and date of the fax (down to the seconds) of when they ordered your procedure.  Often you will find they have waited "5" business days or more before even bothering to possess the request.  The nurses line has always called me back but only one of the nurses is even listening,  the other nurse is like talking to a wall.  She never gets your message straight (that you want to give the Dr.) It is really hard when you are having a problem and actually need to talk to the Dr., you can't only the nurse...  then she (they) can't get the message right.  I would be happy to come in for another appointment when there is a problem escalation but usually they can't get you in before your next appointment anyway. It is a vicious circle.  By your appointment it is too late !!!!  You have suffered through couple of weeks from hell with no temporary treatment (for no reason because help "could" have been available if only the Dr. knew) .  I even tried telling them that this behavior that often causes a real problem at my work because I can't give them any answers and they just give you the same empathy answered they have been brainwashed to give. "We are really sorry about that" or "We are really sorry for your pain".  It just makes you want to scream!!!!! If Dr. Glines staff had only half the dedication he has I could give them 5 stars but considering his back office...!!!! 3 is the absolute most I can give.. I would tell Dr.

column3:
Matsumura Kyle S MD Retired serves the Cottonwood Heights, UT area as a respected former pain management specialist. With decades of dedicated service to the Salt Lake Valley community, Dr. Matsumura built a reputation for compassionate care and innovative pain management solutions before his retirement. His practice was centrally located in the Highland Drive medical corridor, providing convenient access for patients throughout Salt Lake County seeking relief from chronic pain conditions.

During his active years in practice, Dr. Matsumura specialized in comprehensive pain management strategies, combining traditional medical approaches with cutting-edge treatments. His integrative approach addressed various chronic pain conditions including neuropathic pain, spinal disorders, arthritis, and post-surgical pain. Though now retired, Dr. Matsumura's legacy continues through the Utah Pain Specialists clinic that maintains the high standards of care he established.

Location and Contact Information

The practice was located at 6750 S Highland Dr, Cottonwood Heights, UT 84121, in a modern medical facility offering state-of-the-art equipment and a comfortable environment for patients. While Dr. Matsumura is retired, the clinic can still be reached at +1 801-685-7246 for information about current providers and services. Patients seeking information about pain management services can visit http://www.utahpain.com/ to learn about the continuing practice and available treatment options.

Legacy of Care

Though retired as of December 2019, Dr. Matsumura's approach to patient-centered care established a foundation for the continuing practice. His emphasis on developing personalized treatment plans and building long-term relationships with patients created a standard of excellence that continues to influence pain management practices throughout the Salt Lake region. Former patients remember his attentive listening skills and thorough approach to diagnosis and treatment planning.

column40:
When I saw Dr Matsumura years ago, he was basically running a pill mill, in my opinion.

If it weren't for a team of dedicated doctors, I would still be addicted to the 120 tablets of 10mg of Hydrocodone a month he prescribed. I was over prescribed and it could have destroyed my life.|I've had 2 failed back surgeries. Now I'm dealing with permanent nerve pain in my back and legs, I have been working with Dr Matzumura for a long time now. He helps me manage the pain, as well as deal with pain from arthritis in my wrist and elbow. Hes great, Hes very knowledgeable and doesn't talk down to you. Hes great when I get injections for migraines too. I recommend him to anybody who needs help!!!|I was told during my last nerve ablation procedure to make an appointment with him to make a plan for my back pain. When he came into the room he was very angry and told me that I needed to see his Nurse Practitioner. "I see hundreds of patients. How do you expect me to see all of them? You need to follow our system!" I have PTSD, and I apologized and left. I will NOT deal with the stress level his assembly- line practice is causing him.|This man is a wizard!! I have been fighting lower back issues for over 20 years. Doctor Matzumura is the only one to ever talk to me and take his time explaining what he want to do. I have never felt more comfortable talking with a doctor. He got me back to a tolerable pain. I still have to take med but at least they work now instead of barely taking the pain away. I highly recommend this facility.|I my opinion Dr Matsumura is a dangerous Dr, especially when it comes to prescribing pain meds. My sister was under his care when she overdosed. She had seen him for years , she had Chrones . She was given morphine suckers, OxyContin fetynal patches and more. Dr. Matsumura should have seen her addiction but no he just kept prescribing month after month and year after year. I have waited 4 years to get this off my chest, no he didn't make her take all these drugs but he prescribed them. She would visit us in Idaho Falls and Walgreens couldn't refill all those meds, because they didn't have all she took. Dr Matsumura finally kicked her out with a one month supply and a list of drug rehabs, which addicted people usually refuse to go to on their own. I only wish I knew how to have Dr Matsumura investigated as I would be interested to know how many of his patients have overdosed.|Really bad experience,  in my entire life i don't believe ive dealt with someone in the medical field that has been so unkind, condescending and incompetent. If you enjoy being pumped full of drugs,  procedures not being done properly,  getting totally torn into for wanting to ask the doctor some questions before a procedure and being told that you're being a waste of his time because he has 40 other people waiting up get this same thing done and needs to  "get this over with".

If you have a procedure, they'll get you in tomorrow, if you have concerns, questions, or issues,  you wont be seen for over a month. $$$ > quality patient care. Totally greed driven.

So unless you like being treated like a number,  getting generic care that one box fits all instead of being looked at as an individual,  than he's the one for you.|I came in to see Dr. Matsumura after a bad accident with a shoulder that was already damaged.  I could not sleep, work, or function for the pain. My orthopedic surgeon give me tramadol, which gave me hallucinations.  He said there was nothing more he could do.  After a thorough exam by Dr. M, and procedures with a fluoroscope and an ACCURATE shot of medication into the joint, the pain was gone within hours.  I've had no more pain, and can sleep and work in complete comfort.|Dr. Matsumura is quick, efficient, and has been able to pinpoint where my pains comes from then makes it go away! He is amazing!

Perry G. Fine, MD serves Salt Lake City, Utah, as a distinguished healthcare provider affiliated with the University of Utah Health system. With extensive experience in pain management and specialized care, Dr. Fine has established himself as a trusted medical professional in the Salt Lake Valley region. His practice combines evidence-based medicine with compassionate patient care, addressing complex medical conditions with personalized treatment approaches.

At the University of Utah Health's HHT Center, Dr. Perry G. Fine provides comprehensive evaluation and treatment services for patients with various medical conditions. His clinical expertise extends to pain management, anesthesiology, and specialized care for hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (HHT). Patients benefit from his thorough diagnostic process and individualized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and manage chronic conditions effectively.

Services Offered

Dr. Fine's practice encompasses a range of medical services, including consultation for complex pain conditions, management of HHT-related complications, and coordinated care with other specialists within the University of Utah Health network. His approach integrates the latest medical advancements with proven clinical techniques to deliver optimal patient outcomes. The practice welcomes new patients and accepts various insurance plans.

Location & Contact Information

The HHT Center where Dr. Fine practices is conveniently located at 30 N 1900 E #1A71, Salt Lake City, UT 84132, United States. For appointments or inquiries, patients can call +1 801-581-2121. Additional information about Dr. Fine's practice and the University of Utah Health services can be found at http://healthcare.utah.edu/. The facility offers accessible parking and is equipped with modern medical technology to ensure comprehensive patient care.

Southwest Spine & Pain Center - Spanish Fork serves patients throughout Spanish Fork, Utah and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our state-of-the-art facility at 336 W 100 S offers advanced interventional treatments and multidisciplinary care for those suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. As part of Utah's largest pain management group, our board-certified physicians combine evidence-based medicine with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

At Southwest Spine & Pain Center, we provide a wide range of treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options. Our team specializes in addressing complex conditions such as failed back surgery syndrome, sciatica, arthritis, and neuropathic pain disorders. Sterling Orthopedic Pain and Spine in Murray, Utah, is dedicated to helping patients overcome a wide range of pain conditions, restoring function and improving quality of life. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Gregory Condie, this specialized clinic offers comprehensive care for those suffering from acute and chronic pain issues. Their patient-centered approach focuses on identifying the root cause of discomfort rather than merely treating symptoms, allowing for more effective long-term pain management solutions that help patients return to their daily activities with renewed comfort and mobility.

Dr. Gregory Condie brings exceptional credentials to Sterling Orthopedic Pain and Spine as a dual board-certified specialist in Physical Medicine, Rehabilitation, and Pain Medicine. This unique combination of specialties enables him to address complex pain conditions with a multifaceted approach. The clinic's treatment philosophy emphasizes minimally invasive procedures whenever possible, reducing recovery time and potential complications while maximizing therapeutic benefits.

Advanced Treatment Options

The clinic offers cutting-edge treatments including precise spine and joint injections, innovative nerve blocks for PTSD, and interventional migraine management techniques that provide relief where traditional treatments have failed. Each treatment plan is customized to the individual patient's needs, taking into account their medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals for recovery.

Comprehensive Services

Beyond pain management, Sterling Orthopedic Pain and Spine provides superior wound care services, specialized personal injury treatment protocols, and advanced EMG diagnostic testing. Their holistic approach to patient care ensures that all aspects of recovery are addressed, from physical healing to functional restoration.

Patient-Focused Experience

Committed to compassionate, evidence-based care, the clinic creates a welcoming environment where patients feel heard and valued. The staff takes time to educate patients about their conditions and treatment options, empowering them to make informed decisions about their healthcare journey.

For appointments or more information, visit sterlingpainandspine.com or call +1 801-224-8800. The clinic is conveniently located at 84 4800 S Suite 101, Murray, UT 84107, United States.

column48: Do you offer a Stellate Ganglion Block?
column49:
Yes, Sterling Orthopedic Pain and Spine does offer Stellate Ganglion Block (SGB) treatments! Our board-certified specialists are experienced in administering this highly effective procedure to help manage and eliminate pain. SGB is particularly beneficial for individuals dealing with chronic pain conditions, including complex regional pain syndrome, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and other nerve-related pain.

As a leading pain management clinic, we are dedicated to providing our patients with the best treatments for long-lasting pain relief. Whether you're experiencing back pain, abdomen pain or stomach pain, or even chronic migraine headaches, we work closely with you to find a solution tailored to your needs.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit our website at www.sterlingpainandspine.com or give us a call today!

At Riverwoods Spine and Pain, we specialize in minimally invasive treatments for neck and low back pain.
