column3:
Orthopedic Specialists of New York serves Albany, NY and surrounding communities with exceptional spine care and pain management services. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Luke V. Rigolosi, patients receive comprehensive treatment for a wide range of spinal conditions using the latest evidence-based approaches. Our Albany location provides convenient access to specialized care for residents throughout the Capital Region seeking relief from chronic pain and mobility issues.

Dr. Luke V. Rigolosi is a fellowship-trained Physiatrist who brings exceptional expertise to spine care and pain management. He holds dual board certifications in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation and Pain Medicine, positioning him as a leading specialist in the field. Dr. Rigolosi's approach combines thorough diagnostic evaluation with personalized treatment plans designed to address the root causes of pain while maximizing functional recovery.

Specialized Services

Dr. Rigolosi specializes in advanced interventional pain procedures performed under fluoroscopic guidance, ensuring precision and optimal outcomes. His expertise includes:

  • Corticosteroid Injections for targeted inflammation reduction

  • Radiofrequency Ablation to address nerve-related pain

  • Spinal Cord Stimulator implementation for chronic pain management

  • Comprehensive spine care for degenerative conditions, injuries, and post-surgical pain

Patient-Centered Approach

At our Albany practice, we prioritize individualized care that addresses each patient's unique needs and goals. Dr. Rigolosi works closely with patients to develop treatment strategies that minimize pain, improve function, and enhance quality of life. Our team coordinates care with other specialists when necessary to ensure comprehensive management of complex conditions.

Contact Information

Location: 121 Everett Rd, Albany, NY 12205, United States

Phone: +1 518-765-7124

Website: Visit Dr. Rigolosi's Profile
column11: Dr. Rigolosi is a fellowship-trained Physiatrist, board-certified in both physical medicine and rehabilitation, and pain medicine. His practice focuses on spine care with specialized skills in fluoroscopically guided interventional pain procedures, including corticosteroid injections, radiofrequency ablation and spinal cord stimulators.

column3:
Vermont Regenerative Medicine serves patients throughout Vermont and neighboring states with advanced regenerative interventions for orthopedic conditions. As a certified Regenexx affiliate, our practice specializes in non-surgical orthopedic treatments that harness the body's natural healing capabilities. We focus on addressing the root causes of musculoskeletal pain and dysfunction rather than merely masking symptoms, offering patients an alternative to invasive surgical procedures with potentially lengthy recovery periods.

At Vermont Regenerative Medicine, we utilize autologous cellular therapies derived from the patient's own body, including:

  • Super Concentrated Platelets (SCP) - Advanced platelet-rich plasma treatments

  • Bone Marrow Aspirate Concentrate - Containing stem cells and growth factors

  • Micro-Fractured Fat Injections - Harvesting regenerative cells from adipose tissue

All procedures are performed under precise image guidance using ultrasound or fluoroscopy (x-ray) to ensure accurate placement of therapeutic agents. This comprehensive approach allows us to target all involved structures including cartilage, ligaments, tendons, and nerves to stimulate genuine healing responses rather than temporary symptom relief.

Our Expert Physicians

Dr. Fenton has been practicing in Vermont since 1992, bringing decades of experience to our patients. Board-certified and fellowship-trained, he has established himself as a leader in regenerative medicine in the region.

Dr. Albert joined our practice in 2023 and represents the next generation of regenerative medicine specialists. As one of the rare physicians to become certified as a Regenexx provider immediately following fellowship training, Dr. Albert brings cutting-edge knowledge and techniques to our practice.

Visit Us

Vermont Regenerative Medicine is conveniently located at 321 Main St C, Winooski, VT 05404. To schedule a consultation or learn more about how regenerative interventional orthopedics might help your condition, call us at (802) 859-0000 or visit our website at vermontregenerative.com.
column11:
Regenexx affiliate providing regenerative interventional (non-surgical) orthopedic medicine services using autologous (person's own) cells such as super concentrated platelets (SCP), bone marrow, and micro-fractured fat injections, always done under image (ultrasound or x-ray) guidance.
We diagnose and treat all involved structures (cartilage, ligaments, tendons, nerves) to stimulate a healing response, not the usual temporary symptom relief.
Dr. Fenton and Dr. Albert are both board certified and sub-specialty fellowship trained physicians. Dr. Fenton has been practicing in Vermont since 1992, and Dr. Albert joined our practice in 2023, one of the rare physicians to become a certified Regenexx physician just post fellowship.

column3:
Charles J. Buttaci, DO serves Albany, NY and surrounding communities with exceptional spine and musculoskeletal care. As a fellowship-trained Physiatrist at Orthopedics New York, Dr. Buttaci brings specialized expertise in diagnosing and treating disorders of the spine through comprehensive, patient-centered approaches. His practice combines advanced interventional techniques with rehabilitative strategies to address complex pain conditions and improve patients' quality of life. With dual board certifications in both Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation and Interventional Pain Management, Dr. Buttaci offers a unique perspective that bridges conservative care and specialized interventional procedures.

Dr. Buttaci's practice focuses on several key treatment areas:

  • Fluoroscopically guided spine injections

  • Electrodiagnostic testing (EMG/NCS)

  • Comprehensive musculoskeletal medicine

  • Non-surgical spine care

  • Interventional pain management techniques

Education and Credentials

Dr. Buttaci completed specialized fellowship training that enables him to provide advanced care for complex spine and musculoskeletal conditions. His dual board certifications reflect his commitment to maintaining the highest standards in both physical medicine and rehabilitation and interventional pain management approaches.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Buttaci's practice is his comprehensive approach to diagnosis and treatment. Rather than simply addressing symptoms, he works to identify and treat underlying causes of pain and dysfunction, developing individualized treatment plans that may incorporate both interventional procedures and rehabilitative strategies.

Location and Contact Information

Dr. Buttaci welcomes new patients at his Albany office:

Address: 121 Everett Rd, Albany, NY 12205, United States

Phone: (518) 765-8269

Website: orthony.com/providers/charles-j-buttaci-do

For consultations regarding spine disorders, musculoskeletal conditions, or interventional pain management, contact Dr. Buttaci's office to schedule an appointment with one of Albany's leading specialists in physical medicine and rehabilitation.
column11: A fellowship-trained Physiatrist, Dr. Buttaci's specialty is disorders of the spine, focusing on musculoskeletal medicine, including fluoroscopically guided spine injections and electrodiagnotics. He is board-certified in physical medicine and rehabilitation, and interventional pain management.

Integrative Acupuncture serves Montpelier, Vermont with a comprehensive approach to natural healing and wellness. Founded by a dedicated team of healthcare professionals, this group practice combines traditional Eastern medicine with modern therapeutic techniques to address a wide range of health concerns. Their serene clinic at 200 Elm Street provides a peaceful sanctuary where patients can escape the stresses of daily life and focus on their healing journey.

At Integrative Acupuncture, all practitioners are fully licensed acupuncturists and massage therapists committed to delivering evidence-based care. The team stays current with the latest research in complementary medicine, ensuring that treatments are both rooted in ancient wisdom and supported by contemporary scientific understanding. This balanced approach makes their services appropriate for patients seeking alternatives or complements to conventional medical care.

Conditions Treated

The practice specializes in addressing numerous health concerns including chronic pain management, stress reduction, sleep disorders, fertility support, and many other conditions. Their holistic assessment process considers physical symptoms alongside lifestyle factors, creating personalized treatment plans that target the root causes of discomfort rather than just managing symptoms.

Insurance and Accessibility

Understanding the importance of affordable healthcare, Integrative Acupuncture accepts many insurance plans that cover acupuncture services. Patients are encouraged to verify their coverage before scheduling appointments. The practice is committed to making natural medicine accessible to the Montpelier community through transparent pricing and insurance support.

Visit Their Welcoming Space

Located at 200 Elm St Suite 1, Montpelier, VT 05602, the clinic welcomes patients of all backgrounds and health histories. Their therapeutic environment has been thoughtfully designed to promote relaxation and healing from the moment you enter. For appointments or inquiries, contact them at (802) 223-0954 or visit their website at www.acupunctureinvermont.com to learn more about their services and philosophy.

column48: Do you accept insurance?
column49: Yes, we accept insurance that covers our services by either billing in network (BCBS, United, MVP) or out of network (Cigna). Unfortunately acupuncture is not required to be covered by our state so many plans do not include it at all. If that's the case, we can not bill for a service a plan does not cover. At this time (11/2022) Medicaid does not include acupuncture and Medicare does not all for acupuncturists to bill for services. Call the number on the back of your card or call our office for help with our specific insurance plan.

Integrative Pain Specialists serves the Richmond, VA area with a revolutionary approach to pain management that addresses both symptoms and underlying causes. Located in the heart of Richmond at 5901 W Broad St, our clinic has established itself as a premier destination for patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. We believe in treating the whole person, not just isolated symptoms, by combining evidence-based medical interventions with complementary therapies that promote natural healing and long-term wellness.

At Integrative Pain Specialists, we offer a diverse range of treatment modalities designed to address various pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach includes advanced medical treatments, physical rehabilitation, nutritional counseling, and mind-body techniques. This integrated strategy allows us to create customized treatment plans that address each patient's unique pain profile and health goals, providing more effective and sustainable results than conventional single-approach methods.

Expert Leadership

Dr. Seeman brings extensive expertise in pain medicine along with a compassionate, patient-centered approach. Under his leadership, our team of specialists works collaboratively to deliver exceptional care that empowers patients to reclaim their active lifestyles.

We've created a welcoming, calming environment where patients can feel comfortable discussing their pain concerns and receiving treatment. Our clinic is easily accessible from all parts of Richmond and surrounding communities, with ample parking available for patients.

Advanced Pain Management of Virginia serves Charlottesville, VA with comprehensive pain management solutions for patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. As a team of dedicated healthcare professionals, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take a thorough, personalized approach to treatment.

Our team of award-winning pain management specialists collaborates to develop individualized care plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. Rather than simply treating symptoms, we begin by identifying the root cause of your pain. Using a comprehensive examination and diagnostic process that incorporates cutting-edge imaging techniques and detailed assessment criteria, we uncover the underlying factors contributing to your discomfort.

Specialized Services

As Charlottesville's premier pain management specialist, we pride ourselves on creating the ultimate healthcare experience for our patients. Our practice distinguishes itself by offering:

- Advanced diagnostic imaging

We're proud to be one of the only local medical facilities in the Charlottesville area providing innovative cellular products and regenerative therapy treatments that promote natural healing and long-term pain relief.

I'm 4 weeks in and I'm blown away at my progress and look forward to 8 more weeks with vision of recovery from barely being able to walk, to climbing stairs with ease. Gershon Pain Specialists serves Virginia Beach, Virginia with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each individual's unique needs. The dedicated medical team believes that effective healthcare requires personalized attention rather than generic approaches. By combining conventional medicine with alternative and holistic treatments, they create customized care plans that address the root causes of pain while promoting overall wellness for both adolescents and adults.

Specializing in treating patients with neurological, neuromuscular, and musculoskeletal disorders, the practice offers evidence-based interventions designed to reduce pain and improve quality of life. Their multidisciplinary approach ensures that patients receive the most appropriate care for their specific conditions, whether they're dealing with acute injuries, chronic diseases, or genetic disorders.

Beyond Traditional Pain Management

Gershon Pain Specialists extends their expertise beyond conventional pain treatments to include Bioidentical Hormone Replacement Therapy and medically supervised Weight Loss Programs. These complementary services address underlying health factors that can contribute to pain and discomfort, helping patients achieve more comprehensive relief and improved overall health.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

At the core of their practice is a commitment to helping patients live pain-free, energetic, and healthy lives. The team takes time to understand each patient's unique circumstances, developing treatment strategies that align with individual goals and lifestyle considerations.

Contact Information

For consultations or appointments, patients can reach Gershon Pain Specialists at +1 757-496-2050 or visit their office located at 1133 First Colonial Rd, Virginia Beach, VA 23454. Additional information about their services and approach to pain management is available on their website at www.gershonpain.com.

column40:
I saw NP Sarah for neck and back issues. She was excellent at explaining my options. She is invested in keeping me from surgery if possible and keeping my mobility and quality of life intact. I highly recommend Sarah if you are looking for someone who really cares and wants you to do well.|Dr. Wagoner and his nurse Lisa were totally outstanding.  I came in for an Epidural Steroid Injection for lower back pain and sciatica.  Dr Wagoner was extremely prompt, took me in right away, asked how I was feeling. explained the upcoming procedure, and asked if I had any concerns or questions,  Dr. Wagoner was just so compassionate about the pain I suffer with, along with a very calming and caring demeanor, which set me at ease immediately,  His nurse Lisa was so very sweet and caring.  She prepped me for the procedure, and while Dr. Wagoner began the procedure, he told me step by step what he was about to do and Lisa rubbed my arm and shoulder to keep me calm and comfortable, the whole time.  I have been to many Doctors over the years throughout my pain journey, and I can't say enough good things about the level of care and compassion displayed by Dr. Wagoner and his nurse Lisa.  They truly have found their calling.  I absolutely recommend them and this practice for anyone suffering with pain.|I personally met Dr. Gershon when he performed an EMG testing procedure on my leg while also teaching two doctors in training. It is my personal opinion that Dr. Gershon is very intelligent, professional, and compassionate. The staff were patient and kind. The waiting room has a single huge rest room facility that is very handicap friendly. Large handicap friendly parking lot. The parking lot is immediately entranced from a very busy four lane highway with a median, which means a one way entrance and exit. Huge comfortable waiting room. Highly recommended.|I recently had 2 EMGs back-to-back that I wasn't looking forward to after my first one which was done elsewhere. The staff all told me that Dr Gershon is the pro at painless EMGs, so I went to my appointment anxious but optimistic. I'm incredibly happy to say that Dr Gershon lived up to the hype and both EMGs went by in a flash with at most a momentary discomfort in one sensitive area.

Not only did he succeed in a smooth and easy EMG, he was conversational, friendly, and took the time to talk me through the whole procedure and answer my questions. I didn't feel like just another patient coming through because Dr Gershon took an interest in my care and made sure I was all set during and after my procedure. My second EMG was the last appointment of the day and I'm sure all the staff were ready to leave, but neither he nor the rest of the staff rushed me.

I'm very particular about my health care and the providers that are a part of my care.
I would absolutely send anyone I know needing an EMG to Dr Gershon. If I ever need one again I also know just who I want to see for it.|The folks here listen, understand, know the body, and know simple remedies to seemingly complex bodily concerns and issues.  They are accurate without looking at surgery as alternatives are available and restorative.  I am grateful my internal medicine PCP referred me to them.|Terrible experience with this practice. Saw Dr. Gershon's partner for a back injection. He hit my sciatic nerve and I couldn't feel my legs for hours. When I tried to see Dr. Gershwin about my experience, his office manager would not let me talk to him or schedule an appointment. Poor medical practice and unethical.|Dr Wagoner is excellent. I have a particular condition that makes epidural shots more difficult to do. He discussed the whole procedure with me and answered all my questions. Then he used an imaging machine to get the exact spot for the shot. His nurse is incredibly caring and squeezed my hand during the more painful parts. He was quick and precise and I'm now having so much less pain. I highly recommend his services.|The specialists at Geeshon pain management are outstanding in their field. I feel at ease navigating my treatment options with them. I couldn't be in better hands.

column3:
Commonwealth Spine and Pain Specialists serves Richmond, Virginia with exceptional pain management solutions focused on minimally invasive techniques. Our award-winning practice combines the expertise of two board-certified physicians with cutting-edge technology to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We believe in a patient-centered approach that prioritizes your comfort while developing personalized treatment plans that improve quality of life without excessive medication or unnecessary procedures.

At Commonwealth Spine & Pain, we excel in low-intervention techniques that provide effective relief while minimizing risks and recovery time. Our comprehensive services address various conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, neuropathy, and sports injuries. Each treatment plan is tailored to your specific needs, medical history, and lifestyle goals.

Our Expert Medical Team

Our practice features two board-certified physicians who combine decades of specialized experience in pain management. Their expertise in innovative, minimally invasive procedures ensures you receive the most current and effective treatments available. Our entire staff is committed to creating a supportive, compassionate environment where patients feel heard and valued throughout their healing journey.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 1501 Maple Avenue, Suite 301 in Richmond, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. We've designed our space to maximize both clinical effectiveness and patient comfort, creating an environment conducive to healing and recovery.

Our Commitment to Your Wellness

Commonwealth Spine & Pain is dedicated to our mission of helping you "feel better, live better and be better!" We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we focus on comprehensive solutions that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of your discomfort. Contact us at (804) 288-7246 or visit commonwealthspineandpain.com to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.
column11: Commonwealth Spine & Pain is an award winning pain management medical practice that specializes in low intervention techniques. With 2 board certified physicians and cutting edge technology, Commonwealth Spine & Pain is dedicated to helping you feel better, live better and be better!
column38: T Reamey|Sinbad baba|Kelly Speiran|Robert Aldridge|Queen E|Ajax Milling|RichmondCarters|Faye Gunn
column40:
I am a patient of Dr. Barsanti's, I first sought his help in Oct 2007. He truly listens which is not easy to find. He also is very good at walking me thru any procedure he has done over the years. Thanks to his expertise I have made it all these years without having surgery. His staff is very nice as well. Highly recommend him!|As a registered nurse, I came to Dr. John M. Barsanti and LPN Mechole Rajab with a deep understanding of healthcare and trust in the system. Unfortunately, my experience with their care has been deeply disappointing and has caused significant, lasting harm.

A poorly administered injection and the lack of appropriate follow-up care left me in excruciating pain, to the point where I had to rely on a wheelchair for recovery. This was a profoundly difficult experience--both physically and emotionally--that could have been avoided with better attention, communication, and care.

What makes this even harder to accept is the apparent prioritization of insurance-driven decisions over genuine patient well-being. Despite my professional knowledge, I was left feeling dismissed and unsupported when I needed help the most.

I share this not to disparage but to advocate for change. Patients--especially those already vulnerable--deserve a standard of care that is compassionate, thorough, and responsive. I hope this review serves as a reminder of the significant impact healthcare providers have on their patients' lives.

If you are considering care here, I urge you to advocate strongly for yourself and seek providers who place your well-being at the center of their practice.|This practice has contacted my doctor saying they got a referral and they keep calling me to make an appointment. They have been told them multiple times that I don't have pain and don't want an appointment. I'm tired of waiting on hold to ask not to be called for an appointment. It looks like this is falling through the cracks. Surprisingly, they don't have an office manager. I hate leaving reviews like this but it is concerning how they are not able to handle something that should be simple...|Don't waste your time here they don't care about patients. They completely dismissed my wife's pain and refused to listen or do anything about it.|Dr. Rao and Dr. B are very pleasant Doctors I love their mannerism and patience, however their front desk staff could use some improvement and training ( given incorrect information) . I had an appt. With Dr.B, I arranged my appt. In Frederick I live 45 minutes away. ( that was the only facility to see Dr. B) . My son lives in Frederick so I made family arrangements to stay over night with his family) I called the day before while arriving in Frederick to get the correct address. I was told that I could not see my provider because my insurance no longer covered that facility. I was rescheduled for the Mt. Airey office 25 miles away from Fredrick( medicated)
I was given a prescription which was not at the pharmacies in Fredrick, which meant I had to drive 45 minutes to my pharmacy in Kensington Md, unfortunately the prescription was not covered by my insurance company. The receptionist told me that Dr. B wanted to speak with me tele-visit. I received a call to set up the tele-visit with a nurse practitioner who I had given instructions not to be treated by her.
Finally the receptionist and I came to the conclusion that I could wait for a different day, because the Dr. was not available. I was on hold waiting to be rescheduled, RAQUEL, COMES ON THE PHONE IN A RUDE, ABRUPT MANNER WITH AN AUTHORITATIVE AGGRESSIVE VOICE "ESTHER THEIR ARE NO DOCTORS HERE FOR YOU TO SPEAK TO!"  as I was trying to explain myself RAQUEL was over talking me telling that I did not have a visit with Dr. B. Still as I am trying to speak  RAQUEL is still interrupting me tell me that   "YOU scheduled with Orchid And why did you schedule with her if I did not want to see her"
I am still trying to explain myself so I asked to speak with Shelia the manager, RAQUEL responds by telling me " NO YOU CAN TALK WITH ME AND I WILL GIVE THE MESSAGE TO SHEILA!" I hung up the phone and called my favorite facility in Elkridge Md, Not once did Raquel identify herself as one of the assistant managers. I GUESS THIS IS THE TREATMENT YOU RECEIVE WHEN SOMEONE HAS  A TITLE ONLY ON THEIR JOB.  It does not call for one to be so RUDE ABRUPT AND DISRESPECTFUL TOWARDS PEOPLE WHO ARE SUFFERING AND SOME WHO ARE IN SO MUCH PAIN THAT SOMETIMES THEY DO NOT WISH TO LIVE TO SEE  ANOTHER DAY BECAUSE OF AGONIZING PAIN. ( I HAVE THE SAME TRAINING AS RAQUEL WITH MUCH MORE EXPERIENCE, I AM A CMA, CMN/ geriatrics, CMT, and years of experience in private aide in Hospice) You  must show compassion and empathy towards humans who suffer with infirmities. YOU CALL FOR HELP BECAUSE YOU ARE IN PAIN, ONLY SUFFER MORE FROM THE ONES WHO ARE SUPPOSE TO BE HELPING YOU.
Finally I found out the Fredrick Md. office is supported by DR. Roa, Dr. B. and my insurance provider does cover both physicians at the facility.
2nd I did have a tete- visit with Dr. B to find alternative meds besides the ones that were denied by my insurance company.
So RAQUEL's poor attitude towards me only showed that she and the receptionist at the ROCKVILLE office made a HUGE MISTAKE which RAQUEL insisted that I was wrong ( or made to feel as if I was so F *** Up in the mind from drugs) THAT I DID NOT KNOW WHAT I WAS TALKING ABOUT.
There has to be a better way to receive help from a pain management facility.|I am not a patient but my father is. They were very thorough with any questions I had regarding his treatment and handled everything well. They're also ADA compliant to a higher extent than most hospitals we've entered, including most staff being generally informed about service dog access.|I had a great experience especially considering I was having the nerves in my spine altered. The nursing & technician staffs were helpful along with being very knowledgeable. The physician performing the procedure exhibited an aire of confidence & knowledge of his ability to provide the treatment necessary for the procedure to be successful. The physician kept me informed throughout the procedure   as to what I should be experiencing & encouraged me to definitely keep communications open with him during the surgery.
The post surgery work down was thorough with an explanation describing what I should expect over the next few weeks along with telephone numbers to use if something I might not expect occurs.
All in all it was very good experiences considering it was surgery on my back.

Thanks,
Richard Carter
DOB 02-12-1944|Had been a patient for years at Sheltering Arms with a wonderful Dr and her assistant for fibromyalgia but they did away with their providers. So one of the providers, I knew and knew my history went to Commonwealth Spine and Pain Specialists and they accepted me and my medical records. I've been very pleased with the professional services, I have received with them. They've actually gotten to the root of my medical problem and are moving forward to give me the best results to help me. I would highly recommend this group.

column3:
Interventional Pain and Regenerative Medicine Specialists serves Arlington, Virginia with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Founded by board-certified pain management specialists Dr. John Huffman and Dr. Talal Ghazal, MBA, this premier practice combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with regenerative medicine to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Their state-of-the-art facility at 1635 N George Mason Dr, Suite 150, provides a comfortable environment where patients receive personalized care plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function.

The team at Interventional Pain and Regenerative Medicine Specialists treats a wide spectrum of conditions, including musculoskeletal disorders, neuropathic pain, spinal conditions, joint pain, and inflammatory diseases. Their multidisciplinary approach incorporates advanced diagnostic tools to identify the root cause of pain, allowing for targeted treatment strategies that go beyond symptom management to address underlying issues.

Advanced Treatment Approaches

Drs. Huffman and Ghazal utilize innovative techniques including:

  • Minimally invasive interventional procedures

  • Regenerative medicine therapies

  • Precision-guided injections

  • Comprehensive medication management

  • Customized rehabilitation protocols

Patient-Centered Philosophy

What distinguishes this practice is their commitment to treating patients of all ages with compassionate, evidence-based care. The dedicated healthcare team works collaboratively to develop individualized treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain, helping patients regain control of their lives.

For those seeking relief from pain and inflammation, Interventional Pain and Regenerative Medicine Specialists welcomes new patients. Their office can be reached at +1 571-732-0044, and additional information about their services is available on their website at www.virginiaips.com.
column11: Interventional Pain and Regenerative Medicine Specialists is a pain management practice located in Arlington, Virginia. With board-certified pain management specialists John Huffman, MD, and Talal Ghazal, MD, MBA and their team of dedicated health care professionals aims to help patients of all ages manage or overcome pain, inflammation, stiffness from musculoskeletal conditions, chronic pain medical diseases, and more. Drs. Huffman and Ghazal use a variety of advanced approaches for diagnosis and treatment.

column38: Virginia Desautels|Linda Schoolnick|Tim Zindorf|Sherry Maugans|Ingerid Gude|Tsili Wolf|Linda Sivyer|Tracy Easterday
column40:
Dr. Huffman is a very intelligent and remarkable pain management doctor.  He takes whatever time is needed to thoroughly explain your diagnosis, treatment plan(s) and effects your condition may have on all aspects of your body and life.  The doctor I saw before him left me scarred with his treatment and bed side manner. He told me there was one way to do things when in fact that is not true.  I am so very thankful that I found my way to Dr. Huffman because he treats you individually and not just as a number in his practice.  He and his wonderful staff really care about the patients and their wellbeing. That is very apparent in their tone and actions.  The staff are all warm and welcoming and definitely try to accommodate you in anyway they can.   I recommend him to anyone needing pain management treatment where you are an active participant in your care.  You will never regret choosing this practice.|Doctor Huffman has treated me for pain problems for many years. He is terrific at treating all my pain ailments. Also, he is extremely understanding, friendly, and caring. He is one of the best physicians, if not the best doctor, that  has treated me in all my many years of seeing doctors. I totally trust him.

His staff and office manager are very friendly and go out of their way to please me.

Thank you Doctor Huffman and staff, You guys are the very best.
Fondly,
Linda J. Schoolnick
P.S, My husband Ron feels the same way as I do.|Dr. John Huffman is a very competent, kind and caring physician. I have been in his care for about twelve years and I feel very fortunate to be one of his patients. It's also important to mention how well both Dr. Huffman and Dr. Ghazal work together as a team. You are both very much appreciated!|This doctor listens!! I have found that a rare quality in doctors, especially male ones. Dr. Huffman took the time to answer our questions and seems to be genuinely interested in his patients. The staff is very warm and friendly. Altho I  have only been to the office twice, I  wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Huffman if you are looking for a pain management doctor.|I have now been a patient of Dr. Huffman for about six months.  He implanted a pain stimulator in me in early Nov '21 and he is now in the process of slowly getting my body used to tolerate the new drug (Dilaudid  or Hydromorphone).  He is very thorough with his explanations and seems to truly care about his patients, inquiring about you and your family to more fully assess your situation.  There is never the sense of hurry to get you 'out of there'.  I am impressed and satisfied with the care I am receiving and believe that if you are considering a pain stimulator that you will do well consulting with Dr. Huffman.|If you are looking for a Pain Management Specialist look no further! Interventional Pain and Regenerative Medicine Specialists of Virginia is the practice to go to and Dr Talal Ghazal is your guy! My husband has been in excruciating pain for over a week due to a recurring sciatic back pain episode. It was determined he needs an epidural injection but the specialist we went to can not administer an injection until the second week in June. Additionally, our son is getting married that week. My husband is managing his pain with pain medication and a muscle relaxer but can not wait this long. Our primary care physician recommended this group. We were scheduled for initial consultation yesterday. The staff is amazing! I initially called on Friday 5/13 and spoke to the medical assistant Kathy Tran. Kathy asked how my husband was and how I was. She said she knows that being a caregiver can take a toll. Wow!!! I made quite a few calls to other offices in search of someone who can help my husband. Not one person asked how my husband or I were doing. Kathy was pleasant and accommodating and responded promptly to all of my questions. She listened attentively and provided their fees, code numbers for insurance reimbursements, etc.  She even asked if my husband was on blood thinners as patients would have to stop blood thinner medications prior to the procedure (3 days in my husband case). Dr. Ghazal's office will submit a claim on our behalf. I shared the information with my husband that evening. They do not take insurance but after contacting the insurance and finding out the benefit coverage details, we decided it was worth it.  I called Saturday morning to schedule the appointment. The office manager Dalal Atef expected my call and knew my name. She asked how my husband was doing and congratulated us on the upcoming wedding. We were scheduled for Saturday, 5/14. YES!!! same day!!! The office manager Dalal Atef helped us understand what we needed to complete and/or provide prior to the appointment. Dr. Ghazal reviewed my husband medical records prior to our appointment . He took his time with us answering all of our questions during the initial consultation. He provided clear and easy to understand information. My husband will have the injection administered on 5/19. We have the utmost confidence in Dr. Ghazal and look forward to this Thursday. This is what patient care should look like!!! There are not enough words to describe how we feel about Dr. Ghazal. He really cares!!! The best saying to summarize our experience is:"In the absence of value, cost matters!" This practice delivers an abundance of value!!!|I have been under Doctor Huffman's care for about 5 years now. For a short period of time when he started his new practice I was seeing some of the other Doctors at Holy Cross. What a difference! I didn't feel they heard my concerns so I looked high and low to find dr Huffman again.
Now I drive over 30 miles to see him each month because I know he cares about the pain I suffer with.

Linda Sivyer.|Dr Ghazal is amazing.  He listens to his patients, analyzes test results, uses physical exams, and his brilliant knowledge to address the problem.  I drive about an hour and 15 minutes to see him.  I am confident in his care and admire his compassion.  I would drive even further if I had to, just receive such high quality competent car.

column40:
It came to time the doctor decided no more medications. That's fine. I asked to be taken off of them last year. But he left me to go cold turkey. That's about as unethical as you can get. Being on them at a high dose for 11 years you'd think he'd ween me down or give something so I don't have an emergency. And for the week of Christmas to go through this!! Thanks doc!|Everyone from the front desk to the drs are all very friendly, informative and professional. I have had very good experiences!|I had such a great experience at this practice. Everyone was so welcoming and professional and kind. Facility was very clean and tidy and comfortable. Dr. Sen was so kind and so patient with me and was happy to explain  away any fears or questions I had. The entire staff is to be commended. Thank you for making what was a little bit nerve-racking and anxiety ridden for me into a very very positive experience.|Dr. Sen has been providing pain relief for me for several years now. He has a great personality, answers all questions, takes time to make me feel comfortable, listens to what I am describing as to where my pain is, and provides excellent pain relief through an epidural shot. I highly recommend.|Dr Sen is the most incredible Dr I have ever seen. He is knowledgeable and compassionate. He listens to the patient and treats you with dignity and respect. He and his staff are some of the nicest people you will ever meet. I cannot overstate how amazing everyone is. I highly recommend|Dr. Sen and his staff are amazing! Dr. Sen is very caring and listens to everything that you tell him. He is a wonderful doctor very knowledgeable about chronic pain and will do everything he can to give you a better quality of life! I have followed him to three different locations because that's how great he is! I definitely would not go to another doctor. I hope he stays in practice for a very very long time!|I have been seeing doctors for the majority of my lifetime for numerous health issues. I am not a fan of any of them!! I have major trust issues for one reason or another. I'm 46 and all this started when I was 7.
My PA Dr Ferguson who I love dearly recommended Dr Sen to me. I  dreaded going as always with any new doctor and I can't count the number of times I started to cancel my appointment. I thank God I did NOT!!!
Dr Sen is AMAZING! He has a wonderful bedside manner however he is straightforward. This is what I love the most about him!!
Dr Sen takes the time to HEAR what your saying.
Dr Sen's OFFICE STAFF WOW.. WONDERFUL!!!! Have NEVER dealt with such great ladies!!!|Dr. Sen is an extremely caring and skilled professional.  As stated by others, Dr. Sen and his staff (all of them) are extremely kind and helpful people.  We have managed to keep my God given knees for at least 2 years longer than would have been possible! He has a robust set of tools at his disposal to include physical therapy, RF Ablation, etc.  He also diagnosed a carpal tunnel situation when I didn't know what was wrong and he may have saved my hands.

Coastal Virginia Spine and Pain Center serves Virginia Beach, VA and the surrounding Southeastern Virginia and Northeastern North Carolina region with exceptional pain management solutions. Our highly skilled and compassionate medical team specializes in treating both acute and chronic spinal and musculoskeletal pain through personalized treatment plans designed to reduce pain, improve function, and enhance overall quality of life. With a patient-centered approach, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider committed to helping patients regain mobility and comfort.

Our comprehensive range of services includes:

  • Spinal and Joint Injections - Targeted relief for specific pain areas

  • Physical Therapy - Customized rehabilitation programs

  • Regenerative Medicine - Advanced treatments including Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP), Stem Cell Therapy, and Prolotherapy

  • Weight Management Program - Supporting overall health to reduce pain factors

Personalized Care Approach

What sets Coastal Virginia Spine and Pain Center apart is our commitment to developing individualized treatment plans. Our professionals are uniquely qualified to address complex pain conditions, ensuring each patient receives care specifically tailored to their needs. We understand that pain affects everyone differently, which is why we take the time to thoroughly evaluate each case before recommending treatment options.

Convenient Location

We are conveniently located at 4525 South Blvd, Suite 200, Virginia Beach, VA 23452. Our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (757) 227-3820 or visit our website at http://covaspineandpain.com/.

column40:
Kristi Cartwright has been a guardian angel for me. I deal with daily chronic pain and occasional intense migraines. She has helped me get scans, procedures, and medications. She always listens and gives advice. I'm so grateful to have her looking out for me. She is wonderful and I hope she can continue to advise me for many years to come. Thank you Kristi!|Very pleasant and helpful staff. Dr.Spears explains so you can understand whatever he's doing and why. He lets you know where your problem area is.
He greets you with his warm smile and doesn't treat you like a number but is patient with addressing all your concerns. I would recommend him to anyone.|I'ma sometimes  a professional patient at this point. In the last 3 years I've been hospitalized in ICU (3 days with very little chance of survival) and have been on visits to at least a dozen Doctors. This group is: Super Friendly and helpful from receptionist to Dr Spear. I have been treated great. Attended to. Listened to. Cared for. Excellent results. Thank You|Update again as the unnecessary childishness continues. I filled out a release for you to send my records to the new provider, back in January. Riddle me this, why have they not received them? Coincidence, I think not!

Update: God bless you for the boot! This is the FIRST time in my LIFE that I have achieved MIGRAINE FREE! Something y'all could have cared less about and shrugged your shoulders at! That never would have happened if I were still at this office. Interestingly enough, it took less than 6 months with competent providers to achieve. Sad for y'all and your patients.

Petty, indignant, children! You discharged me. That's fine, I've moved on, found new providers, receiving far superior care than I did here. Yet YOU continue to harass me. Sending letters when you know you are in the wrong but too arrogant to apologize. Now calling, non stop no less! It will STOP ASAP! Never in my life have I been subjected to psychotic immature behavior from a doctors office to this degree!

I received the letter, but theres a page missing. There is no apology for stating that y'all spent 6 weeks working on my PA, when what you sent, proves that you lied. Nevermind everything else y'all have lied about. I'm starting to see why y'all find integrity so offensive.

Patients BEWARE!!!! If you post an honest review about what actually happened at this office, they will discharge you from here immediately! All those glowing reviews suddenly make more sense, don't they?

First and most importantly! They care so much that they are willing to completely abandon patients! I was told before my appointment today that I would not be seen that I would have to pick up my medication and go elsewhere! Naturally, Angel changed her story when the subject of patient abandonment came up, but none the less, how better can you say "I care" than with patient abandonment?

Being discharged from this place is a blessing in disguise! Not one of them could care at ALL. When the office manager gets caught in her lies, she either backpeddles or denies what she said.

I find it all too funny that they are severely non communicative, then miraculously figure out how a phone works when you leave an honest review.

This was the discharge worthy post. . .
"Migraine for over a week now, and not one single
call has been returned! Not one! I'm over here just winging it, doing anything and everything I can to manage because they don't return calls. Their rebutted to not calling was that I called?????
I did get an argument and a useless script for a med that doesn't even work. I only got that much because I kept calling! Insanity!"

I was not rude, nasty, cussing, etc. I even asked what the preferred behavior, contact, etc, is when struggling with an intractable migraine. Once again they had no answer. I guess it's a blessing in disguse to be discharged from a practice that can't answer legitimate questions and concerns. It just validates their inability to communicate!

Over 10 years with Kristi Cartwight and the most she could muster up was an "I don't know" followed by a shoulder shrug. Not so much as a thanks for the business, piss off, nothing! Thanks for all the "caring." More importantly, thanks for showing your true colors!|DR Sears and  his staff are outstanding professionals.  For my treatment of  headache and neck pain.  I never thought I would ever get better. But Dr. Sears gave me a second chance at living life.  I got neck  injection, and  now  I can enjoy life . May God bless you, Dr. Sears and your outstanding team.

Thank you
Nisha|Best kept secret for back issues in the 757. I've had back pain for 10 years. I've done massages, chiropractors and physical therapy none of that worked. Dr. Spear is an amazing doctor, Kristi is always so positive and Leona makes sure you will be taken care of from beginning to end. If you are in pain go see them asap.|Military!!!!!!!  How many of us have lower back pain????  I've seen so many doctors, completed everything from PT, chiropractor, home therapy with tens unit, back injections....all this for years.  Had multiple x-rays, CT and MRI scans taken for everyone to say "we can't find anything" so no one does nothing except cram more meds down your throat.  Well on Monday I found Dr. Spears, I brought him all my historical paperwork, he looked through everything, talked to me about all I was experiencing, shown me on a model where my pain was most likely coming from.....truly listened to my needs.  I have basically been immobile for a week pain consuming my life. He worked me his schedule and gave me back injections that day.  I was skeptical because the other ones didn't work, but man this time they did.  I feel sooooooooo much better.  I didn't know what else I was gonna do, but Dr Spears and his staff were amazing.  5++++++++ stars.  I can't wait for my follow up.  If you are looking for help please check him out.|The best PT for hEDS in the Hampton Roads area!! I highly recommend Scott.

column3:
Integrated Spine and Pain Services serves the communities of Alexandria and Falls Church, Virginia with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated medical team combines advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment protocols to address a wide range of painful conditions affecting the musculoskeletal system. With a patient-centered approach, we strive to improve quality of life by reducing pain and enhancing mobility for individuals suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions.

At Integrated Spine and Pain Services, we pride ourselves on being a leading provider of specialized pain management care for men and women throughout Northern Virginia. Our practice features state-of-the-art facilities equipped with the latest diagnostic and therapeutic technologies. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs of our patients, incorporating both interventional procedures and conservative management strategies when appropriate.

Specialized Conditions We Treat

Our clinical expertise encompasses a comprehensive range of painful conditions, including:

  • Radicular Pain and Sciatica - Relief for nerve pain radiating from the spine down the extremities

  • Spinal Disc Pain - Targeted treatments for cervical (neck) and lumbar (back) disc disorders

  • Sacroiliac Joint (SI Joint) Pain - Specialized interventions for this common source of lower back discomfort

  • Facet Joint Arthrosis - Advanced techniques to address degenerative changes in spinal joints

  • Hip Joint Pain - Comprehensive management strategies for hip-related discomfort

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Phone: +1 703-313-9111

Address: 7115 Leesburg Pike, Suite 201B, Falls Church, VA 22043, United States

column2: OPMSM - Ocean front Pain management and Sports Medicine
column3:
Ocean front Pain management and Sports Medicine (OPMSM) serves Virginia Beach, VA with comprehensive pain management and sports medicine services. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Kinjal Sohagia, OPMSM offers specialized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions, as well as sports-related injuries. The practice combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to help patients regain mobility, reduce pain, and return to their active lifestyles.

Dr. Kinjal Sohagia brings exceptional credentials and experience to OPMSM. He completed his residency at the prestigious Institute for Family Health in New York, where he developed a strong foundation in comprehensive patient care. During his residency, Dr. Sohagia provided medical coverage for high-profile athletic events, including the New York City Marathon in both 2007 and 2008, demonstrating his early commitment to sports medicine.

His specialized training continued with a fellowship at the University of Utah, widely recognized as one of the nation's top training programs in sports medicine. This advanced training equipped Dr. Sohagia with expertise in various spinal procedures and non-operative techniques specifically designed to treat back pain effectively. His experience also includes providing medical coverage for orthopedic and sports injuries at various ski clinics and athletic events, giving him unique insights into treating activity-specific injuries.

Services and Specialties

OPMSM offers a comprehensive range of treatments for pain management and sports-related injuries. The practice specializes in non-surgical approaches to pain relief, including advanced spinal procedures, joint injections, and rehabilitation protocols. Patients benefit from individualized treatment plans that address both immediate pain relief and long-term recovery strategies.

Location and Contact Information

Ocean front Pain management and Sports Medicine welcomes patients at their conveniently located office in Virginia Beach:

397 Little Neck Road

3300 North Building, Suite 115

Virginia Beach, VA 23452

United States

To schedule a consultation or learn more about available services, patients can call +1 757-500-2277 or visit the practice website at https://opmsm.com/ for additional information and resources.
column11: Dr. Kinjal Sohagia completed his residency at the Institute for Family Health, NY where he also provided medical coverage for numerous athletic events, including the New York City Marathon 2007 and 2008. He completed his fellowship at the University of Utah which is recognized as one of the top training programs in the field of sports medicine. During his fellowship training, Dr. Sohagia received extensive training in various spinal procedures and other non-operative techniques to treat back pain. He also provided medical coverage for orthopedic and sports injuries at various ski clinics and athletic events.

column38: Nathan Morse|Jordan Jones|Kasey Manning|Phillip Urrutia|Shea|Joseph Kohm III|Jennifer Rose|Quintesia Scott
column40:
Was referred here via Navy Medical for treatment for a lifelong disability diagnosed in 2007 that results in chronic pain throughout my entire body.

Dr. Sohagia saw me for about 5 minutes, then prescribed me Lidocaine patches for my back (only one of my areas of severe pain), after I specifically told him that a) I already get them prescribed by my primary care doctor, and b) they don't help. Was told to get X-rays and come back in a month.

Went through the trouble of getting X-rays from Navy Medical, and a month later showed up to an appointment with them in hand, and spent roughly an hour in the waiting room for a scheduled appointment. The waiting room was filled with people that'd arrived earlier than I had. I have a child that I schedule a caretaker for so I can attend appointments like this, and cannot simply sit around for hours waiting to be seen... and also, I can't physically sit around for hours due to pain. You'd think that a pain management center could spring for something a little better than the cheapest, spine-crunching chairs for their waiting room out of a sense of general understanding for their patients. I had to leave without being seen due to severe pain.|Saw Dr. Sohagia today as a new patient , my first impression was great, his office is very nice and his staff is very kind , he is an excellent doctor as he explains everything very clearly and takes his time with you to answer any questions that you may have, this is why I believe he is a bit behind schedule is because he has that Personal touch and is not rushing you out the door like other doctors I have seen in the past I can honestly say I was impressed and will be sticking with him.|David was awesome! He was very helpful and sweet! Dr Sohagia helped me with my knee pain and had so many options to help!! They both made me feel heard and comfortable! Would highly recommend!|My wife Rosemary has been seeing Dr. Sohagia for several months for lower back pain. Instead of jumping straight to a recommendation of surgery, he has treated the issue with great success. She is extremely pleased with the outcome to date and would recommend Dr. Sohagia and his team to anyone needing any type of pain management. What a great staff!!|Dr Sohagia and David are literally the best! David was so helpful and attentive during my visit and answered any questions i had! Dr Sohagia was super knowledgeable and help me get to the root of my pain. I would recommend this dynamic duo to anyone that finds himself stuck at a dead end. I guarantee you it's to help you find the way out.|Dr. Sohagia is an excellent doctor. His knowledge and care for his patients are exceptional. He is patient and will answer any question you have honestly yet kindly, creating a clear care plan going forward. I am very grateful for his treatments, knowledge, and compassion. I would highly recommend him (and his great staff) to anyone.|Dr. Sohagia is an outstanding pain management doctor! He's seen me through the pain of multiple spine surgeries over the past 6+ years, and has always advocated for my very best interests. He's extremely thorough and understands that *physical pain* affects more than just your body...it creeps into every aspect of your life, and he addresses that as well. I've been very fortunate to have had him care for me as his patient. I know my back can never be *fixed*, but I am keenly aware that with his broad knowledge, I can function quite well, without debilitating pain.|I had an appointment with Dr. Sohagia for my back pain, the service was great. His staff was very friendly and welcoming when I walked through the door. Dr. Sohagia was excellent, he answered every question I had. He was very patient and kind to me. He is very intelligent and does a great job when it comes to patient's satisfactory and pain. I would highly recommend him to anyone because he is great, I haven't had any pain since I left him. He is definitely a miracle worker.

column2: Barr Center for Innovative Pain & Regenerative Therapies
column3:
Barr Center for Innovative Pain & Regenerative Therapies in Virginia Beach, Virginia offers comprehensive solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions and sports-related injuries. Founded with a mission to provide alternatives to conventional pain management approaches, the center has established itself as a leader in innovative therapies that promote healing and restore quality of life. Their multidisciplinary team specializes in regenerative medicine techniques that harness the body's natural healing capabilities to address the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms.

The Barr Center's treatment protocols combine cutting-edge regenerative therapies with personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. Many patients who have struggled with prolonged pain conditions have experienced remarkable improvements after undergoing treatment at the center. Their approach focuses on minimizing invasive procedures while maximizing therapeutic outcomes, offering hope to individuals who may have exhausted traditional treatment options without finding relief.

Comprehensive Services

From platelet-rich plasma (PRP) therapy to targeted rehabilitation programs, the Barr Center provides a wide spectrum of innovative interventions designed to accelerate healing and reduce pain. Their state-of-the-art facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies that enable precise treatment delivery. The center's practitioners remain at the forefront of developments in pain management and regenerative medicine, continuously incorporating evidence-based advances into their practice.

Patient-Centered Care

What distinguishes the Barr Center is their commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. Each patient receives detailed information about their condition and available treatment options, empowering them to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach has contributed to the center's reputation for exceptional patient outcomes and satisfaction.

To learn more about how the Barr Center for Innovative Pain & Regenerative Therapies can help address your pain concerns, visit their comprehensive website at https://www.barrcenter.com/. After reviewing their services, call +1 757-578-2260 to schedule a consultation. The center is conveniently located at 933 First Colonial Rd #200, Virginia Beach, VA 23454, United States.

Blue Ridge Pain Management Associates serves the communities of Roanoke, Salem, and Christiansburg, Virginia with exceptional pain management solutions. Our highly skilled team of anesthesiologists, pain medicine physicians, and certified physician assistants is united by a singular mission: relieving human suffering. With three conveniently located offices throughout the region, we provide accessible, comprehensive care for patients struggling with both acute and chronic pain conditions.

At Blue Ridge Pain & Spine Associates, we practice a holistic approach to pain management that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of living with pain. Our treatment protocols combine cutting-edge interventional therapies, medication management, and patient education to create personalized care plans. We believe in empowering our patients with knowledge and tools to actively participate in their recovery journey.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience treating a wide range of pain conditions, including:

  • Acute low back pain

  • Work-related injuries

  • Myofascial pain

  • Headaches and migraines

  • Neck pain

  • Neuropathies

  • Arthritis-related pain

Visit Our Salem Location

Our Salem office is conveniently located at 100 Knotbreak Rd, Salem, VA 24153. To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call 540-205-3351. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at www.blueridgepm.com.
column11: The highly skilled team of anesthesiologists, pain medicine physicians, and certified physician assistants at Blue Ridge Pain & Spine Associates is dedicated to relieving human suffering. They practice a comprehensive, holistic approach to managing pain at three locations in Roanoke, Salem, and Christiansburg, Virginia.Using a combination of cutting-edge interventional therapies, medication management, and patient education and empowerment, the team at Blue Ridge Pain & Spine Associates provides the full spectrum of patient-centered care. They treat various causes of pain, including acute low back pain, work-related injuries, myofascial pain, headaches, neck pain, neuropathies, and pain related to chronic conditions like arthritis.

column38: Amanda Jordan|Tim B.|Brenda Hunt|Debbie Linkous|Gary Kolarcik|Jay Schmolitz|Cheryl HMauldin|Amanda Dove
column40:
I am beyond upset. I am a new patient. Check in lady with Blonde hair is very rude. Provider was excellent. However, I am extremely dissatisfied so far. It's been 4 days no prior authorization has been done. I only left one voicemail each day nicely but begging for a return call. No one has yet to call me back. I'm also using crutches as I'm in a leg cast. Today 12/23 at 11:25am we arrived and I made it inside and here's the blonde lady again. I was very friendly trying to explain that nobody will call me back and I really need my pain medicine . I made her aware we just drove an HOUR AND HALF to please speak to someone . She said oh they received your message and now you wait for a return call and walked away. Excuse me??? This is how you treat patients. I wish I could speak to Cooper NP (whose the best)  or the head physician there so they would know how I was just treated after driving so far from my home in Madison Heights. No empathy or compassion. She couldn't get someone to come speak to me on why it's been 4 days and not one return call nor my prior authorization has not been done. I'm going to go into withdrawal because of this. I also had cvs Caremark call them Friday and today - no one would answer per Caremark. Please can someone from this practice help me? This is so sad me being a new patient.|I am Now Writing This Review to Try to Explain What Occurred to Me at the Salem office. This Doctors Office Has an Answering Service Which is Not Doing Their Job, Bottom Line They Are Not Relaying the Messages. To Begin With I had an Appointment at the Roanoke Office, and Laura Davis Called in to Mark Off on The Day of My Appointment. The Answering Service Called Me On The Day of My Appointment at the Last Minute ( Matter of Fact I Was Headed Out the Door for the Appointment) I even Asked Them  If Laura was doing okay. I Also Told the Answering Service That I Was Out of Medicationin, She Informed Me to Call Back and I s Said Why Should I Do That When I Have You on the Phone Right Now. She Didn't Know What to Say. On That Day I Was Running a Little Late of Course You Can't Call, Because of the Answering Service. I Could Have Had an Emergency or an Accident, But I Can Not Reach This Office  Because of This Service. On That Day Arriving at the Salem Office I Tried to Explain My Situation However, They Did Not Want to Hear Anything I Had to Say. They Said That I was Argumentative and They Did Not Want to Hear Any of It. The Next Thing I know The Assistant Physician Came Out and She Threatened Me Very Badly and She was Very Unprofessional. She Said If You Don't Stop I will Kick You Out of the Practice. Wow! She Then Said You Are Lucky to Even Be See by Me today!, and  If I didn't Stop Talking I Would Not Be Seen. I Tried to Explain My Situation,But was Told to Take a Seat and to Be Quiet Until I Get Called Back for the Visit. The  Next Thing I know I'm giving a Urine Sample, I Then Walked Around Looking for Someone to Give It To. I Found The Assistant Physician That Was Rude to Me Earlier and Asked If She Wanted to Talk to Me, That I Had Some Issues That Was Happening to Me That  I Needed to Address. She Then Said  You Are Lucky I Even Seen You Today, and I Needed to Leave Right Now or I Will Get Kicked Out of the Practice. That Was Very Unprofessional and Uncalled For, I am Very Upset That This Office Treated Me the Way They Did On That Day. I Have Been a Patient for at Least 15 Years Now with Dr. Baylor, and Now I Received a Letter Saying I got Multiple Cancellations, Don't Forget That Laura Davis Canceled On Me the First Time and That Was Not Recorded Properly in the System as a Cancellation on the Providers Behalf. It Showed Canceled Only Meaning That It Looked Like I Canceled Both of the Appointments, Which I Did noMt. Now I don't Know What's Going to Happen, Because a Letter Was Mailed to Stating I No Longer Can Be Seen by This Practice. I was Prescribed Oxycodone by Dr Baylor I Guess They're Going to Let Me Withdraw From This Medication. I Don't Understand Any of It! This Answering Service Is a Waste of Time and Money. They are Not Doing Their Job, and I  Know What the Practice is Going Say:
That Patients Leave Multiple Messages, However Don't Put Me in That same Basket Talk lto Those Patients That Are Leaving Multiple Messages. This is the Only Doctor's Office That I'm Aware of That Has An Answering Service. It is Given the Practice a Double Black Eye! Meaning Not Only They Do Not Have the Time or Want to Talk to Their Patients On the phone, The Answering Service They Hired is Not Doing Their Job.( A waist of Money ).  I am Now at a Loss and I Don't Know What's Going to Happen. Has anybody Experienced This Situation? Please Let Me Know.|The nurses never smile and when I call one in particular has a bad attitude. She didn't even say goodbye to end our conversation, she just hung up on me. No professionalism at all. I wish my doctor would get new nurses.|They are the best they have been with me for 26 years and they have a heart of gold I miss him more then life and I love the whole office safe|I don't leave poor reviews off the cuff, but I've had enough with these people in this office. I've been coming here for over one year and can not take it anymore. The Christiansburg office is better, but Dr. Baylor is never there.
I'm not there for meds like many others. I need spinal, knee, and other injections. They are rude and condescending. Don't  question anyone, or you'll get an attitude and may be asked to leave if you're unhappy. You must arrive 30 minutes early just to wait up to an hour sometimes.
Today, after waiting 85 minutes to be called, the rude nurse asked a series of questions. One was if I had an infection. I said I have stuffy nose and may be allergy. I said I hope it's not an infection. She then said I can't have my procedure if I have an infection and need to reschedule. So apparently, she knows I have an infection because she's a doctor now??!  AND, Why not ask these questions upon arrival??  Why make me wait an hour and a half to find out I can't get my procedure? She would not even let me speak to the doctor!
Lesson learned... Next time, LIE.
I'm 20 miles from Salem AND require a driver in order to have these procedures. That's their rule. So, I need to inconvenience another person for my appointments. Understand?
They make it so difficult, and you feel like you need to kiss butt to get what you're paying for!!  They made so many people mad while I was waiting. I thought it was people who couldn't get the meds they wanted, but then they treated me like a dog as well!! They know they have no competition. That needs to change.
The place also smells like an ashtray. The nurse wasn't even friendly - at all. I tried so hard to like it here, but I really, really hate this place! STAY AWAY.|I found the place to be more about scribing medicines than solving the problems. They don't listen to their patients, I don't even think they care about their patients. All they care about is the money.
I tried it, and will never go back.|I see Laura Davis, PA. for
non-procedural visits. She's extremely caring, sensitive and nonjudgmental to me at every visit. I highly recommend her to help you through your journey.
For any type of procedures I see
Dr. A. Dragovich. He too, is kind and caring and listens to your concerns and needs. I trust him completely with my care.
The staff, from front to back are always welcoming, kind and compassionate, especially Sarah who works with Laura.
I do, however, have three complaints:
1) There is no way to get in touch with a real person if you need to; such as if you're running a few minutes late. However, they do return calls and messages through their internal messaging system promptly.
2) Their bathroom doors are extremely hard to open, especially if you are disabled. There should be an automatic door opener to accommodate those needing assistance; especially for those who wheelchair bound!!!!!!
3) PLEASE put coat/purse hangers in your bathroom. When you come alone for your appointment and are carrying your coat, purse and medications as needed for your appointment, there is NO WHERE in the restroom to put your things and I most certainly would not put them on the bathroom floor nor leave them in the lobby unattended!!|I went to the Salem office for my first visit. Everyone was so nice, & I believe I saw J.R. if I'm not mistaken, & he was so awesome! He listened to what I needed to say & examined me, & was very professional. I definitely recommend!!

column2: Commonwealth Pain Management and Wellness: Savitri Gopaul, FNP-BC
column3:
Commonwealth Pain Management and Wellness serves Richmond, Virginia with comprehensive pain management and mental health services. Led by Savitri Gopaul, FNP-BC, this practice takes a holistic approach to treating various conditions, addressing both physical discomfort and psychological well-being. Located conveniently in the Discovery Drive area, the clinic has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider for residents seeking relief from chronic pain and musculoskeletal issues.

At the heart of Commonwealth Pain Management and Wellness is Savitri Gopaul, a board-certified family nurse practitioner with exceptional academic credentials. Ms. Gopaul completed her nursing degree at Virginia Commonwealth University School of Nursing in Richmond, graduating summa cum laude—a testament to her academic excellence. She further enhanced her expertise by earning her graduate degree in nursing from Maryville University in St. Louis, Missouri, where she graduated cum laude. Her commitment to providing the highest quality care is evident in her continuous pursuit of education and staying current with the latest advances in wellness and pain management techniques.

Holistic Approach to Pain Management

What distinguishes Commonwealth Pain Management and Wellness is their comprehensive approach to treating pain. Rather than merely addressing symptoms, Ms. Gopaul and her team evaluate the whole person, considering physical, emotional, and environmental factors that contribute to discomfort. This integrated methodology allows for more effective treatment of chronic pain, musculoskeletal issues, and related mental health conditions. Patients receive individualized care plans designed to improve their quality of life and functional abilities.

Services and Location

Commonwealth Pain Management and Wellness offers a wide range of treatments for various pain conditions and mental health concerns. The practice is conveniently located at 8002 Discovery Drive, Suite 125, Richmond, VA 23229. Patients seeking appointments or additional information can contact the office directly at (804) 977-3721 or visit their website at www.wellnesscp.com to learn more about available services and treatment options.
column11:
Savitri Gopaul, FNP-BC, is a board-certified family nurse practitioner at Commonwealth Pain Management and Wellness in Richmond, Virginia. She takes a holistic approach to treating pain, other musculoskeletal issues, and mental health conditions.
Ms. Gopaul completed her nursing degree at Virginia Commonwealth University School of Nursing in Richmond. She graduated summa cum laude.
Ms. Gopaul earned her graduate degree in nursing from Maryville University in St. Louis, Missouri, graduating cum laude. She maintains her advanced credentials with continuing education. Ms. Gopaul strives to stay current in the latest wellness and pain management advances.

column40:
Always kind, polite and respectful. Savitri Gopaul is very thorough and always in good spirits with us, she takes the time to have honest quality conversations with both of us to assess our daily lives instead of short questions that just do not have short answers. Both myself and spouse have been long term chronic pain patients and she treats us as such without pushing procedures on us or as drug seekers which happens a lot with pain patients.|I have my first appointment tomorrow but the staff so far are awesome I made an appointment request online this morning and they called me right away and luckily had a cancellation the next day. I will update once I see the wonderful reviews of the doctor.

Edit- I've been to see Dr GoPaul twice now and to say she is the nicest person I've ever met is an understatement. The office is quiet, peaceful, tranquil you feel like you're in a spa. The lady at the front desk is so nice and bubbly. Yesterday I left a message about a med change and the dr called me back personally in about and hour to talk and set up an appointment to follow up the next week. I cannot recommend these people fast enough the whole office is awesome million percent recommend. Can't forget the nurses awesome|I was so, pleased with Dr. Gopaul, the staff, and how clean her office was. Everyone was so nice and helpful. Doctor Gopaul didn't throw pain medicine at me. She is trying to the root of my problem. Yes I will recommend this doctors office.

New patient,

Priscilla|My doctor visit with Dr Gopaul was excellent.  She listened to my concerns and understood my issues with pain.  She now has me on the right medication to manage my chronic pain.  She's an excellent doctor with bedside manners and I respect her with her methods of pain management.  She has changed my life.  I will have future visits and if you're looking for a pain management doctor i would definitely recommend her.|This facility is not handicapped accessible and I wish that I had known there are stairs to enter, no handicapped bathrooms making it nearly impossible to provide a urine sample , and the exam table required two people lifting me out of my wheelchair onto the table .  I could not be treated due to these limitations and went home in worse pain than I came in and exhausted.   The fall risk are serious.   If you are in life threatening pain from fractures this is not the place for you.   The NP was kind and I think this a good option for minor to moderate pain without physical limitations .|It has been a blessing for me to find a doctor like her. Well, it helped me a lot with the pain in my legs. I not only admire her as proportional but her attitude and personality are very beautiful. The doctora is an excellent acquisition for her company|Dr Gopaul and staff is always friendly but professional . I feel very comfortable with services and  feel that I can communicate with staff with very positive responses.Services continue to be excellent, from nurse assistants to front desk staff, I look forward to my visits,|Savitri Gopaul is very knowledgeable in her Pain Management career. She sees many complicated patients and "normal" ones and seems to enjoy helping all of them. I was going to another Pain Management Doctor who helped me obtain a Spinal Cord Stimulator for my back/leg sciatica. After meeting Savitri twice, I was ready to switch my pain management to her and keep the other Doctor for any problems I have with my stimulator.

I would recommend Savitri Gopaul, NP.

column2: Shenandoah Pain and Palliative Care Clinic
column3:
Shenandoah Pain and Palliative Care Clinic in Broadway, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management and palliative care services to residents throughout the Shenandoah Valley region. Established with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain and serious illnesses, our clinic combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care. Our team of board-certified specialists utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols to address complex pain conditions, cancer-related discomfort, and symptoms associated with progressive diseases.

At Shenandoah Pain and Palliative Care Clinic, we provide a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. Our palliative care services focus on relieving suffering and supporting patients with serious illnesses, regardless of their diagnosis or stage of disease. We work closely with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated, patient-centered care.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Each treatment plan is customized to address individual needs, goals, and circumstances. Our compassionate staff takes time to listen, educate, and involve patients and their families in decision-making processes. We emphasize improving functionality and enhancing quality of life while minimizing medication dependence whenever possible.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 540-901-7028. Our clinic is conveniently located at 173 E Springbrook Rd, Broadway, VA 22815. For additional information about our practice, treatment options, and patient resources, visit our website at www.shenandoahpainandpalliativecare.com.
