The entire staff here is the greatest and treat you very kindly. TABITHA has changed my quality of life in finding a pain management regimen that works for me and I appreciate her so much. My pain was very high before I started going to her and now it's very manageable. There are people put on this earth to help others like me and she is one of those. I would recommend her clinic very highly.|Being new to The Valley, I was looking for a knowledgeable pain management office who could deal with my complex medical conditions. I found better care here than I have found in some of the larger cities in Virginia. They have a small town feel, with the sophistication and knowledge base better than big city practices. I feel lucky to be in their care.|I cannot say enough great things about this office! Cheryl Miller has improved my quality of life so much and I literally can't thank her enough. Being a "younger" person in my 20s with multiple chronic conditions, many other providers have just dismissed my concerns. Cheryl takes the time to address all issues and develop an effective pain control regimen that is tailored to your specific needs. She really takes a holistic approach to pain control, and that is not a very common trait with healthcare providers today. Melody, Shavon, and Janell are always so welcoming. This practice is simply the best|AWESOME
AFFORDABLE
ACCESSIBLE
CARING
CAPABLE
CONSISTENT
COMPETENT
COMPLIANT with regulations

They TAKE TIME TO LISTEN  and THOROUGHLY EXAMINE - at every appointment

They demonstrate EMPATHY, KINDNESS, and UNWAIVERING SUPPORT for patients

They draw upon decades of CONTINUAL TRAINING and EXPERIENCE in many types of pain management modalities to CREATE INDIVIDUALIZED TREATMENT REGIMEN

They courageously help alleviate patient pain while making certain that medication misuse does not occur.|I have a 78yo relative that is in need of the the services here.  Cheryl & Melody have been professional, helpful and respectful from the first visit.  I realize there are some negative reviews, but we have never had anything but a positive experience at this office.|Been at this practice for over 2 years now. Mrs Miller is great in trying to get answers to questions in person. But trying to call and talk to someone is remotely impossible. Told refills were sent in but the pharmacy never receives them, the lady at the front desk talks nasty and gives you a hard time when an emergency comes up to be told to "wait until your appointment or go to the ER" to now never being able to to get in touch with anyone in general.|Tabitha is a great physician. She cares a lot and knows a lot of good resources and ways to help you manage your pain. Make no mistake though, this clinic focuses way more on pain and less on palliative. I went here under the impression that they had a more general scope and could help me cope with a wide variety of symptoms from my chronic health conditions. Tabitha kept saying she didn't specialize in those things and couldn't help with symptom management or connecting the dots between symptoms/conditions or anything like that. Finally I asked and she point blank told me this is basically just a pain management clinic. So, if you're looking for more general care, this probably isn't the place. But if you want pain management, this is a good place. She's really nice and does things like hook you up with paperwork for obtaining a medical marijuana card, she can fill out paperwork for disabled parking placards, she can fill out disability paperwork if you need workplace exemptions or accommodations. They're very efficient with that.|Tabitha has been nothing short of a miracle worker for me , after a botched back surgery that has left several issues.  She takes the time and the steps to treat the problems at hand . Would recommend anyone that's having pain issues to try them out .

column38: Tim Bennett|Ken Belongia|Rachel Mm|Cynthia Brownell|John M|Stacy Lautar|Jan Golden|Suzanne Auble
column40: I have multiple back and neck issues that require medical attention. I started years ago going to Dr Bhatia after trying several other spine and pain doctors. Since going with him I have been able to control my pain to a level of leading a normal life and activity schedule. I highly recommend seeing Dr. Bhatia for any pain issues. In addition to being a great pain doctor, I always reach out to him for advice on other medical issues and get great answers.|I had an epidural steroid injection with Dr. Bhatia last week and it has definitely helped.  My pain level is noticeably less.  Dr, Bhatia is incredibly good at what he does - knowledgeable and very good at explaining what he's doing, has great patient rapport, and wastes no time in accomplishing his task.  He is always on time with his appointments, as well - something I really appreciate.  I highly, highly recommend him!|So grateful to have found him!! Dr.Bhatia is such a kind and intelligent person! He listens and provides constructive feedback and offers several creative solutions to managing pain in every day-to-day life :) He has helped both me and a few members of my family as well, and I would recommend him to anyone struggling with chronic pain. He's also very knowledgeable in spinal conditions, and helps explain things in laymans terms for those who struggle with medical jargon. His nurse Eugene has good bedside manner & his receptionist Emma is very kind and great with scheduling! Overall a great place highly recommend!|I want to say a few words about Doctor Bhatia of DMV Spine and Pain of Sterling Virginia. I have been a long time patient of Doctor Bhatia. I was his patient for several  years  when he practiced in Reston and when I found out he opened his own practice in Sterling I followed. His knowledge, expertise and amazing connection to his patients is why I did not want to be treated by any other doctor.  He also practices the newest procedures and one I just became a happy recipient of is the Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) Therapy that he performed on my knee. I had received knee surgery that was successful but due to arthritis I was still experiencing pain.  Luckily, the procedure was painless, and I had positive results almost immediately.  I have gone from icing my knee several times a week  (sometimes several times a day) to only once since I had the procedure and then it was more for my knee feeling discomfort than actual pain.  I must warn that it was not covered by my insurance, but I found the cost to be very reasonable.  Also, for anyone who experiences pain knows, any procedure that is so effective and increases your quality of life is priceless.|Dr. Bhatia is great! He listened to my concerns, suggested a plan to address my issues, and, most of all, he gave me hope that he'll be able to help me with his positivity. Thank you!|I have been seeing Dr. Bhatia for many years now and he's amazing. He's so personable. Always asks about my family and how I'm doing personally. He also just doesn't ask about my neck issues but all other medical problems I may be experiencing. He's very through!|I was very happy with the personal attention and care that was shown to me.  The office environment was calm and comfortable.  I appreciated the small, non-corporate office.  Dr. Bhatia is not only extremely knowledgeable and caring, but he is practicing medicine the way it should be practiced, something hard to find these days.|I have been seeing Dr. Bhatia for many years. I have seen other pain management doctors prior to him so I can say that he is technically the best.  He also is compassionate and understanding. He listens to my concerns and answers questions thoroughly. I never feel rushed out the door like some other doctors. His staff is also courteous and helpful.  Most importantly, when I tell his scheduler that I'm in pain, I get to see him as quickly as possible. I am truly grateful to be one of his patients.

column3:
Charlottesville Pain Management Center in Charlottesville, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Albemarle County and surrounding areas. Our specialized medical facility combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address chronic pain conditions, sports injuries, and post-surgical rehabilitation needs. With board-certified physicians and a multidisciplinary approach, we're committed to improving quality of life through effective pain relief strategies and sustainable management techniques.

At Charlottesville Pain Management Center, we provide a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy referrals, and alternative treatment options. Our team specializes in treating conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, fibromyalgia, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique needs of our patients, focusing on both immediate relief and long-term management strategies.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating collaborative relationships with our patients, ensuring they are active participants in their pain management journey. Our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and comfortable treatment rooms designed to provide a healing environment. New patients benefit from comprehensive evaluations that consider medical history, current symptoms, and lifestyle factors to develop the most effective treatment protocols.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 434-295-3600. Our clinic is conveniently located at 2050 Abbey Rd a, Charlottesville, VA 22911. Visit our website at charlottesvillepainmanagementcenter.com for additional information about our treatments, staff, and patient resources.

column40: Incredible doctors, that are very thorough and offer the best care and pain relief but the billing is catastrophic. Apparently despite giving my insurance cards at every visit, they weren't billed, my insurance has no record of services being requested, denied or approved. And I'm being harassed by collectors even though I never received a bill in the mail and never brought up at visits, didn't know my insurance wasn't billed or that i owed anything. Both i and a family member have been calling and leaving messages, but no answer and no calls back. I'm not sure I'll be able to find doctors as well as them but I can't keep dealing with this.|Dr. Siddiqui and his staff at Charlottesville Pain Management Center are AWESOME!  Everyone was courteous, I was promptly seen and examined by Dr. Siddiqui, the diagnosis and treatment plan were clearly discussed with me, and I received care (a cortisone injection) the same day!  Very personal, and professional care in a laid-back atmosphere...what more can you ask for?  THANK YOU!!|18 months after wreck my hip pain was down to a "4". Doctor referred me to this place. I thought it was going to be a consultation visit, but quickly talked into getting injection while I was there.10 days later, my pain up to about an 8. They set up a 2nd opinion appt, but Dr going on vacation, so wait 2 weeks. If I need help sooner, told to go to ER..... WHAT? Avoid this place. Don't care, just want patient volume.|Dr. Messinger is fantastic. Bedside manner is awesome!  Taking the time to isolate the underlying cause of your pain and treating it really pays off. I highly recommend him and his staff. Nicole is always friendly and professional when calling in for medications and handling appointments.|I've been one time for an injection. Dr. Siddiqui was personable and professional. However, I'm extremely frustrated by the lack of communication from the staff. I moved from VA this summer and decided to go to a pain specialist my new MD recommended locally and it's so different.  Definitely not Dr. Siddiqui, I really miss his bedside manner for sure!|Quick in and out, great physician and staff.  This clinic does wonderful work and is willing to help whenver they can...  They get the highest feeedback from us (my wife and I are both physicians) - Christopher Starnes MD|Excellent care. I will travel to see him.  clean facility. column3:
Pain & Spine Center of Charlottesville serves residents throughout Charlottesville, Virginia and surrounding communities with specialized care for chronic pain management. Our dedicated team of board-certified pain physicians brings years of extensive experience to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions, helping patients regain control of their lives through personalized treatment plans. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why we combine compassionate care with advanced medical techniques to develop comprehensive solutions tailored to each individual's needs.

At the Pain & Spine Center, we offer a comprehensive range of interventional procedures utilizing state-of-the-art technology and minimally invasive techniques. Our approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, allowing for more effective long-term management. Treatment options include:

  • Advanced spinal interventions

  • Nerve blocks and radiofrequency ablation

  • Medication management protocols

  • Regenerative medicine techniques

  • Customized physical therapy programs

Expert Medical Team

Our physicians are board-certified specialists in pain management with extensive training in the latest interventional techniques. The team stays at the forefront of pain medicine through ongoing education and research, ensuring patients receive the most current and effective treatments available. We take pride in our multidisciplinary approach that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating partnerships with our patients through education and shared decision-making. During your visit, our specialists take the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, explain treatment options, and develop a customized plan aligned with your goals for pain relief and improved quality of life.

Schedule your consultation today to discover how our specialized pain management services can help you regain function and improve your quality of life.

column40:
My experience here has been excellent thus far! Dr. Purvez is attentive in my care and treatments. His staff is also very nice, supportive, professional, and also very well put together. Since becoming a patient here, my pain has been much better managed! Highly recommend!|If you're looking for pain relief, DO NOT see Dr. Purvez. Now that I have discovered how much LESS painful nerve ablations can be since I've had them done with a different physician, I want to spare everyone the torture that I experienced with Dr. Purvez.

I have had chronic lower back pain for most of my adult life and it was at its worst after I gave birth to my first child. I was referred to Dr. Purvez who suggested nerve ablations. I waited for the nerve ablation testing. The tests went fine and so I was scheduled for my first ablation a few weeks later.

Dr. Purvez would not perform bilateral nerve ablations. He prefers to have patients come in at seperate appointments for the left and right sides of the back. I didn't question this at the time because I assumed it was standard practice, but in fact it is not. Other physicians will do both sides at the same visit. I assume Dr. Purvez chooses not to do this because he can bill more.

The first nerve ablation on the right side was incredibly painful. Not just because of the needles, but because I could feel the complete burning sensation of the nerves being destroyed for the whole 90 seconds running down my back to my legs. I cried out in pain and was ignored. I had tears in my eyes as I hobbled out of the room to get dressed and go home. He said I was ok to drive, but I definitely was not because I was in so much pain. The excruciating burning pain lasted over 24 hours and was so unbearable that all I could do was lie in bed and try to be completely still which was very difficult when I had an infant at home.

Then, I had to come back a few weeks later and experience the pain all over again. When I was on the table, Dr. Purvez barely spoke to me, not even asking if I was comfortable or ok. He mostly talked to his assistant. It was like I wasn't there.

However, once 24-48 had passed since the procedure I felt so much better. I was pain free for the first time in a long time. So I made the assumption that nerve ablations are just really excruciating but it's worth it to get the lasting relief. I came back a year later and did it all over again.

He would make off color comments during my visits. I was having my vitals taken by a nursing assistant and telling her how I was recently diagnosed with sleep apnea and was getting a CPAP machine. He said that the only thing I needed to cure my sleep apnea was to lose weight. Update: I am now in normal BMI range and I still have sleep apnea.

The final straw came when I went back for nerve ablations after the birth of my second child. I went in for the right side ablation, but something went wrong. The nerves were damaged but not completely destroyed, and as a result I was disabled for about a month, unable to sit up to get out of bed, drive, or bend at all without intense, blinding white hot pain that nearly made me pass out. I called his office to tell him this, and he prescribed me a muscle relaxer. It didn't help. He then suggested physical therapy, but I was unable to even get on the table for them to take measurements or perform any exercise. I called his office and said I can't live like this what else can be done? He refused to prescribe me any pain medication and said if I was in that much pain I should go to the ER. Which I did. I had to go a few times that month because he was ignoring me.

I finally worked up the nerve to get nerve ablations with another doctor last week. This doctor engaged with me during the entire bilateral procedure. He made sure I was comfortable and explained every step. He tested the intensity of the radio frequency running through each needle BEFORE starting the 90 second procedure which was something Dr. Purvez NEVER did. As a result, I felt NOTHING during the entire 90 seconds.  I felt nothing after the procedure either, even though I was expecting for the pain to creep up later on and put me out of commission. It didn't.

Don't make the same mistake I did and let yourself be tortured by this man. You don't have to suffer to get relief.|Dr. Purvez and his staff are hands down the best!  Personal, caring, and attentive - I've been seeing him for over 10 years. I hope he never retires!|I have had the best experience today for my personal back ablations. Dr. Purvey was absolutely a God send!  Mmm!  Christina has helped from the outside guiding me through the laws of the rolls of|Dr. Purvez is amazing. We've been seeing him at his clinic for many years for migraines, back pain and neck pain. He's been wonderful. He always take the time to address all the issues. I highly recommend Dr. Purvez.|Another thing. It didn't matter how much pain I was in. He didn't help. I received NO numbing meds and if I did it didnt feel like it at all.  I was in tears for days after I went in for injections. A different doctor told me my test results a month later. Dr. Purvez knew how bad my pain was and NO he didn't help nor did he care. I loved Dr. Purvez when I started going to him years ago.|Dr Purvez has done a wonderful job helping to manage my lower back pain over many years. The staff is always excellent, professional, and caring.|I find Dr. Purvez to be knowledgeable and thorough. He is pleasant and caring. I look forward to reading his book The Brain Behind Pain.

UVA Health Pain Management Center serves Charlottesville, Virginia with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to help patients regain control of their lives. Located in the heart of central Virginia, our specialized center combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary team works diligently to develop personalized treatment plans that focus not just on pain relief, but on restoring functionality and independence.

At UVA Health Pain Management Center, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional treatments. Our board-certified specialists utilize the latest evidence-based approaches including:

- Medication management

- Nerve blocks and injections

- Physical therapy coordination

- Psychological support for pain management

- Minimally invasive procedures

- Advanced implantable pain control devices

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our team takes time to listen to your concerns and develop treatment strategies that align with your specific goals and lifestyle needs. By maximizing your functioning and independence, we help you return to the activities that matter most to you.

column40:
If I could give this team a million stars. I started going there as a wheelchair bound 4th grader who doctor's refused to treat my chronic leg pain any further. Dr Goldstein and his team changed my life. As a 4th grader, Goldstein took on the challenge of implanting a pain pump. After several years of constantly tweaking and trying new meds, Goldstein was able to get me to no longer be wheelchair bound. That was 2004. I still drive from northern Virginia to Charlottesville (1.5 hours each way) every 3-4 weeks to have my pump refilled. Going to the clinic is "home away from home" for me. They have always been up for new ideas, innovative, and ALWAYS listened and took into consideration my wants.|They refused to deal with my pain because Virginia law enforcement won't let them! I'm gonna deal with it myself! Bhavana Yalamuru totally lied when she put the information into my medical records! The nurse even acknowledged that she was shielding what she injected into me after I objected to my treatment. UVA refuses to talk to me!|The staff at the front desk are lovely! I saw Ann Murray who was very empathetic and caring. I have nothing negative to say about the staff, but I'm very disappointed regarding the practice's knowledge with pregnancy. This is my second pregnancy. I have an autoimmune issue, cause unknown, that causes me to have very severe, 6 week long, continuous  headaches during pregnancy and post partum. I have a midwife, so she's unable to prescribe anything for me. I was sent to high risk OB and my case was above and beyond what OB could handle. I went to pain management thinking that being specialists in pain management they would know how to treat me. They did not at all. I now have to go back to the high risk OB who said he couldn't help me to see if he will approve a medication being recommended by my midwife. If he does, they will prescribe it. If he doesn't, I'm back on the wheel of seeing specialist after specialist and being denied care due to being pregnant. I have been to 2 EDs, a prompt care, seen ENT, neurology, 2 primary care offices, pain management, internal medicine, high risk OB, a naturopathic doctor, a chiropractor, and I cannot get help. It's very disappointing that people who specialize in pain management have no knowledge on how to manage pain in pregnant people. There's a reason why the US has the highest mother mortality rate of any developed country. You are all but denied medical care if you're pregnant in this country, and this office was no different.|one star because initial consultation seemed reasonable. Procedure recommended and understood I had to drive myself. No sedating drugs to be used. Not needed. MD, DO, and med student heard the conversation. Procedure scheduled. Get "nurse" call who asked about driver. I said MD and I discussed it and worked out. Arrive for procedure. RN checking me in gruff, forceful, asked about driver-me and MD said OK, accused me twice of lying about that. MD did note it in record. Then MD told me the conversation never happened because he failed to record it. And somehow this was my fault. Then accused me of lying about how my prior pain management physician handled the same procedure. I drove myself to and from. Then MD insulted my profession, me professionally, and my employer. I am a highly educated and trained medical profession who does not care for humans. In a 2-3 min time period I was accused of lying by 2 people 5 times and had my career insulted. My 0-10 anger meter was at a 15 and they did not see the half of it. I made sure all the other patients in the area knew I was being accused of lying to cover the ineptitude of a MD not creating and accurate and thorough record of a consultation. I learned better than than and live the ethics I committed to when I chose my profession. Everything gets recorded even it it records something than could cause me some challenge. Never has though because I recorded the discussion and ensured on an agreed understanding. Used 8 hours of leave, 8 hours of my time, waited 4 months to have the visit and then the procedure (not done), 100 miles of wear and tear on my vehicle, and half a tank of gas. Find a real medical practice with real, ethical physicians. It is like finding a unicorn, but the ones that do not take insurance (yes I will be paying out of pocket) have unicorn status.|I would not recommend this clinic if you are a chronic pain sufferer. While the support staff were extremely kind and helpful, the doctor was not. My long-term (16 years) pain issues were dismissed. I was offered nothing to reduce pain (meds, injections, any diagnostics to explore comorbid issues). As pain specialists, they see disabled people daily, and yet they refused to sign off on a disabled parking application, even a temporary one, despite my use of a wheelchair, because of my inability to walk. They had no specific places they recommended for a surgical consult, no knowledge of other specialists of my condition. I watched as the doctor googled my condition and read off the name of the only doctor she found in the state, several hours from me.

I waited nearly 2 months to get in to see someone. My money and time were wasted by coming to this clinic. I wish I had never scheduled an appointment. I felt disrespected, condescended to, and dismissed. My quality of life remains poor, and I have no idea what I'm supposed to do now.|I've been a patient at UVA Pain Management, Fontaine Research Park, for around 15 years. My first doctor was Dr. Kevin Vorenkamp. When he left for another medical organization (across the country) he referred me to Dr. Lynn Kohan. Both have been excellent. I live with extreme pain due to numerous musculoskeletal and health issues. Without them I'd never have been able to be an endurance cyclist for many years and avid hiker until too many major injuries caught up with me. While I await many surgeries of and on over many years, both doctors worked hard and extremely compassionately to oversee my care. The pain Management group has gone out of their way to assist with my pain care both pre and post op at my many surgeries. With pain management being squeezed by the dire opioid epidemic these doctors have carefully maintained to keep me safe with my needs for medications. Many other doctors, non-pain management, have failed to work with pain management and some have accused me of not needing the medications. It is taxing for any patient to constantly have to go through their long pain and medical histories with new doctors. It is especially difficult because while a patient is suffering from pain they just do not feel like rehashing those histories. It is exhausting and can very much bring a person down emotionally. Every person wants to feel good. Every person wants to feel well. People do not want to spend years and or lives in extreme pain. In my many years with this pain management group I've only ever had difficulties when I was wrongly scheduled with a Dr. Irwin at the Monticello location. I was misinformed about whether I needed a driver or to be accompanied and the staff treated me horribly. The doctor- a nurse informed me- made incorrect claims about what I was instructed. That nurse accused me of lying based on her conversation with the doctor. I've made it clear with the Fontaine office that I am not to ever be scheduled with Dr. Irwin or at the Monticello location and was told I am not the first person to complain of problems there. My advice is to stay with the Fontaine location. Their staff and doctors have always been excellent and incredibly respectful. They see you as a person and want to do the very best they are able to with the medical sciences available today. From being one of the first patients to receive new (to them) procedures to regular appointments and procedures over the years there are no egos just compassion, empathy and solid professionalism.|I don't understand why there are so many negative ratings about this place. Dr k o h a n and her assistant Brandi. These people saved my life. I have complex regional pain syndrome which is in the same category of pain as bone cancer. I also have another very rare neurological disorder called arachnoiditis which requires high doses of opioid pain medication. As long as everything is documented and you are not a drug seeker, they will help you. It also depends on who you talk to. I have had a couple of times where I've called and not received any response or help. Be patient and be your own best advocate. I am actually leaving the practice that I am at now because of the doctor missing so many days and has a record with a Medical Board of Virginia and pills started to become missing from my bottle so I will be waiting until December and hopefully switching over to them for that as well.|I had my experience there in 2012. I did several rounds of injections that failed then did MRI's because I told them I was still having pain & problems. They told me there was nothing wrong with my results and I was fine. Would'nt refer me to a pain clinic in my home town. I decided to go to my own PCP and have referral. Went to a pain clinic in my own home town and they found many things wrong with my MRI's. This place is a JOKE!! Don't go.

column3:
Spine & Pain Clinics of North America serves Fairfax, Virginia and surrounding communities with comprehensive interventional pain management services. Our specialized medical facility focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using advanced, minimally invasive techniques. Founded by board-certified physicians with extensive training in pain medicine, our clinic has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in Northern Virginia, offering personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms.

At Spine & Pain Clinics of North America, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and regenerative medicine therapies. Our multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with physical therapy, medication management, and lifestyle modifications to provide holistic pain relief. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's condition, medical history, and personal goals.

Expert Medical Team

Our clinic is staffed by fellowship-trained pain management specialists who stay at the forefront of advancements in interventional pain medicine. Our physicians have extensive experience treating conditions such as back and neck pain, sciatica, herniated discs, spinal stenosis, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. The team works collaboratively to develop innovative solutions for even the most challenging pain conditions.

Patient-Centered Approach

We pride ourselves on delivering compassionate care in a comfortable, modern facility. Our patient-centered philosophy emphasizes education, open communication, and shared decision-making. New patients receive thorough evaluations, including comprehensive medical history reviews and advanced diagnostic testing when necessary, to ensure accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment planning.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at +1 703-520-1031. Our clinic is conveniently located at 4001 Fair Ridge Dr, Suite 202, Fairfax, VA 22033. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at www.sapnamed.com.

column40: Dr. Majid Ghauri isn't just a pain management doctor, he's a pain relief angel. His ability to pinpoint the exact nerve causing pain is almost magical, and his treatments bring real relief. Beyond his expertise, what truly sets him apart is his kindness and humility. He listens, he cares, and he treats every patient with the utmost respect. If you're looking for a doctor who genuinely wants to improve your quality of life, Dr. Ghauri is the one.|This place is a complete joke. My husband has MS and other heath issues and we left Kaiser and his insurance suggested this place  smh. He doesn't write for opioids and told my husband to go to er for withdrawal and to wait 2 weeks for his records. When I told him I was a nurse and that was not proper protocol he walked off and Stay away|Stay away unless you're on opioids!  This place is a joke, I wonder if he's a real doctor.  I went to see him since he was the only spine doctors in my network!  This clown of a doctor refused to complete the forms that diagnosed me - I made an appointment, and he sent me for an ex-ray, even when I told him I had one already 2 days ago, we did it anyway, went back to see him for the diagnosis, 3 pinched nerves in my back, he sent me to physical therapy I went.  When I sent his office a form to complete for my insurance claim (not a motor vehicle claim) I was told that the doctor does not fill out forms!  OMG!  What a joke!  It took them only 4 weeks to tell me after I called 3 times and emailed twice.  Take my advice, stay away from this clown he's only a dope pusher!  He never even looked up at me the entire time I saw him on those 3 occasions!|Dr. Ghauri and his team have been working with me and my chronic health issues for over 4 years and I have never had a bad experience with them. Dr. Ghauri is kind and listens well. His team is considerate of me and my time. The practice manager is always making sure I am taken care of and that prior authorizations are completed in a timely manner. There are procedures that are done in office, under sedation, which is extremely convenient. I sincerely appreciate and recommend this practice to anyone with chronic pain and/or spine issues.|Dr. Majid Ghauri is the greatest doctor in the Area, when I went to visit his office for the first time I was scared because I didn't know him, the staff were so friendly professional makes me feel like home, when I saw Dr. Majid Ghauri in the room he was very polite professional gentleman who understood my concerns my health, he makes me feel very comfortable confident, he said from now on I am your doctor we are going to to take care of, Dr. Majid Ghauri is the only one who did my pain go from 8 to 4 of scale 1-10, all staff are very nice people professional, I can't thank him enough for his kindness and service, thank you so much Dr. Majid Ghauri I do recommend you because you're the best Doctor. God bless you and your family Doctor. Thank you so much for all you did for me.|I was so disappointed on how he treated myself and my situation. From the moment I walk in and the moment I walk out I realize how he was just interested in just charging the Insurance and that it. Not once he decided to help me when ever I ran out my medication 5 days sooner than the next refill. Finally I was able to go back to Mclean Pain Management where it all started. They did listen to me all the time and show me how much they care on my situation and always helped me every time I ran out of my medication if it was m5-8 days earlier due to my severe Pain. Every time I walked into Dr. Majid Ghauri office he was just is so much rush to get me out of his office. It was the worst 5-6 months and Painful time I went through at this clinic. I do value each Doctor because they have dedicated themselves to help others but I just never thought I was going to meet the wrong Doctor. I'm sorry but if you really need a clinic who looks after you and really cares about you even in those moments you see no way out I do really recommend Dr. Daniel Kendall from National Spine and Pain Management in McLean. Without any insurance and pain levels surpassing 10+, this clinic and their staff care more about their patients rather than charging right away over $485 to insurance. Good luck at Dr. Majid Ghauri clinic. Who knows, it might end up working great for you, but unfortunately it would be the last place I will ever go back.|This is the 1st place I have found down here since moving here several years ago that is actually good!!! The staff is wonderful! They are friendly and always very helpful in so many ways. Dr. Sabahat actually listens!!! Then, he explains and breaks everything down so that you completely understand what's going on!!! I HIGHLY 100% recommend them!!! Wonderful office!!!|Have had great experiences with Dr.Guari and staff. They have helped me gain so much relief from the pain I was experiencing. Had the greatest relief with my Abbott pain stimulator implant which they helped me get approved. This is the place to go if you are looking for relief from chronic back pain.

column3:
Blue Ridge Pain Management Associates serves Christiansburg, VA and the surrounding New River Valley with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain, our practice combines evidence-based medical interventions with compassionate care. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating various pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Blue Ridge Pain Management Associates, we offer a wide range of treatments for conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication delivery systems. Each treatment plan is developed with careful consideration of the patient's medical history, current condition, and long-term wellness goals.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating partnerships with our patients through education and shared decision-making. Our team takes time to explain pain mechanisms, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to actively participate in their recovery journey. This collaborative approach has helped countless individuals throughout the New River Valley region regain function and improve their daily lives.

Our Facility

Located at 95 Ponderosa Dr NE in Christiansburg, VA 24073, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. The office environment is designed to provide comfort and accessibility for patients with mobility challenges. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to coordinate benefits for optimal coverage of necessary treatments.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (540) 254-0700 or visit our website at www.blueridgepm.com. Our office hours are Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, with some procedures scheduled on select Saturdays to accommodate our patients' needs.

column38: Cheryl HMauldin|Thais Carvalho|Heather Safewright|Kristen Corell|Blue Lava|Ariana Mandros|W Hall|Lawrence 0
column40:
I have been coming to Blue Ridge Pain Management for over 4 years and am very happy with the staff and the practitioner that I see, Laura Davis PA.
She is exceptionally talented, kind, CARING and she LISTENS to everything that I have to say. Most importantly, she always allows me to ask questions and give my thoughts and input into my plan of care.
I would never change from seeing her and have told many people about her and Blue Ridge Pain Management.
I have been to all their offices and the staff have always been courteous, respectful and polite.
Being a healthcare provider myself, I would not stay at this practice if I felt that the care that everyone here provides was not exceptional.
Thank you all at Blue Ridge Pain Management.
K. Heim|My family and I just got treated extremely unprofessionally and disrespectfully by Dr. Baylor. The practice requires a driver. I was in the waiting room with my kids for my husband to get a steroid injection. I asked the rooming nurse if I could leave  to get gas, and he said yes. The nurse Jessica T came into the room and cussed my husband because she believed I had left to get gas. However, I never left. I was working on computer while my kids watched a movie in the waiting room. She called my husband an a-hole in front of the other nurses. The practice manager came in and said she would be repremended. She asked us to wait for one hour for the processure because Dr. Baylor was in a meeting. One hour later, they took my husband back to the procedure room to get him ready. Dr. Baylor came in and told my husband to leave, that there was too much drama with the driver situation, and for him to never come back again. When bringing up that nurse Jessica T called him a a-hole, Dr. Baylor says that maybe he is one. As they exit to the waiting room, my husband called him a name too, to which Dr. Baylor told him, in front of my kids, that he would grab my husband by the neck and throw him out. And I said to Dr. Baylor "thank you for doing that in front of my kids". This was a example of how healthcare professionals SHOULD NOT behave. Extremely unprofessional and disrespectful. If you have another option, don't go there.|PATHETIC sums it up!  If a doctor is afraid to write prescription for pain what good are they and why do they put themselves in the position to do so?  There was no pain management found at this hell hole!  My 83 year old Mother was treated very inhumanly by these people.
She had gone to a Spine and Pain doctor for numerous years for treatment for pain with no problems.  My Mother has had 7 back surgeries ,  a knee replacement surgery , a hammertoe surgery that wash botched and had to be redone.
It is very obvious just by looking that my Mother had severe chronic pain!
She had began to be afraid of the drives to her old pain doctor in Roanoke so in order to be closer we changed to Blue Ridge.   BIG MISTAKE!
My Mother medicine was cut.  Because of this she rain out approximately 5 days early.  Although there were other options that could have been used they chose to take my Mother off her medicine and put her on a suboxone like patch that she did not understand.
A pain pump would have been a more humane  option but was never offered to her.
She fretted and worried for days just constantly saying how much pain she was in and what was she going to do.
She could have been put in a treatment center to help her better manage her medicine. There were other options besides leaving her to suffer to the point that she took a bottle of over the counter sleeping pills.
My Mother is a hard working woman that began working at 14 and continued to work until her late 70's.
She truly was an advocate for the elderly generation and worked as a Med Tech for many years.
She did nothing to deserve the treatment she receive at Blue Ridge Pain Management!!!
If they want to punish someone they should punish all the young people that come in there and receive much more medicine and sell the medicine on the street.
I guess they like to pretend that this doesn't happen but I know people who appear to be in much less pain than my Mom and are given much more medicine.
The employees at Blue Ridge Pain Management showed very little compassion in managing my Mother's pain and I will never forget.
Run as fast as you can from this place!  I sure wish we would have!   They rate 0 stars for me !   My Mom was treated so unfairly there.  They also should be told that they have very thin walls and I heard the "well, I guess i will go on in here" remark made to her coworkers before entering my Mom's room.    My Mom had done nothing to this woman to deserve this comment and should receive an apology for the way she was treated.   I know that will never happen.  She will not even listen and return a phone call!

Why become a pain doctor if you just are going to cause more pain.
I will never get over the way they treated my Mom and I hope they never have to care for a parent with with the pain my Mom has!|My poor Dad has been treated like trash by an arrogant, egotistical "doctor" here. I would go as far to say he's discriminatory. This whole situation has turned into something that never should've taken place.. I've seen animals get better treatment than this. Sad!|I have only seen one of the "Doctors" at this "medical facility", if the rest are like him they are very arrogant, show no empathy, do not open ears and listen and are very egotistical.  I have found a new facility and am receiving proper/professional treatment along with some kindness at this new pain management center.
I do not recommend BRPM.|Remember that time Jordan Young told me nobody would take me seriously and that my case was "laughable" and now I have a number of serious conditions including cancer? Because I'll never forget. Have the day you deserve, Jordan.|Worst doctor's office I have ever been to. Extremely hard to make an appointment with (have to call, leave message, and wait for nurse to remember to call you back- took over a week, my surgeon's office even complained about them to me). Waiting room always standing room only. Disabled woman with a walker and in obvious distress asked for a chair and staff told her no, even though there were empty chairs in their office. Had an appointment, showed up on time, and they tried to extort money for an appointment they claimed I missed but would have never made. Refused to see me. Called office manager, then they agreed to see me but the nurse practitioner (who I've never met) refused to see me (she was running behind she said, so skipping me helped get her to lunch on time, no regards for my time, gas, or having to get and pay a sitter). Office staff was very rude. Other patients in the waiting room shared their horror stories and ridiculously long waits. At the visit where I did see the doctor, he was too busy chatting up the nurse about his Ebay purchase and weekend to even acknowledge me.  Both doctor and staff treated me and the others I saw like less than human. They don't value you or even pretend to have compassion because there is always someone else in pain they can get $ from. I don't usually have high standards for office staff, but this was just unacceptable. I can't recommend this office.|Love their new offices! Parking is great! No more quarter mile walk in the freezing wind and rain (in the winter) from the parking lot to the facility. Same friendly faces now just in different places!
I feel blessed that my primary care provider recommended Blue Ridge Pain and Spine Associates to me. The staff has always been very professional and attentive. All my experiences there have been very positive. I would highly recommend them to all who need their services.

Center for Complex Pain Care is a specialized chronic pain management clinic serving the Hampton Roads area of Virginia. Located in Norfolk, our comprehensive facility offers advanced treatment options for patients suffering from persistent, complex pain conditions. Our team of board-certified specialists combines evidence-based medical approaches with innovative therapies to address the multifaceted nature of chronic pain, helping patients regain functionality and improve their quality of life.

At the Center for Complex Pain Care, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses not only the physical symptoms but also the emotional and psychological components of pain. We offer customized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and behavioral health strategies to provide comprehensive care for conditions including:

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Spinal conditions and back pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Fibromyalgia and widespread pain syndromes

  • Joint and musculoskeletal pain

Our Facility and Location

Our modern clinic is conveniently located at 6275 E Virginia Beach Blvd #303, Norfolk, VA 23502, making it accessible to patients throughout the Hampton Roads region. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, supportive environment designed with our patients' needs in mind.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 757-461-3141. Our dedicated staff is available to answer your questions and guide you through the process of becoming a patient at our center.

For additional information about our treatments, physician credentials, and patient resources, visit our website at centerforcomplexpaincare.com. We accept most major insurance plans and work closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care for all our patients.
column11: Chronic pain management clinic serving Hampton Roads

column40:
One of the providers I saw made me feel very uncomfortable with his comments and assumptions. For the amount of money I pay to be here every 3 months, I feel like he overstepped many boundaries and really put me off from even wanting to come back. I have an appointment in 2 weeks and I'm hoping I don't have to see him again, or if the office can make sure we don't get scheduled together. No doctor should make you feel like an addict but well rounded person at the same time. Disgusting...|I have been a patient of this practice for over 10 years. They have been a life saver for me. I have a bone disease that worsens with age. I have never been made to feel like a drug addict as with past pain clinics. I have gotten to a point of comfort with my current plan. My pain will never be completely gone, however it is currently manageable. The staff have always treated me with compassion and respect. I will miss Dr. Hansen. He has left us in good hands.|I have been with Pain Management for a long time. Started in Virginia and Portsmout, and to Norfolk. I never had any complaints. Never had a long wait. From the front staff to the back, they are fantastic. They understand that the pain is real. It took us along time to get me to a place we're the pain is manageable. Never free of pain, but have gotten me to a place of getting some of my life back. They have been there for me through many operations and illnesses. They are professional and personable. I recommend them highly . I always remind them that I appreciate them.  Thank you Complex Management Staff !|I have been a patient of Dr Holzers for decades and followed him when he joined Dr Hansen's practice. I have been so very happy with all the providers at this practice- Each of them have taken a personal interest in improving my overall health , quality of life and take the time to listen to my issues. I like the idea of seeing all the  providers in the office which gives me a unique prospective and input  of lots of individual experiences and knowledge of each of them.
I am a different person , doing the things I enjoy thanks to Dr. Hansen's Team of professionals!|i appreciate this practice so much! everyone is kind, understanding, and they listen to their patients. they are thorough yet forgiving if you make a mistake! the staff is so friendly & they respond within minutes, by way of e-mail and same day with voicemails. i'm so grateful to find this type of care with my diagnosis. every doctor seems to care about you not just as patients but as people! i would suggest anyone who's dealing with chronic pain/illness to come here. they will never force anything on you, they actually allow you to let them know what's best for you! you'd love it here!!!|I meet Dr Hansen over a year ago. I wasn't doing very good. Of coarse he had saw my records and of coarse same diagnostic nothing could be done medication to keep comfortable. In 2007 found out I had late stage 3 ovarian cancer i was given a yr and half that was with chemo. I have been on a operation table since 13 found had aggressive scoliosis that never is 25 with the surgeries. If all that wasn't enough 37 almost went 9 eye surgeries felt like some cut your eye out of your head, but I could see things never saw. Dr. Hanson the first day I meet you remember what I told you if I new I only had 15yrs left I give 7 or 8 never to hurt anymore. I broke bones and refused to take medication now I don't have a choice. What does your office do. Well if obvious and your receptionist made it clear my last couple visit. I sent you guys 3 or 4 emails letting know that I am in a bind that my car has been almost totaled and the shop fixing my car is a fraud. The old truck i had spend several 100 dollars and find out motor blown, against send emails explaining why I had to reschedule because I had no vehicle. Finally got there but only had 275.00 that got paid in 7 days could pay the balance.The receptionist told me she have to reschedule me takes me 2hr 15mins I called my church they paid  it for me. A week your office sends me a letter saying if I could afford to pay the 400 dollars they could refer to another clinic I WAS FLOORED I give to help others everyday had no idea you guys were so uncaring.  Act like it a sin my church helps me I give so much to help those in need. Recued 31 little puppies. Make 25 -30 trees for the kids hospital because my church helped made me feel like nothing .I come in my last visit Dr. Bowman  said something to me about being short a couple pills which I was not . Never FAILED A DRUG TEST. KNOWING I HAD NO WAY OF GETTING THERE NO VEHICLE.  NEEDED A DAY OR TWO TO GET THERE. Begged to go to hospital because 8,9 miles from my house take urine test or blood test. The clinic does drug test for high school elementary school. My pastor and my other friends out of town the other on a boat in ocean fisherman.  It's like you didn't care about me at all here I lost my last new vehicle, old truck quit. U knew I had no way to sell my trees that I been making the last  year just for Christmas. That your doctors thought of me as a bum because my church helped me. Even called that my friends that were helping me out. Amanda told to give permission left on 3 different lines. U guys tRefused to talk to my church. Told you guys looking at selling my house so i could get a car. I was so broken depressed still am my general doctor said i should report the clinic to the board lcould believe.  Then you STEAL 425 asked you to return
. But want settled for a year but I want ever have to worry about not making a payment. I not a person that sues but I can honestly say this  clinic has left me in alot of pain.They last couple month gave me Fentany in my char3/4ts causing labeled breathing sick as well nausea.  Begged you to call me and help me out. I still don't have a doctor and no medication. Please return the 400dollars. Amt least fill my medication my 2 refills of mnwhat i pd for Quit being so money hunger.because it's obviously shows how much you don't care. Only thing u made me feel very hurt. By the way Raliegh insurance commissions is taking my case. It could be months before I can get a car.|All the providers and staff are caring. If you are in pain, this is the place to be. They will listen and take you seriously. This office stands out by far from all the others. You can always get a call back the same day and I have been in so much pain there were times I needed a same day appointment and someone always fit me in. My quality of life is so much better now that I am under their care. I can't say enough good things about all of them.|I was so surprised how well everybody there listen to you. They let you explain how your body felt instead of them telling you. Everyone was so kind and understanding. I saw Dr Holzer 20 some years ago and then I moved from the area. It is worth my drive of four and a half hours to go to see these lovely people that really care about you. I highly recommend this practice to anyone having difficulties with chronic pain. We still have a ways to go but they have already helped me tremendously.

National Spine & Pain Centers - Alexandria serves patients throughout Alexandria, Virginia with comprehensive pain management solutions. As part of one of the nation's largest pain management practices, NSPC delivers personalized care through a team-based approach that addresses each patient's unique needs. Located within the Inova Healthplex Building at 6355 Walker Lane, Suite 507, the Alexandria center continues NSPC's tradition of excellence in treating chronic and acute pain conditions.

At National Spine & Pain Centers, patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief. The expert medical team specializes in diagnosing and treating various pain conditions, utilizing the latest evidence-based techniques and technologies. Each treatment plan is customized to address individual patient needs, focusing on improving quality of life and restoring function.

Patient-Centered Experience

The Alexandria facility offers a comfortable, welcoming environment designed with patient convenience in mind. Valet parking is available for easy access to the Inova Healthplex Building. The professional staff prioritizes patient comfort and care coordination throughout the treatment journey, ensuring a positive experience from the first appointment through ongoing care.

Location and Contact Information

National Spine & Pain Centers - Alexandria is conveniently located at 6355 Walker Lane, Suite 507, Alexandria, VA 22310. Patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 703-738-4332 or visiting their website at www.treatingpain.com/alexandria. The center welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans.

Doctor cherik is wonderful and so are the assistant nurses.But I don't like the attitude of these nurses.These front desk.People who have absolutely no remorse for other people's lives or appointments at all.It's either you go or you stay|Dr.Cherrick and Dr Mahboobi give Health care a whole New meaning,they listen and explain every procedure to you so that you have full knowledge about your pain issues .
I have never been treated with such compassion in any healthcare facility as I have with the Springfield office.

SW

I wonder if this must be happening a lot if the office now has an abuse hotline. This manager should be fired, you can't treat patients like this.|The front desk people don't understand why we are there. They make us stand there in line forever. This is a PAIN clinic. BUT, the doctors are amazing. Dr Cherrick is a life saver. Dr Mahboobi is wonderful. Go for the doctors and try not to lose your temper with the front desk people.

Virginia Interventional & Pain Specialists in Arlington, VA offers comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. John M. Huffman, MD. Serving Northern Virginia patients from our conveniently located office at 1635 N George Mason Dr, Suite 150, we specialize in innovative interventional procedures designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions with minimally invasive techniques.

At Virginia Interventional & Pain Specialists, Dr. Huffman combines advanced medical training with compassionate care to develop personalized treatment plans for each patient. Our practice utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and evidence-based interventions to target the source of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialized services address a wide range of pain conditions including but not limited to:

  • Spinal pain (cervical, thoracic, and lumbar)

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain syndromes

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Sports injuries and musculoskeletal pain

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. John M. Huffman, please contact us at +1 571-732-0044. Our Arlington office is located at 1635 N George Mason Dr, Suite 150, Arlington, VA 22205. For more information about our services and approach to pain management, visit our website at www.virginiaips.com.

We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to providing accessible, effective pain relief solutions for residents throughout Northern Virginia.

Dr. Huffman is a lifesaver. He genuinely cares about his patients and wants to help them get better. I saw multiple doctors who just wanted to brush me off and give me injections. column3:
The Chronic Pain Center in Haymarket, Virginia offers specialized trigger point therapy services for individuals suffering from persistent pain conditions. Founded with the mission to provide effective non-invasive pain relief, our center has established a reputation for delivering exceptional results without the use of needles or invasive procedures. Our therapeutic approach focuses on identifying and treating trigger points—tense areas within muscle tissue that often refer pain to other parts of the body—to provide lasting relief where other treatments have failed.

At The Chronic Pain Center, we understand that chronic pain can be debilitating and frustrating, especially when traditional treatments haven't provided relief. Our trigger point therapy technique has demonstrated a remarkably high success rate in eliminating various types of chronic pain. Unlike other treatment facilities that may require numerous visits with minimal improvement, we focus on efficient, effective care that addresses the root cause of your discomfort.

Personalized Pain Assessment

Before beginning treatment, we conduct a thorough evaluation to determine if our approach is right for your specific condition. This personalized assessment allows us to identify the underlying causes of your pain and develop a targeted treatment plan. We believe in transparent communication—if we don't believe our methods will help your particular situation, we'll tell you honestly.

No Needles, Real Results

Our non-invasive trigger point therapy techniques provide relief without the anxiety or discomfort associated with needle-based treatments. Many patients report significant improvement after just a few sessions, often after having endured years of unsuccessful treatments elsewhere.

Contact Information

If you're tired of living with chronic pain and ready for a different approach, contact us today for a consultation. We're conveniently located at 15100 Washington St #102, Haymarket, VA 20169.

Phone: 703-313-8550

Website: www.thechronicpaincenter.com

Call today to speak with our specialists who can ask a few simple questions to determine if our trigger point therapy might be the solution you've been searching for.
column11:

Call 703-313-8550

column40:
Long story short, in 2012, I suffered a spontaneous CSF leak which required a blood patch to bring me back to basic health. Ever since then I've suffered from headaches and back pain. Fast forward to 2020, these headaches turned into aura migraines. Anybody who has ever suffered from these migraines knows how terrifying and debilitating they can be. For years, I sought out help from every type of doctor pertaining to spine/brain health. I've tried everything from shots, nerve ablations, physical therapy, chiropractors, pain pills, etc. You name it, I've tried it with the utmost hope one of these doctors could fix me and bring quality back to my life. My last straw was a nerve ablation done on my neck and I suffered 3 aura migraines within 10 days after the procedure. With no hope and absolute misery, I dove deep into my condition as well as google and essentially stumbled upon Frank Gresham. After speaking to Frank over the phone, he convinced me to come see him in person and have him take a look at me. Within 15 minutes of examining me, he figured out that my left hip was legitimately lower or out of place in comparison to my right. He believed wholeheartedly that it was causing issues along my spine and muscles and was causing all of my pain/headaches. Basically, my body was working overtime trying to compensate for the damage that was caused by my hip being out of place. He devised a plan to fix me and get me back to healthy. God is my witness, his plan is working and working brilliantly. It's been a month and I have not even experienced a symptom or warning sign of a single headache. I've had some back and hip pain simply because my body is readjusting but other than that, I legitimately am feeling 100% better than I did prior to meeting Frank. I trust Frank more than any other doctor I have ever came across. He figured out the root cause of my health problems and is single handedly fixing them. If you are suffering from back pain, headaches, or whatever you may be suffering from. I strongly, strongly suggest at least speaking with Frank. The man is a godsend for me and I am so incredibly grateful for the guy. 10/10, I will never recommend any other person for headaches/back pain. Frank, if you read this, thank you so much for caring and figuring out what's going wrong and fixing it!|Frank Gresham is the absolute best!  I was referred to him by my nutritionist/coach whose other clients raved about Frank.  One visit for me and  I made an appointment for my husband.  Frank saved him from scheduling back surgery.  We had just about given up.  He was in such pain and could hardly walk.  We had tried everything -- cortisone shots, PT, massage, dry needling, you name it. ONE visit and we saw massive change.  A few visits later, he was walking regularly and no longer in debilitating pain.  We recommend him to anyone and everyone!   Frank Gresham is a delightful to work with and a wealth of knowledge.  He is a true gem!!!|I had struggled off and on with knee pain for years following an old femur fracture. I did a lot of PT and exercised regularly, but as soon as I tried to increase my workouts, my knee would fail and then the other knee would compensate and I would be set back for months. Last fall, this caused a quad strain and hamstring strain in addition to swollen knees. I was a bit miserable for nine months; radiographs showed arthritis in both knees and the doctor prescribed anti-inflammatories and possible steroid injections and to see the orthopedist. I didn't want that, so one day on a random internet search I came across Frank and scheduled an appointment. Oh my gosh! Within three visits, my knee pain was almost nothing and the quad pain vanished. The swelling in my knees disappeared. I have not taken any anti-inflammatories. It's been a month and still no swelling. I'm excited to get my old life back! Frank is amazing and kind. If you have something that's holding you back, call Frank! I am most grateful for his expert care. Thank you Frank!|Frank has insight and experience apart from any healthcare provider I've ever seen in my 69 years.. In 3 visit, not only is my pain and discomfort gone but my energy and vitality have me feeling like I'm many years younger.
Thank you Frank|I have been living with tendinitis in my ankle for at least five years. I have worn orthotics, casts, and boots to help relieve the pain. I iced it, elevated it, put pain reliever on it... I tried everything i could think of. I had 28 (!) sessions of physical therapy, and it did nothing. I was considering surgery as a last resort. A friend recommended that I see Frank Gresham before having surgery. It was the best decision I ever made. I can walk pain-free for the first time in years!!! When I step out of bed in the morning and don't have pain, I rejoice! I still can't believe it. Frank is AMAZING! He's professional, listens carefully, and is kind. I highly recommend you give his office a call. You'll be so glad you did.|I have had chronic back pain since 2014.  I spent countless hours and thousands of dollars visiting spine centers and chiropractors, but Frank resolved most of my pain in the first visit and all my pain in just four visits!  Frank identified what was causing my pain and made the necessary adjustments to correct the issues.  He also taught me how to stay pain free!  I would gladly pay all that I paid the others just for my first visit with Frank!  I no longer do I wake up wondering how bad my pain will be today because it's gone! Thanks so much Frank!|I have had chronic migraines for years. All the medication I was prescribed stopped working. I have seen Frank 5 times and the difference has been amazing. He is very kind, and helpful with great knowledge in this field. I'm so blessed to have this relief in my life.|I injured myself lifting too much weight, repeatedly. I couldn't move, I was just radiating pain. I was ready to go to the emergency room (which I avoid like the plague). Instead I remembered hearing about Frank Gresham the amazing trigger point specialist at the Chronic Pain Center. I set up an appointment and he gave me the full treatment! Turned out my hips were out of line and I walk incorrectly. After my first session, and some shoe adjustments I had some AMAZING relief! I went back for a second session 48 hours later and by that afternoon I felt like my old self again! I would recommend Frank Gresham to anyone with chronic or temporary pain, due to injury. This guy is Magic! And he knows his stuff.

column3:
Chesapeake Regional Neurosciences serves Chesapeake, Virginia and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Pellegrino, the practice offers evidence-based treatments for both acute and chronic pain conditions. Their patient-centered approach focuses on improving quality of life through minimally invasive procedures, advanced interventional techniques, and personalized care plans tailored to each individual's needs.

At Chesapeake Regional Neurosciences, patients benefit from a wide range of specialized services designed to address various pain conditions. The practice utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic procedures to accurately identify pain sources before developing targeted treatment plans. Their interventional pain management options include:

  • Epidural steroid injections for spinal inflammation and nerve pain

  • Precision nerve blocks to interrupt pain signals

  • Joint injections for arthritis and inflammatory conditions

  • Radiofrequency ablation for longer-lasting pain relief

  • Advanced spinal cord stimulation and neuromodulation therapies

  • Surgical interventions when conservative approaches aren't sufficient

  • Medication management with careful monitoring

Expert Care with Dr. Pellegrino

Dr. Pellegrino brings specialized training and extensive experience to each patient interaction. Currently accepting new patients, Dr. Pellegrino takes time to understand each person's unique pain experience, medical history, and treatment goals. This thorough approach ensures that treatment plans address not just symptoms but underlying causes whenever possible.

Patient Information

Chesapeake Regional Neurosciences welcomes new patients seeking relief from chronic or acute pain conditions. Their convenient location at 300 Medical Parkway, Suite 314, Chesapeake, VA 23320 offers a comfortable, professional environment for consultations and treatments. Patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 757-312-6195 or visiting their website at chesapeakeregional.com/locations/chesapeake-regional-pain-management.

column40:
The staff is very nice in greeting you and the Dr.s are very kind, understanding and very helpful  in finding a medication that best suits your illness and condition, I highly recommend them|Someone tell that PA Jordan Young I have cancer. I still have the video of him saying "no one is going to take this seriously". "I don't know anyone I can send your case to that isn't going to laugh and send it back". Sooo after seeing a lot of competent doctors I have a great understanding of what is going on with my body now. I have been diagnosed with 2 spinal disorders, hashimoto's, primary hyperparathyroidism, and neurocardiogenic syncope. If it weren't for my current doctors taking me seriously and saying "something is not right here" I never would've known about the cancer that's been sitting inside me for years. Thanks so much Jordan for making me want to die that day. I hope you learn and stop making people miserable.|My wife has been a patient of Dr Dragovich for over 5 years. She loves the fact Dr D and staff listen to her. Dr Dragovich has also helped her with headaches and pinched nerves due to an on the job injury. He's the only doctor she will see. She has stated he understands her pain.|Dr Dragovich was very mean and disrespect. Told me other tan a 7.5 patch there was no other options. After spending thousands on scans injections I was told they couldn't manage my pain so I could work and provide for myself. Awful pm doctor he was.  If you can't manage my pain then what is your job?|I find this office a far better one than Salem. It's just my opinion though and I don't have any thing bad about Salem.

I find this a more reasonable relaxed and less people. However you are expected to be the same as All their offices.

They are a good group of people who I think care about you and the elements in your life out of the office as well as in the office.

Good people Dr. Swanson is a good man and I find him very compassionate and Laura Davis is less but she is still better than ones over the years.

Over the years I have been to few different Pain Management clinics. Found them to be very tyrannical especially if you don't agree with their method. Some have even threatened you. I have not been done that here.

I am just hoping to find a way to get off these medications so I can do something and not have to take a nap. I hate them for their side affects as well. No matter what though I am in it for the long run.

UPDATE... I HAVE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED MY WITHDRAW FROM MY PAIN MEDICATION IN OCTOBER '19 . I am not a patient any longer. I did it by myself and with little effort from this office.|Dr. Baylor has been great and has asked questions and listened to how I was doing. He cares to find a solution to reduce and treat your pain. Dr. Baylor even suggested the medtronic spinal cord stimulation device therapy because I've made it known both my wife and I want to avoid narcotics to treat pain.
He is willing to even meet with my wife to ease her fears about the surgery. Can't ask for better care.
Would recommend highly.|I have stage 4 lung cancer and I can't seem to get anyone to authorize my pain meds . It/s been 3 days , I'm being released from the hospital today and I have no meds ! The pharmacy has notified the practice I need preauthorization  (3 days ago ) and nobody is doing anything .They won"t even answer the phone ! I wish they could feel my pain , maybe then they would do something .|Walked in with back pain. Walked out with 120 oxycodone and nerve damage from a careless procedure done in a hurry. It's a legalized trap house. I have nerve damage in my right leg that I have to live with now. You can set in the waiting room and hear people struggling to breath, because they are on so much dope.

column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers serves Fairfax, VA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. As one of the nation's largest pain management practices, NSPC has established itself as a leader in treating chronic pain conditions through innovative, minimally invasive techniques. Their Fair Oaks location provides patients throughout Northern Virginia with access to board-certified specialists who develop personalized treatment plans addressing various pain conditions.

At the Fair Oaks facility, patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. The center's specialists utilize advanced diagnostic tools and evidence-based treatments to address conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Their treatment philosophy emphasizes minimally invasive interventions that target pain at its source while reducing reliance on opioid medications.

A Legacy of Growth and Excellence

Founded in 2011 through the rebranding of The Spine Center, National Spine & Pain Centers quickly expanded its footprint through strategic partnerships. A significant merger with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012 accelerated this growth, followed by affiliations with New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians). Today, NSPC operates over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers across seven states including D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia.

Visit Our Fair Oaks Location

The Fair Oaks center is conveniently located at 3620 Joseph Siewick Dr #101, Fairfax, VA 22033. Patients seeking relief from chronic pain can schedule a consultation by calling +1 571-512-7000. The facility features state-of-the-art equipment and a compassionate staff dedicated to improving patients' quality of life through effective pain management strategies.

For more information about available treatments and services, visit www.treatingpain.com/fair-oaks.
column11: National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) is one of the nation's largest pain management practices in the United States. We strive to bring high quality providers in the specialty of pain management together to offer an extensive network to meet the needs of an ever growing population of patients living in chronic pain. In late 2012 our affiliations grew with the addition of New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians), bringing our number of centers to over 60 with close to 100 providers in D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia and West Virginia.
