column40:
Dr. P is fantastic.  Let's just say that my last appointment was mishandled and I was misinformed.  It now means I have to go 6 weeks between injections instead of 2 which is what the doctor recommended and which I scheduled.  The staff changed the appointment to a check in only .  How does this happen without letting the patient know?  This is unacceptable.|Amazing staff and office at all levels.  Dr. Marina G. Protopapas is the very best, she's personable, smart, knowledgeable (of course) and provides the best possible medical care. I'm very pleased with the results and the medical care provided by her team.|I can't say enough good things about my experiences at the National Spine & Pain Center in Fair Oaks, VA! From the moment you walk in, you're greeted with warmth and genuine care. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable, always taking the time to listen and understand your concerns. I've felt nothing but top-notch respect throughout my visits. If you're looking for a place that truly prioritizes your well-being, I highly recommend checking them out! You won't be disappointed!  Lamar L.|This about the service at the front desk not the Doctor, who I like a lot.

RE: Office Manager

I called today because I'm in great pain and my appointment wasn't until February 17th.
I was requesting for some medication until the 17th. At that time I was informed that I do not have an appointment on the 17th and the doctor wasn't available. I requested that the manager call me , since this person couldn't help me. He said that she would call me at 10am. I had to call three more times to get her to talk to me. She was never going to call me back. When I finally got her on the phone she was so nasty. I asked why someone didn't call me to reschedule and she said she left messages on both my home phone and cell phone. I checked both phones and there were NO messages from her. She was lying and CYA. It was a stupid lie because it is so easy to check out messages. Plus, if I got the message WHY wouldn't I call to reschedule??
I told her I was in great pain and it was difficult to walk and could I get some medication until my appointment. She said no I couldn't get any. (I have always been given medication before). But, she thinks she is in charge and makes medical decisions. She is not qualified to do that.

I have a card that has my date of the appointment. At that time she told me I had to wait until February 17th before Medicare would approve it. So today she gave me an appointment on February 11th. I tried to call again and left several more messages for her to call me to make sure my procedure would be covered by Medicare. She never called me back. Surprise!! Meanwhile, I'm in great pain and spend a lot of time in bed to get relief from the pain.
She could care less about their patients instead of helping them. She wouldn't let me talk to anyone else either. She is a lair, uncaring, and refuses to make any calls back to patients.

I would avoid dealing with her and she should be fired if this is the way she treats their patients . I'm talking about people's health and people in a lot of pain. She could care less !!  Hope someday Karma comes back to her so she can see how painful our situation is. She shouldn't be doing this job she has. Personally, I'd fire her if she was my employee.

So, bottom line is, if I didn't call today to get medication I would have gone to my appointment on the 17th that was canceled and never rescheduled because of her.  We are having a snowstorm on February 11th, so I asked her when the next appointment would be and she said March ! That's like a month away. This is all her fault and I'm paying for her incompetence.
My neurosurgeon told me if I fall I will not be able to get up and will do major injury to my spine. So, with the snowstorm I will be unable to make that appointment on the 11th.  I'm 79 years old and have a severe spinal condition. NO senior citizen should be treated this way. ! Plus put them under the stress she has caused me to have today.

I sure hope someone has compassion in that office to help me?

I also read the review before mine and it seems that person has the same issues with that office as I do.|I have had excruciating pain in my legs from my thighs down to my knees, and in my arms from my shoulders down to below my elbows, for months and this was diagnosed as being due to trapped nerves in my spine resulting from compaction of some of the discs between the vertebrae. After spinal injections, I feel as though I have gone back from being an old guy (which I am...) to being my younger self twenty or so years ago.

The injection procedure was essentially painless. Dr. Protopapas was reassuring before the procedure and said I would feel only some pinpricks when she gave me the initial local anesthetic and no pain when she gave me the shots. She was right. All I felt when she gave me the shots was a feeling of warmth, with some tingling, in the same parts of my legs that had been the source of real pain before the procedure.

The shots she gave me were in my lower spine and I was expecting to need additional injections in my upper spine to help with the pain in my arms. The better part of a week after the shots in my lower spine, I do not believe I need any more treatment as the pain in my shoulders and arms has also disappeared.

I could not be more pleased with the treatment I had at the National Spine and Pain Centers facility in Fair Oaks, VA, including the administrative staff and the medical staff.|Dr. P is the absolute best!  I have had nearly two decades of pain that other doctors have dismissed.  Dr. Protopapas and Dr. Van Zoeren were the first to take me seriously, order testing, and have me on a treatment plan that they carefully explained in detail so I know what to expect every step of the way.  Their respect for their patient's experiences is top notch.|Staff is accommodating and easy to schedule appointments and answer questions.  Dr. Marina Protopapas/is a wonderful doctor and care provider.  Her "set up" staff is excellent.|Fantastic second visit with Salil Malhotra.   Listening skills, knowledge, and compassion are top notch.  It is helpful to work with someone that will explore different options, and work with you for the best outcome.  Highly recommended!

column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Fairfax serves patients throughout Fairfax, Virginia and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. As part of one of the nation's largest pain management practices, our Fairfax location provides specialized care for individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions. Since our formation in 2011, when The Spine Center underwent rebranding to become NSPC, we have expanded significantly to meet the growing needs of patients seeking relief from persistent pain.

At our Fairfax facility, located at 8501 Arlington Blvd Suite 410, we offer advanced diagnostic and therapeutic interventions designed to address various pain conditions. Our team of board-certified specialists utilizes evidence-based approaches to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing reliance on medication.

Our Growth and Network

NSPC's commitment to excellence in pain management has fueled remarkable growth over the years. In 2012, we partnered with Capitol Spine & Pain, significantly expanding our reach. Later that same year, New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians) joined our network, bringing our total to over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers across seven states including D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. That's why our Fairfax team is dedicated to providing compassionate care that addresses both the physical and emotional components of pain. By combining cutting-edge treatments with personalized attention, we strive to help patients regain function and return to activities they enjoy.

For more information or to schedule an appointment at our Fairfax location, please call +1 703-738-4331 or visit our website at www.treatingpain.com/fairfax.

column40:
Suggestion to patients
Front desk is difficult but do not give up. After you follow w front desk's requirements in 2 or 3 visits you insist to see the doctors who will treat you.
A real pain specialist MD physicians are the one for treatment. After initial evaluation by others.
I wrote one review few months ago.
I had great experience with Dr. Beverly Whittenburg, MD 7 years ago I persistently requested to see her.
Today I saw Dr. Whittenburg. The inside area of office is spacious and spotless clean.
I received 2 injections 6 hrs ago.
Every step was smooth, the physician and her assisstant both are kind caring and very thorough with their work. I am explained with detail instructions for self care by me at home.

Thank you Dr. W and Jamal - her assisstant. God bless you with healing hands to relieve sufferings of people who trust you. Love you.|Always professional and courteous. Seen within 5 or 10 minutes of checking in. Doctors and Physician Assistants do their best to find solutions to your health issues and are willing to listen and discuss various options. I would recommend to anyone seeking professional help with their pain management issues. They have done an excellent job of helping me to improve my situation. I'm not sure where I'd be without their help.|This review is for 8501 Prosperity Center reception only
I saw NP first visit was a good experience. NP said I will see Dr. Whittenburg at my next appt.
While in their office the reception made my second appt. date.
Because I had very good experience 7 years ago with Dr. Beverly Whittenburg and ex-Team in previous office I like to see her again. This new location and new team concerns me. Because after receiving a text confirming a reminder for my second appt. I called the office to check if they receive my Xray, MRI results. The reception said "Good you call because your appt. is move further. Reason.. the doctor has full schedule that day. You need to see NP for intake first" I reminded NP did intake first time few weeks ago and told me I will see Dr. Beverly Whittenburg in my second visit. She insisted  only if I see NP again she will schedule me to see Dr. W only as courtesy. ?? I agreed to see NP again if I see Dr. Whittenburg same date after NP. She assured me that I will see Dr. Whittenburg after NP on the same date, may have to wait a little bit. I accepted
I got confirmation text again for second visit w NP no mention w same date appt w Dr. Whittenburg.
I called today to remind reception I will see both NP and MD same day. Both calls today to office were sent to announcements and when prompt to speak the phone was dropped twice. I am hoping on my second visit things will be better. I will update again.|The care team is top notch! They went above and beyond to help relieve my back pain and for that I am forever grateful. Dr. Whittenberg was extremely caring and made sure to do any and everything to help me. The manager of the facility as well did an amazing job getting me squared away. I would strongly recommend this facility.|I learned quickly that not all National Spine and Pain Centers are equal. I live in National Harbor and went to a location closer to me, only to leave and go to the Fairfax location. My Fairfax team are Stephanie Liu, PA and Beverly Whittenberg, MD. They engaged in active listening to determine the best possible plan to manage my chronic pain. The plan that was developed uses modalities.

There is an ease to everything at this practice. The scheduling is seamless. The front and back-end staff are very courteous.  They are easy to reach via the patient portal. The wait time in the waiting area is very reasonable. The waiting room and exam rooms are very nicely appointed. When it is time to get my epidural, Dr. Whittenberg and her tech put me completely at ease. I highly recommend the Fairfax location.|I recommend this practice without reservation. Brianna Benedetto provides friendly, excellent customer service always. One day she took the time to make calls to help expedite my Stat MRI appointment! So grateful!!|The staff at National Spine and Pain Center in Fairfax is great.  I have been a patient with Dr Whittenberg's team for over ten plus years.  I have seen many changes over those years, each with better and better improvements.  Her whole staff is friendly and knowledgeable, there was very little wait before being taken back to a treatment room, and then being seen by the Physicians Assistant, Stefanie.  Current symptoms were shared, A continued treatment plan was discussed, and prescriptions updated.

Last year, I moved from the NoVa area. I continue to drive over two hours in order to continue with Dr Whittenberg and the team. Their knowledge and care is important enough to me for me to continue to make this trip.  I can't recommend them enough!|Truly one of the best doctor's offices I've ever been to - every member of this practice is exemplary.  Dr. Whittenberg is exceptionally intelligent and compassionate and has come up with a long-term plan that has allowed me to live my life again with mostly minimal pain - this after years of crawling up stairs on my hands and knees to get around.  The entire staff is at the top of their league when it comes to patient/client satisfaction and care.  Kudos to a job well done by all.

National Spine & Pain Centers - Roanoke serves the Roanoke, Virginia community with specialized pain management services designed to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians combines extensive experience with innovative treatment approaches to address a wide range of pain-related issues. Located in a modern medical facility, our Roanoke center provides a comfortable environment where patients can receive comprehensive care tailored to their unique needs.

National Spine & Pain Centers is conveniently situated at 5324 Fallowater Lane, Suite 200, Roanoke, VA 24018. When visiting our center, please note that parking access is available through the entrance off Jefferson Street. Our office maintains cooler indoor temperatures to accommodate medical equipment, so we recommend patients bring a sweater or light jacket to ensure comfort during their appointment.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and advanced diagnostic services. Our specialists treat conditions ranging from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome, focusing on minimally invasive techniques that promote faster recovery and improved function.

Patient-Centered Approach

At National Spine & Pain Centers, we believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address the specific needs of each patient. Our team takes the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, explain treatment options, and involve you in the decision-making process. This collaborative approach helps ensure optimal outcomes and higher patient satisfaction.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at (540) 345-4230. You can also visit our website at www.treatingpain.com/roanoke for additional information about our treatments, providers, and patient resources.
column11: When parking at our Roanoke center, please access the parking entrance off of Jefferson Street. We encourage our patients to bring a sweater or light jacket to their appointment due to cool indoor temperatures in our office.
column38: Jessica Melcher|Christopher Erich, Esq.|sabrina davis|Roberta Melcher|Dawson Cooper|Martin Rhodes|Julie Poteat|Corinne Blackmon
column40:
I've gone to this Dr for about 2 years, I was getting routine nerve blocks and nerve ablations,  one of my care team in Richmond asked that I be put on a pain patch to help with the pain. I go into Dr. Bakhits office to talk to him with My Mom as my witness. He tells me to go on the lowest dose patch to start. I asked him about the Tylenol #3's, he tells me to stay on them as he doesn't know if the patches will be strong enough. Then I go do my first UA and he cuts me off patches because I have Tylenol #3's in my system as I've been taking them for almost 4 years now. I ask to talk to him in a formal letter via their my chart and get no response from him and a message back from Meghan their office manager that she will forward my letter to Dr. Bakhit  Wednesday now and still no response from my Dr.the one that told me to stay on the Tylenol #3's.  I received a absolutely disrespectful call from a gal named Mahogany.  This has to be the most disrespectful and unprofessional call I've ever received in the medical field. So now they won't give me my pain meds because of their mistake and dishonesty. I have proof I messaged my primary care regarding me being put on
patches and talking to my care coordinator the same day I was put on these patches. This is not ok to treat a patient that did exactly what you told her to do. Please do better at keeping notes on what you tell patients to do as this is horrible treatment of a patient for something they were told to do with a witness as well. I asked the most straight forward question regarding taking the Tylenol #3's and now I'm being made out to be some horrible person. This blows my mind that a Dr can act this way. I've sent multiple people to this office as I had felt they were professional and would treat patients with respect. This nonsense they put me through is not ok on any level. How would they like to be treated the way they have treated me. This Dr. Should have made notes on what he asks his patients to do yet he didn't do that. Very hurtful to get treated in a manner that I did not deserve on any level as I did exactly what Dr. Bakhit had asked me to. Staff called and apologized for their mistake. I don't blame any of this on Dr Bakhit himself. But this Mahogany chic is so out of line and unprofessional.  She is a risk for your company in the way she handles herself. She could of given me 2 minutes to explain the situation.  She wouldn't let me talk at all and kept acting like she caught me in some nepharius act or something.  I follow the laws and follow what my Dr's ask of me and never deserved her disrespect regarding a mix up inside their office. There is a way to handle yourself when dealing with the public and this gal is way out of line every single time I've came in contact with her. Most of the staff at National spine and pain have been kind, caring and respectful except Mahogany.|I've been a patient for more than two years, during which I have seen: Dr. Bakhit, who is a caring and talented doctor and Katherine Duffy, who was also exceptional--very smart, very funny.
My health has definitely improved while under their care and I am grateful for that.|I especially like that the staff are all friendly. I usually get in and out without waiting. I have been seeing Dr Bakit for over 10 years. I am grateful for the service he provides.|This is a very unprofessional medical facility. My daughter saw Dr. Bakhit and I was in her appointment with her. Dr. Bakhit put her on pain patches. My daughter asked Dr. Bakhit if she was to continue with her Tylenol 3.  Dr. Bakhit said, " By all means continue taking the Tylenol 3, because I don't  know if the patches will work for your pain. Next appointment she had to give a urine sample and of course the Tylenol showed up. She gets a call from his office the day before Thanksgiving. Mahogany is screaming at her and tells her they will not refill the patches, because she had Tylenol in her system. My daughter hands me her phone and the gal is screaming and will not listen, then hangs up. My daughter request a phone call from her doctor several  times, sent a request to the manager and has not heard from Dr. Bakhit at all. They have been very unprofessional  and disrespectful of her. They are treating her very poorly, when she has gone  there for several years. I could not recommend  this poorly, unprofessional office to anyone. I thought they were better than this.|From the front desk all thru the back; docs and nurses, these people are professional and very helpful...they will not bend the rules at all. Which is helpful for both parties! Best pain management around in my opinion|I love my Dr. Bakhit and the staff!! He always cares about my pain and always trys to help me!|Staff is courteous, professional and seem to genuinely care about my well-being.  Because I have multiple pain issues, Dr. Bakhit will suggest alternative measures to address my chronic pain.  I appreciate him and his staff.|Top of the Line Doctors and Staff. Very Professional and Concerning. I've been a Patient for at least two years.

TPMG Pain Management in Williamsburg, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our specialized team provides advanced treatment options including ketamine therapy, which has shown remarkable results for patients whose symptoms haven't responded well to conventional treatments. Located at 223 Bulifants Blvd STE C, we serve the Williamsburg community with evidence-based approaches to pain relief and management.

Ketamine therapy at TPMG Pain Management has been used to treat symptoms of many disorders that cause pain and may not respond well to conventional treatments. If you suffer from chronic pain or a depressive disorder, ketamine may be the answer for you. Our medical professionals carefully evaluate each patient to determine if this innovative therapy could provide the relief you've been seeking.

Conditions We Treat

Our practice specializes in treating a wide range of painful conditions including:

  • Back Pain

  • Knee Pain

  • Hip Pain

  • Shoulder Pain

  • Rib Pain

  • Shingle Pain

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a variety of interventional procedures and treatments including:

  • Lumbar sympathetic blocks

  • Sciatic nerve blocks

  • Epidural injections (neck and back)

  • Joint injections (shoulder, knee, hip)

  • Medical branch blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Sacroiliac joint injections

  • Trigger point injections

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 757-258-2561. Our office is conveniently located at 223 Bulifants Blvd STE C, Williamsburg, VA 23188.

For additional information about our practice and services, visit our website at mytpmg.com.

I cannot recommend Dr. Newman highly enough for anyone seeking pain management. From my very first visit, it was clear that Dr. Newman is not only highly professional but also genuinely caring. He takes the time to listen to your concerns in detail and doesn't rush through the appointment like many other doctors. It's evident that he values your input and works with you to develop a personalized plan for managing chronic pain.

What sets Dr. Newman apart is his approach: he offers multiple options to manage your pain, allowing you to make informed decisions about your treatment. His explanations are clear, and he provides a thoughtful and well-rounded strategy, which makes you feel supported and confident in your care.|Dr Newman is amazing! He is a patient's doctor and cares about helping you reduce or eliminate pain. Rarely do you ever have to wait more than 5 minutes for your appointment. I would recommend him to anyone suffering chronic pain.|I just moved to the area from Atlanta and am very thankful to have found Dr Newman. It's nice when doctors really take the time to understand our unique medical situations and don't try to box us in as a one size fits all treatment plan. Looking forward to working with him and his team.|I have been a patient of Dr. Newman's for over 6 years.  The office is run very professionally, and even though I'm not always feeling too great when I go there, I leave knowing I will be doing better before long.  I highly recommend them.|Dr Mark Newman has been my pain management doctor for over thirty years!!  He truly cares about his patients and won't stop until he gets to the bottom of the issue at hand!!  I feel very blessed to have him as my pain management doctor!!|My follow up appointment went very well. I'm one of the people that a spinal injection worked well for. That has to be partly due to the medication and greatly due to a very professional doctor who knows exactly what he's doing. I am grateful for that and for the kindness he and his staff so thoughtfully provide.|Dr. Newman is great! He is caring and personable. Great with injections. Not a long wait. Thank you for everything you have done for me!

National Spine & Pain Centers - Midlothian serves patients throughout Midlothian, Virginia and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. As part of one of the nation's largest pain management practices, our Midlothian location delivers specialized care for individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions. The center combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment approaches to address a wide spectrum of pain-related issues.

At National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC), our team of board-certified specialists utilizes evidence-based techniques to develop personalized treatment plans. We understand that chronic pain affects each patient differently, which is why we offer multidisciplinary approaches that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and integrative pain solutions.

Our History and Network

Established in 2011 through the rebranding of The Spine Center, NSPC has experienced significant growth through strategic partnerships, including Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012 and New York Pain Physicians. Today, our extensive network encompasses over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers across seven states including D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia.

Visit Our Midlothian Location

Our modern facility is conveniently located at 13700 St Francis Blvd, Suite 501, Midlothian, VA 23114. Patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions can schedule a consultation by calling +1 804-213-2390. Our commitment to excellence in pain management has established us as a trusted resource for patients throughout the Midlothian community who are seeking effective solutions for pain relief and improved quality of life.

Learn more about our services and approach to pain management by visiting our website at www.treatingpain.com/midlothian.

Dr Newton has improved my quality of life with successful facet joint injections and si injections that have converted constant pain to unhindered ability to walk distances, workout, and play golf. Highly recommend! He looks at my imaging and knows exactly what he sees and what I am describing and meticulously and miraculously treats it. Works for months between tune ups. Thank you!!|Dr Kendall has been taking care of my pain management needs for over 15 years and my family members even longer. He has treated my neck all the way down to my SI joints. Without him, I'd be crippled and if not crippled, I would have endured numerous surgeries. He's one of the very best if not the best!  I have referred 30 or more friends and family members to him. Not one of them have ever been disappointed and they still continue to see him as well. I highly recommend him.|Shout out to Dr. Dan Kendall, at the National Spine and Pain Center in Tysons Corner.  He is phenomenal helping manage very tough back pain.  I have been under his care for the past seven (7) years and I can tell you that I've played golf and tennis with his help that would otherwise not be possible.  He works very hard not to lead your pain management to a surgical option if at all possible.  I highly recommend Dr. Kendall and his very professional and able team.|The text expresses gratitude towards a doctor who exemplifies excellent customer service through kindness and professionalism. The patient appreciates how the doctor's office engages in meaningful conversations about their illness, emphasizing the positive impact this has on their experience. Overall, the message conveys deep appreciation for the care and attention provided.|Our experience at the Spine &Pain centers in Mclean has been one of exceptional care. Dr Kendall is amazing and extremely knowledgeable about back pain. The whole office is exceptional. Highly recommend them.|I used this center in 2020 and 2022. Dr.Kendall is absolutely fantastic and GREAT doctor! He did for me 6 injections overall.
But I am wondering why it takes SO long to schedule 1st office visit before scheduling with doctor Kendall when patient has referral for severe pain|As someone who has suffered from chronic pain in my entire life, I was so happy to finally find a center that was close to my home that offered the treatment that I feel comfortable with that is covered by insurance. I had great experiences with Sharon, the nurse practitioner, however that is where the positives in this review end as I have had such a miserable and dreadful experience with scheduling and billing.

From my understanding The way they enter insurance information is the practitioner provides their notes on the appointment and a different individuals enters their claim codes based on the notes. I was surprised to see that my bill involved a number of complex procedures on top of what I normally pay indicating I received double treatment even though nothing about my visit had changed. I immediately contacted the office when I saw the bill and was told they would contact the practitioner. Through countless back and forths, I was told a variety of excuses including the system was down, some people were on leave on the day of the call and that they were working on it. Eventually I went in for another appointment (three months after discovering the issue) and the matter was resolved...or so I thought. I received another bill from the same time, no changes. At this point it has been half a year and there was no resolution. I contacted the office manager immediately to let them know and did not hear back. I emailed weekly and still have not heard back. Yesterday, I received a bill indicating I would be sent to collections if I did not pay the bill. I attempted calling the office and was told Samantha (the office manager) was in and was just in a meeting but would call me back soon. No call ever happened.

This practice is incredibly unethical. They do not care for their patients and clearly have a lack of quality control. I would recommend a different NSPC as other offices have been more kind and attentive or I highly recommend NOT going to NSPC.|Dr Kendall is awesome!! His treatments are like no other!! Minimal discomfort and pain relief within hours.  He has taken care of me for nearly 3 years and has helped preserve my quality of life. Wonderful Doctor!!! His nurses and office staff are like family and truly exhude superior teamwork.  Finding Dr Kendall and this care center has been a great blessing for me!!!

column3:
The Pain Center of West Virginia serves Martinsburg, WV and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services. Founded by Dr. Baksh, this premier medical facility has established itself as a trusted resource for patients suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions. The center's comprehensive approach focuses on not just alleviating symptoms but improving patients' overall functional mobility and quality of life through customized treatment plans.

At The Pain Center of West Virginia, patients benefit from the expertise of Dr. Baksh, a board-certified, fellowship-trained pain management specialist. His extensive training and experience enable him to address complex pain syndromes using evidence-based techniques. Dr. Baksh also serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor in the Department of Neurosurgery at the West Virginia University School of Medicine, bringing academic insights and cutting-edge approaches to his clinical practice.

Multi-Disciplinary Approach

The center employs a multi-disciplinary methodology that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. This comprehensive strategy ensures that each patient receives personalized care addressing the unique aspects of their pain condition, with treatment plans regularly adjusted based on progress and response.

Patient-Centered Care

Understanding that pain affects every aspect of a patient's life, The Pain Center of West Virginia prioritizes compassionate, attentive care. The professional staff works diligently to create a supportive environment where patients feel heard and respected throughout their treatment journey.

Location and Contact Information

The Pain Center of West Virginia is conveniently located at 1000 Tavern Rd #300, Martinsburg, WV 25401. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 304-263-6165. For additional information about services, treatment options, and patient resources, visit their website at https://thepaincenterus.com/.

column40:
I had the Mild Procedure done on my back in two places. The doctor , Bausch did the procedure in a surgical center and he was very knowledgeable and the procedure was fine. There was back pain for three days for me but overall now I can walk without assistance up stairs and stand longer than before. I am extremely impressed. Lou|This review does not reflect the doctor as I have uet to see him but rather the facility.
I waited 2 months on a referral for an appt., made 10/24 for 12/20/24. I was called by staff 4 hours before the  appointment to cancel and  reschedule for 1/16/25 as the provider wasnt there today.. I politely tld her it was unacceptable as I am scheduled for a total hip replacement in February and need pain medicine. Anyone that's had total hip failure knows how painful it is.  She asked me to hold to see if the " Doctor" could see me today???? Huh??  Confusion because she just told me the provider wasn't there. A few minutes pass and another voice which I recognized but won't name asked if I could be helped and explained I was, she talked continously over me and she insisted to make the 116 appt because the doctor was out for 2 weeks??? Again confusion.  Turns out I would see a PA on my first visit as he, Dr. Basik doesn't see you until a second visit.   The PA on first visits  can't  right prescriptions because im not a Virginia resident?? The PA was out due to some kind of emergency,  understandable,  the Doctor knew in October he be out the 2 weeks. Given this  wouldn't there  be some sort of back up plan? So if I see the PA in January, I won't see the actual doctor until  mid to late February and by then won't need pain meds as I'll be recovering from hip surgery.  Poor way to run a practice or any organization or business.  Th facility was  chosen for me on referrals as it's closer to home rather driving to Hagerstown. The Healthcare system as a whole is broke and a mess nationwide but worse in WV.|Great working with Dr Baksh and his team. After multiple procedures done very professionally I am making progress with my back pain !|Very professional and knowledgeable staff.Dr Baksh is awesome Dr. Takes his time to explain and makes it easy to understand the process and procedure's. Will answer any questions no matter how trivial they may be.

Dr Baksh has recommended several different procedures and each one has helped me.

The latest procedures were the Via Disc. This treatment is used to supplement the tissue loss between each vertebrae. If you are a candidate for this type of treatment I recommend you consult with Dr Baksh. I had it done on my L1 - L5. I'm almost totally without pain free. I have to say I'm 90% pain free after 30 years.|My experience w this office is nothing short of amazing. I forget my appt time almost every month and bc they know this, they call me. They work around my demanding schedule and are always incredibly kind. Most doctors would have run from a complicated case like me, but he has been supportive, reminding me of what's important and gave me back of life. He is the GOAT, as is his office staff.|Dr. Baksh is always so kind.  Staff are so helpful.  Dr. Baksh does everything he can to find the source of your pain and treat it.  I have recommended him to a friend, and she has been very pleased with the care she has received.|Dr Baksh is great. I've seen him for almost 4 years and he's responsive and personable. He does a great job with pain management plans and has done multiple procedures to help alleviate my pain. I highly recommend seeing Dr.Baksh|I've been with Dr Baksh for nearly 5 yrs. Coming from Oklahoma in 2019, I had seen 3 other pain docs in this area, none of which would treat the pain I've lived with since 1995. Finally, I found my pain Prince! Dr Waheed Baksh. Granted, due to the epidemic of drug abuse, he is limited on how much he can treat a persons pain, he gives it his all to make sure we are managed the best he is allowed. I'm thankful to have him and his staff are great. I highly recommend his care.

Advanced Spine and Pain in Woodbridge, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Northern Virginia. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic pain conditions using innovative, minimally invasive techniques. Located conveniently at 2296 Opitz Blvd, Suite 210, we provide personalized care plans designed to improve mobility, reduce pain, and enhance overall quality of life.

At Advanced Spine and Pain, we address a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and sports injuries. Our multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge interventional procedures with physical therapy and medication management when appropriate. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, focusing on long-term relief rather than temporary solutions.

Our Advanced Treatment Options

We offer numerous state-of-the-art treatments including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Platelet-rich plasma therapy

  • Joint injections

  • Minimally invasive spine procedures

Patient-Centered Approach

Our practice prioritizes patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We believe informed patients make better decisions about their health care. During your consultation, our physicians take time to explain your condition, discuss available treatment options, and answer any questions you may have.

Visit Our Woodbridge Location

To schedule an appointment with our pain management specialists, call us at (703) 214-7876. Our Woodbridge office is located at 2296 Opitz Blvd, Suite 210, Woodbridge, VA 22191. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at www.advancedspineandpain.com.

column38: I Am Sharon|Stephanie Slay|Tutu Ahm|Beth Ann F|maria jones|Leslie Lewis|Melissa Woodard|Linda Edwards-White
column40:
I am so grateful that I found Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP), particularly Dr. Ramon Go. He is a breath of fresh air in a world full of doctors that don't listen to you and know your body better than you do. It is easy to get disenfranchised by a healthcare industry bottle necked by managed care bureaucracy that is less about managing your care and more about sabotaging your health and well-being.

Location:
This particular office, as I understand, they have many, is located in Woodbridge in the medical office building behind the Sentara Hospital on Opitz Boulevard. It is less than a mile from I-95. There is ample free, easy-to-access parking.

Staff:
I often find great doctors come with nightmarish staff. That is not the case at Advanced Spine and Pain (ASAP). Dr. Go's support staff - from the front desk clerk to his Medical Assistants - are all patient friendly, come with the patience of Job, and there to help and support you.

Now, to the Doctor:

Appointments/Access:
I cannot speak to any other doctor except Dr. Go. He is at the Woodbridge office every Friday and it is not difficult booking an appointment with him one to two weeks out. While he is in high demand, he works very hard, long hours.

Bedside Manner:
This man cares about his patients. It is reflected in everything he does and says. For this very reason, don't be surprised if he's running a little late getting to you. He takes his time with each patient. He wants to get to know you, the person - the person before the pain and the person with the pain. He does not shy away from difficult or challenging conversations or topics. He is well versed on the types of pain the human body experiences, particularly after it experiences trauma. Dr. Go positions himself as your partner in helping you return to a place where you can resume an active, normal lifestyle.

I cannot speak enough positive things about Dr. Go. I just wish that I found him sooner. I wish he were my doctor in every aspect. That's just how awesome he and his practice are to me.

So, why 4-stars and not 5 stars for a man that practically walks on water? This location does not conduct a full intake, collecting what I feel are critical vitals. During my first visit, the Medical Assistant didn't take my blood pressure! During that visit, after fawning over him, I offered the constructive feedback and I let him know I was disappointed. I've noticed since then, I now get my blood pressure taken, but uh... that's it.

They don't own a scale! Why is this so important to me? I don't own a scale at home, so when I do go to the doctor's office, I make it my intention to get professionally weighed, as I am on a weight loss journey. I can't get weighed here, because they don't own a scale, which is kind of crazy to me.

At any rate, Dr. Go, Dr. Lee, the moment you folks get a scale, this will become a 5-star review. For any person struggling with pain of any type, Dr. Go is who you've been looking for. Tell him I sent you!|Excellent place to receive quality care!!  Not rushed to make a decision for certain treatments!!  Professional, friendly, patient & kindly listens to patient!!  Thank you Dr. Lee & Staff!!|Great physician, friendly staff, on time. He also has several offices for convenience. Wonderful. Really appreciate how Dr. Lee listens to you. Treats you like want to have a choice and understand your treatment. He is a very empathetic specialist.  I have been seeing Dr Lee for 1 year now.|I've been a patient here for around 10 years. I've seen different physicians come and go over the years. I consider myself lucky because I have always have had terrific experiences. Presently I see nurse practioner Angela. She is always warm and caring and actually listens to my complaints and answers my questions. The staff is the same way and I'm always treated kindly and with respect. Thank you for helping me to work through my pain by trying different solutions over the years.|Was very good,bolts front desk so nicely and attention, and Dr Lee,always very good with the patient.|Excellent service at Advance Spine and Pain.  Been getting treated for my lower back and now my neck/upper back.  Feeling better. The Doctor is very good.|I have been going to Advanced Spine & Pain for a little over a year. I originally started going to the Woodbridge office, with Dr. Lee providing my care. He is amazing! He listens, which is extremely important when dealing with chronic pain. Because of traffic congestion, I ended up switching to the Fairfax office, and now see Dr. Go. I cannot recommend them enough. Both of them are extremely professional, very personable and easy to talk to, and came up with a plan of care with my input. Likewise with their office staff; they are professional, and return calls ASAP. I needed a pre authorization for a more involved procedure. Their staff was right on it. If you are looking for a practice that is just going to throw pain meds at you, then this is not the practice for you. If you want a practice that is going to ethically do everything in their power to help you, then this is the place to go to!!|Staff was knowledgeable, respectful, and listened to what I  said about my condition. I highly recommend Dr. Brian Lee and his 5 Star Receptionist who was doing it all the day I was there. Thanks for a professional and kind experience.

column40:
I have been extremely pleased with Dr. Reginald Kaptyne.  He is thoroughly knowledgeable, professional and courteous. He listens.   I have had three procedures by him and they have worked well.  The most assuring part of working with him, as well as IS&PP, is that they take it seriously when a patient calls and says he/she is in pain, and they try to work that person in asap - most times, the same day. I always feel welcomed and in good hands. Obviously, I recommend IS&PP highly.|Was seen promptly, treated well, procedure went smoothly and without pain.  This was my 5th visit, 2nd for epidural steroids.  I am very satisfied.  I am a senior with multiple back issues, ISPP has done well for me|Was a great Dr at first for the last 5+ months. Then my car was broken into last week while in the start of a month long trip and my purse, medications, and other personal belongings and electronics were stolen along with my medications. I of course made a police repair that I gave to DR. And he said "it was your fault you should've been more responsible you shouldn't of taken all your medications with you". Again, it was a month long trip ... Either way, he acted As if I can control criminals! He then refused to refill my stolen medications although my pharmacy and insurance said it shouldn't be a problem. So he chose to leave me to suffer 3 weeks from all my ailments plus the withdrawals of doing my narcotic medications abruptly. Not the actions of a caring Dr!!  ONLY 2 STARS BECAUSE HE REALLY WAS GREAT AT FIRST.|Dr. Desai is a very knowledgeable and helpful practitioner. He has a pleasant demeanor and speaks clearly and directly with me. I am fortunate to be able to see him.
Marty|It was a pleasure meeting Dr. Kapteyn. He was kind and very happy to answer any questions we had regarding my diagnosis. Never making us feel rushed, which is as important as the knowledge he informed us of. Leaving us reassured that in time my back injury will heal. Thank you Dr. Kapteyn|Arrived a little early was seen right on time discussed options found a treatment and will be going back in 2 weeks to start the treatment. Working on trying to avoid surgery with the treatment of my problem. He's very confident and very understanding doctor. It's a very tricky situation that I'm in. And I can tell you his willing to do whatever we can to avoid the surgery. Staff is great too by the way very friendly and very knowledgeable|Dr. Thakral, is by far one of the best doctors I have encountered. His bedside manner is top notch. He truly listens to you, and you can tell that he genuinely cares--and, that is not common these days (sadly). He is also very kind. I honestly cannot say enough good things about, Dr. Thakral. A -God send!|Very uncomfortable experience with doctor thakral to say the least - he acted very condescendingly towards me, showed little to no empathy and acted as if he'd rather die than *potentially* order an MRI - and like I was a junkie looking for pain meds for wanting a simple evaluation when I've never taken pain meds and have never had an injury before. Can't imagine what it's like for other patients with chronic pain and who consistently need pain meds. I also heard essentially the entirety of someone's visit because the sound blocking was nonexistent and he seemed to also be treated the same way. The nurse who did my intake was really nice but I could hear the others loudly gossiping in the hallway which seems to be a pattern based on other reviews  the review by the woman which mentions likely sexual harassment is also very uncomfortable. Treat your female patients better

column3:
Christopher A Dawson, MD serves Newport News, VA and surrounding areas with specialized interventional pain management services. Dr. Dawson's practice focuses on minimally invasive, non-surgical spine procedures that effectively treat back pain, neck pain, and sciatica. Using state-of-the-art technology, his approach aims to enhance patient function while decreasing reliance on pain medication. Patients benefit from innovative treatments that require no downtime and impose no restrictions following procedures, allowing them to return to their daily activities promptly.

Sciatica - Epidural Steroid Injection

Dr. Dawson offers epidural steroid injections as an effective treatment for sciatica, providing patients with a non-surgical alternative that helps them avoid more invasive procedures. These injections require no downtime, impose no restrictions on activity, and significantly reduce the need for pain medication.

Spine Arthritis - Radiofrequency Ablation

For patients suffering from spine arthritis, Dr. Dawson performs radiofrequency ablation procedures that deliver at least 12 months of pain reduction. This treatment notably improves function and decreases dependence on pain medication, offering long-term relief for chronic conditions.

Practice Information

Dr. Dawson's commitment to patient care is evident in his personalized approach to pain management. His practice utilizes the latest medical technologies to ensure optimal outcomes for all patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions.

Location: 860 Omni Blvd STE 115, Newport News, VA 23606, United States

Phone: +1 757-232-8844

Website: https://mytpmg.com/physician/christopher-a-dawson-md/
column11: Using state-of-the-art technology, Dr. Dawson enhances function and decreases the need for pain medication through interventional procedures offering minimally invasive, non-surgical spine procedures for treatment of back pain, neck pain and sciatica. Patients can expect an enhanced function, no downtime, and no restrictions after their procedure. Sciatica - Epidural Steroid Injection: Avoid Surgery, No Down Time, No Restrictions, Decrease Pain Medication. Spine Arthritis - Radiofrequency Ablation: At Least 12 Months Pain Reduction, Improves Function, Decrease Pain Medication.

column40:
Dr. Dawson is a very compassionate and a patient doctor. He went over my MRI and explain the next steps I could take. I'm choosing to do a epidural and I'm praying I'll get some relief. Dr Dawson is very knowledgeable. I never felt rushed or silly for asking questions. He's awesome|I suffered from horrific back pain for ten years before I met with Dr. Dawson. I had seen multiple doctors in three different states with no relief. I was not taken seriously and even told it was all in my head. Dr. Dawson listened. It was the first time I didn't feel dismissed. After reviewing my MRI, he explained why I was in so much pain. I highly recommend Dr. Dawson and his staff. I never felt like just a number. He discussed all my treatment options and took the time to answer all my questions. I am back to living a normal life without being in chronic pain because of the knowledge, expertise, and compassion of Dr. Dawson and his team.|Dr Dawson is one of my favorite doctors. He provides wonderful care and has certainly made my life more livable. He is a good listener and explains procedures carefully. I always look forward to my visits because i know he can help me!|Dr Dawson and The staff are knowledgeable and welcoming. They listen to what you have to say give you a direct answer and let you ask follow up questions. They don't cut you off to go to another patients.  Definitely a winning team! I would highly recommend!!|I had a great experience with Dr Dawson and the staff at TPMG. Been to a couple other facilities in the Tidewater area and this group here does it right. They answer your questions, follow up with you if needed, and make sure you are aware of everything that's going on. I did not just feel like a number to them, they made me feel like the pain I was having mattered. It's refreshing to find a place that cares enough to do things right.
Thanks Dr. Dawson and everyone at TPMG.|Dr. Dawson is a bright and caring physician whose approach to patient care is compassionate and reassuring. I've been very satisfied with the treatment I have received from Dr. Dawson and his staff.|Dr Dawson is spot on. Thats a good thing. Julie, and Danielle are down to earth and very thorough. I'm not crazy about the 3 appointments it take to get the work finished out.
1. consultation- makes sense
2. Procedure necessary
3. The follow up. I feel like this could be done through the office secretary or nurse via phone. I don't object to the fee. I object to the 150 mile round trip to say what could be
handled  over a phone call. Obviously Dr Dawson is bomb, that's why I drive so far, but as long as there are no complications, I  don't think I should have to physically be on the scene for this to be done.
That's my 2 cents,
Cheryl England|Everyone was very welcoming and professional. The doc explained everything he was going to do and after treatment went over post treatment walking us through every step. If you need this treatment I definitely recommend this doctor!

column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Haymarket serves patients throughout Haymarket, Virginia and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services. Located within Novant's Heathcote Health Center, our facility offers comprehensive care for individuals suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians combines extensive clinical expertise with compassionate care to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs.

Our center is strategically positioned adjacent to the main Novant hospital, making it easily accessible for patients requiring multiple medical services. Visitors can reach our facility effortlessly via exit 40 from Route 66, with ample parking available for all patients. The center's location within the Heathcote Health Center creates a seamless healthcare experience for those requiring coordinated care across specialties.

Specialized Pain Management Services

At National Spine & Pain Centers - Haymarket, we offer advanced diagnostic and therapeutic interventions for various pain conditions, including:

  • Spinal pain management

  • Joint pain treatment

  • Nerve pain therapies

  • Minimally invasive procedures

  • Comprehensive rehabilitation approaches

Patient Comfort & Preparation

We prioritize patient comfort during every visit. Due to the cool indoor temperatures maintained in our office, we encourage patients to bring a sweater or light jacket to their appointments. This small preparation ensures a more comfortable experience while receiving care at our facility.

Contact Information & Location

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 703-738-4384. Our center is located at 15195 Heathcote Blvd #230, Haymarket, VA 20169. For additional information about our treatments and approach to pain management, visit our website at www.treatingpain.com/haymarket.
column11: Our center is located on Novant's Heathcote Health Center, adjacent to the main hospital, easily accessible off of exit 40 from route 66. There is ample parking available. We encourage our patients to bring a sweater or light jacket to their appointment due to cool indoor temperatures in our office.

column40:
DR.Patel is a great, kind and listens well to your needs. I had an appointment about 3 weeks ago. Something was going on in the office.  The staff had an attitude.  The black lady the usually checks you in was  salty. The last time I saw her she was so friendly and upbeat. Who ruined her day?
I saw the  NP after being told  I would be seeing the Dr when I confirmed my appointment.  Wow!! She didn't introduce herself,  never made eye contact.
I will never go back there again. Whomever it was that ruined the mood in the office  you should have stayed home.It's unfortunate because  I really liked Dr. Patel.|Talked to them on the phone, they checked my insurance, gave me an appointment, called and changed my appointment, then when I showed up, they told me they don't accept my insurance and wouldn't see me. lol. They told me to calm down if I wanted them to help me find alternatives. But I already know how to use Google.|Dr. Patel is a compassionate and professional doctor. He actually takes the time to listen, understand and work with his patients to find the best solutions.

The front desk is always kind and caring. They make it a pleasure to check in/out.|After seeing Dr Patel for extreme lower back pain for first 3 appointments I was reassigned to his Nurse Practitioner. She prescribed at least 6 different meds including 4 increasing dosages of fentanyl; none of which helped - this process took 5 months at which time she said there was absolutely nothing left they could do. Surgery wasn't possible. By chance I was advised to see orthopaedic surgeon which I did immediately. Had lumbar fusion done, which doctor said was routine, and 6 weeks later 99% of the pain was gone. He couldn't understand why it wasn't recommended by Dr Patel or NP.|I was able to call in the early morning and get an appointment at noon. They were very efficient so my wait was minimal. The PA discussion went well and we came up with something to try that will hopefully work for my pain.|Dr. Patel is wonderful.  Dr. Hiral is very kind and helpful.  Stacey is the best nurse I have ever worked with.  I had an issue with my insurance company and she went up and above to help me.  Totally stress free when Stacey got involved.|The staff at National Pain and Spine is phenomenal. The staff at the front desk are very friendly and professional and they make it easy to schedule appointments with a minimal wait time. The doctor and team provide excellent care and you always get treated like a VIP.  I highly recommend this practice to anyone looking to get out of pain and at the same time wants to be treated with care and compassion.  Love this office!|This is only a suggestion.  A young lady came up on the elevator withe me and I said something to her. She looked very sick and was very pale.  She said she has constant nausea. Anyway in the waiting room she had a bag to throw up in plus she was gagging looking uncomfortable.   I felt bad for her and the surrounding patients.  Since she must be a regular ongoing patient  -- that if her chart could be marked that when she checks in they can take her back and put her in a room. This would make for all involved a better comfortable scene.  Other patients were moving into other seats and I would say feeling trapped.    I'm sure she is an active patient because she was talking to the front desk employee  about her meds.   As I said above this is only a suggestion.  This would be good patient comforting care.
I was impressed with the new staff.   Conditions when I was there a year ago or so were not good.   Everything was excellent.

column2: National Spine and Pain Centers - Marina Protopapas, DO
column3:
National Spine and Pain Centers in Fairfax, Virginia serves patients seeking comprehensive pain management solutions through non-surgical approaches. Under the expert care of Dr. Marina Protopapas, DO, patients receive personalized treatment plans designed to address acute and chronic musculoskeletal and spinal pain conditions. The Fairfax location provides a welcoming environment where cutting-edge pain management techniques meet compassionate patient care.

Dr. Protopapas joined National Spine & Pain Centers in 2006, bringing an exceptionally skilled medical background to the practice. Her impressive credentials include specialized fellowships in Osteopathic Manipulative Medicine at the New York College of Osteopathic Medicine and Pain Management at Harvard Medical School-Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital. Additionally, Dr. Protopapas holds a degree in Clinical Acupuncture from Harvard Medical School, allowing her to incorporate diverse therapeutic approaches into her treatment protocols.

Expertise and Specialization

As a published author on various rehabilitation and pain management topics, Dr. Protopapas has established herself as a thought leader in the field. Her contributions to medical literature complement her role as a guest lecturer in Harvard's continuing medical education program. Dr. Protopapas specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of acute and chronic musculoskeletal and spinal pain, utilizing a range of sophisticated, non-surgical treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Location and Contact Information

National Spine and Pain Centers' Fairfax location is conveniently situated at 3620 Joseph Siewick Dr #101, Fairfax, VA 22033. Patients seeking consultations or appointments can contact the center directly at +1 571-512-7000. For additional information about services offered and treatment options, visit their comprehensive website at www.treatingpain.com.

Dr. Protopapas also holds a degree in Clinical Acupuncture from Harvard Medical School. A published author on various rehabilitation and pain management topics, Dr. Protopapas has also served as a guest lecturer in Harvard's continuing medical education program. Specializing in the diagnosis and treatment of acute and chronic musculoskeletal and spinal pain, she uses a range of sophisticated, non-surgical treatme...

column38: Stefan Schwarz|RR|Khalil najmyar|Stephanie Moseman|Harry Rogowitz|Deborah Ricks|Sabrina McClain|Don Rosenberger
column40:
Outstanding practice! I've been coming to this practice for over two years, and they have been a lifesaver in many ways.  I've seen Salil quite a bit in 2024 after having major back surgeries and complications related to it. I've seen him or Dr. Protopapas more than 20 times in 2024 and 10 times in 2023. They are as good if they are better than advertised.

Dr. P is outstanding! The staff is excellent, and even though others have indicated in the reviews that it is nearly impossible to get them on the phone, it has gotten tremendously better.

Once you have appointments and have been in the practice for a while, it is easier than making the initial appointment. I did have a little help initially, as my referring doctor was close to Dr. P and her staff and was able to connect me more easily.

I'm thrilled with my progress since my initial visit, designed to help lengthen the time before needing back surgery. Based on what I saw from the initial appointments, nothing has changed, and the practice has been outstanding. The pain I experienced before seeing Dr. P has significantly dissipated, and I did not need to see Dr. P again after those November 2022 epidurals.

I highly recommend a visit here if you are in pain and looking for an alternative to surgery. Salil and Dr. P are outstanding in their work. The supporting office staff and techs, like Joseph, are exceptional in assisting Dr. P with her fluoroscopic epidural injections.|A few years ago, with chronic back pain and just low-grade shots offered by a Doctor from a large Group Practice, my chiro sent a referral to see Dr Protopapas and it was one of the best referrals to a Doctor I have ever received. Dr P and her staff are very accommodating and professional. She has an amazing reputation from her peers (as I found out later). Its not easy getting in to see her given how in demand she is but you first get in to see an Assistant and then if needed, you are scheduled in for anyone of several treatments after Imaging is provided. I still remember after my first imaging; she saw something I needed to check out with my PCP and I did.

Getting injections/treatments from her is as good an experience one can hope for given the circumstances. Her nurses (male and female) are very patient and prep you well answering questions. Dr P will also visit and explain/ask questions. Then she very patiently will proceed always asking how you are feeling and letting you know what is about to come (tip look away from the needles). Then when you are finished you are provided instructions and not allowed to leave unless you are feeling up to it.

Her current assistant Chris is awesome to deal with and very patient. He has really helped me out with procedures, prescriptions and medical advice.

The Front Office is great with Ana and I believe Greg the Manager who can also act as a nurse for procedures.

Located near Fair Oaks Hospital with great parking. Worth the drive from Ashburn to Fairfax.

Another tip. If you need PT, ask Dr P for a recommendation. She gave me one and my therapist is awesome.

Dr P's reports are very complete and other Doctors can quickly follow exactly want was done.

Strong recommendation for Dr P and her staff. They ROCK!!!!|Dr. Marina Protopapas has been my physician for 10+ years.
She and her Medical assistant Joseph and her receptionist Ms Rachna Gupta are delightful.
I have excellent experience at her clinic.
I trust her to provide me with the best medical care for my current condition.
I would highly recommend her because of her medical knowledge.|Dr. Protopapas was nothing short of amazing! Her and the support staff were there for me every step of the way for a procedure I needed done. She made sure I was well informed and comfortable throughout the entire process. If you want a doctor to sugarcoat it for you, don't go here. They are straight up, and I am truly grateful for it!|Dr. P. Is a wonderful abd caring Dr.  I have had epidurals from her.  She walks you through every thing she is doing through the procedure.  Always checking how you are doing.  I am very thankful the PA  Amber at Dr. Silveri's office referred her to me.  Her NP Chris, is great.  Like Dr. P, he truly listens to you.
The staff in the front office is wonderful too.  I could not be more happy with everyone there.|My significant other and I were treated by Dr. P a few years ago. Immediately, we noticed significant improvement even before we left the office. Dr. P was very professional, while at the same time very personable. We felt very at ease with her and trusted her judgment in our treatment. Yes, the wait time is frustrating but well worth the wait. I would endure the wait again just to see her and receive treatment from her.|Dr. Protopappas is great...when you can get her. My first appointment was with her, but subsequent appointments were with a PA. I didn't mind that, though it seemed odd I didn't see the doctor again. When a new problem flared up about a year later, I made an appointment with Dr. Protopappas specifically, but again, I didn't see her, I only saw the PA. That was a little frustrating for me, because I wanted Dr. P's insight, specifically. But the PA was extremely competent and helpful, as were the staff. Just know that you may not have an appointment with the doctor you schedule with.|Dr. Protopapas has been wonderful for helping to treat my lumbar and cervical spine problems.   I have read a lot of comments about how long it takes to get an appointment, there is a reason for that.  She is Excellent at what she does!

column2: National Spine and Pain Centers - Ramatia Mahboobi, MD
column3:
National Spine and Pain Centers in Alexandria, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Ramatia Mahboobi, MD. Serving patients throughout the Northern Virginia region, this specialized medical practice focuses on interventional treatments and personalized care plans to address chronic and acute pain conditions. The Alexandria location provides a convenient setting for patients seeking relief from back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, and other debilitating conditions.

Dr. Mahboobi joined National Spine & Pain Centers in February 2013, bringing with him extensive training and international experience. His medical journey began at Tehran University of Medical Sciences in Iran, where he earned his medical degree and established the foundation of his professional career. In 2005, Dr. Mahboobi relocated to the United States to expand his expertise in pain medicine, both scientifically and clinically.

His distinguished training includes a research fellowship in the division of Anesthesiology and Pain Management at the Cleveland Clinic in Ohio—one of the nation's most prestigious and busiest pain clinics. Dr. Mahboobi subsequently completed his Anesthesiology residency and advanced fellowship training in Interventional Pain Management at the same institution, developing specialized skills in minimally invasive pain relief techniques.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

At National Spine and Pain Centers, patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. The practice offers a wide range of treatments including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Joint injections

  • Medication management

Dr. Mahboobi remains committed to continuing education, staying at the forefront of advancements in pain medicine to provide his patients with the most effective and innovative treatment options available.

Visit National Spine and Pain Centers

The Alexandria office is conveniently located at 6355 Walker Lane, Suite 507, Alexandria, VA 22310. Patients seeking consultation or treatment can contact the office directly at (703) 738-4332 to schedule an appointment. For more information about services and treatment options, visit their website at www.treatingpain.com.
column11: Dr. Mahboobi joined National Spine & Pain Centers in February, 2013. He earned his medical degree at Tehran University of Medical Sciences in Iran, where he launched his professional career. He migrated to the United States in 2005 to further his training and develop a broader understanding of the science and clinical aspects of pain medicine. He successfully completed a prestigious research fellowship in the division of Anesthesiology and Pain Management at the Cleveland Clinic in Ohio, one of the nation's busiest and most prominent pain clinics, where he subsequently completed his Anesthesiology residency and advanced fellowship training in Interventional Pain Management. An advocate for continuing education, Dr. Mahboobi dedicates con...

column40:
Doctor Mahboobi is truly exceptional! I came to him with severe back and nerve pain, convinced I would need surgery, but his treatment worked wonders and completely healed my back. His injections were smooth, pain-free, and delivered remarkable results.
He genuinely cares about his patients and offers thoughtful, practical advice that has been instrumental in my recovery. Thanks to his expertise and guidance, I'm now pain-free without needing surgery.
I highly recommend him -- he's a skilled, compassionate, and outstanding professional in his field!|Dr. Mahboobi and his team are outstanding! His expertise in pain management is evident from the very first visit, as he takes the time to truly listen and understand the patient's needs. Dr. Mahboobi combines top-notch skill with a friendly, approachable demeanor that immediately puts you at ease. Thanks to his care, my back pain has fully resolved, and I'm now able to return to daily activities without discomfort. The staff is equally amazing--professional, warm, and always willing to help with any questions or concerns. I highly recommend Dr. Mahboobi and his team to anyone in need of pain relief and quality care!|The best of the best doctors I have seen. The took away my sciatica pain with one injection I highly recommend him.|Dr. Mahboobi is the best in spinal care and pain management. I had previously had epidurals for lumbar disc pain from a couple other doctors with pain at the time of injection. When I found Dr. Mahboobi, that was it. I never wanted any other doctor to perform this procedure on me. I know he's amazing because I've just had an epidural without local anesthesia. It hurt like all get out but it was less painful than the other doctors. He's the most skillful of them all. I still wouldn't recommend getting this without local anaesthesia though. I'm able to withstand pain when others would scream and/or pass out.|Dr. Mahoobi is my go to for relief from nerve pain in my lower back and neck.  Between Dr. Mahoobi and his partner in managing pain, Dr. Abraham Cherrick, I have been able to avoid surgeries and use only lower dose pain medications as needed.  The team at National Spine and Pain know and understand pain relief and there is no one better at intervention nerve pain management than Dr. Mahoobi.  His smooth touch, precise placement, and efficiency get me in and out in minimal time with very little discomfort during the procedure.|Dr. Mahboobi cured my pain!!!  I had terrible pain down my leg (meralgia parathetica) and was on a high dose of gabapentin that caused me to gain weight and I was still in pain.  Dr. Mahboobi cured me with two shots into the nerve and I am pain free.  He was very professional, on time and explained the procedure on the ultrasound machine as he did it in a way I could understand.  I highly recommend Dr. Mahboobi!|Dr. Mahboobi did great, and professional procedure to my wife, in order to heal her back pain.
I am highly thankful to God, Dr Mahboobi, and to Dr Cherrick for referring her to such a great Dr.
I also thankful to his nurse Ami for caring, and preparing his patients to do the procedure professionally.|Dr. Mahboobi literally unfroze my frozen shoulder.  I read that it would take a year to thaw but Dr. Mahboobi did a shot into the shoulder joint and thawed it right out which allowed me to do my physical exercises.  He is very professional, friendly, timely and excellent.  Highly recommend him specifically.

column2: Dr. Murray E. Joiner Jr, MD
column3:
Dr. Murray E. Joiner Jr, MD serves patients throughout Roanoke, Virginia and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management care. As a dedicated physician at Virginia Pain Specialists, Dr. Joiner combines his extensive medical expertise with a compassionate approach to help patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. His practice focuses on developing personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each individual, utilizing both innovative and traditional pain management techniques.

At his Roanoke office, Dr. Joiner offers a wide range of interventional pain management procedures and medical treatments designed to improve quality of life for those suffering from acute and chronic pain. His evidence-based approach incorporates the latest advancements in pain medicine while maintaining a focus on minimally invasive techniques whenever possible. Patients appreciate his thorough evaluations and commitment to finding effective solutions for complex pain conditions.

Practice Location and Accessibility

Dr. Joiner's practice is conveniently located at 2726 Electric Rd Suite #203, Roanoke, VA 24018, making it easily accessible for patients throughout the Roanoke Valley. The modern facility offers a comfortable environment where patients can discuss their pain concerns and receive specialized care. New and returning patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 540-772-4448 during regular business hours.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Joiner's practice is his dedication to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. He takes time to explain pain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach has earned him positive reviews from patients who value his expertise and caring demeanor.

For more information about Dr. Joiner's services or to explore treatment options, patients are encouraged to visit the practice website at https://www.virginiapain.org/ where they can find detailed information about conditions treated, available procedures, and patient resources.

My suggestion and made the call|Dr Joiner and his team have taking care of me for many years when other physicians told me there was nothing left to do!
