column40:
Dr Ton is a skilled professional and is compassionate. I felt genuinely cared for during my visits. His entire staff are friendly and attentive and go the extra mile to make you feel comfortable.|Enjoyed both the doctor and the staff. Very professional, and friendly staff. Doctor was very thorough and explained everything to me. Quick response for all of my questions. I would recommend Dr Ton to any of my family or friends.|Dr. Ton is absolutely amazing!!  He is truly a genius in every physical aspect.  I have seen him twice for epidural injections in my back.  He explained everything to me in full detail and I can finally walk, bend, lift a little at a time and progressively getting so much better.  Not only is he amazing, his nurses and office staff are SO FRIENDLY.  I highly recommend him for any pain you have!!!  Thank you Dr. Ton and your incredibly awesome staff!!|Dr. Ton and his team at SVBGH Pain Management Center are wonderful.  Dr. Ton has been caring and compassionate at every visit.  He fully explained everything he was doing and why.  I was quite anxious before my ESI procedure and Dr. Ton did his best to reassure me throughout.  I would highly recommend without reservation.|I am needle phobic so epidurals are traumatic for me for my spinal stenosis.  The staff are understanding and compassionate and Dr Ton is fantastic.  Professional yet extremely compassionate and his calming demeanor has me at ease each time.  He takes the time to explain each step of the process and talks to me to calm me down.  I've never left his office feeling demeaned for my phobia.  Thanks Dr Ton and staff for all you've down to ease my pain.  Highly recommend Dr Ton for epidurals.|I was in the building for an appt with a neurosurgeon but I was in extreme pain.  They reached out to Dr.Ton"s office, he told them to send me down to office he could fit me in.  That is rare these days!

I was seen immediately and after talking to Dr.Ton he immediately had his staff working on getting my procedure approved by my insurance.  I was given a next day appt for an epidural inject for herniated disc/sciatic.  The next day I was in and out quickly.  Dr.Ton and his staff are amazing.|The experiences with Dr. Ton were caring and professional - a great combination that you don't see much of today. His staff was knowledgeable about what they were doing. Dr. Ton came in and asked how I was doing, and not just physically. He's concerned about your overall health. He took to time to explain everything, showed me my MRI's and exactly where the problems were. Then he explained some of my options, not just for today's visit but for future options as well. He is well trained and professional and knows how to put your mind and body at ease.|I was basically being referred to one surgeon after another, without them even looking at my MRI. The last Dr. sent me to Dr. Ton and immediately confirmed exactly why the E.R. sent me straight to a surgeon. When he showed me the MRI and seeing the herniated disc I was shocked. I had been in so much pain, cramping and muscle spasms for weeks. Dr. Ton gave me epidural injections right then. I love the staff. They made it so easy to relax in spite of the pain and how miserable I was. I'm on my second round of shots now and PT. Praying for the best!
I would not hesitate to refer anyone to see him.

Chesapeake Bay Pain Medicine serves Virginia Beach, VA and the surrounding Hampton Roads area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving quality of life through minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and innovative therapies that address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

At Chesapeake Bay Pain Medicine, we offer a wide range of treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and medication management protocols. Our team excels in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome, arthritis, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is developed with careful consideration of the patient's medical history, lifestyle factors, and long-term wellness goals.

Patient-Centered Approach

We pride ourselves on creating a supportive environment where patients feel heard and respected. Our staff takes the time to thoroughly explain conditions and treatment options, ensuring patients can make informed decisions about their care. column40:
Dr. Varma is the most experienced, compassionate and knowledgeable physician I've ever been seen by. I just noticed now as I was leaving a review for another doctor they my review never went through for Dr. Varma. I am a military dependent and her office staff couldn't have made the process easier working with Tricare Prime and making sure that everything was always covered. The saddest part of leaving the DMV was that I could no longer see Dr. Varma. She by far helped me with multiple pain issues, more than any other physician I've encountered. I can only give her 5 stars on here but really if I could I'd give her 100 out of 100 stars as she helped me be able to do simple things again like take my kids to the park and hug them without being in horrific pain. Thank you Dr. Varma and everyone in your office. You are all amazing!|I love Dr Varma and have been coming to her for years. She has taken time to listen and create a treatment plan that works for me. The staff is friendly and the office has a family feel.|I had an outstanding experience at dominion spine and pain. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a warm, welcoming atmosphere. The front desk staff were incredibly friendly, efficient, and helpful with scheduling and any questions I had.

Dr. Varma is an exceptional professional--knowledgeable, compassionate, and thorough. They took the time to listen to my concerns, explain everything in detail, and ensure I was comfortable throughout the entire process. The care I received was top-notch, and I felt genuinely supported in every aspect of my visit.

The office itself is clean, modern, and well-organized, which made the experience even more pleasant. I've never felt more confident in the quality of care provided by a medical office. I highly recommend Dr. Varma to anyone seeking excellent healthcare with a great staff.|If I could give a 5 star for the Dr.'s employees, I would. They are the ones keeping this office going. God bless them for the hours they work. Seriously love you all. The actual Dr. Varma, she's very nice when you first meet with her but after that, forget seeing her. She has Nps do the hard work and they report back to her to brief her, and come back in the room. They don't even have any NP responsibilities as far as working on their own. Couldn't you have a Registered Nurse do what they're doing? I mean the prescription isn't even written by the NP that did the appointment/ examination.... So how is that legal? I think any if not all of us would prefer the doctor performing these surgeries/procedures that we are put to sleep for, speak to us and go over the procedure thoroughly before we trust her to perform a procedure that has risks associated.... Maybe I'm wrong.  just so disappointed, on the hunt for a doctor that cares about his or her patients and not just the employees of the Dr.|I started coming to Dr. Varma over a year ago and in intense pain, she listened, asked questions sent me for x-rays to make sure she treated me accurately. Today I walk with a pep in my step and a smile on my face ~ she has made my ability to move about, a happy occasion.

Lastly, she has the most wonderful "bedside" manner I've experienced, not to mention that her staff are always caring and friendly; I've ALWAYS been treated respectfully and if I really matter.|I have been a patient at this clinic for over three years, receiving treatment for cervical and lumbar spine injuries. Under the expert care of Dr. Varma, I have experienced significant recovery and improvement in my condition. Dr. Varma's extensive experience and compassionate demeanor have been invaluable to my treatment.

The clinic's staff have consistently demonstrated exceptional cooperation, kindness, and professionalism, making me feel confident and at ease throughout my care.

My experience at this clinic has been transformative, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking exceptional medical care. Dr. Varma and the entire staff are truly dedicated to delivering top-notch treatment with empathy and understanding.|Dr. Varma is amazing. She is very responsive to patient needs and - most importantly - listens. The whole team is extremely friendly and is willing to work to schedule the right time for you. Good choice of locations and hours. I can't recommend this practice enough.|I had horrible pain after a bad fall in July. I came to Dr. Varma's practice for aid to ease my symptoms. Due to work relocation, I had to sadly leave from this office as I could not commute and I recommend this office to any new patient!

Dr. Varma is an expert in treatment of all things pain and is very knowledgeable. From making an appointment, to the check in process, to the appointment, I felt heard and taken care of very well.
I would recommend Dominion Spine and Pain to anyone!

column3:
Blue Ridge Chronic Pain Center, located in Forest, Virginia, is a specialized medical practice dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Rick D. Lee, MD, our center takes a multifaceted approach to pain treatment, combining traditional medical interventions with innovative therapies to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce suffering.

At Blue Ridge Chronic Pain Center, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. Our treatment protocols are individually tailored to address each patient's unique pain profile through three primary treatment modalities:

  • Medication Management: Carefully prescribed and monitored pharmaceutical interventions to control pain and improve function

  • Interventional Pain Management: Minimally invasive procedures designed to target pain at its source

  • Natural Pain Treatments: Alternative therapies and holistic approaches that complement traditional medical care

Expert Medical Care

Dr. Lee brings extensive experience in pain medicine to every patient consultation. Our practice emphasizes building long-term relationships with patients, focusing on both immediate pain relief and sustainable management strategies. We work closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of a patient's health.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and involvement in their treatment plans. Our team takes the time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, helping patients make informed decisions about their care journey.

Visit Our Practice

Blue Ridge Chronic Pain Center welcomes new patients at our convenient Forest location. Contact us to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.

Address: 16830 Forest Rd, Forest, VA 24551, United States

Phone: +1 434-515-2775

Website: www.blueridgechronicpaincenter.com

column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Shirlington serves Arlington, VA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located at 2800 Shirlington Rd Suite 102 in Arlington, this center is part of one of the nation's largest networks dedicated to treating chronic pain conditions. The Shirlington location provides patients throughout Northern Virginia access to board-certified specialists who utilize the latest evidence-based treatments and minimally invasive procedures to address various pain disorders.

As part of the extensive National Spine & Pain Centers network, the Shirlington facility offers specialized care for conditions including back and neck pain, sciatica, arthritis, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Their multidisciplinary approach combines interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies to create personalized treatment plans that focus on improving function and quality of life.

Part of a Growing National Network

Established through the rebranding of The Spine Center in 2011, National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) has experienced significant growth, particularly after merging with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012. The organization further expanded with the addition of New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians) later that year. Today, NSPC operates more than 60 centers with approximately 100 providers across seven states including D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia.

Patient-Centered Approach

The Shirlington center embodies NSPC's commitment to bringing together highly qualified pain management specialists to address the needs of the growing population of chronic pain sufferers. Their team works collaboratively to develop customized treatment strategies that minimize reliance on opioids while maximizing pain relief and functional improvement.

For consultations or appointments, patients can contact National Spine & Pain Centers - Shirlington directly at (703) 738-4336 or visit their website at www.treatingpain.com/arlington.

column40:
Worst run Dr's office I have ever been to in the 15 years I have been in pain management. I'm supposed to see Dr B, not the PA, within 6 months of being a patient and was only scheduled after I demanded it (approx 10 months) and said I was considering someplace else.  Then, when I finally just met her at my last appt, she said I should never have been a patient because Trigeminal Neuralgia was not her 'wheelhouse'.
Also,  while most of the staff  is pleasant, those in senior office positions are not. The office manager is defensive, rude, and unsympathetic which I, think, may just be a front for a lack of knowledge.
Seriously,  I would avoid if possible.|I had an orthopedic appointment in July 2024 and was sent for spinal injections. (This review was posted in January.) Since I have to tackle I95 and it took much longer than it should have to get there, I went to the Spine Institute the same day and paid out of pocket from my HSA for my injections (not a small amount!). I knew it would take 4-6 weeks for a reimbursement once my insurance covered it because I asked before I agreed to it. It's been over six months now and I STILL haven't received my reimbursement. Each time I've called, I've been told only that it is in process.

Late February update: Around five weeks  ago, shortly after I posted the review, a response was posted. As requested, I reached out to the office explain the situation. A few days later, I got an email that a reimbursement had been filed again. I waited one...two...three...four weeks, and no check came. I thought maybe it had gone back to the original method of payment, so I logged into my account. No again. So here I am, about to enter the last week of February, still waiting for my money back for service that the practice has been paid double for at this point. I can understand waiting until the end of the quarter for bookkeeping purposes, but I can think of no reasonable explanation for a delay this long, especially when I've called at least four times.|This is the worst "medical facility" I have ever been to. The staff is very rude at the reception desk, with the exception of one person. Dr. Butampani cares nothing about patients! When I was finally "allowed" to see her after two years, she came across as bombastic and arrogant. I was forced to yell back at her because she wanted to lie and get her point across about an invasive and risky procedure she was trying to push on me! I had to stand up and tell her she was "very combative."  I have never had to yell back at a doctor because no doctor has ever felt they could yell at me! Yes, I have an opinion, and I do my research. She came across as a "big bully" type who cares more about making money on procedures. Dr. Butampani was very flip, condescending, and obnoxious in Dec 2024. She was somewhat more contained Jan 28, 2025, because I took someone with me, knowing I was never returning to this place. It is your right to have someone present, without question, anyone reading this review. It is not okay for a medical practice to stress you out or lie to you or to question your genuine concerns about safety. All of the poor reviews I have read about this office staff and/or Dr. Butampani are TRUE! I have lived them! Dr. Butampani lied about the success rate of the procedure she was pushing on me and shrugged her shoulders last month and Jan 28, 2025, when I mentioned very serious risks! She is incompetant as a doctor, in my opinion! Her staff is emboldened by her,  who seemingly relishes conflict! I saw medical incompetence and ethical challenges in their worst forms! Dr. Budampati has zero empathy and a horrible bedside manor. I even questioned her credentials after we finally met because of her behavior. Upon leaving on Jan 28, the rudest of the desk persons violated HIPAA when she abruptly gave the person I was with my confidential medical documents, in which I requested copies before the appointment began. Passing my personal information off was that employees way of being dismissive, as usual. She saw that I was coming to their reception area. There may be other locations with better doctors and staff outside of this Shirlington/Arlington location. I will not be returning! All the best!|I went to this office for 4 years. I thought at the time they were doing a good job, but have since learned that they are lazy and don't give a crap about healing anyone. They misdiagnosed my torn labrum in my shoulder as frozen shoulder and the resulting PT made the problem worse as they were treating the wrong thing. I now have constant pain and limited mobility in my shoulder. For my back, I had been treated for pain management using drugs and quarterly steroid injections. As my back deteriorated (DDD) I asked if they could refer me to a surgeon, and was told that a surgeon could do nothing for me so don't bother. Well, guess what? I had a  successful lumbar fusion 5 months ago and was told by my surgeon that I was the 'perfect candidate' for this surgery. I wasted years of my life trusting this practice. The front office was always great, but Budampati, and the two PAs I saw regularly, lied to me and never really listened. I was in there monthly for 4 years. It's not like they didn't have the time to get to know my situation.|It's hard to function when you're in such pain and sometimes they wait too long to treat you.  Also hey don't prescribe effective medicine  to help relieve pain until you can be seen.  Be prepared for intense pain during treatment like injections to the nerve- wicked!  Need to be under to make it through the procedures.|Dr. Budampati and entire staff are professional, thorough and understanding!
I highly recommend this Office location in Arlington.|On Friday, July 26th I had an appointment with Dr. Butampani. Reported in fifteen minutes early, waited another thirty minutes and, when it looked like I wasn't going to see the doctor very soon, I re-scheduled.

Second appointment on July 30th was on time and without incident.|I was seen once. 30 days later the Dr called in sick 2 hours before my appointment while I was on Amtrak going to Fredericksburg VA. 2 years later, I get a bill for $760! I paid for my 1st visit so I guess somebody decided to fraudulently bill me for 2 office visits I never had. This place is ripping people off. Beware!

column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Manassas serves patients throughout Manassas, Virginia and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. As part of one of the nation's largest pain management practices, our Manassas location delivers specialized care for individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians combines advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment approaches to address a wide range of pain-related issues.

At our Sudley Road location, we offer personalized treatment plans designed to reduce pain, improve function, and enhance quality of life. Our specialists utilize the latest evidence-based interventions, including minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies to provide relief for conditions such as back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome.

Part of a Growing National Network

National Spine & Pain Centers was formed in 2011 through the rebranding of The Spine Center and has experienced significant growth since then. In 2012, NSPC partnered with Capitol Spine & Pain and later expanded to include New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians). Today, our network encompasses over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers across seven states including D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia.

Visit Our Manassas Location

Our Manassas center is conveniently located at 8644 Sudley Rd, Suite 117, Manassas, VA 20110. To schedule a consultation with one of our pain management specialists, call us at (703) 738-4375. Our dedicated team is committed to helping you find effective solutions for your chronic pain conditions and improving your overall quality of life.

Learn more about our services and approach to pain management by visiting our website at www.treatingpain.com/manassas.

column40:
I have been seeing Meredith Overstreet and Dr. Hassassian for a while now, and they've been nothing but helpful! Their billing is not the best- there have been times where they would bill me for things that they never submitted to my insurance and then threaten to send me to collections because I told them I would only pay for what my insurance didn't cover. Eventually they would catch up with themselves, but you can tell their billing could use some improvement.|Meredith Overstreet and Dr. Hassasian are great. Meredith is thorough, listens to concerns, answers questions, helps prioritize care time lines. Dr. Hassassian does the in-office injections and procedures. He talks yoy through them so you know what's going on and makes sure you're okay during the injection/procedure. The nurses and front office staff are amazing. This practice makes you feel like an individual person and not just a numbered patient on their schedule.|I,  monthly visit the center.  I absolutely adore MONICA.  She is the receptionist. She is efficient, well-organized, and charming. She brings continuity to the office.  I also love my nurse practitioner, MEREDITH..  She gives me good solutions to particular areas of my body that need help. I consider her my friend.  The rest of the staff are very nice and respectful.  The appointments are usually very quick.  I would say around 20 to 30 minutes which includes check-in, filling out your current pain status and reviewing your meds, seeing your nurse practitioner, and making another appointment.|These people are the WORST! The only time I've been treated even close to this baldly was when I was assaulted by a VA Dr! Not good for the medical component of the complex PTSD I've been diagnosed with.

They had failed to provide the referral a when the Dr said and even wrote on the referral it was time sensitive. When asked, they either hung up the phone or left me on hold until I had to attend to other responsibilities. I was hung up on 4 times today alone! They claimed I yelled at them, for the record, I did NOT yell at the staff. Then their corporate representative instructed me not to call the office after my multiple emails over months had all been ignored leaving me no other option but to call?!

All this is after the Dr lied to me during the 1st visit putting my career in jeopardy, and the NP was so rude on my 2nd visit she would neither let me answer her questions nor ask a question of my own.

All this has worsened my condition and increased the pain, anxiety, and PTSD.

Absolutely unacceptable!

If you value your heath, go anywhere else!

...unreal.|Excellent service.  Meredith listens and works cooperatively with me to find solutions.|This was my first time going to this location. I usually went to the Arlington location and then moved to Manassas. I cannot think of one bad thing about this practice. The front desk and nurses are very kind and respectful. Overall they seem happy to be doing their jobs! The doctor I met with had great bed side manners and was knowledgeable about all topics related to my issue. He was very direct and to the point, and set up a plan to figure out what is going on with my back. I highly recommend this location to anyone who is seeking help to manage or relieve their pain.|I had only one provider at the office that I felt listened to me and tried all that she could that was Merridith. The very last visit to the office I was seen by another PA she was extremely rude. I was having tremendous difficulty and as I was talking and explaining things to her she literally stood up and said I need to go to my next patient. We discussed no solutions, I was given no guidance she literally just walked out. So I asked my pcp to take over management of my neuropathy medication. Since I am now having EXTREME pain issues I need to schedule an appointment but I don't know where to schedule that I will feel heard and that they are trying to help.|Great and fantastic Manassas's treatment. The staff are welcoming and treat you like a person rather than a patient. You are treated Will and cared for as an individual, where everything is explained to you with easy of understanding with all procedures from beginning to end.
The main communication center is however very miss directional, and have a robot response and often are not fully listening to you're needs which cause excessive waiting on the line.

Derrick Wagoner D.O. serves Virginia Beach, VA and the surrounding Hampton Roads area with exceptional pain management services. As a board-certified physician specializing in interventional pain medicine, Dr. Wagoner combines his extensive medical expertise with a compassionate approach to help patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. His practice at Gershon Pain Specialists has become a trusted destination for those seeking effective, personalized pain management solutions in the Tidewater region.

At his Virginia Beach location, Dr. Wagoner offers a wide range of advanced pain management treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. His approach integrates cutting-edge interventional procedures with holistic pain management strategies, addressing conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Dr. Wagoner's practice emphasizes minimally invasive techniques that promote faster recovery and improved quality of life.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Wagoner's practice is his dedication to patient education and collaborative care. He takes time to thoroughly explain diagnoses and treatment options, ensuring patients are active participants in their pain management journey. His office at 1133 First Colonial Rd provides a comfortable, supportive environment where patients receive individualized attention and comprehensive care plans designed for long-term pain relief.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Derrick Wagoner, patients can call +1 757-496-2050 or visit the practice website at http://www.gershonpain.com/. The office is conveniently located at 1133 First Colonial Rd, Virginia Beach, VA 23454, with accessible parking and accommodations for patients with mobility challenges. New patients are welcome, and the practice works with most major insurance providers to ensure accessible care for the Virginia Beach community.

column40:
I just wanna give a shout out to Dr Wagoner for performing my cervical injection treatment. I am grateful for his God guided hands. He was very gentle and he made sure that he told me every step that he was doing. I'm also appreciative of his assistant, Lisa. She was very helpful and very accommodating. They set up the atmosphere of peace in such a way eases off  any nervousness .|I was totally impressed with Dr. Wagoner. Although he squeezed me into an already full schedule, he didn't make me feel rushed. He took the time to thoroughly explain the procedure and encouraged me to ask any questions I might have. During the procedure, he could sense the pain I was experiencing and asked if it would help to take breaks during the injection. He didn't rush me through it.
I didnt leave a review right away because I wanted to be able to evaluate how effective the injection was. And now I can honestly say Dr. Wagoner did an excellent job. It was like magic. And so far, 3 1/2 weeks later, it's still helping!! It was well worth the temporary pain. (Which BTW was not the doctor's fault. Just want to make that point clear. And, I'm not doctor but I believe that the worse your condition is, the more pain the injection causes. Again, it's only temporary and well worth it in the long run!!)
Thank you Dr. Wagoner!!|Dr. Wagoner and his staff are top notch! He took his time and explained and answered all questions before and after procedure.
Had injection yesterday and already feel better after a year of back pain.
Highly recommend!|Dr. Wagoner was very nice and professional. The procedure went really well. I was very nervous and he reassured me everything will be ok. His assistants were great too. Talked to me the whole time during the procedure. My back feels better already. Thank You ! :) 5+ stars!!!!!
Karen Bertolino|Everyone at this practice must love working there because they were all extremely pleasant and professional. Dr Wagoner explained the procedure clearly and he and his staff made me very comfortable throughout the process. Highly recommend.|Had my first C spine injection today.  Dr. Wagoner was attentive--listening to the details of my neuropathy and pain. Fully explained his procedure and then it effortlessly and quick.  I was in and out of the office in 20 minutes.  I'm already starting to feel better just 6 hours later.|Dr Wagoner was patient and answered all my questions.  He was very professional and explained to me what to expect.  His staff who helped me get ready for CESI shot were very friendly as well and tried to make me comfortable.|Dr. Wagoner was so kind and took time to explain my issues and how he planned to proceed with my treatment. Lisa stood near me to keep me calm and talk with me during the procedure. I would definitely recommend them.

Blossom Pain Management in Chesapeake, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Hampton Roads. Our specialized medical practice combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions that impact daily functioning and quality of life. Led by board-certified physicians, our team utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques and personalized treatment plans to target the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Blossom Pain Management, we provide a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. Our specialists are experienced in treating various conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, medical history, and personal goals.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our modern clinic at 801 Greenbrier Parkway, Suite B in Chesapeake is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. The comfortable, welcoming environment is designed to put patients at ease during their visits. Conveniently located near major highways, our facility is accessible to patients throughout Virginia Beach, Norfolk, Suffolk, and surrounding communities.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing meaningful partnerships with our patients through clear communication and education. Our team takes the time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach has helped countless individuals regain function and improve their quality of life.

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, call us at (757) 819-7547 or visit our website at https://blossompainmanagement.com/. Our dedicated staff is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain relief and improved well-being.

column40:
I have been seeing Dr Zhitar for Almost 2 years.  I am very happy with the care I am receiving.  He listens to me when I tell him something isn't working and so far has had something different to offer if what I am using isn't working.  I like the Zoom visits  as they happen right on time and are short and sweet if not much going on with my pain, but a little longer if need be.  I also like Dr Shimcus.  Love the office staff!  Life is livabel  again.|I absolutely love Dr. Z... he is wonderful and compassionate. The low review is related to the office staff. I have tried and tried to reach them. I have called at least every other day at different times and NO one answers even if you leave a message. I got someone yesterday who quickly hung up on me before I could explain something.  I'm trying to make a payment which now I will not pay since each visit I tell them I'm going to pay and I'm told oh we can get later so now I owe a lot. Hours of operation listed on website and voicemail are not correct. I work in a medical facility and this is totally unacceptable|Dr. Shimkus always treated me in a caring, and concerned manner.  She always shared advice on my concerns and new and alternative ways to treat my pain.  I felt that she was supportive and easy to talk to.|The doctors are great, and listen to you about what is working and what is not and they get you on a med that does the job.

I have been having the worst luck with pharmacies-- they get my script wrong and all kinds of mistakes. I have switched pharmacies 4 times because they drive me crazy. I am very laid back, but I have called corporate on CVS and Rite Aid. Anyway, Blossom has dropped what they are doing and immediately call and straighten out whenever the pharmacy has screwed up something.  I am writing this while they straighten out something Rite Aid has screwed up AGAIN.

If you have been to any pain management docs, you know that they can be worse than the pharmacy about being responsive. (EVMS was the worst!) Blossom is such a god-send!!|Great experience with Blossom pain management and staff and I love my Dr. Shimkus! We sat down had a serious discussion about what's going on and my situation. She actually listened to everything I had to say, treated me like a patient instead of a person. She is also very professional and so is the front desk (staff). I got referred here through my surgeon and now I can actually go back to work as a landscaper thanks to them. 5 stars all day !! Looking forward to a brighter future Thank God an thanks to Blossom|I moved to Virginia from Florida with a workers comp case. Usually you don't get quality care. I have seen some doctors through this case that I would never recommend.
Since I was referred here at Blossom Pain Management it has been great. I see Dr Jeanette Shimkus, who is really great doctor. She listens to your needs, makes eye contact, really checks your lungs and heart and she assesses you every visit. Dr. Shimkus explains all your information in details and makes sure you understand.
Very calming office and great staff. They are always polite and ready to help. They try to fit you in as soon as possible. I would highly recommend this office to anyone. You get one on one care.
Thank you Dr. Shimkus and staff. Keep up the great work.|This office and all of its staff are amazing! When I couldn't get into other places for as long as 2 months, Dr. Shimkus and her staff were able to get me in with in a couple of days. And I cannot put into words how good of a physician Dr. Shimkus is! She was very knowledgeable, informative, straight laced and straightforward. She did not beat around the bush and let klme know she would do what she could to help. She is a Veteran of the world's greatest Navy and her determination to help reflects that. Please if you are in need of a pain management, go see this office. You will not be disappointed!|I Spoke With RuthAnn (If I Am Spelling Her Name Right) And She Was Just A Peach. She Really Helped Myself And Mom Out With The Enrollment Process. Plus, She Even Stayed On The Phone With Me, Trying To Help Me Out With What Little To No Information My Mom's Doctor Had Given. Makes You Feel Good When People Actually Want To Help

Balint Pain Management Center in Weyers Cave, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Shenandoah Valley region. Founded with a commitment to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, our center combines evidence-based medical approaches with personalized care plans. Dr. Robert Audet leads our experienced team of pain specialists, bringing extensive expertise in interventional procedures, medication management, and holistic treatment options.

At Balint Pain Management Center, we address a wide spectrum of pain conditions including neuropathic pain, spinal disorders, arthritis, post-surgical pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our multidisciplinary approach integrates advanced diagnostic techniques with targeted interventions to provide effective relief while minimizing medication dependence.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Each treatment plan is customized after thorough evaluation of the patient's medical history, pain patterns, and lifestyle factors. Our goal is to restore function and improve daily living through sustainable pain management strategies.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 54 Franklin St #104, Weyers Cave, VA 24486, our facility offers a comfortable, supportive environment for patients seeking relief from chronic pain. We're easily accessible from Interstate 81 and serve patients from Harrisonburg, Staunton, Waynesboro, and surrounding communities.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 540-234-0080. For detailed provider information, visit Dr. Audet's profile at Sentara Healthcare. Our office hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, with some flexibility for urgent pain management needs.

I hate I have to live with chronic pain but feel blessed that I have a great doctor to help life be a little easier.|Was super excited ta be seen here unfortunately got the run around was told that "I couldn't be seen if I was a patient at another facility " so I had that facility release my file so that I could be seen by them just ta be told now "that because iv been discharged from agusta health pain management that I can't be seen"  makes absolutely 0 sense. I have never experienced anything like the other review and I have to take pre test, it's all a part of the office policy, to check your levels not to see if you ate a drug addict,  plus being a pain center and giving out pain medicine it is required of them to do the tedt.|Best pain management doctor in the world truly cares about his patients
Gives every patient their time iegardless of how ltong it takes       - five stars is not enough stars to rate  his ability to care and to help people 12 to 15 years ago he kept me from going down a rabbit hole, I was in so much pain and so chronically depressed over my injuries that I did not care about anything but he helped me he is still helping me and I hope and pray that anyone that can get his help will be able to, if you choose not to go to the Dr Audet you are making a critical mistake he will help you any way he can, don't delay call today he is a very busy man, !!!|The office staff are rude as can be.  They treat all patients like drug addicts and force you to take a drug test before you will be seen. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Steven Gershon, MD, our practice has established itself as a trusted resource for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our Approach to Pain Management

column40:
Dr. Gershon and his incredible staff have quickly become my favorite practice and group of people I have quickly gotten to know. I had been to three different doctors in the area and Dr G was the first one to correctly diagnose me. Dr Penske has done my steroid epidurals and procedures that followed but Dr. G and support staff have always stayed close by to ensure my treatment is top notch. I owe gaining my pain free life back to Dr. Gershon, I really do. I have recommended this clinic to multiple family, friends and colleagues in Hampton Roads, I'd give this practice 10 stars if I could !!! Thank you Gershon Pain Specialists, I can now play with my children again, workout again and live my life to fullest - thank you will never be enough !!|I have been seeing Dr. Gershon for an EMG to understand underlying causes of chronic pain and weakness.  He and his team did an excellent job of explaining the test, what to expect, and guiding me through it every step of the way.  They explained the results in a clear, easy-to-understand way without all the technical jargon. Dr. Gershon has a wonderful bedside manner and makes it a point to listen and understand any questions or concerns you have.  I greatly appreciate him!|Dr Gershon was a pleasant surprise
He walked me through everything before the test began. It was a lot less painful than I thought it would be. Barely a prick. Getting the results from him as we went was extremely comforting.
It was so delightful to hear him teaching/training a resident! Very educational! Love his method of training. The mutual respect between them was wonderful to see.
Everyone in the office was awesome!|I had the EMG/NCS  done for the second time and again it wasn't as bad as people say. Dr Gershon was completely professional and laid out exactly how the procedure was going to be and what the outcome was. I felt at ease during the entire appointment.|Lumbar epidural steroid injection to treat shooting pain hips and lower extremist. Dr Gershon discussed the procedure prior to the start and then during the procedure. After the procedure he reviewed the procedure,  what had been encountered and what to expect. This is my fourth lumbar epidural steroid injection treatment. The treatment provides me relief for nine to fifteen months.|I want to rate this place lower. Had an initial visit a week ago and was informed their doctor wasn't able to prescribe the pain meds I have been receiving from out of state (military) for the past 5 years now. I have been through this entire song and dance many times before and have shown everything required to establish care with meticulously kept records. After 8 knee surgeries and 20 years of living in chronic pain, I was fortunate enough to find a doctor who explored and carefully curated a combination of medications that helped me significantly. Unfortunately due to the Navy moving us around every couple of years, I am forced to establish care all over again.

Today, I was scheduled for a 14:00 appointment with a Dr. Pinsky and sat in a room ignored and forgotten about until 16:00. I left the room and expressed my displeasure and disgust with the front receptionist who couldn't care less.

Do not walk away from this place. Run away. They are highly incompetent, inept, and corrupt people who do not listen to their patients and demean them at every turn. Avoid this institution at all costs!|My preconception of pain management, based on the experience of others, was that they just prescribed pain killers because the ailment could not be treated.  That would not work for me and I almost did not go, but did because I wanted to keep an open mind so I did make the appointment.

Sarah Cullen NP came into the examining room fully prepared having already  reviewed my file, including the two-page memo that I wrote describing my experience to date.  She explained my condition much better than the knee doctor that referred me to Gershon Pain Specialists.  She proceeded with a thorough exam and came up with a non-narcotic course of treatment that included specialized physical therapy.

I highly recommend Gershon Pain Specialists and especially Sarah Cullen NP|Dr. Steven Gershon is an exemplary physician who combines superb professionalism with excellent personal skills.  His staff members are an impressive group.  The consults that I have had with Sarah Cullen, NP, have been most informative.

Having had an EMG exam on both legs and feet, I would like to convey to others that these tests amount to small pinpricks and are nothing which should create any anxiety.  Dr. Gershon administered these tests in such a manner that I was most comfortable.

Having been a Type II diabetic now for over ten years, I have come away from my meetings with Dr. Gershon and his staff with a renewed belief that I can far better reduce my A1c.  His suggestion of purchasing "The Diabetes Code" by Dr. Jason Fung on Amazon has the potential to be a real game changer in my life.

I highly recommend Dr. Gershon and his staff!

column38: Samuel Haile|Lauren Louck|James Bryant|Mike Stark|Carmen Sarraga|Susann Woodside|A Hoff|Katya Vrtis
column40:
I cannot thank Dr. Samantha and Dr.Gordon enough for the exceptional care they provided during my healing process. After a car accident left me two bulging discs, they both stepped in with a perfect combination of expertise and compassion. They gave me three trigger point injections and prescribed medications that made a tremendous difference in my recovery.

Throughout the entire process, they were not only professional but also incredibly kind and supportive, which helped ease my anxiety and gave me confidence in my treatment. Their efforts truly made a positive impact on my life, and I'm grateful to have had such dedicated doctors by my side.

Highly recommend them to anyone seeking quality care!|I have an upper cervical problem that went undiagnosed for 6 months until I saw Dr. Gordon. He did a great upper cervical medial branch block injection with no complications. I can't lay face down and he was very understanding and flexible that I needed to lay on my side for the procedure. I felt he was the first doctor to pay enough attention to realize how severe my issue is. He recommended me to 2 other doctors that specialize in treating my condition. So far they both have been great. My only complaint is the staff/call center can be really hard to work with as others have said. I definitely recommend Dr. Gordon though. In response to some other comments on here, my impression of him was that he's just a little quirky, but a very sweet guy and a good doctor.|I've been a patient of Dr. Gordan's off and on for a decade. He has always listened. He listens very well. I can't say this is true for all doctors. I think he should teach a course on bedside manner to medical students.

Dr. Gordan goes out of his ways to make uncomfortable procedures more pleasant. I trust Dr. Gordan and anyone on his staff as he had to approve hiring them.

He also never pressured me into any procedures or pushed anything on me that wasn't covered by insurance.

Frankly, some of these reviews are ridiculous. It's a busy clinic, but there are also pain emergencies. I've been that emergency who had to come in at a moment's notice, and Dr. Gordan made it happen. I don't mind waiting longer because I know they are efficient unless emergencies happen. I'm not sure you'll find that flexibility in all clinics, but you're welcome to try.

The office staff has always been caring, kind, compassionate, and efficient. The same is true for the Samantha and the technicians.

I wish I could give six stars, and I highly recommend this practice.|Always easy to schedule an appointment and procedure. They do require two separate appointments; you have to be seen before they can schedule the procedure, but that makes sense. And they were able to get me in for the procedure just 2 days later. Anyone that's ever had debilitating pain from a bulging disk/sciatica knows exactly how wonderful it is to be made pain free inside of 3 days. I'm so appreciative of this clinic and all the folks who work there.|yesterday was my first visit
with Dr Gordon. For many months and even recently
I have been in excruciating pain. Dr after doctor were not able to exactly pinpoint what was happening. Didn't seem to understand the immediacy. Dr Gordon was kind, understanding and Mafe sure I understood what he was saying to me. First time I felt that there is hope we will work this out this out. If you need an honest, and knowledgeable doctor  ,this is the place to come.|Dr. Gordon is the man I was looking for to take care of my back problems. He blocked the pain very well 5 years ago and I wanted to find him again. He had gone to other locations and he was the only one I would trust with my back. I found him and life is looking up.|I used Spine & Pain (S&P) for almost 2 years seeing Dr Gordon in North Arlington for a pain management. I have a spinal issue that cannot be fixed with surgery so I require long term pain management. THIS COMPANY IS NOT THE PLACE FOR PAIN MANAGEMENT, GO ELSEWHERE.

The practice is primarily focused on procedures that are not covered by insurance. They will try and sell you on expensive hocus-pocus procedures that have no proven results (there's a logical reason why insurance will not cover these type of procedures.)

I witnessed a very high employee turnover over primarily with physician assistant. Most visits will be scheduled with a PA so you will rarely see Dr Gordon.

Communication is almost impossible. If you have trouble with a script there will be no one to speak to. The phone chain will take 20 minutes to work thru and only get you to a foreign call center or vm. No after hour's service so you can expect to go days without vital medication if a problem arises.

Each office is essentially a franchise like McDonalds. No two offices are the same. S&P claim to follow the same policies but in the end they do whatever will earn the practice more money.

Most pain management centers will require in-person visits only every 3 month for pain management and will refill monthy during this period. S&P requires a in-person visit EVERY month even when you are only requiring a refill.

So if you value your time and your sanity do not use this company. Go to a reputable practice with a major heath care system like Inova or Medstar etc.|Dr. Gordon is the best! His knowledge of the body, pain, and EDS have made me more functional than I was for years. Highly recommended.

column3:
Eastern Shore Pain Management Center in Exmore, VA offers comprehensive pain management services to residents across Virginia's Eastern Shore region. Established with a commitment to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, our center combines evidence-based medical approaches with personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Eastern Shore Pain Management Center, our board-certified specialists utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment options to address various pain conditions. We specialize in treating back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain through both interventional procedures and medication management approaches.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to develop comprehensive treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, medication management, and lifestyle modifications to help patients regain function and improve their daily lives.

Convenient Location

Located at 4364 Charles M Lankford Jr Memorial Hwy in Exmore, VA 23350, our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology in a comfortable, welcoming environment. We proudly serve patients throughout the Eastern Shore peninsula, offering accessible specialized care close to home.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 757-656-3465. Additional information about our practice, treatment options, and patient resources can be found on our website at http://www.easternshorepainmanagementcenter.com/.

column40: Dr. Shirley Randall is one of the only pain management doctors on the Eastern Shore. She and her staff are all professional, courteous and compassionate. column3:
Orthopaedic & Spine Center serves Newport News, VA and the surrounding Hampton Roads area with exceptional interventional pain management services. Our specialized medical facility focuses on providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from spine-related disorders and chronic pain conditions. With state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and minimally-invasive treatment options, we help patients find relief and improve their quality of life without extensive surgical procedures.

Raj N. Sureja, MD joined Orthopaedic & Spine Center in 2008 as a board-certified, fellowship-trained Interventional Pain Management Specialist. His practice is dedicated to pain reduction of the spine and spine-related disorders through minimally-invasive interventional procedures. Dr. Sureja's expertise allows patients to explore effective non-surgical options before considering more invasive treatments.

Recognized for his excellence in patient care, Dr. Sureja has been named a "Top Doc" in Pain Medicine every year since 2012 by Coastal Virginia Magazine, an honor bestowed through votes from his peers in the medical community. This consistent recognition highlights his commitment to providing exceptional care and his standing among medical professionals in the region.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Orthopaedic & Spine Center, we believe in a comprehensive approach to pain management that addresses the root causes of discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms. Dr. Sureja works closely with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans that may include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other advanced interventional techniques.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Raj Sureja, please contact us at +1 757-596-1900. Our facility is conveniently located at 250 Nat Turner Blvd, Newport News, VA 23606. For more information about our services and providers, visit our website at www.osc-ortho.com.
column11: Dr. Raj Sureja joined OSC in 2008 as a board-certified, fellowship-trained Interventional Pain Management Specialist. His practice is focused on pain reduction of the spine and spine-related disorders through minimally-invasive interventional procedures. Dr. Sureja has been named a "Top Doc" in Pain Medicine every year since 2012 by Coastal Virginia Magazine, chosen by his peers in the medical community.

In addition, even though my appointment was the last of the day, I was prepped immediately and there were no delays whatsoever...a very nice bonus. I had been to several different doctors to manage my chronic back pain, he is the 1st one that has provided me with any relief in over 2 years.  I highly recommend him for pain management.|I have had injection in my neck in the spine a few times and had the worst pain and experience from it. It was traumatic. So when I went to see Dr Sureja I was terriefied. He was amazing he talks to you explains everything in detail he is very comforting. He is calming. As he inserted the lidocaine he calmly talked me though it and it didn't really hurt when my last times by another Dr it was exceuciatingly painful. Then he made sure to tell me if I felt ANY discomfort to let him now right away. I did not, even when he did the main injection he said you'll feel pressure not pain. My last injections by my previous I dr it was pain not pressure and severe pain I screamed out to where people in the lobby heard me. With Sureja it was insane at how painless this was that I was able to stop tensing up and relax while he did it. I didn't feel discomfort after either. I am so greatfull to of had him come highly recommend to me.|This doctor has excellent bedside manners, excellent in his treatments and well diversed in knowledge  of spinal and back problems.  I would highly recommend him to any patient.  On my first visit, I could barely walk but he has treated me to the point where I can walk without pain.  Love this doctor!|This Dr got my records and then said he couldn't help me. I've been seeing pain management for a few years with clean drug tests and have several true diagnoses. column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Reston serves patients throughout Reston, Virginia and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Conveniently situated adjacent to Reston Hospital at 1860 Town Center Drive, Suite 430, our specialized facility offers advanced interventional treatments for chronic pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians combine evidence-based approaches with personalized care plans to address various pain issues, including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, and neuropathic conditions. We pride ourselves on creating a supportive environment where patients can find relief and improve their quality of life.

At our Reston location, we provide a comprehensive range of interventional procedures and treatments, including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Platelet-rich plasma therapy

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

Location & Accessibility

Our center is located next to Reston Hospital in Suite 430. Parking options are plentiful, with spaces available both in front of and behind the building. Additional parking can be found in the parking garage, accessible off of Town Center Drive next to our practice. Due to potentially limited parking availability, we recommend arriving 15 minutes prior to your scheduled appointment time.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at (703) 738-4335. Our team is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain management and improved function.

Visit our website at www.treatingpain.com/reston to discover more about our treatment options and approach to pain management. As part of the National Spine & Pain Centers network, our Reston facility maintains the highest standards of care while offering the latest advancements in interventional pain medicine.

column40: This review is mainly for a specific provider- Deb Nelson is truly wonderful. I have a rare, difficult condition and she is very knowledgeable about it. She's got the best bedside manner and I greatly appreciate her efforts to help me. The folks at the front desk are great too, but I did have an issue when I was laid off and my insurance changed (wrong insurance was submitted to incorrectly) and it took quite a bit of time and effort to resolve. Other than that, no issues.|Absolutely love everyone who works in this office. From office staff to physician assistants to Dr. Brar! When you've had "crabby" service before at other doctors offices you really appreciate friendly faces!|They do not prescribe opioids at all even to help patients taper off them safely. They told me there was nothing they could do for my fibromyalgia and that I had to "sleep through the night, exercise 4x a week, and eat healthy" and that's all I could do, and I should learn how to cope with having chronic pain forever. They said the most they could do was try an epidural for my back pain (when done correctly this has helped me). They do not have lateral and vertical cameras for their procedures making it harder for them to make sure they are injecting at the correct site for the epidurals. I left the office crying due to how dismissive and unhelpful they were. All I wanted was for someone to listen and understand what I've been going through for years and instead I was told I just had to deal with it. I even asked if they knew any offices that could help me and they shrugged. They were happy to take my money and then turn me away.|I visit Deb Nelson at Reston Spine and Pain every 3 months for a check up and refills of my pain medication.  She has a wonderful, friendly presence.  In the past, she has also injected hyalorontin into my knees until we determined it wasn't helping.  I would highly recommend Deb.|I had a very good experience with Dr. Michael Jacobs. He was clear and informative at each point during my procedure, with great bedside manner. Dr. Jacobs made me feel at ease at a time when I was highly anxious. Previous positive experience with his PA at an earlier appointment.  Highly recommended.|Debra Nelson is a professional and easy to talk with and provides continuity for me when I come every three weeks. I know she's invested in my health and well-being. She's able to provide suggestions as to how I can become fitter and what I can use to improve my workouts in the pool, due to exercise limitations as a patient with advanced osteoporosis and a fully fused spine. She is someone I can count on to be honest with me and help me find alternate ways to meet my exercise goals, so that my quality of life improves continually. she is a genuine asset to your Reston Office.|Nationals spine and pain Center in Reston Virginia is a Great PAIN MANGEMENT team. The doctors are wonderful and they're very thorough with their patients.. The team there is always upbeat and willing to help would not have it any other way thanks again, Reston Team|Service is excellent at National Spine and Pain Reston Office. Pleasant, quiet waiting room. Very little wait to see your provider.  Dr. Jacobs and Deb Nelson, PA have been very helpful in explaining my options and the various pros and cons of the choices.  I never had felt rushed through a session.  I would consider their service excellent.

column2: National Spine & Pain Centers - Tysons Corner
column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Tysons Corner serves patients throughout McLean, Virginia and the greater Washington D.C. metropolitan area. As part of one of the nation's largest pain management practices, our Tysons Corner location provides comprehensive care for individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions. Situated conveniently at 1750 Tysons Blvd Suite 120 in McLean, our facility combines advanced treatment options with compassionate care from experienced specialists dedicated to improving patients' quality of life.

At National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC), we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, addressing conditions ranging from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome. Our board-certified physicians utilize the latest diagnostic tools and minimally invasive procedures to develop personalized treatment plans. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our team works diligently to provide relief while focusing on functional improvement and long-term wellness.

Our History and Growth

Established through a rebranding of The Spine Center in 2011, NSPC has experienced remarkable growth over the past decade. The practice expanded significantly in 2012 by partnering with Capitol Spine & Pain and later that year with New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians). Today, our network encompasses over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers across seven states including Virginia, Maryland, D.C., New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, and West Virginia.

The Tysons Corner Advantage

Our Tysons Corner location exemplifies NSPC's commitment to excellence in pain management. The modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology and staffed by specialists who stay at the forefront of pain medicine advancements. Patients benefit from our collaborative approach, where physicians work together to address complex pain conditions through innovative, evidence-based treatments designed to minimize reliance on medication while maximizing functional outcomes.

To schedule a consultation at our Tysons Corner location, call +1 703-738-4381 or visit us online at treatingpain.com. Our team is dedicated to helping you find relief from chronic pain and return to the activities you enjoy.
column11: National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) is one of the nation's largest pain management practices in the United States. Formed in 2011 with a re-brand of The Spine Center - NSPC quickly expanded, partnering with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012. We strive to bring high quality providers in the specialty of pain management together to offer an extensive network to meet the needs of an ever growing population of patients living in chronic pain. In late 2012 our affiliations grew with the addition of New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians), bringing our number of centers to over 60 with close to 100 providers in D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia and West Virginia.

column38: Stephani A|Francesca Firek|Cheryl Meyer|Jauhar Hashmi|Colin Doniger|Charilyn Wells Cowan|Valary Brown|Olivette Bennett
column40:
Dr. Dade was genuinely concerned about my well-being and made me feel comfortable discussing my back pain. He took the time to really understand the nature of my pain.  He explained all my treatments options clearly and answered all my questions.
I had previously seen him some years ago with positive results.
I highly recommend Dr Dade!|I have gone to National Spine & Pain Center for many years. The reason was to be seen by Dr. Wagner and his staff. He is very honest in telling you the best treatment for your issues whether that be as simple as physical therapy, PRP, or surgery. But 99% of the time, he can help you through methods other than surgery. I have told my friend that before you decide you need surgery, go see Dr. Wagner. Whenever I have to move out of the DC area, I will still travel to see Dr. Wagner for all my "aches and pains".|Dr Wagner is awesome ! I appreciate all his knowledge, professionalism , how he engages and listens ! His staff is awesome too !|I was scheduled to see a pain doctor but I met with his assistant who very rushed. The appointment lasted 15 minutes. She already assumed I needed another injection in my back. My primary care had sent them all my report in January. They were not knowledgeable about my condition. Driving two hours out of town for medical care was an absolute waste. I also confirmed if my insurance coverage will pay for all costs. However they are billing me  $38 for uncovered expenses. Their office billed $585 for this visit. No wonder health cost keep soaring.  This office is a waste of time!|Dr. Wagner really takes the time to listen and give me options without pushing a treatment on me.  He has helped me avoid several surgeries and heal naturally.  It's especially great to have a doctor who has personal experiences with the treatments.|My doctor with National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) retired so I wanted to explore all options for the future, especially those closer to McLean.  I like the organization's focus on nonsurgical alternatives to treating pain.  It was easy to have confidence with my prior Dr of many years, but with his retirement I wanted someone closer to home and work.

So I'd gone online, reviewing all nearby NSPC Drs and offices - their bios, treatments offered, insurance accepted, and all patient reviews, some multiple times. I narrowed to 3 good possibilities and decided to start with Dr Robert Wagner at the Tysons office.

It was an excellent choice.  I knew it as soon as Dr Wagner started the appt.  While it seems I am not a good candidate for his experimental treatments - the main focus for his office - I'm very impressed with his mastery of challenging surgical conditions. The benefits for some of his patients incude expediting their recovery from injuries. Amazing what can be done with stem cells!

Especially since we both knew from the outset that I would not be following up with his office, he was overly generous with his busy time - reviewing my imaging ordered by a different Dr, offering but not pushing his expert opinions.  He actively listened, giving his total attention, is personable, straightforward, and did not use jargon.
I'm a super fan of Dr Wagner after just one appt, hence the 5 stars.|I have seen A few Dr's from this practice and are all great!! A special shout out to Dr Wagner, he has been amazing . He is on a mission to help me and find the source of my pain . He is very kind, devoted, has my best interest at hand . Connie is also amazing at taking care of my needs! You can't go wrong with any Dr here|I received a referral from a doctor that I trust to visit this practice because of unexplained pain. Let me tell you! This practice exceeded my expectations and Dr. Wagner made me feel so understood. He listened (I talk a lot because I have a lot of complicated issues), he believed me, he took his time with me etc. I was thoroughly examined, my images e.g. MRIs, CTs, (lots of them) were thoroughly evaluated and I left the office feeling confident about my evaluation and care. Everyone in the office was professional, kind, helpful, understanding, caring etc. Overall I had an amazing experience at the National Spine & Pain Center in McLean VA.

column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Charlottesville serves patients throughout Charlottesville, Virginia and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists focuses on addressing the unique needs of each patient. By employing a comprehensive, team-based approach, each patient receives the expert, personalized treatment they deserve. Located conveniently next to Chik-fil-A in the Pantops Mountain area, our facility offers advanced diagnostic capabilities and innovative treatment options for those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

At National Spine & Pain Centers, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our specialists are trained in the latest interventional techniques and treatment modalities designed to reduce pain and improve function. We treat a wide range of conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Sports injuries and work-related injuries

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

Patient-Centered Approach

Our philosophy centers on developing individualized treatment plans that address not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain. We combine interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications to create comprehensive care plans tailored to each patient's specific needs and goals.

Visit Our Charlottesville Location

We welcome new patients at our modern, comfortable facility located at 1460 Pantops Mountain Pl, Suite 202, Charlottesville, VA 22911. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (434) 234-4910 or visit our website at www.treatingpain.com/charlottesville.
