column40:
The greeting I received when I entered the check-in area was excellent.  After filling out some paperwork, I sat waiting for only a few minutes, and they called me back to room 2 for a checkup. After only a few minutes of waiting the Doctor came in.   He was very polite and professional. He told me the procedure in detail and answered all of my questions.  I felt good when I left the building.  I feel like the Doctor will help me with my pain.   Very pleased with this office.|If you are reading these reviews because you are curious about how the new Doctor, Samuel Luebbert, is compared to Dr. Holland this is the one to read. Without going too much into my pain experience or treatment plans, here is the basics. My intake started with Dr. Holland and him providing me his opinion on what treatments would be best moving forward. I left that first initial appointment feeling like all my questions had been answered and that my doctor had a good understanding of what I was experiencing and how to best treat it. Unfortunately, Dr. Holland has since left and his replacement is Dr. Samuel Luebbert who has now taken over my treatment that Dr. Holland saw fit. I have had two appointments with this new doctor and after this second one I will not be returning to this specific national spine and pain center due to how he treated me within this appointment. There were just too many red flags with this doctor to where I do not feel comfortable seeking any further care. When he walked into my appointment room he started asking me about my neck pain which I do not experience at all, my pain is in both my shoulders expending to my elbows at times. Red flag: not reading the patient sheet/ having an understanding of what the patient is experiencing before walking through the door. He started arguing with me that he didn't have a good understanding because Dr. Holland did my intake to which I responded that he should then do an evaluation of me since he didn't seem to have a good idea of what I was experiencing. Did not want to. Red Flag. Went on to the care that I was there for which were trigger points and continued to not listen to where I needed my injections to give me the full effect I needed. Red flag. After my trigger point he wanted to make changes to my medication when I have been on these medications for almost 2 years and they are doing exactly what I need them to do. Additionally to that point, why would I take advice from a doctor that had no idea of my condition before even walking through the door or even following the instructions of how I have typically get my trigger points done. From the moment Dr. Luebbert walked in the door I felt as if Dr. Luebbert saw me and my care as something left behind by Dr. Holland and just wanted to get me out of the door as fast as possible. I spent more time in the waiting room than I did with this doctor which is a lot to say when so much went wrong. I left in tears after seeing Dr. Luebbert and when both receptionist heard my complaints they said I am not the only one who has left in tears after seeing this new doctor. This comment only drilled it in my head that I needed to find a new place of care and also ensure that multiple people of management knows that I am not the only person with this experience. I have never left any establishment feeling so awful that I needed to write a one star review and it really saddens me for this specific national spine and pain clinic because every other person I have interacted with besides Dr. Luebbert has been absolutely amazing. I spoke with the in house manager to place a formal complaint but no formal notes were taken which has lead me to reach out to HR. I want my experience to be a reference incase another patient has as awful an experience as I did. There needs to be documentation to show undeniable proof that this is a pattern with Dr. Luebbert so I will be the first to start.|Moved here from md a few months back and I've had the same care plan for my pain for 10 years. 3rd visit here after charging me my 80 dollar copay they inform me they no longer want to provide me the care I need. Oh and like other reviews have noted they don't seem to read a chart or anything before coming in. Asking me about lower back pain when all of my pain has always been in my upper back/shoulders. Doctor doesn't seem to want to hear anything you have to say and makes assumptions based on his experience. Being like <30 that isn't much.|READ THE BAD REVEIWS! I did not! I am deeply disappointed with my experience at National Spine and Pain Centers. Long story shortened. My journey began in 2023 when my lumbar pain severely limited my ability to walk and engage in daily activities. Desperate for relief, I sought treatment at their Fredericksburg office and scheduled a trial Radiofrequency Ablation procedure, which required two trial rounds for insurance approval. Unfortunately, Dr. Soteropoulos, who performed my first trial, was incredibly rude and dismissive. The procedure was excruciatingly painful, and his lack of empathy was shocking. I was never told about the excruciating pain of this procedure and how it works.

Hoping for a better experience, I transferred to the Charlottesville office, even though it meant restarting the trial procedures. I finally received some relief from Dr. Holland's treatment in January 2024, allowing me to enjoy activities like walking my dogs and visiting museums again. I couldn't believe how well the procedure worked! 70% of my pain was gone! However, by July 2024, the pain returned tenfold and my pain level was at a 20 on a 1 to 10 scale, and I needed another ablation. Dr. Holland quickly approved the procedure after literally a 30-second consultation.

The second procedure in August 2024 resulted in severe pain and complications. I had NEVER had shooting, burning pain going down my legs before my second procedure!!!  I contacted the office, Nurses and DRs expressing my concerns that the wrong nerves had been treated.
My mid back has hurt me since 1998 and all the sudden the pain was gone?? Did the Dr burn the wrong nerves? but I was met with dismissive and argumentative responses. To make matters worse, Dr. Holland retired, and the new doctor was equally dismissive, refusing to listen to my concerns and offering an epidural procedure instead!  This sounds absolutely NUTS to me! Good thing I requested my medical records before they could go in and change any negligence on their behalf.

Now, I'm left with unresolved pain and nerve damage, fearing potential long-term consequences. I strongly advise against seeking treatment at National Spine and Pain Centers due to the incompetence and lack of compassion demonstrated by their staff. If anyone knows of a reliable practice that can provide competent and compassionate care, please let me know."|So first let me set up the back story. A few months back I had a seizure while riding in a vehicle and because of the seat belt I ended up breaking my own back. Burst fracture of my T-12 vertebra. I now have rods and screws in my spine, which formed a cast to help support the break. My neurologist was very adamant that I take my seizure medication on time and that I get plenty of sleep. I have been unable to sleep more than a few spurts through out the night because of the pain in my back.
Now here's my experience with Dr. Holland and his TA. Day #1 I walk in and i Immediately hear a 70+ year old man in agony trying to get his prescription filled only to have the nurse tell him there is nothing that can be done. Already not a good start. I then wait for my turn and proceed to talk with Dr. Holland and explain what is going on and what has been done already. Dr. Holland then immediately starts to argue with me about my previous medical procedure. Stating "no you're actually fused" and treating me and my wife as if we are moron's. He did however come back and apologize for being wrong but only after having to argue with him multiple times! He then sends me home with a prescription that I attempted to take and my body just wasn't having any of it. I even took 1/8th of a pill to try to get some relief without throwing up. No luck. So I then make another appointment and go back take a urine sample with out anyone watching and proceed to put it in the bin along with 4 other samples all of which could be tampered with by anyone who uses the bathroom. They then proceed to prescribe me an anti-inflammatory, which did absolutely nothing for my pain. I go back and he then agrees to write me a prescription for what he says is "Oxycodone". i get to the pharmacy and find out it's the Percocet, which is what my Dr. originally put me on after my surgery and then changed it to standard Oxy HCL 5mg because it was causing me to be Numbed out and depressed and for some reason. I explained this to Dr. Holland and he literally accused me of trying to get medication to sell on the street! This man is rude, jaded and an absolutely terrible Dr. How can any Dr. who took an oath to do no harm treat anyone like this?! Refusing to help a patient in need is a violation of their Oath! I would not recommend anyone go to this cold heartless place!
July 12, 2024|On the first day, after a long stint in the waiting room, Dr. Holland and his  black-haired assistant seemed unsympathetic, distrusting, and somewhat annoyed.  The assistant pointed out something in my chart to indicate that I had lied.  I was too embarrassed and confused to try to explain. I did not lie.

The treatment that Dr. Holland prescribed was an epidural steroid injection, even though I had explained that I had already had this  treatment twice before without any results whatsoever. On the day of the treatment, Dr. Holland and his assistant were, I thought, ,unnecessarily rough.    They showed very little care or compassion. But the worst is that they did not explain to me how much the procedure would hurt. It was the worst pain I have ever felt. I was not prepared for it because my previous two injections were done at a hospital clinic, where a great deal of lidocaine is used beforehand to prevent the pain.  This pair succeeded in understating the pain, saying that would only last for a few seconds.  Nobody prepared me for what what was about to happen.  Immediately afterwards, Dr. Holland fled from the room, shouting over his shoulder without looking at me, "come back in two weeks."   The assistant was unsympathetic and ignored my weeping.

I went out to my car shaky, shocked and disoriented, lost my balance, and collapsed.  I wasn't injured but was afraid to drive home.

The ladies who prepared me for the procedure were extremely kind and professional and tried to explain to me why I was receiving no pain medication.  By then it was too late.  I could never have anticipated what was about to happen anyway.

Another  note.  Beforehand, I asked the black-haired assistant if my insurance would cover more than 3 treatments, this being my third. The answer was no, but she confided that they could arrange self- payment.

This procedure must be a big moneymaker for these people, as they prescribed it without explaining it clearly and without discussing any alternative treatment.

I feel mistreated and exploited.|It seems that this office or the practitioner it's just interested in pushing treatments without cures and answers  I'm losing respect for this office What happened the patient's rights? And what happened to bedside matters from the doctors or the practitioners? Mainly the last practitioner that supposedly knew what she was doing? She is lowering patience well-being by not answering questions by the patient or physical examination Hands-On feel where the problem is, she didn't do this, she was more interested in getting out of the office visit ASAP When I told her that I'm feeling a movement in my lower left side and asked her what it could be, her reply was and I quote "I don't know" RED FLAGS
And this leaves me, a very very untrusting feeling I need answers I want answers, not just some brush off That's what I felt from her There was NO RESPECT And when she asked about physical therapy, I explained to her that I work out of Houston Texas in the oilfield business. She wrote it down a little tablet that I refused physical therapy, a lie and then what she said I can talk to the surgeon, well the surgeon to me means scheduling surgery She did not elaborate, the doctor  The doctor to me means, he'll examine me and give me answers, again she did not elaborate Which was very confusin, you should have said do you want to speak to the doctor I will tell her yes
She was quick to put in a tablet again that I refused, another lie I am confused nervous and scared that I might end up in a wheelchair, she did not elaborate her answers to me Again I felt betrayed abused and disrespected by her, this is not how you treat patients who are worried and scared, I want answers before I make my decision, I don't want to be pushed into something I do not agree with Killing the nerves in my back seems pointless? I want to know which is better, killing in my nerves first or surgery first, then maybe doing something about the nerves in my back
I'll be up there my next visit, but like I said I will not do any procedures until I get answers, answers to me that makes sense
Mr Richard Philemon|Dr. Holland and the entire staff are very pleasant and professional.  They are very patient and they take time to listen to my concerns and/or to provide helpful tips and information pertaining to my situation.  I appreciate and thank each one of them for their excellent service.

column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Aldie serves patients throughout Aldie, Virginia with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team focuses on addressing each patient's unique needs through a comprehensive, team-based approach that ensures everyone receives expert, personalized treatment. With state-of-the-art facilities and board-certified specialists, we're committed to helping our patients find relief from chronic pain conditions and improve their quality of life.

Conveniently situated off Route 50, our center is directly across from Stone Springs Hospital at the intersection of Robeson and Village Drive. You'll find us at 24560 Southpoint Dr Suite 120, Aldie, VA 20105. This central location makes us easily accessible to patients throughout the Aldie region and surrounding communities.

Patient Comfort

We strive to create a comfortable healing environment for all our patients. Please note that our office maintains cooler indoor temperatures, so we recommend bringing a sweater or light jacket to your appointment. This small preparation helps ensure your visit is as comfortable as possible while you receive care.

Comprehensive Pain Management

At National Spine & Pain Centers - Aldie, we offer advanced diagnostic capabilities and innovative treatment options for various pain conditions. Our specialists develop customized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and complementary approaches to address your specific pain concerns.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 703-348-5060. You can also visit our website at https://www.treatingpain.com/aldie/ for additional information about our treatments, providers, and patient resources.

Our center is located off of route 50, directly across the street from Stone Springs Hospital. Our office is located at the intersection of Robeson and Village Drive. We encourage our patients to bring a sweater or light jacket to their appointment due to cool indoor temperatures in our office.

column40:
First time here and I absolutely loved it. The front staff is wonderful and all kind/helpful. Dr T is awesome! He is so sweet and actually cares to know what's going on. Amazing office! So happy I get to come here.|Everyone there is kind, friendly and helpful.  My appointments are quick and easy. The doctors actually care and do everything they can to help.|Thank You to Dr. Tannous, Ariana and Minh!

Today, I am filled with gratitude as I have the honor of sharing a truly inspiring story of hope, healing, and remarkable care.

In the journey of life, we often encounter individuals who leave a lasting impact on our hearts and minds. Dr. Tannous and his dedicated team, Ariana and Minh, have not only provided exceptional medical care but have also demonstrated the true essence of compassion and professionalism.

I recently had the privilege of witnessing the transformative power of Dr. Tannous's expertise. After struggling with the debilitating effects of multiple herniated discs in my neck, I had almost lost hope of ever experiencing a pain-free existence. However, Dr. Tannous's love, care and expertise have healed me. I really feel like I was cared for with love and treated like family.

Writing this with tears of joy streaming down my face!!!|Dr didn't listen to me. Dr called in a prescription that cost $700 after insurance which I wasn't paying that price. I explained what my surgeon prescribed and told him that was working well for me. He then called in a prescription for oxy which I can't tolerate.
I called back and the receptionist was extremely rude and very disrespectful.
There is a huge level of miscommunication there. I'm not going by!!|I was able to make an appointment within a day of calling after suffering for nearly 2 months with neck pain.  The entire staff is extremely helpful and friendly.  Cannot say enough good things about Dr. Tannous and his tech Min.  If I could give a thousand stars I would...he explained my MRI and I finally understood (after seeing multiple chiropractors and Drs) what the cause of my pain was.  I was also able to get treatment that day.  Amazing experience all around and I am so grateful for Dr. Tannous...I am nearly pain free a day later and can start getting back to my favorite activities!|Dr. Tannous has really worked hard to accommodate my needs and has literally saved my life.  My pain was so bad and he helped me right away at my first visit.  The administration are awesome and very professional.  I f you want the best pain management doctor in VA go to Dr.Tannous!!!|I was a new patient today. The front desk and nurse staff were all friendly and professional. I Saw Dr.Tannous. And he was very informative. Took some time to explained my MRI to me. Went in for lower back and hip. He didn't rush me like most doctors would do. Provided options for me to make decisions. The front desk was very accommodating in trying to fix me in asap for my treatment due to my availability. Overall, had a great experience today!|Dr's here are very professional. The staff at reception are awesome as well.

column2: National Spine & Pain Centers - Ketan Patel, MD
column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers serves Haymarket, VA and surrounding communities with exceptional interventional pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Ketan Patel, MD. Since joining the practice in 2012, Dr. Patel has established himself as a leading specialist in non-surgical pain relief techniques, bringing his prestigious training and comprehensive expertise to patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions.

Dr. Patel's distinguished medical background includes completing a Fellowship in Interventional Pain Management at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), where he trained under world-renowned experts in advanced non-surgical pain management techniques. His educational foundation was further strengthened during his residency in anesthesiology at the prestigious Johns Hopkins Hospital, where he contributed valuable content to a leading pain management textbook.

Specialized Training & Expertise

Dr. Patel's practice focuses on minimally invasive interventional procedures, with particular expertise in:

- Fluoroscopic-guided spinal injections

- Comprehensive pain evaluations

- Personalized treatment plans

- Advanced diagnostic techniques

Throughout his academic and professional career, Dr. Patel has received numerous awards and distinctions recognizing his commitment to excellence in patient care and medical innovation.

Patient-Centered Approach

At National Spine & Pain Centers, Dr. Patel combines cutting-edge medical techniques with compassionate care, working closely with each patient to develop customized treatment plans that address their specific pain conditions and improve quality of life.

Contact Information

Phone: +1 703-738-4384

Website: [www.treatingpain.com](https://www.treatingpain.com/)

Location: 15195 Heathcote Blvd #230, Haymarket, VA 20169, United States

Patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions can schedule a consultation to explore the comprehensive non-surgical treatment options available at National Spine & Pain Centers.
column11: Dr. Patel joined National Spine & Pain Centers in 2012 after completing a Fellowship in Interventional Pain Management at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), where he was trained to perform the most advanced non-surgical techniques by one of the world's leading experts in pain management. Prior to his Fellowship, Dr. Patel completed his residency training in anesthesiology at the renowned Johns Hopkins Hospital, during which time he authored content for a preeminent pain management textbook. Dr. Patel has received numerous awards and distinctions throughout his academic career and medical training. He is expertly trained in a variety of diagnostic specialties and treatments, including: fluoroscopic-guided spinal injections,...

column38: Levina Kim|Amy Calligan|Sondra B|Zainab Jalali|Christie Aremu|Annie Pratt|Richard McPherson|Samantha K
column40:
I brought my father to see Dr. Patel for his sciatic leg pain. We arrived early as instructed to complete new patient paperwork and waited for 45 minutes to see Dr. Patel once brought into a room. When I made the appointment, I requested a date/time to see Dr. Patel. We never saw Dr. Patel during our visit and was told that something had come up with another patient which prevented him from seeing us.  Before leaving, we did eventually speak with a Physician Assistant. PAs are wonderfully competent members of one's health team and seeing one would not have been problematic after the first initial consult. The Center's recommended treatment plan is to start with injections, but how would anyone think/feel about receiving treatment without meeting the individual who is going to stick a needle in one's spine? My dad and I left after being at the practice for 90+ minutes.

I have recently learned the Haymarket location has the practice of their mid-level professionals meeting with a new patient for their initial consult. Again, not an issue if this was communicated to us at the time of scheduling or before the appointment.  I have requested a transfer of care to another National Spine & Pain Center location nearby. Based on the online reviews I have read and what I observed while we waited in the practice, I don't doubt that Dr. Patel is a fine physician and pain medicine specialist; however, there needs to be clearer lines of communication with patients (old and new), and adoption of transparency and some new practices to help engender patient trust that is critical in an optimal patient experience and outcomes.|I am thankful to Dr. Patel and his team. They provide excellent care. I have experienced outstanding communication from the front desk to the medical providers. Dealing with chronic pain is something I never imagined having to live with. I am grateful to have them walking this journey with me.|Dr.  Patel was the ABSOLUTE BEST, MOST COMPASSIONATE, CARING,  UNDERSTANDING doctor I ever had.  I am extremely happy for Dr. Patel that he has moved on to bigger and better thing....... However, I am extremely upset that he had to leave, because I have not been the same since he left even though I still get injections.  He helped my husband through a car accident and got him on his feet again (without narcotics)and it was just always a pleasure going to see him.  (even though we were getting a bunch of needles in our back) I really miss him and wish I was able to continue to have him as my doctor.  Wherever he is, and whoever has him as a doctor is extremely blessed because he is an extremely intelligent, compassionate,  amazing doctor that really makes a difference in his patients lives.   I appreciate the time I had with him and wish him the best|I have been in this office for years start seeing Ms. Suares and she is great for years taking care of my lower back pain as the pain is always controllable by her. The office switched me to Ms. Hiral all the sudden and I started seeing her for months and it was alright. I got developed a SEVERE neck, shoulders and upper back pain on March and was NOT controllable by any of the method that I did with my lower back pain. Hiral was NOT taking my upper back pain as serious as I feel now. She sent me to Physical therapy ( which I already do at home ) also to MRI and she gave C 2 pain medicine for 10 days.That was a great relief but temporarily. My intentions for coming to her was getting a steroid shot for long term relief. I could not get an appointment for MRI within 10 days but it was 21+ days so I was seeking a compensation for C2 pain medicine until I got MRI. I work in the pharmacy and I am aware about regulation for these medicines BUT, when they had me to come back to the office, Hiral was extremely disrespected me . Accusing me for abusing pain medication. Hey I am a single mom that has 2 jobs and full custody for my daughter and I am in SEVERE pain I do not want this attitude. I was asking her during that visit what is the chance of getting relief after cortisone shot , she was NOT listening to me. She kept saying no more pain medicine until you get MRI. I asked her if she can do physical exam (which she NEVER touch me to exam me) she was disrespectfully looking into my batch that says my name and Pharmacy info I work. She did look at this batch probably 10 times during the visit giving me a hint that I work in medical field so I should stop asking for pain medicine. I know they do have a system that can look in Virginia, Maryland and DC for my past control medication I have taken and she saw I did NOT take any C2 medication since I delivered my daughter 7 years ago. Why this accusing  and disrespect. When you are in pain you need someone to assure you. Instead Hiral made me cry that night the way she was talking to me. Back to my visit to review my MRI. Hiral could not be able making a call for them and ask, she sent her nurse to accuse me not getting MRI done, I went back to my car to bring MRI CD. Then she said Fairfax radiology system was down. Why did not you call then to find out where is my MRI before you sending the nurse telling me I did not get the MRI. Again it was another disrespect. Getting  steroid shot, Dr. Patel told me there is minimal inflammation that close enough to say I have nothing wrong and it's like normal finding does not correspond to the pain I describe. I asked him while he was giving me the shot in my neck weather the finding on my right more since my pain is a lot of more on my right. He kept saying there is NO finding in you MRI except minimal inflammation. When I put my hand on my neck and shoulders I do not feel muscle, I feel a BIG ROCK, so what kind of minimum inflammation cause a rock feel like muscles? Anyway it was few weeks since I got the shot and I feel 0% relief. I am out of work right now as I can't work anymore. The pain is AS ITS with PT  and NSAID's that do nothing. I and my primary care doctor asked the office to fax the records for her 3-4 times and it was NEVER done. Until I had to walk into the office and get the records from the receptionists myself. Here are 2 things shocking there when I came to the office: 1- I read my MRI report as ( I am a doctor in different country and I am a medical student here as well) the finding was bulging disk, spondylosis , fissures and HERNIATED DISK from C4 until C7. The herniation and the bulging is mostly on the RIGHT side. 2- I asked the receptionist why Dr. Patel did not tell me about these results? The answer was giving me a deaf ears. When I got the full medical report and walk out the door I turn around and I found the 3 receptionist laughing so hard at me. Is it a real professional place?|Dr. Patel is one of the best doctors I've ever known. He has a great bedside manner and is very knowledgeable in his field. I've had some health problems recently and he took the steps I hoped he would and listened to my concerns and answered my questions and has given me additional information that I did not receive from other physicians. Thank you Dr. Patel for caring and helping me figure things out.|I've seen Dr. Patel for almost 3 years and have always been treated with respect and kindness. He is an amazing doctor--he is knowledgeable about  the latest research, is very skilled in performing procedures, AND he has excellent bedside manner. I trust his opinion and would recommend him to anyone. He is smart and has my best interests in mind. Treating people who are in so much pain can't be easy, but he does so with grace.|Dr. Patal has one the best "bedside manner" of any physician that has treated me. He's not only passionate about his profession, he's extremely detail oriented in identifying the best treatment plan. He a wonderful listener and has an infectious personality. I've made several recommendations to family and friends.|Dr. Patel is the best.  He was able to diagnose my problem quickly and came up with a plan.  I'm happy to say that I am now pain free.  During my visits he always took time to listen to my concerns and explained things in a way that I understood.  I have sent my mom, my daughter and countless friends to Dr Patel.  I highly recommend him.

column3:
Dr. Babak Bedayat serves the Culpeper, Virginia community with exceptional pain management services through Wellspring Health Services. As a dedicated pain management specialist, Dr. Bedayat combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients overcome chronic pain conditions and improve their quality of life. His practice offers comprehensive evaluations and personalized treatment plans designed to address the unique needs of each individual.

At his practice located at 608 S Main St in Culpeper, Dr. Bedayat provides a wide range of interventional pain management solutions. Patients benefit from his expertise in treating various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. The clinic utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and therapeutic approaches to identify and address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Bedayat's practice is his commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. He takes time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach has earned him the trust and respect of the Culpeper community and surrounding areas.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Wellspring Health Services is centrally located in Culpeper, making it easily accessible for patients throughout the region. The office at 608 S Main St offers a comfortable, welcoming environment designed to put patients at ease. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Bedayat, patients can call +1 540-825-4557 or visit the practice website at https://www.wellspringhealthservices.com/pain-management for more information about services and appointment availability.
column38: Janet Roberts|Dustin Raines|Elizabeth Garten|Megan|Teresa Merida|John Parham|Patricia Brumfield|John Reber
column40: I was told I should schedule shoulder replacement surgery, but  was hesitant so I ask if I could try pain management first. I was referred to Dr Babak Bedayat at Wellspring in Culpeper and he helped me in one visit. My pain was reduced by 90%  after that visit. I had my 2nd visit today and decided not to take a shot to block the pain. He agreed and told me I could reschedule the shot at anytime if the pain returned. I am 100% satisfied|My mother Charlene  has been seeing Dr. Babak Bedayat throughout the past year and has nothing but wonderful things to say. Diana, Brittany and the team there treat my mother as family and genuinely care for her needs. She would highly recommend anyone to see Dr. Babak Bedayat and the team!|Dr. Bedayat is a great doctor. He is always so happy to see you. I have been seeing for almost 3 years and he has helped me a lot. I would definitely recommend him for your pain doctor.|I've been going to Dr Bedayat for over 3 years now for or various problems and he has been a true lifesaver. Not only does he provide me with any treatments I need to function, he does it with a kindness that is not often seen. He is so incredibly personable with a great sense of humor that I've been nothing but comfortable in his care. I highly recommend him to anyone looking for pain management.|My mom has been seeing him for years now and loves him! She enjoys every visit with him because he explains things to her like no other doctor does! His bedside manner is excellent! National Spine & Pain Centers - Henrico serves patients throughout Henrico, Virginia and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. At National Spine & Pain Centers - Henrico, we offer a wide range of treatments for various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic disorders. Our multidisciplinary approach integrates medical expertise with cutting-edge interventional procedures to provide effective pain relief without excessive reliance on medications. Patient-Centered Approach

column40: DR. GU  and his staff are very professional,  quality  individual time spent with me. I waited since 12 n now it's 430 and the office close but me and the drugstore kept calling back to back for over an hour! The nurses are sweet and kind but I miss Dr Steve I've never had this experience before but how can serve and help your patients when you don't answer the phone???? And it was 2 of us calling back to back! Nice I have to cancel my ride and try another one. This is very frustrating|Medical personnel changed without any notification. New representative was more interested in changing my appointment because it was Thanksgiving week. My appointment was earlier in the week so I'm guessing it was to accommodate other people not me. I've been a patient there for years and should not be reposted to accommodate others.|When you are in severe pain, it is especially important that things run smooth (I know it is a "process"), but nothing went smooth with my experience here.  First P.A. I saw was pretty unprofessional.  2nd appointment was to go over my MRI but it was such a quick appointment my head was spinning and I later found out she glanced at my MRI but didn't keep the information to submit to my insurance, therefore, after another month went by in pain, the appointment I had schedule for an injection was denied because the MRI results weren't sent to the insurance company.  I found this out the day before the scheduled appointment.  So ANOTHER month to wait for an appointment for injection (while suffering in pain ).  Dr. Gu was unsympathetic and unapologetic for them dropping the ball.   Also, one week later , they still haven't sent the required info to the insurance company (and I literally BEGGED Dr. Gu to expedite re-submitting).    Also, one appointment was written on the check out paper for me, but they didn't put it in the computer so I was not on the schedule!  Also, I have sent 3 or 4 messages through the portal and not one has had a response.  Very upsetting to go through all of this while in pain.  They did prescribe pain meds and asked if I wanted more.|On jan 6 they were closed because of snow.  so i called to make an appointment i was put on message machine.  I never heard back so i called today Jan 7 i was still on message machine i couldnt get thru to talk to anyone i wanted to just talk to someone.  But i was locked on message machine from the day before.  I have been coming for about 3 years and i am on pain meds I could go thru withdraw .  i have limited days because i have to do chemo soon i would just like a call back. other places have worked with me who have lots of patients. Please call me. Patricia Bonarrigo. 09/27/1947|Staff is friendly and the office is very clean. The clinic staff treats you like a human being and they are attentive to your needs.|I have been in pain management for several year's due a blown out lower back and knees from a motorcycle crash.. I have received every injection there is offered to the lower back and nothing has lasted for more then two week at best and very paiful. My first visit with Dr. Gu was an evaluation.  I exspained to Dr. Gu the many back injections I had received in the past didn't last and I was not interested. I had a follow up appointment with my back surgeon whom stated back injections were not advised. I returned to Dr Gu for my second visit and advised Dr. Gu of my surgons opinion to the injections. Dr Gu went forward with a nerve test  and requested that I teturn with a current MRI on my next visit so he may go forward with the six injections in my lower back. I feel as though Dr Gu is not listening to me or taking into account that injections do not work for me or my surgons recommendation. I feel that the injections are a money maker at  $800 per set of 2 not to mention that there is an expensive co pay involved. I will not be returning to his office for treatment.  I do feel that Dr Gu is a good Dr, but did not listen to me.|First visit has left a very poor taste for this practice. The receptionist was rude and didn't even know how to do her job. There was a slide asking me to agree to let my information be used for affiliates. I don't want that and didn't want sign that screen. It wouldn't let me proceed without signing that slide. Of course I can't be seen if I can't get past that screen. When I asked for help she was short with me and told me no one had ever refused to sign that screen. I told her I read it and didn't agree. I figured a way to get around it, no thanks to her rudeness. I then listened to her complain about how much work she had. I really didn't need to hear all of that. So, I went to get an appointment for shots that were recommended and was given is a month away. I am in pain, that's why I'm there. It took several weeks to get in, now wait a month to get the shots. Are you kidding me? I really don't trust front office staff and wonder if I made the right choice.

NOVA Interventional Pain and Spine in Lansdowne, Virginia serves patients throughout Northern Virginia with comprehensive pain management solutions. Led by Dr. Anil Chenthitta, our specialized medical practice focuses on interventional techniques to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. We combine advanced diagnostic methods with personalized treatment plans to help patients regain function and improve their quality of life. Our state-of-the-art facility in Lansdowne offers a comfortable environment where patients receive individualized attention and access to cutting-edge pain management procedures.

At NOVA Interventional Pain and Spine, we utilize the latest evidence-based approaches to diagnose and treat pain conditions. Dr. Chenthitta, who is board-certified and fellowship-trained, conducts thorough examinations and orders appropriate imaging studies to accurately identify the source of pain. Our practice specializes in interventional procedures that target pain at its source, often providing relief where traditional methods have failed.

Our Comprehensive Approach

We believe in collaborative care that involves patients in their treatment decisions. column3:
Virginia Ketamine Therapy serves Williamsburg, VA and the broader Tidewater area with specialized pain management solutions. Founded by Dr. Mark W. Newman, DO, this pioneering practice has transformed the landscape of pain treatment in Virginia since its establishment. Dr. Newman, a board-certified anesthesiologist and pain management physician, made a pivotal career shift in 1997 when he discontinued his anesthesia practice to dedicate himself exclusively to pain management. His vision led to the creation of the first full-time interventional pain management practice in the Tidewater region, addressing a critical need in the community.

In 2012, Dr. Newman revolutionized his practice by introducing outpatient ketamine infusions specifically for patients suffering from Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS) who had experienced limited success with conventional treatments. The remarkable outcomes from these treatments prompted the expansion of his practice and the formal establishment of Virginia Ketamine Therapy. Today, the practice specializes in ketamine infusion treatments for a range of conditions including CRPS, fibromyalgia, Lyme disease, depression, and other conditions that may benefit from this innovative approach.

Specialized Care and Expertise

What sets Virginia Ketamine Therapy apart is Dr. Newman's extensive experience and specialized knowledge in pain management. His board certification and dedicated focus on interventional techniques ensure patients receive the highest standard of care. The practice continues to be at the forefront of pain management innovation, offering hope to patients who have exhausted traditional treatment options.

Contact Information

Phone: +1 757-258-2561

Address: 223 Bulifants Blvd STE C, Williamsburg, VA 23188, United States

Website: https://mytpmg.com/physician/mark-w-newman-do/
column11: Dr. Newman is a board-certified anesthesiologist and pain management physician. In 1997, he discontinued the practice of anesthesia to focus solely on pain management. His practice was the first full-time interventional pain management practice in the Tidewater area of Virginia. In 2012, Dr. Newman began performing outpatient ketamine infusions for patients with CRPS who had not responded well to conventional treatments. The results have been nothing short of amazing, and Dr. Newman expanded his practice with the creation of Virginia Ketamine Therapy. This practice is focused on pursuing treatment for CRPS, fibromyalgia, Lyme disease, depression, and other diseases that may benefit from ketamine infusions.

Sentara Comprehensive Pain Management Center in Virginia Beach, VA offers specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located in a large, state-of-the-art facility at 1975 Glenn Mitchell Dr Suite 101, this center stands out for its integrated approach to pain management. Co-located with the Sentara Therapy Center, patients benefit from immediate access to specially trained physical therapists who work collaboratively with pain management specialists to address complex pain issues. The center's board-certified physicians bring extensive expertise to each case, ensuring patients receive the highest standard of care in the Virginia Beach area.

When visiting Sentara Comprehensive Pain Management Center, patients undergo a thorough evaluation to accurately diagnose their condition. The center's specialists take time to understand each patient's unique pain experience, medical history, and treatment goals. Following this assessment, physicians develop personalized multidisciplinary treatment plans that may include a combination of medications, therapeutic injections, physical therapy protocols, or coordinated referrals to related specialists when necessary. This holistic approach addresses not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain.

Facility and Accessibility

The center's modern facility is designed with patient comfort and convenience in mind. Located at 1975 Glenn Mitchell Dr Suite 101, Virginia Beach, VA 23456, the center is easily accessible to residents throughout Hampton Roads. Patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 757-507-1660. The integration with Sentara's broader healthcare network ensures seamless coordination with other medical services when needed, creating a comprehensive care experience for those dealing with acute or chronic pain conditions.

Expert Team and Advanced Treatments

What sets Sentara Comprehensive Pain Management Center apart is its team of board-certified pain management specialists who stay at the forefront of pain medicine advancements. The center offers a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic approaches, from traditional pain management techniques to innovative treatments. By combining medical interventions with physical therapy available on-site, the center provides a convenient one-stop solution for pain management that addresses both immediate relief and long-term recovery goals. More information about their services can be found at the official Sentara website.
column11: Sentara Comprehensive Pain Management Center features a large, state-of-the-art facility, which is co-located with a team of specially trained physical therapists from the Sentara Therapy Center. Our pain management specialists, are board certified. When you arrive at the Sentara Comprehensive Pain Management Center, you will be given a thorough evaluation for your condition. Based on the physician's assessment, they will develop a personalized multidisciplinary treatment plan that might include medications, injections, physical therapy or a coordinated referral to related specialists.
column38: Glenn Mizner|Mandy d'Nadie|J Overman|mike hall|Lakezeya Robinson|John Coker|Mary Schepp|Rhonda Derring
column40:
I have used this facility several times for RFA procedures. They are compassionate and very efficient. The doctor I see is very good!|I wouldn't even give this one Star. If you have chronic pain that keeps you unable to do daily life activities without having this pain eating at you in the back of your mind constantly, do not go here.

The admin and nursing staff were nice enough. So was Dr George Lin. He was...pleasant, but you quickly feel as though you're just another faceless patient, a number on a sheet, a nice bill.

My appointments were spaced four to six months apart. As I'm reading the office notes from my records printout (I'm going to another pain management place and needed the records), I see that on the notes it says that my last appointment, 12/30/20, says to return on 4/30/21. This is a lie. I was told to make an appointment for June, so I did for 6/09/21. It also says to contact him if my symptoms worsen or fail to improve. I was never told this in our appointment, so this is also a lie. On my first appointment, 8/25/20, it says to return on 11/25/20. I was told to return at the end of December. Another lie. Again, contact him if my simpsons worsen or fail to improve. This was not told to me. Another lie.

I already knew I had a herniated disc at L4-5 from a previous injury in 2012. I received my MRI results a day after my MRI via the Sentara app, and it turns out I have two more bulging discs at L2-3 and L3-4 with an annular tear at L3-4. I was never contacted by his office to go over the test results. I had to Google what an annular tear is to figure out what this new issue is.

Basically, I'm in a lot of freaking pain. I get maybe 4 hours of sleep a night before I wake up with horrible slicing pain across my lower back and around my hips. Sometimes, it runs down my right buttock and down to my right knee. I cannot put even the slightest finger pressure on my lower spine without sharp pain.

I live every day in hell with this pain. If you're like this, then this is definitely not the doctor for you. Minor injuries or acute pain, sure. But lifestyle changing pain, definitely not because you are not a person here. You are just words and numbers on a chart.|My experience was wonderful. The receptionist made me feel welcome. The waiting area was clean and the wait times were minimal. The nurses in the back seem happy to be there and were helpful.

The doctor I saw was professional and made me laugh. He was patient with me to help me understand what his thoughts were on my condition and what possible options are available.|Terrible experience. I 1st saw Dr. Lin who was very informed of my condition but only gave me pamphlet with exercises, offered me drugs  but no lasting solutions. Said I could do injections which would take 2-weeks to schedule. Called to schedule and the 1st appointment was 2 - Months away. If you are in serious pain, this IS NOT the place to go. I will never use a Sentara run practice again as it was a complete waist of time and they only care about milking your insurance.|Dr george Lin was the most passive doctor i have ever encountered. He didnt care to acknowledge my pain or what he had already prescribed and when i went to explain this he gave me a look of shock. He asked me " what i wanted" i told him hes the doctor. Spoke with his manager a very nice gentleman. He should be the doctor. Beware people. Choose wisely|Very disappointed with this facility. First, everyone involved was very nice, professional and seemed to know their jobs very well. The problem was with billing. I was seen for an eval and scheduled for spinal injections to hopefully relieve my back and leg pains. I asked at that time, what my cost share would be. I was told they would submit the paperwork to the insurance company and they would let me know before the procedure. They also suggested I could call Sentara billing for an answer.

Well I call Sentara billing and first they can't even find the procedure code. Then they give me an estimate of several thousands of dollars (for a similar code). So I asked what my cost share would be; they don't know. I'm told I need to call my insurance company for that information. I call the insurance company and they say they can't provide an estimate unless the provider submits a pre-authorization request. A request the provider told me they were already submitting, so I figure I'll just want and see.

Well a few days before the procedure, I get a call to confirm the appointment. I asked about the cost share. They tell me, a pre-approval wasn't needed so they did not submit one to the insurance company and they don't know what my cost share will be. So I tell them if I can't get at least a reasonable estimate of the cost share I need to cancel the appointment. No attempt as resolution, appointment canceled.

Completely unacceptable. Who thinks it's reasonable for a customer to enter into a transaction without knowing at least an estimated price? It could be $41 or $4100. Big difference and Sentara should know better.|If you are looking for alternative solutions for pain, this is fine.  They prescribe non-opiod meds, prefer you go to physical therapy, and offer injections. It can get frustrating if those don't work for you. But, at least you tried and then you can go to another pain mgmt. that may prescribe pain meds.|Wait times are extremely long.

column3:
OrthoVirginia in Mechanicsville, Virginia serves patients seeking specialized orthopedic care and pain management solutions throughout the Richmond metropolitan area. Under the expert guidance of Dr. C. Matthew Gibellato, the practice delivers comprehensive physical medicine and rehabilitation services with a focus on improving mobility, reducing pain, and enhancing overall quality of life. The Mechanicsville location offers state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment facilities in a convenient setting accessible to residents across Hanover County and surrounding communities.

Dr. Matthew Gibellato is a distinguished physiatrist specializing in advanced pain management techniques and physical medicine. Board-certified in physical medicine and rehabilitation, Dr. Gibellato brings exceptional expertise to his practice at OrthoVirginia. His comprehensive approach integrates evidence-based interventions with personalized treatment plans to address complex musculoskeletal conditions and chronic pain disorders.

In addition to his clinical practice, Dr. Gibellato serves as an assistant professor within the physical medicine and rehabilitation pain fellowship at Virginia Commonwealth University, where he contributes to training the next generation of pain management specialists. This academic role reflects his commitment to advancing the field through education and research.

Services and Specialties

At OrthoVirginia's Mechanicsville location, patients benefit from a wide range of specialized services including:

  • Comprehensive pain management solutions

  • Non-surgical orthopedic treatments

  • Rehabilitation therapy programs

  • Interventional procedures for chronic pain

  • Sports medicine and injury recovery

  • Diagnostic evaluations for musculoskeletal conditions

Location and Contact Information

OrthoVirginia's Mechanicsville office is conveniently located at 8200 Meadowbridge Rd #200, Mechanicsville, VA 23116. Patients can schedule consultations with Dr. Gibellato by calling +1 804-730-2121 or visiting the practice's website at www.orthovirginia.com. The facility offers ample parking and accessibility features to ensure a comfortable visit for all patients.
column11: Dr. Matthew Gibellato specializes in physiatry and pain management. He is board-certified in physical medicine and rehabilitation and is an assistant professor within the physical medicine and rehabilitation pain fellowship at Virginia Commonwealth University.

column40:
Dr. Gibellato is amazing. I have had spine issues for over 20 years and he is the first specialist to listen to me. He didn't dismiss, gaslight or make me feel like it was all in my head. He was very caring and compassionate. I would highly recommend him if you need to see a specialist for back pain.|I've had 2 injections by Dr. Gibellato and he is such a wonderful person. I love the vibes I get from him and he really does seem to care about the well being of his patients. Thank you!!|Dr Gibellato performed an RFA ion my lumbar spine. I had one done 3 years ago at a different practice and it was one of the most painful experiences I've ever had. I was so afraid to have it done again but I knew I needed to. I told the staff and Dr Gibellato about my prior experience and they all assured me that what I experienced before wasn't normal.. He promised me I wouldn't feel pain like that with him and he was a man of his word. Whenever I began to feel pain, he numbed me more and the pain stopped. He took into consideration that I also have Fibromyalgia and that causes me to feel more pain than someone who does not. Because of him, this RFA was no more painful than having a cavity filled. He explained everything prior to the procedure and as things came up during the procedure. He constantly asked how I was doing while the procedure was in progress. His bedside manner, understanding and empathy were like nothing I've experienced from a provider. The entire staff was fabulous. If you've had a bad experience with pain management in the past, I'd really encourage you to consider at least meeting with Dr. Gibellato.  I'm so grateful for him.|First let me say what was great about the whole time at the procedure ward. My doctor is the best. I trust him, feel very well taken care of by him and will always feel that he is looking out for my best interest. The staff in the procedure room are also some of the best.
The prep staff should all be fired and a new staff bought in and trained on how to treat patients, to make them feel like a person and not something that they can treat like a dog. I'm sorry I bet they treat their dog better than what I saw, heard and felt like I was treated and others around me.
I hate writing a review like this. If you can look back you will see that I have written more positive reviews then negative ones.|Very pleasant visit here. Waiting time was short. Staff were caring and friendly. Dr. Gibellatto talked to me during the injections making sure I was ok. I would definitely recommend this office to others!|They did a fantastic job and he explained everything he was doing to make me feel comfortable. As long as I know what he is doing i can deal with it|My husband, Charles, is the patient, I do the bookkeeping. Dr. "G" is our favorite doctor!  He is a straight talker, tells you like it is, then he helps my husband feel better.  We credit Dr. G with the fact that my husband keeps going as well as he does at age 87! Thanks!

What we said above is still true. Dr. "G" is the best.  His staff at every facility is excellent also.  He really does have the nicest people working with him.|I love Dr Gibellato! He has been my Spine doctor for years. He listens to his patients while finding the best solution. He's very professional and nice every visit. At every procedure he makes you feel comfortable and makes sure everything is straight before he starts. He's absolutely the best!

column3:
Collaborative Pain Management, PLLC serves Fairfax, Virginia and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Founded on the principle that effective pain treatment requires a personalized approach, this specialized clinic has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in Northern Virginia. The practice combines evidence-based medical interventions with holistic strategies to address both the symptoms and underlying causes of chronic pain conditions.

Collaborative Pain Management is led by an experienced Nurse Practitioner who dedicates ample time to each patient consultation. Unlike many high-volume practices, CPM prioritizes thorough assessments and individualized treatment planning. This patient-centered approach allows for comprehensive care that addresses the complex nature of pain management, ensuring that each person receives the attention and expertise they deserve.

Comprehensive Treatment Philosophy

The practice focuses on three primary goals: improving overall function, enhancing quality of life, and effectively managing pain. Rather than simply masking symptoms, the team at Collaborative Pain Management works with patients to develop sustainable strategies that promote long-term wellness. Treatment plans may incorporate medication management, therapeutic interventions, lifestyle modifications, and complementary approaches based on the latest research in pain science.

Personalized Solutions for Your Pain Management Goals

Understanding that each patient's experience with pain is unique, Collaborative Pain Management offers customized treatment options aligned with individual goals and preferences. Whether you're struggling with chronic back pain, neuropathy, post-surgical pain, or other persistent pain conditions, the clinic's approach focuses on finding the right solution for your specific situation and desired outcomes.

Visit their website at www.cpm-clinic.com or call +1 703-615-8422 to schedule a consultation. The clinic is conveniently located at 10400 Eaton Place, Fairfax, VA 22030, United States.
column11: Collaborative Pain Management is led by an experienced Nurse Practitioner who has the time to provide individualized care. The goals are to improve overall function, quality of life, and pain. Find the right solution for your goals.

column40: Michelle is the kindest, sharpest, most creative, and smartest medical professional I have had the pleasure of working with. I was afraid that I was going to suffer the rest of my life because of my injuries from the line of duty. Because of how caring and amazing that she is, my life has turned around. I am marrying an Angel soon, living a wholesome life, and able to wake up each day looking forward to living. There is a ton of information I could write down, but in reality, the best thing I can say is that Michelle saved me in dozens of ways. She takes the time to take complete care of each patient, practices a true collaborative approach, listens to your needs, and makes sure to treat everything that a patient needs to become a whole person again. It is truly an honor to know Michelle, because she is such a good person. I can't recommend her enough, but also want to be selfish with her to ensure that she is always available to help me.|Michelle is a compassionate, understanding,knowledgeable Nurse Practitioner with many years experience to offer her patients.  She is thorough and doesn't hesitate to go the extra mile to get what her patient needs.  She has thoroughly helped me with her medical massages and her support in dealing with my pain.  I trust her to provide resources that will further my journey to relief.  She has been an incredible addition to my medical clinicians.  Thank you Michelle!|Michelle is the BEST! She treats your pain, not mask it! She truly cares about her patients too! Her trigger point injections are heaven!|Michelle is the best doctor I had thank you Michelle for helping me you are the best|||

Sentara Pain Management Specialists serves Hampton, Virginia with comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. As a dedicated department of Sentara CarePlex Hospital, their team of specialists brings advanced expertise to the Hampton Roads community through evidence-based treatment approaches and personalized care plans. Their board-certified physicians work closely with patients to identify pain sources and develop effective management strategies that improve quality of life.

The specialists at Sentara Pain Management Specialists are board certified by The American Academy of Pain Management, representing the highest level of professional qualification in pain medicine. Their comprehensive approach includes thorough evaluation of all pain types, from post-surgical discomfort to complex chronic conditions. The team studies pain mechanisms, physiological responses, medication efficacy, and alternative therapies to create multidisciplinary treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Comprehensive Pain Solutions

Patients benefit from a wide range of treatment options addressing various pain concerns, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and cancer-related pain. The specialists employ advanced diagnostic techniques to identify underlying causes before recommending appropriate interventions that may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy, and complementary approaches.

Location and Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about their services, patients can call 757-827-2230. Additional information about their practice and the Sentara healthcare network is available on their website at sentara.com.
column11: Sentara Pain Management Specialists are board certified by The American Academy of Pain Management. They focus on managing all types of pain - studying what causes it, how the body reacts to it, how different medications dull or eliminate the pain and how other treatments can be used to relieve many pain concerns. They are trained in the evaluation and therapy of all pain types. A Department of Sentara CarePlex Hospital.

column38: Renan|Michelle Hope Lamb|Angela Draper|Sassy Mama|Jonah Pacio|Jaimie Miller|J. De Champern|Kim Gehr
column40:
These one/two-star reviews exist for a reason--I recommend avoiding this location.

I made two visits to this location and had a third one scheduled.

During one of those visits, I waited over an hour past my appointment time to see the doctor. While waiting 15-20 minutes is understandable, waiting an entire hour and being dismissed when I inquired about the delay was off-putting. My appointment was at 8:30 am, and the office opens at 8:00 am, yet I was told, "Yeah, well there are people ahead of you," even though the waiting room had their first patient of the day when I arrived. An hour delay as one of the first patients of the day? Things happen, but if people are running late, just say so--don't dismiss the customer as if they're wrong for asking.

For my third visit, it was canceled just a few days prior, and I was rescheduled for six weeks out! The reason? The doctor went on vacation. When I called a few weeks before this delayed appointment to better understand possible recovery, I couldn't reach anyone. When I finally did, I was told to call back the following week.

Which leads to my most recent interaction. The call began professionally and respectfully; however, when they started to backtrack on their word about the processes/policies in place and concerns discussed previously, my inquiries were quickly dismissed. Some front staff members, particularly MCJ, are unprofessional--interrupting patients, dismissing valid questions, and doubling down when confronted about their disrespect, exacerbating the situation. Naturally, a patient will be frustrated when there's inconsistency along with, curt and dismissive responses, when they just want to better understand their upcoming medical procedures.

Invest in some customer service training for your staff.

By the notes they placed on the Sentara App, it's clear they will continue to find a way to blame the patient/customer for negative interactions, despite their evident lack of professionalism.

I'm not perfect, and I try to be a reasonable individual, but the way I was treated while trying to get answers and clarification is unacceptable; not to mention the significant delay to be seen after the scheduled appointment time.

The only reason I'm giving two stars is because of the one nurse in the discharge area who is very polite and genuinely tries to help the customer, rather than making their experience more difficult.|I went several years ago to this place because my neuro's office is below him. I watched the front office staff verbally abuse a man who was mentally handicapped. It went on loudly in front of the entire waiting room. I spoke to the nurse about it and when the doctor came in he wouldn't speak to me, he'd only give me 2 trigger point injections where he wanted them to go and left with me face down asking him questions. I finally realized he'd gone. No one told me to sit up or help me up or anything. When I got up the nurse was just sitting there looking at me like I was so pitiful. I said he didn't hear a thing I said did he. She just shook her head and left the room. I should have known not to see this "doctor" because at my first visit I was given questions about sex abuse, do I go to AA, do I have friends in 12 step groups. I wasn't even there for pain meds. And when I finally saw him he wouldn't answer my questions, he'd just grunt at me.|I was a patient of Ali Baalaki. The nursing staff was very professional, and courteous. I have never been so humiliated and disgusted, as I was on that day. My initial appointment was for back pain. He came in shook my hand, and than completely medical gaslighted me during the 5 minute visit. Your overweight, do you exercise? How many times? This is how the conversation started. I asked if I could get something in writing to reduce my hours so I wouldn't have to be on my feet for 8 hours with my back hurting bad as it was. I was told that's for disability, and your not getting it. Just nasty. I will not EVER return back to this practice, because of my experience, and the lack of empathy, and sympathy!!|I had a steroid injection by Dr. Baalbaki and couldn't be more pleased with the whole procedure. The nurses were awesome in coaching me along and Dr. Baalbaki did so as well. They are a very caring and competent group. Many thanks to all of you for a job well done.|I have an appt at 3:00 pm. But the lady called me to come at 10:30 instead. I told her I cant because my husband drove me to work, i just said I will come before 2 or early as I can. I came 140 and waiting for more than a hours, the front desk said that they keep my appt at 3pm. So, whats the reason of coming early. I havent eaten yet because I am not allowed to eat for 6 hours before the injection.|I was a patient of Dr. Lin's, on a weak pain killer for my chronic pain which comes from numerous different things that definitely warrant pain management. So after being on this certain medication for over a year, it stopped working... I told her during numerous appointments that I had with her that it stopped working and I stopped taking it and she did and said nothing about it, just kept saying "thing will get better." Well, of course, nothing did get better, and after a few more appointments and drug screens, my future appointment was cancelled without my knowledge, because my drug test came back negative. Told her she knew why that was. Even the medication said it was as needed.

I wouldn't trust this office at all. I'm not sure how the other doctor is, but I did nothing wrong, and now I'm having a hard time finding another pain doctor who will accept me now with my worsening symptoms. My PCP and Wound Healing Doctor keep referring me out left and right and I keep getting denied.|After suffering chronic pain to both of my legs for 2 years due to injuries and surgeries I was finally referred to Dr. Lin for pain management.  Being a new patient I had to wait over a month for an appointment.  When I showed up for the appointment things started out good.  I was called back from the waiting room on time and given the initial check and registration from the nurse, then left to wait for the Doctor.  After a few minutes the nurse came in to tell me I was next and ask if I wanted some water.  I then sat waiting (in a very hard and uncomfortable chair) for 50 minutes.  My appointment time was 8:45, it was now 9:40 and I still had not seen the Doctor and no one came in to check on me or tell me what was going on.  At 9:45 I decided that I had waited long enough, both my legs hurt from sitting in the hard straight backed chair and my knee was starting to swell, it was time to leave and make arrangements with my Doctor to see someone else.  As I was leaving the nurse ask "are you leaving" I said yes, she then got an attitude with me and said "I told you that you we're next".  I said yes but that was over 40 minutes ago, the Doctor is running to late.  Her reply; "She is not running late, she's on time".  So I asked what time my appointment was, "8:45", and what time is it now, "9:45", I thanked her and proceeded out through the waiting room.  She had a few parting words for me as I left but I didn't stop to listen.  As I was passing through the waiting room I was ask to talk with the office manager.  I explained the situation and my feelings on the matter.  Told her I was a reasonable person and if someone had came in, told me they were running late, ask to reschedule or if I wanted to sit back in the waiting room where its more comfortable I would have accepted and been fine with it, but that's not what happened.  The only thing she would offer was to make another appointment.  I told her I would reschedule but only if the Doctor I was going to see would speak with me first about todays visit.  They declined so I didn't schedule another appointment.  After leaving I called my PCP to tell them what happened and ask what to do next.  Getting in to see a pain management specialist is not easy.  They have to review your case and decide if they want to accept you as a patient, it takes a long time.  They agreed that leaving was the right thing to do and that they would have done the same thing in that situation.  Now I'm stuck without pain management treatments or therapies, waiting on a hip replacement to correct 1 injury that I've had 3 surgeries on already.  As well as sever soft tissue injures to my knee, shoulder and elbow that I have to contend with while trying to get them repaired 1 at a time.  I feel that the way I was treated was disrespectful and uncalled for.  Nearly every time I've had to go to the Sentra Careplex  in Hampton I've been treated rudely by Doctors and staff.  I didn't even want to take the referral to them but felt I had no choice if I wanted help... never again.  I will never willingly go into or be taken to this hospital again.  Also, I do not believe the reviews they give themselves on their website.  Compared to reviews from independent review sites they are either "cherry picked" or just false.|It took months to get an appointment here.  Then, when I finally saw the doctor she recommended an injection procedure that she said will solve all my  issues.  I was ecstatic since no one has been able to help me before!  Then, 4 days later the office called to say they do not take my insurance for procedures.  What?  They take my insurance for the doctor visit but NOT for procedures!!  So they want more money than your insurance will pay.  Don't go there and get your hopes up unless you can pay thousands for the miracle procedure they will promise you!
