column2: Virginia Interventional Pain And Spine Center
column3:
Virginia Interventional Pain And Spine Center serves Christiansburg, VA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical facility focuses on interventional techniques to address chronic and acute pain conditions, helping patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life. Since our establishment, we have been committed to providing personalized care plans that minimize reliance on medication while maximizing functional outcomes.

At Virginia Interventional Pain And Spine Center, our board-certified physicians utilize advanced diagnostic tools and innovative treatment modalities to address various pain conditions. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome through minimally invasive procedures. Our interventional approaches include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that considers each patient's unique circumstances. Our team works collaboratively to develop customized treatment plans that may incorporate physical therapy, behavioral health strategies, and interventional procedures. This comprehensive methodology ensures we address not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 80 College St, Christiansburg, VA 24073, our modern facility is equipped with advanced technology for precise diagnosis and treatment. We maintain a comfortable, welcoming environment where patients can discuss their pain concerns and receive expert care in a supportive setting.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at +1 540-251-3472. You can also visit our website at http://vapainsc.com/ to learn more about our services, treatment options, and patient resources. Our dedicated staff is ready to assist you on your journey toward effective pain relief and improved function.
column38: Lindsay M. Pace|Chris Hagreen|caterina calo|Lisa Griffith|Cre Williams|Donna Settle|meranda stafford|Kathy Sweeney
column40:
I have been going to Virginia Interventional Pain and Spine Center for over 5 years now. I drive from Christiansburg to Roanoke because I love Arun Sun, her nurse and the office staff. The treatments have helped my migraines tremendously. Arun has always done a wonderful job, and the front office staff has always been so kind to me. Angel has been, just that, an Angel. I don't know how she deals with the insurance side of things day in and day out. She works hard to make sure my botox arrives prior to my scheduled appointments. If something goes wrong with insurance, she's on top of it and her and Arun will work together to work me in as soon as it arrives. They are the best and I highly recommend. I have been through a lot health wise and even drive 4 hours for one of my doctors. So when I find good people, who care and are good at their jobs, I'll drive far distances. These guys and girls are great!|No problems. Very efficient on patient flow. Was in first time, called back on time, got shot in back, out in 20min after being called.back. Dr. Raju and staff were great. Explained everything, I didn't even know they were done with iniection when they told.me to get up.
And you can call direct for follow-up instead of going back to referring doctor for follow-up to just to have them send you back to pain clinic!! Greatly saves on time, pain,  and money.
This is NOT a pill mill. If you're just looking for pills this ain't the place!! The DO NOT prescribe opiates on a first visit. When I requested them on follow up visit with the PA to help me until next nerve root shot (different nerve), Ms.Rickman rx'd me with no problem. Same when I requested refill on meds after a week and a half, no hassles whatsoever.
FYI they use the Virginia controlled drug tracking system!! And post the report to your record. So don't try doctor shopping.
I've been a "pain clinic" patient before and it's nice to be in one that isn't trying to treat pain with antidepressants, anticonvulsants and other unapproved (by FDA, for pain) meds.
Overall, great service, no hassles. Recommended.
And Louis bird approves  lol.|First off: Fine racket they've got going on her.  Just keep having them come in for steroid shots even if they don't help. Anything else you suggest falls on deaf ears,  after all,  your not the Dr,  your just the patient that feels the pain and knows exactly where it is and not where they say it is.  With that being said,  this was my third visit with Margaret Rickman Pa-C, and given the third try, the benefit of doubt. I've come to the conclusion I was completely right. Needs to go back to her cheerleader days, where she can have the standing ovations she was used too. She's dismissive. Likes to hear herself talk,  does not like to be questioned on her recommendations, even though it's your body, your pain. Just going off reports,  she miraculously knows what is right for you.... PERIOD! It's funny how I already knew what kind of person she was,  without even knowing her. She's used to having patients that just nod their heads yes to her ever whim and praise her. Clocks out, gets her nails done,  everyone tells her how perfect she is and collects her check. Ms. Popular, center stage college years,  carried over in her professional life leaves a lot to be said about self growth,  compassion and dedication to others and not herself first! But it's hard to do when you've been catered to your entire life.  Never once listening to her patients.  After all, it will interfere with the wonderful racket of collecting on constant spine injections nicely directed over to Dr Raju. Dr. Raju and the nurses are very polite. But this little homecoming queen leaves a lot to be said of her bed side manner and self absorbed attitude. Wouldn't recommend this place for my dog's pain management.|Dr. Raju is so very kind and caring! She truly cares about her patients!!! She is very patient and takes the time to listen to all concerns. I feel the same about her PA Kate Duff. She is also a sweetie that listens and truly cares!! Don't hesitate to make an appointment with them!! Doctors that are sincere and truly care and are exceptionally talented and skillful are so hard to come by!!|Understanding,  sympathetic,  professional,  thorough, careful, have my best interests and health as their priority!! Dr Raju, Dr Rickman, and all nurses and office staff are wonderful!! THANK YOU for helping me with chronic pain!!|I have been seeing Dr. Raju for months now & she is so kind & thorough, & puts your mind at ease. I have been getting shots in my back & have had one Nerve Burn & getting ready to have one on the other side & have yet to feel a needle! I highly recommend her!|I absolutely love going here. The nurses are great and kind, the receptionist is very kind and the Dr is wonderful and also extremely kind! They take good care of you and listen to you. I haven't had any back problems since I've started and I've lived with back problems my whole life!|Dr. Raju is awesome.. The nurses are very caring and explanatory of the procedures. I had a block in my neck and had been in constant pain for over tn years only to have the treatment and be pain free within hours...Definitely recommend a consultation...

Augusta Health Pain Management Clinic serves Fishersville, VA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized team of board-certified physicians and advanced practice providers offers personalized treatment plans designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Since our establishment, we have been committed to improving quality of life for patients throughout the Shenandoah Valley region through evidence-based interventions and compassionate care.

At Augusta Health Pain Management Clinic, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, combining interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique needs of our patients, focusing on both symptom relief and functional improvement.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Located at 70 Medical Center Dr #305, Fishersville, VA 22939, our clinic is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies. Our modern facility provides a comfortable environment where patients can receive cutting-edge treatments such as nerve blocks, epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other minimally invasive procedures designed to target pain at its source.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing strong physician-patient relationships built on trust and open communication. Our team takes the time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, medical history, and pain experience to develop effective treatment strategies. We work collaboratively with primary care providers and other specialists to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of our patients' health and well-being.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at (540) 932-5747. Additional information about our practice can be found on our website at https://www.augustahealth.com/practice/augusta-health-pain-management-clinic/. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to all patients in need.
column38: Enga Knicely|18 Wheeles Rollin|Rori Farris|Glenna Hale|Childs Family|Josh Shover|David McDaniels|Dawn Johnson
column40:
I did not even get an opportunity to be seen at this office. They told me I would have to attend and complete physical therapy before I could make an appointment with them. I asked the lady if this was their office policy or if it was pertaining to my insurance not covering the visit until I completed physical therapy. Without contacting my insurance company she made this assumption and when I called my insurance company to confirm this I was informed that my insurance did not require me to complete or even attend physical therapy in order for them to fully cover the injection I was referred to their office to get. So when I called the office back to let them know this they continued to argue with me that the all insurance companies they have ever dealt with required physical therapy first. I  would not want to be seen at this office at  all in fear that they do not know what they are doing when it comes to billing and insurance practices. They should never make an assumptions based on everyone else's insurance.|I had some shots done.. I had a couple of bulging discs and herniated disc in my back. I felt okay for a day or two. Then it got real bad. I called them. There must be a nurse there named Robin.. while explaining what I was going through and trying to understand what the hell was happening.  She literally hung up on me. Completely unprofessional I didn't even bother calling back because I knew I would lose my shit. Don't go here. It's been over a week and I still can't walk. I was in better shape before I had the shots. Whether or not it'll get better in a couple weeks I don't know. But at this point right now I don't appreciate being hung up on in the middle of a phone call. Find someplace else to go|Stanley Hatcher does not care about you. This man treated me as if I was medication seeking when I was begging for an MRI so we could see the damage to my spine. Refused to listen to my concerns. I do not walk straight anymore. My feet drop. The weakness in my legs has worsened in the course of a few months and he did not care. He did not listen to me. I did the PT that insurance wanted to approve the MRI. Stanley decided not to disclose ANY treatment that was done, to the insurance so they denied my MRI AGAIN. He is a horrible excuse for a doctor and is in the wrong career. Not to mention how many times he canceled my appointments due to "personal reasons" and took me another month after to get in. He is dismissive, arrogant, and lazy.
***Wanted to add that they were also rude to my PCP who just wanted to get my records so he could refer me somewhere else and found that they lied in my records as well. Claiming I didn't meet requirements for an MRI. My spine is severely damaged. Their negligence could have cost me my ability to walk. Save yourself and go elsewhere.|I have had an awesome experience with this clinic. Justin Nolan PA C saw me first. I admit I was very nervous and he put me at ease and gave me hope for my back issues. He gave me options and I chose to have steroid injections. That was today with Dr Greer whom was so kind, explained everything he was about to do in terms I could understand and what I could expect before and afterwards. Everyone treated me with respect, a smile on their faces, took their time with me, allowed me to ask questions and were very patient. This goes for everyone I came in contact with from registrars, nurses, Doctors, Medical Student, the Pa and for anyone I may have not mentioned. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.|STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE! THEY DONT CARE ABOUT PAITENTS OR THEIR PAIN. THEY LIE, THEY ARE UNPROFESSIONAL,  ALL THIS PLACE WILL DO IS ADD MENTAL PAIN TO YOUR PHYSICAL PAIN!!
Id rate this place 0 stars if i could. This is the by far the worse experience of my life.  Front desk is rude and argumentative the doctors and nurses don't care about the patients or their pain. Literally iv had 3 surgeries done at agusta health can barley walk due to the pain. Even with the assistance of 2 braces and a cane. . Had a surgery for an scs implant scheduled for the 19th of Oct to be called a few days before and told they have to reschedule me ta be told they don't know when when I asked them what day.... then because I told them that they are unprofessional handling my surgery like that. They dropped me as a patient claiming that "my treatment of staff was inappropriate " stay away from this place.  They don't care about anything but themselves. They need ta be shut down|Kevin Greer and staff are wonderful very informative just great people I've had two spinal surgeries in 2022 after the 2nd September 12 of 22 pretty much been in constant pain since then Dr Greer talk to me while I was getting injections make sure I wasn't I too much pain very patient with me just great person and great staff he doing everything in his power to keep me from having another surgery i just really thankful for that. I had a np of neurosurgery at uva Karen Clark was same way just absolutely super people I just thankful they patient with a old courty boy like me that just doesn't understand all that been going on god bless them|I'd advise people to go ANYWHERE but here. They performed injections in the wrong place three times before finally one of the doctors at the office realized it. After the 4th injection in the correct place, I couldn't receive any further injections because the insurance would only pay for 4 a year and they'd already paid for the ones the doctors at this office screwed up.

The rest of the office is just as incompetent. They don't return phone calls or care that you've had to go to the ER. They'll make notes claiming they made calls they didn't. They also put things in the patient chart that were never said.

Avoid this clinic at all costs.|I have to an anterior cervical discectomy and fusion of the C5-C7 vertibras can't get surgery til 11/10/22. Dr Toussi thinks increasing my muscle relaxers or switching to a new one will help my pain. Or injections that do nothing. No. He is afraid to help patients who have real pain. He chooses #profitsoverpatients when we need #patientsoverprofits

column48: Do I need a primary care dr to refer me
column49: Yes, we do require a referral from your primary care doctor. This is because we treat chronic pain and need the doctor notes, imaging, etc. Thanks.

column3:
Inova Comprehensive Pain Center - Fairfax serves residents throughout Fairfax County, Virginia with specialized care for those suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our state-of-the-art facility is strategically located in the Innovation Park area, making advanced pain management accessible to patients from across Northern Virginia. As part of the renowned Inova Health System, our center combines medical excellence with compassionate care, focusing on comprehensive treatment plans tailored to each individual's unique pain challenges.

At Inova Comprehensive Pain Center, we believe in addressing pain through multiple approaches. Our multidisciplinary team includes board-certified pain specialists, behavioral health experts, physical therapists, and other healthcare professionals who collaborate to develop personalized treatment strategies. We offer advanced interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, psychological support, and innovative therapies designed to improve quality of life while reducing reliance on opioid medications.

Expert Team Approach

What sets our center apart is our team-based methodology. Rather than treating pain as an isolated symptom, we examine how it affects all aspects of a patient's life. Our specialists work together to address both the physical and emotional components of pain, creating comprehensive care plans that evolve with your needs. This integrated approach has helped countless patients return to activities they love and regain control over their daily lives.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 8081 Innovation Park Dr #900, Fairfax, VA 22031, our modern facility offers a comfortable, supportive environment for all appointments and treatments. We're one of two specialized pain centers serving Fairfax County, ensuring convenient access to top-tier pain management services. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (571) 472-6880.

Visit our website at www.inova.org/locations/inova-comprehensive-pain-center-fairfax to explore our full range of treatment options and patient resources.
column11: Inova Comprehensive Pain Centers offer a comprehensive range of services for people living with acute or chronic pain. Through the combined expertise of a multidisciplinary team of pain and behavioral health specialists, we offer the most advanced treatment options currently available in a supportive, compassionate environment located in two locations in Fairfax County.
column38: Mitchell Tobias|Alex Q|Bethany Bledsoe|Eva G|Mallak Riyadh|Raghu Ardeishar|heather martinez
column40:
Accurate injections and excellent symptom relief. No opioids turns off some patients.|Most useless, misleading facility ever. I was sent two bills, charged $1500, to be told by a nurse that they couldn't help because they were moving offices. I was charged for anesthesia services when literally there was no treatment given. In all my years, I have never seen billing practices like this. Stay away. Trust me. Advanced Spine and Pain serves Arlington, VA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using innovative, minimally invasive techniques. Located conveniently in the heart of Arlington, our clinic has been helping patients regain mobility and improve quality of life for over a decade.

At Advanced Spine and Pain, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment. Our services include spinal injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, physical therapy, and medication management. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs of our patients, focusing on both immediate pain relief and long-term recovery strategies.

Our Expert Medical Team

Our clinic is staffed by fellowship-trained pain specialists who stay at the forefront of pain management advancements. Our physicians combine their extensive medical knowledge with compassionate care, ensuring that each patient receives the attention and treatment they deserve. We work collaboratively with referring physicians to provide coordinated care that addresses all aspects of a patient's health.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life. That's why we take the time to listen to our patients, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop comprehensive treatment plans that align with their goals and lifestyle. Our friendly staff ensures a comfortable experience from the initial consultation through ongoing care.

Visit Our Arlington Location

Advanced Spine and Pain welcomes new patients at our Arlington office located at 1715 N George Mason Dr STE 102, Arlington, VA 22205. To schedule a consultation, call us at (703) 436-1314 or visit our website at www.advancedspineandpain.com. We accept most major insurance plans and offer convenient appointment scheduling to accommodate our patients' busy lives.

column3:
OrthoVirginia serves Richmond, Virginia with comprehensive orthopedic and pain management care. Our specialized team provides evidence-based treatments for musculoskeletal conditions, helping patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life. With state-of-the-art facilities and a patient-centered approach, we're committed to delivering exceptional care to the Richmond community and surrounding areas.

Dr. Justin Dumont is a distinguished specialist in interventional pain management and physical medicine and rehabilitation (physiatry). His practice is characterized by a functional approach to assessing and treating disorders of the spine and musculoskeletal system. Dr. Dumont is deeply passionate about forming partnerships with his patients, working to understand how pain impacts their ability to perform the activities they value most in their daily lives.

Specialized Care Approach

At our Boulders Parkway location, Dr. Dumont applies his extensive training and expertise to develop personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain and dysfunction. His comprehensive approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with rehabilitative strategies to optimize patient outcomes and restore function.

Personal Background

Beyond his professional dedication, Dr. Dumont enjoys a fulfilling family life with his wife and four active children, supporting their academic and athletic pursuits. In his leisure time, he maintains an active lifestyle through working out, running, and hiking. Dr. Dumont also enjoys traveling and is an avid sports enthusiast, particularly following Liverpool Football Club and Pittsburgh sports teams.

Contact Information

Phone: +1 804-320-1339

Address: 1115 Boulders Pkwy #100, Richmond, VA 23225, United States

Website: www.orthovirginia.com/providers/justin-d-dumont

In his free time, he enjoys working out, running, hiking, traveling and watching Liverpool Football Club and Pittsburgh sports.

column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Harrisonburg serves patients throughout Harrisonburg, Virginia and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. As part of one of the nation's largest pain management practices, our Harrisonburg location delivers specialized care for individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions. The center combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment approaches to address a wide range of pain-related issues, all delivered by board-certified specialists dedicated to improving patients' quality of life.

Established in 2011 through the rebranding of The Spine Center, National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) has experienced remarkable expansion over the years. A significant milestone occurred in 2012 when NSPC partnered with Capitol Spine & Pain, substantially increasing our network's reach. Later that same year, our affiliation with New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians) further strengthened our presence across the eastern United States, bringing our total to over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers serving patients across D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At our Harrisonburg facility, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. Our multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge treatments with personalized care plans designed to address each patient's unique needs. We strive to not only manage symptoms but to identify and treat the underlying causes of pain, helping patients regain functionality and improve their overall well-being.

Services and Treatments

Our comprehensive services include advanced diagnostic procedures, minimally invasive interventions, medication management, and innovative therapies for conditions ranging from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndromes. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient, with a focus on sustainable pain relief and improved function.

Visit Our Harrisonburg Location

Located at 1500 Brookhaven Dr, Suite 1, Harrisonburg, VA 22801, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (540) 434-1759 or visit our website at www.treatingpain.com/harrisonburg.
column11: National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) is one of the nation's largest pain management practices in the United States. Formed in 2011 with a re-brand of The Spine Center - NSPC quickly expanded, partnering with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012. We strive to bring high quality providers in the specialty of pain management together to offer an extensive network to meet the needs of an ever growing population of patients living in chronic pain. In late 2012 our affiliations grew with the addition of New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians), bringing our number of centers to over 60 with close to 100 providers in D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia and West Virginia.

column2: Richmond Spine Interventions and Pain Center
column3:
Richmond Spine Interventions and Pain Center serves Midlothian, Virginia and the greater Richmond area with specialized interventional pain management services. Our board-certified physicians focus exclusively on minimally invasive procedures designed to diagnose and treat chronic pain conditions, particularly those affecting the spine. Since our founding, we have been committed to providing compassionate care using the latest evidence-based techniques to help patients return to their normal activities with reduced pain and improved function.

At Richmond Spine Interventions and Pain Center, we offer a comprehensive range of advanced pain management procedures, including:

  • Spinal Injection Techniques - Precisely targeted epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, and nerve blocks

  • Spinal Cord Stimulation - Cutting-edge neuromodulation therapy for chronic back and leg pain

  • Kyphoplasty - Minimally invasive procedure to treat vertebral compression fractures

  • Radiofrequency Ablation - Targeted treatment for nerve-related pain

Patient-Centered Approach

Our practice is built on the foundation of personalized care. We take time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, medical history, and pain experience before developing a customized treatment plan. Our goal is not just pain relief, but improved quality of life and functionality for every patient we serve.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Phone: +1 804-378-1800

Address: 14404 Sommerville Ct, Midlothian, VA 23113, United States

Website: www.richmondspinepain.com

Patient Comfort & Experience

column40:
This office is for pain management. I came in with extreme pain in my back, neck, shoulder, and down my arm, caused by a bad fall. I could barely sleep and was miserable. I had been to Dr S before, and he helped me, and my husband. This time he came in and spoke to me a few minutes. He told me I could try trigger point injections (TPI), but they might or might not work (which is fair). He told me I could try gabapentin, but that might nor work either. Then he hurried off leaving me with nothing, zero.  I felt hopeless and abandoned. The thing is, when I went to the front desk to schedule the TPIs, I couldn't get an appointment until a month out!  Here I am in acute pain, probably a 9 or 10 on the pain scale and this is the best they can do for me? Outrageous. I was so inflamed, both physically and emotionally, that I called back a few hours later, and very nicely let them have it. What do you know, I got an appointment for the injections the next morning with his NP. Really? Is this what it takes to be treated fairly and get results?  I might never go back, although he might be the only game in town for pain; I don't know. I just don't trust them anymore.
BTW,  I went to Dr Andrew Reno, chiropractor extraordinaire, and he fixed me right up. I am now pain free.|Finding a sincerely caring doctor is hard to find, but not at National Spine & Pain Center in Fredericksburg.
I've been a patient for awhile and I've never been treated without respect and concern. From the front desk to the treatment rooms, to the care givers, everyone is helpful and caring and kind.
Thank you for taking care of me.|Receptionist was friendly, customer-oriented, and helpful. But the television blaring obnoxious game show in waiting room was obnoxious, and the doctor I saw (Dr. S.) was impatient, dismissive, asked questions but cut me off when I tried to answer, and appeared not to have read any of the information I was asked to provide on their online questionnaire, and appeared not to have read the hard-copy imaging results I brought in. Won't be going back.|Doctor S works very hard to keep me out of pain as a result of arthritis and other complications from previous surgeries, to include hardware. He tries new techniques and available treatments. I have been coming for years. Without Dr S I would not be able to live thru the pain|When I called they we're very polite and concerned,  my appointment  was made for the Next Day! (That's  never happened) i was seen within  minutes  of my arrival.Everyone I had contract with during  my appointment  was understanding, kind and helpful. Tests were ordered,  a plan was set up, I felt Heard, I felt cared for. I actually  look forward to my next appointment. I will not be going back to that office.|They take medicaid which makes my life so much easier and are willing to do so much to help you. Alexandra is amazing, she even said she'd argue with my insurance if they don't want to pay for my physical therapy. I always have a relieving experience when I come in.|Friendly and professional staff who took the time to fully understand my medical issues, work with me to determine what treatments should lead to positive outcomes and resolve any concerns that I had.

column3:
OrthoVirginia serves Richmond, VA with specialized orthopedic and pain management care. Dr. Patrick A. Oley leads our interventional pain management services, bringing his expertise to patients throughout the Richmond metropolitan area. Our state-of-the-art facility at 7650 E Parham Rd, Suite 100, provides comprehensive care in a comfortable, patient-centered environment designed to address complex pain conditions through innovative techniques and personalized treatment plans.

Dr. Patrick Oley specializes in interventional pain management, combining his background in anesthesiology with advanced procedural techniques to address chronic and acute pain conditions. He is passionate about the multidisciplinary approach of interventional pain medicine, embracing the challenges of this dynamic and rapidly evolving field. Dr. Oley's practice incorporates both the technical aspects of pain management and the essential human connection that helps patients navigate their pain journey.

Specialized Treatment Approach

At the core of Dr. Oley's practice is his expertise in ultrasound and fluoroscopic guided procedures, which he employs for both diagnostic and therapeutic purposes. These advanced techniques allow for precise treatment delivery while minimizing discomfort and recovery time. Dr. Oley's comprehensive approach aims not only to reduce pain but also to improve overall functioning and quality of life for his patients.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

What truly distinguishes Dr. Oley's practice is his commitment to continuity of care and building meaningful connections with patients. He recognizes that each individual has a unique story and specific reasons for experiencing pain. By taking the time to understand these personal narratives, Dr. Oley can better identify pain sources and develop tailored treatment plans that address both symptoms and underlying causes.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Patrick A. Oley at OrthoVirginia, please call +1 804-288-3136. Our Richmond office is conveniently located at 7650 E Parham Rd, Suite 100, Richmond, VA 23294. For more information about Dr. Oley's credentials and approach to pain management, visit our provider page.
column11: Dr. Patrick Oley specializes in interventional pain management. Interventional pain medicine incorporates the procedural aspects that he enjoyed from anesthesiology while allowing him to practice in a clinic setting. Dr. Oley is able to utilize ultrasound and fluoroscopic guided procedures for both diagnostic and therapeutic purposes with the goals of improving patients' pain and functioning. However, he most enjoys the continuity of care and the opportunity he has to make connections with his patients. Every patient has a different story and reason for being in pain. Finding the source of thei...

Dr Oley and his team are amazing, the care and dedication to his patients is apparent in each interaction I've had with him. When I started having discomfort during a recent procedure with him, he paused and made sure I was fully comfortable before continuing and kept making sure I was okay the entire time. He listens and cares for you.

Beyond that you can tell his team respects him and that they all get along well. The atmosphere throughout the whole process was comfortable, everyone I came into contact with was very positive, kind and caring! It was such a positive experience I hope that if I need a repeat procedure I have the luxury of having Dr.Oley and his wonderful team again. Thank you Dr.Oley, and your team for all of your hard work!|Dr. OLEY and the team of nurses - (names redacted for privacy ) all were amazing and comforting. I'm sure I am not the most serious case they have seen that day, but I've been in pain since mid July and it's a new experience. They made me feel comfortable as if I were the first patient of the day.
Dr. Oley listened to me before during and after the procedure and has done so since first my first visit. This entire experience is new, back pain, injections and I hope can be my last but thanks to this team- not a bad one experience. Thank you.|Dr. Oley is amazing! column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Winchester serves patients throughout Winchester, Virginia and surrounding areas with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists focuses on addressing the unique needs of each patient through comprehensive, personalized treatment plans. Located conveniently on the Winchester Medical Center Campus, we provide advanced interventional techniques and multidisciplinary approaches to help patients find relief from chronic pain conditions.

At National Spine & Pain Centers - Winchester, we offer a wide range of treatments for various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic disorders. Our specialists employ evidence-based interventions such as epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. By employing a team-based approach, we ensure each patient receives expert care tailored to their specific condition and lifestyle needs.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. That's why our treatment philosophy centers on developing individualized care plans that address not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain. Our specialists take the time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and explain treatment options in clear, understandable terms.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Our office is strategically located at 525 Amherst St, Suite 104, Winchester, VA 22601, on the Winchester Medical Center Campus. Patients benefit from ample parking available in the designated purple parking lot, making visits stress-free and accessible. Our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology to provide the highest standard of care.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (540) 931-0400. You can also visit our website at www.treatingpain.com/winchester for additional information about our treatments, providers, and patient resources.
column11: National Spine & Pain Centers - Winchester is focused on addressing the unique needs of each patient. There is ample parking available in the purple parking lot.

column40:
Awful. Just plain awful. Let's start with the Admin that are glued to their phone and look annoyed when your are at the window. They are plain rude. They forgot to get my copay one day and instead of sending me a letter, email or call they sent it to collections after 1 month. The NP Steve was horrid. I asked why I couldn't see a Dr and he said why would I need to and he had the worst bedside manner. He grilled me on my meds before realizing they were very old and used for only 3 days for surgery. On top of that 2 appointments were cancelled because they called and because I didn't pick up it was cancelled per the front desk staff. They are looking for a fast buck. Tell you to come back the next week and next week at 40$ a visit with no plan to help. If your looking for compassion and competency then go someplace else|Frustrating experience from start to finish. Rude office. Rude PAs. Incredibly disrespectful to me, so much so that I stopped taking my husband to his appnts. No sense that they actually cared. And this is a PAIN management center. Their patients are in enough pain that they're seeking expert intervention. They actually kicked my husband out of the office and refused to help him further after convincing him to undergo an incredibly expensive surgery. When that didn't relieve his pain fully, they refused to continue meds. Medical marijuana is absolutely against their principles and they refuse to treat anyone who may utilize that for pain relief. If I could give zero stars I would!|Nothing bad to say. They manage my pain meds and are by the book strict.
Edit: 1 star - I went to my appointment and was told that it was cancelled. I said by who? She said I have a note saying we called you last week and she said she left you a message. That's a complete lie. My voice-mail box has been full for thr past year, you can't leave messages. I said, well if I miss an appointment you charge $75... so pay me $75 now for you missing the appointment. Nope. Reschedule. Nah, I'm not playing games with this place. I'll go elsewhere|I took my mother to the pain clinic to see if they could address some issues she was having with her hip arthritis. We had already ruled out a hip replacement because of her age, and she already had injections that were proving to be no longer effective. The whole staff, from office, nurse, and NP were incredibly caring in dealing with my mom. They genuinely seemed supportive of her concerns with pain and worked to come up with a plan to try and help her. They were respectful and definitely made her feel comfortable and appreciated.|I have been with this group for a long time and while they have had some growing pains I have stuck with them and now I can say, at their new location they have are running like a well oiled machine. I am in and out at every visit in a very reasonable amount of time. If I have any problems or concerns, my doctor always takes time to listen and attempt to resolve whatever it may be. I see Drs. Lee and Gopal.  The are both excellent and I am grateful to have them.|The staff, nurses, technicians and doctors at the National Spine & Pain Center in Winchester are exceptional. Their knowledge, patience, and understanding make all the difference to me as a patient that has chronic pain. I recommend them highly.|Stephen Maro didnt send in my PT records with my MRI order so my insurance denied my MRI.  He refuses to call my insurance to submit an appeal with my PT records and he refuses to talk to me directly.  He hides behind his female nurses and makes them deal with my frustration.  Resulting from Stephen Maros incompetence I cannot even see another doctor for an MRI order because the insurance says I have to wait 90 days before I can have another MRI order for the same issue.  Stephen Maro knows I was dealing with pain for over 2 months prior to coming to see him.  I am trying to stay away from medications but he has done nothing but delay my diagnosis.  His lack of professionalism doesnt surprise me after speaking with their office manager Melinda.  I told her I am calling back because no one has returned my call.  Ive been trying to get this resolved for 2 months now but she tells me that I am not being patient enough and hangs up on me.  Stephen Maro, I hope youre reading this.  Its not hard to pick up the phone and talk to your patients when youre billing them $500 an appointment.  Next time instead of hiding behind your nurses when you mess up, own up to your mistakes.|Wow! This place has been an absolute nightmare for me! I have a very complicated disease called sarcoidosis it's 1/590,000 people for multiple organ as mine is about 1/900,000! I had a pain pump installed after which I had complications while on vacation in SC somehow my pump malfunctioned so I called the office and was told to go to nearest ER! No hospital in 200 miles had any type of equipment to read the device! So I called the office and was told " we can't do anything for you until you get back home! So in the hospital I go for 5 days during vacation! Got home went to the office and saw Avery! Worst visit ever! Argued with me that their was no possible way that pump would have failed and to top it off... said you shouldn't leave town if your having health issues!!! The very next visit was with Stephen Maro all he was interested in was looking at my past 3-4 urine samples! Again no relief whatsoever from the meds simply because those 2 being PA and NP think they are above anyone else! We could go on for days about how bad those 2 have treated the wife and myself especially not knowing the first thing about Sarcoidosis! No way would I ever recommend that office! Dr Lee and Dr Gopal are great but you are ruined before it goes to them!

column3:
The Barr Center serves Virginia Beach, VA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded by Dr. Lisa Barr, this specialized medical practice has become a cornerstone of innovative pain treatment in the Hampton Roads area. With over three decades of clinical experience and more than 250,000 patients treated, The Barr Center stands apart through its holistic, root-cause approach to resolving chronic pain conditions.

Dr. Lisa Barr established APM Spine and Sports in 1990 before evolving her practice into The Barr Center to provide more integrated care options. The center's philosophy centers on identifying and addressing the underlying causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms. This approach begins with detailed patient histories and thorough hands-on physical examinations, ensuring each treatment plan is precisely tailored to the individual's specific condition.

Advanced Treatment Modalities

The Barr Center utilizes a diverse range of therapeutic interventions, including:

  • Osteopathic Manipulation - Hands-on techniques to improve mobility and function

  • Image-Guided Injections - Precisely delivered steroid and viscosupplementation treatments

  • Regenerative Therapies - Cutting-edge approaches to promote natural healing

  • Functional Medicine - Addressing underlying biochemical and nutritional factors

Patient-Centered Philosophy

What truly distinguishes The Barr Center is its commitment to "raising the bar" of patient health through comprehensive care. Dr. Barr and her team view pain not as an isolated symptom but as part of a larger health picture that may involve inflammation, biomechanical issues, and systemic factors. This integrated perspective allows for more effective and lasting pain resolution.

Visit The Barr Center

Located at 933 First Colonial Rd #200, Virginia Beach, VA 23454, The Barr Center welcomes patients seeking innovative solutions to chronic pain conditions. To schedule a consultation or learn more about available treatment options, call +1 757-578-2260 or visit www.barrcenter.com.
column11: Lisa Barr, MD has treated more than 250,000 patients over the past 30+ years using innovative pain management therapies. After founding APM Spine and Sports in 1990, she opened The Barr Center in Virginia Beach, VA to bring a more holistic approach to treating pain. She and her team focus on resolving pain issues by targeting the root cause of pain and inflammation. This starts with a detailed history and thorough hands on physical examination and culminates with hands on treatment using osteopathic manipulation as well as image guided injections of steroid, visco. and regenerative therapies. We also incorporate functional medicine testing and treatment, constantly seeking to help our patients raise the bar of their health.

column40:
I can not express my gratitude enough for Dr. Barr! Her expertise in pain management is unparalleled and her commitment to understanding and address my specific concerns has made all the difference. She listened attentively and developed a personalized plan tailored to my needs that has incredibly improved my overall quality of life! Her staff is fun and supportive as well. If your looking for a pain specialist, look no further!|While I have not been to her office or a patient I must say the information given on her website on the Low dose naltrexone page was super helpful! I love how she offered practical life alternatives to LDN as well on the same page. Thank you!|I have struggled with neck pain all year and couldn't understand why someone in their early thirties would have these issues. It seemed to stem from nowhere. I've always been healthy in my food and movement in exercise. And then my PT told me about Dr. Barr. I was nervous at first thinking I'd come in for pain management and be prescribed pills for the rest of my life, but I was sorely mistaken! Dr. Barr uses a functional medicine approach, asking me about my past healthy history and emotional traumas as part of her overall holistic assessment. She made me feel like a person and not another number in a doctors office. The result of her assessment was the need for prolo therapy (similar to PRP). Unfortunately, because this was a regenerative medicine procedure, insurance did not cover it. However, it was exactly what I needed to fix the root cause of my issues with ligament instability in my neck. After three sessions of prolo I am SO much better! My pain levels decreased drastically and I feel like I have a completely different neck, in a good way! I am so glad I bit the bullet and trusted her with this. She will be my go to for any future pain management needs for my husband and I. My next health adventure will be in getting some bloodwork further assessed to determine my husband and I's overall health and identify any areas of concern.
Thank you for everything Dr. Barr and team! The front desk and staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. You can tell they enjoy each others company and have fun at what they do. Good energy all around that place! Don't wait any longer in pain. Make an apt!|Dr. Barr has done more to help me in just 6 weeks than any other Dr I've seen in 4 years!! I have been suffering from chronic upper back pain for far too long. After years of physical therapy, epidural injections, cortisone shots, dry needling,  countless massages, and ultimately a 3 level acdf surgery,  my pain was worse than ever. I decided to see Dr Barr as a last resort. Sort of a medical "Hail Mary"! At my first appt, we thoroughly discussed my health history.  I really appreciated how she listened to me, and then after examining me, determined that my pain has been coming from a totally different area all this time! It all made sense!! So far, I've had 3 sessions of Neural Prolotherapy which consists of injections directly into my mastectomy scar. What it does is it breaks up scar tissue that has engulfed surrounding nerves that wrap around to my upper back. Who would've ever thought of that?! I am making progress with every session. Dr Barr is not only brilliant, she is also very kind. I am so grateful and hopeful! My only regret is that I waited so long to see her!|I have been a patient if Dr. Barr for almost 3 years now. When I was referred to her office, I had never visited a spine specialist.  I've suffered major back issues for years. Dr. Barr and her very attentive staff was able to pinpoint the area causing the pain. The staff is compassionate and Dr. Barr is tops in her field. They key to pain management is finding the source of the pain and a solution that doesn't involve medication.  After a treatment of RFA, I can say my spasms have been reduced 80%. With some physical therapy I should  be good as new. I highly recommend Dr. Barr.|I have been going to Dr. Barr many years for back pain and have had great success. Recently I was diagnosed with a Leiomyosarcoma on the chest wall. After surgical removal of the sarcoma and several partial ribs, I was left with very limited mobility of my right arm. Physical therapy helped but not enough. Dr. Barr suggested Scar Injections. After three sessions of scar injections, I now have full mobility of my right arm with no pain. Thank you Dr. Barr.|Dr Barr has treated my husband for over 30 years, every time successfully. The latest issue was with his neck pain, she did a procedure that was difficult, she and her team never gave up until she had the results she wanted and I am happy to say he is doing great.
The thing that sets her apart is her strength, self confidence, she never gives up, she is an amazing doctor.|Dr. Lisa Barr is brilliant!  Dr. Barr diagnosed and provided immediate relief of my lower back pain in just ONE visit.  Dr. Barr is an intuitive healer with a level of expertise not easily found today.  She and her staff are warm, caring, and delightful.  If you are injured or in pain, I'd recommend you seek treatment with Dr. Lisa Barr and The Barr Center.

National Spine and Pain Centers serves Arlington, VA with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert care of Dr. Assaf T. Gordon, MD. Our specialized clinic offers advanced non-surgical treatments for both acute and chronic pain conditions, utilizing a multidisciplinary approach that addresses the root causes of discomfort. Patients throughout Northern Virginia seek our evidence-based interventional procedures designed to improve quality of life and restore function.

Dr. Gordon brings exceptional credentials to our Arlington location, having joined National Spine & Pain Centers after completing advanced fellowship training in Pain Medicine at the University of California at Los Angeles. His comprehensive approach to pain management incorporates sophisticated diagnostic techniques and targeted interventional procedures. Dr. Gordon is highly skilled in numerous pain-relieving techniques, including:

- Cervical and lumbar epidural nerve blocks

- Joint injections

- Radiofrequency neurotomy

- Sympathetic blockade

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Discography

Education and Training

Dr. Gordon's distinguished medical background includes:

- Medical degree from the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine

- Residency training in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation at New York University

- Advanced fellowship training in Pain Medicine at UCLA

Visit Our Arlington Location

column3:
United Spine and Joint Center serves patients throughout Leesburg and Lansdowne, VA with comprehensive care for back, neck, and musculoskeletal pain. The center stands out for its collaborative approach to treatment, bringing together specialists who work as a team to address each patient's unique needs. Patients benefit from expert evaluations, educational resources, and evidence-based treatments designed to address the full spectrum of spinal disorders, from common back pain to complex conditions requiring specialized intervention.

At United Spine and Joint Center, patients receive personalized treatment plans that may include physical therapy, minimally invasive procedures, and advanced pain management techniques. The center emphasizes non-opioid treatment options whenever possible, focusing instead on addressing the root causes of pain and dysfunction. Their integrated approach ensures that patients receive coordinated care that addresses both immediate pain relief and long-term recovery.

Expert Leadership

The center is led by Medical Director Jon Mader, MD, a board-certified physician with specialized expertise in spine care. Dr. Mader completed his undergraduate education at the University of Wisconsin, earning dual Bachelor's degrees in Biology and Psychology before obtaining his Medical Doctorate from St. George's University School of Medicine. His leadership ensures that all treatments offered at the center are supported by the latest research in spine care and pain management.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes United Spine and Joint Center is their commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. The team takes time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative philosophy extends to working with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure comprehensive management of each patient's health.

Location and Contact Information

United Spine and Joint Center is conveniently located at 44055 Riverside Pkwy #216, Leesburg, VA 20176. Patients seeking consultations or appointments can call +1 703-840-0665 or visit their website at www.unitedspinecenter.com for more information about services and treatment options.
column11: At United Spine and Joint Center, the team focuses on collaborative treatment options for patients suffering from back, neck, and musculoskeletal pain. Servicing Leesburg and Lansdowne, VA. patients receive an expert evaluation, education, and treatment for a full spectrum of spinal disorders.Jon Mader, MD is the board-certified Medical Director of United Spine and Joint Center, where he provides treatments backed by the latest research supporting spine care and non-opioid options. Dr. Mader attended the University of Wisconsin where he earned a Bachelor's degree in Biology and Psychology. He went on to earn his Medical Doctorate at St. George's University School of Medicine.

column3:
Horizon Spine and Pain Specialists serves the Falls Church, VA area with exceptional interventional pain management services. Our practice is dedicated to providing patients with comprehensive care for acute and chronic pain conditions through advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment options. With a team of physicians who are board certified in both anesthesiology and pain management, we deliver state-of-the-art interventional treatments designed to address the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Understanding that pain doesn't wait, we prioritize patient access by offering appointments often within 24 hours of contact. Our approach focuses primarily on interventional pain procedures and supporting medications, with a strong emphasis on non-opioid therapies to control and relieve pain. This balanced methodology allows us to create personalized treatment plans that promote long-term pain relief while minimizing dependency concerns.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

While many conditions can be effectively treated in our office with conservative therapies, we also possess the expertise to handle more complex cases. Our specialists offer the most advanced pain management techniques available in the field, ensuring that even patients with complicated pain conditions have access to cutting-edge solutions. From epidural steroid injections and nerve blocks to radiofrequency ablation and spinal cord stimulation, our interventional procedures target pain at its source.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 8081 Innovation Park Dr #604, Falls Church, VA 22042, our modern facility is equipped with the latest technology to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (571) 472-6880 or visit our website at https://horizonspineandpain.com/. At Horizon Spine and Pain Specialists, we're committed to helping you return to a life with less pain and more function.
column11:
Horizon Spine and Pain Specialists provides patients an unparalleled experience in interventional pain management diagnosis and treatment. Our physicians are board certified in anesthesiology and pain management to provide state-of-the-art interventional treatments. We can often see patients within 24 hours.

We focus on interventional pain procedures and supporting medications with an emphasis on non-opioid therapies to control and relieve pain. Many conditions are easily treated in our office with conservative therapies. For more complex cases, we have the expertise to offer the most advanced pain management techniques available.

Many thanks to the whole staff for the dedication to your craft and patient care.|Dr. Phil and his staff are GREAT!!! I was involved in an accident that left my car totaled and me suffering from horrible neck, shoulder, and lower back pain. As a very active person I wanted to make sure that I received the best and latest treatment.   RX Wellness was exactly what I was looking for!! They have PT, compression table, X-Ray, lasers, and more.... My treatment plan was made for my particular needs and I am getting better every week that I come for treatment.  In addition, they a have seamless claims process too...the staff has coordinated with the third-party insurance and I am able to just focus on getting better!! RX Wellness is professional, knowledgeable, and friendly...if you are looking to get better after an accident this where you need to come!!|The experience at Horizon spine and pain center was outstanding. Check in was easy with very little wait time. Dr. Chen Chen Costelloe was very professional and knowledgeable explaining everything. Because my husband has dementia they allowed me in the room with him. Chrissy who assisted Dr. Costelloe was engaging and very considerate. If I could give more than 5 stars I would rate them so much higher. They were genuinely there for the patient and getting the pain under control.|The billing is atrocious here. Took almost a year to receive my first bill and it was for all the sessions I received for 8 months! That is a hefty cost to pay all at once for someone on fixed income. It was baffling and I was beyond enraged because the first two visits I came up to pay my co-pay and the receptionist said there wasn't any. I had a feeling something was amiss the first visit because it took her a long time to contact my insurance, longer than other medical offices I've been to. The office staff is not on top of things at all: scheduling, alerting doctors of waiting patients, etc. It probably all stems from the surly and somewhat arrogant office manager.

That being said, the care of Drs. Fisher and Tseng is marvelous! They are real miracle workers! I've been free of lower back pain for almost four years.
PA Tristan is also excellent and provides useful suggestions pertaining to non-traditional means of pain management.|This is the best place ever!!! The staff is very friendly and will try to fit you in when possible. I was in severe pain and a little concerned about a needle placed in my back. Dr. Tseng's demeanor put me at ease and made the procedure a breeze. I'm a dentist and very grateful to have found this wonderful office. I highly recommend Dr. Tseng and staff.|Con - The wait was over an hour.
Pro - Dr Tseng is knowledgeable and takes his time with his patients|Dr. Fisher is great. I am a different person from when I first walk in to the Horizon Spine and Pain Hospital. Thank you Dr Fisher.

column48: Are they better than National Spine and Pain?
column49: I would honestly say I like Dr. Fischer and  Tristan Case much better. When I attended the national spine and pain center at the VA hospital center, it was not a good experience. The doctor was ok but he kept passing me off to his many assistance. After the 4th assistant I was done. She saw my blood pressure at 190/124 and never asked questions or sent me to the e.r. she was too busy looking at the computer and trying to get urine samples. So I stopped attending for almost 2 years and then finally my primary care switched me and I have had care ever since.  Their front desk staff Shelly is attentive but a busy woman.

column3:
Dulles Pain and Functional Medicine serves Sterling, Virginia and the surrounding Dulles corridor with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded as a physician-led practice, our team specializes in treating both acute and chronic pain conditions, including cancer-related pain, all within a comfortable ambulatory setting. Our integrated approach combines traditional pain medicine with functional medicine principles to address not just symptoms but underlying causes of discomfort, helping patients regain mobility and improve quality of life.

At Dulles Pain and Functional Medicine, we offer personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our board-certified pain medicine physicians utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and evidence-based interventions including medication management, minimally invasive procedures, and rehabilitation therapies. We pride ourselves on providing continuity of care with a focus on long-term pain relief rather than temporary fixes.

Our Functional Medicine Approach

What sets our practice apart is our integration of functional medicine principles into pain management. We examine how lifestyle factors, nutrition, stress, and environmental influences may contribute to your pain condition. This holistic perspective allows us to develop more effective treatment strategies that address the root causes of pain while minimizing reliance on medications alone.

Patient-Centered Care

We understand that living with pain affects every aspect of your life. Our compassionate team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment plans that align with your goals and lifestyle. From your first appointment through ongoing care, we prioritize clear communication and patient education.

Visit Our Sterling, VA Location

Located at 20 Pidgeon Hill Dr, Suite 205, Sterling, VA 20165, our modern facility is designed for patient comfort and equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans. To schedule a consultation, please call us at (703) 884-8400 or visit our website at http://dullespain.com/ for more information about our services and approach to pain management.
column11: Pain Medicine Physician lead practice providing high level of care, to both acute and chronic and/or cancer pain in an ambulatory settings.

column2: National Spine and Pain Centers - Sassan Hassassian, MD
column3:
National Spine and Pain Centers in Manassas, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Sassan Hassassian, MD. As part of a nationally recognized network of pain specialists, our Manassas location provides patients throughout Northern Virginia with evidence-based treatments for acute and chronic pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our approach focuses on restoring function and improving quality of life through personalized care plans.

Dr. Hassassian is an interventional pain specialist who firmly believes in multi-modality treatment protocols for treatment of pain. Prior to joining National Spine & Pain Centers, he was the Director of the Division of Pain Management at the Center for Advanced Orthopedics & Pain Management. His extensive background ensures patients receive cutting-edge care based on the latest medical advancements.

Board certified in Pain Medicine as well as in Anesthesiology, Dr. Hassassian earned his medical degree at Eastern Virginia Medical School, after which he completed an internship in General Surgery at the Eastern Virginia Graduate School of Medicine. He completed his residency in Anesthesiology at New York University (NYU) Medical Center.

Our Comprehensive Services

At our Manassas facility, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and treatment options, including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Medication management

  • Minimally invasive procedures

Visit Our Manassas Location

Our modern, comfortable facility is conveniently located at 8644 Sudley Rd Suite 117, Manassas, VA 20110. We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans.

Contact Information:

Phone: +1 703-738-4375

Website: www.treatingpain.com

Board certified in Pain Medicine as well as in Anesthesiology, Dr. Hassassian earned his medical degree at Eastern Virginia Medical School, after which he completed an internship in General Surgery at the Eastern Virginia Graduate School of Medicine. He completed his residency in Anesthesiology at New York University (NYU) Medical Center.

column40:
Dr. H is the best - he is patient and wants to ensure you understand the options of the various procedures.  He has a wonderful demeanor towards his patients - he cares and it shows.   His staff is excellent, Meredith is amazing every time I see her, along with everyone who greets you.   I even had my dad see Dr. H, as a back up for when he is visiting me and should he need to see a doctor due to his chronic pain issues, he too was extremely happy with the care he received and the guidance was in line with his main doctor from where he lives.  Dr. H reviewed his entire file, which was key to understanding all the issues and finding a way to help my dad should he need to come in, along with working in conjunction with his primary pain doctor down South.  Thank you ALL for your care, guidance, and thoroughness with both myself and my dad.|I got the 3 spinal tap injections and I could walk pain free for about 8 months.  This was first time pain free after trying everything and every doctor in 6 yrs.  It was glorious.
Dr Sassan Hassassian is a miracle worker in my book.  He was very personable yet professional.  I never felt rushed and he also prescribed my medication to take before for my anxiety to the procedure.  He listens to was his clients are there for.  I was never overcharged for tests not received.  The front desk staff and his nurses are as l very friendly and very helpful.|I have been a patient of Dr H for years now, and I must say that his work, His staff.. They have changed my life. From years of chronic pain to a doctor who listens. I have been to pill pushers and he is not. I have been to doctors trying to pump money out of me and this office does not.  He's incredibly ethical. If he can't fix the problem, he will say so. If he can only improve the problem, he will say so. He doesn't always have the answer you want to hear, but his integrity, empathy, and professionalism is unlike any other I've seen. I was injured in the service and I have been all over to doctors all over the country. Dr. H is above and beyond any of the other doctors I have met. Dr. H  and his staff took my request to be on as little medication as rarely as possible seriously. He's done exactly what he's meant to: Helped me manage and reduce my pain that others just wanted to throw drugs at. I am not always pain free but my pain is manageable and I don't have to take meds everyday.  I do and have recommended him to anyone who needs a doctor to help fix them and not just mask problems.  My husband was a patient of Dr. H's as well but he's all better now. This is where you go to get better.|2 months ago I visited The Spine Care Center to consult with Dr Siddiqui regarding back surgery to remove a cyst on my lower spine. He was fabulous, taking a lot of time to go over my MRI results and to explain the surgery he would perform. I also went to the Center twice prior to surgery to get steroid shots in my spine to relieve me of pain. Dr. Zafar gave me these injections, aided by his very capable staff, and they helped me tremendously while I awaited surgery. All my interactions with the staff at the Center were extremely professional, including the receptionists and schedulers, billing personnel, and medical technicians and doctors. In addition, everyone bent over backwards to make my experience there outstanding in every way. I highly recommend the Center!|I am a chronic pain patient.  I have had to deal with my spine problems for a VERY long time.  I finally came and saw this doctor at the recommendation of a local friend.  Am I glad to have done that?

This doctor listened and cared.  He doesn't believe in pushing pain meds so if that's what you are looking for .. then look elsewhere.  After a series of injections, I finally ended up with a nerve stimulator in my back.  My pain is not gone but it's so much better.  I have my life back!
Thank you for being there for me.|I saw this doctor after I was seen by three other specialists who could not help me with my complicated situation.  I wanted to go online and let everyone know how terrific my experience was.  He is very professional and I think genuinely cared which is not common these days.  I am doing a lot better already with his injections.|Can't say enough good things about them.  After 2 failed back surgeries, I was referred to National Spine and Pain by the surgeon.  They have been very attentive to my needs and have helped me greatly both physically and mentally.  They check on my pain levels on a month-to-month basis, change medicines as needed and offer various alternatives to medicine.  I highly recommend.|Do not go to this "physician." He doesn't listen to his patients. He couldn't care less about his patients. He wanted to try treatments that I cannot have done because of my pacemaker. He wanted to prescribe medication that I am severely allergic to. I had to keep telling him that I couldn't try these treatments and medications and finally he said that because I am not willing to try what he wants then there is nothing he can do. He recommended one treatment and one medication. There are plenty of other options but because he doesn't profit from other options then he isn't willing to try them. He is a propietor for certain treatments and medications so those are the only ones he will offer. If you are looking to see a remotely decent physician who listens to you then go somewhere else!!

column3:
Dr. Richard B. Messinger, MD serves patients throughout Charlottesville, Virginia, and surrounding communities as a dedicated pain management specialist. With years of specialized training and experience, Dr. Messinger offers comprehensive care focused on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches. His practice combines interventional procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies to address the complex nature of persistent pain.

At his Charlottesville practice, Dr. Messinger provides individualized treatment plans for patients suffering from various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. His approach emphasizes minimally invasive techniques and multidisciplinary strategies to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Education and Expertise

Dr. Messinger completed his medical training with specialized focus on pain medicine and anesthesiology. His continued commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in pain management techniques allows him to offer patients the most effective and innovative treatment options available. He is known for his thorough evaluations and patient-centered approach to care.

Practice Location and Appointments

Dr. Messinger sees patients at the Charlottesville Pain Management Center, conveniently located at 2050 Abbey Rd, Charlottesville, VA 22911. The modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology to provide comprehensive pain care in a comfortable setting. New and returning patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 434-295-3600.

Learn More

For additional information about Dr. Messinger's background, approach to pain management, and treatment philosophy, patients are encouraged to visit http://charlottesvillepainmanagementcenter.com/meet-the-doctors/dr-messinger. The website provides detailed information about available treatments and patient resources.
column38: Melinda Maupin|Carolyn McPherson|Elizabeth Thewes|Deborah Wright|Thomas Sojka|Tony Garrett|Leslie Oates|Mike Thelk
column40:
Dr Messinger is a breeze of fresh air. He took his time getting my history, explaining the options and explaining the procedure I picked. He was very aware of my anxiety level and spoke words of calmness. I recommend him to everyone that's in pain. He cares about his patients. I felt prioritized and not like a number.|Dr. Messinger performs miracles. My multiple sclerosis is responsible for a great deal of body pain. This pain is unpredictable and diffuse: the location of my symptoms cannot usually be explained. I never know what state I will be in tomorrow, which--years ago--meant I had to give up my terrific job as the dean of a small college.

I do not want to be highly medicated. I have been through all sorts of pain modalities and clinics, including at UVa, with no good results. Dr. Smith at UVa--their spine specialist--sent me to Dr. Messenger, and the results have been--as I've said--miraculous.

Dr. Messenger is wonderfully pleasant and he really, really wants to help you! It you are at a dead end with your treatments, please call this smart, kindly, and results-producing doctor. He has certainly changed my life.

Carolyn M.
Charlottesville|Dr. Messinger is an example of professionalism, expertise, and kindness. I have utilized his injections several times and he is precise and quick in his delivery. His staff were competent and very hospitable. Highly recommend.|Dr. Messinger is a wonderful doctor I had the pleasure of being referred to on short notice. I've had wonderful care for all of my three visits and treatments with injections. He is prompt at returning phone calls and follow up care. He listens and explains his thoughts and treatment in a simple fashion I could understand. He's a wonderful person and doctor I would recommend highly. Thank you and your staff for being so great. Kindly Deborah W.|I intended to talk about options on first visit, but quickly talked into injection. Messinger said, give me 10 minutes to call into your insurance. Returns & says it's all approved. I find out 2 weeks later my co-pay is $600. Plus, my pain has doubled immediately after injection. His response was, nothing he can do. Worst doctor experience ever. Avoid this place!|I scheduled three appointments for treatment of back pain. I arrived ten minutes early for the first appointment and waited one hour and 45 minutes for the procedure, due to "problems" at the front desk.
A week later I arrived ten minutes early for my second appointment and was told I was not scheduled for that day and time at all.  My three appointments had been scheduled with the front desk while both my wife and Dr. Messinger were present.  I will not be going back, which is unfortunate because I found Dr. Messinger to be a very personable and highly capable doctor.|I have been seeing Dr. Messinger for years now. He is an extremely caring physician and I have never felt like he didn't have time to listen, or explain things, to me. I respect his opinion regarding my care and since moving away from C'ville, I still go back for treatment, even though it takes me 11/4hrs to drive there. Thanks for all you do for me Dr. Messinger!!|Wish I could give more than 5 stars.  The treatment not only helped me but it was done in a very caring and professional manner.  Dr. Messenger has an excellent bedside manner and is able to easy any anxiety one has and then explains everything step by step and is there to answer any questions.
