column2: Centra Medical Group Physical Medicine & Pain Management Center
column3:
Centra Medical Group Physical Medicine & Pain Management Center in Lynchburg, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Central Virginia. Our specialized medical facility combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions, musculoskeletal disorders, and rehabilitation needs. With a multidisciplinary approach, our board-certified physicians and healthcare professionals develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At our Lynchburg facility, we provide a wide range of interventional procedures, including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Our team also incorporates physical therapy, occupational therapy, and behavioral health strategies to create holistic treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. That's why our physicians take the time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and develop customized treatment strategies. Our goal is to improve function, reduce pain, and help patients return to their daily activities with greater comfort and mobility.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 1330 Oak Lane, Suite 202 in Lynchburg, VA 24503, our facility is easily accessible to residents throughout the region. The center is part of the respected Centra Health network, ensuring coordinated care with other medical specialties when needed. For appointments or inquiries, patients can call +1 434-200-4175 or visit our website at www.centrahealth.com/locations/physical-medicine-pain-management-center-oak-vassar.

column40:
This place turned my husband away who was apparently in severe pain when he walked in the office because he didn't have his co-pay they are more concerned about money then helping anyone. This place lacks empathy! If you hate your job so much maybe you should just quit! Just saying,|I have been a patient since 2018. The past two years have been awful, but nothing compares to what I've experienced since January 2024. I have called last three months for my prescriptions. They failed to get prescription called in three months in a row. All new staff and no one returns a phone call. Again today, the message line for the nurse says the Mail Box is full. My daughter had to go in last month and talk to office manager and I finally got my medication that day (6 days without my medication). They treat you like a drug addicted. I'm 65 years old and retired. If it weren't for my medication I'd have to have surgery. Shame on this very unprofessional and poorly ran place.|Notice: BEWARE of DONNA FRASIER- acts like a correctional officer! Ok --- I sought help for pain while having 6 orthopedic surgeries ( 2 knees, 2 hips, and 2 shoulders). One mistake, and I was put on probation. This is fine- discharge the patient - not place a patient on criminal probation. What makes it worse is that she pulled my pain meds before the third surgery! No problem, I discharged myself and went to Roanoke to see professional pain specialists !!! This was the BEST decision I made--- now on my last surgery and life is good. This pain center is the horror story that people talk about. The one mistake was a false positive drug test that they would not let me immediately re- test. I don't drink or use! Why not the discharge?|Great place for pain management.. all the staff are great especially Vadell who works up front. She is so nice  my nurse practitioner Veronica Richardson is absolutely the best!! I highly recommend..|I am so thankful to have found the people at CPM, Dr. Susan takes the time to talk with me and find out how her treatment is working for me. My health is what she is most concerned about, but she also ask about my family, how I have been doing overall. She is a pleasure to talk with, and the Nurses make me feel comfortable each time I come in. Both Megans do excellent jobs as do the Ladies up front, all of the people that work there make office visits special for me every time I have an appointment. The PAIN that I have gone thru has been helped so much by ALL these Ladies. Thanks to Each and Every One of you.|I have only been seeing Dr. Estrada for less than a year but in that time I truly look forward to my visits. He is so attentive and takes time to really listen to me.  He cares for my needs, not only the physical pain, but for my emotional and mental health.  I really wish he could also be my primary care physician, but I am so happy to have found him for my pain management needs.|I went in on Friday and because of a mistake by their office in not having me sign a release of information form it is now Tuesday I'm still going without any help at all. I understand the opiod crisis and having to be very careful prescribing these kinds of medications but you would think a doctor would see the need for pain meds when dealing with a t-6 paraplegic due to a gun shot wound. If I can't receive help then who is??? I have no intention of begging a doctor to uphold the oath he/she took when becoming a doctor. I become more depressed each day I lay in bed with no help from these "medical professionals". Thanks for absolutely nothing|I've been dealing with many of the issues I see Dr. Estrada for largely since 2007, and in those 13 years, have never experienced the level of care and attentiveness that I receive now. For the first time, I feel like a doctor is actively seeking to ways to help me improve and get the pain and how it impacts my life to a realistically manageable level and curb as much of it as possible rather than just throwing medications at me or giving me very general tips like "exercise this way and not that way, try a chiropractor, get regular massages, etc." and instead suggests individualized and targeted advice and treatment. I never felt like I was truly being listened to when I expressed how I was feeling physically and how much my life was being negatively impacted until now, and I'm beyond grateful that I finally found a doctor who carefully listens and seems to genuinely care. There's likely not going to be one quick fix for everything for me, and figuring it all out and navigating effective treatment takes time and requires patience, but I trust a doctor for one of the first times ever and don't feel as though I just have to resign to pain and how my issues negatively impact me, and dont feel like I just have to accept "bandaid treatment."

Many reviews I read about doctors in general seemingly imply only one or a few visits - though I understand that sometimes one just knows whether a doctor is right for them or not, more often than not, a little patience is required, and I strongly, strongly encourage someone to not give up quickly. Doctors don't have magic wands and have to figure out the best course of action - they're essentially piecing a sometimes complicated puzzle together and it can take time. I've been seeing Dr. Estrada a little over a year now and am beyond satisfied. The ladies at the front desk are super sweet as well and so pleasant!

Expert Medical Team

column40:
When I walk in they call me by name and ask how I am , just like your friends would do. There smiles and friendly faces mean a lot. I think that's what anyone would appreciate a greeting like that. It also starts your appointment off in a great way.  And leaving your appointment with the same friendly faces and smiles. Thank you girls and Dr.Lee for a pleasant visit.|Dr Lee is very passionate about his patients and cares about their overall health, both physically and mentally. He has an outstanding staff that have great customer relations. I've been a patient of doctor Lee's off and on for over three years and I recommend his expertise when dealing with both neck and or back pain issues.|ASAP has been a life saver for me this year.  I was a normal, active 33 yr old female and I also have 3 kids.  Not only has Dr.Lee help me retain some amount of normalcy in my life of the last 7 months, but he listened to me and validated me.  He has been so understanding and supportive!!  I would recommend ASAP any and every single day!!

Thank you for everything|Dr. Lee is awesome. I met him today. He did the most through intake. He listened kindly and took lots of notes. I like that a through recorder taker. He truly cared too. I can't recommend him enough. I didn't feel like I was a burden. That's huge from a doctor, lots of respect from him.|This ASAP Stafford group is awesome. Always take care of my needs. Professional, empathy, and concerned. They show compassion and kindness. Thank you team - I am feeling better.|I e been coming here for 8 years now and they have never failed to make me feel comfortable. I manage my pain with injections and it's worked beautifully for me. Dr. Lee is fantastic, patient, kind and supportive of my choices when it comes to my choice of treatment plan.|I've been a patient here for the last two years and I have had nothing but great experiences here, I don't think that I could come up with one negative or bad thing about this clinic and the amazing and professional staff and doctors that I've seen.  The environment is so friendly and the staff always acknowledge and are aware that there are patients there, they continue to always update us if for some reason our appointment time is going to be slightly delayed when most clinics that I go to or have been to will normally never keep the patients updated, majority of the time I would have to go to the front desk and ask what's going on because my appointment time  was 30+ minutes passed and no one had told me anything about why I haven't been seen yet. I think one of the worst things to happen at any clinic is to show up early to your appointment as required by the clinic and then you are not seen for over an hour and a half or longer only to find out that the doctor was eating breakfast/lunch or not even there and when you were finally seen your time with the doctor was 5 to 10 minutes.  I understand that things happen but when you are not updated to why you have been waiting so long past your appointment time and it's not just the one time here and there but happens continuously as if the patients time is not valued or important to the doctor or staff.  At this clinic I have never had this problem or seen any other patients have this problem which is a blessing and tells us that our time is valued and important to the doctor and staff.  Thank you for being a clinic that cares about their patients.|ASAP is a great pain management facility! I have been to couple different pain management doctors and by far DR. Lee is the best out of these doctors that I have been a patient of! He definitely does take time to listen to you, As well he gets all of the medical documents and all the flims... Meant x-rays CT scans MRIs..all the test that you have had. He does his absolute best to get a full picture of what all is going on inide your body. If your like me and have been to a few PM doctors, then you definitely know  that it seems like most of the Doctors treat you like your just another number, don't take time to listen to all you have to say, let alone to get all of your pervious medical documents and test! Most PM doctors don't seem like they care about you as patient. Seems like they just try to get you in and out in 5 minutes! Alot of pain management doctors offices only give the Doctor 3 minutes per patient... And that's not right at all! It's all about booking as many patients as they can a day per doctor, all about getting as much money as they can everyday. That is ok if your a established patient and it's just a quick follow up, But not for a new patient...need to take time to find everything out a the patients so they actually can help with the pain management!
Dr.Lee is a caring Dr will take the time to find out everything that will help him treat you as a patient and not just another number! I will and do recommend advanced spine and Pain and Dr Lee to everybody I know in ones I don't know!

column49: It depends on your needs.  If you have injuries that requires physical therapy because you can get better over time they will get you started with that. column2: National Spine & Pain Centers - Matthew Holland, MD
column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers serves Charlottesville, Virginia with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert care of Dr. Matthew Holland, MD. Since joining the practice in early 2014 after relocating from Tucson, Arizona, Dr. Holland has established himself as a compassionate pain specialist dedicated to helping patients reclaim their lives from chronic pain. When asked if he tires of working with suffering patients, Dr. Holland's response reveals his passion: "The thing is, I never do. Most of my patients are highly motivated people who have pain that keeps them from doing what they love. When we can treat the pain and restore function, our patients can return to their passions, and they are incredibly appreciative. What an honor to be a part of that process!"

Dr. Holland brings specialized expertise to the National Spine & Pain Centers, particularly in treating occupational injuries through workers' compensation cases. He also conducts Independent Medical Examinations and manages patients requiring multiple treatment approaches. His comprehensive care philosophy focuses on addressing the root causes of pain while restoring functionality and quality of life.

Patient-Centered Approach

At National Spine & Pain Centers, patients benefit from individualized treatment plans designed to address their specific pain conditions. Dr. Holland's approach combines medical expertise with genuine compassion, creating an environment where patients feel understood and supported throughout their healing journey.

Location and Contact Information:

1460 Pantops Mountain Pl, Suite 2B

Charlottesville, VA 22911

Phone: +1 434-234-4910

column40:
They take your urine it stays in a metal box with no supervision and every patient puts their pee there and open to anyone tampering with it.  They claimed my urine had cocaine and Xanax in it (didn't do either, although I did have a prescription for Xanax) and discharged me with just 18 oxycodone 5mg for the month, no step down no 2nd chance no option to have another urine done.  Just threw me out.  Mind you I was on the same dosage and quantity for all the years I went there.  I never wanted to increase my dose.  I just wanted some pills to ease my pain.  I left there that day and had a hair drug test done and it showed oxycodone, and nausea med.  they would not even consider that they were wrong not my urine.  To be discarded that way with no regard for my pain flat out pisses me off.  They just don't care about their patients.  Even though weed legal in Virginia, they won't allow you to use it.  What a bunch of jerks|Dr Holland is quite knowledgeable about CRPS.  He didn't agree with the diagnosis I have been led to believe for the last 26 years and explained why. He did not dismiss me or my issues  though.  He has suggested a different approach for my pain issues yet at the same time he is very honest and explains just because pain is his specialty he doesn't know everything and directed me toward a different physician who is  better skilled for what I need. That speaks volumes to me when a physician knows their limits.|Dr. Holland's Office was frustrating. I waited an hour before I was even admitted into a cubicle. He was careless, rough, distracted, and impatient and spent less than 10 minutes with me. He did not review my medical history, nor did he listen to my pain issues. He did not want to deal with my complicated health issues which are severe, diverse, and ongoing. He advised against surgery because of the pain medications that I take which are necessary for me to function. He destroyed my hope.|Dr Holland could not have been nicer....whenever I have seen him, he has taken lots of time with me and I've never felt rushed.
His office staff is friendly and welcoming. The office location is easy to get to with lots of parking close by!|He's a nice guy. He won't continue my medication until he receives my records from my previous doctor. Until then he's put me on clonidine for withdrawal symptoms. Hopefully my records get to him quickly.|Dr. Holland is very knowledgeable, spends time with his patients, and provided excellent treatment.  Within 2 visits my neck pain was eliminated. I highly recommend Dr. Holland.|He was extremely knowledgeable friendly and willing to work with his patients|I have been going to this office for over 18 months. The office and medical staff are wonderful.

column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers - Woodbridge serves patients throughout Woodbridge, Virginia and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Conveniently situated near the Wegmans shopping center and Sentara Hospital, our specialized clinic offers advanced interventional treatments for chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians combines extensive experience with cutting-edge techniques to develop personalized treatment plans addressing back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, and various chronic pain syndromes. We're committed to improving our patients' quality of life through minimally invasive procedures and multidisciplinary approaches.

You'll find our Woodbridge office at 14605 Potomac Branch Dr #100, Woodbridge, VA 22191. While our location offers convenience to major shopping and healthcare facilities, please note that parking can be limited during peak hours. We recommend allowing additional time to secure a parking spot before your appointment. For those using public transportation, bus service is available with stops conveniently located across the street from our office.

Patient Comfort Information

We strive to create a comfortable healing environment for all patients. Our treatment rooms are maintained at cooler temperatures to accommodate medical equipment and ensure sterility. We encourage patients to bring a sweater or light jacket to appointments for optimal comfort during consultations and procedures.

Contact and Appointment Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at (703) 738-4371. Our patient care coordinators are ready to assist with insurance verification and appointment scheduling. For additional information about our treatments and providers, visit our website at www.treatingpain.com/woodbridge.
column11: Our office is located near the Wegmans shopping center and Sentara Hospital. Parking is limited so please allow for additional time to secure a parking spot. Public transportation to the clinic is available via bus and accessible across the street from the office. We encourage our patients to bring a sweater or light jacket to their appointment due to cool indoor temperatures in our office.

column40:
I have recently had appointments with Dr. Ashish G. Shanbhag a spine and pain specialist.  He has such an impressive broad experience in this field.  Anyone with a spine  and pain condition should give the National Spine And Pain  Centers a call. (703-738-4371).  He is definitely a top notch doctor.

Also I want to say his nurses and receptionist are very professional as well.  They make you feel welcome the moment you arrive at the office.

Marsha Campbell|I have been Dr. Shanbag's patient for 4 years and has always received great care! He and his staff ensure that my health concerns are fully addressed. They are very courteous, understanding, and approachable.|I gotta say! I am so glad I went to see Dr. Shanbhag. I have been experiencing lower back pain due to a protruding disk.
I never thought there could be anything out here to ease or stop the pain I was experiencing, or the physical lost of some movements I use to be able to do freely, such as bending down, over, or stooping.
After seeing Dr. Shanbhag, I have regained those movements again. He's absolutely wonderful in the care that he gives while being funny at the same time. I am painless Thanks to Dr. Shanbhag.|I have been a patient at the Woodbridge location for many years now. Dr. Shanbag and his team have provided me with procedures related to lower back and shoulder pain. They are awesome and I highly recommend them for anyone hoping to find an alternative treatment for pain in lieu of surgery.|Welcome to National Spine & Pain Centers of Woodbridge, where they take cleanliness and security as seriously as they take your pain relief--and apparently, their stand-up comedy!

First off, don't expect to just waltz in here unannounced. This place has Fort Knox-level security! Need to use the restroom? Better have a golden ticket--or at least Jackie's approval from the front desk, because those doors are LOCKED. Try to sneak in and see how quickly Jackie turns into a bouncer, albeit a very polite one with a winning smile.

Now, speaking of Jackie, this guy could moonlight as a diplomat for all the practice he's getting trying to pronounce my name. You'll see him blush (quite a sight, actually) every time he gives it a shot. But don't worry, he's quick to recover and handles all the paperwork like a pro.

Then there's Dr. Ashish Shanbhag, who's basically doing a stand-up routine while fixing my spine. Is it a distraction tactic? Maybe. But somehow, between his zingers and "Dad jokes," I realized the treatment had wrapped up before I even noticed he'd started! I wouldn't be surprised if he's got a secret life at open-mic nights around town.

Balancing out Dr. Shanbhag's comedy act is the ever-serene Ms. Yvonne. She doesn't say much, but when she does, it's like a calming presence straight from a meditation app. Plus, she's in charge of the numbing--so, trust me, she's essential.

In all seriousness, this place has it all: cleanliness, safety, efficiency, and an oddly humorous vibe. It's like going to a comedy club where you leave feeling less pain and more secure. Thanks, National Spine & Pain Centers--Woodbridge, VA. I think I'll be back...but for the laughs as much as the treatment!|I went to see Dr. Shanbhag today for the first time. I must say I think I have found mine and my family's new Spine Care Specialist. He was very informative, knowledgable, and I left with no unanswered question. My daughter was with me and she felt he answered her questions without her having to ask. Every issue I had was addressed and was told if I thought of anything afterwards I could reach out. This has been a long journey for me and I feel like I will finally get some relief and on the road to feeling better! Prayerfully. Thank you Dr. Shanbhag!!!!|I love going to the National Spine &Pain Center in Woodbridge. The entire staff is great! Dr.Shanbhag is so funny. No matter how much pain I am in he makes me laugh. Gotta  them.|The doctor was incredibly rude and sarcastic. They made us wait while everyone else that came after me went before me. It was the Indian looking doctor by the way. The only cool guy was the young asian looking receptionist. He condescendingly told me to fix my blood pressure. DO NOT BOTHER THEY ARE SCAMMING THE ELDERLY.

Bhavin S. Suthar, MD serves Fredericksburg, Virginia and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management and rehabilitation services. As a triple board-certified physician, Dr. Suthar brings specialized expertise to patients suffering from chronic pain conditions, sports injuries, and rehabilitation needs. His practice combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care, helping patients regain function and improve their quality of life through comprehensive pain management solutions.

Dr. Bhavin Suthar holds impressive credentials that set him apart in his field. He is board certified in physical medicine and rehabilitation by the American Board of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, with additional subspecialty certification in pain medicine from the same institution. Further distinguishing his practice, Dr. Suthar has earned subspecialty certification by the American Board of Pain Medicine, making him triple board certified in his specialty areas. This extensive credentialing reflects his commitment to excellence in patient care and advanced treatment methodologies.

Services & Treatment Approach

At his Fredericksburg practice, Dr. Suthar offers comprehensive evaluation and treatment for various pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. His approach integrates interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and rehabilitation techniques. Dr. Suthar emphasizes creating individualized treatment plans that address both immediate pain relief and long-term functional improvement.

Practice Location & Contact Information

Dr. Suthar's practice is conveniently located at 4710 Spotsylvania County Pkwy #201, Fredericksburg, VA 22407. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 540-374-3233. For additional information about Dr. Suthar's credentials, services, and approach to care, prospective patients can visit his professional profile at Mary Washington Healthcare.
column11: Dr. Bhavin Suthar is board certified in physical medicine and rehabilitation by the American Board of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation and holds subspecialty certification in pain medicine by the American Board of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation. Dr. Suthar also has subspecialty certification by the American Board of Pain Medicine, making him triple board certified in his specialty.

column40:
I've been to Dr. Suthar twice in recent weeks and each time I left thinking "I really like this place". The staff is friendly and very attentive. Dr. Suthar explains what he's doing so you can fully understand the problem and the solution. He is proactive with his referrals and both times I've truly felt like they care! I'm so glad my PCM referred me to him. Now I understand why he's listed in the NOVA Top Doctors magazine for at least the last 7 years!|I am so thankful to have found Dr. Suthar.  He's caring, a good listener with excellent bedside manner.  His front desk girls are ferry kind and friendly, and his nurses and assistant are wonderful too!  Thank you everyone for taking such a good care of me.|As someone who has had the pleasure of visiting Dr. Bhavin Suthar, I can confidently recommend him to anyone seeking pain management and rehabilitation services. Dr. Suthar has triple board certification in his field, demonstrating his dedication and expertise in physical medicine and rehabilitation.

During my visit with Dr. Suthar, I was impressed with his extensive knowledge, attention to detail, and his commitment to patient-centered care. He took the time to listen to my concerns, performed a thorough evaluation of my condition, and developed a comprehensive treatment plan that took into account my individual needs and goals.

Dr. Suthar's subspecialty certification in pain medicine by both the American Board of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation and the American Board of Pain Medicine, speaks volumes about his expertise in managing pain. His knowledge of physical medicine and rehabilitation is also exceptional. His ability to leverage these subspecialties follows a holistic approach to his patients' needs and maximizes their outcomes.

While his credentials are impressive, it is Dr. Suthar's kind bedside manner and compassionate nature that truly sets him apart. He is a wonderful listener, and he made me feel comfortable and valued as a patient. He takes the time to explain everything to his patients in a way that is easy to understand and always goes the extra mile to ensure they receive the best possible care.

In summary, Dr. Bhavin Suthar is an exceptional physician with triple board certification in physical medicine and rehabilitation and subspecialty certification in pain medicine. He is highly knowledgeable and skilled in managing pain and helping patients regain their independence. I am grateful to have had the opportunity to be under his care, and I highly recommend him to anyone seeking the best in pain management and rehabilitation.|I have been seeing another doctor for my back.  When I was referred to see the pain specialist within the practice I was scheduled quickly and with out issue.  Unfortunately there was an illness in the office that created a bit of delay in getting a make up appointment.  My doctors referred me to Dr. Suthar in order to get my appointment quicker than would be possible in practice.  Dr. Suthar and his team were able to work me into what I could see was a very busy day. (Oh yeah, it was the day after I was referred! Amazing)
Once in the exam room I figured there would be little actual exam since Dr. Suthar was mostly just doing a "favor" for my normal doctors.  Man was I WRONG.  Dr. Suthar gave me a detailed exam and explained a number of items relating to my injury, the procedure I was getting, and the medications I was taking.  I cannot say enough about the professionalism, quality of care, and upbeat and knowledgeable service of Dr. Suthar and his entire staff.
Being injured is certainly not a fun time but having great doctors like Dr. Suthar and my regular orthopedic doctors is certainly helpful to maintaining a good bearing.|Dr. Bhaven Suttar is an amazing spine specialist doctor . He is current with the  latest medicines & treatments & has good diagonastic abilities . He listen to me very kindly and patiencely . I am very lucky to find a good spine doctor . He cures me alot and I find him best of the bests . He spends as much time with as I needed . I strongly reccommend to all verginia residents spine patients . God bless him I pray for his better health and good success in life .

Warm Regards :

Rana Rasikh|I have been going to Dr. Suthar off and on for 10 years having various types of injections on my back.  He, Merdith Chappel and the rest of his staff are outstanding in every way, courteous, friendly and efficient.  He takes time to make every visit feel like you, the patient, the most important person he sees.  I would highly recommended him to everyone who suffers from pain in their back or anywhere else in their body that an injection would help.|Dr Suthar is by far the best doctor in his field.  I've been dealing with an issue for almost 3 years which was largely a mystery.  I went to the Cleveland clinic, John's Hopkins, and VCU and they couldn't figure it out. Within the first visit he was able to identify the possible issues and come up with a get well plan. It was a very common sense approach and low impact.  His staff has all been on point and very helpful.  Highly recommend!!|Well I have been seen by P.A. Heather Brown and Dr. Suthar to help with my pain management and by far these 2 are the best in the field.  I have always been treated great during my appointment times by all staff members.  Once I'm in the patient room, I am their main focus.  You can tell that you come first in their eyes, especially from Heather Brown (you are awesome)
Thank you both for taking good care of me.

North American Spine and Pain serves Harrisonburg, VA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to address a wide range of acute and chronic pain conditions. Located conveniently in the heart of the Shenandoah Valley, our state-of-the-art facility offers innovative treatments designed to improve mobility, reduce discomfort, and enhance overall quality of life.

At North American Spine and Pain, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment. Our services include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and minimally invasive techniques. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, sciatica, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs and circumstances of our patients.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing meaningful partnerships with our patients through clear communication and education. Our team takes the time to thoroughly explain diagnoses, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach has helped countless individuals throughout Virginia regain function and return to activities they enjoy.

Visit Our Harrisonburg Location

Our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology to provide the highest standard of care. We welcome new patients and referrals at our Harrisonburg office:

Address: 2034 Pro Pointe Ln, Harrisonburg, VA 22801, United States

Phone: +1 540-433-1905

Website: www.naspacmd.com/locations/

column40:
The staff was very nice and helpful. They make sure you feel comfortable and make sure that you feel confident in yourself with the step that you're making to get help. The staff also brings a smile to my face anyways because of their kindness and generosity. I think people should try this doctor because the doctor and their staff members are genuinely nice, truly an influence and really about their work.|My experience here was great at first, but then it all went very wrong. I eventually got my pain under control with a very helpful doctor, but then 2 days before my appointment I get a letter saying I was dismissed from their practice. I was just very confused. I had got a tooth pulled and got another prescription. I called to let them know before my Mother had went to drop off the paper to pharmacy and the lady told me she would let the 2 girls know. I tried to call and explain to them that I had informed them that I got a different prescription and they very extremely rude saying they went over the contract with me. However I was given a piece of paper told to read and initial it. I was not told if I got a different prescription I was supposed to bring it in to the practice. On paper it says to notify them. Well I did notify them and when explained to them again they were very rude yet again to me. Now I am stuck trying to find a different pain management. So now I suffer due to lack of communication between the people at that office. And the sad part is I really did like and communicate well with my doctor.|I had a positive experience.  Straight and to the point, explained procedures, everything as expected, very accommodating.  Kind of long wait, but understandably so having just recently replacing all but 1 employee. Nice to see a friendly face. All in all rather pleased.
I must say equally I have been with Tabitha and her staff as swell. They were family and made me always feel welcome. Tabitha really did have your best in mind and heart. Will miss her as well.|I was just recently discharged from the pain clinic after being there 3 years. It's a long and complicated situation that caused my discharge and even though I told the complete truth about what happened, I still violated my contract. Tabitha Garrison and the nursing staff and front desk were all wonderful people and helped me with my pain and I'm very thankful for them. Whenever someone gets discharged, they are quick to blame everyone except themselves. I created my situation and I got myself put out, just me! Thanks again for all the great help guys!!|Please don't waste your time here!  Every single time I had an appointment over the course of several months, I waited no less than an HOUR past each appointment time.  The doctor only visits this practice once a month from Maryland.  The one time I was scheduled to actually see him I waited TWO HOURS & still never got to see him!!!  They are nothing but pushers!  I take ONE med, yet every time I go they try to push another drug on me! I've been driving 35 minutes to this clinic.  No more!  I finally found another pain management practice closer to me where I can actually get an appointment & be seen in a normal amount of time.  I'd actually rather suffer the pain than deal with this place!  Extremely unprofessional & could care less about my time or my needs!!!|It's always a pleasant experience when I visit the clinic. Everyone is so nice and able to answer my questions. They are knowledgeable when it comes to my concerns and overall a great group of people. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in need of a good practice to go to.|I have only been to this location 3 times to date but they are always helpful and professional. They have worked with all my health pains and that is not very easy since I have already had my esophagus removed due to cancer. And now have other pain issues with my spine and back. I will say however they need to be more active to make a covid-19 social distant waiting area and disenfect it frequently while open. Other than that I would recommend them.|The medical personnel are very efficient but also very personable. They are quick but allow one to ask questions and even chat to give some context to these questions. I was uncertain in these pandemic times how to deal with five or more of us sitting for an hour or more waiting together in a small waiting room. I did stand outside for some of that time, but filling forms outside while standing is too difficult, so I sat inside for that.

Cosmopolitan Pain and Spine Centers serves Annandale, VA and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Our board-certified physicians combine advanced interventional techniques with comprehensive treatment plans to address chronic pain conditions affecting the spine, joints, and nervous system. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, ensuring each individual receives personalized care tailored to their unique pain challenges and recovery goals.

At the Cosmopolitan Pain and Spine Centers, our mission is to provide comprehensive and compassionate care to patients who suffer from chronic pain. The primary goal of our office is to alleviate patients' pain, improve their quality of life, and help them regain function and go back to their happy and healthy life. We are dedicated to treat our patients, the way we like to be treated, and see them leave our office happy and healthy.

Specialized Services

Our practice offers a wide range of interventional procedures and treatment options, including epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. We specialize in treating conditions such as herniated discs, sciatica, spinal stenosis, arthritis, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our commitment to creating individualized treatment plans that address not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to ensure comprehensive care that considers all aspects of your health and wellness journey.

Contact Information

Website: http://cosmopolitanpainspinecenters.com/

Virginia Pain Network And Clinics serves Richmond, VA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Located conveniently at 1445 Johnston Willis Dr in Richmond, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to chronic and acute pain conditions, utilizing the latest advancements in interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies.

At Virginia Pain Network And Clinics, we understand that pain affects each person differently. Our physicians develop personalized treatment plans addressing various conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible, including nerve blocks, epidural injections, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes our practice is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. We take time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and explain treatment options in understandable terms. Our goal is to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence through comprehensive care strategies.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, call us at +1 804-302-8571. Our clinic is located at 1445 Johnston Willis Dr, Richmond, VA 23235, with convenient parking and accessibility features. New patients are welcome, and we work with most major insurance providers to ensure access to quality pain care for all who need it.

Ballad Health Pain Management Clinic in Abingdon, Virginia serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions in the Southwest Virginia region. Established as part of the broader Ballad Health network, this specialized clinic offers evidence-based treatments designed to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. The dedicated team of board-certified pain specialists combines years of clinical expertise with compassionate care, ensuring each patient receives personalized treatment plans tailored to their unique needs and circumstances.

At Ballad Health Pain Management Clinic, patients have access to a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management options, and integrative therapies. The clinic specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Their multidisciplinary approach focuses not just on symptom relief but on improving overall function and quality of life for patients struggling with debilitating pain conditions.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that pain affects each individual differently, the clinical team prioritizes listening to patients' concerns and developing collaborative treatment strategies. The physicians and staff recognize the physical, emotional, and social impacts of chronic pain, offering support that extends beyond medical interventions. This holistic philosophy ensures patients receive care that addresses all aspects of their pain experience.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 601 Campus Dr STE #100, Abingdon, VA 24210, the clinic features modern treatment rooms equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies. The comfortable, accessible facility was designed with patient comfort in mind, creating a healing environment conducive to recovery and pain management.

Contact Information

Patients seeking relief from chronic or acute pain can schedule a consultation by calling +1 276-258-1670. Additional information about services and treatment options is available on their website at https://www.balladhealth.org/locations/pain-management/abingdon. The clinic welcomes referrals from primary care physicians and specialists throughout the region.
column11: We understand just how challenging pain can be to your life. Thats why our pain management team is committed to bringing you the most current advances in treatment. Our physicians are dedicated to caring for you when you need it most.

column40:
Michele Painter is probably the most horrible uncaring  Dr (if that's what she wants to b called) I've ever seen. Not only is she uncaring but notes the exact opposite of what's going on.  You won't find any in of my doctors notes. She has never examined me or touche me to examine all she does sit typing on her computer. I appreciate her not wanting or asking if I need opioid but a pain shot was to much to ask for. When you're in terrible pain and the only thing wants to set u up to do is get an injection . No other options from her. No other help. She is in pain management  your there bc ur in pain.|HORRIBLE experience! Dr. Painter has no sympathy. I was already in tears when she walked in the room from being in horrible pain and she could care less. Said she couldn't help me until I lost weight. ( Understandable, BUT) I told her I wish I had known about the BMI issue all this time that I had been waiting for the appointment so I could've been working on it and I felt like I wasted my time. She replied " what, you want your money back? Did u pay any money today"? She had no bedside manners and was so blunt and cold. It's like she could care less. She typed in her computer for basically my primary doctor to deal with me about the pain. The nurses and staff there were so nice and supportive. I don't see how they put up with her. I've waited months for this appointment just to be treated like this. She shouldn't be a Dr in my opinion.|I had an appointment last Friday, 9/23/22, with Dr. Booth to get a much needed caudal before leaving for vacation.  She was 7 patients behind so I waited 3 hours to get in.  Then she refused to give me my caudal stating that I questioned what medication I was getting and because she touched the side of by back near my bra line and I 'jumped'.  I am very ticklish and when my husband touches my back I jump.  I recently moved here from PA and one of her comments to me was "Well you're not in PA anymore".  My understanding was she had 5 more patients to see and it was already 2:30 pm.|I wish that I could put less than one star!! Michelle Painter is horrible!! My daughter who is the sweetest, hardest working person and has been in misery for months waited from the end of December until late February, the whole time in intense pain to the point that she had to quit both of her jobs, for her appointment with her to try to get some relief. She has a serious kidney disease that made her have to take steroids that contributed to a lot of weight gain and Michelle walked in and just bruskly announced that she could not do the procedure because her BMI was 1 point too high and put her off for another 4 months. She had an outright nasty demeanor and my daughter was already in tears before she saw her due to the pain that she was in and her being outright mean did not help. It was bad enough to be turned away like that and she did not deserve the meanness. All she wants is for the pain to stop so that she can go back to work and properly care for her little family. Nasty Michelle has apparently never suffered any intense pain and I bet that one day karma is gonna show her what it feels like!! My daughter showed up at my house in tears over this and it infuriates me that someone could be so callous toward her. Shame on you Michelle!!!|I had an appointment with Michelle Painter NP today and she was awful. When she first entered the room she acted like she didn't want to be there. She asked me if I had any questions once she was done, I asked her if surgery was likely within the next year or two and she scoffed as if l wasn't hurting enough to bother with me. The "in-between" conversation was not any better. Pain management was my last resort after being in pain for over 5 years. I have psoriatic arthritis and fibromyalgia and I DO NOT want pain medicine.
On the other hand, her nurse and the ladies at the front desk were extremely nice, knowledgeable, and accommodating. I was actually debating if I would go through with the epidural she wanted to do, but after reading the reviews for Dr. Booth I went ahead and scheduled the epidural.
I have to say my first experience with pain management was not a good one!!!|Dr Booth is very caring. In my experience she does what she thinks is best for your needs. She may not write pain meds but she tries other ways to help you. I'm very grateful for Dr B.|Although I didn't like the process they put my dad through because of his insurance.. the  injection helped my dad alot.im leaving 4 stars because they needed to have my dad's doctor change the meds he is on.|If I could give them a zero I would. If you are in pain DO NOT CONTACT Ballad health pain management. I was referred to them back on March 16, 2023. To this date June 10, 2023 they have not scheduled me an appointment. I have contacted them several times and I keep getting told "my referral is being evaluated". What the heck does that mean?  I am in severe pain and I have since been referred to another provider in Roanoke.

Twin County Pain Services in Galax, VA serves as a specialized department of Twin County Regional Hospital, dedicated to comprehensive pain management solutions for residents throughout the region. Our facility focuses exclusively on treating chronic pain conditions through personalized care plans developed by our expert medical team. Established to address the growing need for specialized pain treatment in Southwest Virginia, we've become a trusted resource for patients seeking relief from persistent pain issues.

At Twin County Pain Services, we offer a wide range of treatment options tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our board-certified specialists utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root causes of pain, followed by evidence-based interventions that may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary approaches. We treat conditions including but not limited to back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, post-surgical pain, and complex regional pain syndrome.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life, our compassionate team takes time to listen and develop individualized treatment strategies. We emphasize education, empowering patients to participate actively in their recovery journey. While we are not an urgent care or emergency facility, we provide thorough, scheduled care focused on long-term pain management solutions.

Location and Contact Information

Twin County Pain Services is conveniently located at 200 Hospital Dr, Galax, VA 24333. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call +1 276-238-3558. Additional information about our pain management programs can be found on our website at https://www.tcrh.org/pain-services.
column11: Twin County Pain Services, A Department of Twin County Regional Hospital. This facility specializes in providing pain management services to patients. While it is not an urgent care, quick care, or emergency facility, Twin County Pain Services offers comprehensive care for individuals seeking relief from chronic pain. With a dedicated team of healthcare professionals, patients can expect personalized treatment plans and compassionate care at this location.

column40: I was excited to finally receive pain relief after years of chronic back pain.  I did get an injection,  as I was still laying on the table face down this doctor leans down and said,  "I like to do these in multiples so I want to do one more in two weeks"(knowing insurance won't cover injections so close together). Why was I not surprised that my injection ONLY lasted two weeks. They wanted to discuss physical therapy.  He failed to look at my previous MRI showing no disc between my vertebra.  Think physical therapy will help that, do ya? Don't waste your time with this guy.|The Dr spent 5 mins with me. Did not listen to me. would not order a new MRI , would not look at my recent x rays or 4 year old MRI S but STILL scheduled me for spinal injections! This is negligent at the very least. But also dangerous. I left feeling so dismissed and depressed. I had been hopeful for months about this appointment as I desperately need pain relief.  Please do not waste your time or energy and please do don't let any Dr do blind surgical procedures on you.|My doctor  in Martinsville,VA has had a emergency  and closed his office for now. My pain scrip was transferred to twin county pain. FOR A TELEVIST 289.00. A THIRD OF MY DISABILITY. TODAY !!!  A responsible doctor would not take me off pain meds I have been on since 1999.  When my doctor took me off Xanax he weaned me off gradually ..so now a irresponsible doctor wants me to come off a opioid  because  of money. Oh  they will not bill me . Tired of the few dictating to the many..government.|I went for a consultation and the staff was all friendly and professional.  Dr C was very kind he knew exactly what my back problems were and explained everything  in a way I could understand.I would recommend this place for people that hurting. I will be going back.|

Chheany W. Ung, M.D. serves the Cave Spring, Virginia community with exceptional pain management services. As a distinguished physician at Virginia Pain & Spine Center, Dr. Ung brings specialized expertise in interventional pain management techniques to patients throughout the Roanoke Valley region. His practice focuses on comprehensive treatment plans that address chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Ung's clinical approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with compassionate patient care. He specializes in treating various pain conditions including spinal disorders, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Patients benefit from his extensive training and commitment to providing relief through the most advanced and appropriate treatment options available in modern pain medicine.

Education and Expertise

With comprehensive medical training and specialized focus in pain management, Dr. Ung applies evidence-based practices to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. His patient-centered philosophy emphasizes thorough evaluation, clear communication about treatment options, and ongoing support throughout the recovery process. This approach has earned him the trust and respect of patients throughout the Cave Spring and greater Roanoke communities.

Contact Information

Virginia Pain & Spine Center is conveniently located at 3405 Ogden Rd, Cave Spring, VA 24018. Patients seeking consultations with Dr. Chheany W. Ung can schedule appointments by calling +1 540-777-0090. For more information about Dr. Ung's qualifications and approach to pain management, prospective patients are encouraged to visit the official practice website.
column38: Anne Hogan|Cathrine Doyle|Karen Bratton|Valerie hepler|Alicia Magill|Tammy Baughman|F. R. E.|Carolyn Harvey
column40:
I went with my husband yesterday and saw Tyler PA. We were both super pleased with entire experience.
Office is beautiful and comfortable.  Check-in process quick and efficient.
We did not wait for more than a few minutes and were called back.
Questions asked and vitals taken. Tyler came in very promptly.  He was personable and pleasant- very informative.  Listened to our concerns and questions . Had a plan for pain management and they were able to work a time to get this done quickly and to our satisfaction.
I wish all doctor's offices could work this efficiently and be able to get a procedure done this quickly.
Very satisfied.|Dr Ung and Arun Sun, his PA, are both excellent!! I started seeing Dr Ung after an injury at work - I went through 3 years of workman's comp terrible treatment!
Workers comp told me there was nothing they could do except pain medication and I took 75mg (SEVENTY FIVE!!) of oxycodone a day for over 2 1/2 years!! It lost its effectiveness and I literally tried to end it all But Dr Ung found the problem and treated it and I no longer take opioids!!!
And about 8 months ago I started having a different problem- before even having the MRI, Arun described what she thought it might be and she was correct! It took a few minor procedures but the pain is mostly gone!
They respond quickly - I can message thru the MyChart system and get a response in less than 24 hours! They've even moved appointments up when I'm having trouble and don't feel like I can wait!!
I highly recommend them!! And most of the staff in their office are great and have been with the practice for years!!|Dr Ung has done wonders for my pain. Being back pain free for the past year has been a blessing. I also had neck pain that he has under control. He is professional yet caring as a physician.|Dr. Ung is truly amazing. He tells you step by step during the procedures. You know what is being done and what you should feel. He is such a calming presence. He takes his time and will answer any questions. You never feel rushed or unimportant. And he relieves your pain! A tremendous asset to his practice is the lady that helps with his procedures! She is ALWAYS up beat, sweet, and kind. Amazing Doctor and assistant!!!|Dr. Ung and his office staff are the kindest and most caring around. From the beginning of the procedure to the end, Dr. Ung shows compassion. He talks you through the procedure and checks on you. He has helped me tremendously with my lower back pain.  He has been a Godsend to me and I would highly recommend him to anyone. I am so appreciative of his expertise and kindness.|Dr. Ung  is compassionate, listens, open to questions and truly wants to help. The staff are friendly, welcoming and practice is organized.
Thankful my regular pain doctor referred me to have procedures done to help with my spine, S.I. Joint & neck pain.|Dr. Ung is a life changer!  He and his staff are courteous and professional.  Dr. Ung has given me my life back, literally.  I highly recommend him!|Dr Ung and his staff are the nicest. Dr. Ung is so great with his patients he genuinely cares about them. I wished he could be my primary care doctor.

Natura Pain Clinic in Centreville, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management solutions through integrative and holistic approaches. Serving patients throughout Northern Virginia, our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions with minimally invasive techniques and personalized treatment plans. Our team of board-certified specialists combines conventional medical practices with evidence-based alternative therapies to address the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms.

At Natura Pain Clinic, we provide a wide range of treatments including interventional pain procedures, regenerative medicine, physical therapy, and medication management. Our practitioners are experts in addressing conditions such as back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is customized to the individual patient's needs, focusing on long-term relief and improved quality of life.

Meet Our Dedicated Team

Our clinical staff brings decades of combined experience in pain management and rehabilitation medicine. You can learn more about our qualified healthcare professionals by visiting our staff page at https://www.drpaulclinic.com/staff. Our practitioners stay current with the latest advancements in pain management to ensure patients receive the most effective care available.

Visit Our Centreville Location

Natura Pain Clinic is conveniently located at 14631 Lee Hwy STE 204, Centreville, VA 20121. Our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology in a comfortable, healing environment. We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 703-359-7272.

We understand that living with chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. That's why our approach goes beyond symptom management to help restore function and improve overall wellness. Let us partner with you on your journey to a more comfortable, active lifestyle.

column38: Eric Broyles|Areen Kim|Mickey Tomar|Heather D|Faye Talhame|Fred Glaeser|Milan Stevanovic|New Water
column40:
Dr. Rhyu has been my Doctor for 6 years, in that time he successfully cured me of 13 years of back pain and also twice restored my hearing after I experienced significant hearing loss. To heal my back he used a combination of chiropractic and acupuncture treatments. To restore my hearing he used acupuncture. Dr. Rhyu has amazing medical skills and is very generous and caring toward his patients. I would highly recommend him for anyone looking for the best in medical care.|Although I've been to other acupuncturists, chiropractics, and other clinics before, the doctors here were the most friendly and personal. They were able to relate my physical conditions to everyday life, and my life at that, and they were able to recommend changes that I could make to my life in order to maintain a healthier body. I have a herniated disc and so they gave me nutritional help, massages, and acupuncture and also made sure to ask if I was alright during every session. They were also able to inform me of what a herniated disc was and how I might have gotten it.|Dr Rhyu is FANTASTIC!  Super friendly, personable and highly skilled with acupuncture.  The best part for me is just getting inspired by how much he has accomplished!  He treated Michael Jordan in the early 90s, has owned Lamborghinis, has worked for the US Olympic team as the team acupuncturist, lectured at Harvard University, is the author of many books, procured and refines his own herbal tonics which he sells at his office ( mental master and sleep are my favorites).  I have to put a period because the list goes on lol!  He is a certified KUNG FU master from Beijing, former doctor of Samsungs Medical Center in Korea, former actor in Korea, has successfully saved people from committing suicide (jumping off an infamous bridge in Seoul), owns the Guiness World Record for longest Yoga class at Wanderlust Festival, owns a shoe company in Italy and many many more.  MAIN POINT - he is not your average doctor!  Unlike most of the medical industry - he advocates natural medicine and is a FORCE to be RECKONED with and the bonus is that he actually listens to his patients and if you dare listen to his stories you will be inspired too!|This place is amazing and Dr. Rhyu is helping save my life. I noticed a difference the very first day I met him. It's remarkable what he has done for me and I would highly recommend him to anyone. His place of business is warm and welcoming. Words can not express my gratitude that I have for him and this place. Thank You,  Thank You,  Thank You!|I do acupressure with a great Dr but it's a bit far. I decided to try someone closer to home. I made an appointment with Dr Paul Rhyu in Reston at 12:30. I arrived at 12:20 so I can fill the paperwork. No one was in the office front desk, five minutes later I see an oriental man leaving the office and I assumed he is a patient. It was Dr Paul going to lunch. At 12:50 some staff started arriving but no one acknowledged me.  I called the Dr at 1:00 and he told me that he is on his way. To make a long story short, he didn't apologize, did my acupressure with all my clothes on, sweater, t-shirt, Jeans, socks and on top of that a blanket. When I said that I never heard of any massage fully clothed, I was told that it is ok in winter!!! He kept asking if I'm in pain? Helloo, under all those layers? How can I feel anything? I was done in 40mns, when I said that my massage is suppose to be an hour, I was told that they consider 40mns a full session. Save your money and go somewhere else.|Paul got me back to Swimming from Frozen Shoulder Syndrome. Adjustment and Acupuncture for Flexibility and Strength. 5,000 years of experience combined with 21st century technology. 100%|Therapy was ok , unfortunately we had being Extra charged for some services that we never receive and we lost our credit through our insurance.
Fyi to everyone double check your bill!
We won't be back to this clinic|Very understanding and is patient with you. Speaks English and Korean and has multiple degrees. Tries to set a plan with you that is set in your time and your pace and is very flexible.

Virginia Interventional Psychiatry Services in Arlington, VA offers specialized psychiatric care under the leadership of Dr. Talal Ghazal, MD. Located in the heart of Arlington, our practice delivers innovative treatment options for patients struggling with treatment-resistant mental health conditions. We combine evidence-based interventions with compassionate care to address complex psychiatric needs that haven't responded adequately to traditional approaches.

At Virginia Interventional Psychiatry Services, we specialize in advanced treatment modalities designed to help patients who haven't found relief through conventional treatments. Dr. Ghazal and our clinical team provide personalized care plans that may include ketamine therapy, transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS), and other cutting-edge interventional approaches alongside traditional psychiatric services.

Expert Care from Dr. Talal Ghazal

Dr. Talal Ghazal brings extensive training and expertise in interventional psychiatry to our practice. Board-certified and committed to staying at the forefront of psychiatric innovations, Dr. Ghazal takes a holistic approach to mental health, considering each patient's unique medical history, lifestyle factors, and treatment goals when developing care strategies.

Our Arlington Location

Conveniently situated at 1635 N George Mason Dr STE 150, Arlington, VA 22205, our office provides a comfortable, private environment for all appointments. We're easily accessible to residents throughout Northern Virginia and the greater Washington DC metropolitan area.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 385-244-2505. For additional information about our practice and treatment options, visit our website at www.virginiaips.com.

We accept various insurance plans and offer flexible scheduling to accommodate our patients' needs. Virginia Interventional Psychiatry Services is committed to providing hope and healing through advanced psychiatric care.

column40:
Dr. Talal Ghazal takes the time to explain test results and procedures to his patients. I have seen several orthopedic doctors at other clinics and this is the first time the doctor explained in detail what is wrong, and when I had an injection he explained each step and what I would be feeling. Dr Ghazal shows an interest and empathy for his patients.|Dr. Ghazal is amazing - I have never had a doctor sit down and talk me through my condition with such detail and care. He was generous with his time, compassionate, and made sure I was comfortable throughout the procedure. I've had similar procedures at different practices over the years (and been generally pleased) -- but the quality of care provided by Dr. Ghazal blows them all out of the water.|Dr. Ghazal went far out of his way to get me in, listened to my issues and suggested several courses of treatment. I am extremely happy to have been referred to his care.|Dr. Ghazal is thorough and takes his time with me. The office staff is wonderful and nice. Dr. Ghazal saw me at my appointment time.|Dr. Ghazal takes his time when providing a way forward plan. The appointments are never rushed regardless of the time allotted.|Dr. Ghazal has treated both my husband and myself for different conditions and I can honestly speak for both of us when I say we would never go elsewhere for pain management. He is patient, extremely thorough with his exams, takes as much time as is necessary to make sure the test results, his diagnosis and his treatment plan are clearly understood. I have never felt rushed or felt the need to get another opinion from another doctor.|I cannot thank you and your team enough to have worked me into your schedule the week before last.  The injections helped considerably.  I also want to thank you for your profession manor and your ability to communicate your care and concerns for my health.  I am fortunate to have found your team to help me in my continued need to pain assistance.  I look forward to working with you to find potential solutions to fight off pain.  Sincerely,  Morgan Williams

I want to thank Dr. Ghazal again for the great education he provided explaining the MRI report in full detail.  As an architect, I am always curious and attentive to detail.  I look forward to my next spinal injection in my pain management program.

Regards,  Morgan Williams|I've had many doctors after suffering a polytrauma injury and nearly dying. I have been fortunate to have a lot of good doctors during my recovery, but I think Dr. Ghazal is easily the best from my healthcare team. He does not just treat pain; he treats the patient, their symptoms, and their concerns as an entire system. I've never experienced a doctor willing to spend so much time with a patient investigating the cause of the pain and really ensuring the patient is educated in the process. He is able to articulate his perspective in a way that makes the plan of care easy to understand and inspires confidence. Highly recommended!

column2: National Spine and Pain Centers - Abraham Cherrick, MD
column3:
National Spine and Pain Centers - Abraham Cherrick, MD serves Alexandria, VA and the surrounding Northern Virginia area with exceptional pain management services. Dr. Abraham Cherrick brings over 30 years of specialized experience to patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. As a founding member of National Spine & Pain Centers, Dr. Cherrick has established himself as a distinguished expert in diagnosing complex pain cases, earning consistent recognition as a "top doctor" by both Washingtonian Magazine and Northern Virginia Magazine in 2017 and 2018.

Dr. Cherrick's approach to pain management is distinguished by his exceptional listening skills and patient-centered care philosophy. "Patients can tell us a lot about their pain; we just need to ask the right questions," explains Dr. Cherrick. This methodical diagnostic approach allows him to identify underlying causes of pain that might otherwise be missed, leading to more effective treatment plans tailored to each individual's needs.

Comprehensive Pain Treatment Services

At National Spine and Pain Centers, patients benefit from:

- Personalized treatment plans developed after thorough evaluation

- Advanced diagnostic techniques to identify pain sources

- Minimally invasive procedures designed to provide relief with reduced recovery time

- Ongoing pain management support from an experienced medical team

Dr. Cherrick joined National Spine & Pain Centers immediately following his medical residency and has dedicated his entire professional career to advancing pain management techniques and patient care at the practice.

Visit Our Alexandria Location

The Alexandria office is conveniently located at 6355 Walker Lane, Suite 507, Alexandria, VA 22310. Patients seeking consultation with Dr. Cherrick can schedule an appointment by calling +1 703-738-4332 or visiting the practice website at https://treatingpain.com/medical-staff/abraham-a-cherrick-md.
column11: Dr. Abraham Cherrick is known among his patients and peers as an expert in diagnosing the cause of pain, even in the most complex cases. He is consistently named a "top doctor" in pain management by Washingtonian Magazine and Northern Virginia Magazine, most recently in 2017 and 2018. In diagnosing and treating patients, he draws on his more than 30 years of experience with National Spine & Pain Centers. "I came here after my medical residency, and I never left," said Dr. Cherrick. In fact, he is a founding member of the practice. In part, Dr. Cherrick attributes his diagnostic expertise to his listening skills and the value he places on input from patients. "Patients can tell us a lot about their pain; we just need to ask the right ques...

column38: Liz Hart|V Frentz|Chanel Sullivan|Roshea Imhotep|John Pulwers|Anastasia Griffin|Wilhelm Ogle|Simon Caine
column40:
I just moved to Alexandria from the Bay Area San Francisco. I was really worried and stressed out about seeing a new pain doctor and a new spine center after many many years of being treated on the West Coast.

The office was easy to find and I didn't wait long to see Dr Cherrick. He was fantastic and helped me calm down and relax. Like many pain doctors he is super busy juggling many balls in the air but he is a master of handling a million things at once. He was clear and concise about my role as a patient which I really appreciated. I felt I understood everything.

I can't tell you how relieved I was to know I would be in the hands of a well known doctor who understood me. Tomorrow is my second appointment. Im looking forward to seeing Dr Cherrick again.|I can't express how happy I've been with the Alexandria office. I originally saw Dr. Cherrick many years ago for chronic lower back pain. He listened and got me on a pain management program. But the Physician's Assistants are the ones I particularly want to thank. I've suspected that I had fibromyalgia for years and been ignored and pushed off by numerous doctors to the point that I stopped trying to get help until it got to be too much again.  I got up the nerve to mention it to Nadia at my pain management appointment recently and she listened! She started me on the right medication and the difference it has made is amazing. I'm not 100% but my quality of life is much improved and at my latest appointment the PA I met with was also wonderful. (I apologize - I forgot her name).

I never write reviews, but felt that I needed to share how good my experience was with them. Yes, sometimes you have a long wait for appointments and in the waiting room, but I take that as they are taking the needed time with other patients like me and trying to help them too, so I find it worth it.|Dr. Abraham Cherrick is a 5 star professional literally,
The entire facility was very nice and professional.
Dr. A. Cherrick is the best doc. On the planet, he listened to my story and observed every piece of my bodily and mental pain....
He's AWESOME,,,
He literally cared about my bodily and mental health..
He also has super Cool yet hilarious jokes...
He made me feel at home....|I HAD been coming to Dr. Cherrick for over a year. He prescribed me Relistor to take once a day but he said it was supposed to be written 3X a day which is why it was not working. He rushes with everything he does! Not paying attention to detail. I am really appalled, hurt, and disappointed because, as I was sitting in the patient room I opened the door to see what was taking him so long and I overheard him talking about me to another colleague!! He called me a "Crazy Lady" and spoke of how he was dreading to come back in the room. So, once he  came back, I confronted him about it, I proceeded to tell him my ears do not lie and be sure to close his door before talking about his patients! I walked out and told him I do not want to be seen by him or anyone in this practice. I can trust him with my health when he laughs about his patients right in the other room!!!! He does not care about his clients he just wants to hold you in a room for an hour to be able to bill your insurance. I am awaiting my refund from the billing department. Thank you, Hailey for helping me!  I am waiting my refund of my $25.00 Co-Pay as we did not conclude our appointment. I wonder what the bill will include since I walked out??|This doctor is awesome: High energy personable care; very intelligent; extremely funny; when the office visit is over you'll feel you've got a powerful ally in your corner. I ran into a woman there I've known at my office for almost ten years...she said I've picked a very good place and added that she'd experienced pain for most of her life and now it's almost completely gone. I really loved his PA as well; her name is Sarah, and she has a talent in listening to you well, and determining where you hurt and what makes it happen. You almost feel like she feels your pain with you. She is very good at conveying this information to Dr. Cherrick. She finds out what and where, he knows why and how to fix it. They are a good team.|I have seen several doctors for a problem with my dominant hand. I have a mixed bag of symptoms and kept getting passed from specialist specialist. I saw Dr. Cherrick today and he took lots of time asking me a plethora of questions to figure out what may be causing my problem. I was so appreciative of someone listening and helping me with a diagnosis.|I have been a patient here for some years and have always recieved the most excellent medical service. I wish I could say the same for the clerical service.
Last week I faxed them a request to send my medical records to a doctor in Daytona Beach, Florida, my new home. It took them 3 days to notify their records service, who claims they need 10 business days to process the request and then they will send them by parcel post. Not even First Class mail.
I have already taken the last of my pain medication and the new doctor won't give me a prescription without the Discharge Notice from Dr Cherrick. So I guess I'll have to find some way to tide me over for the next 2 weeks.
Any one know where the drug market is in Daytona Beach, Florida?|Dr. Cherrick is the best! He will take the time to go over your charts, make sure you understand your medical situation, and clearly explain your next steps. We need more doctors like this guy!
