Dr. Robert M. Spear, DO serves Virginia Beach, VA and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services. As a board-certified physician specializing in interventional pain management, Dr. Spear combines his extensive medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. His practice offers comprehensive evaluations and personalized treatment plans designed to address the root causes of pain while improving overall quality of life.

At Cova Spine and Pain, Dr. Spear provides a wide range of advanced interventional procedures and treatment options. His approach integrates cutting-edge techniques with evidence-based practices to deliver optimal outcomes for patients suffering from various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, medical history, and lifestyle goals.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 4525 South Blvd Suite 200, Virginia Beach, VA 23452, Dr. Spear's modern medical facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. The comfortable, welcoming environment is designed to put patients at ease during their visits. The practice is conveniently situated to serve residents throughout Virginia Beach and neighboring communities.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Spear believes in establishing strong doctor-patient relationships built on trust, clear communication, and mutual respect. He takes time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly explain diagnosis and treatment options, and answer questions. This collaborative approach ensures patients are active participants in their pain management journey.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit covaspineandpain.com or call +1 757-227-3820. Dr. Spear and his dedicated team are committed to helping patients overcome pain and return to the activities they enjoy.
column38: Sandra Nixon|Lynn Mathews|Mary Fullerton|James Mills|Laurie Chapman|Kathie Kuchta|Kathleen fay graham|Anna Ensley
column40: I went to Dr. Spear when he was with another practice for pain management. I received multiple trigger point injections in my neck and shoulders over several years.. Great relief. I also received a number of  guided sciatic injections, which helped immensely. Of course opioid use for pain was not taboo, then so my pain management for migraines, chronic back,   sciatica, and neck and shoulder pain were very well managed. I only left the practice because of loss of insurance and then a move to Florida.  I do plan on returning to him now that I am back in Virginia Beach.|I went in for a SI Injection and immediately the pain hit me when I tried to sit up. Blood pressure dropped and he had to put a wet rag on my face and neck. Said it was the numbing medicine is why I reacted this way. I had to sit for 10 minutes and he told me to walk like a Pirate. That weekend I ended up in the ER because the pain was unbearable and I could barely walk. Its 10 days later and the pain is still horrible! I cant get in with a Neuro Surgeon until the 29th. I'm sure its NERVE DAMAGED because I took Gabapentin that I had on hand and it and it seemed it took the edge off the pain. This place is a shot clinic and the only thing he had to go off of was a X-Ray. Never took any precaution with inserting the needles. The MRI from the ER showed I had a underlying severe spine issue! Don't you think he should of required testing prior to the injection or at least taken precaution with fluoroscopy or ultrasound to guide him safely through the Injection.|Warning! Do not go to this place unless you want to be dropped like a hot potato. After going to this place for at least 4 years, I was sent to Abby Barney to get injections in both my shoulders due to torn rotator cuffs. Prior to that, I had seen Bonnie n o c k. I never saw Robert spears. Lisa in the front desk always real sweet to me a month ago I went to Abby Barney and she gave me an injection in my left shoulder, and I was to come back in a few weeks for the injection in my right shoulder, which is worse. When I called to make the appointment for the injection in my right shoulder, Lisa told me I could not come back there. I asked her why that was, you have missed three appointments with us since you started coming 6 years ago I couldn't believe what she was saying I asked her could she give me the dates of the appointments that I had missed and she refuse to do that, and she hung up on me I then call back nicely and asked her to give me the dates again, and she got very very rude and told me not to call again. I told her that I was supposed to come back for my right shoulder and that the was excruciating but she did not care it all, tell me not to call again, and she hung up I waited a few minutes and I called again to ask her what had I done wrong. She told me nothing, but I had already been discharged she said. I told her that I needed an injection in my right shoulder as I was in extreme pain and could hardly use my arm period ask her if I could speak to Abby Barney or to Robert Spears and she said no I could not and slam the phone down on me. I was in tears and I am still in excruciating pain and I do not know what to do to do that was very cruel, heartless, and uncaring way to treat a patient like me chronic pain and I have very bad arthritis since Abby Barney had all my MRIs and the ones of my shoulders, she knew where to inject her concoction into my shoulders she had done it three or four times in the past, so I don't know why this Lisa was so rude and yelled at me that I missed three appointments and would not tell me when. I told Lisa that I had covid-19 and that I was in the hospital the first time for 6 weeks and I called and canceled it, then I got it again after Thanksgiving and was hospitalized for 2 weeks and I see you, CU unit do not call when you are in there. I explained all that to her and she could care less. She still would not tell me the dates you did was yell at me and say you have been discharged to talk to who was in charge she would not let me. Prior to that I told her pay money that I if I owe something I would pay it, anything. Even though I don't know why she did this to me she had me in tears by then my pain flew up my blood pressure went up I had to call my cardiologist at CVA he said that he would try to call the head of the company which would be Dr Speer I think and tell him directly that the chronic pain I have makes my blood pressure go very very high and I could have a stroke is am I'm not on any pain meds and now they were refusing me a shot. He told me to call or notify you to send me all records from beginning to end and why you discharged me and whatDates dates did I miss. IAm in so much pain nowThat I can hardlyMove my right armLisa at the front deskWas cruel, rude rude andGave me no optionsAnd gave me no optionsI don't understand whyA doctor would do thisTo me|Using my husbands account to post.   Dr. Spears is a really nice doctor and human being, but I will make it clear that he does not do anything with meds - so if you're looking for help there, go to another practice.  It's all alternative treatments.   I received trigger point injections from a physicians assistant.   Time will tell if they help.   - Amy|Quick, easy and Dr. Spear is very kind and personal as is everyone in his office.|Dr. Robert Spear is the very best you will find in a doctor as well as a pain management physician.  I have seen him for many years and the truth is, I can ask him about anything (except dermatology) and he actually knows the answer.  He's a 'healer' in my book and those are rare. When you locate a doctor that great, you have found a gold mine, especially if you are in pain.  I truly cannot say enough 'good' about Dr. Spear.  And his office staff is always friendly and personable.  Truly excellent doctor.|Dr spear didn't do and thing for my head, that I had to go to him  not for my spine.Now I having seizer, and blackout , dizziness. Carilion Clinic Interventional Pain Management in Roanoke, Virginia offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Roanoke Valley and Southwest Virginia. Established as part of the renowned Carilion Clinic healthcare system, this specialized facility combines advanced interventional techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. The clinic's multidisciplinary team includes board-certified pain specialists, anesthesiologists, and support staff dedicated to developing personalized treatment plans for acute and chronic pain conditions.

At Carilion Clinic Interventional Pain Management, patients have access to a wide range of evidence-based treatments including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. The clinic specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique needs and circumstances of individual patients.

Patient-Centered Approach

The clinic emphasizes a holistic approach to pain management, considering both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Patients benefit from comprehensive evaluations and collaborative care that may include coordination with physical therapy, behavioral health, and other specialties within the Carilion network. This integrated approach ensures that all factors contributing to a patient's pain are addressed effectively.

Facility Information

Located at 2331 Franklin Rd SW, Roanoke, VA 24014, the clinic offers a modern, comfortable environment designed with patient convenience in mind. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment, enabling the delivery of advanced interventional procedures on-site. For appointments or inquiries, patients can call +1 540-224-5170. Additional information about services and providers is available on their website at carilionclinic.org.

Interventional Pain & Spine Specialists serves Chester, VA and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Led by Dr. Nadeem Khan, our practice specializes in interventional techniques that address chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures. Our state-of-the-art facility at 12230 Branders Creek Dr offers patients access to advanced diagnostic and therapeutic options designed to improve quality of life while reducing reliance on medication.

At Interventional Pain & Spine Specialists, we take a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Dr. Khan brings extensive training and experience in treating complex pain disorders including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and pain related to workplace injuries. Our treatment protocols are individualized to each patient's specific needs, combining cutting-edge interventional procedures with comprehensive care plans.

Our Services

We offer a wide range of specialized treatments including:

  • Epidural Steroid Injections for spinal inflammation

  • Facet Joint Injections for arthritis-related pain

  • Radiofrequency Ablation for longer-lasting pain relief

  • Spinal Cord Stimulation for chronic back and leg pain

  • Workers' Compensation Case Management for workplace injuries

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that living with chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. That's why our team is committed to providing compassionate care in a supportive environment. Dr. Khan is known for his humble demeanor and professional approach, taking time to listen to patients' concerns and thoroughly explain treatment options.

For appointments or more information, contact us at (804) 715-4709 or visit our website at www.ipssva.com. Our office is conveniently located at 12230 Branders Creek Dr, Chester, VA 23831.

column40:
This version now includes Kelly Wood's name and emphasizes her lack of customer service. Let me know if there are any more changes you'd like to make!

You said:
Can you add I just got Kelly's name from front desk.
ChatGPT said:
Sure! Here's the updated version with that detail added:

Subject: Concerns Regarding Appointment Communication and Handling

Dear [Manager's Name],

I am writing to express my frustration with the recent handling of my upcoming appointment at [Doctor's Office Name].

Three days ago, I received a voicemail stating that my appointment would need to be rescheduled due to weather-related office closures on Friday. However, when I reached out to my case nurse this morning, I was told the office would actually be open and that I was expected to attend as originally scheduled.

This conflicting information left me uncertain about whether I should keep the appointment. It wasn't until I reached out to my case manager for clarification that I was told I needed to show up, even though the office had initially communicated otherwise.

To make matters worse, I received a call from the office manager, Kelly Wood, late in the evening, just hours before my appointment, insisting that I attend. Instead of offering clarity, the manager's tone was unprofessional and confrontational. When I attempted to ask for her name during the call, she abruptly hung up on me while I was still speaking, which I found incredibly disrespectful.

I was finally able to get Kelly's name from the front desk, and I am deeply disappointed by her lack of professionalism. Additionally, when I mentioned my concern about how my case was being handled, Kelly blamed her staff for not knowing that I am under workers' compensation. This was troubling to hear, as many of their patients are likely under workers' compensation, and I would expect that my case should be familiar to the office staff. She also stated that she would not apologize for any mistakes they had made, which only added to my frustration.

If the office knew the weather would not affect operations, I believe they should have communicated this much earlier, rather than leaving me to chase down answers. The lack of professionalism and the dismissive attitude from Kelly has been deeply disappointing.

On a positive note, I have no complaints about Dr. Khan. He has always been kind, humble, and professional, and I truly appreciate the care he provides. However, I would suggest that Dr. Khan consider addressing the behavior of Kelly. If she is unable to communicate effectively with patients or manage situations with professionalism, I don't believe she is suited for a managerial role.

I hope this feedback will be taken seriously to improve future interactions with patients, as this experience has left me questioning the level of care and communication at your practice.|This is a great practice and, in my opinion, the standard of care all speciality facilities should strive to be like. The front staff are always kind, courteous, and helpful. The nurses are thorough and pleasant to talk to. Dr. Kahn's team are a nice, funny, and caring. Every procedure has been easy from scheduling to follow up. I've had 10 procedures here and I'm beyond satisfied. Great practice, great staff, well done.|If I could give this office 0 stars I would. Every single time my husband has an apt the Dr or nurses run an 1 hour 2 hours behind for a 20 minute procedure with no communication as to what is going on. This place sucks, the staff is rude. I would recommend going to another Spine and Pain center. This office is so unorganized. Good luck getting them to answer your calls.|I'd been in excruciating pain over a year with Ortho VA. My PCP directed me to IPPS. The knowledge and care and time put in by C. CdeBaca and Dr. Kahn saved my life when I wanted to be euthanized. Ordered am MRI to cover exact areas he suspected. I have scoliosis. He determined herniated disc and arthritis. I agreed to injections and I was afraid. Every visit I am well informed on all treatment plans and procedures. Very caring manner as if I am the only patient. I'm grateful for the entire staff.|They don't respect your time .Your appt time means nothing to them thinking about leaving|I have been trying to contact the office on numerous occasions to ensure I get paid, they do not answer the phone whatsoever. I was also fired after communicating with management TWO hours before my scheduled time that my boyfriend's car battery was dead. After even having proof of communicating with management, I was told it would make no difference and I was let go. Sad there is no understanding for simple things that can occur to anybody in every day life. This office is so quick to fire people that now they don't even have an adequate number of employees to even answer the phone for regular patients. Other than not trying to be understanding to hardships, I did enjoy my time there. But I truly do not believe it is okay for any employer to disregard an employee completely when they have done all the necessary things to ensure everyone was in the loop about what was going on. Especially something as simple as a car battery not starting, if you felt the need to fire me over a car battery not starting then someone could have offered to pick me up if that was such an issue, but that wasn't discussed either. Just immediately terminated me.|My husband and i just spent 2 hours there for a 20 min procedure. After he was finished, I asked him who was his Dr. He said Dr. Khan. At that time I realized that it was the same doctor that was walking around recording on his phone instead of treating my husband. The appt was at 12:40, my husband was called back at 1:00, he was texting me while he was in the room, and I finally walked to the window at 2:00 at which point the lovely lady I spoke to went to check on him. They finally took him back, rushed the procedure according to my husband, and rolled him out. This was absolutely unacceptable. I guess websites and social media are more important than the patients.|I have been seeing Dr Khan for about 14 years? I can't believe the posts about the wait time as he and his staff try so very hard to help everyone.  Dr Khan takes TIME with you in the room answers every question.  That's why there's a wait and it's so worth it. He helped me, my hubby, my son, my mom and my mother in law who all loved him I have sent many of my friends to him.  So yea if you want someone who cares see him. And we all should know by now since COVID finding staff is difficult. So try to have some patience, make notes before your appointments.

Daniel S. Heller, MD serves Warrenton, Virginia and surrounding communities with exceptional interventional pain management services. As a fellowship-trained and board-certified specialist, Dr. Heller brings advanced expertise to Blue Ridge Orthopaedic & Spine Center, where he helps patients find relief from both acute and chronic pain conditions. His comprehensive approach combines cutting-edge diagnostic techniques with personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function.

Dr. Heller's practice focuses on several key areas of pain management, including:

  • Electro-diagnostic studies to accurately identify nerve and muscle disorders

  • Interventional procedures for precise treatment of pain sources

  • Advanced neuromodulation using spinal cord stimulation systems

  • Comprehensive pharmacological management of pain conditions

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Heller's practice is his commitment to understanding each patient's unique pain experience. He takes time to conduct thorough evaluations, explain diagnostic findings in understandable terms, and develop treatment strategies that align with patients' goals and lifestyles. This personalized approach has helped countless individuals throughout the Warrenton area reclaim their lives from debilitating pain.

Location and Contact Information

Dr. Heller practices at Blue Ridge Orthopaedic & Spine Center, conveniently located at 52 W Shirley Ave, Building A, Warrenton, VA 20186. To schedule a consultation or learn more about available pain management services, patients can visit www.blueridgeortho.com/heller or call 540-347-9220.

Virginia Interventional Pain & Spine Center serves Cave Spring, VA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to help patients overcome chronic pain conditions and improve their quality of life. Located conveniently at 3405 Ogden Rd in Cave Spring, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for residents throughout the Roanoke Valley seeking relief from persistent pain.

At Virginia Interventional Pain & Spine Center, we offer a wide range of minimally invasive procedures and therapeutic approaches designed to address various pain conditions. Our treatment options include epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and comprehensive medication management. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, focusing on both immediate pain relief and long-term functional improvement.

Our Expert Medical Team

Patient-Centered Approach

This holistic approach allows us to develop more effective treatment strategies and support better outcomes for our patients.

Great.|I have been a patient here for many years.  Dr. Ung and his team are top notch in their field. I have had many procedures done due to chronic lower back pain. Was told I had bone spurs in my neck. Pa Arun was to set up a MRI for confirmation.that was 8 days ago still no word .I have left 2 messages with them also left message with frt desk  nothing.|Tom must have been hired off the street!  He doesn't communicate nor address issues.  In December my daughter put a CBD gummy in with my other vitamin gummies.  I tried to explain since I am 71 years old and never had urine screen fail, and told him even before he tested.  Today, I normally put medication into a weekly dispenser and after a recent visit was told I had to bring all medications in original bottles. Since a recent heart attack I am lucky to be able to take any.  In gathering up medication, my dispensers, my pill case in my purse, an emergency kit in the car, I was exhausted.  He listens to NOTHING!  I intend to report him everywhere possible!  Last straw, after last  months visit, he sent all meds to pharmacy.  NO local pharmacies had oxycodone and could not get it.  Took him over a week to see my telephone messages.  At that time he phoned in 20.  Again trying repeatedly to call him he finely, phoned in 120.  I have champva and can get my medication at NO Cost if the doctor would send it there.  Never could make him understand.  So those RXs were filled with my 10% co-pay and cost me $139, leaving me $31 for groceries.  He put me on a pain patch that was $99 each!  $400 for that!  He doesn't seem to care about what the patient has to pay out of pocket! Absolutely no regard or understanding elderly patients!  CHAMPVA sent me an instruction on sending them but I was told they didn't need it!|I call Dr Ung and Arun my saving Angels.  Had I nor been sent to them I k ow that I would not be here today. At The Spine Care Center, Dr. Bassam and his dedicated team provide evidence-based treatments for a wide range of spinal conditions, including herniated discs, spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease, sciatica, and chronic back pain. About Dr. Deeni Bassam, MD

Dr. Bassam is a board-certified spine specialist with extensive training and experience in advanced spine care techniques. His patient-centered philosophy focuses on exhausting conservative treatment options before considering surgical intervention. When surgery is necessary, Dr. Bassam employs the latest minimally invasive procedures to ensure optimal outcomes with reduced recovery time.

Our Facility

Bassam sophos and dr. Bassam and all the other doctors in there are absolutely wonderful the way he injects is you don't even feel the needles I wasn't even sedated and I trust him so much that I don't get today I haven't gotten sedated in years because he's so good he walks you through what he's doing tells you when you know he's going to do this and do that and I am paying for you today so please go to dr. column40: I have been a patient of Dr Henick for almost two years. He is very friendly and professional.  He doesn't stop until he finds a solution to your problem and he is very gentle. I would never use anyone else. There are many pain management Doctors out there but Dr Henick is the best. I should know I have been through 5 other Doctors before finding him.|Dr. Henick show compassion & concern. I believe these are positive qualities that make for an exceptional doctor. He takes time to listen. I describe where the neck pain is & how it is affecting my life daily., Dr. Henick listen before making recommendations for treatment options.  He is an EXcellent doctor.|First time visit. In room, was taken for an x-ray, saw doctor go into another room with patient. Returned from  x-ray. Sat for 10 to 15 minutes. Dr came in sat, crossed his legs, was reading medical record asked one question, are you here about your back. When answered and tried to explain pain he cut me off saying something about another issue he saw in my chart having nothing to do with y I was there. Then said "you're allergic to prednisone" said there is nothing I can do for you, got up and walked out. He was with me less than 5 minutes, which has been the same with the other doctors. I'm in excruciating pain, have been for over a year, being passed to over 5 different doctor and not 1 has helped me. I did research to find out possibly why, and came across something that said white doctors treat black patients differently. Now I wonder if this is true because I have never been to a black doctor. At this visit, I was treated as if I wasn't even there. I had a bill an didn't want to pay it because of this, but I finally decided to pay for the poor service I received. I don't seek out color because it's blind to me, but the article gave me something to think about.|Dr. Henick, is awesome. He listens and i felt as if he truely cared about me and managing my pain. He was super helpful in addressing all of my concerns and the rest of the SMOC are great.|I've been a patient doctor Hendricks Three Years. Very nice. Professional place place very qualified. Doctor and takes his time to talk to you and explain what's going on with you.  And what you need.|Excellent doctor and staff. Thank goodness they are very concerned with my health . I am happy with my results. Neck pain and back injuries have made me very ill and unable to sleep at night and have anxiety.|I have always had very quick and professional care while attending to my appointments both during a procedure and the appropriate office visits with Dr Henick and his support staff.|Dr. Henick's skills as a pain management physician are second to none.  He listened closely as I described the chronic issues that I've had with my neck and back for over decades.  He reviewed my x-rays, showed me the areas of concern, successfully pinpointed the source of the pain, discussed various alternatives to help reduce chronic pain, and ultimately provided treatments that have helped manage the pain for the first time in over 30 years. His support team are equally knowledgeable, providing a comprehensive and holistic experience in the management of chronic pain.

column2: National Spine & Pain Centers - Daniel Kendall, DO
column3:
National Spine & Pain Centers in McLean, Virginia serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management under the expert care of Dr. Daniel Kendall, DO. With a state-of-the-art facility located at 1420 Spring Hill Rd, Suite 210, the center provides specialized interventional treatments designed to address chronic pain conditions without surgical intervention. Dr. Kendall and his team employ advanced diagnostic techniques and personalized treatment plans to help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life.

Dr. Daniel Kendall brings exceptional expertise to his practice, having joined National Spine & Pain Centers in 2004 after completing a prestigious fellowship in interventional pain management at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore. His deep interest in pain management has evolved into a rewarding career focused on providing relief to those suffering from chronic pain conditions. As an expert clinician with specialized training in non-surgical techniques, Dr. Kendall offers treatments that significantly improve patients' daily functioning and overall wellbeing.

Advanced Treatment Options

Patients benefit from Dr. Kendall's proficiency in performing a wide range of fluoroscopic-guided procedures, including:

  • Epidural nerve blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Intradiscal electrothermal annuloplasty

  • Vertebroplasty

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Non-surgical disc decompression techniques

Patient-Centered Approach

The center emphasizes individualized care, beginning with thorough evaluations to identify the root causes of pain. This comprehensive approach allows Dr. Kendall to develop targeted treatment strategies that address each patient's specific needs. For consultations or appointments, patients can contact the office directly at +1 703-738-4342 or visit their website at treatingpain.com.
column11: Dr. Kendall has long been interested in the field of pain management and finds his chosen career to be deeply rewarding. An expert clinician with advanced training in sophisticated, non-surgical techniques, Dr. Kendall administers pain-relieving therapies that significantly improve quality of life. He is one of the region's most proficient physicians in performing fluoroscopic-guided procedures, including epidural nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, intradiscal electrothermal annuloplasty, vertebroplasty, spinal cord stimulation, and non-surgical disc decompression techniques. Dr. Kendall joined National Spine & Pain Centers in 2004 after completing a fellowship in interventional pain management at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore....

column40:
Dr. Kendall and his staff are knowledgeable and efficient. Very good at managing my lower back pain. His procedures are quick and he is doing his best for the procedures to be as painless as possible. His front desk staff and nurses are always helpful, professional and kind. Highly recommend.|Without Dr Kendall, I know I would be using a walker by now. Between my SI joint, a couple of lumbar disc herniations and a 10/10 painful sciatica, I will never be able to express enough gratitude for the help of Dr Kendall and staff. I do not need surgery as long as pain is managed. My ortho surgeon, Dr Childs, even said that I was in great hands with Dr Kendall and to continue to follow his recommendations.
I literally go from not being able to walk up stairs to surfing and hiking. I am so happy with my treatment from this office. I have to be diligent to do MY part with stretching, exercising, and staying ahead of the pain, but I guarantee that if you do your part he will do his.|Chop shop that treats patients like an assembly line. Gave me a medial branch block without a steroid, which is normally used as a test run for a lumbar rhizotomy, when I thought I was getting a steroid shot.

There was a huge failure in communication  about the procedure and no explanation of what injections were being given, what to expect afterward, nor any follow up.

Super unprofessional and unbelievable that I was given a completely different treatment than what I had requested, without my consent. I went an entire month thinking I had been given a steroid shot (because that was what we originally discussed) and that it hadn't worked, before seeing in the official paperwork that a completely different procedure was performed on my back.

This is medical malpractice and I honestly feel violated and incredibly upset that this occurred.|Dr. Kendall is absolutely the BEST, he takes his time setting you at ease  right before the procedure. I've been his patient since May 2019 with really bad lower back issues and it is steadily getting better. His staff works like a team, from the front desk to the nurses and the check out associates they are all on the ball and very helpful. The office is spotless and very welcoming. I am very happy with the care this practice delivers. They go out of their way to help their patients in every way. Don't go anywhere else!|I'm not pleased at all with this office! I originally booked an appointment with Dr. Kendall and arrived to the office at my scheduled time but he didn't even come see me. He left me to the nurse practitioner (who was wonderful by the way but that doesn't change the fact that my original appointment was with Dr. Kendall and he didn't even make an appearance. Moreover the front desk woman took 5 min to even acknowledge that I'm standing there waiting to be checked in (even though I observed that with the next 5 patients she immediately attended to them). It's possible that she might have been trying to finish something up when I was waiting but she still could have said something simple like "I'll be with you shortly" instead of completely ignoring me for a good 5-10 min. Finally, as I was checking out I asked why I wasn't seen by Dr. Kendall despite my appointment being with him and the receptionist told me this is normal for first visits since that's when they ask for tests or Xrays only but in future visits, I should see him. However, when I called to move my follow up appointment (which is supposed to be with Dr. Kendall as per my original app. and as per the receptionist) I was told that my app. is with the Nurse and not with Dr. Kendall at all. So it seems like they just switched me to being a patient of the nurse practitioner and not the doctor at all without telling me even though I specifically requested to be seen by the doctor and moreover gave me wrong info on my way out making it seem like I'm still his patient but that he will start seeing me once we go into the actual treatment. I want to reiterate that the Nurse practitioner who saw me was fabulous (Dr. Charles, Lowe) but it's really unprofessional of the office to just switch my provider without my consent when I originally came in for Dr. Kendall who I obviously chose for a reason.

Even using their app isn't convenient as you cannot make edits to your appointment or changes to the time and all in all nothing about my visit was satisfactory except Nurse Lowe herself.|"Dr. Kendall is an extraordinary healer who has completely transformed my life. For over 20 years, I battled with chronic back pain until I found Dr. Kendall. With his compassionate care and remarkable expertise, he performed what can only be described as a miracle. Thanks to Dr. Kendall, I have been blissfully pain-free for the past decade. His dedication to his patients knows no bounds, and I am forever grateful for his unwavering support. If you're seeking relief from chronic pain, Dr. Kendall is the answer you've been searching for. Thank you, Dr. Kendall, for giving me back my quality of life."|Back pain has definitely been a game changer but Dr. Kendall has kept me in the game!  I've tried other pain management specialists and there is no comparison. He actually listens and suggests the procedure to best address the issue.  His kind bedside manner and gentle administration of the treatments are so appreciated and his assistants are the best!  They make you feel that they care and I always feel I am in good hands.|I had not experienced such a professional, efficient, quick and friendly medical service in a very long time. The staff is excellent, there was almost no wait time, Dr. Kendall has amazing bedside manners, is very friendly, patient, and caring. Very professional. Highly recommended!

column2: The Chronic Pelvic Pain Center of Northern Virginia
column3:
The Chronic Pelvic Pain Center of Northern Virginia serves patients throughout Vienna, VA and the surrounding Northern Virginia region with specialized care for complex pelvic pain conditions. Founded with the mission to provide comprehensive treatment for patients suffering from chronic pelvic disorders, our center combines evidence-based conventional medicine with holistic approaches to address the multifaceted nature of pelvic pain. Our team of dedicated specialists understands that conditions like endometriosis, interstitial cystitis, chronic UTIs, and irritable bowel syndrome often coexist and require an integrated treatment approach rather than isolated symptom management.

At The Chronic Pelvic Pain Center, we focus on diagnosing and treating challenging conditions that often go misunderstood or undertreated in traditional medical settings:

  • Endometriosis - Comprehensive evaluation and personalized treatment plans

  • Interstitial Cystitis - Advanced diagnostic techniques and multi-modal therapy

  • Chronic UTIs - Identifying underlying causes and breaking the infection cycle

  • Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) - Integrative approaches to digestive health

Our Treatment Philosophy

What sets our center apart is our commitment to blending conventional medical treatments with evidence-based alternative and holistic modalities. We recognize that patients with chronic pelvic pain often have multiple overlapping health concerns that require a customized solution. Our practitioners take the time to understand each patient's unique health history, symptoms, and goals before developing individualized treatment plans that may include medical interventions, physical therapy, nutritional counseling, stress management techniques, and complementary therapies.

Contact Information

If you're struggling with chronic pelvic pain conditions that haven't responded to standard treatments, we invite you to contact our center for a consultation:

Website: www.pelvicpaindr.com

Phone: +1 703-448-6070

Address: 8100 Boone Blvd #710, Vienna, VA 22182, United States

Our office is conveniently located in Vienna with accessibility for patients throughout Northern Virginia, Maryland, and the Washington D.C. metropolitan area. We welcome patients seeking second opinions and those with complex cases involving multiple pelvic pain conditions.
column11: We specialize in Endometriosis, Interstitial Cystitis | Chronic UTI's & IBS. We use conventional, holistic and mainstream-alternative modalities to create customized solutions. Especially those with multiple health concerns.

I am on the Center's Wellness Program and I have to say it is wonderful to find a medical office that is focused on women's holistic health and wellbeing. I feel seen and heard as opposed to being hurried out of the office like most practices. My appointment was with Wendy Roberts today and she is excellent. From the moment I stepped into the office, I was greeted promptly and warmly by Case Prieston, the office manager. I was eased into my appointment so professionally and with such reassurance I felt almost at home, if one can day that about a medical office. I highly recommend women to check out Dr. Delgado's office and what it has to offer. You will be in gentle and capable hands.|Dr. Delgado is nice and all, I appreciate her holistic approach, however it feels very much like a money grab. Pushing me to buy specific supplements and do treatments that would not be covered by insurance but was told by the front staff it would be booked with "this code" so insurance would reimburse which feels like fraud. When I filed with my insurance the codes I was provided, insurance covered almost nothing. It made moving forward with any treatment unlikely. I wound up seeing another specialist who was able to treat and perform surgery all covered by my insurance. Her office was just not for me, but I'm sure she's helped others. It's sort of a no brainer to use my federal benefits elsewhere when I already pay well for them.|I wish all women's care could be this wonderful!  Start to finish wonderful experience.  Beautiful office, ease of getting a convenient appointment, helpful front desk staff, and wonderful medical care. Dr Delgado takes the time to listen to her patients and get to the root of the issue.  She then works with the patient to come up with a game plan.  Great bedside manner. column2: Puget Sound Pain Clinic - Tukwila (A Sound Pain Alliance Member)
column3:
Puget Sound Pain Clinic in Tukwila, Washington serves the greater Seattle area with specialized pain management solutions. As a proud member of the Sound Pain Alliance network, our clinic combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Our multidisciplinary team of board-certified specialists develops personalized treatment plans addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions, with a focus on improving functionality and quality of life.

At Puget Sound Pain Clinic, we offer a three-pronged approach to pain management that includes medication management, interventional procedures, and minimally invasive surgical options. Our specialists are trained in the latest techniques for treating complex pain conditions, including spinal disorders, neuropathic pain, joint pain, and post-surgical pain. We emphasize responsible medication management while exploring interventional alternatives that may provide longer-lasting relief.

Our Facility and Location

Conveniently located at 7200 S 180th St #102 in Tukwila, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. The clinic provides a comfortable, accessible environment for patients throughout the Puget Sound region. With ample parking and a central location just minutes from I-405 and I-5, we're easily accessible for patients from Seattle, Renton, Kent, and surrounding communities.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our approach goes beyond symptom management to address the physical, emotional, and social impacts of pain. Our team works collaboratively with primary care physicians, physical therapists, and other specialists to ensure coordinated care. New patients receive comprehensive evaluations to develop individualized treatment strategies that evolve with their changing needs.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our website at www.soundpainalliance.com/puget-sound-pain-clinic/ or call us directly at (253) 983-9390.

My dr transferred here and I havent been able to see him since.  Dr Chen is a wonderful Dr and I really wanted to continue care with him but I can't get the "New Patient Coordinator" to even call me back, let alone get an appointment to see him.  I have been trying off and on since 9/1/2024 and every time I call, I am told to give my name, phone number and date of birth and "new patient coordinator" will call me back  LIES!!! no one calls you back.  Even though I've been seeing Dr Chen for a few years now, I have to be set up as a new patient anyway, okay fine, let's do that then but NO, I get ignored.  I also called my medical provider and was told that I don't need a referrel because I'm already an established patient according to my medical insurance.|Dr Jason is amazing and is so easy to talk to. He makes you feel like he understands what your going through. He listens and gets it. I'm so greatful to have found him.  Thank You Dr Hussey for always listening and understanding!|I have been  a patient here for over 5 years. I suffer from RA and struggle with day to day activities like getting out of bed. The help I get from Jason Hussey PA is amazing. I'm able to work and be active as a mother and wife.  I would highly recommend this office.|Always professional in a warm way.  I would recommend Puget Sound Pain to anyone.
I noticed other reviews complaining about PSP not answering the phone.   I  experienced the same thing.  However,  this was during the office remodeling.  There was also something wrong with the phone electronics....  Given the wonderful Doctors, staff and service.... I think this is forgivable.|As always, I'm treated with dignity and respect at Puget Sound Pain Clinic. column48: What is pain mgt?
column49:
Donnie,

Thank you for reaching out and asking! Pain management is a specialty that helps treat any type of pain such as new/acute, chronic and cancer related pain. We focus on a comprehensive approach that can include lifestyle changes, medications, interventions (injections), minor surgery and/or pain psychology.

column2: Puget Sound Pain Clinic - Covington (A Sound Pain Alliance Member)
column3:
Puget Sound Pain Clinic serves Covington, Washington and surrounding communities as a dedicated member of the Sound Pain Alliance network. Our comprehensive pain management center specializes in providing multidisciplinary care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Located in the heart of Covington, our clinic combines evidence-based medical approaches with personalized treatment plans to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

At Puget Sound Pain Clinic, we offer a full spectrum of pain management services including medication management, interventional procedures, and minimally invasive surgical options. Our board-certified specialists work collaboratively to address complex pain conditions through a balanced approach that considers both immediate relief and long-term pain management strategies. We treat conditions ranging from back and neck pain to neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Our Treatment Approach

Our clinic utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and therapeutic interventions to precisely identify and target pain sources. Treatment options include prescription medication management, nerve blocks, epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and various minimally invasive surgical procedures. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs and circumstances of individual patients.

Patient-Centered Care

We believe in establishing meaningful partnerships with our patients through clear communication and education. Our team takes time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach has helped countless individuals throughout the Puget Sound region find effective relief from debilitating pain.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 253-983-9390. Our clinic is conveniently located at 17615 SE 272nd St #109, Covington, WA 98042. For additional information about our practice and the Sound Pain Alliance network, visit our website at https://www.soundpainalliance.com/puget-sound-pain-clinic/.

column38: Stacy Johnson|Alice Campbell|OGperkyb1tch|Tere Runkel|Jason Williams|Donielle Blair|Janelle Hite|Sarah Boyle
column40:
This is an excellent pain clinic all around, with caring and compassionate providers and and Amy at the front check-in desk is fabulous. The process from start to finish for each appointment is super easy and fluid. I have never had to wait more than a few minutes to be seen for my appointment.

Dr Chen and Dr Wheeler are both phenomenal. Dr Wheeler is who I see, and he is always very compassionate, patient, knowledgeable, and truly cares about his patients. He has great recommendations for ways to treat pain, which I have promptly tried every device or advice he has provided to me. Every time, they work! He talks to you like you are a person, not like many other pain clinics out there. There is no judgment.

You are not FORCED to go through procedures like some other clinics, especially if you have already gone through most of those procedures, some of them often. You're not required to do urine drug tests every single month if you are stable on your meds and follow all the rules of the pain contract.

Their billing is transparent and accurate. I love that you can do most appointments virtually. Yes, the phone calls rarely get answered, but they are easy to contact via the online portal. They get back to you within a day. I highly recommend Puget Sound Pain Clinic.|My Dr. Stephen Wheeler  is a very good knowledgeable  and friendly doctor when talking  with me.  he gives me eye contact shake my hands when enter ti room  and the visit is over.    when we speak we always end up laughing about something. Edited the visit is over.. A good Doctor.. he give the very best knee injection I don't feel it at all. I am not comfortable with needle but with Dr. Stephen I am comfortable with him I know he care about me and the quality of life I  having  with this pain.  The Receptionists and staff  are very sweet,  polite  and patience  with me and  that could be saying a lot I know, because I move so slow but they're are smiling and helpful. I never feel rush or like I am a bother and I know we all have bad days but they're  don't let show very well and they  treat me with dignity and respect. just get great care at the Covington clinic Dr. Stephenwheeler. Another thing I like they get you in and out and like I said the entire staff are polite and friendly.  May God continue to bless them all and Dr. Wheeler  and his family|My PCP sent me here after brain surgery and 2 major neck surgeries. Dr. Wheeler, from the beginning has been amazing. He listens to me and my concerns. I don't feel rushed. For once I feel like I'm being treated like a human being. Amy also is amazing from the minute I walk in to when I walk out, even during phone calls.  Thank you.|My care from Puget Sound Pain Clinic has always been excellent.  The doctors and staff have always been kind and respectful.  My current provider, Stephen Wheeler is knowledgeable, compassionate, and professional.  I'm doing well with the trigger point injections he recommended for my chronic back pain.  He also successfully treated me for a lingering migraine.  The clinic helps manage my pain so that I am able to navigate and participate in required daily activities.|I usually don't leave replies on medical care, but I'd like to really highlight the level of care I've received since going Sound Care. I came to them after my pain provider lost their contract with my insurer.

I was scared and did not know what would happen, & from the 1st visit it's been nothing but care....1st class! I've had nothing but positive experiences with multiple providers and I feel that Sound Care is one of most caring, supportive and understanding group of medical professionals.

Now everyone's situation is different, but if you are going to be "active" in your medical care, and will be open to working on your care and health, this group of doctors will help you be better.|Dr. Chan is a very good spine specialist... He answers all your questions, and takes time to explain things to you so you understand. Amy, the front desk, secretary, is great! She's easy to talk to, funny, always having a smile on her face, and is very good at explaining things to you and answering all your questions as needed.|Jason Hussey and supporting staff are 5 star!
I will always choose to remain with the absolutely best care possible with my providers.

However , communication has been an ongoing long term huge frustration. Impossible to contact anyone via phone unless 5% chance someone answers, otherwise calls go to a call center and usually do not hear back for days or weeks.

New Doctor Plan app communication system is a failure. Office staff and myself have worked in person and via phone, system has failed to send emails to allow access. All junk/spam emails investigated without success. We've tried different emails and still no success.Healow is the only way I can communicate.

Bottom line, I would recommend these providers 100%|After 20 years of being over medicated and nothing else I finally found Dr. Wheeler. I now get injections and he knows exactly where to do them to relieve my pain. My pain has significantly reduced. All of my office visits are a discussion. He cares about you as a person and genuinely wants to help reduce your pain. I would highly recommend him to anyone. He's been a lifesaver for me. I'm actually taking less medication and going back to work.

column3:
Peninsula Pain Clinic in Silverdale, Washington serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions across the Kitsap Peninsula region. As a distinguished member of the Sound Pain Alliance network, this specialized medical facility combines advanced interventional techniques with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Their team of board-certified pain specialists employs evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique circumstances, focusing on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At Peninsula Pain Clinic, patients gain access to cutting-edge interventional procedures designed to target pain at its source. The clinic's multidisciplinary approach incorporates various treatment modalities including nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options. Their specialists work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address not only the symptoms but also the underlying causes of persistent pain conditions.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that pain affects every aspect of a patient's life, the clinical team prioritizes creating treatment strategies that enable patients to resume normal activities and regain functionality. Their philosophy centers on helping patients effectively manage or potentially cure their pain, allowing them to return to daily routines with minimal limitations. This patient-focused methodology has established Peninsula Pain Clinic as a trusted resource for those suffering from debilitating pain conditions throughout the region.

Patients can easily schedule consultations by calling +1 360-415-9110 or visiting their comprehensive website at www.soundpainalliance.com/peninsula-pain-clinic/ for detailed information about available services, insurance options, and educational resources about pain management approaches.

column38: Shelley Wood|Heather Flanagan WA-Silverdale|Kathleen Lyon|Vicki Esparo|I C|Catherine Sisk|Vickie Schumann|Thomas Olson
column40:
Really nice staff. I'd recommend them!
I've been going there for 4 yrs now, and happy with them.|I was welcomed very warmly by the clinic staff.  I was still finishing my paperwork when I arrived and they were very kind to help me finish and start processing what I had already finished.  Dr. Hillyer was extremely knowledgeable in everything I am experiencing in my back and leg.  I felt very confident in the treatment process we discussed.|Peninsula Pain Clinic was disappointing. After my consulation, they lost my paperwork for contacting my insurance and getting an injection approved and scheduled. Weeks went by without a follow-up. I eventually called them to see what was taking so long just to find out they were doing nothing since my papers were lost. The process off the actual injection was fine, other than it literally did nothing to help my pain. So that was a waste but maybe that's just my personal injury problem. When scheduling the injection, they also scheduled a 2-week follow-up. I felt obligated to go so that I could tell them it didn't work for me. When there, they forgot about me in the exam room for nearly 45 minutes. It was 10 minutes before closing time, so I stepped out to ask what was going on. They seemed bothered that I had the gall to do so and there was a lot of whispering about it. The Advanced Patient Provider that was seeing me seemed especially bothered and also confused as to why I was here for a follow-up. Um, you guys are the ones that scheduled this. I thought it was necessary, I would have gladly not come in, wasting my time and money to tell you guys it didn't work at all. He basically only suggested we try the same exact thing again and didn't seem to care at all that it didn't have any positive effect on my pain. Both times that I thought I was seeing the doctor, I only saw the Advanced Patient Provider. So that's frustrating to have never actually seen or talked to the doctor about my issue. That didn't stop the clinic from billing my insurance as though the appointments were with the doctor. That seems sketchy to me.

Overall, lacking in professionalism, messed up my papers, forgot about me in an exam room, treatment didn't work, and the APP didn't seem to care about my issue. I will not go back and wouldn't recommend it to others based on my experience.|If you are a drug addict this is the place to go. A family member overdosed on Fentanyl (fortunately I found him. Emergency personnel were able to revive him) but they still keep prescribing. I contacted the manager before this most recent overdose to inform them that he was abusing all the pain meds they prescribe (more than one). Nothing changed - they keep issuing him opioids.|I have had a fantastic experience with Dr. Juan, Ms. Bouquet, and the rest of medical team treating me. I have had not one negative experience since starting my treatment at Peninsula Pain Clinic. The staff asked about my lifestyle, diet, medical conditions, and emotional well-being. I have been left with disabling conditions after dealing with rare form of luekemia. In the past, I lived in the southern states and throughout my residency there my medical conditions were either dismissed and/or neglected. Since moving to WA, all of my conditions are being treated and my personal well-being has improved because of medical professionals like the ones at PPC. They are well educated in their fields and the staff has true empathy for every individual that comes through the clinic. Being proactive with my health concerns and listening to the advice of my doctors/nurses has had a remarkable improvement mentality and physically.

Insurance can be messy and tricky place to navigate. The staff will do their best to work with your insurance plan or come up with a financial plan best suited for your budget. They are very reasonable. I am still disabled, however I can better cope with the chronic pain with their treatment options and compassionate staff. I will continue my treatment at this clinic for years to come.|My intake visit was last week. I was very impressed by: a) the new patient forms emailed to me could be filled in on my PC b) the receptionist was friendly & efficient c) wait time was minimal d) clinical staff were great, especially Kelly (ARNP) e) I feel confident in my plan's next steps d) facility was spacious and clean e) pleased the doc came in to introduce himself and check on my experience. Suggestion for improvement: too much is left up to the patient to call back and see, e.g., is insurance improved for diagnostic tests? Has the test order gone to medical facility? Was it faxed correctly?  If I hadn't dogged the process it would have been delayed, and when one is in pain, that matters. Please note: I would heartily recommend the Pain Clinic. Everyone can improve.|I have been a patient of Peninsula Pain. Clinic for over twenty years and have always been treated with respect and compassion. I would highly recommend this facility for chronic pain treatment.|I receive EXCELLENT health care at Peninsula Pain Clinic (PPC) on all my visits there. Kristin Downs is my provider and she has helped me so much, developing a plan to get my pain levels  under control and I'm finally learning to live a decent life. The staff is always friendly and professional, and caring. I really appreciate all the great care I receive from PPC and I would recommend this office to my family and friends

column40:
Dr. Goldworm is a GREAT doctor and is fantastic to work with.  He takes the time to understand the cause of the pain and looks at the entire health picture in order to best serve the patient.  I wish I could use him for all of my health needs.  I would like to thank him for his passion and the way in which he serves his patients!|So 5 stars for sure in beginning a little apprehensive at first.read horror stories about pain clinic. Rest assured this is not that.

I always have an excellent experience at this pain clinic. The environment is clean, the staff at the front desk are professional and friendly, and Dr. Brad Goldworm is outstanding. He communicates clearly and ensures I understand my treatment, even with the challenges of my MS. If you follow the rules and seek genuine care, this clinic provides exceptional service and support. Highly recommend!|The staff are very sweet, helpful and professional. The building is super clean. Dr. Kim is the nicest pain doctor I've ever had.  He is honest with you. He will tell you what works best for dealing with pain. And if you choose to take his advice you will live with less pain which is what we all want!|The front desk staff are nice enough barely. They mocked a patient after he left. The office does not answer the phone and they have yet to return any of the three messages I left asking for information.
Dr Brad Goldworm is dismissive and rude. He talked to me like I was an ignorant 12yr old instead of a 68 year old woman who has experience with pain clinic procedures.
The he flatly refused to refill my prescription and suggested a cortisone shot. A very bad idea for diabetics with a high A1C. He offered no other help for the chronic pain. He suggested PT for neuropathy. Really?
I would suggest you find a different clinic or at least a different provider .|Extremely friendly and helpful staff, doctors care for you and out of any pain centers I've experienced in my life, this one has treated me the best out of all of them combined.
Definitely a place to go if you need treatment or help with chronic pain. Although I am chronically ill with autoimmune dieseases, they give amazing care for temporary chronic pain and treatment for injuries as well.|I enjoy working with Brad Goldworm. He listens and is attentive to my needs and concerns about my health. He works hard to help me find the best relief I can with all my pain issues. I feel listened to, respected, and that my health is in his best interest.|Dr Kim and all of his are very polite and courteous. Dr. Kim is amazing at his job. I've never met anybody like him and he figured it out the first time I saw him which nobody else could do in 30 years. Thank you so much to everybody. I appreciate you.|The staff is very friendly, warm, and welcoming. The doctors have a great bedside manner and take the time to this to their patients. I've been going to Sound Alliance for a little over 2 years now and have had the best experience, I won't go anywhere else so with that being said I highly recommend this place.

column3:
Inland Pain Specialists serves Spokane, Washington and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating both chronic and acute pain conditions through innovative, evidence-based approaches. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving quality of life for patients throughout the Inland Northwest region by offering personalized care plans that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Inland Pain Specialists, we take pride in our interventional approach to pain management. Our practice focuses on minimally invasive procedures designed to provide effective pain relief while reducing dependency on opioid medications. These advanced techniques allow many patients to experience significant improvement with shorter recovery times and fewer side effects than traditional treatments.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

Our clinic offers consultations and treatments for numerous pain conditions, including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Sports injuries

  • Work-related injuries

Patient-Centered Approach

column40:
I can't say enough good about this clinic! I went in fairly debilitated. To a person they were informative, professional and knowledgeable. I was given a thorough explanation of what they could do for me and they absolutely did! It took a few days after treatment but I ended up one hundred percent better! I think they were all as excited as I was about the results.
Don't hesitate to see them if you are having any kind of chronic pain. You'll be glad you did.|Excellent Staff, they are competent, experienced, knowledgeable, helpful and very kind. My particular case is complicated, waited years to get to this point. The staffs competent efforts far surpassed my expectation. Dr J Fontana is great, my experience was above average overall.  Treatment was without worry and very effective.
Thank you so much|John Fontana is a personable,caring, highly informed and clear speaking pain specialist. I had my first round of injections just yesterday and I'm experiencing much improvement this morning!  Thank you|I was unable to stand more than 5 minutes,but after my procedure by Dr. Fontana I am able to vacume,or clean my entire kitchen.  I'm having so much more fun with friends.  Very happy with everyone at Inland pain Specialists!|My R knee (patella) broke in 1/2 in February 2012 as a result of a head on collision (not my fault). At that time I had a diagnosis of Scleroderma however was not symptomatic. My knee healed... Over the years since this injury along with degenerative arthritis, osteonecrosis and other factors this knee has given me problems to say the least. I am able to "manage" my all over chronic pain, Spinal stenosis and other problems with my back with PT, ablations and other injections. I have had success with previous Pain Management and Spine specialists since 2017 for both my R knee and back issues.  My last R knee ablation was done at Providence Orthopedic/pain management in California. I got great relief, this was May 2023. This past July 2024 I had my R knee ablation done by Inland Pain Specialists not only did not help, I believe damage was done. There is a hard "mass" on my knee that was not there before. He inserted  SIX needles for the procedure which I thought was strange as all other knee ablations done were never more than Three. All I know is the "before and after" this provider performed the ablation. My knee since this ablation is worse than it has been in several years. It was less painful prior to this ablation!! I will never let anyone except an Orthopedic specialist/MD treat my knee ever!!!|Doc and nurses are great! Very helpful and nice to work with. Took care of my neck problem with one shot!  Gave me great information on everything and got me setup for a good outcome. Will happily go back if needed again!!|I saw JJ and Kala for a knee injury I sustained. They took their time to help me outside of regular business hours.  They closely examined my knee and were both very positive and supportive, talking me through all the options. I highly recommend these two because they are very professional, but the amount of knowledge they have is unlike anything I've ever experienced. Undoubtedly, they were the best choice of medical professionals from whom I could have sought answers. Not only did I feel heard, but I also felt like I was so much more than a dollar sign to them. If I could give them a higher rating, I most certainly would.|Went in to see John for my elbow and had the best experience! The staff was thoughtful and kind and easy to talk to. I am so glad I chose to support small business with my health care.
My elbow has been free of pain since my visit!!
Highly recommend!!

column2: Peninsula Pain Clinic - Gig Harbor (A Sound Pain Alliance Member)
column3:
Peninsula Pain Clinic serves Gig Harbor, Washington and surrounding communities as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions. As a proud member of Sound Pain Alliance, our clinic combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified specialists utilizes evidence-based approaches to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At Peninsula Pain Clinic, we offer cutting-edge interventional pain management options designed to help patients effectively manage or potentially cure their pain conditions. Our comprehensive approach integrates the latest medical technologies with proven therapeutic techniques to address the root causes of discomfort. We understand that pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our goal extends beyond symptom relief to restoring normal function and activities.

Specialized Treatment Options

Our clinic provides a wide range of specialized treatments including nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, radiofrequency ablation, joint injections, and minimally invasive procedures. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs following thorough evaluation and diagnostic testing. We emphasize collaborative care, working closely with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated treatment approaches.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and active participation in their treatment journey. Our compassionate staff takes time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, ensuring patients make informed decisions about their care. The clinic environment is designed to provide comfort and reassurance during what can be a challenging time for those suffering from chronic pain.

Visit Our Clinic

Peninsula Pain Clinic is conveniently located at 5122 Olympic Dr Ste A-203, Gig Harbor, WA 98335. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (360) 415-9110. Additional information about our approach and treatment options can be found on our website at www.soundpainalliance.com/peninsula-pain-clinic/.
column11: Peninsula Pain Clinic offers cutting edge, innovative interventional pain management options to help patients manage or if possible cure their pain effectively so they can live life as normally as possible.

column2: Bellevue Pain and Wellness | Spravato, Ketamine, Injections
column3:
Bellevue Pain and Wellness serves the Seattle-Bellevue area as a premier pain management clinic dedicated to comprehensive care solutions. Our facility combines traditional pain management approaches with innovative treatments to address both chronic pain and treatment-resistant depression. Under the expert guidance of double board-certified physician Dr. Robert Bowers MD and Marshall Kim ARNP, our clinic has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in Washington state, offering personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Bellevue Pain and Wellness, we understand that pain affects everyone differently. Our approach involves thorough evaluation and customized treatment plans that may include:

  • Fluoroscopic-guided injections including epidural steroid injections

  • Joint injections for hip, knee, shoulder, and elbow pain

  • Radiofrequency ablation for longer-lasting pain relief

  • Trigger point injections for muscle pain and tension

Innovative Mental Health Solutions

Beyond traditional pain management, we proudly offer cutting-edge treatments for depression and mood disorders:

  • Ketamine infusion therapy for treatment-resistant depression

  • FDA-approved Spravato/esketamine treatments in a controlled, supportive environment

Our Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our commitment to exceeding patient expectations through personalized care. We take the time to understand your specific condition, medical history, and treatment goals before developing your custom treatment plan. Our team works collaboratively to ensure you receive the most effective interventions for your unique situation.

Visit Our Clinic

Located at 14450 NE 29th Pl #230, Bellevue, WA 98007, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. Contact us at (425) 998-7884 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward improved wellness.

Learn more about our services at www.bellevuepainwellness.com
column11:
Welcome to Bellevue Pain and Wellness, Seattle-Bellevue's premier pain management clinic. Our goal is to offer a custom tailored pain management plan to all our patients. We also offer ketamine infusion therapy as well as cutting edge and FDA approved Spravato/esketamine for depression.
We offer everything from standard injections using fluoroscopic guidance like epidural steroid injections, joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, trigger point injections, hip knee shoulder and elbow injection.

column3:
Northwest Pain Specialists serves Spokane Valley, WA with comprehensive interventional pain management solutions. Led by Dr. Russell Legg, who holds board certifications in both Anesthesia and Pain Management, NWPS delivers specialized care through advanced techniques and personalized treatment plans. The clinic stands out for its multifaceted approach to pain relief, combining medical interventions with rehabilitative strategies to address both acute and chronic pain conditions.

While Northwest Pain Specialists primarily focuses on interventional pain management, their comprehensive care model also incorporates targeted exercises, thorough patient education, and advanced neuromodulation surgeries. Dr. Legg's extensive training includes completion of an ACGME accredited Pain Fellowship, providing him with exceptional expertise in interventional techniques. The clinic offers both fluoroscopically guided procedures for spinal issues (cervical, thoracic, and lumbar regions) and ultrasound guided treatments for headaches and musculoskeletal pain affecting the upper and lower extremities.

Patient-Centered Approach

At NWPS, each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique needs of individual patients. The clinic's commitment to comprehensive care ensures that patients receive not only immediate pain relief but also strategies for long-term management and improved quality of life. Currently welcoming new patients, Northwest Pain Specialists provides a supportive environment where pain concerns are addressed with both expertise and compassion.

Location & Contact Information

Address: 12109 E Broadway Ave BLDG C, Spokane Valley, WA 99206, United States

Phone: +1 509-828-7288

Website: www.nwpainspecialists.com
column11:
Northwest Pain Specialists (NWPS) is primarily an interventional pain management clinic, but also provides targeted exercises, patient education and neuromodulation surgeries.
Our provider Russell Legg, MD is board certified in both Anesthesia and Pain Management which includes further specialized training in interventional by completing an ACGME accredited Pain Fellowship.
Dr. Legg performs fluoroscopically guided procedures for the cervical, thoracic and lumbar spine as well as ultrasound guided procedures for headache and musculoskeletal pain for the upper and lower extremities.
We are pleased to be accepting new patients.

As a proud member of the Sound Pain Alliance network, this specialized clinic has established itself as a leader in interventional pain management techniques that help patients reclaim their quality of life. The clinic's team of board-certified specialists combines years of clinical expertise with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions affecting residents throughout Snohomish County and surrounding areas.

At Mt Baker Pain Clinic, patients have access to cutting-edge, innovative interventional procedures designed to target pain at its source. The clinic's approach focuses on minimally invasive techniques that can reduce or potentially eliminate the need for long-term medication dependence. Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Mt Baker Pain Clinic is their unwavering commitment to personalized care. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation and customized treatment plan that addresses their specific pain challenges. The clinic's philosophy centers on helping patients manage or potentially cure their pain effectively, enabling them to return to normal daily activities and improve their overall quality of life. Their multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to ensure all aspects of a patient's pain condition are addressed.

Location and Accessibility

Their modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology in a comfortable, welcoming environment. For appointments or consultations, patients can reach the clinic directly at +1 360-200-4388 or visit their website at https://www.soundpainalliance.com/mt-baker-pain-clinic/ for more information about their services and treatment options.
