column38: R|Deborah Sleeman|Cheryl Pearson|Michael Johnston|Debra Compton|M Barnett|RACHEL KNUTSON|Dorothy Sargent
column40:
Dr. Hannah has kept me alive and working for years.  Her quality of care is and has been the best I've had.  She's an extremely intelligent Doctor and has also solved a medical issue I've had for years and seen other doctors, specialists etc for.  Just by her and I having a simple conversation that started with her asking how I was doing.  I had a gnarly migraine at an appointment and mentioned for the first time that I've had them pretty constant since a previous neck surgery years earlier.  She right away mentioned that often with the type surgery I had, patients experience migraines.  Wow!  I made a trip to my family doc, he gave me migrain medications and I've been like night and day!  That little conversation, that world of knowledge and her deep care she has for people and patients has helped my life so, so much and truly myself and my family are so thankful she keeps me alive and able to work!  Kelly has also taken great care of me making sure i know what's going on with my insurance stuff and giving me the appointments for the times I need,  she takes care of all that for me then,  I just  pay what she tells me.  She's been wonderful to work with.  Yes, Mount Baker Pain Clinic, the doctors, the staff have been wonderful.  They all have treated me very well!|Very kind and friendly providers and staff. They seem to really care about their patients and worked very hard to help each patient with there own issues. They take care to listen to you and help you in the best way they can.
My experience since starting at Mt Baker has been very positive.b|I have been going to this pain clinic for approximately five years.  I have always been treated with the utmost respect and dignity for a person who suffers daily with chronic pain. The doctor, the receptionist and the nurses all explain the treatments and paperwork in a very professional and understandable language/way.|Kelly And  the doctors are very professional. They are very helpful with my needs for my pain Management.. I am very thankful for the Doctors and staff They are very compassionate. Hannah my primary pain management Doctor. She has always show concern about my pain and given me great direction And help for pain relief. Thank you, Mt Baker, pain clinic.|Front desk team member Kelly is always cheerful and helpful with scheduling, insurance questions and payments.  PAC Hannah always gives me the time I need to review pain issues, medicine adjustments and any other concerns I might have regarding my health.|I've been going to the Smokey Point Clinic for awhile. I have chronic pain, have been on pain meds for years and the only reason why I changed to this place was because I've been having extreme anxiety driving to my other provider. This is the 2nd time that this provider has disregarded my needs to get my meds on time. They use their authority to make you feel like a lying junkie. If you push back and ask questions of certain staff, they ignore you and actually hang up on you! I'm not confrontational. I only take a half pill more frequently so I get a longer lasting relief. My prior doctor never prescribed and set up my next appointment for the day I run out, incase anything comes up he would do a week or more. This doctor thinks that 28 or 30 days you are okay to run out the night before and she'll just give you your next prescription the next day! The last time she knew I would run out 3 days prior to my appointment and refused to give me a few days extension to last. So she knowingly left me to be in pain and to go through withdrawals. Which then you ask yourself, what ever happened to the Hypocratic Oath to do no harm?
I called the pharmacy and asked if the doctor wrote the prescription to be picked up, how early do they refill, they told me up to 2 days prior to the next refill. So the office staff and doctor lied when they said they couldn't do it for the same day it ran out.
I was so hopeful when I first started here because the doctor made me think she was on my side. She said that taking your meds as prescribed I shouldn't feel bad because I'm dealing with chronic pain. We then tried different meds to try to get me off of the narcotics but unfortunately I have allergic reactions to the chemicals in other stuff. Placing me back on the original dosage. I couldn't have been more wrong with thinking this place had my back.
I wasn't going to leave a review. Because then I worried that if this was seen I'd be treated even worse or I would be refused my medication as a punishment. But, others need to know how you'll be treated if you go with them as your pain management clinic. That if you can go down a different path and avoid becoming dependent on narcotics, I can't stress enough that you'll be treated by everyone that you're a lying junkie. You have to do random pee in a cup and have your medication counted like your not an honorable person. You can't drink or do herbal/marijuana substitution for relief or they'll stop your prescription. I don't drink or do anything else so it's no biggie for me. I hope this helps others to try and travel a different path or find a better place to get your relief. I'm stuck now with how bad my neck and back are, the pills barely give relief but without would be a worse nightmare. Take care, find strength from within and don't trust blindly.

Update the next day; I found out from my pharmacy that my prior authorization wasn't filled out fully. The insurance company can't approve my prescription without it. The pharmacy can't let me pay cash for my rx because I'm on Medicaid. The office closed at 4:30 without finishing the authorization and they won't open again until Monday. My regular doctor cannot help because they didn't prescribe the Oxycodone and have never seen me for it. The pharmacy can't help and suggested the ER. My doctor can't help and suggested the ER. Because we don't know how my body will handle the pain and withdrawls after being on this opiod since 2013. I am very angry at this point. All I did was followed what the multiple doctors, surgeons, ect offered as pain relief over the years. My paranoid brain wants to think that because I filled out this review this all happened. But my sanity says to just try to hunker down and breath through the massive anxiety attacks and emotional feelings that are so very strong right now. Once again if you ever are offered opiods as an option for pain relief don't do it! I may not be able to function without pain relief, but at least I wouldn't have all this added on. I just will never leave my bed again. Beyond sad...|I have been trying to get a hold of them for awhile got a referral to go here because I don't drive have been a chronic pain patient for several years and my 1st pain mngmt doc moved to Eastern WA the 2nd 1 we found was in Sea. To hard for me to get to but trust me I am missing them right now. I have been in limbo for over a year now.|It was a really good appointment .
Dr was engaged with me and I felt heard. Office staff is always plesent.

column2: Mt. Baker Pain Clinic - Bellingham (A Sound Pain Alliance Member)
column3:
Mt. Baker Pain Clinic in Bellingham, Washington serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions in the Pacific Northwest. As a proud member of the Sound Pain Alliance network, this specialized clinic has established itself as a leader in interventional pain management techniques. Their dedicated team of pain specialists works diligently to provide personalized treatment plans that address both chronic and acute pain conditions, helping patients reclaim their quality of life and return to daily activities with minimal discomfort.

Mt. Baker Pain Clinic offers cutting edge, innovative interventional pain management options designed to help patients effectively manage or potentially cure their pain. Their comprehensive approach combines advanced medical procedures with holistic care strategies, ensuring that each patient receives treatment tailored to their specific needs. The clinic's philosophy centers on minimizing medication dependence while maximizing functional improvement, allowing patients to live life as normally as possible despite pain challenges.

Specialized Services

The clinic provides a wide range of specialized interventional procedures and treatment modalities that target the source of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Their expert physicians utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to accurately identify pain generators before developing customized treatment plans. This precision-based approach helps ensure optimal outcomes for patients suffering from various pain conditions including spinal disorders, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndromes.

Location and Contact Information

Located at 4029 Northwest Ave, Suite 301, Bellingham, WA 98226, Mt. Baker Pain Clinic is conveniently accessible to residents throughout Whatcom County and surrounding areas. Patients seeking consultation or treatment can contact the clinic directly at +1 360-752-0518 to schedule an appointment. For additional information about their services and treatment options, prospective patients are encouraged to visit their website at https://www.soundpainalliance.com/mt-baker-pain-clinic/.

column2: Spine Team Spokane - Pain Management Clinic Spokane WA
column3:
Spine Team Spokane serves Spokane, WA and surrounding communities as a comprehensive pain management clinic dedicated to addressing chronic and acute pain conditions. Established in 2002, our integrated healthcare facility brings together physicians, chiropractors, and physical therapists who collaborate to create personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from neck pain, back pain, joint discomfort, muscle injuries, and nerve-related conditions.

At Spine Team Pain Center, we believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief. Our team recognizes that every patient's body responds differently to treatments, which is why we customize care plans based on individual needs and conditions. This collaborative model ensures patients receive the most effective combination of medical interventions, chiropractic adjustments, and therapeutic exercises.

Comprehensive Services

Our pain management services include:

- Specialized pain injections

- Advanced rehabilitation programs

- Chiropractic care

- Physical therapy

- Interventional pain procedures

- Comprehensive pain assessments

Serving Our Community Since 2002

For over two decades, our professional staff has been committed to improving quality of life for Spokane residents suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our diverse team brings together various specialties and perspectives, united by a passion for helping patients achieve pain-free living.

Relief from persistent pain is within reach. Whether you're struggling with debilitating back pain, recurring headaches, or post-injury discomfort, Spine Team Pain Center offers the expertise and compassionate care needed for effective pain management.

Contact us today to schedule your consultation:

Website: [spokanespineteam.com](http://spokanespineteam.com/)

Phone: +1 509-363-3100

Address: 510 E Holland Ave, Spokane, WA 99218, United States

Our professional staff is well-diversified and passionate about making people's lives pain free. Relief from back pain, neck pain, headaches, and all around pain management is right around the corner for you and your lived ones. Give Spine Team Pain Center a call today!

column40:
I am not sure if this is normal procedure, but I been patiently waiting about a month since about Jan. 3rd 2025 to schedule an appointment. My main doctor put in a referrel from an x-ray taken. Pain is progressing and I hope to be a new patient if I can get an appointment or even a call back. Perhaps once  I am in the system, things will get better with the communication and I can move forward.  I will update this review as this procedure continues.
As for returning messages, I left 3 so far and I finally spoke to a real person on Feb 3rd. This could be because I updated my phone number, but I have given them the new number on a prior message.
Presently I am rating a 3 because of poor follow up to me. I will gladly raise this if I can get some progress toward helping me. They seem to have some  decent reviews.|I don't know where to start. Everyone in The Spine Team north side office has been amazing! They all treat you like a real person, with real medical problems, needing help! Dr. Sneddon is very informative, patient and understanding. He takes the time to thoroughly explain all of your options and what the potential outcomes and risks are. I've never felt rushed dealing with any provider at The Spine Team and I have quite a history with them between myself and my wife. He has done everything he can for me trying to reduce my pain without increasing my pain meds. We still have a ways to go but for once I can almost see a light at the end of the tunnel. Nathan Weins, Dr. Sneddon's PA is my pain management specialist. Most people dread medicinal pain management. A lot of them treat you like a pill seeker or a criminal. Not Nathan and not The Spine Team. Nathan, just like Dr. Sneddon, takes the time to get to know you, hear you out and come up with a plan that works for you and that Nathan is comfortable prescribing pain meds for. Then there's the office ladies. Melissa F, Amber, Bree, Kaitlin, Siera or Siena (I can never remember), Kat and everyone else is just amazing. It's so nice to finally feel like I'm being heard, treated like a person vs just another number and everything is being done without just doping me up and actually feeling like I'm being cared for. I don't feel like I'm just another payment from insurance. Speaking of insurance, the ladies in the office will go to war with insurance companies who get in the way of their client's care. I've witnessed it happen. Everything gets all held up by insurance, Melissa F or Amber make one phone call and suddenly all is well on my end. I could go on and on, writing a novel but I think I've got my point across. If you deal with any spine related pain or are in need of pain management, don't even look anywhere else, just go to The Spine Team and get treated right!|5 Star care!! That is what you will receive at Spine Team in Spokane. I have been a patient for two years now and would never go anywhere else for my Pain Management care. Dr. Mara and her team are awesome!!!|I've been coming here for pain management and all the staff are friendly and helpful but my PA-C Lindsey Sommers is awesome! She always listens to me and helps me choose which procedure or avenue to take with my pain. She's the best!!!|Jan 22, 2025 was my second appointment at The Spine Team In Spokane Valley on Evergreen Rd. This appointment was to start treatment plan as discussed & agreed upon with my provider at prior appointment. I went to recieve my first Epidural Steroid Injection. A staff member that's stationed in the surgical department is named Ashley. She was patient, professional, through, openly offered me assistance with  removing clothing garments required, getting into or closing back side of provided gown and post proceedure Ashley offered me any & all assistance I may require getting dressed to go home. Prior to my exiting Ashley was extremely through explaing to me that it's best & wisest to completely fill out the two week record post today's injection. By doing the required completing filling out this record which is to be returned at next two week appointment. Ashley stated the record I do & return does extremely assist the spine team provider members to clearly view what & how the injection effected my pain level, etc! I appreciate the kindness that Ashly displayed towards me. Cya again in another two weeks for follow up appointment!|I love the team at Spine Team Spokane. Dr. Sommers and Dr. Stringham are both superb in their caring attitude, attention to your needs, and desire to help find a treatment solution. Angel is a fabulous assistant and all of the staff are amazing! I am confident that this team will find results for my back issues and I am super grateful that I was referred to them!|Absolutely the best place I have ever been to for my pain management. I see Mara and her and her team are second to none! I have seen the other provider Nathan while Mara was on vacation. His team was just as pleasant and helpful and kind as Mara and her team! I would highly this place to anyone in need of pain management! Life changing help!!!|I've never experienced a clinic more focused on the money than they are on healthcare than this clinic. The staff is rude and they are so focused on getting paid, they have lost site of actual patient care. They are very quick to collect upfront rather than waiting for a claim to process but they are extremely slow to refund when you overpay. I have found a more compassionate healthcare team to continue treatment and will never go back to this business.

column3:
Robert Bowers, MD Chronic Pain Management serves Bellevue, Washington and surrounding communities with specialized care focused on alleviating chronic pain conditions. Located in the heart of Bellevue's medical district, Dr. Bowers' practice combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. The clinic offers comprehensive evaluations and personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique pain management needs.

Dr. Bowers brings extensive expertise to the treatment of various chronic pain conditions, including neuropathic pain, back and neck pain, arthritis, fibromyalgia, and post-surgical pain. The practice utilizes a multidisciplinary approach that may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications to address pain at its source.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Bowers' practice is his commitment to listening carefully to patients and developing individualized treatment strategies. The clinic prides itself on creating a welcoming environment where patients feel heard and respected. Dr. Bowers takes time to educate patients about their conditions and involves them in decision-making about their care plan.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

The practice is conveniently located at 14450 NE 29th Pl, Suite 230, Bellevue, WA 98007, with ample parking and accessibility features. The modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technologies to provide the highest standard of care.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Robert Bowers, patients can call +1 425-998-7884. The office staff is ready to assist with appointment scheduling, insurance questions, and other inquiries. New patients are welcome, and the practice accepts most major insurance plans.

column40: Dr Bowers and his staff have  treated my conditions with understanding and compassion. They are all very knowledgeable and display an ability to convey their knowledge in a manner which suits the level of their patient. I feel my needs get met with attention to my specific concerns without judgement. Dr Bowers and his colleagues provide alternatives to oral medication which is so important to maintain function and provide an environment for healing. I'm grateful to have his clinic as part of my care team.|I've recently moved here from Rochester,MN and it's been difficult finding doctors i like and could help me. Dr. Bowers was referred to me and I am so grateful! He spent the most time of any doctor here getting to know me and finding how best to deal with my chronic pain. He is kind, caring, concerned and compassionate. I feel I am in trusting care. Thank you!|Dr Bowers is always attentive and he listens and validates my symptoms. In my experience, some doctors have barraged me with questions about my pain and, when you live with pain for a long time, you become desensitised to exactly where the pain is. My MRI might say my pain should only be on my left side, but I experience pain on my right side also, most likely due to my muscles trying to protect and accommodate my limp, ect... Some doctors try to trip you up, because our system is flawed, but Dr Bowers openly discusses the results of my MRIs and he doesn't try to hide information from me. I really appreciate Dr Bowers candor, knowledge, and his willingness to give me the information I need to advocate for myself with the surgeon. When I have questions or need to be seen quickly, I'm able to call and get in, in a reasonable amount of time with one of the doctors, if not Dr. Bowers himself, and that has been very helpful. When I leave the office, I feel taken care of, validated, and like this is what healthcare should be like.|Dr. Bowers is excellent.  He truly cares about his patients and their well being.  He adapts procedures and medicines to provide the best quality of life for his patients.  Highly recommend for folks with chronic pain management needs.|Dr. Bowers has the rare capacity to combine a knowledgeable, no-nonsense approach to treatment with empathy for the patient.  Best way to describe it is that he has a rare balance and optimizes the experience and approach from both an intellectual and emotional angle.  This is probably more philosophical than necessary for a review but he is really quite good, from multiple perspectives.|Dr. Bowers and his entire staff are caring, thoughtful and knowledgeable. He's helped me with both chronic and short term pain management and resolution. I recommend his office to everyone.|We had our first meeting with Dr. Bowers.  You could tell right away that he is extremely knowledgeable and really cares about the patient and wants to do what is best for the patient.  Dr. Bowers asked the right questions and often times was 2 steps ahead.  My father has been suffering for the last 1 year with inability to walk and lower back/hip pain and we have seen so many physicians / specialists.  Having been in the medical field myself, immediately I knew that we were in the right hands based on just the first consultation! .   I would recommend Dr. Bowers in a heartbeat.  We are extremely grateful that we found him and look forward to addressing my father's issues following his laminectomy.|AMAZING!  I am a Canadian where our healthcare system is broken. My procedure in Canada required nearly a year long wait. Crazy. I went to Bellevue and got immediate relief from Dr Bowers. So good I cannot overstate the quality of the clinic, procedure

column3:
Northwest Spine and Pain Medicine serves Spokane, Washington and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures and personalized treatment plans. Located in North Spokane, our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies to address complex pain disorders affecting the spine, joints, and nervous system.

At Northwest Spine and Pain Medicine, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief that combines interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies. Our team excels in treating conditions including herniated discs, spinal stenosis, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We prioritize non-surgical and minimally invasive options whenever possible, helping patients avoid unnecessary surgeries while achieving meaningful pain reduction.

Our Advanced Treatment Options

Our practice provides cutting-edge treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted nerve blocks. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and goals of our patients, with a focus on improving function and quality of life. Our physicians stay current with the latest advancements in pain medicine to offer the most effective evidence-based treatments available.

Patient-Centered Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take time to listen to our patients and develop comprehensive treatment strategies. Our compassionate staff guides patients through every step of their care journey, from initial consultation through ongoing management. We work closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of our patients' health.

Contact Information

Visit our modern facility at 9425 N Nevada St #300, Spokane, WA 99218. To schedule a consultation, call us at +1 509-464-6208 or visit our website at www.nwspm.com for more information about our services and providers. Our office is conveniently located in North Spokane with ample parking and accessibility features for all patients.

column40: I have had a terrible experience with this office. The customer service is terrible. I don't get returned calls. They have lost paperwork that I dropped off to the front desk. They have not attempted to get x rays from other offices. The attitude they have shown to me has been arrogant, unkind and with no care for me as a patient dealing with chronic pain. The positive feedback I have read about this facility is amazing to me because I have seen nothing good from this location. In all the years I have dealt with care facilities this is the worse!|I see Jocelyn and Branden once a month. Every time, and  I mean every time I am greeted warmly. Jocelyn is genuinely glad to see me! And that makes me feel comfortable. I feel I can trust her and Branden. And Trust is so important these days. I know I can ask Jocelyn any questions I have and answers them all for me. We can chat easily about family and our lives. All in a short amount of time...that feels like we had coffee together. I believe God led me to these people who have and continue to help me. They care. I appreciate them and grateful they are my care team.|Dr. Nemri and James Foster are both excellent providers. They listen carefully, are responsive to my concerns, and explain things well. They are fair and consistent. I believe this clinic to be very concerned about not only treating my pain is but my overall health. All of the staff have been very polite and considerate to me, and have tried hard to schedule as appointments for me as convenient as possible. I highly recommend Spokane Spine and Pain Clinic for any person who experiences either severe and/or chronic pain. They have improved the quality of my life substantially.|I was assigned to a nurse practitioner for monthly visits for meds. But as my treatment became more complicated, I  began to see Dr Nemri, whom I cannot say enough good things about. The only phone contact is to leave a message for a provider's assistant. The practice owner's focus now seems to be on reducing the total daily intake of meds, probably due to the opioid crisis. But in doing so, the nation's medical providers are hurting those of us who actually use opioids for pain relief and don't abuse them.|I went to the clinic on Nevada and it was an Absolutely wonderful experience going there. I had gone to a different clinic and was treated horribly so I made an appt here and complete opposite experience. Very caring staff and during my appointment I didn't feel rushed and they did a very thorough exam and made me feel like I was in good hands. I'm incredibly thankful after having the horrible experience with the other clinic I went to.|I have been seeing RMA Jocelyn at the beginning of every monthly visit to NW Spine & Pain Clinic.  She is terrific at listening to what I say and passing that information accurately to my provider.  She is cheerful, personable and not afraid to be human.  She has an infectious laugh and it is always a pleasure to see her.  I would also like to add that it is equally pleasant to see Brenden.  They are a fantastic team and I treasure them both .  Roxanne.|Joalyn is amazing. I absolutely love my team.  Brenden and Joalyn both always make sure they listen to what each patient has to say, and provide the best options they can. Thank you both so much for making things happen with the patients concerns always addressed.|Everyone is alway courteous and respectful. Jocelyn is always upbeat and kind. I really like her and I'm glad she's the MA working with my provider. Brendan is the provider I see and he is excellent too.

column3:
Mt. Baker Pain Clinic in Burlington, Washington serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions in the Skagit Valley region. As a proud member of Sound Pain Alliance, this specialized medical facility has established itself as a leader in interventional pain management techniques. The clinic's dedicated team of pain specialists employs evidence-based approaches to address chronic and acute pain conditions, helping patients reclaim their quality of life through personalized treatment plans.

Mt. Baker Pain Clinic offers cutting edge, innovative interventional pain management options designed to help patients effectively manage or potentially cure their pain. The clinic's philosophy centers on enabling patients to live life as normally as possible, free from the limitations that chronic pain can impose. Their comprehensive approach combines advanced medical interventions with supportive care to address the physical and emotional aspects of pain management.

Specialized Services

The clinic provides a wide range of specialized treatments including nerve blocks, epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, taking into account their medical history, pain severity, and personal goals for recovery.

Convenient Location

Located at 340 E George Hopper Rd in Burlington, WA 98233, Mt. Baker Pain Clinic is easily accessible to residents throughout Skagit County and surrounding areas. The modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to ensure patients receive the highest standard of care in a comfortable environment.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Mt. Baker Pain Clinic apart is their unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. The clinical team takes time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and develop customized treatment strategies that address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

For more information about their services or to schedule a consultation, patients can call +1 360-707-7260 or visit their website at https://www.soundpainalliance.com/mt-baker-pain-clinic/.

column40:
I have been a patient for a while and have always had amazing care. I see Cassie but have also worked with Dr Nowlin as well. Even through this insurance snafu we have been dealing with, as frustrating as it has been for me as a patient and them as a provider. They have been great. Thank you to the entire Mount Baker Pain Clinic staff for everything you do.
Even those behind the scene.. Your work doesn't go unnoticed.

Now if this insurance issue would resolve the issue so we can move forward in our plans to help my pain I would be so very thankful. :)|Overall my experience was great. I believe there was some miscommunication between my provider and myself on the distribution of my pain meds. I believe I heard one thing and the pharmacy got totally different directions when they received my script, about the filling of the script. This is the only reason why I gave the visit a 4 star. Otherwise it would have been a 5. Now I need to call my provider and get things straightened out. To me this is taking time out of my work day to do this which I shouldn't have to do.|I have been a patient for 1 and 1/2 years. Dr. Dangleis and staff are professional and empathetic toward patients. They are also very punctual returning calls.

Pretty rough road the first 6 months but we have gotten to the point where my  pain is manageable, Thank God.
I am liking life again because of them!|PA Matthew Dangleis and all the staff there are kind and understanding, knowledgeable and professional. Matthew answers all my questions and has been available for tel-med visits. Because of him, I now have a Boston Scientific neuro transmitter in my back and it has helped to control my lower body pain level to where I can walk and do more activities. I am grateful for Mt Baker and Matthew. I only wish there could be a patient portal to make communication easier.|I have been a patient of Mt. Baker Pain Clinic, Arlington, for over 5 years now. I love the front desk staff (Hi Kelly! You're the BESTEST!), medical assistants, and my provider. Through all my twists and turns in life, the pain clinic has always been there to support me during cancer (pain and recovery medication tweaking and management) and through many surgery pain management postoperatively above and beyond what surgeons provide for my complex pain struggles.

The pain clinic never treats me like a number on a clipboard or a pain med seeking junkie which is very valuable to me. I've had pain clinics for over 20 years and not all-- heck not many-- are created so humanely and patient centered. They listen and care and offer a variety of treatments to compliment more than just "taking pain meds and that's all."  I value that a lot. Neck injections of all kinds, trigger point injections and similar are very effective for me short term so I seek those as complimentary to the nerve med and pain med I take.

Overall appreciate being treated dynamically and compassionately and value my relationship with everyone at Mt. Baker Pain Clinic!!|The first interview was short and informative.
I despair of having to fill out everything on the Tablet
basically because I'm and old dinasaur when It comes to computers and electronics.
I did survive, talked to the doctor and I felt that he understood
my personal frustrations with oxcycodone 5mg doses.
They were almost useless relieving my leg and hip pains.
The second appointment we talked about my new prescription
for hydrocodone 10mg 3 doses per day, 8 hours apart. for
4 weeks until the end of this month. I'm taking them as directed
and they successfully relieve my pain. I'm actually able now to
stand and cook dinner, walk better, and to stand and work on my
paintings and sculptures. I'm an exhibiting sculptor and painter
with regular shows of my art works.
I truly thank you.|Appointments are on time, no long stays in the waiting room, ever. The staff from reception, through the medical assistants ending with Casey, are knowledgeable,  efficient, helpful and very friendly. This office staff are consistantly the best!|Staff is always courteous and helpful. They make the visit easier from the moment you walk in until you leave. The medical staff is above and beyond!!!! They actually listen to you and work with you to come up with a plan that works best for you. However many attempts that may take.

Northwest Spine and Pain Medicine serves patients throughout Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho with comprehensive musculoskeletal care. Our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating conditions affecting the spine and joints while providing effective pain management solutions. With our main location in Spokane, Washington, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider committed to improving patients' quality of life through personalized treatment plans.

At Northwest Spine and Pain Medicine, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach that combines various medical specialties to address complex pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians works collaboratively to develop customized treatment strategies that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and rehabilitation services. We specialize in treating chronic back and neck pain, sciatica, herniated discs, spinal stenosis, arthritis, and other musculoskeletal disorders.

Our Facility and Services

Located at 3124 S Regal St, Spokane, WA 99223, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. We offer a range of services including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and regenerative medicine therapies. Our goal is to provide minimally invasive solutions that reduce pain while improving function and mobility.

Patient-Centered Care

We pride ourselves on delivering compassionate, patient-centered care that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Our staff takes the time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly explain treatment options, and answer questions to ensure informed decision-making. New patients are welcome, and we work with most major insurance providers to facilitate access to care.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit our website at www.nwspm.com or call us at (509) 464-6208. Northwest Spine and Pain Medicine is committed to helping you find relief and return to the activities you enjoy.

column38: Venny Tiberio|jungandi100%me|Jennifer Luoma|Brooklynn Ferrell|Sierra|Josh Crenshaw|Jeffrey S|Jennie Jett
column40:
I have never been to a provider's office where they really care about their patient like at Northwest Spine and Pain Medicine. They are great to work with and so very accommodating with scheduling and just taking care of their patients. They have bent over backwards to help me when my insurance wouldn't they help set up a program so I can continue to be seen there and able to get my meds. They have been absolute angels helping me deal with my chronic pain condition...|I was optimistic.  I have severe widespread  arthritis  torn rotator cuffs and neurological pain caused by arthritis.. Ramona was great on the phone. I put off going to pain clinic for a long time. my first visit ..... I was prescribed ..by Dr. Gilmer. a pain medicine amount that treats pain  for  8 hours. on the planet I live there are 24 hours. that would leave me in severe pain for 16 hours a day.  why stop taking what I take now  that works somewhat 24 hours???unbelievable. my pharmacist    couldn't believe it either. Gilmer had seen my X-rays..and ordered more... but that's what he did .. and told me to come back.... in a month. all heart, that guy. in a month I'm supposed to maybe get a pain block. in a shoulder that's been bone to bone ten years. I get home and read these pain blocks are best used on new sites of chronic pain.. and probably an elderly woman with widespread advanced arthritis.. would not benefit.. much though I might be subjected to multiple attempts so.all to fail so .. I think.. finally  I will agree to take opioids. I have long resisted. though  nearly every opiate pain med is derived from morphine,to which I'm seriously allergic and or combined with the highly toxic and useless  acetomeniphen. the only one that isn't is tramadol. I'm going to see if my primary doc.. will prescribe tramadol along with my usual Diclofenac. something Dr. gilmer could have done.. but didn't. though he's supposed to be the expert I should trust.. perhaps he is unaware of the latest research. I don't know I don't think  northwest spine is committed to elderly people with severe widespread pain people who have difficulty just getting to appts.  I cannot access patient portal for more answers. I have no problem generally with my computer. I have another appt with nw spine.. but I might not go back.  more stress .. I don't need. I don't know how many visits it would take to get pain relief  superior to what I get now. I am..... heartbroken. I'm trying to stay alive. I'm trying to stay out of a nursing home. I believe if a young person with an athletic injury.. I would have been better treated.. or even middle aged. I could have got my golfing arm fixed. I just want to do the most basic human functions  without horrible pain.i would like that. I don't think they can offer that. it makes me believe ..... they have not had many patients like me.  or if they did... they sent them to nursing homes.. where 60 per cent of the patients with chronic pain.. receive  .. no pain medicine at all.. and most nursing home patients are dead within 5 months, I want to live. but I think.... our  society, including some doctors   would rather .. I just shut up.and give up... like most old people do.|They set up an appointment. Told me I was approved for migraine shots and months later they still haven't given me a reason why they cannot find the Botox. They're unprofessional, unethical and a scam|I'm an Active Duty Military Member who is separating and moving across the country in less than 2 weeks. I waited for over a year to get this referral from my on base provider and unfortunately was finally able to be seen close to my move date. I explained this to the team that I wouldn't be able to get the treatment. However, they moved mountains for me so that I was able to at-least get one cervical epidural prior to my separation. The team was incredibly helpful and supportive. They have no idea just how thankful and appreciative I am for them. I've been living and working with this pain for years and was incredibly disappointed when I initially thought that treatment would not be an option for me due to something as simple as time. They were incredibly understanding and made sure that I had all of my medical records from these appointments so that I could submit them to the VA.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart Northwest Spine and Pain team!|Thank you, reviewers, because of your shared experiences. I will not consider this location. I implore people to please do your research. Remember, these people work for you, treat your search for a medical team like an interview|I'm a fairly new patient with these guys. They provide the worst customer service make you feel like cattle moving through. I try to ask questions about my treatment they never give a clear response they just respond in away that moves you along swiftly. Treatment of pain management ordered was to help the area I don't get any pain they just want to get more money out of insurance company. If was alternative place in the area I'd go there. I had a good place before but the primary physiatrist I had and ran the office retired and she was amazing as well as her staff.|I have been a patient for years and I always feel like a number to NWSP South.  They never seem to have time for you...rush you in and out...make you wait months for appointments...and when you show up for check-in make sure you're at least 25 minutes early...otherwise you'll wait in line and get to the front to he told...sorry you're late.  Save yourself time and a headache..go to Northwest Orthopedics for pain management, injections, ect...you won't regret it.|Andrew Garten and his nurse got me back to work and having a life. They the most compassionate and professional team I've had.

column40:
I cannot speak highly enough about this office and the incredible team behind it. Dr. Yang has been instrumental in my care, always taking the time to explore different treatment options with patience and expertise. With a long history of back pain, finding a provider as dedicated and compassionate as Dr. Yang has been truly life-changing. He consistently goes above and beyond for his patients.

Additionally, Katrina and Jordan at the Puyallup office are exceptional. Their professionalism, efficiency, and kindness make every visit seamless and pleasant. The level of care and attentiveness from this team is truly outstanding.

I also want to highlight the incredible experience I had at the surgery center in Bellevue. The staff was unbelievably kind and treated me with the utmost respect throughout my entire visit. A special mention goes to Vi--her warmth and kindness are unmatched.

If there were ever a team deserving of recognition and appreciation, it would be these amazing individuals. I feel incredibly fortunate to have found not only a skilled physician but also a supportive and compassionate care team. Thank you all for your dedication and excellence!|I have seen 4 specialists in WA and 1 in AZ regarding my back issues. Not one would help because of my age and the need for total spine replacement. I was at the end of the line when I consulted with Dr. Hong many years ago. I found he listens, is caring and compassionate. Upon further research I found he is extremely  knowledgable and skillful along with a great personality. I know I will never be pain free again and I know my condition will only worsen. Dr Hong is working closely with me to keep my pain as minimal as possible. I am ever so thankful. I highly recommend Dr. Hong.
I have  follow up procedures in the Puyallup office. The staff is fantastic! They are knowledgeable, efficient and professional. I have always received exceptional service and have witnessed empathy towards other patients.|Sound pain mgmt in lakewood and puyallup no no no dont go. If I could give them a negative number I would!!! Horrible don't go to any location. Especially Mcewan he thinks he is above people and is clearly only there to take your money and not treat you. Arrogant and obviously not intelligent enough to make decisions when it comes to your loved ones pain. Don't waste your time. Probably why you can never reach them on the phone.|If there is someone you really dont like and they need help with chronic pain...send them to this place and watch them suffer for weeks in bed like I am currently.
Please look for better people who care and take time to help improve the quality of life you want and treat your chronic pain.
As WCPM can't seem to manage anything but adding to the pain with complete incompetence. Prior authorization, appeals and phone calls are confusing to the staff who are lacking basic compassion for the patient who is suffering with CHRONIC PAIN.
No communication with the patient definitely no compassion they act more like a bully.
I have been dealing with chronic pain for a few years and a few different states. These people at WCPM are the worst.
As I presently try to complete the circle of idoacracy, with the front office bullies my insurance companies gatekeepers attempting to communicate with the back office Medical Assistant who acts more like a stop sign. They filed 1 PA on Nov 30th it was denied. Instead of filing the appeal like insurance instructed, they submitted another PA the same way. It to was denied. I was told good ol Jordyn is on it and will let you know. Yet I get no phone calls at all EVER.  My phone has 0 inbound calls from WCPM. I have to call insurance daily and see they did nothing but start another PA, then call them with that information. Over and over and over now for 18 days today I was told they finallydid an appealbut that will take 7-10 more days. Somehow they dont seem to understand that waiting for 3 or 4 or more weeks in CHRONIC PAIN destroys your quality of life. Sitting with 6 pedicle screws in my spine and a hip that is frozen locked up and burning like hot pumice stones rubbing against my bones. Unable to sit or lay in any position for longer than 15 min and how bad that affects my family as well. WCPM they dont seem to acknowledge the pain
But they just keep doing the same thing. Refuse to write a different script when my insurance gave a long list just not this specific special drug Dr. HUNG wants me to use even with this discount its $150 for 3 weeks. I am on ssdi becauseof this accident. I have begged I have cried. I have followed their suggestions and went to ER while sat in wheel chair for 4hours just to be sent home with a OTC muscle patch and an Ibuprofen shot after being treated like a junkie and ignored more.
I established care with Dr. Hung on Nov 17 today is Dec 13th and I have received absolutely no care. I have had to make more than 15 phone calls to their office and more to my insurance company. I have had to advocate more for myself with this place than any other office and I have lived in 3 states since my accident.
This office will tell you they care....they dont.
This office will say they will follow up and call you back to let you know what is taking place....they wont.
This office will say they know what needs to be done to help you and they want to help you feel better...they dont
This office will tell you many things....none of them are accurate.  Not one person I have met in this process from beginning with the medical assistant with a total negative atmosphere surrounding her she seemed to hate her job, who called me to the back, to all the receptionist whom I have had to explain this process to seems to care what you are going through. Like missing out on family Thanksgiving to my Pops funeral tonight the boys Christmas choir play is happening but I am in bed in pain and crying. It is looking like I spend Christmas in bed with tears as well.

To sum it up....send your enemies here and your loved ones elsewhere.|Do not go to this place. They are impossible to get a hold of if you have a billing issue. Then they send you a late fee due to their own lack of communication. I reported this to my insurance, WA DOH, CFPB, and the OIG for billing fraud. I am also spending my free time determining any other agency I can report this place to and will do so. I hope this costs them more than they hope to take from me in the long run.|I have been going to this clinic for 3 years usually seeing Dr Hong. I cannot say enough good things about Dr Hong!! He is very friendly and listens carefully to me at each appointment. He is also so caring and compassionate with me and my chronic pain issues!! And he is very knowledgeable about chronic pain issues and medications and treatment options for chronic pain conditions. The staff are usually very supportive and helpful also.|So I really liked this clinic when i first started going. Over the past few months they have really gotten worse at their services. I recently had a doctor cancel my appointment so he could take a longer Christmas vacation and rescheduled me for late in January.

This would have been fine if they were willing to refill my prescription. I am on the lowest dose of  hydrocodone possible following multiple surgeries from a work place injury that has left me disabled. However, you have to visit the doctor to get your monthly refills. They are refusing to do a refill because it has been 3 days over their 2 month limit you have to see the doctor for refills. Even though they cancelled my appointment and the next opening was so far out.

Avoid this place. They show no compassion or care toward their patients.|Absolutely useless. I went here because I moved here from the south very recently and needed a doctor to take over my existing pain management medications and treatments. The doctor refused to do anything at all and said that I have to go see a cervical spine specialist. He also refused to give me a referral for one and my GP told me that he wouldn't either, that the pain clinic had to. That's an endless loop that never treats me at all.

Furthermore I was chewed out and told that I was in the wrong because I asked them to take over treatments and medications they didn't diagnose of prescribe and that I had to start over from the beginning, trying all the meds and treatments that didn't work (and my records were transferred so this was already known), but that they wouldn't do that for me. They never explained why even though I asked.

I was not treated. I was not helped. Worst off I was told that when my medications ran out that I should go to a methadone clinic for the pain medication and "just deal with it" for the muscle problem, tumor problems, replacement body part pain, and cervical disk damage.

That's utterly unacceptable and completely inhumane. I would never recommend this place for any reason. I don't see how they're still in business.

It's fine if you don't want to continue pain medications, but you have to help me reduce my dosage on them and you have to treat my problems somehow or the patient will be miserable.

Never waste your time or money here. They don't care about you or your health.

column40:
Told his patient "your opinion is the problem here" and "I don't care if you are experiencing pain"
-Dr. mambalam
refused to write him a pain prescription after his nerve ablation (which caused more problems than it helped)  Was gonna refuse to write him a rx today until I showed him I was recording his voice during the visit.
Then he quickly changed and said "per law" I have to write you for 30 days.
So per law he has to write it but he allowed the patient to be without pain meds for a week after a nerve ablation.
Make since Washington center for pain management. Management implies ongoing.
This guy wants to hurt you and leave you without any relief. Sadist.|I had a new patient appointment over a month ago, was told they would reach out to insurance for prior authorization for RFA, called back today and had the desk person rudely tell me that the doctor doesn't know what he's talking about and that I have to make an appointment before they can request prior authorization. Then she scheduled me for an appointment in February BEFORE telling me oh btw it's in Bellevue. I wasted a month of being in pain because of the incompetence and now have to get back in with my primary for a referral elsewhere. Completely ridiculous.|I'm a patient of Dr Hong he's great as a doctor but Olympia is just a gloried clinic he's there only in Tuesday you need to drive to Bellevue for any service like a pain management trail now I love 3 hour drive 6 hours round trip I've asked for a referral to a pain management Dr in  aberdeen I get voice .message saying call someone can help you tgecare phone people not dr's I'm.very dissatisfied with Washington pain management I've been in the medical field for ,35 yrs|Dr. Mambalam has been the most amazing doctor, truly managing my husband's back pain for the first time in 20 yrs. He is completely thorough in his treatment plans, explaining them in depth and gaining our trust. He always makes time for us and instills complete confidence in his work and plan. Only complaint I have is that it can be very difficult to get to a live person on the phone when calling the clinics at either location. That needs work.|Such horrible doctors at my step dad appointment then wanted to argue with my step dad and mom instead of listening and understanding what's my step dad is going through|The Dr at this facility has forced my husband to do experimental injections that our insurance refused to pay for. But the doctor threatened to take away his pain maintenance if he didn't do them. When he refused to do the last one and most expensive that our insurance wouldn't pay for, he did take away his pain meds for pain maintenance. The injections didn't even work!!!|Dr. Hong is an excellent doctor who cares about his patients. I came to him with pain in my shoulders and knee. Previous doctors had recommended surgery I didn't want and couldn't afford.  Dr. Hong gave me a PRP and stem cell injection in each joint. I was surprised at how quick the procedure took. I have not had any pain in over three years. His staff was very professional and friendly.They followed up with me to make sure I did not have any complications. I highly recommend Dr. Hong and The Washington Center for Pain Management.|We called to setup an out of pocket plan because my husband needs someone who is a good pain management clinician. We were told the initial consult is $200 out of pocket and the first appointment would be within two weeks. So we agreed and had my husband's PCP send a referral.

A few weeks later we finally get the call about whether or not their doctor will see him. He stated he would need to take a "3 month vacation" from the medications he's been on for years, that help him to function in life. Most of the time he can hardly get off the couch due to pain, and the only thing that helps is being on narcotic medication along with some non narcotic medications.

Then they said the initial consult is $300 - completely different from what we were told when we first called.

Your staff needs training in empathy, as you work with chronically ill patients. Your staff needs training in what your actual out of pocket costs are and wait times. This was a complete and total waste of our time and energy - when my husband who can barely function day to day needs understanding and help.

column38: The Comedian|Anita Brighton|BIG_CHEV_BOWSKIE MIKE|Candis Gauvin|Amanda McConnell|Debbie Tomack|Brenda Colbert|Kathy Nguyen
column40:
Dr. Velling is truly exceptional. Without his expertise and skill, I would be struggling immensely. He is the only doctor who has genuinely been able to assist me. The staff is equally remarkable--friendly, outgoing, intelligent, and highly informative. I have recommended Dr. Velling to numerous colleagues and friends, and will continue to do so.|Immediate relief of chronic pain, minimally invasive!
I had spinal facet nerve ablation today at Genesis.  I experienced immediate relief of chronic pain (25 years).  It's been so long since certain areas have been pain free, I hardly realized how bad it has been until sweet relief has begun to set in.

I am additionally excited, and feeling so hopeful and grateful for sweet, sweet relief of potentially multiple areas of chronic pain in my body. This will change my life!|I have a slipped lower disc in back that will require surgery. I am just not ready  to take that step yet. Genesis has been a life saver for me. The procedures they perform to help with this issue really work. The Staff and Doctors are first rate and they really do care about you the patient. Here you will be treated like a person not a peace of meat like so many other places.  I would rate Genesis a 100 out of 5 if I could.   Mike.|Dr. Velling is an excellent doctor who really cares, listens and helps me get REAL pain relief without drugging me up with narcotics. His judgment and expertise are phenomenal. I truly own a huge debt of gratitude for giving me my life back.
Dr. Velling is always professional, Kind and Knowledgeable. If your looking for a Pain Doctor who truly cares about their patients then you've found him.
He's an Angel with a Stethoscope.|Dr Velling is by far one of the best doctors I have seen.  I have a connective tissue disorder/ genetic condition that causes severe issues all over my body. The disks in my neck and back are also affected leading to complex and hard to identify issues throughout my neck, back and spine. There are only 2-3 specialists(surgeons)  in the US who specialize in Ehlers Danlos Syndrome(all on the East Coast), so finding doctors who knows how to identify the issues caused by this gene defect can be very challenging. Dr Velling was not only great at listening, but he quickly identified issues that up until now,  only the specialists had caught and educated me on.  It was clear that he truly cares about his patients and that he is in this profession to help people. I definitely recommend him if you have a complex issue going on that needs a trained eye and listening ear. I am thankful that my Doctor referred me to him <3|Dr. Velling is a caring doctor who truly strives to improve his patients quality of life and relieve their pain issues. I have been suffering with chronic back pain for 9 years.  I have seen numerous specialists but after a few months they tell me they have run out of treatment options and refer me on to someone else.  Dr. Velling is the only pain specialist that hasn't given up on me and continues to help treat my pain related issues.    I am so grateful that I was referred to him.|From my first visit Dr Kinder spent time truly listening to everything I was concerned about. He is the best and he laughs at my jokes which eases any nervousness I might
have come in with.
Truly a blessing.|I have been a patient for over 2 years and thought I was going to change my career of over 30 years Dr Veiling and his staff has been a miracle maker! My neck and back issues have been controlled threw there well trained staff! I'm working full time and able to enjoy what I do every day! Don't what to feel better call them and get a consultation.

column3:
Cascade Interventional Pain Center in Puyallup, Washington offers specialized pain management services under the expert guidance of Jay Iyengar, M.D. Our comprehensive approach to interventional pain care combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate patient support, serving residents throughout Pierce County and the greater Puget Sound region. With state-of-the-art facilities in both Puyallup and Tacoma, we provide accessible care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions, sports injuries, and post-surgical discomfort.

Dr. Jay Iyengar leads our team of pain management specialists, bringing years of clinical expertise to each patient consultation. Our interventional techniques target the source of pain directly, offering alternatives to traditional pain management approaches that may rely heavily on medication. We develop personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique medical history, pain profile, and lifestyle needs.

Our Locations and Accessibility

Our primary clinic is conveniently located at 4210 10th St SE, Puyallup, WA 98374, with an additional location in Tacoma to better serve our patients throughout the region. Both facilities are equipped with modern diagnostic and treatment technologies to ensure comprehensive care under one roof. We maintain flexible scheduling options to accommodate urgent pain concerns and follow-up appointments.

Patient-Centered Approach

At Cascade Interventional Pain Center, our mission drives everything we do: providing high-quality, cost-effective, and compassionate interventional pain care. We work closely with referring physicians, insurance providers, and rehabilitation specialists to create a coordinated care experience. Our staff prioritizes patient education, ensuring you understand your condition and treatment options fully.

For consultations or to learn more about our services, contact us at (253) 627-2666 or visit our comprehensive website at www.cascadepaincenter.com/pain-clinic.html to explore our treatment approaches and patient resources.
column11: At Cascade Interventional Pain Center, our mission is to provide high-quality, cost-effective, and compassionate interventional pain care to our patients. With locations in Puyallup and Tacoma, Washington, we serve customers throughout the region.

column40: My Husband has had such an amazing experience with Dr. Iyengar. His back pain has significantly improved. 10/10 recommend!|I saw Dr. Iyengar for 18 years and I highly recommend him. He took my neck/back pain away for all these years. He's very gentle. Unfortunately, I changed my Insurance, but I am considering coming back.|The doctor and his assistants were friendly and very concerned for my well-being! They made sure that I was comfortable during my procedure.  They asked about how I felt after the procedure.  My knee is already feeling better!  Thank you Dr. Iyengar and your assistants!|Dr. Iyengar is a magician! Excellent care and wonderful staff. Always on time and willing to listen to concerns. So glad my physician recommended Dr. Iyengar. Also found a couple of my friends receive care there as well and are very pleased.|Dr. Iyengar is the perfect doctor for pain management. He is caring, compassionate, and incredibly gentle. I cannot recommend him and his whole staff enough. They are superb!|A very positive experience, especially being my 1st time and I was very nervous and apprehensive abt having back injection. DR WAS EXCELLENT! and very gentle and reassuring, so was staff. Have had several inj there since with same. Good job & very professional. Thanks so much.  M.Smith.|Dr. Jay Iyengar and staff are absolutely incredible. I was told by two orthopedic surgeons that I needed surgery to remove a good amount of my meniscus in my right knee.  I decided to hold off and try an injection with Dr Iyengar first. I entered the office on crutches with severe pain in my right knee. After one injection, not only did I not need the crutches after a few days, but was able to return to my racquet sports a few weeks later. It's been over a year and I have not had any knee pain and never had to have surgery whatsoever. Dr.Iyengar alleviated my pain which has allowed me to continue to do the activities and sports that I love so much. The office staff is very efficient with the insurance/billing side too. The procedure rooms are immaculate and sterile and his equipment is top of the line, allowing Dr. Iyengar to skillfully place his injections in a very precise manner. Dr Iyengar and staff are truly amazing! D. Dennis|Dr. Iyengar has helped bring me much needed relief in my back. I would recommend Dr. Iyengar to anyone who needs pain management. Thank you so much for helping manage my pain.

column2: Anesis Spine and Pain Care - Renton
column3:
Anesis Spine and Pain Care - Renton serves the greater Renton, Washington area with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located conveniently at 801 SW 16th St, Suite 121, our specialized clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians utilize evidence-based approaches to diagnose and treat a wide spectrum of pain disorders, focusing on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At Anesis Spine and Pain Care, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment that includes interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, medication management, and innovative therapies. Our team specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, sciatica, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Each treatment plan is customized following thorough evaluation and diagnostic testing to address the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing meaningful partnerships with our patients through clear communication and education. Our practitioners take time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. The comfortable, modern facility in Renton is designed to provide a healing environment where patients feel supported throughout their pain management journey.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at +1 206-538-6300 or visit our website at http://www.anesispain.com/ for more information about our services. Our office is located at 801 SW 16th St, Suite 121, Renton, WA 98057, with accessible parking and convenient access from major highways.
column36: Closed|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|8 a.m.-5 p.m.|Closed|Closed
column38: Rena Sullivan|Jessica Wilkins|Kent Meiswinkel|Hedvig Jenson|Jenni M|J Babbyyy|Olia Polivoda|Rick T
column40:
DOCTOR HARSTROEM with Anesis Spine and Pain care is a remarkable doctor and pain center is remarkable.  They are tenacious to find the best way to help relieve pain.
I didn't think there would be any relief from my incredible occipital headaches and neck pain from occipital nerve damage.  Using an NALU occipital nerve stimulator, and pain pills, I finally received relief from my pain.
Thank you Doctor Harstroem and all with Anesis.|Absolutely no bedside manor. My mom wasn't able to get a word in as the Dr was just talking w out letting her explain what was going on. Straight away the Dr  said she needed injections. Then the Dr said she can't help my mom. Unexceptable. The Dr 2as in the room for 3 mins and didn't listen to anything. Absolutely horrible. My mom eneded up crying after the appointment|I have some issues with my joints.  Some are worse than others.  Among the superlative worse of them is my left shoulder.   I went to the clinic for an injection.   I honestly wouldn't have minded if the injection was uncomfortable.   I was in so much discomfort, I just wanted the anti inflammatory and the little bit of numbing in the injection.

I felt so much relief!   The doctor has a very gentle touch and an excellent bed side manner.

When a patient is hurting, it's easy to want to take it out on everyone.  What I recognize, and appreciate, is that these folks looked at my chart and could see why I was hurting.  I have had other doctors not show me as much empathy, and sympathy.  When you are really hurting, even if the doctor can't help, it's comforting to have a doctor that doesn't dispute patient discomfort.

They are all empathetic, soft-spoken and patient with folks.  If you're hurting badly,  maybe give these folks a try.  At the very bear minimum, you will be taken seriously.|Anesis Spine and Pain Care, what is it that you exactly do? I put my 1 star review below with an explanation. There are other one star reviews with explanations that make my eyes go wide. Then you have your 5 star reviews to counter balance your 1 stars. Who wrote those? Heck! One woman below gave you a 5 star review because she was amazed at the process of having a COVID 19 test!  My my.... Don't you have your game on! 
I'm inquisitive...because your Renton clinic seems to do nothing really. Where is the staff? I mean, you have such a large space with many rooms. Don't you do injections, ablations, or x-rays even? I saw no one in two visits, except one receptionist, one escort to the doctor's interview room, and the doctor herself. And the bathroom was so clean it was like no one even used it.
What are your crew of MDs up to? And where is the rest of the staff...like a nurse or two? Seemingly, there is no real pain care or public service that I can detect. But, maybe it's just me. I've always come in the afternoon. That must be the reason. I could make a list of reasons to lease or rent such large square footage without doing any real work. Is that what you are doing along with gaslighting pain patients?
There are professionals and then there are people like you...|I was diagnosed with chronic pain many years ago. Dr. Harstroem had been treating me for just over a year and she has changed my life. I even followed her from her Everett practice to Renton because she listens to my concerns and advises multiple ways of treating the pain. My pain level has decreased drastically! My quality of life has improved and I am able to get back to the things I love to do.  Thank you, Dr. Harstroem, don't know what I'd do without you!!|Life changing experience! I have been dealing with neck/back pain for over ten years now and getting spinal injections for about 4 years that typically put me down for a couple of days because they are so painful.
After seeing Dr Harstroem, she suggested that I try something called trigger point injections and OMG... let me tell you! Most of my back pain gets instantly taken away with these! All of the tension in my neck and shoulders relaxes immediately! I no longer have to get the painful injections I was getting before, that half of the time barely even worked!

Dr Harstroem has changed my life and made my day to day living so much better and improved! I can finally go back to doing regular activities!!!|My cousin recently came to America - English is not her first language. Her doctor referred her to Anesis Spine & Pain clinic in the fall. Since day one (October 2023) this clinic has been nothing but an absolute nightmare. When the first appointment was initially scheduled, I asked for an interpreter to be there for my cousin, since I wasn't able to be there. They called a few days before the appointment to reschedule for November, because they couldn't find one. Understandable, I'll let it slide it.. things happen. November rolls around, they call again to reschedule, same issue. Now I'm on more of an alert.. because the future patient is also in pain.. and this is a tad ridiculous. We reschedule for December - I specifically ask again please make sure there is an interpreter because I'm not sure I'll be able to be there - I will try, however just in case to be safe. 3 days before the appointment we confirm the appt. I call ahead on Monday, again - to be safe whether or not an interpreter will be provided - it's crickets. Finally a response - "We'll call you back". Okay. Great. All of Monday.. no call back. Tuesday.. half the day.. no call back. I call AGAIN.. they say "yes we will give the Renton office notice & give you a call back". Did they call back? No. They didn't. Wednesday rolls around, the day before the appointment - I call around 4pm to AGAIN confirm. They say they don't know. I ask if the patient can have me translate over the phone; or google translator. "Yes no problem". Awesome, sounds like we're getting somewhere! Then the appointment happens today - no interpreter, I'm not allowed to translate over the phone (even though I'm certified) AND google translate also isn't allowed! So now I'm starting to believe this office is really discriminating against patients who do not speak English. If your clinic cannot provide an interpreter; then tell the patient "we're sorry, we cannot accommodate your needs" and let them know AHEAD of time. Rereading your clinics reviews, I'm starting to believe your clinic needs some major restaffing. I will be filing a discrimination complaint against your office.|Dr. Harstroem is great. She listened to me, "heard" what I was saying and we discussed a plan to move forward that I feel good about. Thanks Dr. Harstroem!

Change in itself can be hard. Changing pain management doctors can be hard, stressful and even scary. I feel that Dr. Harstroem and all of Anesis Spine and Pain Clinic want only what's best for me.

Alliance Pain Center serves Olympia, Washington and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain, our center combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care. Our team of board-certified specialists utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions, from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome.

At Alliance Pain Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology that allows us to perform various minimally invasive procedures designed to target pain at its source while minimizing recovery time.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs and circumstances. Our physicians take the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, medical history, and previous treatments to develop a comprehensive strategy aimed at reducing pain and improving function. We emphasize patient education and active participation in the treatment process to achieve optimal outcomes.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 360-866-7990. Our clinic is conveniently located at 3240 14th Ave NW, Suite A, Olympia, WA 98502. Additional information about our practice, including patient resources and service details, can be found on our website at http://www.alliancepain.com/.

Alliance Pain Center is committed to helping patients navigate the challenges of chronic pain with dignity and hope. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to ensure accessible care for our community.
