column38: Matthew Katzer|L C|dalena spears|Carolyn Johnson|Frank Cisneros|J W|Sarah Rogers|Denise Lozier
column40:
I went to Alliance Pain Center in Olympia for about 6 months. The nurses were always very nice and helpful. I had Dr. Fleming and he was great, then he left. After he left, I never saw the front two receptionists again for some reason. From that point on I was seen by Nurse Erin. She was straight forward with my treatment but was constantly telling me how lucky I was to be on the medication I am on, because if I was on opiates she would only prescribe enough opiates to be able to go just shopping, or just to mow the lawn and no more. Just about every time I saw her she just couldn't help but tell me how lucky I am. My last visit I did the usual $200 urine test and got my prescriptions, or so I thought.

They insist if you have a medication issue you have your pharmacy send the request. Okay well I did that the last time they forgot to send my medication over and they never responded to my pharmacy. So I called Alliance and Dr. Fleming took care of it. There is an issue every other time I go there but this final time I have my pharmacy send over the request, it's ignored. I call, no answer. Next day, I call no answer. I'm out of meds by this point, but I wait and call the next day, leave a message directly with Erin and still no call back, no response. I gave up and went to see a different doctor at a different practice who saw me very quickly. I never ended up receiving a call back and basically paid for the privilege of not getting treatment. Weeks later I go to my appointment because I was supposed to have gotten a referral which I also never got, they said they sent that through at my appointment.

I did every thing they asked for, injections, therapy, you name it, but Erin always had me on edge because the first time I saw her she said she wanted to cancel my medication I had been on for months before that for no reason other than by her own words "I only looked at your file 15 minutes ago so I don't know anything about you." As if that was my fault, I had my appointment with her made a month before that. Along with the always telling me how lucky I am.

I would recommend you probably go elsewhere unless you okay with withdrawals every other month for no reason other than a lack of compassion and forgetfulness.

I never saw Dr. Ross Vogelgesang so I can't speak as to his care, I'm sure it's just fine.|If you are in pain and you want to be more than a number...this is your place.   I have been a patient on and off for years.  I've had the pleasure of being seen by Erin Henderson as well as Dr. Vogelgesang.  At my worst, I could only walk 20 ft before having to lay down due to pain, unable to sleep, and unable to get a carton of milk from the fridge.     Using muscle relaxers, anti-inflammatory medications, and injections they get me "back to normal" in no time.   I'm thankful that small caring places like this still exist.|Dr V. And Theresa, Amazing ! They're so patient with me & willing to walk me through each step of my injections. Theresa is kind enough to hold my hand during the scary process. I've been a patient there for 4 years now. I couldn't ask for better than they are. Dr V takes the time to get to know his patients and he truly cares. Thank-you, to my Care-Team and the Ladies at the front desk, Teddy and Tanner, y'all are the best ! Be Blessed, Dalena Spears|Worst place I've been too. Ran all the way in 1 hrs. Drive one way cause they need insurance card. I get there they say oh we got that but we need to give you paper to get a xrays. Oh I have to find place yes here's the paper. Really they could have faxed it to tra.  Get that done nope no call back after 2 weeks call they make appointment we show up opps wrong appointment. Make another oh yeah we can do shot we will okay it with your insurance. Okay another 2 weeks no call Call insurance we don't have anything from them. Nothing but run around from these people they don't have clue what there doing.|Not so often you find a clinic that respect and honors the patients.  Our experience is with, Nurses,  Dr. V and PA Erin is nothing less than exceptional. No time is wasted, they listen talk with you and all way look forward to the next visit
Frank and Patty Cisneros|With all sincerity, Dr. Vogelsang is one of the most intelligent doctors I have had the privilege of being under a doctors care.

He is very well versed in almost all areas and really listens and has a keen sense of understanding people.

He provides a comfortable environment and really has done wonders for me.

I came to him in very bad shape and had three years of dealing with doctors who did not fully understand my issues or me.

The one blessing he gave me is at our first visit he told me to promise him I would never allow myself to be treated with such disrespect from any other medical professional. What an incredible man and such powerful words. He earned my trust and I will forever cherish his words. My point... He cares, listens and has empathy.

His staff is incredible, competent and top notch. He chooses great people, because he is great!

If you are in legitimate pain, I highly recommend the Alliance Pain Center. You will not be disappointed. 

Jennine West|Unfortuanetly after waiting nearly an hour (50 minutes) and not seeing the doctor I left. I was missing work and had to get back. Shortly after leaving I got a call from the nurse telling me that the doctor was about to see me. I explained that I had to get back to work. After some back and forth she told me I shouldn't have accepted the appointment if I couldnt stay. When I told her that she shouldnt have offered it to me if she was so backed up as she claimed was the reason for the hour long wait. She then said I was no longer allowed to come back. I was shocked. I called back and left a voicemail and sent a facebook message regarding this. The doctor and other staff were so friendly that I cant imagine this is normal behavior but no one has called me back. Apparently this is how they feel.|I was a patient there in compliance with everything and then all the sudden with no warning I was dropped. I was told in around about way that the doctors new girlfriend took over the clinic she was rude and unprofessional. I heard her talking to another doctor in the office where they had left the door open saying she was going to Slash all these patients of another doctor that left the practice. Anyway I went in for my monthly visit and was told not to come back that they would not prescribe for me anymore very unprofessional end of course I was a patient of the PA that left

column2: Spine Team Spokane - Pain Management Clinic Spokane Valley, WA
column3:
Spine Team Spokane serves Spokane Valley, WA as a premier pain management clinic dedicated to comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Established in 2002, our integrated healthcare facility brings together a collaborative team of physicians, physical therapists, and chiropractors who work in harmony to address the root causes of joint, neck, muscle, ligament, and back pain. With nearly two decades of service to the Spokane community, we've developed a reputation for personalized treatment plans that recognize the unique physiological needs of each patient.

At Spine Team Pain Center, we understand that effective pain management requires a multifaceted approach. Our specialists utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the precise source of discomfort before developing customized treatment protocols. From therapeutic pain injections to rehabilitative exercises and chiropractic adjustments, our treatment options are designed to provide both immediate relief and long-term healing. We specialize in addressing:

  • Chronic back pain and sciatica

  • Neck pain and cervical spine disorders

  • Tension and migraine headaches

  • Joint inflammation and arthritis

  • Sports-related injuries and rehabilitation

Our Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes our practice is our unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. We recognize that pain affects not just the body but every aspect of daily life. Our well-rounded team of professionals approaches each case with compassion, taking the time to listen to patients' concerns and educate them about their conditions. This collaborative relationship between provider and patient forms the foundation of successful pain management and recovery.

Contact Us

If you're ready to take the first step toward a pain-free life, contact Spine Team Spokane today. Our facility is conveniently located at 1123 N Evergreen Rd, Spokane Valley, WA 99216. Schedule your consultation by calling 509-363-3100 or visit our website at spokanespineteam.com to learn more about our services and approach to pain management.
column11:
Spine Team Pain Center is a team of physicians, physical therapists and chiropractors. We are working diligently to solve you joint, neck, muscle, ligament, and back pains!

We have been in business since 2002 and serving the Spokane community. We are customizing treatments for each person because everyone's bodies are different.

Pain management is needed and can be solved with pain injections and other rehab that our team specializes in.

We are a well-rounded group and professionals that are passionate about making people's lives pain free. We will relieve you of your back pain, neck pain, headaches, and any other pains you may be feeling. Your needs and living free of pain is very important to us. Give us a call today

column40:
I have been sick for over a year. My Rheumatologist referred me to spine team for my back issues. I see Lyndsey Somers, and Dr. Crisp. The have been putting be back together so to speak since August. I am able to walk again. I am so happy with spine team. I have been to both offices. The staff is wonderful. I suggest to everyone I know who needs pain management to come here it is a wonderful place. Thank you Spine Team Spokane!|My first appointment was with Mara Lins, PA- C Interventional Pain Specialist, I was seen  for an  evaluation, consultation & 9treatment plan wa)s discussed, which we both agreed upon. Mara was extremely professional, knowledge, patient & treated me with kindness & respect. She showed me my test imaging results which truly clarified what's been going on  with my spine & why I'm currently having high levels of pain. Prior to my exiting the Spokane Valley Office, Mara fitted me properly for a Spine / Neck  Collar Brace, instructed me on how to use in the proper way & had me show her that I'd learned to use properly use the brace prior to my leaving& taking the brace home with with me. Honestly my first Impression of Spine Team & my provider Mara Lins isn't anything other that a positive review|It took only two epidural shots and my back feels great. Dr. Stringham and Angel are a very compassionate and invested care team. My thanks to both of them.|Sonita at the front desk is always so helpful in getting the best appointments that suit our timeline and is always smiling and so sweet when I call. Tia is the best at helping me manage the tablet and getting things right with the paperwork. She's always offering me readers when I forget to bring my glasses she is very sweet. Maggie is the best when I'm checking out and scheduling appointment, she's so kind. Maura is a breath of fresh air when she comes in the room. She is kind and listens without talking over you, she always helps get to the root of the problem. My overall experience is great and there is no tension between client and staff!|All the staff has been super nice to me and they explain everything you need to know and what to expect.  I highly recommend them for your spine care. The lobby is beautiful as well. Very inviting.|Let me start by saying that a medical office's quality patient service is everything to me. It seems like, more and more, it is a lost art. So when I experience stellar service, I feel inclined to share about it.
Let me explain:  My body has been a train wreck for years. I have had 4 back surgeries, a spinal cord injury, a hip replacement and arthritis in my back and joints. I have gone for weeks, months, years (my first injury was at age 22), in, pretty much, constant pain. I cannot thank Dr. Dibble and Dr. Mitchell at the Spokane Valley office of the Spine Team enough. Get this:  Two weekends ago, I spent more than 27 hours over 3 days on my feet on concrete ... PAIN FREE. No one was more surprised than I to have that experience. If you are in pain, you owe it to yourself to visit the Spine Team Pain Center on Evergreen in the Spokane Valley. This office is so much different from other "pain management" centers. This office is amazing, thorough and ohhhhhhhhh sooooooooo effective.  I am extremely grateful to Dr. Dibble, Dr. Mitchell, Moriah, Emily, Tiffany, Jeremy, Ben and the rest of the outstanding staff at the Spine Team in Spokane Valley. If you're in pain like I was, make an appointment today.|Very friendly staff. Knowledgeable of my issues and took care of what i needed. Highly recommend.|Dr Crisp and his staff are all absolutely amazing! Everyone is super friendly and nice!  This was my first experience with injections and they walked me through each step and ensured I was comfortable. I highly recommend Spine Team Valley!!!

column2: Cascade Interventional Pain Center, Jay Iyengar M.D.
column3:
Cascade Interventional Pain Center in Tacoma, Washington offers comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of board-certified physician Dr. Jay Iyengar. Serving patients throughout Pierce County and the greater Puget Sound region, our specialized clinic focuses on identifying and treating the root causes of chronic pain through minimally invasive techniques and personalized treatment plans. We combine cutting-edge interventional procedures with holistic approaches to help patients regain function and improve quality of life without excessive reliance on medication.

At Cascade Interventional Pain Center, we provide a wide range of advanced treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and targeted nerve blocks. Dr. Iyengar's expertise in fluoroscopic-guided procedures ensures precise treatment delivery for conditions such as back pain, neck pain, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address each patient's unique pain profile. Contact Information

column40: I saw Dr. Iyengar on Oct. 9th for sciatic pain. After looking at my MRI report Dr. Iyengar gave me an injection and I felt better by that evening. Dr. Iyengar treated me with respect and compassion. After several weeks I returned for a follow up and possible second injection. I appreciated the fact that when Dr.Iyengar found that I had no pain he opted to not give the second injection. He could have given me a second injection but instead took a more conservative approach and didn't press for the additional injection. I highly recommend Dr. Iyengar. He and his staff are very helpful and professional.|I have seen Dr. Iyengar for several years and the lumbar injections have been life changing.  I no longer use a cane, and I can go about my daily routine with ease.  His offices are immaculate and he and the staff are friendly and caring.|This office was scary and unprofessional. I went in to have a routine steroid shot that I never received and when I had the vegas nerve reaction they were not prepared to treat me and called an ambulance. Dr Iyengar then said he would not treat me and I must go to the hospital for my procedure which was the best thing that happened to me. Thank god. I found a better Dr and he has been amazing. Dr Iyengar also treated my friend before myself and injected her with the wrong steroid one that has a allergen she is allergic to and she has a lump on her neck and numerous reactions she is still fighting because of his mistake. I am only writing this so that people are aware and make the best medical choice for their care. Please go to someone else.|

column38: Kelly Rhodes|Candis Gauvin|Jephunneh Utu|Annmarie Childs|Chris Morey|Megan Reann Sibert|Trish Flett|Joe Rivera
column40:
I recently had my first steroid injection with Dr Velling and I can honestly say it was a fantastic experience from start to finish! Walking into the office, I was a bit nervous, but Dr. Velling immediately put me at ease with his warm and friendly demeanor. He took the time to greet me with a smile and made sure I felt comfortable in the environment.

What impressed me the most was his extensive knowledge of the procedure. He talked me through every step, explaining what to expect and addressing any concerns I had. His ability to communicate clearly and patiently helped alleviate my anxiety, making the entire experience much more pleasant than I anticipated.

Dr. Velling was not only professional but also truly seems to care about his patients. You can tell he is dedicated to providing the best care possible. He listened attentively to my concerns and made me feel valued as a patient, which is something I really appreciate. It's rare to find a doctor who combines expertise with genuine compassion.

After my procedure, I felt confident in my decision to trust him with my care, and I will absolutely return to Dr. Velling if I need ANY further procedures done for my back. I completely trust him and have no doubts about the quality of care I will receive.

In summary, I had an outstanding experience, and I can't recommend Dr. Velling enough! I give him 10 stars for his professionalism, knowledge, and the genuine care he provides to his patients. If you're seeking a doctor who truly has your best interests at heart. Very impressed to say the least. 

Kelly Tolle|I have CRPS and Dr. Velling is the Dr that gave me my life back. Without his expertise and compassion, I wouldn't be able to put shoes on or wear clothes against my back. He gave me hope and pain relief that I thought I would never have.  This man is amazing and honestly cares!|Excellent service from the Doctor, very caring and friendly when conversing with me. He is also very knowledgeable in his field of expertise. Doctor Velling takes the time to hear you out and hear about your concerns. I just trust him completely!|Dr veiling listens to everything I have to say with a caring ear. Answers every question I have.  Makes me feel extremely comfortable. I've gone to Dr veiling for many years and appreciate the care I receive. Staff is also very attentive. I feel I get the best care possible.|I love Dr. Velling! You won't find a more knowledgeable,  compassionate, caring doctor anywhere! He and his staff are amazing and run a smooth operation. He has made my life much more comfortable. He takes time with me and listens to all of my problems. A++++++ in my book!!|This is the most empathetic, compassionate and intelligent doctor I have ever met. He is always willing to listen and he genuinely cares. He knows his stuff too!! For 10 years I had Drs scratching their heads, one visit with Dr. Velling and he knew exactly what was wrong. I'm military so I have been around the world, and you just can't find a doctor this good anywhere!!|IT is great to finally speak to a interventionalist who listens and is clear about the expectations regarding insurance coverage and when we can do the procedure i would like. Prior MD's were like we will do it and process your insurance but if they do not cover you will have to pay the difference. It would be nice to know this information up front. It was also great to have a MD who listens regarding the fact that i have had several interventional procedures so i already know which ones work or do not work for me and the fact that he listened and was like then lets not repeat those that dont work, and move forward.|Personable,
great listener,and empathetic to the concerns of their patients.

column3:
Proliance Eastside Pain and Regenerative Medicine serves Kirkland, Washington and the greater Puget Sound region with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located in the heart of Kirkland, this specialized medical practice combines advanced interventional techniques with regenerative medicine approaches to address chronic pain conditions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Daniel Nelson, the clinic has established itself as a trusted resource for patients seeking effective, minimally invasive pain relief options.

Dr. Nelson's deep roots in the Pacific Northwest complement his exceptional medical credentials. As a native of the Puget Sound area, he graduated with honors from the University of Washington, where he was inducted into the prestigious Phi Beta Kappa society. His medical education continued at the University of Southern California, followed by an internship and residency in anesthesiology at USC-L.A. County Hospital Medical Center, where his leadership abilities led to his selection as chief resident.

Following his residency, Dr. Nelson pursued specialized fellowship training in interventional pain medicine. His expertise in this field led him to establish the Pain Management program at Desert Hospital in Palm Springs, California, before returning to his home region to serve Washington patients.

Services and Approach

The practice specializes in diagnosing and treating various pain conditions through a multidisciplinary approach. Patients benefit from customized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and cutting-edge regenerative medicine techniques. The clinic emphasizes minimally invasive solutions that address the root causes of pain while maximizing function and quality of life.

Location and Contact Information

Proliance Eastside Pain and Regenerative Medicine welcomes patients at their conveniently located office at 12911 120th Ave NE, Suite h210, Kirkland, WA 98034. To schedule a consultation or learn more about available treatment options, patients can call +1 425-823-4000 or visit their comprehensive website at www.danielnelsonmd.com.
column11: Dr Nelson grew up in the Puget Sound area and was an honors and Phi Beta Kappa graduate of theUniversity of Washington. He went to medical school at the University of Southern California and completed his internship and residency in anesthesiology at USC-L.A. County Hospital Medical Center where he was elected chief resident.After residency Dr. Nelson completed fellowship training in interventional pain medicine. He then started the Pain Management program at Desert Hospital in Palm Springs, California.

column38: Rebecca Michaels|Stacey Martinez|Josh Jablon|Janna Mydland|Murray Krebs|Les Peterson|Brahim Djouider|Sam M
column40:
Dr. Nelson was calm, confident, and communicative. He was empathetic and walked me through every step of the procedure both preemptively and live while it was underway. He genuinely seemed to care about my well being and prognosis. You don't find many doctors these days with this level of emotional intelligence and competence and I'm very grateful.|Dr Nelson was very thorough and explained the procedure in detail. I was in and out quickly. Getting the appointment scheduled with all the back and forth with the scheduler took over a month which was very frustrating and almost caused me to leave the practice for another doctor. The front office is very short staffed...|Like another reviewer here, this review is not at all about Dr. Nelson's medical practice or bedside manner, but the office itself.
I visited Dr. Nelson in early September for imaging--it is late November, and I have still not received results or a follow-up. Despite over half a dozen phone calls to the office, giving times of availability and leaving urgent messages, I have still not received my results. Not via telephone, not via MyChart (which should be incredibly easy)...nothing.
I get the same message each time I call the office, assuring that I will hear back from someone...no dice. Dr. Nelson struck me as a kind, honest, and empathetic problem solver, but this failure to follow-up and communicate with important results and next steps has left me in a standstill with chronic pain that only continues to get worse.|Dr. Nelson and SarahGobble are the best there is. Super caring and know what they are doing.

Dr Nelson saved my life fifteen years ago by making my diagnoses! 10 stars!|Dr Daniel Nelson is caring and compassionate with his patiences. Not only has it been my experience but my wife has seen Dr Nelson on several occasions and we have both had the best of care!|I saw Dr Nelson recently for autogalous stem cell injections for my knees. In this procedure, marrow is aspirated from the posterior hip area, spun down in an FDA approved centrifuge and injected under X-ray guidance into the joint. The pain was minimal throughout the procedure and at all times Dr Nelson was monitoring my responses and medicating if needed. (I actually needed very little, other than local anesthetic for the injections and aspiration.)
Also included was an injection into the joints of PRP--platelet rich plasma. A second PRP injection is performed in 4-6 weeks.
Just 8 weeks before this procedure, my wife was seen for a similar procedure for her shoulder. She had a severe rotator cuff tear that required surgery. Her surgeon is one of the best in the area--shout out here to Dr Michael Codsi--but we wanted to increase the odds of a complete recovery, so, enter Dr Nelson. He gave her the same care I received.
In short, Dr. Dan Nelson and his staff are top-of-the-line care for regenerative medicine in the Puget Sound.|Over the years Dr. Nelson has proven to be a highly skilled and uniquely caring physician in the area of pain management and treatment. He demonstrates an  unusual mix of professionalism, and commitment to make you feel comfortable by explaining step by step what the procedure involves. Among Dr. Nelson's qualities are his excellent bedside manners and his eagerness to answer the toughest of questions. I rank him among the very best in all medical specialties combined.|*Edit: it is 09/10/2024 and I was finally called and told that no provider can see him so they referred me to call another clinic. Again. Why not tell me in July when we first called your office that we might not be able to be seen.

No you had my husband wait about a month and a half to be told to go somewhere else.

If I could give negative stars I would.

My husband was involved in an accident back in may. He was a bicyclist. He was referred to this location by one of the providers he's working with.

We put in a request at the end of July. I don't hear back from them for two weeks. I had to keep calling and was given different reasons for what was going on. Our pip adjuster confirmed that she had spoke with them and confirmed there was coverage, after weeks more I get a phone call from someone named Olga Jackson who provides me this information
Email: o.jackson@proliancesurgeons.com
Fax 425-821-3550
Our conversation took place on 08/23/24. She advised me to have my husband's pcp send her over a referral in case the pip is not able to cover it. She says once she gets the referral she will send over a message to the pain management team to see who is available to take my husband on as a patient. My husband's pcp sends over the referral on 08/26. I wait two days and call Olga and leave her a message. No response. I call Olga again on 09/03, leave her a message, no response. So today 09/05 I call the main office number where I speak with Giselle, who is very rude and informs me there is no referral and that she doesn't know why old would be involved and she doesn't handle these kinds of things. I explain to Giselle my initial conversation with Giselle, who again informs me I am wrong, Olga has nothing to do with this and told me there is no referral.

We started trying to set up an appointment in July and it is currently September. My husband is in pain and had I known this would have been the outcome I would have gone somewhere else. This office lacks communication and customer service.

Please don't waste your time coming. I'm sure the doctors are really good at what they do but good luck getting in. I'm very disappointed.

Please see below redacted chart from your office calling the pip provider to confirm coverage, this took place on 07/31/24

MultiCare Interventional Pain Management - Puyallup serves patients throughout Puyallup, Washington and surrounding Pierce County communities with specialized pain management solutions. Our comprehensive clinic combines advanced interventional techniques with compassionate care to help patients experiencing chronic pain conditions. Located in a modern medical facility at 1450 5th Street SE, Suite 3500, our team of board-certified pain specialists works diligently to develop personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain while minimizing reliance on medication.

At MultiCare Interventional Pain Management, we offer a wide range of minimally invasive procedures and therapeutic approaches designed to provide lasting relief. Our interventional techniques include epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted nerve blocks. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome, arthritis pain, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our approach focuses on the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our multidisciplinary team collaborates to create comprehensive treatment plans that may incorporate physical therapy, behavioral health support, and advanced interventional procedures. We emphasize patient education, ensuring you understand your condition and treatment options to make informed decisions about your care.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Our Puyallup clinic is conveniently located at 1450 5th Street SE, Suite 3500, Puyallup, WA 98372, with ample parking and accessibility features. As part of the trusted MultiCare Health System network, we coordinate seamlessly with your primary care provider and other specialists to ensure continuity of care. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (253) 697-4110 or visit our website at www.multicare.org.

column38: suzanne mackler|J Ramme
column40: I have received cortisone injections from Dr Iyengar several times and have been relieved of pain almost immediately or within a day or two. Yesterday I made an appointment for an injection and it's been less than 3 hours and I can get up out of a recliner and walk around almost painlessly. I've had other doctors give me injections and either the pain's gone away more slowly or not at all. Dr Iyenger's offices in Tacoma and Puyallup are comfortable, clean, and his staff are warm and caring. Dr Iyengar is very kind and soothing and always makes me relaxed with a little humor and sedation before the injection so it doesn't bother me. All in all the sedation and injection are very quick and I'm in and out within 30 minutes or so. His injections have lasted me several years and would've lasted me longer if I had not reinjured my back. I recommend Dr Iyengar very highly to anyone who is in pain and needing relief quickly.|

column3:
Lake Washington Pain Management serves the Kirkland, Washington area with specialized chronic pain management services. Our dedicated team of pain specialists focuses on improving quality of life for patients suffering from persistent pain conditions through comprehensive treatment approaches. By utilizing the full range of modern pain relieving medications in conjunction with targeted interventions, we help patients regain function and comfort, making daily life more manageable and enjoyable again.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

At Lake Washington Pain Management, we specialize in the use of prescription medications for the management of chronic pain. Our physicians develop personalized treatment plans that may include carefully monitored medication regimens, minimally invasive procedures, and complementary therapies. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our primary goals focus on improving our patients' comfort levels and functional abilities.

In-Office Procedures

Our clinic offers several pain-relieving procedures performed on-site by our experienced medical team:

- Lumbar epidural steroid injections

- Myofascial trigger point injections

- Joint, tendon, and bursa injections

These targeted interventions can provide significant relief for patients suffering from specific pain conditions, often complementing medication-based approaches for optimal results.

New Patient Opportunities

We are currently welcoming new patients seeking optimization and management of their daily pain medication regimens. Our team takes a compassionate approach to pain management, working closely with each individual to develop effective strategies that address their unique needs and circumstances.

Contact Information:

- Website: https://lwpain.com/

- Phone: +1 425-678-8534

- Address: 13122 120th Ave NE, Kirkland, WA 98034, United States
column11:

By utilizing the full range of modern pain relieving medications, in conjunction with other therapies when indicated, we are very successful at realizing our primary goals of improving our patient's comfort level and function, making life "liveable" again. We are happy to take on new patients to optimize and manage their daily pain medication regimens.

We also perform several pain relieving procedures at our clinic which include lumbar epidural steroid injections, myofascial trigger point injections, and joint, tendon, and bursa injections.

column38: Lisa Krewer|Bilinda|Chris|Jeffrey Cameron Stewart-Adams-Knowles|Marisa Nesbit|Brian Killgore|Kara Blanchard|Allen Smith
column40:
I haven't worked with the doctor there but Melissa is wonderful! She's compassionate, personable, down to earth and very knowledgeable. I highly recommend her.

Before coming here I was grossly over prescribed. While it was scary coming off of certain meds and adjusting doses of others I'm so happy I did; less medication is working better for me. They really know what they're doing! Best, most responsible treatment I've ever received.|***My issue is not that I was asked to stop a medicine that potentially could interact with a new medication. I'm disappointed by the way I was treated, and that I wasn't even allowed to see the doctor and discuss what medicines need to be stopped. This information could have been given to me in the first phone call I made instead of stringing me along for 6 weeks while I was in pain. When I called, they took note of my medicines and asked if I was willing to stop them and I said YES. This was a terrible experience because no one told me initially so I could get things adjusted prior to an appointment. The doctor refused to even see me.***

I was referred to Lake Washington Pain Management by my PCP. They never called me for an appointment, and after a week I called them. Spoke with Rebecca who said she had to send my info, including current meds, to the doctor to approve me as a patient. She instructed me to get 1 month of pain medicine from my PCP because they had appointments in early June.

There was no callback after a week, so I called back. Rebecca was out of office. A receptionist said she would be out until 5/22 and that Rebecca is the one who handles scheduling so she couldn't schedule me. I called back 5/22. Rebecca apologized and said she worked me into the schedule for Friday 5/26 since I only have 8 days of medicine remaining.

She called me back on 5/24 to tell me the doctor would not see me because I'm prescribed 1mg of Clonazepan (1x per day). This is prescribed by my psychiatrist who I see regularly. I had told Rebecca in our first phone call I was willing to discuss changing those meds, but they refused to see me until I have stopped them completely. Not only was this interaction the most unprofessional I have experienced, but it puts me in an awkward situation with my PCP and current medications.|Dr. Naibert,  is the worst.  I met this this guy in 2006 in Edmonds WA. He was more worried about his new house under construction on mercer Island then me. He's rude, obnoxious, and treats you as a patient second class. He's had his problems, but I shouldn't have been the one he takes it out on. I can say nothing positive about him. Stay away. His true colors came out the first day I met him. He'll give you more pain than you knew you had. I was even told to boycott Walgreens in Edmonds because there was an issue with them calling authorities on him. There was actually a post it note hanging in the patient room, that's how I learned of it.|I've been a happy and relatively pain free patient for over five years. Unlike the other negative reviews, I understand pain specialist must stay on top of the demanding and ever evolving regulations. These regulations mean patients must also follow specific rules placed on them by the provider at Lake Washington Pain Management. Some of these rules may not make sense to those who refuse to adapt as required to ensure their pain management plan doesn't put their lives in danger. One drug screen showed nicotine. They were quick to question me on this fearing I had begun using tobacco products. Nicotine can negatively interact with some medications.

Prior to being accepted as a patient at Lake Washington Pain Management I was being grossly over prescribed. In addition I was prescribed a deadly combination of medication. Being accepted to the Lake Washington Pain Management may have very well saved my life. In addition to weaning me off prescriptions with deadly interactions Doctor Naibert began immediately reducing the grossly over prescribed medication. It took nearly two years, but we were able to comfortably and painlessly reduce my med by 80% (***every patient, their prescriptions, and their situation is different. Do not use my experience as a template for your individual treatment plan***).

We've been so successful reducing my meds and tweaking meds/therapies, I was able to reduced meds a further 33% on my own last year. It is true, less is indeed more. Prior to Dr Naibert accepting me as a patient I would wake with horrible headaches each and every day. My previous doctor simply kept increasing the doses while adding in and trying new medications. That provider nearly killed me. There were serious signs I was overdosed. However I didn't know what or how to recognize signs of overdose. Besides I was being treated by a pain specialist....right? Wrong. I would pass out and sleep for hours any time of the day. I gained over 45 pounds eating anything with sugar and drank 12 cups of coffee a day. To be fair I have complex injuries and conditions. However that is no excuse for over dosing me and prescribing me a deadly cocktail. After switching doctors I asked the pharmacist about the deadly cocktail; she admitted she had concerns and phone the doctor multiple times over the years but was told she had no need for concern. She now knows to report deadly prescription interactions when a provider shows indifference and she feels the patient in danger. Sadly not all pharmacist have the courage to confront doctors and report potentially deadly prescriptions.

As others have noted Dr. Naibert can be intense. To some his personality and opinions may be too much..... however he is now retired. Although retired he has filled in a time or two.

This clinic serves the diverse public. As such patients are also diverse. Which clearly indicates this clinic does not discriminate, seek high net worth cash only patients, or operate as a pill mill. And yes, like all other pain clinics there are addicts who show up with a valid referral seeking treatment. All I can say on that is I've never seen those who appear sketchy twice. They likely were refused opioids. This clinic is not dirty, nor a pill mill for street addicts. The gentleman who posted the false review was likely not accepted as a patient, was refused an opioid prescription, or was told he would no longer be treated because he failed a drug test.

I trust Lake Washington Pain Management with my life. I honestly believe they saved my life.

Give them a call if you want a provider who cares and will work with you to find the correct pain management plan tailored to your specific needs.|I called over two weeks ago seeking treatment for chronic pain.  I was advised that I needed a referral and 3 months of chart notes which I had sent in that day.  Some one called me last week to screen me.  One of the questions was if I used marijuana.  I advised them that I used CBD oil to control inflammation and nausea.  She  asked if I would quit if I were prescribed an opioid.  I said I would doubt it but I would be willing to discuss it with a provider because I have never gotten adequate pain relief from  any opioid  I have ever had before, they make my skin itchy, I use CBD oil everyday and I don't even know what options are available.

I called today because I had not heard back from them yet.  They advised me that they would not be able to even have a consultation with me to discuss treatment options unless I was willing to commit to give up the CBD 100% and the doctor would have no discussion with me.

I find this disturbing, especially during an opioid epidemic.  Treatment alternatives were not even presented to me and I was turned away because I have been responsible with my medicinal care.  This strikes me as irresponsible and unprofessional medicine, but I am not an expert.|My mom was referred here when she was  in her late 80s.   She had been an RN many years ago so she knew something about the medical world.   She had horrible problems with pain from arthritis and long-term problems and she needed narcotics to manage her pain.

Ultimately mom's primary care doctors felt that they could not prescribe the levels of narcotic medicine that she needed, so they referred her to LWPM.

My mom was not an addict.   I mean she really wasn't.   But she was always treated as an addict when she came here.   The front desk staff was cold, although they did what they had to do.   There was no sense of compassion from the front desk.   I assumed they were used to a lot of addicts trying to work the system.

I will say that this clinic controlled Mom's pain and adjusted her dosage as needed.

Mary, the ARNP in the office, was wonderful.   My mom always hoped she would get Mary.   Dr. Neibert was a bit different.    He always wrote the RX she needed, but he was more combative.

The thing that bothered me most about Dr. Naibert was on one visit he told us that he was a Trump supporter, and he believed that the social safety net should be disbanded and that we should go back to a world where churches provide the safety net.

He is entitled to his opinion, but we did not share it, and we felt it was totally inappropriate for a clinical setting.

I mean what do you do or say?   You need the RX for your pain, so you sit there and nod.   I mean FFS.   And he was very often gone on safari to Africa or wherever, to kill animals.

There was this really creepy feeling about going there.   My mom felt it.   It was like the front desk staff thought everyone was scamming, and the doctor did not seem very compassionate.    The whole office felt like they had had way too much experience getting punked by addicts.

My mom fell and died after a couple weeks.   This had nothing to do with this clinic.   She was just unstable on her feet.

And when she was admitted to the hospital, I told them what her RX was, and they were kind of horrified, but I did not feel mom was over-treated.   Her doctors at Overlake were kind of horrified, but they were not pain management specialists.    I got so angry at them when mom was dying.   She was clearly in pain and they were prescribing a fraction of what she had been on before.   I kept telling the doctors that they were under prescribing and she was moaning in pain.

It was not until the hospital put Mom on "hospice care," and Evergreen Hospice came in that I felt she was getting the treatment she needed.   When I explained her history to the nurse, he immediately upped her doses so she would not die in pain.

So I give them 3 stars.   I hated the front desk.   Dr. Naibert made me feel uncomfortable.   Mary was so kind.|I've been a patient of Dr. Naibert's for about 3 years now and he's contributed greatly to saving my life. I suffered severe back damage from a serious car accident on I5 when I was 6 months pregnant 13 years ago (was airlifted to Harborview as my car was flipped on the freeway). I was referred to Dr. Matthews in Bellevue and for the next 10 years I was under his "care"....I trusted him. Then I got a call from the state. His license was being revoked for constant overprescribing and abusing his oath. I was terrified, where would I go? Who was going to gain 10 years of knowledge of my injuries and my case? Would I have to start all over again with building trust? I found Dr. Naibert and from day 1 I've been in great hands. My very 1st appt i found out I was being OBSCENELY overprescribed (I was on 4 80mg Oxycontin and 24 30mg Oxycodone A DAY) on my own I weaned myself off all Oxycontin and with Dr. Naibert's careful guidance I've tapered WAAAAAY down off the Oxycodone and will be completely opioid free one day very soon. Sooo amazing. These bad reviews you're seeing are from keyboard commandos and internet troll warriors who are probably doctor shoppers and were booted from Naibert's clinic, they also don't have the integrity to share their concerns with Naibert, instead they (like 80% of millennials and snowflakes today) run to their keyboards to spew lies and damage a really good doctors name. Don't come to this clinic if you're just looking for your next fix, you aren't going to get past my no-nonsense,  no b.s., no muss no fuss Doctor.  And I feel safer just knowing that about him. He also has some of the best staff at the front desk, the sweetest gals are there to greet you every time. Very clean and organized waiting area. The walls are adorned with Naibert's amazing photography he himself took. He's proud of his 20 year recovery story and that's one of the biggest reasons I trust him with my life.|Melissa Barclay is a wonderful dr, always listens to what I have to say and has a reasonable treatment plan to accommodate my pain and medical needs! I been under her care over a year and glad I came to her clinic and I highly recommended her service for lower back pain!

column2: Water's Edge: Memorial's Pain Relief Institute
column3:
Water's Edge: Memorial's Pain Relief Institute serves Yakima, Washington as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions. This specialized medical facility spans nearly 10,000 square feet of meticulously designed space, featuring modern offices, examination rooms, and dedicated procedure areas specifically equipped for advanced pain treatments. Patients experiencing chronic pain conditions find solace in the institute's tranquil environment, where the waiting area offers comfortable reclining chairs positioned to provide calming views of Yakima's Lake Aspen.

Water's Edge distinguishes itself through its multidisciplinary approach to pain relief, offering patients access to specialized treatments designed to address various chronic pain conditions. The facility's team of pain management specialists employs evidence-based protocols to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

State-of-the-Art Facility

The institute's thoughtfully designed environment combines clinical excellence with patient comfort. Each treatment room is equipped with advanced medical technology, allowing the medical team to perform a range of interventional procedures with precision. The facility's location overlooking Lake Aspen creates a serene backdrop that contributes to the healing atmosphere patients experience during their visits.

Patient-Centered Care

At Water's Edge, the patient experience remains central to the practice philosophy. From the moment patients enter the relaxing waiting area to the completion of their treatment plan, the staff provides attentive, compassionate care focused on addressing individual needs and concerns.

Water's Edge: Memorial's Pain Relief Institute is located at 1460 N 16th Ave, Suite D, Yakima, WA 98902. For appointments or additional information, patients can call (509) 574-3805 or visit their website at www.multicare.org.

column3:
MultiCare Pain Management - Puyallup serves patients throughout Puyallup, Washington with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Located conveniently in the South Hill area, our practice focuses on minimally-invasive procedures and personalized treatment plans designed to address both acute and chronic pain conditions.

At the heart of our practice is Dr. David Hou, MD, a highly qualified pain management specialist with international training and extensive experience. Dr. Hou received his medical training at the Fourth Military Medical University in Xian, P.R. China, establishing a strong foundation in medical science. His commitment to excellence led him to complete a residency at both the State University of New York and the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences, followed by specialized fellowship training in pain management at the prestigious University of Washington.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Dr. Hou provides a wide range of modern, effective, and minimally-invasive pain management therapies tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our approach integrates advanced interventional techniques with holistic care strategies to address various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. We emphasize treatments that minimize recovery time while maximizing pain relief.

Visit Our Puyallup Location

Our clinic is conveniently located at 1450 5th St SE #3500, Puyallup, WA 98372. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Hou or learn more about our services, please call us at (253) 697-4110. For additional information about our practice and MultiCare's comprehensive healthcare services, visit our website at www.multicare.org.
column11:
David Hou, M.D., received his medical training at the Fourth Military Medical University in Xian, P.R. China. He went on to complete a residency at the State University of New York and the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences and a fellowship in pain management at the University of Washington.

Dr. Hou provides a wide range of modern, effective and minimally-invasive pain management therapies.

column2: Anesis Spine and Pain Care - Tacoma
column3:
Anesis Spine and Pain Care - Tacoma serves the Tacoma, Washington area with specialized pain management solutions from their convenient location at 1628 S Mildred St #102. At Anesis, we provide comprehensive care for individuals suffering from chronic pain. Our team of highly trained and experienced medical professionals is dedicated to helping our patients manage their pain, improve their quality of life, and regain their independence. We understand that chronic pain can be debilitating and have a significant impact on your daily activities.

Our practice offers a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief, addressing both symptoms and underlying causes. We offer a range of personalized treatment options, including interventional therapies, minimally invasive surgeries as well as medication management. Our team will work closely with you to develop a treatment plan tailored to your specific needs, goals, and lifestyle.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Anesis Spine and Pain Care apart is our commitment to treating each patient as an individual with unique pain experiences. We take the time to listen, understand your specific challenges, and create customized treatment protocols that address your particular pain conditions. Our goal is not just temporary relief but helping patients achieve lasting improvements in their quality of life.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, call us at +1 206-538-6300. Our Tacoma office is conveniently located at 1628 S Mildred St #102, Tacoma, WA 98465. For more information about our services and approach to pain management, visit our website at http://anesispain.com/.

column38: Mary Stalling|Kelly Davis|Tammy Chambers|Susan Knutson|Andrae Reddish|lynn Boldenow|Jason Lee|Charles Colenaty
column40:
I had an appointment today with Praveen Mambalam. This was my first time seeing him and he basically said I need to be off of my pain medication which I've been on for two years at the lowest dose. He took my prescription from 4 times a day down to three times a day. Mind you he's not who I see he's a stand in.  He wasn't trying to hear what I had to say on the matter. He has a rude demeanor. I do not want to see him again.|This is based on the Lacey office and doctor Burkley.  I initially gave them 5 stars I've seen them 3 times the first time I've seen them was to discuss my chronic pain issues and all my back issues.  It was the initial appointment and they were great, second time I got a few pain pills and he would monitor me. No offer of anything else just pills, ok fine i dont like pain meds but will take them when i absolutely need to and i actually had expired ones i had brought with me and turned into him this last visit. I was supposed to come back for a recheck from the 2nd visit however I didn't make it back because I ended up getting pancreatis from a bad gallbladder and was given pain meds due to the pancreatis and had been  very ill from that add in a few deaths in the family and I just did not make it back for another follow up. when I finally was able to come back which was  last month, July of this year he was not friendly, hes not a friendly doctor anyways he has an unfriendly demeanor and that's fine I got along with him regardless, but he really didn't do anything or offer anything. I asked him if he could get me an MRI as felt like my back had gotten worse And we discussed that briefly and then he kinda said okay I will get a hold of you and out he went. it's been a month and I just called to see what was going on and apparently there's nothing more they can do for me or my pain.  But heres the thing, they havnt done anything for me anyways beside give me a few pain pills. I did not ask for pain meds this last appt when I came back  i asked to be reevaluated  as my back feels worse and it had been a long time since anyone had did an mri to see if it had progressed. But they didn't offer me any alternatives, no lumbar injections etc they  just said sorry we cant help u anymore. Well u didnt help me in the 1st place except give me drugs. Thats it no alternatives and doc Burkley you sir are rude and condensing and should not work in a field that should atleast possess some compassion for those of us with chronic pain.
Did u ever think we are often out of it because we are chronically tired from lack of sleep due to pain? No u just assume we are all  drug seekers.
Shame on you Im absolutely disgusted with you and this place and will make sure to share that with many.

I do not recommend them anymore.|I have been being seen at Anesis Pain & Spine Center now for about 3 years. I have to say, I have never been treated unkindly or indifferent. I can count on all of the Physicians at Anesis to take care of me, and I believe they Really Do Care. One time I had an appointment, I was coming from Bellevue to Tacoma I was over 45 mins late.... The Doctor Stayed and waited for me because she knew I was coming from Bellevue, and Traffic  As a matter of fact I have an appointment today for injections . Compassionate Doctors, and Staff I don't know what I would do without you guys I would easily give them. 5  
Thank You Anesis.. T Chambers|The people here are great. The treatments they offer are beyond what other pain clinics offer. They truly want to help you. They listen to your concerns and treat you with respect. I have never felt like I'm ignored ir treated poorly.|In two visits I've had positive experiences with Dr. CHEUNG. The staff was friendly, the waiting area was clean, and the doctor took the time to listen to my concerns, providing thorough explanations and guidance. Overall, it was a professional and caring environment that made my visit comfortable.|I recommend this practice and all the wonderful people that work there whole heartedly. I came into this office in so much pain I was unable to even make my own bed and was having trouble walking. I had a plan to get my life back and they were 100% on board. They listened to me and helped me with my back problems first. I now am pain free in my back for the first time in over a decade. We are going to tackle my hip problem next. I know that they will help me get back to the lifestyle I want. I can't say enough good things about these people and the wide variety of help they have available to get patients better. They truly do care about their patients.|I have degenerative disc disease and Anesis has helped me for the last 3 years navigate different treatment plans to get the best results possible.  I'm happy to say that today was my final visit unless I start experiencing symptoms again. In December I had a spinal stimulator implanted which has reduced my pain by 90%.  I don't have to take pain medication any more and I don't have to think about if a certain movement will cause shooting pain in my back or leg.  I just have to remember to recharge the stimulator every couple days to keep it on.  I highly recommend Anesis if you are looking for a solution for your pain.  I think the biggest barriers comes from what insurance wants to cover, but they helped navigate through all the options and prerequisites needed to get my treatment where it needed to be.  I am forever grateful to return to a normal pain free life.|I can't say enough to praise Dr. Burkey and the staff at Anesis Spine and Pain. I am walking without a cane again after two years of needing one. Dr. Burkey listens and is attentive to my needs and concerns, especially in my desire to stay off of opioid pain meds. The treatment I receive is cutting edge and highly effective. I never have a problem getting an appointment when I need one and am always treated with the upmost respect and courtesy. I would not hesitate to recommend Dr. Burkey and Anesis Spine and Pain to anyone having to deal with chronic pain. The only exception would be if you just want a doctor to throw pills at you. Go elsewhere. You will be wasting your and the clinics time. You will see some one star reviews for this clinic. I suspect that those people may have been shopping for a pill dispensary and were therefore disappointed and agitated.

column2: Sound Pain Alliance - Mt Baker Pain Clinics, Puget Sound Pain Clinics, and Peninsula Pain Clinics
column3:
Sound Pain Alliance serves patients throughout Washington state through its network of specialized pain management clinics including Mt Baker Pain Clinics, Puget Sound Pain Clinics, and Peninsula Pain Clinics. As Washington's largest and most experienced independent pain management specialty group, Sound Pain Alliance has established itself as a leader in interventional pain management, offering innovative solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. The alliance brings together experienced specialists dedicated to helping patients overcome chronic pain conditions and return to normal, active lifestyles.

At Sound Pain Alliance, patients benefit from cutting-edge interventional pain management techniques designed to not only manage pain but potentially eliminate it entirely. The clinical team develops personalized therapy plans that address the specific causes and manifestations of each patient's pain. This individualized approach ensures that treatments are as effective as possible, with the ultimate goal of guiding every patient toward a pain-free lifestyle.

Multiple Convenient Locations

With multiple clinic locations across Washington—including the Mt Baker region, throughout the Puget Sound area, and across the Peninsula—Sound Pain Alliance ensures accessible care for patients regardless of where they live. Each location maintains the same high standards of care and comprehensive treatment options, allowing patients to receive consistent, quality pain management services without extensive travel.

Contact Information

Patients seeking relief from chronic pain can reach Sound Pain Alliance at +1 206-249-9730 or visit their website at http://soundpainalliance.com/contact/ to schedule an appointment at any of their clinic locations. The dedicated staff is ready to help new patients begin their journey toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.
column11: The Sound Pain Alliance is the Mt Baker Pain Clinics, the Puget Sound Pain Clinics, and the Peninsula Pain Clinics. At Sound Pain Alliance, our aim is to offer cutting edge, innovative interventional pain management options to help patients manage or if possible cure their pain effectively so they can live life as normally as possible. As Washington's largest and most experienced independent pain management specialty group, we offer patients personalized therapy plans customized to fit their needs. Our goal is to put every patient on the path to a pain-free lifestyle.

I really appreciate all of the kindness and truly important questions they ask to find out what is going on with me. They seem to realize, chronic pain can also affect someone mentally and emotionally. They check-in on all aspects of their patients.

Jackie and Vaughn show when I've had issues with previous medications and disquiet concerns. Vaughn and Jackie always listen to questions I have, and/or concerns I may have as well. Vaughn has listened to suggestions I've had regarding my medications and possible other treatments. I feel as though my opinion really matters to Vaughn and Jackie and that I'm just as involved with my health and the ongoing treatment of my chronic pain management.

. I truly appreciate my opinion being included in any changes to my medications. Vaughn and Jackie have taken the stress out of chronic pain management and I would recommend them to anyone without questions.|From the minute you walk into the clinic you feel very welcomed. Thank you Michelle! Once in your room Jackie comes in to take your vitals and once again you feel not only welcomed but like you met a new friend. Then Vaughn comes in to go over your medical needs. If you are in need of this type of service I highly recommend to at least have a consultation appointment. Dr. Vaughn is a very intuitive human and you can tell he truly cares about your well being in life. Thank you all!!!|Dr. Vaughn Howe his assistant are the best. Everytime I come in they are both so nice and professional. I would recommend them to anyone who is needing help with pain. Dr. Howe looks for other options other than just pain pills, he likes to get to the root of the problem which is refreshing.

column2: MultiCare Medical Pain Management - Gig Harbor
column3:
MultiCare Medical Pain Management - Gig Harbor serves the Gig Harbor, Washington community with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve quality of life for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located in the picturesque waterfront city of Gig Harbor, our specialized clinic combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to address complex pain issues. Our team of board-certified pain specialists develops personalized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and integrative medicine approaches.

At MultiCare Medical Pain Management, we offer a wide range of specialized services to address various pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach includes diagnostic evaluations, nerve blocks, joint injections, spinal cord stimulation, radiofrequency ablation, and comprehensive medication management. We treat conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our providers take time to understand each patient's unique circumstances, medical history, and goals for pain management. This collaborative approach ensures treatment plans align with patients' lifestyles and preferences while focusing on functional improvement and reduced dependence on medications when possible.

Convenient Location and Facilities

Our clinic is conveniently located at 4545 Point Fosdick Dr # 250, Gig Harbor, WA 98335, within the Gig Harbor Medical Park complex. The modern facility features state-of-the-art equipment and comfortable treatment rooms designed with patient comfort in mind. We're easily accessible to residents throughout the Kitsap Peninsula and surrounding areas.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at (253) 792-6970. You can also visit our website at www.multicare.org for additional information about our providers, services, and patient resources. Most major insurance plans are accepted, and our staff is available to assist with insurance verification and scheduling.

column40:
Dr Settle is a caring and attentive Dr. Anyone who needs help with a similar issue, I always recommend him. He has been a great help in addressing health from an immediate and preventative perspective.|Everyone I have met at this pain clinic, from front desk, through nurse, right up to my doctor, Dr. Jing, have been both kind and professional.  Empathy is so important, and we patients know when it's real.  Thank you Dr. Jing, Rosalee, and all the staff.|Dr, Settle is my favorite doctor by far!! I have been seeing him even before he came to multi care gig harbor!! I have been seeing him for about 16-18 yrs now!! I don't want him to retire but I hope multi care finds a great & understanding Dr like Dr Settle!!|Dr. Lau made such an amazing impression on me. She knew a lot of things many of my doctors didn't - quite a variety of knowledge. She was down to earth, truly listened to me, and she made an intelligent and conservative plan for my care that includes seeing specialists who can help me get to the root of WHY the pain and how to fix the causes of it rather than just treat one of the symptoms. As far as I'm concerned, that is a doctor who's worth her weight in gold.|This was my first visit with Dr Settle  and he was absolutely awesome... He will be continuing my pain management while I also see my regular Dr ( Blaisdell) for all other of my medical needs. I feel I have a good team that will help me sort out my health struggles...|These guys are the best! Especially the supporting staff who will go above and beyond if you're having trouble with your refills or if you end up somewhere they are denying you meds. They make sure your meds are effective and you can return to some form of decent living. I gave up many times for years of having everyone treat me like a drug seeker and finally found these guys. The pain clinics aren't what they say they are and just want to do implants and whatever they want to do without considering you. Pain management treats your pain with medication and that's just what they do|Dr. Settle and his staff stay on top of all patient issues.  They are relentless in their follow-up for their patient needs no matter the circumstances. Thank you Dr. Settle and staff!|Doctor comes in and mentions that she was looking over my file, meaning she probably made up her mind about me before she even met me. She goes through the motions and does the physical and begins to ask me questions, asks if I've seen a nerve doctor and have had a nerve test-yes. Seen a PT-yes. Tried trigger point injections- yes, didnt work. A psychiatrist-yes. Tried massage/acupuncture-yes. Tried a sleep study-yes. Tried aqua therapy- no but we can. Compression socks and gloves-yes. Seen an orthopedic surgeon-yes. Trying to find the root of the pain... Ms, its the years of drugs i put in my body, the diabetes, my three bulging disks in my back and the two in my neck and old age.

She finally says at the end, "Well, I'm conservative" when it comes to prescribing pain medications. Okay? And so am I. I waited as long as I could to make this appointment with you, so i wouldn't have to be subjected to this. To be judged. I was hoping to talk to someone empathetic. Someone who would understand that my pain has escalated and is forcing me to be here

I'm struggling to understand how you can be conservative and be in control of peoples pain? In control of someones suffering? You're in the wrong business. I'm also confused on why she was pushing for me to take trasadone but then told me she doesn't want to prescribe a pain medication because they could make me drowsy and make me more of a fall risk. Huh?

I had to have a thumb amputated a year ago and had to battle a pretty severe infection after the surgery. I was in the hospital for weeks. While in the hospital they gave me oxycontin, that was the only thing added to my med regimen, and I felt wonderful. Not high or drowsy or any negative side effect. I was able to sleep, my daughter visited and even said she noticed i was moving a little quicker and easier getting myself to the bathroom, that my mood was more chipper (i wasnt in severe pain). This doctor didnt listen to anything i said. She saw my depression score, saw my past record with drugs in my 20s and wrote me off. I'm 60 now.

column2: Acute Pain Therapies | Bellevue Ketamine, Spravato, Injections Clinic - Drs. Zachary Fisk, and Christina Julian
column3:
Acute Pain Therapies serves Bellevue, Washington and the greater Seattle metropolitan area as a premier interventional pain management clinic. Founded by board-certified physicians dedicated to innovative pain solutions, this specialized medical practice offers comprehensive treatment options for patients suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions. Their integrative approach combines cutting-edge therapies with personalized care plans to address complex pain issues that may not respond to conventional treatments.

At Acute Pain Therapies, patients have access to a diverse range of advanced pain management solutions. The clinic is led by distinguished physicians Dr. Zachary Fisk and Dr. Christina Julian, who bring extensive expertise in interventional pain techniques and regenerative medicine. Their treatment offerings include:

  • Ketamine Infusion Therapy - For treatment-resistant depression, PTSD, and chronic pain syndromes

  • Spravato® (Esketamine) - FDA-approved nasal spray for treatment-resistant depression

  • Interventional Pain Injections - Including epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, and nerve blocks

  • Stem Cell Therapy - Cutting-edge regenerative treatments for joint pain and tissue repair

  • Regenerative Medicine - PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) and other advanced healing techniques

Patient-Centered Approach

The clinic emphasizes individualized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Their comprehensive evaluations consider medical history, physical examinations, and advanced diagnostic testing to develop targeted interventions. This multidisciplinary approach helps patients achieve meaningful pain relief and improved quality of life.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 13033 Bel-Red Rd #120, Bellevue, WA 98005, Acute Pain Therapies offers a modern, comfortable environment equipped with advanced medical technology. Their convenient location serves patients throughout King County and neighboring communities, providing accessible specialized care for those seeking alternatives to traditional pain management.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about available treatment options, patients can reach Acute Pain Therapies at +1 425-440-3351. Additional information about services, physician credentials, and patient resources is available on their website at www.acutepaintherapies.com.

column40:
I cannot recommend Acute Pain Therapies in Bellevue, WA highly enough. Dr. Fisk and his team are truly exceptional. I was initially hesitant about undergoing Ketamine treatments for my chronic pain and depression, but from the moment I walked into the clinic, I knew I was in good hands.

The staff at Acute Pain Therapies are not only professional and knowledgeable, but also incredibly kind and reassuring. I was worried about feeling anxious during my Ketamine IV infusions, but their calming presence put me at ease. They made sure I was comfortable and well taken care of throughout the entire process.

I have tried numerous treatments for my chronic pain and depression in the past, but nothing has worked as effectively as Ketamine. The results have been truly life-changing. If you are experiencing similar issues, I urge you to not hesitate any longer and seek relief at Acute Pain Therapies.

Overall, my experience at Acute Pain Therapies has been nothing short of exceptional. I am so grateful to Dr. Fisk and his team for their expertise and compassionate care. Do not let any doubts hold you back - take the first step towards relief and book an appointment today. You will not regret it.|Dr. Chloe Kennedy is a phenomenal doctor. She is compassionate and leaves you feeling heard and understood. I'm healing from complications I had during surgery and she's been the first physician to understand my concerns and actually address them as oppose to being swept under the rug. I really respect her and feel grateful for being connected with her. Thank you!|I should start with, I was in a really bad car accident in 1993 and ended up in the hospital for a month. I ended up with half a knee cap, titanium rods in both femurs, pins in my ankle, and hips, limited mobility, and I had to learn to walk again after being bed ridden for several months.  Needless to say, I've been working with pain management doctors for a little over a decade and it's been difficult.

After moving here from another state, and having several bad experiences, I was recommended Acute Pain Therapies from my insurance provider along with a few others and I am so glad I found them. I agree with what others said, they treat you with dignity, care, and respect.

Most importantly, they listen to you, treat you like a human being, not just a number, they take the time to understand your situation, and then offer a comprehensive plan that aligns with what your body needs in order to function as normally as your body allows.

I'm not ready to give up or give in.  So, I look forward to working with them as they continue to help me manage my pain.  .|I used to come here for depression and PTSD treatments. This was of course before they told me to take down my Google Review. If I did not take down my review I was told that I would not be able to reschedule my appointment or future appointments.
The person who told me this called me from the clinic phone. Announced it was acute pain therapies calling and let me know the phones were working and advised me to take down my Google Review or they would not let me schedule or reschedule.
I have no idea if this person has been fired or how long this highly unethical and illegal advice has been going on. It's not just bad advice it's blackmail!
I will never ever come back to this clinic because I am not going to trust a doctor that is highly likely now mad at me with a needle in my neck.|I am always treated with the upmost dignity and respect when I have my appointments at Acute Pain Therapies.
.  The staff at the front desk (Peter)
goes beyond his job requirements to be welcoming, helpful and friendly!!
Dr. Chloe Kennedy is also warm, great at explaining things, and validating the patients explanation of their pain .  She is gentle and kind.  A wonderful addition to the practice!

Of course, Dr. Fiske is excellent at listening and understanding what the patient is expressing.
I have always felt heard and taken seriously about my pain when he has been with me.

I feel trusting and safe there especially since some drastic changes were made in the staff about in the last couple of years.
Thank you for being a safe place for myself and others who are suffering to come for help!|Chloe Kennedy is great! She listens to her patients and treats you like a person and not a number! Dr Julian and Haleen have been incredible as well the few times I have met with them both!|I highly recommend the Acute Pain Therapies office in Bellevue, Washington.  The moment I enter the office, I'm warmly greeted and taken care of.  I know the support staff, physician assistants, and doctors focus on the well being of each patient, because it's evident during each meeting I have with them.

For years I thought that the ever present pain, lack of sleep, and my reduced activity level had become my "New Normal."   But since going to this office and working with Chloe K. (PA-C) and the supporting doctors, I've learned that there are other viable options to consider to help manage my pain.  Options that are realistic.|The staff and doctors were very friendly.   They were able to answer all my questions and were able handle any concerns I had about the procedure.  Dr. Julian explained how she was going to do things prior to the procedure which was nice and was honest about the pain after the procedure was over.
