column2: The Doctors Clinic: Deepak I. Sreedharan, MD
column3:
The Doctors Clinic in Silverdale, Washington offers specialized pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Deepak I. Sreedharan, MD. Our established medical practice has adapted to current healthcare challenges by implementing comprehensive virtual care options while maintaining essential in-person services for urgent cases. With a patient-centered approach, we continue to provide the highest standard of pain management treatment through secure telemedicine platforms, ensuring continuity of care during the COVID-19 pandemic.

At The Doctors Clinic, Dr. Sreedharan specializes in advanced pain management techniques and treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our practice focuses on both acute and chronic pain conditions, offering evidence-based interventions designed to improve quality of life and restore function. While currently operating primarily through virtual appointments, we maintain capabilities for essential in-person procedures when medically necessary.

Virtual Care Appointments

In response to COVID-19, we have transitioned to primarily telemedicine consultations. These virtual appointments allow patients to receive professional medical guidance from the safety and comfort of their homes. Our secure platform ensures patient confidentiality while providing convenient access to our specialized care. For patients with urgent or essential needs that require in-person evaluation, we maintain strict safety protocols at our Silverdale facility.

Contact Information

To schedule your virtual appointment or discuss an urgent medical need, please contact our office directly at (360) 830-1100. For additional inquiries, you can reach us at (360) 830-1106. Our physical location remains at 2200 NW Myhre Rd, Silverdale, WA 98383. For more information about Dr. Sreedharan and our services, visit our website at www.thedoctorsclinic.com/providers/deepak-sreedharan-md/.
column11:

While we are using telemedicine to treat a majority of our patients, we are able to see patients who have an essential or urgent situation. Please call us directly, 360-830-1100 to schedule your virtual appointment or if you have an urgent need.

I cannot express enough how grateful I am to have Dr. Kim as my pain specialist. From my very first appointment, Dr. Kim has shown a remarkable level of compassion and understanding.  He really  takes the time to listen to my concerns and thoroughly explain my treatment options, which has made a significant difference in my overall experience.

Dr. Kim's expertise and dedication to patient care are truly commendable. He has  tailored my treatment plan to address my specific needs, The office staff is also friendly and accommodating, making every visit a positive experience.

I highly recommend Dr. Kim to anyone seeking a knowledgeable and caring pain specialist. His commitment to helping patients regain control of their lives is evident, and I feel fortunate to be under His  care. He will even personally call you to check to see how you are doing, He gives such  a high standard of care!

Dr Kim is truly a remarkable kind hearted man.

God bless You & your wonderful team.
- Marlord Brown  (Max)|Dr. Kim greeted me so kindly! I was to have a pain injection. I really felt comforted and respected by this outstanding Doctor. The shot was done prfessionally and kindly. Obviously this man is a genius, award winning in his field, and genuinely compassionate.|A sincere thank you Dr Kim.   Gave me significant relief after 4 business days.   Professional and thorough.     Cares and wants to get the most appropriate intervention done as soon as possible.  The Dr obviously has the patient's best outcome at heart.    These type of injection specialists can make more money doing all their injections 1-2 days a week (2 -3 WEEKS AFTER your initial appointment) and farming out a lot if the prep to an under-qualified Nurse Practitioner (No burn on NPs but they are not meant for surgical intervention)   Instead this Dr can sometimes do injections same day and oversees all steps of the procedure.  I've worked in the medical field for 22 years and this provider is the helpful/timely doctor that I needed.  Thank you Dr Kim|I highly recommend Dr Kim. Over the years I've had pain issues and not only is Dr Kim knowledgable but thoughtful in his care and manner. I'm very grateful to be his patient.|My worst experience with the office of Dr Kim.
They charge me no show fee of $75 although I called them 4 days in advance, they have not updated their website and they expect you to remember the the days their office is closed.
Front desk calls me back following Monday to confirm the cancelation , does not say a word about me getting charged for this appointment.
Their lack of communication and not disclosing their policy while you are on the phone with them is misleading.|I have seen Dr. Kim for several years.  He has always been extremely professional and caring.  You can tell he genuinely cares about my well being. He has educated about my condition.  He has performed his procedures and they gave helped me function and work with much less pain. I am grateful to be one of his patients.  Thank you Dr. Kim for being there for me.|Dr. Kim is very professional! Had my 3rd injection today & I'm always pleased & helps tremendously! He knows I get anxiety during the procedure & talks me through it & keeps me calm. He's also a jokester which puts me at ease! Procedure is quick & makes me wait a bit after to make sure all is good. I highly recommend him. Would not go to anyone else. Thank you Dr. Kim|Dr. Kim literally saved my life when I had a spinal fluid leak after a failed disc surgery. Urgent care and my surgeon misdiagnosed my issue and blew me off, but when I called his office he personally got on the phone and told me it was a CSF leak and exactly what to do. I was in terrible condition at that point and had to have emergency surgery. Dr. Kim was there for me during my recovery and I returned for many epidural injections which allowed me to avoid the spinal fusion surgery being recommended by several surgeons. He showed genuine compassion and kindness at every visit and gave me a better quality of life.

Been going for over 10yrs. Just listens and types does what he thinks is right. Acts buddy buddy. This review has been years over do.. have disc,nerve,hip etc problems and he focuses on what he thinks. He needs to watch a brilliant mind and take some notes. I have many but I'll tell you the last time I went. Told him my back had gone out a few times last couple months . Rebounding spasms. Etc i told him i was taking a little more then i normally do on tramadol. he never asked me how much I was taking which is one first hour.. I'll talk half of 2nd one hour later and other half if need be.. no more then 2 a day if that. He assumed I'm probably smoking injecting who knows. So I go to get my normal prescription and it's cut to 16 from 54 about pills andddddddd aaaaa box a narcan..
Guess I'm a drug addict so it seems like he thinks.  Never one word he said about this when I went to pick it up.. wants to inject you more then anything|Dr Kim is really ridiculous.  He doesn't seem to care about his patients.  if he can't continue to bill someone's insurance, he gets very annoyed. I ended up having to have surgery and he was annoyed that I had to start seeing the surgeon.  Now today 10.21.2024 I just received a bill for balance due after insurance. Date of service was 1.31.2023. This is the second bill I've received from him for services just about 2 years old.
What a joke!!!!!
He gets mad when he can't continue to bill insurance.  Beware patients and insurance companies.
Tisk, tisk, tisk Dr. Kim.  Very bad juju|Dr. Kim treated my son's herniated disc with steroid injections on two separate occasions nearly two years apart. He was very empathetic towards my son which helped him relax and feel heard. I was very aware of how carefully and methodically Dr. Kim considered all medical notes and test results from multiple providers across several years. He also spent a lot of time discussing the best approach. The procedures aren't fun but both my son and I felt very confident in his expertise and approach. (It's also worth noting that Dr. Kim was able to successfully treat my son's pain after he had seen another M.D,  for the same procedure: we believe Dr. Kim's expertise and experience made the difference and allowed my son to avoid surgery. )|Dr. Kim is outstanding. I have chronic back pain and I'm choosing to treat my pain extremely conservatively (and opt against surgery at this time). Dr. Kim was very supportive of my choices, extremely knowledgeable of my condition, very efficient in each visit, empathetic of my pain, and his entire office staff reflects the same. I had an epidural steroid injection by Dr. Kim, which I have had several previously by other professionals to treat my pain. Dr. Kim did an amazing job (the procedure was nearly pain free and Dr. Kim narrated as he performed the different process of the procedure, I'm very familiar with the procedure, so I'm sure if you wanted more of a narrative or less he would be happy to do) and he did not over use lidocaine like in my previous experiences, Dr. Kim used the perfect amount, which I am so impressed with! (In a previous experience I had a doctor give too much which made me unable to walk without assistance for a 24 hour period). After my quick and nearly painless procedure by Dr. Kim I felt very confident to walk again (unassisted). All around excellent experience and I highly recommend if you're looking for a doctor educated, efficient, empathetic, and direct (he is straight to the point - which I really appreciate)! Thanks, Dr. Kim and staff for such a positive experience! Looking forward to seeing you again soon.|Dr Kim is awesome. He's extremely knowledgeable and professional in his practice. I had always feared having the shots in the spine for chronic lower back pain. Dr Kim is skilled, and the spinal shots were no big deal!
Thank you Dr Kim!!|Dr. Kim has always been very compassionate and professional with me. It's obvious that he genuinely cares about my well being. He has helped me though difficult times.  His procedures have helped me function and work with much less pain.  Thank you Dr. Kim for being there for me!|Dr. Kim is thorough, thoughtful, communicates transparently, and has done a great job for me as a patient.|Dr. Kim is by far the best doctor I've seen related to my chronic back pain.  I was able to easily get an appointment that matched my schedule.  He proposed an epidural steroid injection, which I've had in the past.  While my pain continued, Dr. Kim spent two weeks convincing Regence Blue Shield King County that it was an appropriate procedure.  I went in to follow up while he was negotiating with Regence.  He received approval while I was there then and said "Well, you're here, let's do it now."  Perfect!  While I've experienced a lot of pain going through my last epidural a year and a half ago with a physician in Kent/Renton, my experience with Dr. Kim was a completely different experience.  While he prepared my back for the injection, I felt a tiny tiny pin prick on my back.  Laying on the table, I was awaiting the injection, steeling myself for extreme pain - like I said, my prior experience was severe pain, as if I'd been electrocuted.  While I'm waiting for the procedure to continue, Dr. Kim announces that he completed the injection.  Never did feel a thing.  And, it seems that Dr. Kim was correct - it was an appropriate procedure as it knocked my pain down by 60% or more.  Dr. Kim is a very interesting physician; easy to converse with and puts one at ease discussing issues that potentially bring up stress.  He's a great man to deal with.  I give him 5 stars and a thumbs up on top of it!!  I would recommend him to anyone with chronic back pain.

column38: B W|Debbie Fox|Ron Hyde|Sue Martin|Joyce Clark|Maury Hafermann|Frazier Bank|Amy Foster
column40:
While I no longer see these guys, I wanted to take the time to leave a review. I have been suffering from chronic pain for a long time due to a military injury, and I was eventually referred to Dr. Wagner. Working with him was, compared to previous doctors I have had to deal with, extremely pleasant. He was willing to listen to my issues and concerns, and was never pushy about things I had concerns about, and actually remembered the things I told him.

For example, my chronic pain is related to some nerve damage in my torso, for which one possible treatment are injections into the rib muscle. There are many concerns with this, namely lung puncture risk and the fact that you develop a tolerance to the medication each time until it no longer becomes effective. I found this to be a poor solution for long term chronic pain, but previous doctors always seemed to push this treatment on me regardless of my complaints. Dr. Wagner however understood my reservations and agreed with me, and whenever we would try something new, skip past it and comment the reasons we weren't going to try it. It made me feel respected and that he was invested in my care and priorities.

The only reason I stopped seeing him is because the only thing that ended up working were stronger classes of painkillers that had undesirable side effects that I was no longer interested in making the trade-off for, and there wasn't much else to be done. I recommend anyone suffering from chronic pain to consider Dr. Wagner, as you will find in him a compassionate doctor who believes you, focuses on what will work for you, and is happy to try new things that you're comfortable with.|I was on a dinner cruise & hit my head on the railing of the boat. I've been to many pain Dr's. I was recommended to dr Wagner.  He is so amazing and cares about you & your pain& figures how to get you better. I highly recommend dr Wagner. His staff is amazing as well.   I wouldn't go to anyone else. Thank you dr Wagner   debbie fox|Thank You DR. Theodore Manos for your Professional evaluation of my Spinal Stenosis Pain relief solutions....You Gave Me the will i needed to schedule & receive the Laminectomy spine operation that was the only realistic solution to the pain i was enduring....& thank you for the prescriptions that helped me endure the pain the month it took to get the operation scheduled at the UW spine center at the Harborview hospital in Seattle...|Sue Martin

In 2017, after 4 botched back surgeries in four months,  I was told after the last surgery that after two more years, I would be the best I could get.
For over two years now I have been  pretty much house bound,  unable to do much of anything.  The nerves have attacked my thighs, calves, sciatic area, etc.  Enough said.  My family physician referred me to Dr. Wagner.  It is as if a miracle came about.  After Dr. Wagner gave me the pain  shots he recommended, I have had 2  months of feeling normal.  Not falling, wobbling, hurting ...AMAZING !!  I would recommend Dr. Wagner to anyone in need of pain relief.  He listens to you, is very thorough and easy to talk to.  I would HIGHLY recommend him to anyone in pain.|This is "The BEST", Doctor for pain relief that I have EVER been to! I will recommend Dr. Wagner any time to anyone!!!! He will treat you like a person! Not a figure of bones! Keep up the GREAT work doc, we who know you & your work, Love you!! You Are the " BEST!"
Mrs. Clark|I had badly twisted my neck and with a set of cortisone injections Dr. Wagner was able to resolve 2 months of significant pain.
Great teamwork with staff in the procedure room.
Much appreciated.
-- Maury Hafermann, MD|If I could give more stars , I would . My primary referred me to Dr Wagner this last summer as she had tried everything possible to control my chronic pain , 3 neck surgeries and progressively getting worse . Dr Wagner  and I had made the decision to try shots in my neck (have had different ones in the past with no relief ) within a week I was able to do regular life things that people take for granted  , and just kept getting better ... I was not waking up with horrible neck pain , numb fingers , burning in arms . I know this will need to be repeated as medicine leaves the body , but I know I will again feel relief . I am so grateful . Dr Wagner listens , gives educated answered to question, and truly cares for his patients.|Was referred to the pain management specialist by Dr. Demergen. Won't recommend him to anyone. He's been dodging the initial appointment for a year with me!! I have a PARS fracture and  hardly walk. I should be in a wheelchair! Do I get any sympathy?? No!!

Dr. Howard Quint serves patients throughout Edmonds, Washington and surrounding communities with exceptional dental care focused on comprehensive oral health. Our established practice combines modern dental techniques with a warm, patient-centered approach that has earned us the trust of families throughout Snohomish County. Dr. Quint's commitment to continuing education ensures that our patients receive the most current and effective treatments available in modern dentistry.

Our practice offers a complete range of dental services including preventive care, cosmetic dentistry, restorative procedures, and emergency dental treatment. From routine cleanings and examinations to advanced smile makeovers, Dr. Quint provides personalized care tailored to each patient's unique needs and goals.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that dental visits can cause anxiety for many patients. That's why we've created a comfortable, relaxing environment where patients of all ages feel welcome and at ease. Our friendly staff takes the time to listen to your concerns and thoroughly explain all treatment options, ensuring you're an informed partner in your dental health decisions.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 7614 195th St SW, Suite 203 in Edmonds, WA 98026, our modern dental office features the latest technology and equipment to provide efficient, effective care. Digital imaging, intraoral cameras, and other advanced tools allow us to diagnose issues with precision and deliver treatments with exceptional results.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment with Dr. Howard Quint, please call us at +1 425-774-5163. New patients are always welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans. Our office is conveniently located with ample parking, making your dental visit as convenient as possible.

column3:
Advanced Pain Care serves Olympia, Washington and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic focuses on providing relief for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions, pre and post-operative discomfort, and those struggling with benzodiazepine or opioid dependence. With a patient-centered approach, our team of experienced healthcare professionals works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each individual.

At Advanced Pain Care, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach combines various therapeutic modalities to effectively manage and reduce pain while improving overall quality of life. We take the time to thoroughly understand your condition, beginning with an extensive 90-minute initial evaluation to ensure we follow best practices in developing your customized treatment plan.

Specialized Treatment Areas

Our expertise extends to various pain conditions including but not limited to:

  • Chronic pain management

  • Pre and post-operative pain control

  • Medication management

  • Benzodiazepine dependence treatment

  • Opioid dependence recovery support

Patient-Focused Care

We believe in creating partnerships with our patients through education, compassionate care, and ongoing support. Our collaborative approach ensures that you are an active participant in your pain management journey, with regular assessments and adjustments to your treatment plan as needed.

Contact Information

To schedule your comprehensive evaluation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Phone: +1 360-218-5990

Website: https://advancedpaincarewa.com/

Address: 205 Lilly Rd NE Bldg B, Ste A, Olympia, WA 98506, United States
column11: At Advanced Pain Care, we offer collaborative services to help you manage any chronic, pre and post op pain. We can also help those with benzodiazepine or opioid dependence. The initial appointment includes a 90 minute evaluation to assure best practices are followed.

column40:
The staff are very nice and pleasant. They have helped me when I needed to get paperwork faxed to their clinic. The doctor treats me as a person he listens to my questions and answers them. He has patience to my concerns. I would definitely recommend him to others needing help. It's nice having wonderful staff and having a great doctor who cares about your overall health. And helps you to ease your discomfort when you have chronic pain.|Advanced Pain Care was so great in helping with my mother's pain problems.  She had previously been prescribed a lot of opiate painkillers for over 20yrs, and they were no longer working for her.  Probably causing more harm than help. Dr. Overton was able to assist me with getting mom cut back and eventually off the high amounts of opiates she'd been on for so long.  He placed her on 2mg of a newer prescription drug, that took away her cravings as well as taking care of her pain issues.  She is now 81yrs old, and is in the best health I've seen her in in the past 25yrs.  Thanks for your help and support Dr. Overton and staff!! We miss you and wish you the best always! Bless you!!|I dont think ive ever left a review but i thought i should now As much as miss my old doctor that retired. Im greatful overton has takin me in last min hes helping to continue my pain managment and explains things to you and cares bout your well being. Appointments are fast and easy front staff been helpful ya the pharmacy communications can be delayed sometimes because of software they use but staff so far has been quick to respond about it correct it. But overall im happy i can continue have my pain under control and work save up for surgery
And try enjoy life.|This review is in response to David Byers review of David Overton. I am a CNA and have taken my client to David Overton numerous times as he is her pain specialist. First of all he has her test at most visits for opiate abuse which she has never done. It protects him and the person being tested. Sometimes the system does not connect with the pharmacy, so yes they have to send the script again. There was a time when my client had to use a paper script because the service was down.  He also caught the mistake my clients PCP did that I brought up to him. I was worried because she had prescribed a narcotic for my client to sleep. She was already on a pain narcotic. When I brought it to his attention he immediately took her off of it and put her on a non narcotic non addictive sleep medication. So he is NOT pill pusher! David does not deal with shoppers who go from doctor to doctor shopping for pain meds. If some is looking for a professional pain doctor I would definitely recommend him.|I have had nothing but problems with Mr Overton PA at Advanced Pain Care. He is unorganized, forgets to complete what he has promised to do and is unable to use any form of online system to interact with  a pharmacy. He even admits their system has problems and you need to monitor your prescriptions to see if your pharmacy even gets them. I have had the pharmacy techs tell me they have faxed him up to 7 time for refills and had zero response. I have even had to drive to his office to get paper prescriptions. I also doubt his qualifications as he has over perscribed medications that MDs have said were dangerious doses. I just tried to get a non opioid medication filled and had contacted his office telling them the pharmacy had received no response from him and that I would run out in several days. I had to call his office again only to be told I would need to schedule an appointment in 2 weeks. If this was a requirement I should have been to this at my last appointment. I believe David Overton to be unqualified as a pain management provider, totally unprofessional and dangerous. I won't be returning and you should not go to this clinic.|Everyone at this clinic is very professional and caring.  Took the time to explain everything, listen to my concerns and resolved my chronic pain issue.  I could not be happier! My life is 100% better now!|Dr. Overton has always treated me with respect and genuinely cares about the people he treats for chronic pain. His staff is kind and professional and always calls me back when I have left messages and needed help with my medication. Thank you for improving my quality of life!|I love Dr Overton. I appreciate the time and care he provides me. He has gotten my pain under control no doctor has before. I suffer with fibromyalgia and intractable migraines. He's given me my life back to the degree that is possible under the circumstances. Highly recommend.

column2: Washington Center for Spine and Pain Management
column3:
Washington Center for Spine and Pain Management serves Bellevue, Washington and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical facility focuses on treating chronic pain conditions through innovative, evidence-based approaches. Located in the heart of Bellevue at 1900 116th Ave NE, our center combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with personalized treatment plans to address the unique needs of each patient suffering from spine-related pain, joint disorders, and other chronic pain conditions.

At Washington Center for Spine and Pain Management, we believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to develop customized treatment strategies that consider your medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals. This comprehensive approach allows us to address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain, helping patients regain function and improve their quality of life.

Our Specialized Services

We offer a wide range of interventional procedures and non-surgical treatments including epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Our physicians are board-certified specialists with extensive training in pain medicine, ensuring you receive the highest standard of care using the latest techniques and technologies.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 425-774-1538. Our facility is conveniently located at 1900 116th Ave NE, Bellevue, WA 98004. For additional information about our patient-centered approach and treatment options, visit our website at https://washingtonspineandpain.com/about-us/patient-centered-approach-6474820.

column2: Franciscan Pain Management Clinic at St. Clare
column3:
Franciscan Pain Management Clinic at St. Clare in Lakewood, Washington serves patients throughout Pierce County with specialized pain management solutions. As part of the Virginia Mason Franciscan Health network, this dedicated clinic combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to help patients experiencing chronic pain conditions. Their multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional aspects of pain management, empowering patients to regain control of their lives and improve their overall quality of life.

The clinic offers a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management techniques, including medication management, therapeutic injections, physical therapy referrals, and complementary approaches. Their specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, with a focus on sustainable pain relief and functional improvement.

Patient-Centered Approach

At Franciscan Pain Management Clinic at St. Clare, patients benefit from a holistic approach that considers all aspects of their health journey. The clinic emphasizes education and self-management strategies, helping patients understand their conditions and actively participate in their recovery. Their compassionate staff creates a supportive environment where patients feel heard and valued throughout their treatment process.

Location and Contact Information

Conveniently located at 11311 Bridgeport Way SW, Suite 100, Lakewood, WA 98499, the clinic is easily accessible to residents of Lakewood and surrounding communities. To schedule an appointment or learn more about their services, patients can call (253) 985-2949. Additional information about the clinic's services and the Virginia Mason Franciscan Health network can be found on their website at www.vmfh.org.
column11: Franciscan Pain Management Clinic at St. Clare is dedicated to delivering high quality, compassionate care to Lakewood and nearby communities. Visit us at 11311 Bridgeport Way SW or call (253) 985-2949 for more information.

column40:
I have had an experience of being bedridden and in extreme pain for nearly 2 years.  Had surgery and relief for 5 months then the pain was  is back. Went back to pain management and they have screwed up my med delivery each week by not calling it in no matter how early I contact them. Each week I go days without pain meds. I live in a bed. I can't sit for long nor walk more than ten feet. I have unbearable pain. The pain clinic sent an apology for their lack of care giving after the fact and then did it all again.|I was sent here from a foot surgeon I was seeing. I had no idea he was sending me to a pain clinic. He had told me on 2 separate visits that he would be doing surgery to fix my foot that I had 3 surgeries on it already. But it was still really messed up and the pain from this foot is really bad. Someday it's a 10. I start coming to this clinic and from day 1 they treated me with little to no empathy or bed side manner.  The Dr I see from this clinic is the 8th Dr. I have called and left numerous messages for a return call and you get zero response.  Or if you do, it's days to a week later. I'm having a spinal cord stimulator put in next week for the massive nerve pain from my foot and they aren't putting me out. Just giving me a Valium and I also get zero pain meds. I know 3 people that have had this same thing done to them and they are say it's super painful and you have to wear all of this stuff for a week. It's the trial then if it works, you get it put in permanently. They do absolutely nothing for the pain I have been in. I warn anyone, DO NOT COME HERE!!! So not only am I in a lot of pain with my foot 24/7 now I'm going to be in pain with this thing in my back for a week. You are seriously treaded like a number, or a inconveniences. I hate this Dr office.|I have been coming to this clinic for going on three years and today I must say is the worst experience that I've ever had in my life dealing with a doctor and office receptionist. It was hard enough being told that there was nothing else that they could do for me when they haven't done anything but prescribe me medication that's for people that overuse their medicine. But after I see the doctor And then I walk out of the office limping face full of tears and nobody did anything. I also informed the doctor that my legs had swollen up so much to the point where I couldn't even wear shoes almost and she said absolutely nothing mind you this is a doctor that has never seen me before. So I went out to my car and calm down and try to find another pain specialist, then I went back in to see if they could write me a referral to a new doctor and I stood there for a total of almost 20 minutes. I was purposely left in the waiting area I knocked on the door nobody came, all the nurses and everyone else in the office I saw walking back-and-forth. Then when the receptionist finally decided to come out after I just decided to stand there and make a phone call to the office, I had to yell hello excuse me is anybody going to come out and help me. Then the receptionist finally comes out and is very very rude as if I've done something to her then she rudely tells me that they will not give me a referral or that they can't give me a referral. This was done on purpose and I was left in the waiting room for no apparent reason at all. This is very unacceptable and I will not tolerate being treated like that no one should have to especially when you're in excruciating pain in a doctors office. I would not recommend anyone go to this office at all under any circumstance. Please look through your options of a pain clinic and do not go to this one. I am deeply hurt and upset by the way that I was treated.|I've had two bad experiences with Kali Thibault, PA-C. She is rude, condescending, likes to argue and speak down to her patients and has a horrible bedside manner.  I will never see this provider again, and I would not recommend her to anyone.|I have been being cared for By Dr. Vo. He is an excellent Physician.
Well respected by all hospital staff.
He is a very patient person. Super responsive and up on all the latest technology available to patients.
He is not easy to get into because he is very much in demand as this is a much needed Specialty in Medicine.
Once you become an established patient you will not be sorry for the wait. So be patient please.
He does not rush you in and out ever.
He extremely thorough and conscientious.
St. Clare's is a very good facility to be seen at as again, you are not rushed in and out. All staff is very respectful and excellent communicators.
I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Vo or St Clare's.
You won't ever regret the experience.
I am a Registered Nurse of over 40 years experience. I know great Healthcare practitioners as I have been fortunate to have worked with many. Dr Vo is very exceptionally gifted. A really hard worker and smart worker.
Thanks
John Grey RN|I don't know why people have given Franciscan Pain management such bad reviews. I had to change pain management doctors due to insurance coverage changes. I transferred to Franciscan. After reading reviews I was worried about changes in my care. Dr Dhesi and his team have treated me with respect and care. I couldn't be happier with the team at this clinic. They've listened to my concerns and been nothing short of excellent in their care for me.|When I first met Tatyana Tools I was not at all impressed with her. But she grew on me. I was sad to see her go. She took very good care of me, she listened to what I had to say.   6-1-2022|Had a zoom appointment with Tatyana tool that she didn't show up then wanted me to reschedule appointment was at 2 pm logged onto zoom at 155 waited til 3 and called office 3 times to see if she was showing up !

column3:
Bellevue Pain Institute serves Bellevue, Washington and the greater Seattle metropolitan area with innovative pain management solutions. Founded on the principle that effective pain relief doesn't always require medication or surgical intervention, our multidisciplinary clinic specializes in conservative treatment approaches that address the root causes of chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified specialists combines decades of experience with evidence-based methodologies to create personalized treatment plans that restore mobility, reduce discomfort, and improve overall quality of life.

At Bellevue Pain Institute, we understand that pain is complex and often requires multiple therapeutic approaches. Our integrated care model incorporates physical therapy, chiropractic adjustments, acupuncture, massage therapy, and advanced diagnostic techniques to identify and treat pain at its source. We specialize in addressing back and neck pain, joint disorders, sports injuries, neuropathic conditions, and post-surgical discomfort through non-invasive methods that promote the body's natural healing processes.

Patient-Centered Approach

Every treatment plan begins with a thorough assessment of your medical history, lifestyle factors, and pain patterns. Our specialists take the time to listen and understand your unique situation, ensuring that recommendations are tailored to your specific needs and goals. This personalized approach has helped thousands of patients throughout the Pacific Northwest find lasting relief without dependency on pain medications or the risks associated with surgical procedures.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located in the heart of Bellevue at 12360 NE 8th St, Suite 200, our modern clinic is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies. The comfortable, healing environment supports our holistic approach to pain management and reflects our commitment to providing exceptional care in a supportive setting.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 425-999-9633 or visit our comprehensive website at www.bellevuepaininstitute.com. Our dedicated team is available to answer questions and guide you through the first steps toward a pain-free life.
column11: Multidisciplinary conservative pain treatment & management without drugs or surgery.

column40:
I would recommend this clinic unreservedly, especially for anyone experiencing back issues or nerve pain.  The entire staff is friendly, engaging, knowledgeable and respectful of patients' time.  They take a holistic approach to patients' care and look for underlying issues rather than just treating symptoms.  They are honest and present realistic expectations.  In just a few months, I achieved more results and understanding of my condition than years spent working through my HMO.  They also provide support and guidance to help you maintain good health at home after treatments.  Definitely the best care I have ever received!|Bellevue Pain Institute provided exceptional treatment and care for me as I struggled with an L4/L5 herniated disc. I had been dealing with pain for almost six months before finding BPI and seeing multiple doctors and specialists with no success. It was not until Dr. Polzin was able to take a deeper look at my MRI that I realized the severity of my issue. Dr. Polzin and his team were able to put a plan together not only to help fix my disc issue but also to provide me with the knowledge and tools to help prevent further injury in the future. After four months of treatment, I am now stronger than I've ever been and excited to live my life without constantly worrying about my back pain. I am beyond grateful for the entire staff at BPI, and I can't recommend them enough if you are struggling to find a solution for your back pain.

Thank you BPI!|I recently experienced vertigo for the first time. After several days of the terrible spinning sensation, I sought relief with Dr.Polzin at the Pain Institute in Bellevue. He performed the Epley maneuver on me. The next morning, I was able to sit up in bed without vertigo. He also advised me about Vitamins D and K, and how they affect the crystals in my ears.
I'm very grateful for the work of Dr. Polzin.|I am a 68-year-old man who was diagnosed with peripheral neuropathy in both feet of unclear origin. I am tall and thin, which may be relevant, and I experienced discomforting sensations of pins and needles in both feet, which disrupted my sleep. As an active runner, biker, and rower, I was deeply concerned about the potential long-term impact of this condition. Fortunately, I was referred to Drs. Patti Mullen and Kevin Polzin at the Bellevue Pain Institute.

I underwent 16 NeoGen treatments (two per week), during which both feet were electrically stimulated to promote neuro-muscular growth. Additionally, I received local injections of B-12 and oral supplements to stimulate blood flow in my feet, along with neuromuscular re-education, which involved manual stimulation of various regions on my feet and legs.

Although I was initially skeptical--being a brain scientist, I doubted that my symptoms could be reversed at my age--I am thrilled to report that, over the course of several months, my discomfort and pain completely disappeared! Objective measures, including assessments of blood flow, pain sensitivity, and both cold/hot and pressure sensitivity, all confirmed that I am now cured of my polyneuropathy.

I am absolutely overjoyed with this outcome and would like to express my deepest gratitude to Drs. Polzin and Mullen, as well as to their team members--Drs. Greg Cofano, Kaitlyn Burnette, and Holly Sternod. I truly appreciate the enthusiasm, knowledge, and care they demonstrated throughout my treatment.

Thank you again for your exceptional support. I am deeply grateful for the positive impact this treatment has had on my life.

Christof Koch, PhD

Meritorious Investigator and former President and Chief Scientist of the Allen Institute for Brain Science in Seattle

Former Professor of biology and engineering at the California Institute of Technology in Pasadena|For over a year, I suffered with a herniated disc at L5/S1 causing severe back and sciatic pain.  I tried every treatment under the sun with little to no success, then I found Dr Polzin.  The talented team at Bellevue Pain Institute uses cutting edge technology and provided a comprehensive treatment plan that restored me to normal function and has all but eliminated my pain.  I cannot recommend them enough!|If you have any pain caused from back or neck trauma, this AMAZING team will ensure they do everything they can to get you feeling better! From the second you walk through the door, you will immediately feel like family. Maddie and Christina are incredible at making sure that you know they care.

Dr. Polzin, Dr. Cofano, Dr. Burnette, and Dr. Brown are all absolutely incredible. They take the time to get to know each person they treat. I think the entire team had my name memorized by my 2nd visit.

I simply cannot say enough about how great this team is. I (barely) walked into this office with severe back pain and leg numbness/burning. After about 3 months of treatment, I would say I'm at 95% back to normal. They gave me my quality of life back.

I would highly recommend you go in for a consultation if your pain is interfering with your daily routine. You will quickly find that there's no better team in the medical industry than this one at the Bellevue Pain Institute.
Thank you also to Blayke and good luck with your new endeavor!
Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU!!|My first appointment was about what pain I have as to why I was there.  Then I was off to get full body Xrays at Bellevue Imaging.
My second appointment then showed me the cost, payment plans, etc. for what was seen on the Xrays and a taste of the manipulations that would be required 3 times a week !  Then they put on a back brace with an ice pack.
Sticker shock on the cost was my first thought until they said to get better would require manipulations 3 times a week, which an hour+ drive each way was a deal breaker.  I did ask if I could return the back brace knowing it was going to be ridiculously expensive and  was told no.....turned out it was a $200 back brace that you can certainly get elsewhere for under $50.
All that was just step one of 3....cha ching !
I would not recommend this place based on what seemed to be an extremely costly venture without much assurance for success and the fact insurance doesn't cover a large portion ESPECIALLY THE OVERPRICED BACK BRACE.  BE WARNED.|I have been debating on writing this.
I am actually very disappointed in this facility overall.
I had to take out a huge loan to get this treatment. I will have a large monthly payment for 6 years.
Although many of the employees are great.  The main doctor seems to be after payment,  and not truly care for the client.  In my experience.
After following their protocols to a T. Getting my treatments on time.   I had essentially no improvement.
Once my 3 months of treatment ended, because the thousands of dollars I paid wasn't enough.  They basically said see ya.  I think I needed a longer duration of treatment,  not their 3 month protocol.
I honestly feel completely used and thrown out. And that I was gaslighted.
I am honestly questioning all the reviews.  I can't be the only one who's been treated line this.

column48: Do you treat neuropathy of the feet?
column49: Hello JoAnn:  Bellevue Pain Institute has been successfully treating select cases of small fiber peripheral neuropathy for more than a decade.  Following a comprehensive examination and review of records and imaging, the doctors will determine if your prognosis is such that you would be a good candidate for a successful outcome.

column3:
Dr. Kyong H. Kim, DO serves Lakewood, Washington and surrounding Pierce County communities with dedicated osteopathic care. With a practice centrally located in Lakewood's medical district, Dr. Kim combines traditional medical approaches with osteopathic principles to deliver comprehensive healthcare solutions for patients of all ages. The practice emphasizes preventative care, chronic disease management, and holistic treatment options that address the interconnection between physical health and overall wellbeing.

At Dr. Kim's practice, patients receive individualized attention through a range of services including routine check-ups, chronic condition management, osteopathic manipulative treatment (OMT), and preventative health screenings. The office utilizes modern diagnostic equipment while maintaining the hands-on approach that distinguishes osteopathic medicine. Dr. Kim's training as a Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO) provides patients with additional options for pain management and functional improvement beyond conventional treatments.

Patient-Centered Approach

The practice prides itself on creating a welcoming environment where patients feel heard and respected. Dr. Kim takes time to understand each patient's unique health concerns, lifestyle factors, and treatment preferences. This collaborative approach ensures treatment plans align with patients' goals and daily realities. The friendly office staff assists with appointment scheduling, insurance questions, and follow-up care coordination.

Location and Accessibility

Conveniently situated at 11306 Bridgeport Way SW in Lakewood, WA 98499, the practice offers ample parking and accessibility features. The office is easily reached from Interstate 5 and is near major Lakewood landmarks. New and returning patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 253-983-9390 during regular business hours. The practice accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to address financial considerations.

column40:
I went 25 years on pain medications and still in pain! I met Dr. KIM and he put a Boston Scientific stimulator in my back and it took my pain away. Now I am off all my pain medications! I feel so fortunate to have met Dr. Kim for this reason. He has always taken time with explaining just what he is going to do or how he feels I am doing. Thank you Dr. Kim for improving the quality of my life. Please don't retire any time soon.
Joni|My husband has been suffering from RA for about 15 years.
In the past he has had some amazing specialists!!! Unfortunately they have either moved to a different state or are now out of network.
He was passed off to Dr Kim.
His compassion for his patient is minimal. His office staff haven't been much help either. Getting scripts has been a nightmare. Have missed doses several times because they don't transfer the information to the pharmacy.
Have been battling to get records, labs,and images to a different dr. They have been extremely difficult and simply don't care about making this transition easy.
Did our homework on the new Doctor and will be a welcome change to have a doctor and office staff care for the patient instead of just caring about their money|Dr. Kim is one of the best doctors in the PNW. He is thorough and never rushes the appointment. Several weeks ago I had a pinched nerve flare up that left me in severe pain. He scheduled me for the next day and did an epidural injection that took the pain away immediately. He was gentle, quick and always made sure I was comfortable. His staff is A+ and kind. Thank you to everyone there.|I had an electronic paintrial July 2012, then a pain pump installed August 2012. Dr was extremely helpful, exceptionally nice and took great care of me until April 2014 when I moved out of state.
I see the negative reviews and wonder how much demand these people are putting on the professional,  who has spent years taking care of, seeing the character of patients who may be pushing the limit on what they're looking for.  Are they telling doctor what they want or are they looking for the best options available. Meaning; are they drug seeking? I've been u enough clinics and seen enough drug seekers to understand what doctors are up against. When a patient is so negatively reviewing, it makes me wonder if they couldn't get what they 'wanted'. Just my opinion, I personally loved doctor and he did wonders for me, titrating me down from high doses of medications to minimal in my pain pump, exactly where I needed it the most. Evil, come on, give me a break!|Dr. Kim is a magnificent in his specialty and a very kind man. I am very happy he is my Doctor. Warm Regards, Christina Moore|He isn't a caring dr. Douglas W Taylor, MD serves the Olympia, Washington area as a distinguished pain management specialist at Olympia Orthopaedic Associates. With dual board certifications in Anesthesiology and Interventional Pain Management, Dr. Taylor brings exceptional expertise to patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. His comprehensive medical background, beginning with his medical degree from Northwestern University's Feinberg School of Medicine, followed by both residency and fellowship training at the same prestigious institution, has established him as a leading authority in complex pain management cases throughout the South Puget Sound region.

Dr. Taylor has developed particular proficiency in treating several challenging pain conditions, including:

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS/Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy)

  • Cancer Pain Management

  • Advanced Neurostimulation Techniques

  • Back and Neck Pain

  • Neuropathic (Nerve-mediated) Pain

Education and Credentials

Dr. Taylor's exceptional qualifications include:

  • Medical Degree: Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine

  • Residency: Anesthesiology, Northwestern University

  • Fellowship: Interventional Pain Management, Northwestern University

  • Board Certifications: Anesthesiology and Interventional Pain Management

Practice Information

Patients seeking Dr. Taylor's expertise can visit him at:

Olympia Orthopaedic Associates

3909 9th Ave SW

Olympia, WA 98502

Phone: (360) 709-6230

Website: https://olyortho.com/providers/douglas-taylor-m-d/

Dr. Taylor's patient-centered approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with comprehensive pain management strategies, offering hope to those suffering from debilitating chronic pain conditions. His commitment to advancing pain medicine makes him a valuable resource for patients throughout Washington state seeking relief from persistent pain issues.
column11: Douglas W. Taylor, M.D., is a Board-Certified Anesthesiologist and Board-Certified, Fellowship-Trained Interventional Pain Management Physician. After obtaining a medical degree at the Feinberg School of Medicine of Northwestern University, he completed both a residency in Anesthesiology and a Fellowship training program in Interventional Pain Management at Northwestern University. Dr. Taylor has a special interest in the diagnosis and treatment of Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (or Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy), Cancer Pain, Neurostimulation, Back and Neck Pain, and Neuropathic (Nerve-mediated) pain.

column40:
Dr Taylor will treat you with kindness and compassion and respect!  I've been going to Olympic Orthopedic for years and I have always been happy with them.  They care first about you and your needs. He will follow through with patient care as his number 1 priority.  I'm super happy that I found this practice and couldn't be happier with him.  I recommend Dr Taylor for anyone who is in need of spinal care.|Dr Taylor and team were efficient, kind and professional. Dr Taylor took time to review updated plan, was gentle and respectful in manner. In the treatment room he and his team were explaining step by step, advising when something was going to be uncomfortable and completed with the goal of my safety and comfort met.
Dr. Taylor checked in post procedure with a referral for continuing care. He took all the time I needed to answer questions and assure I had contact information for concerns.|Dr Taylor and his team were so incredibly kind!! I was very nervous for my procedure. They talked me through every step and constantly reassured me with kind words. I have never had such a positive medical experience and I cannot give enough praise. From reception to recovery, everyone was phenomenal. Huge thank you to Dr Taylor and the Olympia Ortho Team!!|It's a drive for me. I always look forward to seeing Dr. Taylor. He is the nicest Dr. I have ever known. I will always ask to see him. My arm's, hand's, had no issues this weekend driving. The neck injection definitely helped. Ty so much. James Mcphetridge.|Found Dr. Taylor very personable, professional. I felt he listened to me when gathering my history of pain and in his planning the course of action he felt best for me. Had my first shot in back yesterday and the pain is lower today. We'll wait and see how I do the next few weeks. I'm hopeful.|I saw Dr. Taylor once for a referral on a long, ten year issue with my lumbar spine. I have previous spent years at UW spine center in Seattle where I had countless procedures done, including an RFA, until I gave up and decided to live in pain. Dr. Taylor came in with a new patient intake that he had handwritten all over. It was very obvious that he had had researched my extensive history. Took him 3 minutes to tell me I needed a fusion, which I had been begging to get for years at UW.

I am very grateful that he took the time to review my history and current mri. Seems reasonable that this would be something that a physician would do with any patient, but I have not found this to be the case in my ten years of dealing with this life changing issue.

Pleasant, direct, knowledgeable  and efficient with my time. What more can you ask for?|Dr. Taylor is simply the best  I had 2 injectios in the back and he is so gentle trying to keep the discomfort minimal. I cannot say enough good about Dr. Taylor.|THE ABSOLUTE WORST PAIN DOCTOR I HAVE EVER WORKED WITH!

Dr. Taylor was engaged and great for the first couple of months. However, the longer I was a patient the worse his serve and support helped me.  There have been numerous times I was scheduled for appointments only to discover those appointments we cancelled.  Since the travel time for me is over 90 minutes one way for my appointmens, this was simply unacceptable.
I worked with him on getting approved for a spinal cord Stimulater. This was the solution that he and the surgeon both directed me to. The first request for insurance approval we denied but he assured me that we just needed to complete the items insurance wanted (multiple physical therapy appointments).  Once completed, his team resubmitted for insurance. This too was denied and my attempts to find time for an appointment with him never happened. After speaking with my new pain management team, it seems clear that he did not work hard enough to get this approved. Instead they simply resubmitted the insurance request. If this stimulater was truly the right solution, I think he should have been working on my behalf to show this was the right solution. Instead I have received multiple calls from his office with the same message over and over..."we want to let you know your stimulater was denied".
Having to deal with this pain for years and worked with other pain management tears, I can honestly say that Dr. Adams is the worst team I have worked with.

Our specialized clinic combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address chronic pain, sports injuries, and post-surgical rehabilitation needs. Located conveniently in southwest Burien, our facility features state-of-the-art equipment and a team of board-certified specialists dedicated to improving patients' quality of life through effective pain management strategies and functional restoration.

Specialized Treatment Areas

column40: I've been going to Dr zong for years. I had really bad knees and I needed to work and I couldn't hardly sleep because of the pain. She got me through this episode One knee at a time. I had knee replacement surgery and the pain has improved. I have some other diagnosis that are painful but I'm barely on any pain medications now. I know many people abuse opioids but there is a place for them and I really appreciate her getting me through this painful part of my life and letting me have a better quality of life. I respect her and I would not ever went to abuse her willingness to help.|I have been seeing Dr. Zhong for more than 15 years and her insight to health and pain diagnosis is amazing.  A little over a year ago she diagnosed that I had spinal issues coming from my neck and ordered an MRI of my neck and brain...Results of the MRI of my neck revealed spinal stenosis (Narrowing of the spinal canal) which is why I was losing major strength in my legs !!  I had surgery to fix my neck and I am feeling much better and I am very grateful for all of Dr. Michelle Zhong's professional care and knowledge she provides me !!  Very blessed !!|Dr. Zhong is simply the best at what she does.  The other people giving her low reviews are simply pain med seekers.  As everyone knows, the government regulators are keeping a tight rein on pain medications, due to all the abuse.  Good luck finding someone who will prescribe opioids willy nilly.  I was a recovering cancer patient when I started with her.  They gave me really too many meds during my treatment.  Dr. Zhong has patiently and carefully gotten me to the point I need very little. Good luck if you decide to go there, they don't sound to cordial at all.|No stars deserved...arrived for my 2pm appointment at 1:45 to a locked door and no one to be seen at a reception desk...finally got let in right at 2pm to fill out standard paperwork for new patients...the "Dr" was the only one working the clinic who was running around back and forth with giving me paperwork and then back to her patient...2:40pm came around and very annoyed thinking I got forgotten in the lobby I stood up making noise to remind her I was there...she took me back to a room with no lights on, left the door open with a wonderful view of 20 plus piss samples on the back counter with a garbage can in the room that was overflowing....very frustrated at this point and slightly disgusted of my view I let 5 more mins go by until on the floor was a cockroach and that is when I decided to get up and leave without even being seen at all...DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS TERRIBLE PRACTICE|0 STARS DESERVED  WORST DOCTOR EVER takes your pain medicine away without telling you and when you try to tell her not to se tells you go somewhere else has no gauge at what she does calls people fat oh Beast and blames the pain on you as she takes more of your medicine away she didn't even want to give me my pain medicine this time around looking for a new doctor you should too very abusive oh and don't forget she's been reported if not busted for prescribing methadone at too high of rate

column2: Center for Pain Relief at UW Medical Center - Roosevelt
column3:
Center for Pain Relief at UW Medical Center - Roosevelt serves Seattle, Washington with comprehensive pain management services designed to help patients reclaim their quality of life. Located in the heart of Seattle's University District, this specialized center brings together a multidisciplinary team of pain medicine experts who understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's wellbeing. The center operates as part of the renowned UW Medicine network, ensuring patients receive evidence-based care backed by the latest research and medical advancements.

When ongoing pain prevents you from meeting your goals for a meaningful and productive life, it's time to speak with your usual care provider to see if a visit to the Center for Pain Relief would be helpful to you. The center diagnoses and treats complex and persistent pain resulting from a wide range of conditions, including:

  • Arthritis and rheumatologic disorders

  • Diabetes-related pain

  • Cancer pain

  • Neuropathy

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Chronic headaches

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Myofascial, visceral and pelvic pain

Multidisciplinary Approach

What sets the Center for Pain Relief apart is its comprehensive approach to pain management. Rather than simply masking symptoms, the medical team works to identify and address the underlying causes of pain while developing personalized treatment plans. Patients benefit from access to specialists in anesthesiology, neurology, psychiatry, physical therapy, and complementary medicine—all working together to provide integrated care.

Location and Contact Information

The Center for Pain Relief is conveniently located at 4225 Roosevelt Way NE, 4th Floor, Seattle, WA 98105. To schedule an appointment or learn more about services, patients can call +1 206-598-4282. Additional information is available on their website at www.uwmedicine.org/locations/center-for-pain-relief-uwmc-roosevelt.

As part of UW Medicine, the center maintains the highest standards of patient care while contributing to clinical research that advances the field of pain medicine. Patients can expect compassionate care in a supportive environment designed to help them develop effective strategies for managing pain and improving their overall quality of life.
column11:
When ongoing pain prevents you from meeting your goals for a meaningful and productive life, its time to speak with your usual care provider to see if a visit to the Center for Pain Relief at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt would be helpful to you.

We diagnose and treat complex and persistent pain resulting from a wide range of musculoskeletal and neurological pain conditions, including but not limited to arthritis and rheumatologic disorders; diabetes; cancer; neuropathy; surgery; chronic headaches; fibromyalgia; myofascial, visceral and pelvic pain.

column38: Eileen|Chad Melton|Carla Flue|Jim Cooley|Julia Gulia|shawna volley|Brianna|Astor Reinhardt
column40:
Dr. Wu is an exceptional pain doctor who I highly recommend!
Before seeing Dr. Wu, I was struggling with debilitating pain in my lower back. I had even seen a neurologist who dismissed my pain as muscular and suggested I buy a massaging tool! Thankfully, I was referred to the pain clinic at Roosevelt and saw Dr. Wu. Unlike the neurologist, Dr. Wu actually listened to my concerns and ordered imaging.  This led to the proper diagnosis of a cyst in my lumbar spine that was pinching a nerve.
Dr. Wu administered two steroid injections which significantly reduced my pain, and then he referred me to physical therapy. I'm incredibly grateful to him for his accurate diagnosis and effective treatment plan.
My only criticism is the requirement for a driver and someone to wait during the injections.  While I understand this protocol is necessary, it creates a significant barrier for patients like me who lack a support system. I hope the clinic can develop a solution for this issue in the future.
Despite this, I give Dr. Wu 5 stars. He's a skilled and compassionate physician who truly cares about his patients.|This place is an absolute joke. Months to get in for appointments and half the time they cancel them without warning. I had a procedure done at this clinic. I was supposed to have a 3 month follow up to then do another procedure. But it was cancelled without warning. My doctor left. They then rescheduled me, 4 months out. That appointment was cancelled without warning. Now, another 4 months before I can get back in. Rendering the first procedure worthless. This place is so disorganized it's incredible.|I went a few years ago and I have had this chronic pain since giving birth to my second son when they had difficulty placing the epidural. When I went to them they informed they do no medication for pain and I just needed to lose weight. Then I went to a spine Dr through the U and they also said if I lost weight it would help oh so much like being fat was my entire problem. Well guess what lost the weight 235 pounds down to 150 and I still struggle from the pain. I had to fight to try an injection which they finally gave believing it wouldn't help and it did. They are so consumed by looking at u and making assumptions that everything is about weight they do not look at the bigger picture. My spine dr at the U currently is alot better now that I'm a lower weight and that clearly was not the problem. This review is just to remind Dr's that losing weight doesn't always solve the problem and they need to look at the whole picture.|I thought this would be the place for supervised administration of opiates for pain relief even in this age of temperance, but I was told to try turmeric or acupuncture, despite a history of trying most everything else. THEY DON'T PRESCRIBE OPIATES, a medicine known to Hippocrates. This place is a mind-boggling example of humbuggery at its finest. Turmeric? It's almost impossible to believe the suggestion came from the mouth of someone with an MD.|Legit waiting for my appointment to start and don't even want to be here. Lack of communication as to when I was supposed to be there, causing me an hour of waiting for them to decide they're ready to see me. Navigating to get here is literally like just hope you get to the right place. Another place you're forced to pay to park at for your own Health. I'm ready to leave and the appointment hasn't even started. Also less than welcoming front desk staff what's the point. Seriously- thanks folks for making me feel extremely insignificant right away lol. I'm outta here.

Revised to 4 Stars:

Despite the confusing and frustrating beginning- the providers were very kind. But there needs to be a bit more clear communication for patients to understand and adjust accordingly.

-Paying to park for appointments really is a way to continue to run people dry and add extra financial burden to their appointments. Thus, making people not want to have appointments as much as they may need.
-The signage is extremely confusing between the two locations and hard to decipher. When I got into the elevator I couldn't even find a descriptor that said "Lobby" on a sign. You were apparently just supposed to know even though the 1 button has rubbed off so much you almost can't see it.
-Running a pain clinic does mean you deal with people in pain, which is why clear communication and also providing good customer service is important. Pain can make it even harder to keep every detail perfect and together- so the expectations for patients should be realistic in that regard- just as we try to have those realistic expectations for our providers. But I felt like a lot of detail was left out of what my expectations should be for arriving here at this clinic. They certainly don't make it easy to find.

As a person struggling with pain AND also working previously in healthcare, the "onboarding" experience of this clinic still needs work. There is nothing wrong with providing details- tell your patients what they need to know so they can have a smoother experience. As I said previously- the provider made the experience feel more worth it. But otherwise I would have not made my second appointment.|DO NOT SEE DR. POWELSON
A student performed the procedure with the Powelson in the room. When they started the procedure, I svresmed out in pain, because I could feel EVERYTHING. I literally had to ask for pain. It was extremely traumatic. Still having flashbacks.
SHE IS THE WORST!|Don't go here if you're overweight.  My appointment lasted around 50 minutes but the doctor was only in the room for the last 8-10 minutes.  First I met with the nurse.  Then I met with a student doctor, explained everything, she went to discuss with the doctor before Dr. Rana Al-Jumah finally came in.  Throughout the process I genuinly participated in the process.  I talked about what I've done to try to manage the pain, what movements cause the pain.  I answered all of their quesitons.  In the end the doctor told me I needed to exercise and lose weight.

She did not ask me what I do for exercise or if I exercise.

She did not ask me what efforts I make to lose weight.

She did not ask me how/if the pain impacts my ability to exercise.

She saw an overweight person and simply judged that the only answer was that I needed to lose weight.  She made no effort to actually evaluate what causes my pain.  I've never felt fat shamed by a doctor before this experience.  My experience with Dr. Rana Al-Jumah was one of the worst I've had with a medical provider and I will never go back to this clinic.

If the types of treatments this clinic provides wouldn't be a good fit for the type of pain I'm experiencing, she could have simply said that.  She isn't a PCP.  She isn't a wight management doctor.  She isn't a physical therapist.  She shouldn't give opinions about areas of healthcare she clearly knows nothing about.|Don't go here basically. I was recommended a spine specialist via my PCP. The spine specialist turned me to the pain clinic. I ended up getting Dr. Wu. He has to be one of the the WORST Doctor's I have ever had. He wasn't willing to do anything for me and actually made my pain worse because he kept poking my back where the pain was!

I decided to get a second opinion/new doctor there...well don't try doing that. They have to "send it to the higher up's" to get approved. When it finally DID get approved, I got a new appointment...4 months away. I'm in pain NOW.

I said to heck with the UW and looked for other options. Turns out CHI Franciscan has a Pain Management Clinic at St. Clare is Lakewood, WA. I got an appointment within a few weeks and I'm about to have my first steroid injection a month after my first appointment with them (that's more on my insurance then them.). The team was also VERY caring, great bedside manners, the doctor actually LISTENED to me!!!! Do you know how it felt finally having a doctor listen to me after getting the run around by UW doctors? I almost cried.

If I could give zero stars...I would.

column3:
Swedish/Edmonds Pain Treatment serves patients throughout Edmonds, Washington and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients experiencing acute and chronic pain conditions. As part of the renowned Swedish Medical Center network, we maintain the highest standards of medical excellence while providing personalized treatment plans tailored to each individual's needs.

At Swedish/Edmonds Pain Treatment, our multidisciplinary team utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative therapies to address various pain conditions. We offer interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy referrals, and integrative approaches to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. Our specialists are experienced in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndromes.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects every aspect of a person's life, which is why we take the time to listen to our patients' concerns and develop comprehensive treatment strategies. Our goal is not just to manage symptoms but to address underlying causes when possible and provide patients with the tools they need for long-term pain management. The clinic environment is designed to be welcoming and supportive, reducing anxiety associated with medical visits.

Location and Contact Information

Swedish/Edmonds Pain Treatment is conveniently located at 21601 76th Ave W, Edmonds, WA 98026, within the Edmonds Specialty Clinic on the Swedish Edmonds Campus. Our central location makes us accessible to patients throughout Snohomish County and north King County. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call +1 425-640-4740. Our website at swedish.org/locations/edmonds-campus/edmonds-specialty-clinic provides additional information about our facility and treatment options.

Insurance and Accessibility

We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to navigate coverage options for pain management services. Our facility is fully accessible, with ample parking available on the Swedish Edmonds campus. New patients are welcome, and referrals can be made through primary care physicians or specialists within the Swedish network.

At Anesis, we provide comprehensive care for individuals suffering from chronic pain. We offer a range of personalized treatment options, including interventional therapies, minimally invasive surgeries as well as medication management. column40:
Dr. Mitchell has been the best doctor I've been to. She actually listened to me, and is helping me. She hasn't been rude and dismissive to me like many other doctors I've seen since I got hit by a truck walking home from work. It's taken 14 years to find her. Looking forward to improving my quality of life with her.|My significant other got a referral from her PCP for this clinic and called to schedule an appt. The receptionist told her "after reviewing your charts, we are unable to help you and there is nothing we can do for you " SHE HAS NOT EVEN SEEN A DOCTOR AT THIS CLINIC!!! How can a place tell someone they can't help them without even an initial appt?!?!?!

Maybe it's due to the doctor who wrote the referral and left out pertinent info. But all I know is that she has multiple MRI scans, documented medical issues, etc. After a back injury left her with multiple slipped discs, severe cervical spine damage, right shin permanent tissue damage how can a clinic say they can't help her when she has never been seen by them before?????? She cannot even walk 20 feet without the use of crutches due to her pain!!! It is so bad that I have had to become her caregiver because she cannot fully take care of herself on a daily basis. This is absolutely mind boggling to me that they are so quick to deny someone any help without being seen first. I guess now all of the negative reviews for this place finally make sense.|This is not a pain clinic they don't do anything for you!!! I've been in excruciating pain for the last year and they have done nothing for me. And I have major back surgery in 2 days! No pain relief from them!!!!!|Worst pain doctor thinks he is the best is a surgical hack wants to make money on procedures and give out pills no alternative treatments no newer treatments .
Stay away he will hurt you then no medicine for your pain . He shouldn't be a pain doctor most unprofessional doctor I have dealt with.  Good read his health grades you would see or any of the doctor review sites has 2 stars and 30 to 50 complaints .
He hurt my friend that has real structural pain|Front desk staff is rude, theres signs all across the lobby saying they can refuse your treatment for any reason, and they signed me up for spam emails. I don't remember giving them permission to do that.

To top it all off they were very firm about how they would contact me when they had a care plan together for me, but that never happened. A full month of radio silence later and I had to call to find out they decided they can't help me. They won't tell me why. They claimed they sent a letter to my doctor, but my doctor never got it so... I just spent a month in debilitating pain for no reason. Thanks.

Find another clinic if you can. There's nothing for you here.|Dr. Burkey was extremely reluctant to clarify concerns and questions even though every person I interacted with directed me to him for concerns and questions. Odd right? According to him, asking questions and being concerned about conflicting information was "attacking" him. He was extremely condescending, gas lit me, and took no responsibility for lack of and false information. The only reason my husband and I stayed was because I'm in desperate pain and needed the possible help since I've waited 7 months. Felt extremely uncomfortable and broke down in tears before, during, and after the operation. My follow up is not even with him or anyone who was present during my two procedures. All I wanted to know was what the procedure was, how it would go, and what i could expect afterwards. The after care paperwork was changed after my first visit to reflect pertinent information that was missing, like how long it could actually take the operation to go into effect. Long story short, will never be seen my Dr. Burkey again and you shouldn't either.|This place is incredible! Everyone there is so nice and professional. Dr Bourke is heaven sent after talking with him on my first visit it was a breath of fresh air. He knew and understood what was happening to me unlike any other doctor me and my husband were so pleased who knew what he was talking about.. I've seen bad reviews but I can't see how those are true. They are all an amazing group of people to work with. Even the ladies who answer when you call they are so pleasant. I had a procedure and they were so empathetic and caring. Anesis deserves to get recognition for their incredible customer service. Thanks to everyone there for making it a pleasant experience.|Dr. Burkey has a very "holier-than-thou" disposition and his patient care is extremely unprofessional and uncaring... My mother is a pain medication dependant person due to inoperable fractures in her back. Dr. Burkey suggested a nerve stimulating implant that my mother declined because of numerous risks that DO NOT outweigh the possible benefit of surgery. She has been on the same low dose of medication for over 3 years and we have struggled the entire time to get her stable on that dose with her level of pain so she requested an increase and was then was emotionally degraded by Dr Burkey. He then said that maybe we should find someone else and I agreed, then he got up and walked out and was going to let her go through possibly deadly withdrawals without a new prescription. In the end he gave her a one month prescription and said "you have 28 days to find someone else".  Not the place you want to go if you want to be listened to and your needs taken into consideration without being treated like a less-than-human. If you don't want their surgery, prepare to eventually find someone else to help with your pain management. WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE WHILE HE IS THERE!
