I've been seeing Doctor Oh for a few years now and I just wanted to take the time and express my appreciation for him he has always listened to my concerns and problems and has helped me figure out the best way to treat my pain and I truly can't thank him and his staff enough they are amazing|Dr Oh has treated my fibromyalgia for the past 6 years. He has a truly knowledgeable, compassionate, bedside manner. He takes the time to listen to my concerns and continues to patiently work with me, which is rare in this day and age. He has made a positive difference in my continued journey to wellness.
His office has a clean, friendly, welcoming vibe. His receptionist always greets me with a smile and makes me feel valued as a patient. Another rare quality.
I'm fortunate my PCP recommended Kirkland Spine Care.|The Dr. Is ok but the front desk lady, "Prissy" is a vindictive snatch ! She's inept and refuses to take responsibility for her own mistakes. Mistakes that cause people a great deal of stress and complications. If you mention something she did incorrectly and ask for her help to fix it, she blacklists you and all  but cuts you off, Making it near impossible to see the Dr. This woman needs to be fired! Look at the other reviews, she sucks! Get rid of this liability Dr. Oh.!!!|I have been a patient of Dr. Oh for about four years now and can honestly say he is a life saver. A doctor that actually listens AND cares is hard to find, luckily Dr Oh is both compassionate and listens. Whenever there has been a billing issue the staff works with me until it's resolved. The negative reviews are surprising because I've had the exact opposite experiences for four years. Dr Oh is an expert on addiction and can tell the difference between pill seekers and people who suffer from real chronic pain.
I would give Dr Oh and staff 10 stars if possible|He's Amazing! he's been my doctor for years & he is always kind & caring, he goes above & beyond to help me with my complex health & pain concerns. Wait times are quick, easy to get an appointment & he educates his patients about pain management & other options for pain relief. Dr. Oh uses a compassionate approach to managing care. He also is extremely educated in addiction and provides an in depth understanding of how to manage pain in the most healthy way possible. He truly is a doctor who cares about his patients.  I am honestly very grateful to have found my way into his care. He wrote a fantastic book that teaches you so much, it is a must read called, "Why can't Johnny Just Quit" . I highly recommend Dr. Oh. Thank You Dr. Oh, Mrs. Oh & Priscy:)|I have seen Dr. Oh for 5 years now. He is absolutely the best doctor I have ever seen.

As a patient who has struggled with severe upper cervical spine and hip joint pain for many years I had a very hard time achieving stability through pain management.

Dr Oh is extremely educated in many areas. He has spent allot of time reviewing my CT's and MRI's. He takes extra time to explain everything that he sees. He is very thorough in his exams.

I was referred by my spine surgeon to
Dr. Oh after I went through upper cervical fission surgery and have had some progressive complications a few years after my surgery.

Dr. Oh uses a compassionate approach to managing care. He also is extremely educated in addiction and provides an in depth understanding of how to manage pain in the most healthy way possible.

He truly is a doctor who cares about his patients. If I could give 10 stars I would. He is definitely a five star "plus" doctor.

I am honestly very grateful to have found my way into his care.
I recommend Dr. Oh to everyone I come across that needs a Really good pain management doctor.

Thank you for all your hard work and compassionate care Dr. Oh.|I have not seen Dr. Oh in over 3 years (was a patient for several years - not a fan! He does not listen!)  Just got a bill for almost $300.00. This is the first time I have received this bill. His wife is in charge of running the office. What total incompetence to not realize that a patient owes money for 3 years. We had moved 2.5 years ago so they had wrong address. They sent bill to collections. We did have address forwarded for 1 yr so if they had sent a bill then I would have received.  I'm sure I'm not the only one this has happened to.|We need more physicians like Dr. Oh! He cares, listens but doesn't put up with any shenanigans. Mrs. Oh and Priscy keep the office running and I can tell you as someone who has been a patient since 1997, I have not always liked what I have heard and I am not the easiest patient either. I tend to over do things and then I pay for it. As far as the billing, take some personal responsibility. You should be monitoring your Explanation of Benefits (EOB), if you do not see the charges, call your insurance and the doctor you saw. We are all human and we make mistakes. Maybe the most recent card is not on file or an address or change has taken place. Dr. Oh has been a leader in reducing the amount of narcotics in our community and again personal responsibility plays a huge part. I am thankful for that!
Thank you Dr. Oh for all of the years of keeping me walking and moving upright, despite the surgeries, falls, and other traumas I have endured.

Swedish Functional Restoration Clinic - Seattle serves the greater Seattle, Washington area with comprehensive pain management and rehabilitation services. Located in the heart of the First Hill medical district, our multidisciplinary clinic specializes in helping patients with chronic pain conditions regain function and improve quality of life through evidence-based treatment approaches. Our team of board-certified physicians, physical therapists, psychologists, and pain specialists work collaboratively to develop personalized care plans that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain.

At Swedish Functional Restoration Clinic, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management solutions. Our functional restoration program takes a holistic approach to chronic pain, combining medical management, physical reconditioning, behavioral health support, and patient education. We specialize in treating complex pain conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and fibromyalgia.

Our Multidisciplinary Approach

What sets our clinic apart is our integrated team approach. Rather than focusing solely on pain reduction, we emphasize improving function and helping patients return to meaningful activities. Our comprehensive assessment process evaluates physical capabilities, psychological factors, and social considerations to create truly personalized treatment plans that address the whole person, not just the pain.

Location and Contact Information

The Swedish Functional Restoration Clinic is conveniently located on the Swedish First Hill Campus at 600 Broadway Suite 530, Seattle, WA 98122. Our central location provides easy access for patients throughout the Seattle metropolitan area. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (206) 386-2013 or visit our website at https://www.swedish.org/locations/first-hill-campus/pain-services-first-hill.

Spokane Pain Management Specialist serves Spokane Valley, WA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our physician-led clinic specializes in both traditional and osteopathic approaches to pain relief, offering personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. With a focus on whole-person care, our board-certified pain management doctor combines medical expertise with compassionate service to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

At our medical clinic, we offer a diverse range of treatment options tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our services include diagnostic evaluations, medication management, interventional procedures, and specialized osteopathic manipulative treatment (OMT). As an osteopath committed to excellence in pain medicine, our physician utilizes hands-on techniques to address musculoskeletal dysfunction, improve circulation, and enhance the body's natural healing abilities.

Specialized Osteopathic Approach

Osteopathic manipulation is a cornerstone of our practice, providing non-invasive relief for many pain conditions. This gentle yet effective manual therapy addresses structural imbalances that contribute to pain and dysfunction. Our osteopathic manipulative treatment protocols are designed to restore proper alignment, reduce muscle tension, and improve joint mobility without relying solely on medication or surgical interventions.

Conditions We Treat

Our pain management clinic specializes in treating a wide spectrum of painful conditions, including but not limited to:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Headaches and migraines

  • Sports injuries

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Fibromyalgia and chronic widespread pain

Patient-Centered Care

At Spokane Pain Management, we believe in creating collaborative relationships with our patients. Our approach emphasizes education, preventive strategies, and active participation in the healing process. We take time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment plans that align with your goals and lifestyle.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our chronic pain treatment options, please contact us:

Phone: +1 509-991-3054

Website: www.painmanagementdo.com

Address: 2310 Cherry St Suite 200, Spokane Valley, WA 99216, United States

Take the first step toward effective pain relief today by partnering with Spokane's trusted pain management specialist.

I've been seeing Dr Williams since the beginning of 2025, it's now the end of February. Let me just say, if you are considering a D.O., especially for pain management, he's the one to go to! It's totally different than anything you'll have experienced in the traditional medical field. If you've had any experience with subtle energy, this is what you'll experience with him. He most definitely has a deep innate healing ability, and though we all have this ability on some level, Dr Williams' is very fine-tuned.

For me it's like a meditative and quiet time where my body is given the opportunity to fully relax. Most of my pain is tension related, which I feel may be most other's pain, too. Fangfang Xing, M.D. serves the Seattle, Washington area as a distinguished pain medicine specialist committed to providing personalized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. As part of Swedish Comprehensive Pain Services, Dr. Xing has established himself as a leading expert in his field, having been recognized by Seattle Met Magazine as a Top Doctor in Pain Medicine. His approach centers on the belief that each patient deserves individualized attention to develop the highest quality treatment plan tailored to their specific needs and circumstances.

His exceptional qualifications include double board certification in both pain medicine and anesthesiology, demonstrating his comprehensive understanding of pain management techniques and protocols. This dual specialization allows him to approach pain treatment from multiple perspectives, offering patients more comprehensive care options.

Treatment Philosophy

At the core of Dr. Xing's practice is a commitment to using the best of modern medicine to improve his patients' quality of life, well-being, and functioning. He understands that chronic pain affects not just the physical body but impacts every aspect of a person's life. Through careful evaluation and personalized treatment plans, Dr. Xing works to address both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain, helping patients regain control and improve their daily functioning.

Services and Specialties

Working within Swedish Comprehensive Pain Services, Dr. Xing offers access to a full spectrum of pain management techniques and treatments. His approach combines evidence-based medical interventions with a compassionate understanding of each patient's unique circumstances. This comprehensive methodology ensures that patients receive care that addresses their specific pain conditions while considering their overall health and wellness goals.

Wonderful Doctor excellent in his field of Medicine although I just started to take visit and take in the pain manage program he offers at Swedish i can see the dynamic each time I have a schedule visit Dr.Fangfang Zing made me realize that it truly does take village to help everyone get through their lives with the program. Thank you Swedish Pain Management.|Dr. Xing truly  cares about getting you to a comfortable  place with his pain management treatments. He possesses a gentle bedside manner and his staff are wonderful. I feel so much better now and it has taken me years to get here. Wish I'd found him sooner! Highly recommended.|I've had three doctors -two in Seattle and one outside the US- provide pain care of this nature, and Dr. Xing has provided the best communication and most thorough care. I couldn't be more pleased with the team!|Nice enough Dr but I don't want anyone to run into the issue I did.

DR XING DOES NOT DO SCANS OR PHYSICAL EXAMS TO DIAGNOSE YOU. HE WILL ONLY ASK YOU QUESTIONS AND MAKE DIAGNOSIS BASED ON WORDS ONLY.

DR XING ALSO DOES NOT PROVIDE ANY PAIN MEDICATION, EVEN IF YOU HAVE A SEVERE INJURY (RAN OVER BY CAR, BROKEN BACK, ETC)

DR XING ONLY DIAGNOSIS CHRONIC PAIN WITH MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES. IF YOU HAVE CHRONIC PAIN, IT IS 100% A MENTAL HEALTH ILLNESS AND NOT AN INJURY.

DR XING ONLY WORKS WITH PHYSICAL THERAPY AND MENTAL HEALTH. HE HAS REPEATEDLY TOLD ME THAT IS THE ONLY THING HE OFFERS PATIENTS.

If all of this sounds good to you, you will be in AMAZING hands. If you feel your pain is do to MENTAL illness you will absolutely get relief from his restoration program. I plan to return to the program after I get my broken back fixed with actual surgery, brace, etc. I currently have no feeling in my legs now and am in a wheelchair. My husband poked my leg with needle, without my knowledge and told me 5 minutes later. My Spine is also swollen, red and scanned in at 104.3 on thermometer on the spot. I have red lines running down the back of my legs and my labs are now showing infection. I've now chosen to go out of state to find a professional to finally take xrays or MRI of my back.

I am truly hoping I am not permanently paralyzed.|Great doctor. Bad office - the telephone message said that there was only one person in front of me - I gave up holding after 25 minutes.|||

column3:
The Everett Clinic Comprehensive Pain Center in Everett, Washington offers specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located at 4027 Hoyt Ave in Everett, WA 98201, our multidisciplinary team provides evidence-based treatments designed to improve quality of life and functionality for those experiencing persistent pain. We combine medical expertise with compassionate care to develop personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs.

At The Everett Clinic Comprehensive Pain Center, we utilize a holistic approach to pain management that may include medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. Our specialists are trained in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and arthritis-related discomfort.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in collaborative care that empowers patients to take an active role in their pain management journey. Rather than focusing solely on pain elimination, our team works with patients to develop realistic goals for improving function and quality of life. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the physical, emotional, and social aspects of chronic pain.

Facility and Accessibility

Our center is conveniently located in downtown Everett with modern facilities designed for patient comfort. We offer coordinated care with other specialties within The Everett Clinic network, ensuring seamless communication between your healthcare providers.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 425-304-8476. You can also visit our website at https://www.everettclinic.com/medical-departments/comprehensive-pain-center for additional information about our treatments and providers.
column38: Austin H|Monica Nohava|Kristin M (Kristin in Seattle)|Diana Al-Hamdany|Leslie lei Mafia City|Emerald Green|Larry Richardson|Color Me Zebra
column40:
I am a cancer patient I've had many major surgeries. Liver, Colon, intestines basically everything in my stomach has been either removed or stitched back together. The person I saw at this clinic a few time ignored every problem I have. She has no understanding or care of what I've been through she doesn't even care enough to know my age she thinks I'm 28. Replacing my pain meds with anti psychotics then when surprisingly they have no effect she says drug use is highly encouraged. This is absolutely insane to be treated with such abuse.|The only reason I am giving it 1 star is because the receptionist and nurse where kind. I went there today because I have been in all over excruciating pain for 6 years with no answers. Kriti didn't listen she was cutting me off constantly. I was sharing how I was in pain 15 years when pregnant with my twins when I explained the care I was given the look on her face was confused. I was crying and upset and she told me I was depressed and need a mood stabilizer after she told me that my pain was nothing special and that treating pain was her "bread and butter." She suggested meds that I have already taken others in the same class and the side effects are horrible. Oh physical therapy how is that possible when I can barely get out of bed..tells me I rate high on there 5 question depression sheet. YES I am because of pain!!!! She wasn't the least bit compassionate or sincere. I was another "bread and butter" patient. That she thought she was going to manage the symptoms but never get to the source. She also made it very clear that narcotic drugs don't help long term. Well duh..I worked addiction recovery and I wasn't asking for them!!! Another stigma in this world. I have sufferred for years because this has happened so many times I quit reaching out for help. I stood up and told her I was done and her bedside manner was the worst I have ever encountered, and walked out. If you are not typical patient and understand this is not a healing system but a medical system that doesn't want to get to the cause because as soon as she deals with the cause her "bread and butter" would be gone. I feel sorry that my insurance companies have to pay for a sorry excuse called care. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME.|If I could give her a ZERO I would! One of the v worst providers that I have seen! Kind of goes hand and hand with the Everett Clinic!  She told me that I didn't have the pain that I said that I did although I ended up having a neck operation as well as a shoulder/bicep repair as the result of ONE accident! When the Everett Clinic was bought out by Davita in 2015 the care of the patients was forgotten. I was on a merry -go-around with I believe 13 different doctors because one doctor said one thing and another said something else. My primary doctor cared and tried but said "I can't overrule another doctor".
The writing was on the wall in the MRI of my shoulder and of my neck courtesy of the EVERETT CLINIC.  And I was passed around like cattle. It took over 2 years before I was fixed and it was fixed OUTSIDE of the Everett Clinic. I about had a nervous breakdown because of the pain. I expected her to actually treat me lolol silly me ! I have wrote letters and have made numerous calls regarding the level of care. But this provider could have and should have eased my pain!

I see the EVERETT CLINIC sold again recently, I can't imagine why??!!!
The clinic USED to be one of the best in the country. I have been a patient there my entire life so I know what I am talking about. All it has become now is Cha Ching! " Give me your money and I'm sending you to another specialist to get even more money" seems to be their motto.  I would suggest anyone who has a real problem to look at their reviews especially when you start being sent to one doctor after another. They are rated an F with the BBB for a reason.|Concerned with the direction this clinic is taking since I've received a new pain management doctor. After having pain for over 20 years and medication in being told I only have arthritis and don't have pain.

Is this the  everett clinics way of getting rid of pain management patients. If so please just be upfront about it and not insult people.|STAY AWAY , don't think of going to see her or anyone at this clinic.  If you have legitimate and with proof of medical physical issues, they will genuinely accuse you of needing mental health help. They accuse you of it being in your head.  "0" compassion, even if your suffering from allot of pain.|My neck pain was relieved after an injection at this pain center. The doctor and staff were kind, patient, and did a great job.|Not a good choice. Over loaded . Under staffed . 10 minutes on hold . No help. If you have serious health problem do not expect much more than a bandaid. Motherinlaws pain grew to the size of a basketball till they could figure out it was a cancer tumur.|Erin was great at helping me manage my pain.  Too bad that the clinic closed and she moved.  I wish her all the best.

Spine Team Spokane serves patients throughout Spokane Valley, WA and the surrounding communities with exceptional interventional pain management services. Founded by Dr. Timothy D. Dibble, MD (also known as T. Daniel Dibble, MD), this specialized medical practice focuses on comprehensive spine care and pain relief solutions. Dr. Dibble brings his extensive expertise as a board-certified physician in both pain medicine and anesthesiology to provide targeted treatments for patients suffering from acute and chronic spinal conditions.

At Spine Team Spokane, Dr. Dibble employs advanced interventional diagnostics and therapeutic techniques to address a wide range of spinal issues. His approach combines careful assessment with minimally invasive procedures designed to identify pain sources and deliver precise treatment. Patients benefit from his specialized knowledge in interventional spine medicine, which offers alternatives to traditional surgical approaches when appropriate.

Services and Expertise

Dr. Dibble's practice encompasses comprehensive care for conditions including herniated discs, spinal stenosis, facet joint syndrome, sciatica, and complex regional pain syndromes. Treatment options may include epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other targeted interventional procedures. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and conditions of individual patients.

Patient-Centered Approach

The team at Spine Team Spokane prioritizes patient education and collaborative care. Dr. Dibble works closely with each patient to develop appropriate treatment strategies that align with their goals and lifestyle needs. This patient-centered philosophy ensures that individuals receive not only expert medical care but also the support and information needed to participate actively in their recovery process.

Location and Contact Information

Spine Team Spokane is conveniently located at 1123 N Evergreen Rd, Spokane Valley, WA 99216, United States. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Dibble or learn more about available treatment options, patients can call +1 509-363-3100. The practice welcomes referrals from primary care physicians and specialists throughout the greater Spokane region.
column11: T. Daniel Dibble, MD, is an interventional spine/pain medicine physician specializing in interventional diagnostics and therapeutics for both acute and chronic conditions of the spine. He is board-certified in the specialties of pain medicine and anesthesiology. He is the founder of Spine Team Spokane.

column3:
The Everett Clinic in Everett, Washington has been a cornerstone of healthcare excellence in the Pacific Northwest since 1924. As part of Optum, this nationally-recognized physician group has built its reputation on delivering exceptional medical care while maintaining a commitment to cost-effective healthcare solutions. Under the guidance of physicians like Dr. Kriti Srivastava, MD, the clinic continues its long-standing tradition of patient-centered care that has served the community for nearly a century.

With 31 care sites strategically located throughout Pierce, Skagit, Snohomish, and King Counties, The Everett Clinic provides accessible healthcare to more than 342,000 patients across the region. The organization employs approximately 2,600 dedicated teammates, including over 600 specialty and primary care providers who work collaboratively to address the diverse medical needs of their patient population.

Expert Medical Care

Dr. Kriti Srivastava represents the high caliber of medical professionals practicing at The Everett Clinic. Patients seeking care from Dr. Srivastava can expect the same commitment to excellence that has defined the clinic for generations. Her practice embodies the clinic's philosophy of combining cutting-edge medical expertise with compassionate patient care.

Convenient Location and Access

The main Everett location at 4027 Hoyt Ave, Everett, WA 98201 serves as a central hub for medical services in Snohomish County. Patients can easily schedule appointments by calling +1 425-259-0966 or visiting the clinic's website. For more information about Dr. Srivastava's practice specifically, patients can visit her provider profile on the clinic's website.

Legacy of Excellence

Since its founding in 1924, The Everett Clinic has evolved into one of the region's most respected healthcare institutions. Now as part of Optum, the clinic leverages additional resources and expertise to further enhance patient care while maintaining its community-focused approach. This unique combination of local dedication and national resources positions The Everett Clinic as a leader in modern healthcare delivery.
column11: Founded in 1924, The Everett Clinic, part of Optum, is a nationally-recognized physician group known for providing high-quality health care services while lowering the overall cost of care. column2: Electrodiagnosis & Musculoskeletal Associates (EMA) of Puget Sound - Tacoma
column3:
Electrodiagnosis & Musculoskeletal Associates (EMA) of Puget Sound - Tacoma has been a cornerstone of specialized neurological and musculoskeletal care in the greater Tacoma, Washington area since the 1980s. Now entering its fourth decade of service, EMA has established itself as a premier medical practice dedicated to diagnosing and treating complex nerve and muscle conditions that impact patients' daily lives. Our state-of-the-art facility combines advanced diagnostic technology with personalized treatment approaches to address conditions ranging from peripheral neuropathy to complex neuromuscular disorders.

Our team of highly qualified and compassionate physicians brings decades of collective experience in evaluating and treating patients suffering from muscle and nerve dysfunction. These conditions often manifest as weakness, muscle atrophy, fatigability, pain, numbness, and/or tingling sensations that can significantly impact quality of life. Through comprehensive electrodiagnostic testing and clinical evaluation, we identify the root causes of these symptoms and develop targeted treatment plans.

Comprehensive Care Approach

At EMA Puget Sound, we pride ourselves on our thorough understanding of both musculoskeletal and neurological disorders. Our physicians are specially trained to recognize the intricate connections between the nervous system and musculoskeletal function, allowing for more accurate diagnoses and effective treatment strategies. Every treatment plan is customized with the ultimate goal of maximizing function and enhancing our patients' quality of life.

Contact Information

We welcome new patients at our conveniently located Tacoma office. For appointments or inquiries, please contact us at +1 253-272-9994. Our practice is located at 3315 S 23rd St #200, Tacoma, WA 98405. For additional information about our services and physicians, visit our website at www.emapugetsound.com.
column9: Pain management physician|Physiatrist|Sports medicine clinic|Sports medicine physician
column11: Welcome to EMA Puget Sound, now into its fourth decade. Our highly qualified & compassionate physicians have been successfully treating patients suffering from muscle & nerve dysfunction that can cause weakness, muscle atrophy, fatigability, pain, numbness and/or tingling. We are knowledgeable in evaluating & treating a vast array of musculoskeletal & neurological disorders, with the goal of maximizing function and quality of life.

column40:
Zero compassion. As another person mentioned. Billing is whack. Sent an invoice for $36 that was covered by insurance. EMA is now claiming $360 and submitted to Collection Agency. I called to try to discuss and was told to call the collection agency. If you are going to get persuaded out having surgery you better not still become a long term pain of mine... thanks for nothing EMA.|First of all, the doctor was excellent.  However, I called 10-12 times, left a message to see if LNI was approved, and Never received a call back...  I went in 1 1/2 hours early. The receptionist called the main office and found out 20 minutes later that I was approved.
This is a serious problem.  They also bill for a No-Show even when they don't answer their phones or return calls|Dr. Kashif Saeed is an outstanding physician who has made a life-changing difference in my journey with back pain. At Electrodiagnosis and Musculoskeletal Associates of Puget Sound, his expertise and compassionate care stood out from the moment I walked into the clinic.

Dr. Saeed has treated my back pain with steroid injections and ablation therapy. His approach was thorough--he took the time to explain each step of the treatment, answer my questions, and ensure I felt confident and comfortable before, during and after treatments.

The treatments reduced my pain and improved my quality of life. Dr. Saeed's precision and dedication to his patients are remarkable. It's clear that he is not only highly skilled but also genuinely cares about helping people regain their mobility and live pain-free.

Each visit to the clinic my experiences with their entire team have always been professional, kind, and efficient. Appointments were easy to schedule, and the environment was welcoming and supportive. If you're dealing with chronic pain and seeking a knowledgeable and compassionate provider, I highly recommend Dr. Kashif Saeed and his team.

Thank you, Dr. Saeed!|Don't get me wrong, the Dr. Was Excellent. It was for the receptionists that this review is poorly rated. The first thing I noticed is that the waiting room had old delapitated furniture and there was a lot of giggling behind the counter. I was properly greeted and given direction on how to use the code for the restroom. On my return, I noticed that the waiting room was pretty full. Now, after I had been sitting in the waiting room for 42 minutes-one of the receptionists called my first name and said "the Dr. Is running behind and the people next to you will be going next so if you want to reschedule you can."

First, I took off work so I could be seen which means unlike her in her customer service based position, I was not getting paid to wait. I should not out of courtesy had to wait 45 minutes to find out that I was possibly going to have to reschedule, and if I was seen today that I would be thrust into rush hour traffic for my 45 minute drive home.

More giggling and then the antics (the heavyset blonde- peeking over her monitor & quietly whispering amongst mainly her and 1 other receptionist, along with sideways glances followed by more giggling until the blonde gal finally turned off her computer and left for home.

At that time all was quiet but it was too late to salvage any attempts at respectable relations apparently because when I went to the counter to make my follow up appointment, the 2nd receptionist (heavyset Spanish gal) started to come to the counter and then took 2 steps in reverse, smiling with her head down. So subsequently the main receptionist (dark skin h/w/p gal whom had also helped me with the bathroom code earlier) helped to scheduled my next visit at their other location (thank goodness).

It was unfortunately not the only instance in witness of this poor receptionist behavior, my prior visit with my boyfriend whom was in attendance with me weeks before truly left a bitter impression for him as well.

The reception staff should be trained that the patients are not there for their amusement and should be treated with the utmost respect because YOUR BUSINESS DEPENDS ON IT.

I just left feeling disappointed, hurt, and bullied. It's your decision if you want to go here, best of luck.|They refuse to bill my insurance even though it's one of the excepted ones. Not to mention I was told by someone there that no surgeon would touch my injury & a second opinion resulted in a much needed surgery 2 months later. I'd skip this place if you can.|After first visit I was extremely disappointed. After being in pain for 8yrs with chronic pain from Fibromyalgia the only options I was given where aids that where going to cost me out of pocket which I cannot afford. And physical therapy which at 3 days a week is unrealistic for me. (I've gone over this with my pcp) After 3 years of fighting for a Pain Management Referral I had sought out a clinic that offered many different options for pain and was hopeful..... after, I see now and am understanding more and more why people simply give up and turn to allocate drugs. I've never once been prescribed opioids for my Fibromyalgia however I wouldn't be opposed if It meant I could stand longer than 20min at a time. However much like everwhere else they would much rather put you on Gabapentin and misuse it as a pain reliever when it is not. I'm already on extremely high doses. I was expecting a combination of medications and injections just to start to get me to where I can begin getting better and move twords physical therapy. You have to walk before your expected to run. But I'm simply exhausted telling Doctors my body hurts all over and being told sorry.... Basically it's up to your own will power to make your body move and work through the pain, which after 8yrs I have non left. I can't push myself through my most painful days anymore. It took me years to get this far downhill and it's going to take me time to get better.  I wouldn't recommend this place if you have Fibromyalgia. Their solution will be physical therapy & Gabapentin(both of which can be done through your PCP). Save yourself the heartache thinking you will get any relief or help and look elsewhere.|The reason for 3 stars is because customer service is awful. They never answer the phone. They rarely return calls when I leave voicemail messages. Big receptionist with blond streak is horrid and rude. I stepped in front of her and stated my name and doctor I was scheduled to see. She turned to her computer, looking at it for a long time. I thought she was looking at the schedule and almost asked if there was mixup or problem when she picks up her phone and starts to make phone calls. The other other receptionist looks at me then asks the blonde if she was  helping me. Her response was no, I thought you were. If the blonde doesn't want to receive or help clients then she should get another job, she is unprofessional and surly. Dr. Mordus and assistant Kylie are both pleasant.|I am so glad I chose to come here instead of the place I was originally referred to. They had horrible reviews so there was no way I was going there. EMA was so great, everyone was super nice. I ended up being 30 mins late for my appt and they still saw me, and their attitude didn't change towards me like other places I've been. (I'm never on time to anything no matter how hard I try) the actual appt was very quick. The doctor was knowledgeable, proficient, and made the nerve test itself tolerable. I'd definitely recommend EMA to anyone needing these kinds of services.

column2: WaPASS | Washington Pain and Spine Specialists
column3:
WaPASS | Washington Pain and Spine Specialists serves Everett, Washington and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management solutions. Our dedicated medical facility has established itself as a premier destination for patients seeking relief from debilitating pain conditions. At Washington Pain and Spine, we combine advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment protocols to address the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms. Our board-certified physicians bring decades of collective experience in pain medicine, physical rehabilitation, and minimally invasive interventional procedures.

Our practice offers a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment, recognizing that each patient's experience with pain is unique. We specialize in treating various conditions including chronic back and neck pain, sciatica, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Through careful evaluation and personalized care plans, we help patients regain functionality and improve their quality of life.

Advanced Treatment Options

Washington Pain and Spine Specialists utilizes cutting-edge technologies and evidence-based interventions including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Joint injections and nerve blocks

  • Minimally invasive spine procedures

Patient-Centered Approach

What truly sets us apart is our commitment to compassionate, patient-focused care. We take the time to listen to our patients, understand their concerns, and develop treatment strategies that align with their goals and lifestyle needs. Our team works collaboratively to ensure comprehensive care coordination and optimal outcomes.

Visit Our Everett Location

Located at 3305 Nassau St, Everett, WA 98201, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technologies. We welcome new patients and referrals from throughout Snohomish County and the greater Seattle metropolitan area.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 206-895-1825 or visit our website at washingtonpainandspine.com. Take the first step toward reclaiming your life from pain with Washington Pain and Spine Specialists.
column11: At Washington Pain and Spine, we specialize in providing compassionate, state-of-the-art care for individuals dealing with acute and chronic pain. Whether you're seeking relief from back pain, joint discomfort, or nerve-related conditions, we offer a range of services, including interventional pain management, physical therapy, and advanced minimally invasive procedures. Visit us to reclaim your quality of life with personalized, patient-focused care.

Fernandez, MD, our specialized clinic focuses on treating chronic and acute pain conditions through innovative, evidence-based approaches. Located conveniently in west Spokane, we've built our reputation on combining compassionate care with advanced medical techniques to help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life.

Our Approach to Patient Care

Contact Information

column3:
Shingles Nerve Pain Study in Bellevue, Washington offers specialized clinical research opportunities for individuals suffering from post-herpetic neuralgia and shingles-related nerve pain. Located in the heart of the Eastside tech corridor, our research facility brings cutting-edge medical studies to the greater Seattle metropolitan area, providing participants with access to potentially groundbreaking treatments before they become widely available.

Our dedicated team of medical researchers and healthcare professionals specializes in evaluating innovative therapies designed to address the debilitating nerve pain that often follows shingles outbreaks. Post-herpetic neuralgia can persist for months or even years after the initial rash has healed, significantly impacting quality of life. Through our carefully monitored clinical trials, we aim to advance medical understanding of these conditions while offering participants potential relief and contributing to the development of more effective treatments.

Participation Benefits and Eligibility

Study participants typically receive comprehensive medical evaluations, access to investigational treatments at no cost, and compensation for their time and travel. Our screening process ensures that only suitable candidates who meet specific criteria are enrolled, maximizing both safety and the potential for meaningful research outcomes. If you or someone you know suffers from persistent nerve pain following a shingles outbreak, contact our research coordinators to learn more about current enrollment opportunities.

Contact Information and Location

To inquire about participation in our shingles nerve pain studies, call +1 877-453-0404 to speak with a research coordinator. Our facility is conveniently located at 1951 152nd Pl NE #200, Bellevue, WA 98007, with ample parking and accessibility features. We serve patients throughout King County and the greater Puget Sound region, offering flexible scheduling options to accommodate diverse needs.

Swedish Pain Services - Issaquah provides comprehensive pain management solutions for residents throughout Issaquah, Washington and surrounding King County communities. Located on the Swedish Issaquah Campus, our specialized clinic combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients experiencing chronic, acute, and post-surgical pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary team of board-certified physicians, pain specialists, and support staff work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

At Swedish Pain Services, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional approaches to pain management. Our treatments include nerve blocks, epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, medication management, and integrative therapies. We specialize in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, cancer-related pain, and post-surgical pain.

column38: kassandra stocker|Derek Bird|Rachelle Molnar|Shelley Hansen|Shannon Meek|Cal McDonald, P.I.|k c|Joanne Malpica
column40:
Dr Yu was about the worst. And the clinic manager is impossible to get a hold of, never returning phonw calls. When you do finally get ahold of her she doesn't keep to her word. As a CRPS patient I should be able to trust and communicate with my doctors and that is not the case with this office staff. After years of trying to be heard I mentioned going else where and I was immediately discharged with no back up plan for my chronic pain management.  You would think people in this field of work would have a little more compassion and imo this office is just there to make their money and go home. They do not care about what's going on with their patients at all.|"Dr" Yu is the WORST doctor I have ever seen in my life. He is rude, arrogant, and has the worst bed side manners. At one visit he said that's the medicine your taking and don't talk to me about it again. I couldn't believe it. He literally could care less about his patients. He also has the personality of a rock. STAY AWAY AT ALL COST. I will be filing a formal complaint at the hospital he works at.|After 40 years of lower lumbar surgery and the chronic pain associated with scoliosis surgery I was referred to Dr Yu. For pain management. The visit was like any other and he indicated that I would require and injection in my lower spin to help ease the multiple compound fractures and bones spurs I acquired over the years. He said I'd need an MRI /CT Scan to see if my spine is even supported from the broken hardware. A few days later I called to make those appointments come to find out he never put the order in for the spinal injection or the MRI /CT Scan. How does this happen? Seriously all my specialist are at Swedish and this is the first I have questions about. SMH|Dr Yu should not be in pain management. he is rude and can't wait to be done with your appointment. I just recently asked him to take me off of the fentynal patch and try something else. So he puts me on. 5 mg of oxycodone 4 times a day. It's nowhere near the pain relief I used to get and need. But he doesn't care. He doesn't want to listen to you . He actually told me that the reason he lowered the amount was because I was recently diagnosed with fibermyalgia and that pain medications don't work for that. Is this guy a complete sumbass??? Does he forget that I've been seeing him for 6 years now for lower back pain and we have discussed a spine stimulator. And he forgets about my neck and shoulder pain and the fact that I need another siak removed at some point. So both of these are pre-oexisting issues and have nothing to do with fibermyalgia he doesn't lay in bed most days and stare at the wall crying ,..............,,|Dr. Glen David and his team are excellent. They are competent, compassionate, polite and have consistently listened to my concerns. They have addressed any questions I have with clear explanations.|This facility is an inappropriate location to seek care for management of your severe pain.

You will immediately be treated as a drug addict, your objective medical history will utterly be disregarded, and your doctor's word is law- they do not allow you to see another provider if you didn't gel with the first one.

The staff, from doctors to nurses act with impunity to the point it is absolutely outrageous. I've never been talked to like that in my adult lifetime. It seems they've learned they can get away with anything (behavior that would get any other medical professional fired or lose their license) because any complaints or malpractice committed by this staff is instantly disregarded as "drug seeking behavior", when perhaps you were merely seeking the tools to deliver your life back to you, or perhaps just trying to better understand about what all of your options may be.

These people just don't get it, and I cry when I think about the incalculable amount of pain and suffering wrongly endured by those that have walked in, and back out, of these doors without answers or relief. But hey, if you want a lidocaine injection to take care of your pain for about an hour or two, feel free to book an appointment here (6 weeks out from now), and get ready to sit in their waiting room for several hours while they scrutinize your urine before they even allow you to talk with a provider.|The staff is friendly and efficient. It's quiet, pretty setting.  Dr Yu is helpful thinking of what's best for me.
I found the best way to reach them is through MyChart. Thank you! HOPE IT Helps.|I have called numerous times and have not heard from them at all not even a call back

column38: Steven Watts|Marlena Meyer|Bill and Carol Fairey|Bondesson Estate|Amy Smith|leslie gring|kelly bailey|Sheri Gerritsen
column40:
I have visited Dr. McQueen several times over the past few years and find his specialized medical experience, demeanor and personalized medical guidance to be rated as excellent.  He has been attentive to my unique medical needs and has performed several procedures as a result of his diagnosed medial plan.  Additionally, his workplace is also very professional.  Office, nursing and surgical staff go out of their way to enhance the Doctor/patient experience.  I would therefore  highly recommend Dr. Carlton McQueen to those seeking specialized medical care.|I was referred to Dr. McQueen from Seattle Spine sports medicine regarding my neck for a related-work injury. I received a TPI medication injection used with an Ultra sound. Dr. McQueen hit the spot on both my shoulders. I do have multiple injuries besides my neck. My shoulder's relaxed and gave me relief for my neck and shoulder pain. However, I still do have neck issues and my shoulder pain is up and down. I would go back again.|After treating me for one year it was concluded I was a candidate for a spinal cord stimulator.  Dr. McQueens assistant encouraged me to call United Healcare to speeed their approval.  After having done so two days later I received a call from Tom, asking me where I want my medical records sent.  I am not a mal conent patient or complainer,  I never got an explanation from Fourth Corners as to why they wanted to get rid of me.  Office politics may have had something to do with it.  I will never know.|This place is a extremely unprofessional and has absolutely no regard for patient care or well being. My mother was yo yo'ed between Dr McQueen and the surgeon across the way whom promised new, helpful procedures to relieve her pain, but instead sent her home in tears multiple times. The surgeon told my mother that he got a higher education so that he wouldn't have to work hard like she does and that was basically his word of advice.
Now for Dr McQueen... this @sshole not only sent my mom home in tears because of inflicted pain with difficult injections, but then had her make an appointment to discuss another optional treatment to help relieve her major pain in which he reveals there is NOTHING more he can do to help her!!! Not only did he get her hopes up, waist her time and money, but then tells her he will not sign any paper work for her to ease up on work duties, etc because he doesn't want to get caught up in filling out paperwork which doesn't make him any money!!!!
Who says that??!? Isn't it part of your job as a physician to do both clinical and documentation work?!? Absolutely disgusted!!!! What a complete penny pinching butcher shop!!!!||||

column40:
I've seen many specialists in pain management and ortho surgery and this is one of the most straightforward facilities I've encountered. Disabling sciatic pain/numbness from disc herniation over a year means you want someone to go straight to what works instead of going through hoops and hurdles. Dr. McGuire did just that and was as direct as could be. No sugar coating anything. No fake pity party. Options laid out clearly and a step plan made for options at first appointment. Just straight to what needed to be done and got it done right. The injection he performed was much more effective than the first one I had at a different facility.|Went in for pain management and left my appointment with Dr. Olsen feeling very alone and unheard. Absolutely zero medication to help. This office only wants to do injections. I was told when I got there it was only interventional treatment. Don't waste your time. Particularly Dr. Olsen.|I was referred to Dr. Olssen by my PCP. Had an appointment with him on Dec 29.  In the meantime, I had a second, botched back surgery, and he told me I was prescribed a medication that was not acceptable while on pain mgt so he refused to treat me until I saw my Dr again. Months went by, some follow ups later, pain mgt office contacted me to schedule another appointment, weeks later, not with Olssen. At that appointment, the dr got a is,sent message to my PCP to refill pain meds for 2wks, and scheduled another appointment for 2wks out. Waited in endurance what seemed like forever for this, we'll see what happens next.|I was referred to Dr Olsson by a internist that practices in the office that I saw my doc to whom left suddenly. When my doctor disappeared I found it a monthly
Challenge to refill the medications that I need to be able to comfortable enough to move, I catered to there wishes of taking all the meds that helped me get thru and move.when I asked for replacement.  meds I was ignored.I get to doctor olsson and on my 1st appt, he told me in a abrasive voice I had a mental issue, I asure you I do not furthermore Not sure of his degree.Then he said he wanted xrays to see if I have arthur!! All this info along with 7 Maris are in my file and he obviously had spent zero time looking at my records. I well add cost me thousands as I did not want to live in pain and had done every thing in my power to get out of it
his bedside manner was horrific.Chi has cared for my conditions for many years. Trusting I would be cared for I put my thoughts aside and continued on to the pain center.
Nxt appt was seen by a Dr McCarthy whom informed me olsson was going to lower my dose 20%note its been several months that any doctor asked about my pain levels ect. And I stayed quiet because I knew they did not care to deal with CHRONIC PAIN.MEDICATIONS.
I made my appt for .november and it was moved too dec, so when I had to call for my refill meds...as crazy as it is I was as used of cancelling my Nov appt and he would not refill my medication. I broke down and told the nurse it was against FDA RULES to do such to anyone. So then he agreed if I came in for a UA. He'd fill my meds.I gladly did so. He called my meds in telling me to take 20 tablets every four hours of course it wasn't filled after many calls to his office he called my meds in but took 100
Tablets away 85%. I will contact chi franscan about my experience
When I called about my meds not being right Dr Olsson came back with I had Meth in my body!!! Absolutely not possible 11years of clear UA reports I don't take
Street drugs never have never will
I've spent days in my bed sick and in pain. Also my UA was not done by protocol as a matter of FA CT. My insurance never was billed by the company my lab never went too!! Was sent a FAKE
SPREAD SHEET WITH A PHOTO COPY OF THE SO CALLED LAB INVOICE!! BEWARE OLSSON IS OVERWHELMED AND HAS NO TIME TO HELP ME OR ANYONE
UNLESS HE CAN GIVE SHOTS THESE REVIEWS ARE DELEATED ON A REG BASIS|This clinic has been a God send with all the excruciating chronic pain I've had.  They always take the time to listen and come up with solid plans to decrease my pain.  They also get back right away with My Chart questions and requests.  I'd recommend this place to anyone!|Honestly the pain management center is a joke. I guess in order to get treated for your pain you have to be missing a limb. I went to the ER after calling the pain doctor because they won't help. I will be finding a new doctor at this point. I have been in excruciating pain for almost a week now, and nobody wants to help.|Both Dr Olson and Dr. McGuire have been nothing less than wonderful. They spend time explaining everything and are very kind. I'm not sure what was going on in the earlier reviews, but this is not the experience I had|

column3:
NeoSpine Puyallup serves patients throughout Puyallup, Washington and surrounding Pierce County communities with specialized interventional pain management services. Under the expert care of physicians like Dr. Kathy Wang, the practice offers comprehensive solutions for chronic pain conditions, focusing on minimally invasive procedures and regenerative medicine techniques. The state-of-the-art facility on 3rd Street SE provides patients with access to advanced diagnostic and therapeutic options in a comfortable, patient-centered environment designed to support optimal recovery and pain relief.

Dr. Kathy Wang is a distinguished pain management specialist at NeoSpine who brings exceptional credentials and experience to her practice. Board certified by the American Board of Anesthesia with a sub-specialty in Pain Medicine, Dr. Wang has established herself as a leader in interventional pain procedures and regenerative therapies. Since 2013, she has been at the forefront of implementing cutting-edge regenerative medicine techniques at NeoSpine, helping patients find relief from chronic pain conditions without relying solely on medication management.

Specialized Procedures and Treatments

Dr. Wang specializes in a comprehensive range of interventional procedures, including:

  • Regenerative Medicine: Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) and Bone Marrow Aspiration Concentrate (BMAC) stem cell therapies

  • Interventional Pain Procedures: X-ray guided epidural steroid injections for precise delivery of anti-inflammatory medication

  • Neuromodulation: Implantation of spinal cord stimulators for long-term pain management

Patient Care and Facility Information

NeoSpine's Puyallup location offers patients convenient access to advanced pain management in a modern clinical setting. The practice emphasizes individualized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient, with a focus on improving function and quality of life. New patients are welcome to schedule consultations to explore comprehensive pain management options with Dr. Wang and the NeoSpine team.

Location: 1519 3rd St SE, Suite 101, Puyallup, WA 98372, United States

Phone: +1 253-841-8939

Website: www.neospine.com
column11: Dr. Wang is board certified by the American Board of Anesthesia with a sub-specialty in Pain Medicine. Since 2013, Dr. Wang has been performing regenerative medicine at NeoSpine, including Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) and Bone Marrow Aspiration (BMAC) stem cell therapies. She also regularly performs X-ray guided epidural steroid injections, as well as implantations of spinal cord stimulators.
column38: R M|Donna Sanders|Doug Baltazar|jason mitchell|kunher wu|David Benton|Amy Creamer|Amanda Lorennij
column40:
I have been to many pain specialists over the last 20 years dealing with chronic pain from 2 bad auto accidents and the surgeries that followed. I have met caring doctors with their own agendas- for example a doctor that only wanted to implant a spinal cord stimulator. I really didn't want one- for several reasons, but that's all he would consider for me. I've met rude, dismissive doctor's- who told me I'd just have to accept the fact that I would be living with a rather high level of pain and there's nothing to be done for it. I've been made to feel like a drug seeker- even though I have always carefully managed my medication. I just quit trying to get better than I was for years. My primary care dr. and I worked to manage the pain, but thought I'd try again as I've gotten older. Dr. Wang is amazing. It's not fair to give her low reviews based on services from the office staff, which I've found very pleasant. Dr. Wang is intelligent, caring, and told me right away she could help me . I wanted to get off medication, but get pain relief. She immediately put a plan into action. I only hesitated to review her, because she's busy and now more people will know how good she is, but they should!  If you are hurt and have a real pain issue I would recommend Dr. Wang.|Just a word of caution...if all you need are injections this could be the right place for you but if your condition is at all complex, you really should keep searching for a doctor who can address complexity.
I also agree with the one other review about the office staff. Perhaps they need more help or better training because they really are very nice in person but forget about speaking with anyone via a phone call.|I was referred to Dr. Wang from my surgeon who did my fusion back in 2014 and then last September 2018 I was hit by a vehicle as a pedestrian, I was given pain blocker 2  times with successful results and waiting for a 3rd appointment to get the nerves rf ablated. and now I am unable to get any kind of successful answers on why I have been waiting over 6 months for this, I have been in pain for most of them. I have been leaving emails voice mails for months and every 3 or 4th week I will be able to get ahold of somebody and they are usually very nice to tell me how they are going to get some kind of answer for me, but them I am left  to sit in pain for longer with no return calls emails or answering of my calls, I have been missing days off of work. the office has completely dropped the ball with me.|I have been dealing with debilitating at times chronic pain.  Dr Wang was able to help be cut the pain down extremely.  Friendly, explains things to the level you are comfortable with, and very competent.|Dear Dr. Wang,  I am so happy for you , I know you will be an excellent doctor because you do care.|Staff are very friendly and helpful||

column40: I had been going there for a couple years an office visit was 300 before insurance  now that they do everything in house they decided to charge over 600 a UA which then puts your bill up over 1000. I have good insurance but they think 300 plus a month you pay is normal. Save your money and time!! It is a complete rip off!! However if Dr. Bolton ever leaves there I would highly recommend her.|Don't waste your time. It's not even called PMO anymore because they were bought out by some business on the east coast. PMO was AMAZING but this new company is a scam. They'll have you wait hours because they only have 1 doctor on staff that sees 100's of patients. Find another place, there are many many more out there that are way better. They are cheap and you have to skype people on the east coast that are hella rude and disrespectful. They have 6 nurses that walk around doing nothing or sitting at the reception playing games on their phone or computer all day while there are 14 people waiting to go back. It's a terrible place! You will be miserable.|This place saved my life, had a great staff and a beloved counselor Liz, that was particularly helpful and well loved. The worthless CEO of this garbage clinic made a drastic, spontaneous overhaul, fired Liz without a days notice, fired every doctor that had been staffed, turned the front desk employees from joyous welcoming people to seemingly frightened, quiet and PTSD-esque. They abruptly stopped my medication, forced me through withdrawal and played games with scheduling, vague explanations, and underhandedly and secretly blackballed me because a spontaneous cheap instant test yielded positive for benzodiazepenes. This was the only time they hadn't used a lab affirmed UA, and I have had a lab proven false positive for benzos from a faulty instant test. They didn't allow me to contest or lab test my sample which was protocol. The day I was scheduled to finally see a doctor, I met patients with 3 lab confirmed positive UAs who were never abruptly or ever denied their prescription. I also had an appointment with Liz, the favorite individual and group counselor made on Friday. She was fired by Monday. Plenty of patients walked out in anger immediately. I sat through a very long, theatrical wait and submitted a clean test. Eventually a random new employee told me that not one of several doctors was "comfortable seeing me". She lied and said it was because they were unsure about my psych meds that their own office had been prescribing for 8 months with Suboxone and was now an issue. They said I was banned even if I received the remaining meds elsewhere. Basically the entire new staff they used to replace the long time staff were much worse and less educated. I was clearly singled out because I was the only patient with a service dog, but they decided that "we do not accept established or any patient on any medication that isn't Suboxone." Very sensible. They handed me a useless generic crisis number sheet and booted me. The entire routine and feel of PMC is like a prison based sobriety program devoid of any compassion and was more fear, authority and power based. When I asked the secretary I knew for a year what the hell is going on, she sheepishly pointed to the name of their slimy, wretched CEO. A heartless woman that didn't even talk to patients. This place is based on money and kickbacks, patients welfare is not even second on their priority list. They brought me to a state of hopelessness, sickness, psychic hell and heroin relapse. I wish 1,000 fold of my suffering upon the CEO and hope she burns in hell. I hope the whole operation goes belly up. If you want to escape opiate dependency and feel better about your life, AVOID PMO. I was blessed enough to get through the horrible place they left me in and I'm now with an awesome doctor at NEIGHBORCARE. NEIGHBORCARE'S PROGRAM IS A GENUINELY PATIENTS FIRST PROGRAM. I hope this review keeps people from PMO's recovery gulag. I am going to speak to the ADA about their tyrant CEO and hope they can slap this "person" silly in some form. I came to a reservoir, I left a soulless business suite. SAY NO TO PMO!|Idk, how this place got even a.1 star review its terrible . 1st off its very overpriced even with very good private insurance .2nd  nurses and or the secretaries ignore you and Drs give you a 2 minute physical not even resolving anything just giving you.a bottle of meds and sending you away . thx 4 nothing . Please Close .|I could write a long @ss review but I am just going to say, save your money and time and find a different place for addiction treatment.|This place saved my life and I could have never done it without Alison tassler......... Thank you Ali|These people saved my life. The staff is amazing.|

column2: Seattle Neck and Back Pain Clinic -Kent
column3:
Seattle Neck and Back Pain Clinic serves Kent, Washington and surrounding areas with specialized chiropractic and massage therapy services. Our clinic focuses on providing quick, effective, and affordable solutions for patients suffering from neck and back pain. With a team of experienced practitioners, we offer comprehensive care that combines modern chiropractic techniques with therapeutic massage to address the root causes of discomfort and promote long-term wellness.

At Seattle Neck and Back Pain Clinic, we understand that pain can significantly impact your quality of life. Our treatment approaches are designed to provide immediate relief while developing personalized care plans that prevent recurrence. Whether you're suffering from acute injuries, chronic conditions, or work-related strain, our practitioners utilize evidence-based methods to restore mobility and reduce pain.

Our Treatment Approach

We combine traditional chiropractic adjustments with complementary therapies including therapeutic massage, exercise prescription, and lifestyle counseling. This integrated approach ensures that patients receive comprehensive care addressing both symptoms and underlying causes of discomfort.

Convenient Location and Hours

Located at 25854 108th Ave SE in Kent, WA 98030, our clinic offers flexible scheduling to accommodate busy lifestyles. We prioritize accessibility and affordability, making quality pain management available to everyone in the Kent community and beyond.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at (253) 852-2828 or visit our website at www.seattleneckandback.com. Our friendly staff is ready to answer your questions and help you begin your journey toward a pain-free life.
column11: Chiropractic clinic and massage clinic focused on quick and affordable neck pain relief and back pain relief.
column38: Davyd Kovalenko|Anna K|Natalya Troyan|Kristina Zinchuk|Yuliya Gural|Irena Potseluyko|Osman Arsalan|Ibraham Ann
column40:
Got into an accident in July totaling my car and was recommended this clinic multiple times. Right off the bat, everyone was super helpful and answered all my questions. Lana made scheduling every appointment super easy and quick. Mariana was very helpful with assisting with all the services. Inna was a wonderful resource and very easy to talk to. Dr. Nazar was very clear with everything, explaining everything step by step throughout the entire recovery and very pleasant to talk with as well. Overall, just an amazing experience and most importantly, of course, got me out of treatment in under 5 months from a totaled accident feeling better than ever.|If you are looking to find the Best chiropractor clinic, this is the one. Dr. Nazairy and his team are the Best. I have been struggling with back pain for years. I went to different chiropractors, I did massage therapy, muscle relaxers and anything that could possibly help, but it didn't help. Few month ago, my back started hurting so bad that I couldn't even pick up my 1 year old daughter. I decided to switch to new chiropractor and that's when I got recommendation to come to Seattle neck and back pain clinic. If I  didn't come to them, I would've not  known what exactly going on with my back. Dr.Nazairy and his team did few scans, and tests and they helped me to be able to do my daily routine and feel so much better. Oh and if you thinking oh I have little baby , no baby sitter. Don't worry Lana and Dasha got you. They are the Best. You get yourself fix while they take care of your baby!|I can't thank Dr.Nazarij enough for the exceptional care I've received. I am incredibly grateful for his support and expertise. Highly recommended !|I recently visited Seattle Neck and Back Pain Clinic with my grandma after our car accident, and I can't recommend it highly enough. If you're looking for compassionate and effective chiropractic care, this clinic is the place to go. column2: The Doctors Clinic: Beno Kuharich, DO
column3:
The Doctors Clinic in Silverdale, WA offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert care of Dr. Beno Kuharich, DO. Specializing in chronic pain management, Dr. Kuharich and his team have established a reputation for their patient-centered approach that emphasizes building strong therapeutic relationships. By carefully listening to each patient's unique pain experience, the clinic develops personalized treatment plans that combine medical interventions with educational resources and coping strategies.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

At The Doctors Clinic, Dr. Kuharich believes that effective pain management requires more than just medication. The practice offers a multidisciplinary approach that may include physical therapy, interventional procedures, medication management, and behavioral health support. This integrated strategy helps patients regain functionality and improve their quality of life despite chronic pain conditions.

Dr. Beno Kuharich's Approach

Dr. Kuharich's philosophy centers on creating a strong doctor-patient alliance as the foundation for successful pain management. His approach involves:

- Thorough assessment of each patient's pain experience

- Collaborative development of treatment goals

- Regular evaluation of progress and treatment adjustments

- Education about pain mechanisms and self-management techniques

Patient Outcomes

Patients who receive care at The Doctors Clinic often report significant improvements in their daily functioning and overall well-being. By addressing both the physical and psychological aspects of chronic pain, Dr. Kuharich helps patients develop effective coping mechanisms that allow them to lead more productive and fulfilling lives.

Contact Information:

- Phone: +1 360-830-1106

- Address: 2200 NW Myhre Rd, Silverdale, WA 98383, United States

- Website: [https://www.thedoctorsclinic.com/providers/beno-kuharich-do/](https://www.thedoctorsclinic.com/providers/beno-kuharich-do/)
column11:
Effective management of chronic pain occurs when there is a strong therapeutic alliance between doctor and patient by listening closely to the patient's pain experience and providing education, treatment options and coping mechanisms.

Often, the end result has patients leading higher quality, more productive lives.

He is up to date with the most innovative treatments and I wouldn't trust my care to anyone else.|This is the most unorganized clinic. I have been left in pain for weeks, as staff scheduled imaging at the wrong lab, then did not fix the problem, I was forced to. They do not provide basic information such as it is my responsibility to provide test results? And I am supposed to drive a CD of images to their office? Another fact they never informed me of. They do not return calls,  they do not provide basic information, many of the staff act as if I am inconveniencing them by being there. Meanwhile, I remain in pain and they don't care. I have never signed into Google to leave a review before, this is the first. I would recommend never going to this clinic.|How on EARTH is this clinic & dr even getting 5 star reviews ! My 91 yr old mother who lives on Bainbridge Island has been left hanging in excruciating pain for two weeks. She's been in the ER, the only place to actually treat her for pain and run new scans but referred back to this clinic plus her regular dr for pain management until injections can be done.
Both of which have gone ignored and put off for another review. Are you out of your minds over that way ?
