column3:
Restore Health & Pain Treatment Group serves Spokane, Washington with comprehensive pain management solutions focused on holistic wellness. Our dedicated team of specialists provides personalized care plans designed to address chronic pain conditions through integrative approaches that minimize dependency on traditional pain medications. Located conveniently in North Spokane, our facility offers a welcoming environment where patients can explore effective treatment options tailored to their unique health needs.

At Restore Health & Pain Treatment Group, we believe in empowering individuals to take control of their health journey. Our approach centers on potential alternative methods including osteopathic treatment, acupuncture, and targeted supplement protocols that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. We carefully evaluate each patient's condition to determine the most appropriate treatment path, prioritizing safety and long-term wellness over quick fixes.

Treatment Approach

Our clinical team conducts thorough assessments to develop personalized treatment plans. When the risks of opioids outweigh potential benefits, we implement effective non-opioid alternatives. Patient safety remains our paramount concern—we will not prescribe opioids when a patient uses substances that could create dangerous interactions. While this approach occasionally results in negative feedback from patients seeking specific medications, our commitment to ethical, evidence-based care remains unwavering.

Communication Policy

Due to HIPAA regulations, we cannot address patient-specific questions or respond to reviews in public forums. If you have concerns about your treatment plan or wish to discuss alternative options, we encourage direct communication through our secure channels. Patients who disagree with treatment decisions are welcome to contact us to discuss available options and the clinical reasoning behind our recommendations.

Contact Information

Address: 1601 N Division St, Suites A, B, C, Spokane, WA 99207

Phone: +1 509-824-6080

Website: https://restorehealthptg.com/locations/spokane/

For secure communication, please visit our website and use the "Chat with representative" chatbot option or submit a contact form through our secure portal.
column11:
Our philosophy revolves around empowering individuals to take control of their health with potential alternative methods such as osteopathic treatment, acupuncture, supplements, etc.
If risks of opioids are higher than the benefits, non-opioid options will be used. We will not endanger a patient when substances are used that are dangerous with opioids. This often leads to negative patient responses if opioid seeking. Please contact us to discuss options if you disagree with a treatment decision.

Patient Specific Questions & Reviews:
We cannot respond to patient specific questions or reviews due to HIPAA guidelines. Please visit our website and use the chatbot option "Chat with representative", or submit a contact form.
column38: Kailar Oak|Megan aikman|Oly Dee|Teisha Loy|Karl Anderson|robert majure|Leslie Swaner|Eric Sorensen
column40:
I've been seeing Christian for the past 5-6 years. He's not only a great doctor but also a great and wonderful person. He's always supported me and shown care in every aspect. As this is a pain clinic, I'm obviously seeing him for chronic pain. I have numerous specialists, and my weeks are filled with appointments. Christian always knows what's going on in those appointments and goes out of his way to ask about them and make notes. I always go in with a bunch of information for him, and at every appointment, he sits and listens, being more empathetic than most of the other doctors I see. He's always 100% there to shed guidance and point me in the right direction when needed. All he cares about is that I'm doing everything in my power to be healthy. He's always willing to listen to suggestions when I feel an adjustment needs to be made on my medications. Anytime I call with any issues relating to a hospital stay or the pharmacy, he has always responded right away and is more than on top of any situation. He works after hours, and even gives responses on weekends. His staff is filled with some of the nicest people I know, and everyone at the clinic advocates for their patients.

Being there for so long, I've heard people get mad for not getting what they wanted, and I guarantee that most of the negative reviews are from people giving false allegations because they didn't get what they wanted. The clinic is constantly booked, yet every single person that works there goes out of their way to be friendly, schedule your appointments, and get you everything you need. Even when other patients aren't returning the same positive vibes, they still manage to stay level-headed, professional, and above all, kind and compassionate. I don't know what I would do without these amazing individuals. They have altered my life in such a positive way that I can't imagine going to any other chronic pain clinic. These people deal with so much on a day-to-day basis, and they deserve the compassion and positivity they continually spread.

If I could, I'd give them a 100-star review. If any of the amazing Restore Health staff read this, please know you're doing such a good job and an amazing thing for those who truly suffer from chronic pain. Please keep up the good work; it is paying off for those who deserve it!|If you are someone who is looking for a pain management team, this is the place to go! I have worked with Christian Garrido for the past 3 years, and he is not only a wonderful doctor but a genuine kind person. I have dealt with a lot of different doctors, and no one compares to Christian. He has sat with me well past my appointment time if needed and has helped me through all different stages of my pain. Sometimes, getting a doctor to listen to you is the biggest battle. I feel like he is the first doctor I have ever had that listened to me. I have recommended him to friends, and they also have had great experiences.

I also want to shout out the front staff and the medical assistants. They are friendly and very warm. I appreciate them a great deal.|We have been going here since they were Lynx. We were happy when Galoshopav was there. But even he gave too high of a prescription for a family member. Wound up in the ER. Caught the amount the time after and noticed the messed up medication. Got it fixed. He left. Then another doctor. He left. Then another doctor. She left. Lynx shut down. Became restore. I think we have Ben through three or four doctor's since. Then, there's no understanding. People are in pain and just want their pain to be managed. We liked them at first. I don't know what is going on now. But I am not happy. Bring an advocate for your appointments.|The Dr was super inappropriate made rude comments made me feel super uncomfortable. I would never recommend anybody to go to him. I will be trying to get a hold of corporate as a patient. This man made me feel below him absolutely disgusted by him. Never again will I go back or have my friends go to him!|Show no concern to pain issues. Only compliance to new rules and drug testing  to keep out the drug users. Helped me not one but showed  zero conc e rn about my well being and health. Nearly killed me with new drug tries which  I tend to be allergic  too. Was absolutely  no help to my needs and concerns|Absolutely terrible experience. Their front office staff refused to help me. Then i asked to speak to management and the front office said they WERE management and the owner gave them permission to refuse me care.  All this because my phone is inactive and i couldn't email them documents. Im flabbergasted. No stars.|Christian (Dr. Gerrido) and Dr K. are an amazing team! They have treated me with empathy, compassion and respect. Here, they combine modern medicine with holistic solutions. They listen, in detail, to my issues and concerns and address them head on and immediately. They even take the time to educate you. Most clinics do not have the time to do that, they rush you through or they don't have the resources available for any other treatment options other than medication. I have several debilitating issues that medication does not always help. After going over these issues with Christian,  he referred me to Dr. K. Between the two of them,  I am treated in a balanced manner that has given me so much relief from relentless pain. I have had non steroidal trigger point injections, acupuncture, chiropractic style treatments, acupressure and even medication adjustment that have less side effects than previous medication. If you are truly looking for help and healing, I recommend you to give them an opportunity to show you all of the things they have shown me. Even their staff treat you with respect and kindness.|I feel fortunate that I was referred to Restore Health. My provider's name is Christian and he is very nice and understanding, but what I appreciate the most is how much he is willing to listen to your concerns.  He genuinely cares and not just about your pain...  He shows compassion regarding the full extent of your health.

column3:
Northwest Pain Management Associates serves Marysville, Washington and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists has been providing relief to patients throughout Snohomish County for over 15 years. We combine evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions, helping patients regain functionality and improve their quality of life.

At Northwest Pain Management Associates, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment. Our services include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy referrals, and complementary therapies. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, fibromyalgia, and complex regional pain syndrome. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs of our patients.

Our Facility and Approach

Located at 4404 80th St NE in Marysville, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. We prioritize patient education and active participation in the healing process. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to identify and address the underlying causes of pain whenever possible. We work closely with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated care.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management experts, please call us at +1 425-640-6976. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans. For more information about our services and approach to pain management, visit our website at https://www.soundpainalliance.com/northwest-pain-management-associates/.

column2: Interventional Pain Clinic at Virginia Mason
column3:
Interventional Pain Clinic at Virginia Mason serves Seattle, WA and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Located in the heart of Seattle's First Hill medical district, this comprehensive clinic combines advanced interventional techniques with compassionate patient care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. The expert team of board-certified physicians, pain specialists, and support staff work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

The clinic offers a wide range of minimally invasive procedures and innovative therapies designed to target pain at its source. Treatments include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and regenerative medicine approaches. Each intervention is performed with precision using state-of-the-art imaging guidance to ensure optimal results with minimal discomfort.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes the Interventional Pain Clinic at Virginia Mason is their multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Patients benefit from coordinated care that may incorporate physical therapy, behavioral health support, and complementary medicine alongside interventional procedures. The clinic emphasizes education and self-management strategies, empowering patients to take an active role in their recovery journey.

Convenient Access to Expert Care

The clinic is conveniently located at 1100 9th Ave, Seattle, WA 98101, within the Virginia Mason Medical Center campus. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 206-223-6600. The facility features modern treatment rooms equipped with advanced technology in a comfortable, healing environment designed to reduce anxiety and enhance the patient experience.

For more information about services, physician credentials, or to request an appointment, visit their official website at https://www.vmfh.org/our-services/interventional-pain-clinic. The Interventional Pain Clinic at Virginia Mason is committed to helping patients find relief from chronic pain and return to their active lifestyles through evidence-based, innovative care.
column11: Interventional Pain Clinic at Virginia Mason is dedicated to delivering high quality, compassionate care to Seattle and nearby communities.
column38: Mac Martin|Terence Edgar|Jane Doe|Molly Costello|Bug|Danny McClain|Lynn Wells
column40:
I saw them a few days ago, I got an epidural steroid injection for chronic pain. I feel 1000x better today and can't say anything but great things about them. They were flexible with my schedule and did a great job getting me scheduled ASAP. As for the other reviews... you DO NEED a referral for all specialty doctors and you will have to bird dog (call frequently) all providers, jump thru the hoops and have some patience to get into any specialist. Thanks!|I would like to separate getting an appointment as a new patient, versus quality of care. With many events dealing with my low back spine, and neck spine, over close to 30 years. Including surgery 25 years ago, low back and 20 years ago neck, both herniated discs, that have done well. Now working through arthritis, I so appreciate their help.
Care, clarity of options, safety, pleasant, follow up, just good service. I trust my spine to the team.|This is a one star Post. I wondered why I was constantly being "put off" here. I have lumbar & cervical herniated discs. Everytime I visited I saw someone different. I explained the epidurals on my back did not work, and the next suggestion was to come in a couple more times to do movement evals to locate the pain. That was ridiculous to me, and after looking further I discovered this is what they call a teaching clinic. Hence why you never see the same doctor.|I will start by saying I have never even visited with a doctor at the Virginia Mason Anesthesiology Pain Clinic or been there, and have only struggles with the initial steps. I stumbled upon the Virginia Mason Anesthesiology Pain Clinic in my quest to get control over my chronic pain, manage it better and live a more normal life. I reviewed the services and doctors thinking I had found something really good, feeling hopeful. First I tried to schedule an appointment with them on MyVirginiaMason. Then, when I discovered this was not possible (weird and inconvenient, why), I called them to try and schedule an appointment that way. I was sent to a voicemail. I left my information thinking i'd get a call back in the next day or so as is customary. I have never received a call back. I realize this is probably a busy place, maybe there is even a waitlist. I respect that. But please, at the bare minimum I deserve a call back to tell me that I need a referral or there is a 6 month wait or none of the doctors are accepting new patients. Anything. Perhaps there are other clinics in the area that are more sensitive to the needs of us as chronic pain patients and will respond to these with more respect and urgency.|The doctors and nurses here are awesome, only issue here is the parking..... the card reader in the garage constantly breaks and is unable to read the card, then I need to mail in a $7 cheque for 1 hour parking. It would be great if parking validation was a thing|Great Hospital|

column38: mike long|Sindea Kirk|Frank & Anne Drumm|Roar Dinos|Richard Head|Evah Risper|Scott Hume|Kathryn Pratt
column40:
I have seen Dr Cassius on and off for the last 15 years for chronic back pain.  When I first saw him I was popping vicodin like jelly beans and under his supervision I weaned off the narcotics and his injections worked miracles.  You have to stick with it and actually do the exercises even when it's painful....to see results.  After 6 mos of injections all the while doing pt I am virtually pain free.  Over the years I have tweaked my back or twisted the wrong way and have had to return for a visit or 2 but have always had a great outcome.  Dr Cassius was originally referred to me by one of my clients who said he would change my life... I was skeptical at first but in the end he did change my life and I am forever grateful.|Dr. Cassius was recommended by my chiropractor for some very serious back and hip pain. He was kind, caring, not rushed. I love that he thinks outside of the box and seems to have a good understanding of the body as a whole, not just parts. I feel hopeful that I will continue feeling better, for the first time in a long while.|I had been in severe nerve pain for 1 1/2 years before I found Dr. Cassius. I felt like I had no quality of life. After seeing many specialists, I was referred to Dr. Cassius.

At my first visit to him, he said he could help resolve this pain. I had tears in my eyes, finally seeing someone who could help me. And he did. I will be forever grateful for his care and am pain free now.|Actual experience wasn't bad - he ran some blood tests and recommended vitamins. Seemed to be convinced of the latest pseudoscience but told me what I wanted to hear. Called 3 times to get a letter of medical necessity and the office wouldn't return my calls. They then deposited my check 7 months after I wrote it, in a different calendar year, meaning I have no way to file with insurance for reimbursement. Very displeased with communication - only go here if you're looking for someone to tell you about the latest book they read while 'prescribing' medicines and then refusing to contact you ever again. Sad thing, I was happy with it for the first few months post "treatment".|A remarkable Pain Physician that does not use Opioids to treat pain.  Instead, he uses nerve blocking techniques to shut down the pain until the body heals itself.   I would definitely recommend Dr Cassius.|He was caring, attentive and very helpful. He treated my pain, I will be forever grateful. Had been to many doctors and they couldn't figure out what was wrong.|Had good long lasting results.|

column38: Brian Carroll|Diane Weinman|H. M.|Jerri Ann Tuck|Becky Sturm|Bill More|Steven M i|A Smith
column40:
Horrible doctor absolutely no empathy! I had to fire him and get another doctor. Been stable ever since I left him and his clinic!|As far as I'm concerned anyone giving Dr. Yu a negative review hasn't given him a chance. When I saw him the first time I was wondering if I should see him a second time. I have to drive a few hours to get to Swedish and I wanted to make sure my drive was worth it. Now, having seen him for about 7 years, I'm so glad he's my dr. My pain is manageable and the drive is well worth it.

Since this review I've had a change of heart. Last time I saw Dr. Yu he was on one topic and I was on another topic. We couldn't connect and his impatience drove me away. I now see a different doctor. Dr. Yu is an excellent doctor but he needs to slow down and listen. His patience is limited.|To be clear, I think Dr. Yu deserves 0 stars.

Exhibits a severe lack of empathy; seems to hold himself in higher rank than patients; rushed & terrible communicator; does not prioritize patient wellness but max number of procedures.

I am a PhD professor who teaches medical anthropology. Dr. Yu is a textbook case of someone who should not be in this line of work. And you don't need to be a PhD professor to know why--you just need to be a patient on the receiving end of his bad temper and poor service.

My husband has suffered chronic pain related to his spine. His surgeon recommend a steroid shot, so he went and got one at another hospital. It didn't work because the person administering the shot delivered it in a spot other than what the surgeon had recommended. My husband then had surgery, to no avail. Enter our relationship with Dr. Yu, who was recommended for pain management.

During the first visit, Dr. Yu did not impress. He rushed and did not listen. He made flippant remarks about patients with chronic pain becoming suicidal. He pushed a spinal stimulation chip that he is a fan of, but had no other plan except for another steroid shot. But the shot didn't work, we said. "That's because the guy who did it was too scared to put it in the right spot--it's risky. But I'm not afraid, and I will put it in the right spot," he claimed.

So we decided to try the shot again. When the insurance denied it, Dr. Yu's office failed to appeal until we called them to remind them. During the next weeks, Dr. Yu left my husband in crippling pain with no medication or pain management plan, even though we let him know that my husband could not function. We asked about medicinal marijuana, pain medication, or ANYTHING else that he could suggest. He responded tersely, offering nothing meaningful. He was also shockingly ignorant of my husband's medical history, telling him to up the dosage of a drug that he was already maxing out--clearly he never read the patient's MyChart. We wrote to him asking, point blank, "What is your plan for pain management as the pain management doctor??" He reluctantly wrote a prescription for pain killers at an insultingly low dose that has no effect. The result was a patient in so much pain that he could not function in daily life.

Finally, the shot was approved and we went to get it. We were received by Dr. Yu saying, "OK! Last procedure of the day!!!" He rushed through some waivers and blurted out that he was going to deliver the shot in THE SAME WRONG SPOT AS THE FIRST GUY DID. Mistakes happen, so it was just a matter of letting him know that the spot we needed was the spot the neurosurgeon had recommended, not the incorrect spot that had been treated previously. His assistant went to inform him.

Dr. Yu did not deal with the confusion well. Or maybe he did not like feeling corrected. Or maybe the hospital overworks him and he can't handle all the stress. Whatever it was, it was ugly.

He began by backpedaling and saying that the previous doctor hadn't done it wrong after all, rather, his technique may have been ineffective, and the shot is likely to work this time even if it didn't last time, etc. It was a lot to digest, didn't always make sense, especially since he was rushing and in a very bad mood. It wasn't just the information we were digesting but the prospect of having the procedure performed by a doctor who was angry and rushed.

Not even two minutes had gone by when Dr. Yu grabbed his coat and said, "So that's it, you're not getting the shot." We said, "No, it's not that; we're just taking a minute to think about it." His response? "I don't have time for this! I have to be in the OR in 20 minutes!!!"

Um, OK. We definitely didn't want a 30 minute procedure performed by a guy in a rush to be somewhere in 20 minutes, so we let him go. I feel VERY concerned about the patient in the OR, who was about to be operated on by a man in a rage.

We will never visit Dr. Yu again. And we will be pursuing the matter with higher authorities in Swedish.|Dr Yu is every bit a professional. He is a bit short on words but Ihe has been my specialist for many years and I appreciate his knowledge and skills. I jokingly tell him at appointments he simply can not ever retire!|As you can see dr yu rated very low. I understand why.  He doesn't listen he bullies you into unnecessary procedures and is quite frankly the rudest doctor I've ever met. Zero compassion to arrogant.  Suprised he is still in practice.|Felt like being in a car dealership for Medtronic implant products. It's pretty clear who's paying for his office. He didn't want to know what was going on with me, just wanted to implant me with a neurostimulator off the bat.|Dr Yu only cares about how many procedures he can do per day.  He implanted my Medtronic device incorrectly and ended up having to move it!|Dr Yu has been great with me. Just had my second scs with him. I can't thank him enough for the pain relief

Seattle Pain Relief serves patients throughout Seattle, Washington with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert care of Dr. Jason G. Attaman. Located in downtown Seattle, our practice specializes in both interventional and regenerative approaches to chronic pain, offering patients alternatives to traditional surgery and medication management. Our state-of-the-art facility combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with cutting-edge treatment options to address pain conditions affecting virtually any area of the body.

Dr. Jason G. Attaman, DO, FAAPMR brings exceptional credentials as a double-board-certified pain management and spine physician. His comprehensive training allows him to treat the full spectrum of pain conditions through both surgical and non-surgical interventions. Whether you're experiencing discomfort in your ankle, foot, elbow, wrist, hand, hip, knee, shoulder, spine, or elsewhere, Dr. Attaman's expertise ensures you receive precisely targeted care for your specific condition.

Specialized Treatment Options

Our practice offers several specialized treatments not widely available elsewhere:

  • Stellate Ganglion Block Therapy for patients suffering from PTSD

  • Pudendal Neuralgia Treatment for patients with this challenging pelvic pain condition

  • Regenexx Procedures - highly specific image-guided regenerative treatments using your own bone marrow concentrate containing stem cells to reduce pain and improve function

Patient-Centered Approach

At Seattle Pain Relief, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our comprehensive evaluation process ensures we identify the true source of your discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms. Dr. Attaman develops individualized treatment plans that may combine multiple modalities for optimal results.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Attaman, please contact us at +1 206-395-4422. Our office is conveniently located at 801 Pine St #100, Seattle, WA 98101. For more information about our services, visit our website at https://jasonattaman.com.
column11: Dr. Jason Attaman is a double-board-certified pain management and spine physician. He treats the full spectrum of pain with surgical and non-surgical procedures, whether your pain resides in your ankle, foot, elbow, wrist, hand, hip, knee, shoulder, spine, or elsewhere. We can help patients with PTSD (who come to us for stellate ganglion block therapy) and patients with pudendal neuralgia. We also perform highly specific image-guided Regenexx procedures using your bone marrow concentrate, which contains your own stem cells and can mitigate your pain and improve your function. Contact Dr. Attaman's office for a consultation.
column38: Karol Lucchesi|Emmy Duros|Christopher Roberts|Jessica M|Jacqui Phillips|Sarah Fitzpatrick|Cheryl Lewis|Lindsay Kotay
column40:
My encounter with Dr. Attaman was disappointing. He abruptly canceled my procedure, leaving the room without explanation. Rather than discussing the situation with me, he simply deemed me "nervous" and walked away. Subsequently, I received a bill for a procedure that NEVER HAPPENED, and attempts to clarify were met with unresponsiveness from his staff.

Dr. Attaman's lack of professionalism and accountability is concerning. I strongly discourage seeking his services due to the dismissive attitude and questionable billing practices. Consider opting for a more reliable and trustworthy medical professional to save yourself unnecessary trouble.|I am a firefighter paramedic and our benefits directed me towards Dr Attaman's office. His consultation process is simple and fast; you understand the next steps as soon as you finish the initial consult. Scheduling was very easy and accommodating. The office is relaxing and staff is professional and very friendly. Dr Attaman never pushed any surgical agenda and treated what I felt was permanent soft tissue pain within my neck with excellent results. Zero time off of work. Follow up was timely, thorough, and thoughtful. Recently I recognized I injured my knee; he was the first phone call I made. All the fear that comes with the what-ifs when we have these physical jobs and get injured was negated when I went to see Dr Attaman and I would highly HIGHLY recommend anyone, especially IAFF FFs with our benefits, to reach out and take a step to life without that nagging pain you've just put up with, new and old.|Dr. Attaman and his team helped me recover from a lumbar spine injury to my L4/L5/S1. I no longer need to take any pain medication and my back no longer hurts. I had chronic pain for years following the injury, with intense sciatica, low back pain and odd (and often painful) sensations going all the way to my foot.

I followed the requested supplement protocol and received PRP injections after an initial telehealth consult and in person exam. I would and have recommend this office to people struggling with pain management who are looking for long term relief.

It seems many of the reviews on here are people being upset that they don't want to provide sufficient pre-appointment information or secure their appointment with payment. I'm not sure how those folks think a busy doctor's office is supposed to work, but I found all the information asked for to be appropriate considering the type of care I was seeking. Remember that review sites like this are prone to selection bias. Malcontents have a disproportionately loud voice on them.

It looks like there are two entries for this office. Be sure to look at the other one with 150 reviews listed as just Jason Attaman, not Jason G Attaman for more reviews.|I had one appointment that was done virtually due to ongoing back & rib pain. I was initially referred for gentle rib manipulation but during my appointment was told he is no longer doing this due to a personal injury. He then recommended PRP injections, even though he knew my medical history and other diagnosis. After the appointment I was bombarded with many emails regarding the PRP injection appointments and supplements he wanted me to take. I wanted to first run the procedure by my rheumatologist and my pain management doctor given they are who referred me to him. Given the fact that I've been in pain for over a year I wanted to make sure the appointment wouldn't be booked out months so I decided to call and schedule. They require over $1200 for a deposit on this procedure. After my appointment with my pain management doctor he was SHOCKED to find out 1) how much they charge and 2) that PRP was even recommended given my medical diagnosis.

I attempted to call the clinic manager and request a refund given I will NOT EVER be having the PRP injections done as this is not the correct treatment plan for me. However, Dr.Attaman denied the refund. For a doctor to prescribe a treatment plan without ever physically touching my back and ribs and then not be willing to refund over $1200 to an individual is outright unethical. What do you plan on doing with that money?

After several months of back and forth between my original referring doctor and this clinic Dr. Attaman denied the refund of the entire deposit after initially calling me to tell me they would give me 50%.  I will NEVER return to this clinic for treatment and hope no one in pain who is just seeking help is treated this way again.|Dr. Attaman was a good listener, efficient, friendly, and he was able to diagnose my pudendal nerve pain. He carefully listened to my particular concerns, and did his best to guide me through the nerve block shots without undue pain.

Other MDs had been of no help with this particular condition, but he was able to alleviate some of the suffering. Also, he has offered a treatment plan to move forward that is affordable, and I have full confidence in his knowledge of this rare condition. If he did not offer this expertise, I would have continued suffering without a diagnosis. I now feel hopeful I have a treatment plan. It was well worth traveling from out of state for this visit. I would highly recommend his office for pain management.

The office staff was also efficient, friendly, and did a great job!|Dr. Attaman has done an excellent job taking care on my dad and my brother. He is so patient and kind. He strives to take the best care possible of his patients. He gives 100% and there's no one else I would trust more! I highly recommend going to see Dr. Attaman for your pain needs.|I have been seeing Dr. Attaman since early May. He has literally been a life saver to me in treating my conditions. He and his entire staff are warm, caring, knowledgeable and truly want what is best for you. I am so grateful to have found Doctor Attaman.|I paid for an invoice 8 months ago, and continue to get notices sent to me requesting payment. Concerned they will send this to debt collectors, I have called and left multiple voicemails and emails for months, forwarding the receipt, and have had no response. I finally got a call from a New York number today, asking me to forward bank statements to a suspicious email address. Still can't get in touch with anyone in the actual office in regards to this.

Northwest Orthopaedic Specialists serves Spokane, Washington with exceptional interventional pain management services through the expertise of Dr. Patrick Soto, DO. Located in downtown Spokane, NWOS has established itself as a leading provider of comprehensive orthopedic care, specializing in treating various spine conditions and pain management. Dr. Soto's patient-centered approach combines cutting-edge techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life.

Dr. Patrick Soto is a highly qualified Interventional Pain specialist who brings extensive expertise to Northwest Orthopaedic Specialists. Board-certified in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation through the American Board of PM&R, Dr. Soto has dedicated his practice to diagnosing and treating complex spine conditions. His comprehensive approach addresses the root causes of pain rather than simply managing symptoms, allowing patients to achieve long-term relief and improved functionality.

Specialized Treatment Areas

Dr. Soto specializes in treating numerous spine-related conditions, including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Arthritis

  • Degenerative disc disease

  • Sciatica

  • Radicular pain

  • Work-related injuries

  • Car accident injuries

Advanced Pain Management Techniques

Utilizing state-of-the-art technology and evidence-based practices, Dr. Soto offers a variety of advanced interventional procedures, including:

  • Epidural Steroid Injections - Targeted relief for nerve inflammation

  • Facet Joint Injections - Precision treatment for spinal joint pain

  • Sacroiliac Joint Injections - Specialized care for lower back and buttock pain

  • Radiofrequency Ablation - Long-lasting pain relief through nerve interruption

  • Spinal Cord Stimulation - Advanced technology for chronic pain management

  • Peripheral Nerve Blocks - Targeted treatment for specific nerve pain

Integrative Pain Management serves the Bellevue, WA area with comprehensive pain relief solutions that combine traditional medical approaches with holistic therapies. Founded on the principle that effective pain management requires addressing the whole person—not just symptoms—our practice offers personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our multidisciplinary team specializes in both acute and chronic pain conditions, utilizing evidence-based interventions alongside complementary therapies to maximize results while minimizing medication dependence.

At Integrative Pain Management, we provide a wide spectrum of treatment options including:

  • Holistic Medicine - Addressing the interconnection between mind, body, and spirit

  • Acute Pain Management - Targeted interventions for recent injuries and post-surgical recovery

  • Chronic Pain Management - Long-term strategies for persistent conditions

  • Hypnosis Therapy - Utilizing the power of focused attention to manage pain perception

  • Reiki Meditation - Energy healing techniques to promote relaxation and pain relief

  • Trigger Point Therapy - Targeted pressure to release muscle tension and pain

Our Philosophy

Our mission is fundamentally empowering—we help patients reclaim control over their lives by finding effective methods to manage pain and suffering. We understand that when pain is properly controlled, patients often experience renewed optimism and can set goals previously considered unattainable. Our approach focuses not just on symptom relief but on improving overall quality of life and functional capacity.

Visit Our Bellevue Location

Located in the heart of Bellevue at 1515 116th Ave NE #300, Bellevue, WA 98004, our modern facility offers a calming environment conducive to healing. We welcome new patients and referrals, providing comprehensive evaluations to develop individualized treatment plans.

Contact us today at (425) 467-5929 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management and improved wellbeing.
column11:

Here at Integrative Pain Management, my mission is to help you reach your goals in life to the extent that is reasonable by finding methods to control pain and suffering. When pain is controlled, you may feel more optimistic about setting and reaching goals that otherwise were out of reach.

Contact us today for more information!

Swedish Pain Services - First Hill serves Seattle, Washington with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located in the heart of the First Hill medical district, our specialized clinic has been helping patients overcome chronic and acute pain conditions for over two decades. Our multidisciplinary team combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address complex pain issues that affect quality of life. We believe in creating personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique circumstances, medical history, and wellness goals.

At Swedish Pain Services, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management options. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and post-surgical pain. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to accurately identify pain sources before developing targeted treatment strategies that may include nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, physical therapy, medication management, and integrative medicine approaches.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that living with chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our team works collaboratively with patients to restore function, reduce reliance on pain medications, and improve overall well-being. Each treatment plan is designed to address not only the physical aspects of pain but also its emotional and psychological impacts. Our goal is to help patients return to their daily activities with improved comfort and confidence.

Location and Accessibility

I am not a patient. They don't accept outside referrals. They couldn't be bothered to inform my providers office with this information after receiving a referral from him. I have been waiting for 3 months. In pain. When I called them to see about an intake appointment and was informed of their policy...
I was spoken to as if i should have known. No concern, caring, or offer of apology.|I wish I hadn't gone here. I belive  Dr yu should not be a dr.  He is rude and has no concern for  the people who  have  no choice. On my august  22. Appointment he was 20 minutes late.   The Injection was performed without enough sedation.   When I informed the doctor of the pain that I was feeling I was Told twice no talking and to be quiet.   He seemed to Have no compassion regarding My pain.  I was under the impression that I would be given a local anesthetic before the procedure started to my knowledge, this was not the case.  This was the most horrific thirty minutes of my life.  I don't even think I waited for the mandatory observation.  I immediately walked back to the intake room put on my shirt and left.  I really did not wish to see this doctor again.  However on the third day sends this procedure the pain was really kicking it up.   So I made another appointment with him and it was a complete disaster.   I was chewed out for a message that I put on my chart regarding his behavior toward me.   This doctor then proceeds to gaslate me and humiliate me in every shape and form.   He told me that I didn't have what I had been diagnosed with back in march.  He told me I had something completely different.  He explained then that there was a couple of other injections that could be performed. And when I told him that I couldn't do any more injection unless I was completely sedated. He rolled his eye.  So finally, after twenty minutes of his gaslighting humiliation, I had decided I'd had enough and this appointment was over.  He then proceeds to hand a sheet of paper with quote pain clinics listed.  So this morning August twenty ninth I Called several of several of them.  One the number had been disconnectwo none of them had a voice answering machine.   And three of them would be a five  hour trip from my location, one way. So please if you need any type of injections please please go somewhere else. Update  January  2024   after this  disaster  I decided I'd  would give chiropractor  a try.  This treatment  has  been a blessing.  The chiropractor  told me that when I had my first treatment  my back and shoulders  were  a mess.  Now I have more movement and  less  pain.  Dr yu  was wrong.  My muscles were  so tight.   Dr yu really  should  really suggest    a chiropractor. It's been  nearly  a year  since  this horrific  and painful experience  Ihave tried to put this in the pass. I beg any one let  injections  be the last resort.|I was referred to Swedish Functional Restoration.  Prior to my first appointment, I received a call to schedule an appointment and told the person I was speaking with that I was currently seeing a physical therapist that I really liked and wanted to continue with the physical therapist. The therapist was not with Swedish.  I was told that I could not do this because they wanted all my care at one place.  I was seen by Dr. Wilson Chang and told that this program would include pain management, physical therapy and occupational therapy.  It was two months between the first and second appointments that I had with Dr. Wilson Chang. I never saw anyone for pain, I had two appointments with an occupational therapist and two appointments with a physical therapist.  I met with Dr. Chang on my second appointment and told him that I felt not listened to by the occupational therapist and said that the physical therapist did not have a goal of strengthening my lower back at the same time as working on healing my torn tendons which my previous therapist had and it helped.  Dr. Wilson cut me off and told me the next step was a cortisone shot.  He told me I had ten days to get back to him.  I did not get back to him at all.  The past shots have never helped me.

Swedish Functional Restoration with their policy that my healthcare had to all be done at the same place, Dr. Wilson Chang misrepresenting to me what was going to be offered to me and how it was going to work and my physical therapy goals being changed from what I had with my prior physical therapist, without telling me, let me know that Providence Swedish is not interested in including the patient in their healthcare and is more interested in controlling the progress of your healthcare.|The Seattle pain clinic pain reduction program is how the recommended For those invested in learning about their pain as well as means of reducing it. The Program Is very comprehensive.
Including physical therapy, occupational therapy, pain psychology, and stress management, relaxation methods. Staff members are highly educated, compassionate and very easy to work with. Doctor Chang is excellent as well; making for a comprehensive team.|Well where do I start? I went and seen a doctor there because my primary care doctor told me to and when I got there I seen Dr. Zhang worst decision of my life he told me it's  all in my head and that I need to do yoga and go on walks and runs  as if that's going to help, any gaslighted everything I said about my pain and told me it was on my head and I needed to talk about it because of him I was cut off my pain prescription that I've been on since 2016  because he recommended stuff that we've already done medication's. We've already tried and basically said because he couldn't see my charts that he didn't think I was being seen by a doctor back in 2016 ( old doctor left providence). This place is the worst I've ever seen and I turned him into the board of doctors and into the state because I want him investigated the system I think he is a womanizer and I feel like he is a joke and should have his license removed|Dr. Chang and his team are amazing. I am new to Washington and finding medical care to the extent that I needed was becoming an impossible task. I was finally referred to Swedish hospital (5 hours away from my home) and I am so glad that I was. My initial exam with Dr. Chang was so thorough and everyone in his office was so compassionate. Dr. Chang has followed up on my treatment several times and even spoken with other doctors on my medical team to make sure they all on the same page (when does that ever happen?).  I can't recommend them enough. Thank you Swedish Pain services for everything you are doing for me.|I see Dr. Steven Stanos here at this Swedish clinic. He is very respectful and a wonderful listener. He is very aware of my past and present health records. He researches his information before giving me instructions on what he would like me to do for my chronic pain issues. I would definetely recommend him to  anyone looking for a pain services provider doctor. He also treats me as an equal when dealing with me at my monthly appointments. He cares about my health and well being in general. I LOVE THIS DOCTOR!!!!! He helps me with  my emotional aspects of my chronic pain issues. Wonderful experiences every time I have visited him!!!!|I was frustrated with my visit with the medical doctor on my team and extremely frustrated with the psychologist on my team.  The medical doctor interrupted me several times, was late for appointments, and did not respond to my questions on My Chart.  The psychologist had an obvious agenda, asked me what I thought was the cause of my pain and then ignored my answer and told me ... this is what I think and then this is what you need to do (lots of appointments to change my brain!).    AARRRRGGGG  I think I am done with them!

Anesthesiology Clinical Services at UW Medical Center - Montlake serves Seattle, WA as a premier provider of comprehensive anesthesia care within the University of Washington medical system. Located in the heart of Seattle's medical district, our department combines clinical excellence with cutting-edge research to deliver exceptional patient care. Our board-certified anesthesiologists specialize in tailoring anesthesia plans to individual patient needs, ensuring safety and comfort throughout surgical procedures and pain management treatments. As part of the broader Department of Anesthesiology & Pain Medicine Division, we maintain the highest standards of medical practice while advancing the field through innovative approaches and techniques.

Our clinical team provides a complete spectrum of anesthesia care, including thorough preoperative medical and surgical evaluations to assess patient risks and develop personalized anesthesia plans. We offer both general and regional anesthetic options, allowing for procedure-specific approaches that optimize patient outcomes. Our expertise extends to specialized services such as labor epidurals for expectant mothers and sophisticated transplantation anesthesia for liver and kidney procedures. The department's commitment to excellence ensures that patients receive the most appropriate anesthesia care for their specific medical needs.

Advanced Pain Management Solutions

Beyond surgical anesthesia, our specialists excel in comprehensive pain management services. We provide effective postoperative pain control strategies
column11:
The Department of Anesthesiology & Pain Medicine Division at UW Medical Center - Montlake provides a wide range of anesthesia services, leading-edge research and advances in various areas of anesthesia. Our anesthesiologists are experts in the most advanced anesthesiology and pain management options available.

Our clinical anesthesia services include:

-Preoperative medical/surgical evaluations
-General and regional anesthetics
-Labor epidurals
-Postoperative pain management
-Acute care services
-Moderate/deep sedation services
-Transplantation anesthesia for liver and kidney transplantation

Sound Pain Solutions Bellevue serves residents throughout Bellevue, Washington and the greater Puget Sound region with comprehensive pain management solutions. As part of the Sound Pain Solutions network, our Bellevue location continues the practice's commitment to providing nonsurgical and drug-free alternatives for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Established by chiropractic physicians with over 25 years of clinical experience, our integrated approach combines evidence-based therapies designed to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Sound Pain Solutions, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates several advanced treatment modalities including non-surgical spinal decompression, high-dose laser therapy, traditional chiropractic adjustments, specialized manual therapy techniques, and customized physical rehabilitation programs. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's specific condition, health history, and recovery goals.

Advanced Treatment Technologies

Our Bellevue clinic features state-of-the-art equipment for non-invasive pain management. The non-surgical decompression therapy provides relief for patients suffering from herniated discs, degenerative disc disease, and sciatica by gently stretching the spine to relieve pressure on compressed nerves. Our high-dose laser therapy accelerates healing at the cellular level, reducing inflammation and promoting tissue repair for faster recovery times.

Expert Care Team

All treatment protocols at Sound Pain Solutions are developed and supervised by experienced chiropractic physicians who bring decades of clinical expertise to each case. Our practitioners stay current with the latest advancements in pain management through ongoing education and training, ensuring patients receive the most effective care available without resorting to surgery or prescription medications.

Visit Our Bellevue Location

Sound Pain Solutions Bellevue welcomes new patients at our convenient location at 12360 NE 8th St, Bellevue, WA 98005. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (206) 508-4463 or visit our website at soundpainsolutions.com. Our team is committed to helping you achieve lasting pain relief and return to the activities you love.

Cascade Orthopaedics in Auburn, WA has served the community with specialized orthopedic care and physical therapy services for many years. Located at 122 3rd Street NE Suite 1B and Suite 2 in Auburn, Washington 98002, this practice has been a trusted resource for patients seeking expert orthopedic treatment throughout the Puget Sound region. Unfortunately, the practice has made the difficult decision to close its doors permanently as of July 31, 2024.

For patients requiring assistance following the closure, Cascade Orthopaedics has established protocols to ensure continuity of care. If you need to contact the practice for any reason, you can reach them via email at contact@cascadeortho.net. This same email address should be used for medical records requests, which require the patient's full name, date of birth, and specific instructions on where to send or fax the records. Patients should anticipate approximately two weeks for processing of medical records requests.

Contact Details

While the physical location is no longer operational, patients can still reach out through the following channels:

  • Phone: +1 253-833-7750 (may have limited availability)

  • Email: contact@cascadeortho.net

  • Website: https://www.cascadeortho.net/

  • Former Address: 122 3rd Street NE Suite 1B, Suite 2, Auburn, WA 98002

The team at Cascade Orthopaedics expresses sincere gratitude to all patients and community members for their trust and support throughout the years of service to Auburn and surrounding communities.
column11: It is with great sadness that Cascade Orthopedics closed it's doors on 7/31/2024. If you need to contact us you can email us at contact@cascadeortho.net. Friendly staff and clean waiting area. I could have survived without the fuzzy patient complaining about the treatment costs, but it's could be worse. We could be a communist nation.|This place went out of business without notice. I can't even get access to my records including MRI. If you're looking for Dr. Martin, he is with Virginia Mason down in Bonney Lake.|Fantastic medical team! The office staff, medical professionals, and the surgery team were top notch. Dr. Smith handled my broken arm from the ER consultation through the surgery and post operative care. Great care and great results!|Dr. Smith was informative, personable, and a great listener.  She outlined a detailed care plan, with options as my symptoms might progress.  I will definitely recommend her to friends, and continue her as my care provider!|My experience is only relevant to my experience with Dr Susie Kwon. I would avoid her at all cost. I was referred to her by my PCP for chest pain. I went through 6 weeks of PT to get an MRI and she diagnosed me with something Scheuermanns Syndrome which so far has been refuted by 2 other Drs I have seen. She suggested I get trigger point injections which I did not take lightly and took my time to research the risks and ultimately decided I would be ok with trying it as a purely diagnostic tool to determine if trigger point injections in my back made the pain in my chest go away which she stated would be an appropriate diagnostic tool. I asked her at the time of I would need someone to drive me and she stated it was a simple procedure that could be done in the exam room and that she didn't need imaging and would use the bones as guide. When I arrived for my appointment, she came into the room and immediately started accusing me of making requests against her recommendations which made me feel quite confused and no longer prepared for my appointment. I asked her to treat me like an idiot and assume I know nothing because I'm just a patient and not a Dr. She insisted that she didn't need to treat me like that and that I apparently knew it all already. I regurgitated what she stated at our last appointment and she insisted she did not suggest trigger point injections per her notes and had instead suggested I go to a surgery center and get an epidural. I don't know how I would have came up with one treatment over a nother because the words are quite different. In my opinion, she had to refer to her notes because she speed visits her patients so quick that she is unable to keep up with her patients base. She always gave me the impression that she was trying to be in and out as quick as possible. We went back and forth for a bit and she reiterated that she could not and would not perform an epidural in the office which again left me confused because I did not ask for that and it was the first time I was ever hearing of it. To me where she crossed the line was stating that she couldn't do the procedure without paralyzel8ng me and asked me twice in a threatening manner if I wanted her to paralyze me right there in the exam room. It was at this point that I told her I was no longer comfortable being a patient of hers and told her she was an awful Dr that needed to work on her bedside manner. I fully intended to never go back there again. Today I received a certified letter stating they were terminating my care as if this was somehow my fault. To date this is the most bizarre medical experience I have encountered and I honestly wish I could say I was making this up. Please be careful if you find yourself under her care, trust your gut if it doesn't feel right.|I love Dr Donna Smith. She is very warmand puts  you at ease. She gives her full attention to you and your injury. You feel immediately safe, she is here to help you. My x-rayed hand and wrist were explained thoroughly and an MRI was ordered for my shoulder along with a recommendation for another wonderful shoulder Orthopedic doctor.
I will always come to her for my hand and wrist even if I move away. Thank-you Dr Donna Smith.|Dr. Smith is just wonderful.  She knows exactly how to diagnose and treat issues concerning hands.  It's so refreshing to see a doctor who can quickly identify and successfully treat an issue.  She has a wonderful manner and is such a pleasure to meet with her.  Also, the office procedures are excellent.
Thank you.|Dr. Smith already came highly recommended and great experience in her office.  Dr. Smith was very thorough and took time to explain the process and what to expect with the next step. Her assistant was very friendly, had a positive attitude and pleasure to talk to.
Office staff were positive and efficient with getting me in quickly.

Wilson Chang, M.D. serves the greater Seattle, Washington area as a distinguished Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Specialist. With a practice focused on comprehensive pain management and rehabilitation services, Dr. Chang has established himself as one of the region's most respected physicians in his specialty. His patient-centered approach combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans designed to improve mobility, reduce pain, and enhance overall quality of life.

Dr. Wilson J. Chang graduated with honors from Michigan State University College of Human Medicine in 2012, bringing more than 6 years of diverse experience to his practice. His expertise in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation has earned him recognition from peers and patients alike, including being selected by Seattle Met Magazine as a Top Doctor for multiple years.

Specialized Care

Dr. Chang's practice focuses on treating a wide range of conditions affecting physical function and mobility. His comprehensive approach addresses:

- Chronic pain management

- Sports-related injuries

- Musculoskeletal disorders

- Neurological rehabilitation

- Post-surgical recovery

Professional Affiliations

Dr. Chang is proudly affiliated with Swedish Medical Center, one of the region's premier healthcare networks. This affiliation allows him to provide patients with access to cutting-edge treatments and a multidisciplinary approach to care.

Acupuncture & Pain Management in Silverdale, Washington offers comprehensive holistic healing services to residents throughout Kitsap County. Our established practice combines traditional Eastern medicine techniques with modern therapeutic approaches to address chronic pain, stress-related conditions, and overall wellness concerns. Located in a serene clinical setting, our licensed practitioners bring decades of specialized experience to each personalized treatment plan.

At our Silverdale clinic, we provide a range of evidence-based therapies including traditional Chinese acupuncture, cupping therapy, herbal medicine consultations, and targeted pain management protocols. Each treatment begins with a thorough assessment to identify underlying imbalances contributing to your symptoms. Our practitioners specialize in addressing chronic conditions that have proven resistant to conventional treatments.

Our Approach to Wellness

We believe in treating the whole person, not just isolated symptoms. Through careful needle placement along energy meridians, our acupuncture treatments help restore proper energy flow while stimulating the body's natural healing mechanisms. Many patients report significant pain reduction, improved mobility, and enhanced overall wellbeing after completing a recommended treatment series.

Visit Our Clinic

Conveniently located at 10030 Silverdale Way NW, Suite 101, Silverdale, WA 98383, our practice offers flexible scheduling options including evening appointments. The clinic features private treatment rooms designed for comfort and relaxation. New patients are welcome, and most insurance plans with acupuncture benefits are accepted. Contact us today to begin your journey toward natural pain relief and improved health.

column2: The Back and Joint Pain Institute
column3:
The Back and Joint Pain Institute serves Tacoma, WA and surrounding communities with exceptional chiropractic care focused on non-surgical solutions for chronic pain conditions. Dr. Richard Leone brings over 50 years of clinical experience to his practice, having dedicated his career to helping patients find relief from debilitating back and neck pain without resorting to invasive procedures or medication dependence. Since establishing his practice in 1967, Dr. Leone has continuously refined his approach to incorporate the most effective evidence-based treatments for spinal conditions and neuropathy.

At The Back and Joint Pain Institute, we specialize in treating severe back and neck pain caused by bulging and herniated discs. Our practice also offers comprehensive care for patients suffering from peripheral neuropathy, providing relief from nerve pain, tingling, and numbness that can significantly impact quality of life. Dr. Leone's extensive experience allows him to develop personalized treatment plans that address the root cause of each patient's condition.

Advanced Non-Surgical Techniques

Our treatment protocols include:

- Non-surgical spinal decompression therapy that gently stretches the spine to relieve pressure on compressed discs

- Class 4 laser therapy for deep tissue healing and inflammation reduction

- Sanexas neoGen treatment for managing neuropathic pain and improving nerve function

Drug-Free Pain Management

Dr. Leone is committed to providing drug-free alternatives to pain management, helping patients avoid the risks and side effects associated with long-term medication use. Our comprehensive approach focuses on correcting underlying issues rather than simply masking symptoms, leading to more sustainable results and improved overall wellness.

Contact Information

If you're seeking a non-surgical solution to chronic back or neck pain, contact our office today to schedule a consultation:

Phone: +1 253-683-8382

Address: 1720 S 72nd St #201, Tacoma, WA 98408, United States

Website: [https://backandjointpaininstitute.com/](https://backandjointpaininstitute.com/)
column11:
Dr. Richard Leone has been a chiropractor for over 50 years since 1967 and specializes in the treatment of severe back and neck pain from bulging and herniated discs as well as peripheral neuropathy. He uses non-surgical spinal decompression, class 4 laser therapy and Sanexas neoGen treatment protocols.

If you want a drug-free and non-surgical solution to your back or neck pain please contact our office for a consultation.

Hatzakis MD serves Bellevue, Washington and surrounding communities with specialized physical medicine and rehabilitation services. Led by Dr. Michael Hatzakis, this practice offers comprehensive care for patients suffering from a wide range of musculoskeletal and neurological conditions. With a patient-centered approach and years of clinical expertise, Dr. Hatzakis has established himself as a trusted healthcare provider in the Pacific Northwest region.

Dr. Hatzakis specializes in treating numerous conditions including low back and neck pain, joint conditions affecting the shoulder, hip, and knee, as well as muscular strains and sprains. His expertise extends to nerve-related issues such as carpal tunnel syndrome, pinched nerves in the neck, back, wrists, and elbows, thoracic outlet syndrome, and migraine headaches. Patients seeking treatment for both acute injuries and chronic pain conditions find personalized care tailored to their specific needs.

Specialized Patient Care

The practice welcomes diverse patient populations, including:

  • Athletes with sports-related injuries

  • Individuals involved in automobile accidents

  • Patients with sudden onset pain

  • Those managing chronic pain conditions

  • Workers' compensation cases (both state and self-insured Labor and Industries claims)

Recognition and Expertise

Dr. Hatzakis's commitment to excellence has earned him consistent recognition from his peers. He has been nominated for the prestigious Castle Connelly Top Doctor Award annually since 2013, reflecting his standing in the medical community and dedication to providing exceptional patient care.

With a practice centered at Swedish Medical Center, Dr. David has established himself as a leading physician focused on interventional and regenerative medicine techniques. His patient-centered approach combines advanced medical expertise with a deep commitment to improving quality of life for those suffering from pain and mobility issues.

Dr. David's practice is built on a foundation of compassion, education, and understanding. "To provide compassion, education, and understanding to the patient. With a focus on interventional and regenerative medicine, our goal is to help repair and strengthen damaged tissues, provide improved pain control, and recover function for all the patents we see," states Dr. David when describing his medical philosophy. This patient-first approach ensures that each individual receives not only expert medical care but also the knowledge and support needed to participate actively in their recovery journey.

Specialized Services

Specializing in interventional and regenerative medicine, Dr. David offers innovative treatments designed to address the root causes of pain and dysfunction. His expertise includes advanced techniques that promote the body's natural healing processes, helping patients avoid more invasive procedures when possible. By focusing on repairing and strengthening damaged tissues, Dr. David's treatments aim to restore function and improve long-term outcomes rather than simply masking symptoms.

Practice Location and Accessibility

column40: I have had several consultations with Dr. David and treatments he recommended  subsequent to the consulations -- in 2009, and 2016. At each consultation I presented with very severe neck pain resulting from injuries. Specifically, in 2009 a local Chiropractor manipulated my cervical spine despite my expressed concerns about a history of episodic cervical pain, and in 2015 I sufferred a herniated disc at C4-C5 from an industrial accident caused by a careless co-worker. After each incident I chose conservative treatment though surgery had been recommended. In each instance, Epidural Steroid Injections performed by Dr. David and his team eliminated my use of very strong opioid pain medications within days, and provided for a pain-free existence thereafter -- and it is now 2024! Because of my experiences with Dr. David, I took my mother to see him for hip and lower back pain. I am confident that he will help her like he helped me -- I trust this man with my life and with those I love and care about. Dr. David is the best of the best and our community is very fortunate to have him available for our care.|I've been seeing Dr David for 7 years & he & his team or incredible. Before consulting with him I was always in severe cervical pain. At times my pain was so severe & disabling that I'd end up in the ER. Thru procedures & exercise, Dr David has been able to minimize my pain & maintain a tolerable level. I highly recommend Dr David! He has certainly improved my quality of life.|2023-01-04 I'm here to tell you Dr. David, his fellow Dr. Nixon, the amazing team of nurses, anesthesiologists and other technical folk in his clinic and surgery center are, in my opinion, absolutely phenomenal. I had two days when I had first 3 and then 4 of a total of 7 vertebrae repaired by kyphoplasty. The same day as the first group was completed, I went for a walk with my wife for almost 3 miles. The day of the second set of repairs I walked for close to 2 miles. As of this writing, practically there is essentially no pain whatsoever, and this is not quite 3 weeks out. I had never heard of this surgery and my family's history with back surgery in another state was not good, so I had some trepidation about going in for the corrections. I was given a prescription for some pain medications, but all I needed was acetaminophen (Tylenol). My discomfort was minimal and I expect at the end of my 6 weeks, I will have no problems. He also referred me to Dr. Shuhart for followup with the previously undiagnosed and untreated osteoporosis. Dr. Shuhart is also personable and knowledgeable in his own right. From personal experience, I can say you will be amazed how quickly your pain is over with these folks' intervention. Thanks, people!|Sent home from surgery with half the pain medication as my husband normally takes.  We live out of town and they did not mail the pain script in advance to account for our small town pharmacy only gets the mail 2 days a week. 3 weeks post surgery and my husband is in debilitating pain.  When I called I was told "it was taken care of" by the receptionist and never got to speak with a nurse.  Very sad.  I will not be recommending this procedure like I thought.  The trial surgery went better than this.  My heart is very broken.  Sad to see my spouse so disappointed and suffering. Call today and phone just rings until it hangs up. No answering service.|Dr. David, great presence and communication abilities.  Bedside manner is good.  However, my biggest issue with Dr. David has been his inaction and complete lack of compassion.  I ended up in his physiatry practice because of severe back and knee pain after my ulcerative colitis came back with a vengeance after 13 years in remission.  I've gotten one epidural in 3 and a half months with him that provided 2 and a half weeks of mediocre relief.  Nothing else.  I would say that this is not successful, nor acceptable treatment.  If it was another disease or problem being treated, I doubt it would be handled with this level of unempathetic apathy.|Dr. David is very poor at communicating what your problem is, the path to solving the problem and  how he intends to help you. His attitude in the surgery table is flippant and uncaring. Mine was not  a success but his disrespectful attitude is what I will remember most.|My sister has suffered for years, going from doctor to doctor. She met Dr. David and her problems are gone. He gave her an injection in her back and she is so much happier and pain free. I recommend him to everyone I know!|Dr. David is as close to perfect as it's possible to get.   Both myself and my husband have been to him.   He's easy to talk to, listens, and knows what he's doing.  Definitely a 5-star.

Northwest Pain Care serves Spokane, Washington and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. John Hatheway, our practice has established itself as a trusted resource for patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. We combine evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to help our patients regain function and improve their quality of life.

Dr. John Hatheway brings extensive training and experience to Northwest Pain Care. As a board-certified pain management specialist, he employs a multidisciplinary approach to treating complex pain conditions. Dr. Hatheway works closely with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans that address their unique needs and circumstances. His commitment to patient education ensures that individuals understand their conditions and treatment options fully.

Our Services

At Northwest Pain Care, we offer a comprehensive range of interventional pain management procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative approaches. Our team specializes in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative treatment modalities to provide effective pain relief solutions.

Location and Contact Information

Our practice is conveniently located in downtown Spokane at 421 W Riverside Ave, Suite 900, Spokane, WA 99201. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Hatheway, please call us at +1 509-863-9789. For more information about our services and team, visit our website at https://northwestpaincare.com/team/john-a-hatheway-md.

Patient-Centered Approach

Northwest Pain Care is dedicated to providing patient-centered care in a supportive environment. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, and we work diligently to help our patients achieve meaningful improvements. Our team coordinates with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure comprehensive care that addresses all aspects of our patients' health and wellbeing.

UniClinic Renton serves the Renton, Washington community with a unique approach to healthcare that bridges Eastern and Western medical traditions. Founded by Dr. Shin, this integrative practice focuses on natural healing methods that address the root causes of health issues rather than simply treating symptoms. Located in a convenient office space at 4300 Talbot Rd S, Suite 311, UniClinic has become a trusted healthcare destination for patients seeking alternatives to conventional prescription-based treatments.

At UniClinic Renton, Dr. Shin applies his extensive medical background in internal medicine, neurology, pain management, and psychology to deliver comprehensive care. Rather than relying on pharmaceutical interventions, treatments center around acupressure and other Eastern therapeutic techniques that promote the body's natural healing processes. This holistic methodology considers the interconnection between physical symptoms, emotional well-being, and overall health.

Dr. Shin's Expertise

"In my practice, I combine the best of Eastern and Western medicine to provide the best care for you," explains Dr. Shin. As a fully licensed MD with specialized training across multiple disciplines, he brings a depth of medical knowledge that informs his alternative treatment protocols. His unique approach emphasizes "no prescriptions, just healing," focusing instead on techniques that stimulate the body's inherent ability to recover and maintain wellness.

Services Offered

UniClinic specializes in treating a wide range of conditions through non-pharmaceutical methods. Patients seeking relief from chronic pain, neurological issues, stress-related ailments, and other health concerns can benefit from Dr. Shin's personalized treatment plans. Each therapy session is tailored to address individual needs, with acupressure serving as a cornerstone technique alongside other complementary modalities.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Shin, patients can call +1 425-228-7446 or visit the clinic's website at www.myuniclinic.com. UniClinic Renton welcomes new patients at their office located at 4300 Talbot Rd S #311, Renton, WA 98055, United States.
column11:
