I had pain on my lower back and leg, I didn't sleep 3 nights because it's was crazy pains, first I went to chiropractor, but he didn't do anything with that. After all I decided to try acupuncture, cause I had experience previously, so I found Dr. Shin and he fixed my pain in 2 sessions. Thank you so much Dr. Shin and his team. Great customer service, they scheduled my appointment immediately.|I'm very happy with my experience at UniClinic with Dr. Shin. He was able to cure my back pain with sciatica (radiating nerve pain to the leg) after I was more than five months in pain and I tried everything with very limited positive outcome: I tried  Spinal institute, Physical therapy (PT), pelvic floor therapy, massage therapy, chiropractic care. He is also helping to manage my migraines and headaches, and my body overall stress response, and this treatment is effective and is a good natural holistic alternative to pain management through medication. I also referred many friends to this doctor. I do not hesitate a second to recommend this doctor.|If you are looking for a non-invasive approach of treatment, Dr Shin is the specialist you need to see. From dealing with our pain to him giving acupuncture treatment, he is very personable and professional. He explains everything clearly as well as gives educated explanations of each. He is also very compassionate. You can tell he really cares for his patients and how the progress of their improvement is going.|First time went in for acupuncture due to having pain in my shoulder and neck. Other treatment has not helped in the past. The doctor use acupuncture needle to pin point the area that may cause the pain, just like the old country healing in Chinese method like I seen in movies. Within sec the pain went away. Will be returning.  I recommend Dr. Shin.|Uni Clinic is great! My son plays football, which is very hard in his body. After seeing Dr. Shin he would be in less pain. He also suffers from harsh muscle cramps and there was an improvement after seeing Dr. Shin.|It is a nice clinic to go. I like the staff there. They have good energy and willingness to help the patients. People enter there with pains but leave the clinic with better condition or pain relief. Dr. Shin doesn't give any medication and treats simptoms with acupuncture and acupressure. I recommend this clinic highly.|If you need any sort of pain management I promise this is the place to go. For many years I have been dealing with Fibromyalgia, Chronic pain constantly with no relief and past Doctors prescribing me a bunch of medications like benzodiazepines and muscle relaxers only to curb the pain only for a short period of time with no solution or becoming addicted and having chance of withdrawals and it would be an on-going cycle.
March of this year I moved to Seattle with my boyfriend and I was experiencing more Fibromyalgia Flare-Ups than normal and was becoming irritable and desperate for help. My boyfriend found Dr. Shin at UNI Clinic and made an appointment for me. At first I was skeptical because I've never had anything help my pain, but I was willing to go and see if it would help.
I have been going to see Dr. Shin for about 2 months now and his techniques with acupuncture have helped me so much and the treatments have even helped me to stop taking the controlled substances I was prescribed prior to going to UNI Clinic. I look forward to each and every appointment and this has been the only treatment that has ever worked for me. I am very grateful for Dr. Shin and his lovely Staff. If you have a family member or loved one or even yourself that deals with a huge excessive amount of pain, please take them here I promise it works wonders and truly helps.|I've had 3 shoulder surgeries and chronic headaches. After 1 visit with Dr. Shin I had ZERO pain. I've lived at a pain level of 7 for the last 4 years. I can't recommend him enough!!!

Seattle Chiropractic Spine & Injury Center has been a cornerstone of holistic healthcare in Seattle, Washington for over a decade. Established as a premier chiropractic clinic, the center has built a reputation for excellence in treating patients suffering from spine-related issues, injuries, and chronic pain conditions. Under the expert guidance of trusted chiropractors Dr. Jas Walia, DC, and Dr. Laura Fairbook, DC, the practice has become synonymous with compassionate care and effective treatment protocols.

What sets Seattle Chiropractic Spine & Injury Center apart is their commitment to precise, low-force chiropractic adjustments tailored to each patient's unique needs. Rather than applying a one-size-fits-all approach, the doctors develop personalized treatment plans with a singular focus: the complete elimination of pain. This patient-centered methodology ensures that individuals receive care specifically designed for their bodies and conditions.

Comprehensive Services for All Ages

The center proudly serves patients across all age groups, from infants and children to teenagers and adults. This inclusive approach demonstrates their versatility in addressing spinal and musculoskeletal issues at every stage of life. Whether treating sports injuries in active adults, addressing developmental concerns in children, or helping seniors maintain mobility, the team applies their expertise with the appropriate techniques for each demographic.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 905 NE 45th St Suite B, Seattle, WA 98105, the clinic is strategically positioned to serve patients throughout the greater Seattle area. Their central location makes quality chiropractic care accessible to residents from numerous neighborhoods and surrounding communities. Patients can easily schedule appointments by calling +1 206-782-9762 or visiting their comprehensive website at www.seattlechiropracticspineandinjurycenter.com, where additional information about services and treatment approaches is readily available.

column40:
I recently was in a car accident, leaving my neck, back and wrists in pretty bad shape n. Not only was I shaken up physically but also mentally as well. Dr. Walia and his staff have been an integral part in my healing process, making every appointment easy, fast, and restorative. They set me up with a treatment plan that was thorough but also flexible with my work schedule. Any time I needed to change times or make date changes, the staff at the front were more than accommodating. I was shocked by how thorough they were with taking baseline performance metrics and updating those throughout my treatment so I can see and feel real changes throughout the way. If you are ever experiencing pain, I highly highly recommend Dr. Walia and team. They will take care of you and get you back to feeling normal again, which I didn't think was possible. The Back Pain Relief Center serves Everett, WA with specialized chiropractic care focused on personalized treatment plans. Located in Snohomish County, our practice has established itself as a trusted resource for patients seeking effective solutions for back pain, neck discomfort, and related musculoskeletal issues. We recognize that finding a chiropractor who utilizes current techniques and approaches can be challenging, which is why our team stays at the forefront of chiropractic advancements to deliver optimal care.

At The Back Pain Relief & Wellness Center, we understand that although patients may share similar diagnoses, their responses to treatment can vary significantly. Our practitioners take the time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, medical history, and wellness goals before developing a customized treatment plan. This individualized approach ensures that you receive care specifically tailored to your unique physical condition and health objectives.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

We offer a wide range of evidence-based chiropractic techniques and complementary therapies designed to address the root cause of your pain, not just the symptoms. Our treatment options include spinal adjustments, therapeutic exercises, massage therapy, and guidance on ergonomics and lifestyle modifications that support long-term wellness. We firmly believe that pain-free living is possible, and we're committed to helping you achieve that reality.

Patient Education Focus

Education forms a cornerstone of our practice philosophy. We ensure all patients fully understand their current health issues and the available treatment options. This empowers you to make informed decisions about your care and actively participate in your recovery journey. Our practitioners take the time to answer questions, explain procedures, and provide resources that support your healing process.

Contact Information

Visit our welcoming facility at 3701 Colby Ave, Everett, WA 98201. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at (425) 259-3700. Additional information about our practice and treatment approaches is available on our website at www.thebackpainreliefcenter.net.
column11:

At the Back Pain Relief & Wellness Center we understand that although our patients may be diagnosed with the same condition, they can respond very differently to treatments. For this reason, we tailor a specific plan of action to meet YOUR needs, goals, and unique medical and physical condition.

The "Dr" didn't know how to work the X-ray, "couldn't remember what to set it at" I heard him say after 5 min of me sitting with small tanning glasses on my nose to "protect" my eyes as he had the machine 2 inches from my face. He kept readjusting and moving around the room all the while I'm still sitting patiently trying to figure out why he wasn't prepared for an appointment. Well, after the 5 ish min I said I got to get up and I got to go. He tried blocking the door and I said nope I'm going out. He was very hesitant about me leaving the room that was upstairs in someone's house. Don't let the pictures on the website fool you,someone converted their home into a "chiropractors office" with an X-ray machine upstairs in narrow hallways.
I made my way outside and decided never to return. Well the reason I'm writing this review is due to my bill that I just received in the mail. They billed my insurance $185 and want to charge me now for $50. For what you ask, filling out paperwork. I called and asked why I was being charged and the lady said I will definitely take that off your balance. She then went in to how the process works, which I've already told her I knew I don't need an explanation. The "Dr" was ignorant, and had no idea what he was doing. Apparently I was yelling at her even though my whole family was right there listening to me and I only got frustrated with her when she told me she's NOT going to take it off the balance because of how I'm "yelling" at her. She said she would NOW have to send it to the "Dr" to see if we can waive it due to how I'm speaking. I explained that she just said she was going to take it off, and now she's not because of how she assumed I was talking to her? She said yes. I told her to take it off or I'm going to get a lawyer, she said go ahead. Already reported to the BBB.|Dr. Keezer is incredibly helpful with my incredibly pitiful body (chronic pain) and has made it possible for me to continue my job even on my worst days!

He's been his chiropractor for 8 months now and I just set up service for myself. He's a great chiropractor. I definitely recommend him.|Dr. Keezer is incredible. column3:
Pain Management 360 serves Huntington, WV with comprehensive pain management and rehabilitation services. Located conveniently near Marshall University Football Stadium, our practice specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based, multidisciplinary approaches. Our team of physicians is both Board Certified in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation and Board Certified in Pain Management, ensuring patients receive the highest standard of specialized care for their pain concerns.

At Pain Management 360, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our integrated treatment plans address not just symptoms but the underlying causes of pain. We utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and therapeutic interventions including medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy, and rehabilitation exercises tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Specialized Expertise

Our physicians bring extensive training in both physical medicine and pain management to every case. This dual specialization allows us to offer a more complete approach to pain relief, combining rehabilitative techniques with targeted pain interventions. We treat conditions ranging from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and active participation in their treatment plans. Our goal is not just pain reduction but improved function and quality of life. Each treatment plan is developed collaboratively with patients, considering their specific goals, lifestyle needs, and long-term wellness objectives.

Visit Our Practice

Pain Management 360 is conveniently located at 551 21st St, Huntington, WV 25703, just steps away from the Marshall University Football Stadium. Our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology to provide comprehensive care in one location.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 681-378-3266 or visit our website at www.pain360.org. Our dedicated team is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.

column2: CAMC Teays Valley Pain Relief Center
column3:
CAMC Teays Valley Pain Relief Center serves Hurricane, West Virginia and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized facility is dedicated to helping patients find relief from persistent pain conditions that affect their quality of life. With a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, we combine advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment options to address the root causes of chronic pain.

At CAMC Teays Valley Pain Relief Center, our expert team can diagnose and treat chronic back, arm and leg pain, as well as headaches and migraines. We understand that chronic pain affects each patient differently, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans tailored to individual needs. Our physicians are board-certified specialists with extensive experience in pain medicine and rehabilitation.

Advanced Diagnostic Capabilities

We utilize the latest technology for accurate diagnosis, including:

  • CT scans

  • MRI imaging

  • Electromyography (EMG)

  • Comprehensive laboratory studies

  • Digital X-rays

Innovative Treatment Options

Our treatment approaches include both interventional procedures and therapeutic modalities:

  • X-ray guided therapeutic injections

  • Radiofrequency nerve ablations

  • Spinal stimulators

  • Physical therapy programs

  • Aquatic therapy

Patient-Centered Care

We believe in creating partnerships with our patients through education and shared decision-making. Our team takes the time to explain conditions, diagnostic findings, and treatment options to ensure patients are informed and comfortable with their care plan.

Contact Information

Address: 1206 Hospital Dr, Hurricane, WV 25526, United States

Phone: +1 304-757-5420

Website: https://www.camc.org/painclinic

If you're struggling with chronic pain, contact CAMC Teays Valley Pain Relief Center today to schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists.

WVU Medicine Pain Management Center serves Morgantown, WV and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our dedicated team of specialists combines evidence-based medical approaches with integrative therapies to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. As part of the larger WVU Medicine healthcare system, we leverage advanced diagnostic tools and innovative treatment protocols to improve quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain.

At the WVU Medicine Center for Integrative Pain Management, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach includes both opioid and non-opioid medical management, along with coordinated integrative care designed to address the physical, emotional, and psychological components of pain. We work closely with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving function and reducing reliance on medication when possible.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience treating a wide range of pain conditions, including:

- Back pain and Neck pain

- Spinal conditions (stenosis, herniated discs, degenerative disc disease)

- Joint pain (osteoarthritis, sacroilitis)

- Nerve-related pain (shingles, peripheral vascular disease)

- Musculoskeletal and Myofascial pain

- Head pain (cervicogenic headaches and other types)

- Internal pain (abdominal pain, chronic pancreatitis)

- Cancer-related pain

Advanced Treatment Options

Our center offers state-of-the-art interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy referrals, and complementary approaches to create comprehensive pain relief strategies. We emphasize patient education and self-management techniques to empower individuals in their healing journey.

Contact Information

Phone: +1 855-988-2273

Address: 1075 Van Voorhis Rd, Morgantown, WV 26505, United States

Website: [WVU Medicine Pain Management Center](https://wvumedicine.org/ruby-memorial-hospital/services/wvu-specialty-clinics/pain-management-center/)

We welcome new patients and referrals from healthcare providers throughout West Virginia and neighboring states. Our team is committed to improving your quality of life through effective pain management strategies.

column38: Rebecca Chadwell|Fallon Duncan|Andrea Adams|Ashley Dunn|Joanna Walton|hannah marker|Robert J Kauffelt|Michelle Nickelson
column40:
Just left this place and I don't understand it at all! I just moved here from Tampa where I saw a wonderful pain management team.
Someone warned me about this place and I should have listened. Although everyone was friendly, especially the front desk and the nurse, the Dr didn't even mention all my back problems. Just addressed the knee issue. I've been on pain medication for a while for spinal stenosis, 2 bulging discs, a spinal cord stimulator, and sciatica. I can't even sit in a chair properly due to back pain!  The Dr told me they only give pain meds to cancer patients. So then why not call it that then? Call it the cancer center. Not pain management! I was told to go swimming for rehab. Are you kidding?? He didn't even address the reason I have such bad pain in my legs at night either. And I can't even get the injection for my knee until the end of the month! Upon leaving he hands me a paper about how NOT to just stop taking your pain medication and how you should taper off.  But yet doesn't tell me how to do that or give me a script for a lower dosage. I'm not surprised AT ALL why there is such an opiate crisis here!! And why people seek out 'other' options. This is a joke! There has to be a better way of treating people here!|Only wanted to talk about my lower back touched one spot told me it was my muscles ignoring the crate that day it is not just my muscles. Gives me a note for physical therapy and tells me to come back in 3 months waste of time and money|I've debated on reviewing this place for a long time now. I guess I keep hoping things will get better. However, this office has shown me that better is not an option. First off everyone should be made aware that you will not see a doctor at each visit. You will see the doctor for your first appointment and for any injections or procedures. Other than that, you see a nurse practitioner. Now i genuinely believe that these NP's have had the new opiate prescribing guidelines drilled into their head so much that they don't know how to deal with patients who do not take them.

So, what do they do? They rely on patient ignorance while withholding and refusing and all treatments.
I have had them tell me (attitude indluded)
"Your at your maximum dose" (without me even asking for an increase) or my personal favorite,
"there isn't anything else we can give you!"
This last one is usually followed by the doctor coming in and contradicting every one of the nurses claims.

Further proof of this was presented to me two weeks ago. A few months ago I started seeing a new NP who was awesome! She actually took great care of me. She listened to me and remembered everything I told her. She was willing to go down every avenue to find the root cause of my problem. She never once made false promises .
I just found out she no longer employed at their facility...

During my seeing her, she told me we could go up on my lidocaine patches if need be. At the time i did not need it. I've since endured a few surgeries and realized i could really use an extra lidocaine patch. I contacted my new PA and what does she say?
"I'm sorry, one patch is the maximum dose".

So i told her what the doctor told me in the hospital. "Actually 3 is the maximum dose".

So i get a message back (attitude included) "I've sent a new prescription for 3 patches to your pharmacy"

That was not my intention but it was just further proof that they count on patient ignorance so they do not have to provide treatment.
Why they do this to those of us who do not use opiates is beyond me but given the fact that the waiting room always seems to be full of elderly patients who look so pained, I'm sure this treatment is harming more people than just me.

Edit: since writing this email my doctor has been switched 2 more times. The first time was as all the others had been. The second time the NP was awesome and again, wanted to get to the root cause so he could properly treat me. That was for about six months which is oddly similar to the last NP who wanted to do more than deny treatment. Now I've been told he's gone too and once again i've been switched to someone else.|I have wasted 3 months of my life at this clinic. I have been experiencing neck and upper back pain for the last 9 months. At the 6 month mark, I had my first visit. I was told the doctor, chiropractor, and movement therapist would work together to best help me recover. That was not true at all. The movement therapist gave me exercises to do and 2 weeks later the chiropractor told me to stop doing them. After waiting almost a month, I had trigger point injections in my left trap & left upper back region. I did not feel any relief. Two weeks later I had my follow up with the doctors PA and I asked for more injections. She refused that request & told me to go to talk therapy to help cope with the pain or go to another clinic. She said she would talk to the doctor about my treatment plan moving forward. 2 weeks passed and I heard nothing back. I sent a message on MyChart and did not receive any response until a week and a half later. He told me the same thing his PA had said. After 6 rounds of acupuncture, the chiropractor recommended injections in my neck. I told him the doctor refused to do them and the chiropractor said he didn't have contact with the doctor and his hands were tied. Once again I reached out to the doctor to ask for this treatment. His reply was to have another follow up in 2 weeks to discuss the possibility of more injections. I felt like they were just prolonging the process to make me come in for more visits. At this point I was fed up and decided to try another clinic. After my first visit at the new clinic the doctor said I needed multiple sessions of injections in my neck, both traps, and upper back, along with physical therapy. Do not make the same mistake and I did and believe this Pain Clinic has your best interest!!|I have seen Dr. Carpenter a total of 4 times and have yet to receive any pain relief of any kind.  The administrative staff and nurses are absolutely wonderful and incredibly helpful. After my first appointment, she tried to transfer me to another doctor, and the only reason she agreed to see me again is because I wrote a strongly worded message about being shuffled around to another doctor.  As with other doctors I have dealt with at WVU, the notes put in my file are only partially true.  The only action Dr. Carpenter would take is to give me a diagnostic nerve block in my back, even though I've had 4 of them so far.  I have major, untreated anxiety and mental illness which was not taken into consideration at all.  Nerve blocks are one of the most painful things I've ever gone through, they actually make my back pain worse, to the point where I can't walk for a day or two after.  The first block I was scheduled for, was cancelled when I got there due to reasons I was not informed about ahead of time, after I drove an hour each way.  After only getting 2 hours of sleep, fasting, and having to drive an hour each way, my anxiety was sky high for the second procedure.  At the beginning of the procedure, I informed staff that I was having a bad time and was completely disregarded.  She then got quite upset when I had a neurodivergent meltdown due to pain, fear, and anxiety and callwd her a cunt due to her hateful behavior.|Do not visit this clinic. My husband was refered here by another clinic that was wonderful because they were unable to do injections and this office could and it was closer to us as we live in PA but he got hurt in WV. He came here the first time and was told to wait 6 weeks and do physical therapy if he could. And then we came back to get his full release to work since the pain was managable and he couldn't afford anymore time off and after calling first to make sure they could do it. We drove the hr+ here only for the doctor to say she wouldn't sign the release he needed to go back to the first clinic for that. So he had 2 visits here and they did absolutely nothing.  But recommend more appointments. They're just looking to charge you for appoinments but not actually trying to help. They seriosuly couldn't tell us over the phone he needed to go back to the first clinic. But instead had us drive over and hour to get here and pay for an appointment  to be seen for 2 minutes where they did nothing but tell him to go back to the first place because she won't lift his restrictions which is what he asked if they could do over the phone before we drove here. Why did we have to pay for an appointment for that? They don't want to help anyone and they just want money from as many appointments as they can book!|I went in for a epidural in my lower back. But, evidently is was above Kelsey Bauer's skill level.  After three very painful attempts, she said, "if you want I can try again." I told her no, she should be able to do her job on the first attempt. After I declined to let her continue to inflict pain on me, they gave me no advice on what I should do next. Instead, they rushed me out like they were trying to hide the evidence of their incompetence's. All they've done so far is inflict more pain then they have relieved. On top of that Kelsey Bauer lied on the mychart results and said she only attempted the injection two times.  She must of forgot I was there also and that I can count.  She tried a minimum of three times, more likely four.  Either way don't let them do anything to you!!

****Update!!!! on my follow up appointment!

Well it went just like I thought it would! They were more worried about protecting their reputation then helping me with my pain. They called me unprofessional for pointing out that one of their doctors couldn't do what they were supposed to do. Then they started throwing around all the "gas light" phrases about me. They said I cursed at the doctor during my procedure. I did say $h*t, but it was not not directed at anyone.  I said it because she was inflicting a great deal of pain on me. Again, they had a lot of excuses, and how I was wrong, but no apology, they blamed me for their failure. Draw your own conclusions.|Our healthcare system is BROKEN and the providers that judge and talk condescending to the patients is inappropriate. I left the clinic crying in pain.  When a patient leaves a PAIN clinic crying in pain there is a HUGE problem.  I begged for help.  I said I am not here for drugs I am here for relief! The doctor was unbelievably rude and had ZER0 empathy... dont even bother...

Malayil Pain Management in Huntington, WV offers comprehensive pain treatment solutions for patients throughout the Tri-State area. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Rudy Malayil, MD, our practice specializes in interventional pain management techniques that address both acute and chronic pain conditions. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, developing customized treatment plans that combine cutting-edge medical interventions with holistic care strategies.

At our state-of-the-art facility located at 551 21st St in Huntington, West Virginia, we provide a wide range of specialized treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Dr. Malayil brings extensive training and experience in addressing complex pain conditions such as failed back surgery syndrome, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and cancer-related pain.

Patient-Focused Care

We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our team is committed to providing compassionate care in a comfortable environment. Our comprehensive evaluation process ensures we identify the root causes of your pain, not just the symptoms. This thorough approach allows us to develop effective treatment strategies that improve functionality and quality of life.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Malayil, please call us at +1 917-935-7788 or visit our website at https://www.pain360.org/ for more information about our services. Our clinic is conveniently located at 551 21st St, Huntington, WV 25703, with accessible parking and accommodations for patients with mobility challenges. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to ensure our patients receive the care they need with minimal financial burden.

West Virginia Pain Institute serves Beckley, WV and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded by board-certified physicians dedicated to improving quality of life, our institute combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why our multidisciplinary approach focuses on both symptom relief and addressing underlying causes.

At West Virginia Pain Institute, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. column40: I have been a patient of Dr Yee's for 2 years, he has helped my back pain several times over the years. Dr Yee and the procedures are great, but on the other hand you can never get a hold of the office staff. I literally had to fax a note over with a call back number to get a response one time. I had been going there for 2 years and had one conversation with that power-trip supervisor that was very hateful and rude and got a certified letter kicking me out of the pain clinic, signed by Dr Yee and dated for the day I called. 2 years attending a place you would think you know a persons character to at least question the story told. The only negative thing I can really say about Dr Yee, is he doesn't really have your back, pun intended... I have been going for 2 years and have never had an issue with the clinic until 10/07? Was it me or was it her? According to some of the other comments hateful office staff is trending..... not Holly Brittany or PA Will they have always been so nice|My doctor a neurologist has been trying for 2 weeks to get me in this place to put a back stimulator on me for chronic back problems.  They will not call me doctors office back nor me.  My doctor is the best in charleston and this place is the most disrespectful I have encounter.|My elderly Mom had an appointment at this institute today, the Doctor has always been very nice to her. But today a nurse was throwing things, yelling, being very disrespectful and rude. A front office employee said he's like this all the time (the nurse). Why would any employer allow this to happen? It was sad to find out that my Mom who has been in pain to encounter such a rude and unprofessical person. The employees are being exposed to aggressive pressure or intimidation, which is workplace harassment and the verbal abuse toward the patients, which goes against the The Code of Ethics for Nurses that was developed as a guide for carrying out nursing responsibilities in a manner consistent with quality in nursing care and the ethical obligations of the profession..|The staff that installed the pain management device in my mother were cold and heartless. No compassion for a 87 year old dying woman. Refused to turn the device on and refused to show me how it operated. She's out of pain now and I can only hope karma visits this particular staff.|I have been seen in this office for years. I've had multiple treatments that have helped  me soooo much. Recommend them highly. column40:
The only reason I gave one star is cause no stars aren't an option. Office staff is extremely rude. They schedule and reschedule and don't let you know till the day before or day of. Witnessed one of the registering ladies being rude to an older lady that couldn't hear and had asked again where to go. Got in the back the guy that led us to the exam room was rude as hell and kept interrupting us and chewing gum as loud as he could and walked out when we asked him to stop. Dr karrs came in for a very brief 10 min at the most said what he was going to proceed with and walked out. I transferred here from KY and boy am I sorry I left my pain management dr there. Nobody returns calls or answers phones. Never have I seen office staff like this in all my life.|Unbelievably RUDE office staff! They do not follow up
with insurance for prior authorization requests, and they require you to keep to keep calling incessantly to try to make new appointments if insurance does not approve procedures. When you finally do get through to a person, you are talked down to, talked over, and I was even transferred in the middle of speaking today! Ive been put off for months at a time for appointments and procedures. Every time I go in, it's like starting over again as a new patient, and even with insurance I somehow end up paying $600+ per visit, for "approved" procedures! That is after waiting up to 3 hours at every appointment! People with chronic pain conditions struggle with that!   This place is a straight-up JOKE! I'm done with them! They do not care. No wonder WV is in the shape it is in. Places like this are contributing to the failure of decent healthcare for WV folks.|Dr Deer is great. However the rest of the staff there is extremely rude and has no interest in your well being. They couldn't care less what you have to say. Just keep coming back for shots over and over. I have four bulging/ruptured discs in my back and was told I have no reason to get another MRI use an ice pack and keep coming back for shots. Even after I told the NP I could barely walk now and my pain had changed and my leg was going numb. Glad I followed my instinct and got an MRI. My regular doctor referred me to Cleveland Clinic.|I have been seeing Dr.Grace for over two years wich is q outstanding Doctor. However he wanted to do a procedure that required a prior authorization from his staff to obtain every apointment fir 7 month's he kept asking about it and his staff kept saying they we're awaiting ro here from my insurance for the approval. Finally he when and asked them and they never even sent the referral. They were waiting for me to bring in forms that had been in my file since day one. The whole time I am in a lot of pain. Then he did a referral to repeat injections when it was approved i got a appointment date but I emediatly called to reschedule I had a apointment on the same day. Didnt here from them called 3 times. Called and even spoke with his nurse. Never hered from them. Upset I tryed to go without any meds for my back for almost 6 months. Till I fell and hurt my back badly. I called and spoke with Dr Grace's nurse and she got me a appointment next day. I went in to my surprise I wasnt seeing Dr Grace and the lady I say was rude not caring I explained to her how much I was hurting way more then when I started coming I told her about the bad fall and she did not order a exray or seem concerned at all. She actually told me a would have to go to ER for paintreatment and they couldn't write me nothing any way till I passed a drug test I said thats fine give me one now but she said it would take two weeks. I told her I was in so much pain. She didnt care. She even asked me why a facial surgen 4 months ago wrote me pain meds thats when I told her I had facial surgery and was admitted to the hospital for 3 days due to a abscess that was blocking my airway. She was.very rude and treated me like a druggie. Thats when I told her I havent even been taking meds for my back for 6 months And I have never failed a test in my life. I was upset and ealked out due to the uncaring and unprofessional altitude. I left ther whent straight to my familie Dr. And they ordered a MRI that showed more damage and the reason I was in so much more pain is because of a new bulge in my disk.  I called back and treyed to tell Dr Grace what happened and how I was treated. I talked to his nuse and she told me he would not see me again. And that I sounded high. Dr Grace knows I cut my meds in half I woulnt even take a whole one. This not his fault but he should get better staff.|They will not return phone calls.  I have left a messages about 5 times invtwo months and the procedure nurse will nit return my calls.  The last call is to the office manager and so far, have not heard back from that person either.  I triec to get referred to a different location, but was denied because i have been seen at St. Francis.|The injections in my neck were ineffective after two shots at $170 co pay I decided not to get any more, after talking to the lady with scheduling she said that they would try another type which is a nerve block but when they called to confirm it I was informed that my co pay was $4000 which is more than I can afford being on disability. I don't understand why they charge you so much.|We had an appointment and after waiting 2 hours and filling out a ream of paperwork we were told that we would not be seen as my husband had been seen previously at another pain clinic where one of the other physicians worked.  We were not getting any relief from the things they were doing at the other clinic and were looking for some relief.  Dr. Kim was recommended by our family doctor and he made the referral.  What a disappointment we received.|I started out with Dr. Chong Kim, who was very nice, very kind and explained each procedure as he went along. I was so disappointed when he moved to Cleveland but then I was scheduled with Dr. Christopher Kim and he picked up where Dr. Chong Kim left off! He is very knowledgeable, takes time to explain procedures and answers all my questions. I feel very fortunate to have Dr. Kim as my Dr. Everyone from check in, all the girls in the surgical center and checking out were all very nice. I think this is a great place and would definitely recommend!  :)

Established as a premier medical practice in the Ohio Valley region, our clinic specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions through innovative, minimally invasive techniques. Our board-certified physicians combine decades of experience with cutting-edge technology to develop personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Located conveniently in Weirton's medical district, we've built our reputation on compassionate care and successful patient outcomes.

At Three Rivers Spine and Pain Medicine, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic approaches designed to improve quality of life for patients suffering from persistent pain. Our services include spinal cord stimulation, epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, joint injections, and comprehensive medication management. Rivers Edge Pain Relief in Wheeling, West Virginia stands as the Ohio Valley's premier interventional pain medicine program. Dedicated to addressing chronic pain at its source, our specialized team focuses on identifying the root causes of your discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms. We serve patients throughout the greater Wheeling area with comprehensive diagnostic evaluations and targeted treatment plans designed to restore quality of life and functional mobility.

At Rivers Edge Pain Relief, we understand that pain is complex and unique to each individual. Our practice is committed to finding out where and why you're experiencing pain, then taking methodical steps to identify and treat your specific painful condition(s). Using advanced diagnostic techniques, our specialists work diligently to pinpoint the exact source of your discomfort, whether it stems from nerve damage, musculoskeletal issues, or other underlying conditions.

Cutting-Edge Treatment Options

We pride ourselves on utilizing 21st century treatments and technologies to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective pain management. Our interventional procedures may include nerve blocks, epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other minimally invasive techniques designed to provide lasting relief while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Care

Every treatment plan at Rivers Edge Pain Relief is tailored to address your specific needs and goals. Our compassionate team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly explain your condition, and discuss all available treatment options. We believe in empowering patients through education and collaborative decision-making.

Contact Information

column48: WILL TREATMENT HELP ME AVOID SURGERY?
column49: With any treatment option the outcome and sustained results are dependent on the extent of the injury. In the case of mild arthritis, therapy could potentially prevent the development of further degeneration. In advanced arthritic degeneration the goal would be to minimize pain and improve function. PRP therapy could highly increase the ability to avoid surgery such as joint replacements.

Saldanha Francis Dr Charleston Pain Management serves the Charleston, West Virginia area with specialized pain management solutions designed to address chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated medical team combines years of clinical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Located in a convenient Charleston setting, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for those suffering from persistent pain conditions that affect daily functioning and quality of life.

At our practice, we offer a wide range of advanced interventional procedures tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our specialized treatments include:

  • Spinal Cord Stimulators - Advanced technology that delivers mild electrical impulses to interrupt pain signals

  • MILD Procedures - Minimally invasive lumbar decompression for spinal stenosis relief

  • Epidural Injections - Targeted medication delivery to reduce inflammation and pain

  • Nerve Blocks - Precise injections that interrupt pain transmission pathways

  • Radiofrequency Ablation - Using heat to disable specific nerves causing pain

  • SI Joint Fusions - Stabilization procedures for sacroiliac joint dysfunction

  • PRP Injections - Platelet-rich plasma therapy particularly effective for knee pain

  • Ketamine Infusions - Alternative treatment for depression (please note: not covered by insurance)

Our Approach to Patient Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our patient-centered approach focuses on developing individualized treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional components of pain. While not all our physicians perform pain device implants, we maintain a strong referral network to connect you with the appropriate specialist when needed.

Facility and Location

Our clean, modern facility at 2335 Chesterfield Ave #302, Charleston, WV 25304 is designed with patient comfort and safety in mind. We maintain rigorous standards to ensure you receive the highest quality care in a welcoming environment.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services:

Phone: +1 304-925-3535

Website: https://wvkit.com/

At Saldanha Francis Dr Charleston Pain Management, we're committed to helping you find relief from chronic pain and improving your overall quality of life through expert care and innovative treatments.

Not all our physicians perform pain device implants, but we can connect you with the right specialist. Our clean, safe facility ensures high-quality care, focused on restoring your quality of life.

I attended NYU Grossman School of Medicine, I am keenly aware of quality care. My girlfriend unfortunately succumbed to rectal cancer metastasis. One of the kindest and most compassionate physicians I have ever known gave her as much freedom from chronic pain as is possible while allowing her to maintain reasonable coherence. I am grateful to the moments he spent speaking reassurance to her heart and peace to her mind. Her battle was hard and her journey long, but my friend Dr. Ozturk made it bearable. (The only reason my husband had to discontinue Dr. A.Ozturk's treatment was after my husband's fifth year of treatment was my husband's health insurance no longer offered pain management as an alternative medicine. Otherwise, the charges for the pain management was an "out of pocket" expense.) Dr. Ozturk and his staff gave my husband excellent care. Dr Ozturk would explain exactly what and why he was doing a specific procedure and what kind of results he hoped to achieve. Pain Care PLLC in Huntington, WV is a specialized medical practice dedicated to comprehensive pain management services for residents throughout the Tri-State area. Established with a patient-centered approach, our clinic combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help individuals suffering from chronic, acute, and post-surgical pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians and experienced healthcare professionals work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

At Pain Care PLLC, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. Our specialists are trained in the latest techniques and technologies to provide effective relief while minimizing dependency on opioid medications whenever possible. We treat various conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Focused Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our compassionate team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment strategies that align with your goals and lifestyle. We emphasize education and self-management techniques to empower our patients in their journey toward improved function and quality of life.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 1623 13th Ave, Huntington, WV 25701, our modern facility is designed with patient comfort in mind. We offer convenient scheduling options and work with most major insurance providers to ensure accessible care for our community. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 304-526-2243.

Our Commitment

Pain Care PLLC is committed to providing the highest standard of pain management care in a supportive, respectful environment. We continuously update our knowledge and techniques to offer the most current and effective treatment options available. Our goal is not just to reduce pain, but to help restore function and improve overall quality of life for our patients.

column40:
I'm not directly involved, but I must say that I have never felt left out or in doubt of what's happening. Staff, you are awesome. Great job, thank you.|I recently had an appointment with a pain specialist, Mr. Tracey Sherman, PA-C, and I regret to say that it was a deeply frustrating and disappointing experience. As someone who has been struggling with chronic pain, I understand the importance of effective communication and empathy in healthcare, but unfortunately, Mr. Sherman fell short in this regard.

From the moment I entered the clinic, it was evident that Mr. Sherman was more interested in rushing through the appointment than in genuinely listening to my concerns. His demeanor seemed detached and distracted, and it was clear that my pain and discomfort were not his priority.

Throughout the appointment, I attempted to explain the nuances of my pain, its impact on my daily life, and the treatments I had previously tried. However, Mr. Sherman continuously interrupted me, cutting me off mid-sentence and redirecting the conversation to what seemed like a predetermined treatment plan. This lack of active listening made me feel dismissed and undervalued as a patient.

What was most distressing about this experience was that Mr. Sherman's inability to listen resulted in a treatment plan that did not address my specific needs. He seemed more interested in pushing his preferred approach rather than tailoring a solution that considered my unique circumstances.

Chronic pain is a complex and deeply personal experience, and a successful pain specialist must be willing to engage in a meaningful dialogue with their patients to understand the full scope of their condition. Mr. Sherman's lack of attentiveness left me feeling unheard and left me without the relief I had hoped to find.

I left the appointment disheartened, frustrated, and concerned about my ongoing pain management. A strong doctor-patient relationship built on open communication is vital when dealing with chronic pain, and it is disheartening when a medical professional fails to meet this expectation. I sincerely hope that Mr. Sherman can work on his listening skills and consider the unique needs of his patients in the future to provide more effective and empathetic care.|Wonderful, compassionate, caring facility. I wouldn't go anywhere else. I made that mistake once, never again! Dr. Dodrill is the best.!|Wife and I went to get covid tested. She went to clarksburg, I went to West Milford. She has yet to get results back. I got mine today. She waited over 2 hours for them to swab her. I waited 10 min at West Milford. Nice staff, quick appointments. All around an excellent experience.|As far as common cold or a referral if a specialist is needed I'd say I'd give a recommendation. However, I've watched my parents suffer going through additional testing to confirm issues we knew they had,  all the while having more problems because of side effects and being worse off than they started out with.  Circles.|Great staff, Physicians, all round  pleasant and professional experience. Other than the drive I'm glad they are in my circle of care.|THEY WILL JUST TAKE YOUR PILLS OFF YOU AND YOU TO GO THROUGH WITHDRAWAL AND THEY DO NOT CARE
NOW THEY WILL TELL YOU A DIFFERENT STORY TO MAKE THEM LOOK GOOD|

Deer Timothy R MD serves patients throughout Charleston, West Virginia with exceptional pain management care. As a distinguished physician at the Charleston Area Medical Center, Dr. Deer has established himself as a leading specialist in interventional pain medicine. His practice combines cutting-edge techniques with compassionate patient care to address chronic pain conditions that affect quality of life. Dr. Deer's approach emphasizes minimally invasive procedures and comprehensive treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Deer offers a wide range of specialized treatments for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. His expertise includes spinal cord stimulation, intrathecal drug delivery systems, peripheral nerve stimulation, and various interventional procedures designed to provide relief when traditional methods have failed. Patients with complex pain syndromes, failed back surgery syndrome, complex regional pain syndrome, and neuropathic pain conditions particularly benefit from his advanced approach to pain management.

Practice Information

Dr. Timothy R. Deer practices at the Charleston Area Medical Center, located at 400 Court St, Charleston, WV 25301. Patients seeking consultations or appointments can contact his office directly at +1 304-347-6120. His affiliation with CAMC provides patients access to comprehensive medical resources and support services. For more information about Dr. Deer's credentials, specialties, and approach to pain management, prospective patients can visit his profile at https://www.camc.org/doctors/timothy-ray-deer-md.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Deer's practice is his commitment to patient education and involvement in treatment decisions. He takes time to thoroughly explain pain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed choices about their care. His multidisciplinary approach often incorporates physical therapy, medication management, and interventional procedures to address pain from multiple angles, maximizing the potential for successful outcomes.
column38: Mandy Hope For A Simple Life|Vicki Horn|Carmen Hamilton|Al Day|Becky Sarrett-Cloonan|Karen Melton|Jayla Housley|LaDell Hanson
column40:
My mom is a long time patient of Dr. Deer. She loved him but had trouble with the travel (3hrs) to see him so changed to Morgantown in 2018. Well that was a big mistake. She has a spinal stimulator, pain pump and very complicated history from sarcoma, nerve damage and a hemipelvectomy. Fortunately she went back yesterday to Dr. Deer and was referred to a Neurosurgeon in Durham. I cannot thank him enough for his kind treatment of my parents and his glimmer of hope to find something to help her pain once and for all. AND not only did he offer to speak personally to  the neurosurgeon about her case but they already contacted the NC office and NC called to schedule a consult. Blows my mind with gratitude. I could cry. When someone you love is suffering and you feel powerless to find a solution and a doctor listens to their story, has compassion and tries to help find a solution it's a beautiful thing!! Thank you many times over Dr. Deer and his whole office team.|Saw Dr. Deer years ago (either Spring 2002 or 2003) when I was in excruciating pain and no one could determine the cause or how to help. I am know for being VERY precise and detail oriented. I had even taken a written copy of when my pain began, type of pain, severity of pain, as well as the limitations that resulted from it (I was already using a cane to walk). I asked if he wanted to keep the copy of my history because I had more copies at home, however, he declined my offer. He did, however, give me an injection which helped me finish the school year but when I went back 6 weeks later he told me there was nothing else he could do to help me. Even when I told him the injection had made the pain at least bearable he refused to give me another one, nor did he refer me to any other specialist. Before I left I requested a copy of my records. When I read the entire report TWICE I called his office and told the receptionist it was urgent that I speak with Dr. Deer. He did return my call later that day and I informed him that I was confused and upset because his report was completely incorrect. I went over point by point what I had told him during initial appointment and that I wanted his report redone to state the actual information I had given him. He bluntly told me that he records every intake interview (and I did recall he had activated a recording device) and that his report reflected what I had told him. I again told him the report was NOT correct and I wanted it redone to state what I had actually told him and informed him that I still had the written statement I had brought with me for the initial appointment and had offered to leave with him. At that time Dr. Deer stated that his report was an official document and could not be changed, nor did he give me a reason why it could not be changed. However, he did say that I was welcome to bring in my written version and it would be stapled to the back of his report. I found Dr. Deer to have a cavalier attitude concerning this discrepancy, as well as no concern about my continued pain as he did not offer to refer me to any other pain management doctor or any other type of specialist, basically leaving me to deal with the pain on my own. I was referred to Dr. Deer by my PCP at the time, however, I am unable to verify or denounce his skill as a pain management specialist because all he did was give my one injection then refused to continue treating me or give me a referral to any other specialist when I returned in six weeks for my follow up appointment. I will add that since Dr. Deer is still a practicing pain management specialist twenty two years after my unfortunate experience with him he must be helping some patients who are suffering from pain.|I've been a patient for more than a decade and I have had nothing but wonderful experiences. Dr. Deer is extremely knowledgeable and truly cares for his patients.|Amazing physician, I've been given a second chance at life it seems. Thanks to Dr. Deer and the pain injections I'm able to work, sleep and be in a good mood for the first time in years. I can't say enough positive things about him and his team, I havent had this many pain free days since my early 20's. Thank you Dr Deer !|Due to permanently damaged nerves in my spine I have been a patient of Dr Deer for over ten years.  I was impressed Day 1 with him & his attitude about treating chronic pain.  He DOES NOT push pain meds but offers alternative methods. I fully trust Dr Deer's advice decision's & referrals.  It's wonderfu to have a doctor you feel safe in their care. I recommend Dr Deer to everyone.  He won't give up till he finds a way to help you.|Dr. Slater was extremely rude. We waited over 2 hours to be seen then we hear him ask the nurse "what am i supposed to do" as she was giving report on my daughter. He then enters the room and rudely asks us "why am I here". He did not do any assessment on her and said there was nothing he can do. Truly the worst experience. My daughter is disabled and suffers 24/7. Even if he couldn't help her he could have at least been kind. As I tell my patients, never pay someone to be rude to you. That's really all we paid for.|I've been going to this clinic and seeing Dr. Deer for 8 years. Today I went in for an appointment and I had the worst experience ever. The receptionist AMY MARKS was very rude and unprofessional with me.  If she don't like her job she needs to find a new one or not be at the front desk or answer phones ... Every time we come it's the  same problem. Dr Deer is a great physician but his receptionist Amy marks needs to go retire or retrained she's brining him down.|Dr. Deer has helped me so much with my pain.  I have a burst T12 vertebrae and some nerve damage so he gave me a Spinal Cord Stimulator.  It has helped me deal with my pain.  He is also so friendly and compassionate.  He seems to really care about you.   I would recommend any of my family and friends to him.

Sincerely
Helen LaDell Hanson

Pain Management 360 in Charleston, West Virginia serves as a premier destination for comprehensive pain relief solutions. Under the expert leadership of Dr. Rudy Malayil, a board-certified specialist in both Pain Medicine and Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation, our practice delivers personalized care that addresses the root causes of chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our approach focuses on restoring function and improving quality of life through evidence-based treatments and compassionate care.

At Pain Management 360, we treat a diverse range of conditions including persistent back pain, debilitating neck pain, radiating sciatica, complex pelvic pain, and limiting spinal stenosis. Our treatment protocols are designed to provide both immediate relief and long-term management strategies. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation to determine the most effective approach for their specific condition.

Advanced Treatment Options

We offer cutting-edge interventional procedures including:

  • Radiofrequency Ablation - Targeted thermal treatment to interrupt pain signals

  • Spinal Cord Stimulation - Advanced neuromodulation for persistent pain

  • Targeted Nerve Blocks - Precise injections to reduce inflammation and pain

Personalized Care Approach

Every patient at Pain Management 360 benefits from a customized treatment plan developed by our expert physicians. We believe in collaborative care that empowers patients to participate actively in their recovery journey. Our goal is not just pain reduction but helping you return to the activities you love with improved mobility and comfort.

Visit Our Practice

Located at the Day Surgery Center, 2335 Chesterfield Ave, Charleston, WV 25304, our facility offers a comfortable environment equipped with state-of-the-art technology for diagnosis and treatment. Contact us at (681) 378-3266 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.

Learn more about our comprehensive services at pain360.org, where you can also request appointments and access patient resources.

column40:
Dr Mike refuses dope seekers and absolutely plays by the rules. The bad reviews here must have a problem with that.  If your pain is cooked up and not legitimate, he won't help you and will send you home empty handed. He also will call you in unexpectedly, count your pills, test your urine, check your medical history, past (and present) prescription history, and psychological history. Anything odd and you're cut off. He also will cut your meds back if your medical reports dont match your complaining. He will NOT play your games.
However, if you have real chronic pain from a real medical condition, follows the rules, and have no problem abiding by the strict state policies, he's a godsend. He has helped me for years lead a productive life. I've never once had an issue with him or anyone in the building. Dr Mike is genuinely concerned with your well-being, is an excellent doctor, and goes beyond his call of duty. He will help you find specialists and solutions when primary care physicians wont. The rehabilitation clinic is excellent. With health insurance, my balance is always less than $20 a visit. The only downside is the waiting room wait can be long at times. Early AM appointments are best. Expect hour-long appointments and follow-ups every 30 days.|Got hit with a car when I was 12 and my back and hip has continually gotten worse over the years so. Ow at 52 it hurts a lot and I can't move like I should be able to.  Dr Mike and staff has helped me more than I can explain and at least I can move without hurting as much.  If you are just looking for a pill doctor your at the wrong place, he is a very caring doctor and for the most part the staff is also great.  If they aren't then maybe they are just having a bad day as we all do.|I have seen this Doctor for years. Staff was always very nice and helpful though.|ThisMedical Ethics

An important division of the AMA, the Ethics Group works to improve patient care and the health of the public by examining and promoting physician professionalism. If you're looking for guidance or insight to ethical issues in medicine today, the AMA Ethics Group offers relevant resources to help you such as the Code of Medical Ethics.

The AMA Ethics Group is responsible for helping establish ethical policies, developing educational programs and pursuing scholarly research of ethical issues in medicine that practicing physicians are likely to encounter in their training and daily practice.

*AMA Council on Ethical and Judicial Affairs
*AMA Ethics Resource Center
*AMA Institute for Ethics

At the time, I'd been experiencing mid to moderate back pain for several years.  I stressed in my appointment that my pain was NOT in my spine, but rather in the lower back muscles away from my spine.

Dr. Tune commenced (and rightfully so, in my opinion) a round of diagnostic facet block injections for me.  It was important to rule in or out arthritic causes of my pain.  But the injections didn't stop my pain; instead, having needles forced in to my muscles was in itself horribly painful (I remember vividly lying on that table with a needle in my back muscles and wailing and sobbing with pain).  There's a reason for these tests, and that's to see if your pain is coming from your spine.  If it is, then good for you, because Dr. Tune et alhave a surgical answer for that.

BUT, if your pain does NOT have a clear, operable source, prepare to be written off, shunned, and discarded.  I've yet to hear from a chronic pain patient who was helped by Dr. Tune.  While his badge might say "Pain Relief", the truth is that he c@n only provide pain relief IF your cause of pain is an easily identifiable entrapment or the like.

Dr. Tune WILL NOT treat you for chronic pain that has no known cause and isn't treatable by shots or the like.  And (at least from my experience), he will NOT prescribe pain medication.  So, you should see Dr. Tune IF:  your pain is not chronic; you have free time to undergo multiple diagnostic shots; and if you think that diagnostic facet block injections will help you find the source of your pain (I recommend these, without doubt, and recommend Dr. Tune for these...they're important and frankly, required for any long-term pain patient.)

My biggest complaint of Dr. Tune (and, in my world, is s huge and non-negotiable complaint) is his choice to not prescribe ANY opioid painkillers.  At least, that's what I was told.  Even a layman can tell you that if you have a patient eith chronic pain, and (AND THIS IS HUGE) that patient seemingly suffers du to their pain, IF you are a properly certified doctor, you offer pain relief for that person. What you don't do is hide behind laws that specifically do NOT exclude you as a prescriber, and you pony up and fill the scripts you're given.

Okay, I'm tired,  of fightIng, of pronouncing my case. I hope you gain from it.|Long wait time in waiting room(55 minutes). Long wait time after taken back to private room(30 minutes and he was sitting around the corner working on paperwork and didn't not apologize for the wait)
Spent 7 minutes in room
Seemed to have general protocol for doing things but none extra
When he was finished, he shut the door without any instruction. I didn't need to get dressed or do anything so I was confused. Finally I opened the door and he peeked around the corner and told me to go schedule.
Will see how he carries out his typical protocol and review again later.
Personally, glad I don't have to get anything major done such as surgery at this point. If that were the case, I'd probably see who else was available before going to him or seek a second opinion after going to him.

With his fellowship training and expertise in interventional pain management techniques, Dr. Nguyen has established himself as a trusted healthcare provider in Northern Virginia, offering personalized treatment plans that focus on both pain relief and functional improvement.

column2: Thomas Hospitals Spine and Nerve Center
column3:
Thomas Hospitals Spine and Nerve Center in Charleston, West Virginia offers comprehensive care for patients suffering from spine-related conditions and neurological disorders. Our state-of-the-art facility combines advanced diagnostic technology with specialized treatment options to address a wide range of spinal and nerve issues affecting patients throughout the Kanawha Valley and surrounding regions.

At Thomas Hospitals Spine and Nerve Center, our multidisciplinary team of board-certified neurosurgeons, neurologists, pain management specialists, and physical therapists work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans. We specialize in treating conditions including herniated discs, spinal stenosis, sciatica, neuropathy, and complex spine disorders using both surgical and non-surgical approaches.

Comprehensive Services

Our center provides a full spectrum of care including advanced diagnostic imaging, minimally invasive spine procedures, complex spinal reconstruction, nerve conduction studies, and rehabilitation services. Each patient receives individualized attention focused on pain reduction, improved mobility, and enhanced quality of life.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that spine and nerve conditions can significantly impact daily activities and overall wellbeing. Our compassionate team prioritizes patient education, ensuring you understand your condition and all available treatment options. We emphasize conservative management whenever appropriate while offering surgical intervention when necessary.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 304-347-6120. Our center is conveniently located at 400 Court St #100, Charleston, WV 25301. For additional information about our services and providers, visit our website at wvumedicine.org/thomas-hospitals/services/spine-and-nerve-center/.

As part of the WVU Medicine network, Thomas Hospitals Spine and Nerve Center combines the expertise of a leading academic medical system with compassionate, community-based care to deliver exceptional outcomes for patients with spine and neurological conditions.

Spineworks in Morgantown, West Virginia serves as a premier chiropractic and wellness center for residents throughout Monongalia County. Founded in 2015 as a specialized chiropractic clinic, this practice has evolved into a comprehensive healthcare destination offering multifaceted treatment approaches for patients seeking relief from various conditions. Under the leadership of Dr. Timothy Dorey, a proud West Virginia native, Spineworks has established itself as a trusted provider of evidence-based care that addresses not only symptoms but underlying causes of discomfort and health concerns.

Spineworks offers an extensive range of therapeutic services beyond traditional chiropractic adjustments. Their specialized neck and back pain relief techniques include manual traction and targeted stretching protocols designed to alleviate discomfort and improve mobility. The practice has strategically expanded its offerings to encompass neurological assessments, nutritional counseling, and therapeutic massage services, creating a holistic approach to patient wellness.

Award-Winning Care

The clinic's commitment to excellence has earned Spineworks multiple accolades, most notably the prestigious "Best Chiropractic Clinic" recognition in the annual "Best of Morgantown" contest. This community acknowledgment reflects the practice's dedication to providing exceptional patient care and achieving consistent results for those seeking pain relief and improved function.

Convenient Location

Conveniently situated at 6000 Coombs Farm Dr #102, Morgantown, WV 26508, Spineworks provides easy access for patients throughout the region. The modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology to ensure comprehensive care for each individual's unique needs.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, patients can visit www.wvspineworks.com or call +1 304-381-4144 to begin their journey toward improved health and wellness.

column38: Laura Keene|Ashley Bredenberg|Angel|Jason Collins|Rebecca|Kyle Grady|Jeff Jarvis|Lindsay Jarrett
column40:
I can't even begin to describe how life-changing going here was. My lower back pain began around May after working a 12 hour shift as an aid. At first, I thought I had just pulled a muscle, but that my wasn't the case. Since then, I had a constant burning and stabbing in my back. I couldn't walk, couldn't stand, couldn't sit for long periods of time. I even struggled to put on SOCKS. I am young, and I need my back for a lot of things. After going to another chiropractor that did NOTHING for my back, I went here. I was terrified because I had never been somewhere that would actually crack my back, but I was willing to try anything to get rid of this pain. Dr. Dorey was fantastic. He explained everything to me, and he told me that I would be controlling my plan of care. He didn't expect me to need a lot of sessions to get better. I have done two sessions so far. After the first one, I felt like a new person. I was walking normally again, I could pick things up off the ground. I was doing everything that I had been doing before without pain. Today was my second session (exactly a week after my first), and the only pain that I have is a little aching in the morning that goes away as I get my day started. This place is incredible, and everyone there is very professional and kind. I highly recommend.|Dr. Dorey is the best! Excellently equipped and CLEAN facility - they always get me in in a timely fashion. X-ray capabilities, and now offering medical massage!|I've been going to see Dr. Dorey for several years now, and I will not go anywhere else! I ride horses and have had lower back problems since I was 16, and for several years I worried I would have to give up what I loved. Every time I would ride or do anything even remotely strenuous, my back would punish me for days afterwards. And if I continued to push myself, it could be months of intense pain and limited activity before I could resume my normal activities. Since I started going to Spineworks, I've felt like I can live my life again. I am back to riding my horses, cleaning stalls, playing with my dogs, doing housework, and not being worried about whether or not I'll be able to function for the next 6 months. Dr. Dorey always gets me in pretty quickly when I'm having a flare up, and I always leave feeling significant improvement. I'm also able to be seen as little or as often as I want, and he never makes me feel pressured about my decisions; he will give me his advice and then let me decide. This is something I know a lot of places aren't good at, and I really appreciate his approach to this. Sometimes I only need to see him once or twice a year, and sometimes I see him weekly or twice a week for a period of time; this mostly depends on my activity level and what trouble I'm getting myself into lol. I briefly worked for Advantage Health and Wellness in Morgantown as well, and even while working there, I still went to Dr. Dorey for my care. He has such a different approach than other places I've seen, and I will never go anywhere else as long as he's still in business. I truly believe he cares for his patients, and yes he runs a business and needs to make a profit, but he isn't out to drain your pocketbook. Dr. Dorey also has impeccable bedside manner, and even my friend who has had bad experiences with multiple doctors/specialists in the past feels very comfortable going to see him. So if you're reading this, I'll tell you, and I'll continue to tell everyone I talk to in person, go see Dr. Dorey if you need chiropractic care! :)|HANDS DOWN THE BEST!!! All the reviews I read before going were spot on and it's the service the verbal walk thru with everything he did and everything he didn't recommend if you don't go you're missing out 28 yrs of pain and today I am 210% pain free|From the friendly greeting by Kat when you walk in, to the warm welcome by Dr. Dorey, Spineworks instantly makes you feel welcome and comfortable.

The offices are clean and well maintained, and it is clear the equipment is well kept and up to date.

Dr. Dorey takes the time to explain the 'why' behind the injury and explains the treatment in such a way which educates you, without ever making you feel dim-witted.

The skill and precision with which he operates has you feeling better more quickly than you would anticipate.
His technique is quick and effective, yet you never feel rushed, and it is EVIDENT that he cares about getting the problem(s) resolved as quickly as possible.

I have never in my life experienced a specialist who is so kind and personable (and I've seen my fair share). I most sincerely could not recommend ANY other office with such conviction. If you're looking for a quality Chiropractor, you need look no further. I would rate 10 stars if I could!|You won't find a friendlier doctor around Morgantown. Dr. Dorey asks you very specific questions to localize the problem you're having|I hesitate to write a review, because some may say it's too good to be a true review. Nope. He's that good. From Kat, (Cat?) Up front, to the few other crew he has to help, I have nothing but great things to say. Friendly and kind, and at the same time, very professional. Clean and quiet atmosphere, with a very low stress vibe.

Dr. Dorey is nothing short of a magician.  I spent months at another place that couldn't care less about my health, just about billing. Dr Dorey has changed my ability to walk and work in less than 3 weeks, when others failed for 4 months.|Went in for lower back pain. Dr. Dorey is SUPER nice, personable and makes you feel comfortable from the beginning throughout the entire appointment. He is there to help and wants to make his patients comfortable and feel better by the end of every appointment. He explains everything in detail an what he is going to do every time to make you feel better. Go see him ASAP for back pain. You won't regret it at all!

Pain is only a Word...... NOT a sentence. Pro Spine & Pain (formerly PPW Health & APM) is a group of physicians and mid-level practitioners with nearly 100 years of collective experience in the field of minimally invasive spine care and pain management.
Conditions Treated:
* Back pain; neck pain; thoracic pain, herniated disc, degenerative disc disease, spinal stenosis, failed back surgery, syndrome, sacroiliac pain, sciatica and sports injury.
* Diabetic neuropathy
* Complex regional pain syndrome
* Post herpetic neuralgia (pain related to shingles)
* Cancer pain
