They explained everything they were going to do and did what they said. After sedation everything was fine and I was able to relax and have my procedure done. Such friendly people.|Always a great experience.  The whole staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.  Dr.Dino is great and cracks jokes and makes everyone laugh. I think that is great as I'm usually nervous. I would definitely recommend coming here for all your back problems!|They always make me feel comfortable and the vibe is always friendly. Everyone is laid back but still professional. I just love Dr Dino! ***edited - yes, I meant to type comfortable!|I recently had a procedure done on my lower back with Dr. Dino and I am thrilled with the experience. From start to finish, the care provided was exceptional. Dr. Dino demonstrated remarkable expertise and made sure I felt comfortable and well-informed throughout the process.

The support staff--Michelle, Dionne, Janet, Kelly, Becky, and Romie--were all outstanding. They were professional, compassionate, and attentive, ensuring that every aspect of my visit went smoothly. Their collective dedication made what could have been a stressful experience remarkably positive. I highly recommend Dr. Dino and his incredible team for their outstanding care and professionalism.|This place and Dr. Dino and his staff were so amazing. He sat with me before hand and talked in depth about everything and made me feel real comfortable. I was BERY nervous and high anxiety for the epidural steroid injection so much so I wanted to be completely sedated. Coming in I learned it wasn't really that more like twilight but I would be breathing on my own. I didn't even remember anything other they taking my glasses off and I woke up in my recovery room. For anyone experiencing high anxiety, please don't. They were all amazing at every step of the way. Literally everyone. Briana Leyba|I have been a patient of this practice for about 8 months. I had a spinal fusion last week leaving me with a significant amount of pain. On Friday, the NP prescribed me a pain medication that was not in stock at the pharmacy she sent it to. I called around and found this medication was in stock at a different pharmacy about 20-25 min away. I called the office back but it was a little after 430p and no one was available. This practice does not have a provider on call after hours so I had to wait until Monday to speak to someone. I called on Monday morning and left a message on the nurse line for the NP to send the prescription to the pharmacy where it was in stock. Rarely does anyone answer on the nurse line so you need to leave a message most times. The NP sent the prescription to the pharmacy but I found out it was not covered by my insurance and will cost me $487.00. I called the office back, left a message and got a call back from the nurse. Monday afternoon the nurse told me she would have to do a "prior authorization" to try to get this prescription covered by my insurance. Tuesday nothing was done. Wednesday was Christmas. Today, being Thursday,  I called the nurse line at 0815 and left a message. I got a call back from the nurse around 1p telling me the NP left at 12p so she will have her sign the prior authorization tomorrow. Why wasn't this done on Monday? Or Tuesday? Or this morning? It's been almost a week and nothing has been done regarding my pain. I am so unhappy with this situation. The provider should be addressing my pain in the meantime while waiting for this "prior authorization" but she has not. I've been in a significant amount of pain since this surgery and after being discharged from the hospital last week and what I was taking prior to surgery has not been effective. I don't know what to do. The pain in my lower back and upper legs when moving can be excruciating. At this point, I'm tempted to use my credit card and pay for the medication out of pocket.

Pain is only a Word...... NOT a sentence. Pro Spine & Pain (formerly PPW Health & APM) is a group of physicians and mid-level practitioners with nearly 100 years of collective experience in the field of minimally invasive spine care and pain management.
Conditions Treated:
* Back pain; neck pain; thoracic pain, herniated disc, degenerative disc disease, spinal stenosis, failed back surgery, syndrome, sacroiliac pain, sciatica and sports injury.
* Diabetic neuropathy
* Complex regional pain syndrome
* Post herpetic neuralgia (pain related to shingles)
* Cancer pain

Dr. Stauss and his team help me so much with the procedures he has done on my neck and back. I have had 2 neck surgeries which have left me with chronic pain. I get relief from the procedures. I've always felt comfortable and relaxed, very informed and understanding of my procedures. Great overall experience. A++|Dr Dino  is the most amazing doctor you could ever find. Hes very professional. The best hands youll ever be in along with all his staff they all have the best bedside manner. Mar D RN was fantastic and was so knowledgeable. Gieri ST, Donne RN they were Angel's an did a great job at making me feel comfortable. Michelle LPN Ashley L Recovery we amazing an very helpful. Lauren was the best at calming me down she was knowledgeable on everything her bedside manner was amazing. Dr Dino has the best team that will take great care of you. Thank you all! Your all Angel's thank you for tring help me find relief with my back problems. If i could give you so much more starts if I could 5 stars is just not enough. Thank you all|I am very pleased with everything and everyone that i have come in to contact with. Not just a boring old waiting area. It's a very comfortable setting and I have always been greeted with kindness and that really does say  alot. I see Erica on a regular basis and have been with her for many years. I am the lucky one who never lost her through the adjustments and new locations. Was referred by my pain management Dr at a large Hospital Group. I'd changed jobs and had a lapse in insurance, so had to go to self pay. I've been through injections, chiropractic and 2 back surgeries in the past 2 years (One being a fusion. For reference... I'm 40 years old and can't perform  daily activities on a regular basis without severe pain) I appreciate them explaining this before I paid $240 out of pocket. The front desk staff was very professional... But they could have told me this a month ago when I made the appointment and provided all of my history. Now I'm back at square one trying to find legitimate pain management.|Love the staff! They are always happy, comforting and give off good energy.
Dr.Dino, he's straightforward, a bit intimidating because he's a tall man- but he couldn't be any nicer. I trust him with my injections. He's also  quick with the procedures & talks to you through the process. Plus, his taste in music is 
10/10 would recommend.

column11:
Our goal at Great Midwest Pain Center is to improve your quality of life by effectively helping you manage pain. We focus on interventional techniques to achieve that goal. We determine the cause of pain and recommend treatments to interrupt the transmission of pain signals. This approach reduces or eliminates pain, decreases the need for medication use and avoids surgery. We advocate a multi-disciplinary, multi-modality approach to pain management including physical therapy and exercise as well as cognitive and behavioral therapy.

Our staff includes board-certified physicians with decades of experience in pain management. Our clinic organization focuses on personalized service directed to your specific needs.

column40:
I have not been to pro spine and pain in over a year. And yet they're sending me a bill for twenty dollars on a sunday several times today even after i've asked them to stop. Their staff is been nonstop harassing me for a year now. The same way they harassed me when I was a patient there.
Funny thing is the last time I was there over a year ago for an injection, I waited 3 hours past my scheduled time and then when I got testy and started bitching, Dr. Dino came in and told me if I didn't like it, I could find another place to do my injections and so I did, but not before his staff told me. To take off my mask. During covid season and how to staff, people lined up on each side of my bed as they wheeled me in for an injection that I would be sedated for. You can imagine the fear that went through my mind.As they were get glaring down at me, angrily from both sides of my bed. As I was starting to come to in my room, I could hear a nurse or somebody staff, wise saying she won't wake up.
As I came to I got myself dressed and walked out, the building still sedated by myself.
When I went in for a follow up appointment, they didn't bother to notify me and tell me that they're no longer going to see me as a patient. They waited till I got there to tell me that.
They also sent me a letter after that, stating that they'll no longer see me as a patient. So since I have not been there in a year due to their request, how is it? I incured a twenty dollar bill for a recent appointment. A year later, and they're still harassing me. I guess my only other option is to either hire an attorney for harassment.Are contacted better business bureau, or both. Because enough is enough.
I did a screenshot of the bill. They sent me in my email as proof.|I recently been assigned to the Layton ave clinic and see shana.before that I was going to the waukesha clinic.i was a little apprehensive at first but Shana made me feel welcome and she put me at ease.i met ms Shana 3 times and I cud tell she is dedicated to helping me.the staff at the check and check out are very helpful..I'm very grateful I have team of Professionals that will help me
Sincerely Tim k.|have my visit today
list of information, W/C assb. doors,  open , elevators or stairs  has a pharmacy in building|All around horrible experience!

First Issue: They have a centralized answering service that answers, but then they transfer you and you end up in a voice mail box 80% of the time. After a few calls over a few days I was able to get through to schedule an appointment.

Second Issue: A few days before the appointment they call me and tell me my appointment is with a nurse practitioner. They never indicated that to me on the phone when I scheduled. I asked to speak with someone so I could discuss what the appointment would be like since I was seeing a nurse, not a doctor. Apparently their doctors don't see anyone for the initial visit; it's their "office policy" that patients meet with a nurse first. I specifically called this office because their DOCTORS had decent ratings; I can't check ratings on their nursing staff and this was not what I expected. But I spoke with the nurse's assistant (who was very nice) and I decided to keep the appointment anyway because all other offices seem to be booked 3-9 months out!

Third Issue: A few weeks later I show up for my appointment EARLY (Layton office in Milwaukee) to fill out paperwork. I approach the office and the door is locked. I wait. Someone finally comes to let me and they don't even say hello. The crowd at the desk looks at me like I'm an annoyance. Then one of them tells they probably can't see me because I needed to be there a HALF AN HOUR before my appointment to fill out the paperwork. What?! They told me 15 minutes early on the phone!! Additionally, if you have a HALF AN HOUR of paperwork, there is a serious administrative issue! But if you honestly think you need 30 minutes of paperwork, then you need to mail it to patients prior to the appointment. She goes to double check with someone in the back and returns to tell me they won't see me and I'll have to reschedule. NO THANKS.

What a hot mess. Take your business elsewhere. Unfortunately now I have to start from square one and reach out to other offices who told there would be a 3-9 month wait for appointments. I wish I had know this place was a joke and I would have saved myself 4 weeks. Now I have to start over. Will be calling my insurance company to complain as well.|This clinic is absolutely amazing. They have gone beyond my expectations to assist with my medical issues. I'm so blessed to have them on the top of my care, truthfully I don't know where I would be at if I didn't have them. Dr. Dino and Jill are incredible physicians and over human beings. They treat you with highest regard and  dignity, Thank you, thank you!|I CANT RECOMMEND THIS WONDERFUL CLINIC ENOUGH!!! From the warm, courteous staff to the exceptional Doctor who did my injections! Bravo sir! I did not feel any discomfort and IN literally 5 seconds it was over! If you need injections Dr. Dino is your Doctor!!!|I went to their clinic in Waukesha. They are a wonderful group of professionals. Dr. Staz short version of his last name and nurse practitioner Christina were wonderful. As we're the rest of the staff. There are 4 physicians in this group with if I remember correctly 5 locations that they service. It's a 1 stop clinic that has everything you could ask for. I'm saying this as my previous experience with pain management offered nothing like this group offers. I highly recommend them.|Erika Plamtag PA-C and her entire staff are so compassionate and caring to my mother when she sees them.

column2: Lakeshore Pain and Spine Center: Bradley Silva, MD
column11:
Dr. Bradley Silva is board certified in anesthesiology and pain medicine. He completed both his residency training in anesthesiology and fellowship training in interventional pain medicine at the University of Chicago Medical Center. Dr. Silva is a proponent of the multi-disciplinary approach to pain management - utilizing interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, surgery and psychological therapy in various combinations depending on the needs and goals of each patient.

The mission of Lakeshore Pain & Spine Center and Dr. Bradley Silva is to provide compassionate, patient-centered care for chronic pain.

column40:
Dr Silva is a very caring provider. He answered all my questions and concerns. He review my MRI images of my neck and spine. My procedure was smooth w/ great attention to detail. He explained every step and made me feel very comfortable.  I'm already feeling relief in my neck and arm after dealing with pain for 2+ years. I am a health provider myself, and I highly recommend Dr. Silva.|I had my 1st appointment with Bradley A. Silva,  MD, JD. He listened closely about my problem. He explained what my orthopedic Dr had sent him. He explained the procedure he was going to do. I felt very comfortable with him. His receptionist/nurse was friendly and made sure all the information was done correctly,  and she was very professional.

I had my first injection yesterday, 02/14/2025. I came home feeling very good and was pain-free for a change.
I awoke this morning without any pain in my back that I usually do have every morning. His nursing staff explained everything she was about to do to prep me for my injection. Dr. Bradley A. Silvia explained everything he was about to do to ensure that I was calm and agreeable if what was being done. I look forward to my next appointment with Dr. Bradley A. Silvia.|Dr. Silva is extremely knowledgeable and passionate. His bedside manner towards his patients regarding "root causes" of their medical issues is outstanding. Very understanding with a thorough approach.|I highly recommend Lakeshore pain and spine center. They are very flexible with their scheduling. The first time that I scheduled an appointment they didn't have anything available but still found a way to sneak me in even though I know it was inconvenient for them. Also, I don't feel rushed or pressured with Dr. Silva. In my past experience with other doctors sometimes you get that uncomfortable feeling or they're just in too big of a rush to really understand how bad you're feeling and how concerned you are about getting better. Doctor is very professional, personable and understanding of my concerns and needs as
far as treatment plans and managing my pain. Thanks.|So I had my first steroid epidural for a herniating disc.  Doctor Silva has great communication skills and talks about options.  He actually discusses your conditions.  My epidural wasn't painless as none of them are, however he walked through the process and there were no surprises.  The staff was great as well.|If your reading this and are possibly thinking it might be too far. Trust me make the drive. I live about an hour away and I'm telling you Dr Silva is worth it. I was frustrated for years trying to manage my back pain. Dr Silva has done so much for me, I'm back to an active lifestyle. Id give this review 500 stars if I could. Trust me, it's worth your time.|Dr. Silva has been very kind and understanding. He is working on managing my pain and is attentive to my needs. I am hoping he will be able to eliminate or at least manage my pain. His office staff is also very kind.|Dr Silva is a very caring and concerned doctor. column38: S T|s c|Mary Brunner|Megan Swiecichowski|Wisdom _vargo|Tracy LeDocq|chad smurawa|Thomas Fries
column40:
I've been in a lot of disabling pain for quite a few years, only getting worse with age. I finally got to see Dr. Sohn. I thought my misery might finally be resolved. I had my MRI, and attended my consultation with an assistant today. I had been on Medicare but recently got married, (literally 3 days ago). I haven't even had time to legally get my info changed. As I was making an appointment to finally get some relief, Kristen came out and Bud into our conversation and said, "did I hear that you just got married?", then proceeded to tell me that I could not schedule my injections until I took on my new husbands insurance. All I wanted to do was schedule the procedure. She made a lot of assumptions. When I first came in, I could immediately sense I was being judged by her on what insurance I had. No one needs to feel belittled or less than, she had no clue about my personal situation. The appointment was far enough out where any changes to insurance could have been taken care of or if we even decided to pay for it out of pocket ourselves.  She made me feel looked down upon and there was no care whatsoever about my health or what I had been suffering and how it has affected my quality of life in many aspects. It's very sad that people like her can affect how people perceive the clinic and the doctors that work there. I will no longer be a patient there, and not recommend this place for care for anyone.I did receive a call from an office management and they made light of her attitude. People that work in healthcare should be empathetic and put their patients care first.|I was seen here right after APM went bankrupt and never told any of us.  I seen Dr Sohn and was planning on getting a spinal cord stimulator.  I was so full of hope!!!  Hope that I could be out of this miserable pain I'm in 24/7!!!!

I went through all of the tests and visits to be approved for the SCS.  I was approved and over the moon excited!!!!  I finally had hop for a better life.   I wasn't sure about the clinic because of the bankruptcy so I went to my PCP and got Suboxone for pain and it's made a substantial difference!  I'm not in severe pain anymore and don't have to deal with injections that never worked and numerous procedures that never did a thing!

What happened???  I was not in miserable pain!  So when my appointment came to get the SCS I cancelled at the last minute.  I went for another visit at WSP and was excited to tell them how great I felt,!!!  That the sun finally came out and I could function and have QOL!  I thought they'd be really happy for me!!

I left there sobbing in tears!!! No not tears of joy.  Years of sadness and hurt because the NP yelled at me and bersted me for going to the clinic!!  Stated why didn't u let us help you????

I never went back again because of this awful treatment!|Dr. Sohn is extremely professional and caring. He explains your condition and treatment plan thoroughly, and always provides options.
He stays involved with his patients issues, and agrees to work with your surgeons, to keep pain at a minimum.
Carmen, the receptionist, is very warm and friendly. She always greets you with a warm smile and a kind word
The nursing staff is equally friendly and caring. They take care to insure you're comfortable before, during and after your procedure!|Dr. Sohn was really great at letting me know what to expect.  His nursing staff was amazing.  Not only friendly but got the iv in on the first try, which doesn't happen often.  His receptionists are on top of his schedule, answer your phone calls and get you in when you need to see him or his nursing staff.  Let alone they are also friendly and wonderful to work with.|Carmen and Kristal do an amazing job. They are always friendly and efficient. I really dislike going to the doctor but these young ladies make it pleasantly bearable.

Dr Sohn does a great job too. He doesn't rush and listens. Explains your condition and the best treatment plan.

I really appreciate them for making my pain bearable.

Thank you!

Jo L Chester|From the first day I called for it appointment everyone was so nice. I felt they went above and beyond looking into what my insurance would cover even though they were out of network for me.
Dr. Sohn made me feel like I'm not crazy about the chronic pain I have had for many years. Right away I trusted that he could help me. I can't wait to get the treatment under way.|Dr. Sohn. Is very professional & will explain things so patients understand & Carmen @ the front desk is great & will go out of her way to help but Prior authorization  is terrible @ least for someone who is out of Network! Then as for the physic evaluation that is needed for spine stimulator is whole different story @ least getting it covered out of network & having all prior authorization in place before the evaluation! That part was very frustrating otherwise 5 stars all the way! Great staff
Thank you for all your help|I want to thank Dr Sohn for being professional as well as his staff. Someone stole my pills out of my car I understand he has a job to do and everybody or should I say some people are not trustworthy. But he did what he could do and a very professional manner and I highly appreciate it thank you

column40:
My providers have always been great, the reception desk is very unprofessional, condescending and rude. They talk about you and down to you. After months of mistreatment by the receptionist, I finally inquired as to why she had such an issue and I was then dismissed from their clinic as they sided with their staff and not their patients. I had been coming to their clinic for 9 years, drive over an hour to get there and to be treated as such and dismissed like I don't even matter by a provider is sad and unprofessional. The receptionist attempted to fight me because her attitude was uncalled for and was redirected by another staff member. I hope they do better in the future.|My provider (Mary K.) always asks how I'm doing all-around, in addition to prescribing medication. She really listens to me. The clinical RN coordinator, Kathryn, is quick to assist with working with my insurance company when pre-authorizations are needed. The front staff who check people in and schedule appointments are great, as well. I always know what to expect when I go there, which is nice.
I'm updating this as of Dec/2022; still a very helpful place to come to.|Today was my first appointment. This is the first place I've gone to for pain help and I felt like someone cared. They listen to you, and never rush. They cover all the basics if you receive medications from them.
They test and do pill counts. They seem very intelligent and worry about the comfort of the patient, not just worry about their license. I've been in extreme pain for a while now and I actually finally feel hopeful for my future, knowing I have someone that has my back.
If you've been to other pain management doctor's you probably know how they treat people who need opiates to manage pain, (You almost feel like a criminal for asking for help) but not here. I've never had someone genuinely care about how chronic pain effected my life.
I highly recommend them. They also have physical therapy at their office and I'm excited to start there soon.|Update: I had been with the clinic for years. I had seen all the staff and felt I could be open and honest with just about anyone in the clinic. But one day out of the blue I got a phone call stating I was being dismissed because after going through the past YEAR of my records, I had been constantly testing at ZERO meds in my system and that I was being discharge just like that. Going off high doses of pain meds cold turkey can even land a person with certain other conditions in the hospital and can last up to two weeks or more. I was given 7 days of meds. The worst of it usually starts at day 7.

My husband dropped off a current test from my primary taken not even two hours after i left from my last appt at the clinic and that test reflected that I had all the appropriate meds in my system and none I wasn't supposed to have. Just like the review before mine, I was dismissed with no meds to wean down and I was told THROUGH MY HUSBAND that they also said I was not following up with other providers as I was told.

I never gave them permission to talk to him. They had permission to release a receipt and later my medical records. Those are supposed to come in a sealed envelope. So I guess when I run out of meds, I'm supposed to just be sick.

They did give me a number of meds that helped not much and meds I was allergic to along with meds I am already prescribed and meds I can't take due to other interactions: it's sad that I thought I was being responsible and had NOT broken my pain agreement. They could have just told me I had a month to find another provider.

But I got a phone call as I was pulling into work and was just told. Only one business day before my next appointment. So I guess stay on their good side and you are good to go, but they just decide things and things that were just not ethical all around.

If I had been testing negative for ONE YEAR, I should have been made aware, then given a warning that I would be discharged. Plus they have a drug screen my doctor did and it was completely opposite. I couldn't just have taken my meds in that hour and a half then tested positive for all my meds I was supposed to be on and this is just too bad.

I won't be able to work now until I'm done being sick from withdrawal because you can't just stop meds of this kind. What they prescribe to sort of help doesn't even come close to even helping a little. So no work.

Plus I was given meds I can't take due to allergies and I had to hear from my husband something completely false and they were never given permission to tell him anything. He was just allowed to pick up papers twice.
That does not give an assumed permission.

So good luck, I wish you well and thank you for putting me through this. UNETHICAL and very opposite of their description of care. This wasn't compassionate or ongoing because if they saw a problem one year ago, why dismiss patients on no notice? I think they need to change that. And note that only my review and the one below are from dates with the current owners and staff. The rest are with totally different providers and office managers.|The staff as a whole treats me like family I lost my dad, mom and cousin and they really showed concern and empathy. When I walk in here I feel like I'm amongst caring people they know when I'm sad or happy I love the energy they give me. The best part of coming here they don't treat me like a number they treat me like I matter I've been told to keep my head up, keep striving for greatness because I talk to the youth and countless other things. It's not just going to pain management but also seeing a psychologist. We need more people and places like this I'm grateful for them.|They are very strict on guidelines and look for alternative options other than opioids . My practitioner has gotten to know me very well and asks all the right questions related to my health/ pain. For patients that have insurance u can submit your receipts and get refunded ( according to ur insurance plan) . The people who work there care about you and know your name, it's not a cold experience and I have never felt judged. They care!|I thought i had a great pain clinic.  After being assigned to my 3rd ptovider because the other 2 quit i was dropped by them as a patient without an expanation or to discuss it with me.  Now I am left high and dry without a pain specialist provider.  Very unprofessional and with new management and new providers that don't even speak English very well I am so disappointed and left to navigate a complicated system best.|I was very impressed with my experience at Pain Consultants. The medical staff and doctors really listened and took good care of me. I would absolutely recommend this place to everyone and I myself will be returning. Very happy with the results of my health care team!

I'm even surprised about what I can do now, and it's their help that got me to this level. I could have never done it on my own! They all work together as a whole team to help you on your way! They tailor a treatment plan to your needs and provide a number of different options to help you live with pain. With their help I've been given another five years of a fuller and more functional life that has allowed me to engage in activities that would not be possible as a person living with chronic pain. Not to mention the thoughts of despair and suicide that come with pain that is unmanageable. The staff is friendly and professional.|I went in for a 4 hour treatment today. I can't say how outstanding their service was.  The doctor whome I've seen prior came in to check on me multiple times while my nurse Yia patiently was by my side the entire time. Beth also surprised me with how nice and welcoming she was. I would HIGHLY  recommend this clinic for any one of the things they treat. They have an extraordinary staff there. Thank you Integrative Pain Management and see you soon! Josh.|I highly recommend Dr Joseph.   He was able to fix my back pain, and i was able to help me stop narcotics which i was on for over 12 years.  Dr, Joseph,  save my life and i have my life back again. column11: Since 1991, Pain Clinic of Northwestern Wisconsin has striven to meet the needs of patients in Eau Claire, WI and surrounding areas who are suffering from acute, sub-acute and chronic pain. We provide rapid and direct access to an experienced, multidisciplinary team of board-certified physicians and nurse practitioners. Our team diagnoses, treats, and when needed, provides same-day therapeutic, minimally invasive pain interventions to return patients to work and family. Because we don't require a referral, your treatment is accelerated.
column38: Keri Maier|Allen Gates|Mary Pahl|Mo Rondo|Deanna Anderson|Maralene Strom|luis a chavez|Pamela Hanson
column40:
The staff, from reception, nurses, Dr's and recovery are all amazing. The relief I get after an injection is going from a 8/10 to a 2/10 and it is literally life changing.|My name is Allen. I went to Mayo Clinic for a possibility of a nerve issues and the doctor I seen was extremely rude. Very inpatient with me. He's name is DAVID NYE, M.D. Not helpful at all. Did NOT want to hear anything I had to say about my situation. Did a feel touch test to see if I have aby nerve issues. He said it was in my head, even though I have X-rays of my neck and back where I have slightly messed up disks into the lumbar, and my neck has a messed up disk as well. Doctors like him SHOULD NOT have their license.|I have been coming to the Pain Clinic for 8 years for both my lower back and chronic neck pain. Dr. Schlimgen is so thorough, offers different options, and goes through a plan that's right for me. I feel so confident having him doing the injections.
The nurses are always so wonderful too! Everyone treats you like s person and not a number.
I would  highly recommend the Pain Clinic and Dr. Schlimgen.|I've been going to the pain clinic for 20 years. I had success with my back pain beyond what I could have hoped for.
Not true anymore folks. I'm having severe neck issues going on 6 months now. Went to a chiropractor. Made it worse. Went to PT made it worse. Was excited to get referred to TPC. Right.
Very long story short, this place has turned into a milking parlor. Find someone in private practice if you can.|Extremely unprofessional when it comes to returning calls.  Allows patients to remain in pain and fail to return phone calls in regards to medications and follow-ups.  Two weeks and still no response from the Clinic in regards to the plan for pain control.  How can they expect to live up to their claim to help manage pain when the do not return phone calls.
In response to below. The post I made was in regards to my fiance Chad Young. He saw Mary on a Thursday two weeks ago. She was to talk to the doctor and get back to us the following Monday. I have left a message and Chad has left two. It would be nice to at least receive a call back explaining why the delay. His primary physician has told us to do all pain management through your clinic. So what are our options if we can even get a call back.|I have been receiving treatment from this pain clinic for a number of years due to a chronic deterioration in my lower back. To maintain as much mobility in my active lifestyle i have been treated very well by staff and doctor. The one outstanding thing is the attending physician is very thorough with explanation in laymen terms,  options, additional resources of maintaining mobility ie exercises, etc . What is nice is the staff are friendly and informative.|This place does care about your well-being. I wouldn't recommend this place for care.Why because they dont!|I missed over 2 months of work and acquired huge medical bills due to my back pain.  It finally subsided after much physical therapy.  When the pain returned, I was devastated.  I could not go through all that again or I would most likely go bankrupt and lose my job.   Someone suggested going to the Pain Clinic.  Dr. Schlimgen was absolutely wonderful.  I was very scared to go, but he and his staff explained everything so well, and calmed me down.  The pain went away and now I am able to do the exercises to strengthen my back and prevent further episodes. I would tell anyone with pain to not be afraid of seeing Dr Schlimgen.  The procedure itself was nothing and I got immediate relief.

I would appreciate that we explore my experience and work together as a team before we just jump to quick fixes. Been in pain for 5 years. (Nerve damage) Today I seen Dr. Pride's  nurse practitioner Alex. They set up multiple ways and things to help me with my pain. I really appreciate her and Dr. Pride for all that they are doing for me. Just wanted to say Thank you!|I was referred over to uw madison for a pain pump. column40:
Dr.Joesph is amazing. His knowledge and experience is terrific.  He listens to his patients and addresses the issues that are explained to him right away.  He has a exceptional knowledge of treatment plans for every situation and offers different treatment plans. He meets the patients needs and is very down to earth and easy to talk to. Excellent services. The office staff is very friendly and very professional.|My experience with Integrative Pain Management w Dr. Joseph has been very positive. His cumulative work has reduced my extensive pain & and improved my quality of life.  He has used a variety of treatments   with each taking some pain away.|I have been seeing Dr. Joseph and his staff for about 7 years. My chronic pain started in 2016. The staff is like my family. Because of Dr. Joseph I have my life back. Years of pain and depression. Dr. Joseph was genuinely kind and always listened to my issues. How many Dr. t hese days actually answer their after hour phone number on the 3rd ring?  Thank you Integrative pain management for always being here for me!|Dr. Joseph is the doctor to see if you are in pain. He listens and gets to know you. He is extremely knowledgeable and is very honest. I trusted him completely and I  can honestly say we found the treatment and I have no pain !! His staff is very professional and personal awesome group !!|Dr. Joseph takes the time to listen and really diagnose what is causing pain. He starts with the least invasive practice and continues until you see tolerable pain levels. For me, a spinal cord stimulator was the answer. I was in excruciating pain every time I moved, was not sleeping, and had a poor quality of life. I could not be nearly as active as I wanted to be and if I tried, I would suffer. Then, I started seeing Dr. Joseph and he helped figure out what would work for me. Now, I am beginning to be able to do things I have not done for years! I know spinal cord stimulators don't work for everyone, but for me it has given me a new lease on life. Thank you Dr. Joseph for helping me find some relief. Just being more active and being able to sleep makes me feel like a new person. I am so very grateful.|I am the victim of a back surgery gone wrong. This happend about 3 and a half years ago. I was in extreme pain 24 hours a day. I have been going to see Dr. Joseph for almost 3 years. Dr. Joseph takes the time to listen and really wants to treat your condition the best he can. The staff is incredible! They also take the time to listen, even when they busy, which is every day. I consider them all my second family. If it wasn't for Dr. Joseph and his staff I would hate to think what my life would be like trying to live with my chronic nerve pain.   I have been able to have a life which allows me to manage my pain and also live my life to the fullest. Bless each and everyone  of them for the work that they Do! Thank you.  Melisa Kametler|ATTENTION VETERANS/SPOUSES that may be considering using community care referrals here - I would highly advise against sending anyone who is precious to you, to this place. I am my husbands caregiver in every capacity of the term. My husband was disrespected, called a pill seeker, and was not listened to by his pain management doctor.

Dr. John Joesph's bedside manner is awful. He appears to not thoroughly read the charts and makes assumptions on if you have PTSD/Anxiety disorders. He does not listen to the patient. If you find yourself reading his doctor profile and think to yourself that he would be a good fit, he is far from compassionate. Look elsewhere.

And forget about patient confidentiality in the office. Courtney at the front desk is inappropriate in complaining about patients. Don't worry, the rest of the office and patients waiting can hear her airing complaints too. She is very rude and sarcastic and feels as if she can do whatever she pleases with no consequences for her unprofessional behavior. SHAMEFUL!

After 6 months of no improvements with his pain management care, we decided to reach out to his primary care team at the VA to get a new referral to someone who was more professional, who listens to the patient and is caring.

Upon notification of the referral, Courtney and her high horse demeanor, decided that my husband would not get his next month's prescription to allow him time to get a new provider established. She stated that it was a breach of pain management contract to ask for another provider at this location or any other pain provider. Because you are not allowed to disagree with the provider or the course of treatment. You are also not allowed to advocate for yourself or think you deserve better care and treatment.

She then proceeded to harass me about why I call on my husbands behalf. Any spouse of a disabled veteran can attest to being heavily involved in their partners care management. We the spouses are often their biggest support system and advocate. We are there to ensure our veterans are being taken care of with dignity and respect.

This morning again, Courtney called my husband a pill seeker and a doctor shopper to me over the phone. If you have any self respect, this isn't the place for you or your loved ones.

I have never been one to post reviews unless they are positive. However, I could not live with myself knowing that other Honorable Veterans with chronic pain could be referred here and so disrespected. If I could be allowed to post without any stars, you bet that's what they deserve a ZERO.

Our hopes in reaching out to you is that you can use your own platforms to shed light in this dark corner of poor community care providers for Veterans.|My experience at Integrated Pain Manegment has been exactly what I was exactly what I was seeking.  Help for my pain. I have nothing but praise for Dr Joseph.  When he first interviewed me he was very thorough. Listed my pain in levels of worst first. He really listened to me.  When people say he didn't remember their condition-give me a break. He has many patients. He has injected my back and knee and has given me the exact amount of pain medication I need. No more, no less. Trial and error.
I would recommend him to anyone. I am so relieved to have found him.

column11: If you're living with chronic pain, our pain management care team at Ascension SE Wisconsin - Mayfair Rd Pain Management in Wauwatosa, Wisconsin, can help you manage your pain using minimally invasive procedures, injections, and medications. We specialize in the diagnosis and treatment of pain. At our outpatient pain management center, our pain management physicians specialize in controlling pain symptoms to help your body heal. We're here to help improve your quality of life.

column48: When will the COVID-19 vaccine be made available?
column49: We are following local and state government and health department guidelines for COVID-19 vaccine distribution. For the first doses of vaccine available, front-line healthcare workers have been prioritized. As vaccine appointments are made available in your community, additional information will be shared. Answers to frequently asked questions can be found on our website at ascension.org.

column11:
The goal of the our pain treatment team is to help our patients live their healthiest lives possible by easing pain symptoms and restoring function and movement. Our pain management physicians are anesthesiologists, interventional radiologists, and physical medicine and rehabilitation specialists.

Together, they form the "backbone" of our non-operative spine-care team. The team uses state-of-the-art techniques - including medication and innovative procedures - to help ease pain symptoms caused by a number of different conditions. A wide range of precision diagnostic tools, advanced procedures, and innovative therapies are used to design treatment plans that are customized to our patients' specific needs.
column38: Barb|tjch 4|Miranda Crandell|Brian Day|Rachelle Margenau|Just Heather|lizabme|Carol Masslich
column40:
I would give zero stars if I Could. At the time of my initial consult Dr. Scarlett was 30 minutes late and when I inquired as to what this thiswas taking so long the response wax I.dont know When I made the appointment for the injection I was told to schedule  a follow up with a Nurse Practioner and stated I only see physicians either MD or DO . I was told  she was 40 minutes late and said I will NEVER come back.|I have been coming here for several years and have always had a great experience with the Dr's and nurse practioner's. I recently had an appt with Christa for the first time and she wasn't familiar with my rare disease so she made the time to educate herself on it. I struggle to find Dr's that care enough but they always go out of their way to show they care about you. The staff is always very friendly and helpful as well.  I had an issue with something one time and Nicky fixed it instantly,  what an asset she is to them, it's hard to get great service like that just anywhere.|Communicates well while in office. Shows care for you and your situation. Helpful with coming up with suggestions to help improve your overall spine and pain health.

Update - stay away. Will not complete procedures the way it is intended. This is so you continue to come and charge your insurance. Be sure to ask for a detailed statement for billing. They do not care about you.|Dr Scarlett and his staff were very professional and courteous. I felt that my medical issues were heard and handled with compassion and respect. Both receptionists working on the day I went in were very kind and thoughtful. I drove 70 miles to see Dr Scarlett based on reviews of people with a similar condition to mine. I absolutely believe it was worth the time and distance I traveled to see him.|The communication with my doctor and other stuff members has been pleasant and very special in my life. I've been working with this medical team for over 10 years and have made improvements, and been able to have a more functional life because of the ability to communicate what I'm living with, and the new treatments that have become available to improve my health and lifestyle. I'm very proud to recommend Dr Scarlett and Wisconsin Spine and Pain to anyone willing to put effort in to the recommendations and instructions and keep going to the follow up appointments.|I started as a patient about a year ago. I have to say that everyone I have seen has been a huge help to me. Dr. Scarlett, Krista, nurses, and staff are friendly, courteous and helpful. They are knowledgeable about many conditions and listen to their patients concerns. I feel I can rely on everyone at Wisconsin Spine and Pain to be honest, helpful, knowledgeable, and understanding. They provide options and solutions that are realistic to health problems I have. I trust them.
I recently met Dr. Shah as well because my my regular providers were unavailable. I am impressed. He knew my health history and what Dr. Scarlett and I had talked about at our last appointment. He was knowledgeable, friendly, and answered all the questions I had.
Once again, great place to seek treatment for pain. And many options available.|The nursing staff and procedure staff are very professional and wonderful. Shout out to Maria! Dr. Scarlet is really kind and a compassionate doctor. He has excellent skills and I trust in them. In my 20+ years of getting hundreds of injections, blocks, etc from multiple doctors and clinics I can say he's one of the best.|I have multiple back problems and other problems probably caused by my having had polio as a child. Dr Scarlett has been of tremendous help through the years in keeping me moving with as little pain as possible. He truly cares about his patients and has referred me to other doctors who have helped me in areas where he can't. Excellent doctors are not easy to find, and he is an excellent skilled and caring doctor. His staff is also caring and considerate.

column11:
Pain is only a Word, NOT a sentence. The pain management center, Pro Spine & Pain (formerly PPW Health & APM), is a group of pain physicians and mid-level practitioners with nearly 100 years of collective experience in minimally invasive spine care and pain management.

Conditions Treated at the The Pain Center in Madison, WI:
* Back pain; neck pain; thoracic pain; herniated disc; degenerative disc disease; spinal stenosis; failed back surgery; sacroiliac pain; sciatica, and sports injury.
* Diabetic neuropathy
* Complex regional pain syndrome
* Postherpetic neuralgia (pain related to shingles)
* Cancer pain

Visit Madison Pain Center to relieve back, neck, and joint pain symptoms. Our offices are conveniently located in Madison, Wisconsin.
column38: Glenda Wyatt (Monster's Mom)|Colleen Duranceau|Roger Hessling|Kathleen McBrair|Lyndzi Edwards|Amelia Brunner|Jack Zimmermann|Anne Shaben
column40:
I was seen quickly.
The staff and the Nurse Practitioner I met with, were particularly understanding and gave me adequate time to explain my situation.
I found them to be very helpful and willing to help with my questions.
I'll be going back for a follow up in 2 weeks.
I'm really looking forward to working with them.|I've been coming to PSP for many years now. I started when they were Advanced Pain management and will always continue. The nurses are so nice. My PA Kim and Kelsey listen and are very in tune to what I need. Appointment's are easy to get. I know a lot of people might be thinking ugh, not a PA. Don't worry on this. You'll see a doctor too. He's nice.|I would like to thank everyone at Pro Spine & Pain Clinic. From the appointment makers to Dr. Aasen and his crew, and everyone in between. They are personal, very caring, professional, and compassionate. The procedures they do are awesome. I would recommend anybody to go to this clinic!!!|I went to a new pain clinic today, and I met with my new doctor, face-to-face. He examined me, spoke with me and prescribed treatment that should have been undertaken before my first SCS. He addressed my months-long elevated pain and need for more than begging for a Tylenol 3, like I'm some heroin addict looking for recreation.  And I don't know what lab the clinic Pro Spine uses, but they need to clean up their act. I tested positive for morphine, which has been on my allergy list for 30 years.  That should have been a huge red flag as to the test validity.

To top their performance, as a reaction to my elevated pain, they prescribed Tramadol/Ultram, another medication that has been on my allergy list for 30 years.

After pointing out this bad prescription, they "fired" me as a patient, citing too much contact. If you can't call your pain doctor four times in a week (because they're not calling you back), there are bigger issues at play.

I was in the ER twice in a week, but Pro Spine sat on their hands. They finally went totally crazy and gave me a steroid pack after the second ER visit. They wanted me to travel two hours (one way) to relinquish the wimpy T3s and prove pill count so I could get the prescription on my allergy list.  And now I'm also facing another surgery to replace the SCS they recommended.  Bad support for the SCS, but also nearly impossible to charge.  I'm on a fast-track to bankruptcy thanks to "providers" like Pro Spine because I need to get back to work, not guinea-pig at their leisure while I can't even meet with a doctor.

Quite possibly the most incompetent "specialists," given that my pain has increased and gone unaddressed under their care.

Finally, if a certain doctor has had issues with opioid prescriptions in the past (yes) then he may need to change his shingle.  But a pain practice that can't relieve pain; and a pain practice that blocks patients from their own doctors is hugely problematic.

Thank you for firing me as a patient so I could move forward. I'm not so appreciative of the six months of torture.|Everyone at APT are amazing and very helpful. I have been in pain for couple years and doctors wouldn't actually listen. With the referral I received to go to APT I wasn't very hopeful as I've been ignored and brushed off for so many years. Once I started the staff LISTENED and spoke to me like I was a human being.I seen Dr Orji and he was awesome he listened and gave tips not only for my back but also for weight loss and his advice has worked amazing. Then I seen Chris he actually shown how he cares for his patients. Now we are on the same page and on the right track to them helping me on managing my pain.  I would recommend these Drs to anyone who is in pain.They are absolutely amazing and you can see the pride they take in caring for their patients.|My experience with Pain Physicians of Wisconsin has been wonderful! Kim Litwack has been nothing but kind, caring, and empathetic as to my chronic pain condition and how it's affecting my life. She REALLY listens to me and talks to me even about what's going on in my personal life with my family. I usually end up crying at pretty much every visit, and she always gives me a long hug before I leave. She's been a great pain provider for me by listening to me and how I'm being affected, and also taking my suggestions about pain control into consideration. I would recommend her to anyone dealing with significant pain that needs help in managing it!! Edit: Things DID start out going really well with her. However, unfortunately, things ended up going really really aweful. I ended up with serotonin syndrome, because she didn't have the complete records of my medications, such as the dosages that I was on. So I was on a very high dosage of an antidepressant, along with taking pain medication 4 times a day. (This is all because the previous place went bankrupt, and now Advanced Pain Management had the rest of my medical records, which failed to transfer over to Kim's office.) I have an EXTREMELY painful medical condition called Adhesive Arachnoiditis. With the Serotonin Syndrome, my blood pressure was very high, I was tachycardic, I was constantly having muscle spasms, I couldn't get my words out straight, I was extremely irritable, and it was like my chronic pain on steroids! This lasted for MANY months on end. I'd call them and call them and report my symptoms to them, but they either wouldn't take me seriously, or would tell me to go to the ER. But the ER would never do anything for me. I had already tried that before. It took ME figuring out over time what was going on between the two medications. I even asked her at my last appointment: "Is it ok to take this med and this med together?" She goes: "Oh yes, it's perfectly fine!" Well, I don't think she ever looked up the interactions, because when I did, it said: "Major: Using these together can increase the risk of a rare but serious condition called Serotonin Syndrome." I was at the max dose of my antidepressant. So it's no wonder that happened to me while also being on the pain med at the same time. So, since I was in such horrendous pain, what did they decide to do? Increase my dose of pain medication. When that's not what needed to happen. Although at that time, I still didn't know what was going on with me. Plus, when she gave me the extended release version of the new pain med, she didn't give me instructions for stopping the old one and starting the new one. I eventually had to figure out that I needed to get off of my antidepressant with the help of my Psychiatrist. After I did that, guess what? My pain medication worked SO much better for me, and I was no longer having the Serotonin Syndrome effects. In the end, I left Kim, and now I'm just with my PCP. I'm using LDN to manage my pain, along with other therapies. I truly hope that they have things put together a lot better than they did when I was going there. Because that was a HUGE patient safety risk, and I told Kim that on my last visit with her!|I can only say Great Things about Dr. Orji and his staff during my recent visits for epidural injections.   They did everything possible to make my treatment as painless as possible.   The entire Staff was very professional and sympathetic to my wants and needs.  I would strongly recommend them for treatment.|The staff at Advanced Pain Treatment, especially Dr. Fattouh, have truly given me my life back! He is an amazing physician; his care and procedures have been the first and only thing that has given me enough pain control to function in the world again. I have now gone back to work and am also able to be the mother that I wanted to be. I cannot say enough wonderful things in a short review! Highly recommend!

column40: I see Dr Aasen for numerous injuries. He and his team are informed compassionate and professional and offer me treatments that work for me. Waiting time is minimal and scheduling appointments is efficient. For convenience, I go to both the Franklin and the Waukesha offices and they are both good and  offer the same excellent service.. Although  I get other treatments  for numerous injuries I am happy to have someone who is good with cervical RFAs.|Since my car accident in '17, I've been attempting to reduce my pain that kept me forced to be horizontal 22 hours a day for 4.5 years...a huge change for me not missing my engineering job for 26 years straight. Pro Spine was my 4th pain doctor that I tried because the initial 3 doctors were ineffective and I fired them. While in #9 pain, the beginning with Pro Spine seemed too slow, but these folks delivered. In all my pain elimination efforts, my 11th spine surgery is scheduled in a few weeks which will be for a permanent installation of a peripheral nerve stimulator (PNS)... hopefully is the last. Hats off to the skills of Dr Stauss (and praise to God) for the progress made that has me the best functioning since the accident. It's a tough truth to realize I'll not be the same as before the accident, but, that is life. At least I can better interact with my grandkids now and occasionally volunteer to help others in doing home maintenance work which I enjoy. Thank you Dr Stauss!|I have been dealing with pain for the last ten years. The doctors here are so kind.  I see Jay and Dr. Stauss they both teach me about what is going on with me. I have learned a lot from them. They address my issues with compassion. I would refer my family and friends in a heartbeat. Thank you so much ProSpine and Pain.|Dr. Jay PA is the kindest most knowledgeable pain management PA I have ever seen. I've been going to these pain doctors for 15 years. Hands down they are the best|I am a current patient at Pro and Spine in Waukesha Wi. I had some trouble with there billing they billed me wrong and charged me for my visits and injections. I brought it ti there attention and they were ruid and not very helpful at all. Either was the woman head of billing. I know most of you are on fixed incomes so every little bit we need. Took 2 months or so and still did not get any results. Finally I approached HR Kevin he was amazing listened and agreed that I deserve my refund. Still no refund. Finally Debra and Kevin took matters in there own hands spoke to there ppl. Worked together and I got a call from Debra saying my refund would be mailed. Now she is customer service wen you walk in . Greets us with smiles and cheer does our paperwork and sets up appts for us. I personally look forward to seeing her wen I get there she is amazing at her job. Now like I said that is her job Debra and Kevin worked together and talked ti the right ppl and next thing I know I was being sent my refund. Now why didn't the head of billing and billing didn't respond like Debra and Kevin dud. I was told it was out of my hands. Well that is funny cuz Debra and Kevin went   out of there way to make it right. I am very grateful for them. There efforts were amazing and made me feel heard. They deserve to be recognized in that Clinic for there amazing and very empathic efforts to get my refund and make things right. I am very grateful for them and very much appreciated what they did for me. So thank you from the bottom of my heart for getting my refund and making me feel important and heard. I can't say enough that deserve to be recognized.  There isn't ppl like them in companies anymore . So once again Debra and Kevin thank you and you make me wanna keep coming back and knowing if I had concerns you both you be there for me and make me feel heard. God Bless and I am giving you all I can from me. There isn't many ppl who understands money is tight these days and we need our money. I am grateful for Debra and Kevin.  Love always Tina Black.|I have the best np miss laska and she is so compassionate towards me.she is truly one of the best in health care.i have been seeing her for bout 10 yrs and I don't know what I would to without her and the clinic.her assistant deserie is just a wonderful caring person also.timothy kinney|Their business model is "we don't do medication management because we don't make money on that. We only make money on procedures, so unless you're here for a procedure, you won't be a good fit as a patient."  That was said to us verbatim, and then they proceeded to charge us the full visit cost to tell us that and not do any exam or care whatsoever. They should be ashamed of themselves.|Most times you get your medication in a timely manner. But there are the times when they let you go through withdrawals and immense pain for a week at a time. They ignore your calls and don't fill your medication on the day it's due. Leaving you the patient to suffer severely and if you do get to talk to someone their attitude is very nonchalant. Dr. Stauss is amazing but not so much the staff he chooses to work for him.

"Advanced soft tissue diagnosis and treatment.
Specializing in fixing problems that have lasted longer than 6 months and failed other doctors or therapies."

We help annoyed & frustrated people who are struggling with chronic pain, finally get permanent pain relief!
Pivotal Point Rehab is the only clinic in the Minnesota/Wisconsin area certified in Adhesion Release Methods to find and fix adhesion -- the most common cause of Chronic Pain.

Some common conditions we treat are low back pain (disc herniations, stenosis, sciatica, piriformis syndrome), neck neck pain, plantar fasciitis, & knee pain.

Proud Veteran owned and operated clinic.
column38: Molly George|Natasha McLean|Shania Shehow|Becky Hansen|Valerie Rose|Katy Everett|Steve Jerlow|Sawyer Wilson
column40:
For 9 months I suffered from shoulder pain; limiting my ability to move in the gym, sleep comfortably at night, and eventually eliminating my ability to raise my arm overhead. I saw chiropractors, PTs, and massage therapists religiously during these 9 months and even purchased a new mattress. Unfortunately, with no signs of any tears and no acute injury, my pain and limited ROM was a mystery to all. That was until my massage therapist found a nerve entrapment technique on Instagram. As a last ditch effort, she suggested I give Pivotal Point a shot. I was skeptical, but after watching a few patients issues and treatments videos I figured it may be the answer to my mysterious shoulder pain. After meeting with Dr Ben and his team, we identified the likely cause of my pain and limited functionality. After a few treatments, my pain was significantly reduced and my range of motion continued to improve. Now, at the end of my case, I have regained full range of motion and functionality without pain. I am have since been able to hit lifts in the gym that I was hitting 100% healthy, like nothing ever happened.  Had I not found Dr Ben, I likely would have had an unnecessary surgery that would have left me unable to ever attain my previous level of fitness. I am so thankful for the power of social media and providers that will explore all options before resorting to surgical intervention. THANK YOU PIVOTAL POINT!|For over 20 years, I endured relentless chronic pain. Countless treatments offered me nothing more than fleeting relief. As a mother of two, the anguish went beyond physical. It broke my heart to miss out on precious moments with my children. I longed to be the mother they deserved, but my mental health was crumbling under the constant pain. My options were narrowing down to invasive exploratory surgery or lifelong shots--neither of which promised a hopeful future.

Then, through a serendipitous click on a YouTube video, I found Dr. Ben. Desperation led me to take a chance on him, thinking, "It can't get any worse than this." Little did I know, this decision would become a monumental turning point in my life.

Dr. Ben and his compassionate staff have given me something I hadn't experienced in over two decades--true relief. For the first time, I have been virtually pain-free for more than two months. I have reclaimed my mobility, strength, and mental well-being. I am finally able to be the mother my children deserve. We play, we go for walks, and I no longer have to say, "Mommy can't, she doesn't feel good."

Dr. Ben is nothing short of a miracle worker. His dedication, empathy, and personal story are incredibly inspiring. He doesn't just treat the symptoms; he genuinely cares about his patients' overall well-being. I am profoundly grateful for taking a chance on Dr. Ben and his amazing team.

Today, my life is filled with possibilities. I feel empowered, resilient, and ready to conquer anything life throws my way. If you are suffering from chronic pain and feel like you've exhausted all options, don't give up hope. Dr. Ben's clinic may very well be the light at the end of the tunnel, just as it was for me. He has not only restored my health but also my ability to live life to the fullest. God Bless you, Dr. Ben and all you do to help people in the most difficult times in their lives, you have a heart of gold!|WOWWW.. just wow. All I can say is Dr. Ben and his knowledge of practice are truly incredible. Within just a few sessions I already felt an insane amount of relief in my lower back. Before I found Pivotal Point -- I had been out of the gym for 4 months with pain crippling enough to immobilize me and now just 10 sessions later I'm back to lifting heavy in the gym again with even better range of motion. I can't recommend him and his team enough! The best investment I made for my health, hands down! Thanks for giving me my life back!|When your life consists of just merely surviving each day because you've been in chronic pain for years, you'll try anything. That's what I did. Dozens of people in lab coats led me to have major spine surgery, and when that failed, 12 nerve ablations. They got paid, I got significantly worse. At 34 years old, even walking to my own mailbox would send me into a flare. With a toddler and a growing small business, I had all the motivation to get better. I tried a dozen or more treatments in the two years following these medical procedures. Laser, PT, Chiropractic, Dry Needling, Injections, Acupuncture, Braces, Medications, the list goes on. With each failed treatment I felt more hopeless and depressed wondering if my three year old will ever see his mom active and vibrant, as I once was. I found Dr Ben in a late night desperate googling session. I figured this had to be the only thing I hadn't tried, and had very little expectations, as no one I had ever seen had ever mentioned adhesion. Dr Ben and his staff immediately did things different. They took so much time during that first appointment measuring all the angles of my range of motion and really digging into my case. They wanted all of my previous imaging, which made me feel like this might be the real deal. Apprehensively, I dove right in because I had nothing left to lose. I am a really complex case and probably one of their more hopeless patients, but they have given me so much hope. After a few months, I can confidently say that I am already 30% better than I was - which to me, feels like a miracle in itself. These guys are the real deal. If I could go back in time, I would have come here first and have no doubt they could have helped me avoid this low point in my life, but I am so thankful to have found them now! I have all the confidence in the world that I will keep improving in their care. I would give them 10 stars if I could. If you're in pain, please give Dr Ben a call. He knows what he's doing, he's honest & realistic, and he cares about the people he serves!|I used to have really bad inner shoulder blade pain until I met Dr. Ben. I limited myself for so long. Suffered for so long. I was told by a chiropractor & massage therapist nothing could be done, I would need surgery, it's too far under my shoulder blade. I couldn't do more than an hour of homework w/out wanting to cut my whole arm off. I couldn't clean my shower or vacuum. I pushed through, of course. Things need to get done. Dr. Ben fixed me! This man can fix just about anything with minimal pain. A truly amazing man w/a good heart & wonderful bedside manners. He's very respectful, professional, always available, listens, & cares.

Dr. Ben's assistant, Jay, that young man is the highlight of my day! He's so sweet & spunky. He always makes me laugh. His positive energy radiates throughout the office making it a welcoming & safe space.

1,000,000/10  RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!|Dr. Ben and his team have done wonders for my mobility and ongoing back issues.  For reference I am a woman in my 30s have had 2 babies, been in multiple car accidents and in December of 2022 was diagnosed with Transverse Myletis.  I came to Dr. Ben with both ongoing pain in my lower back (for years) and numbness/mobility issues from my recent TM neurological stuff.  Through his therapy over the course of months I began to regain feeling in multiple places I had lost it and my back pain has disappeared completely most days.  Additionally, my range of motion and mobility is back at about 90 percent.  Where we thought we might be able to get a 20 to 30 percent improvement in my mobility and quality of life we ended up in the 75 to 80 percent improved realm and are still working.  I loved Dr. Ben and his teams transparency and honestly from the beginning.  He was always completely honest on whether or not he could help and set realistic expectations for real quantifiable change.  Unlike many doctors that ego trip and sell things as if they can completely fix everything you can count on Dr. Ben to be real and speak to you with honesty and clarity.  I highly recommend his services to anyone with ongoing mobility or pain issues.  He will be real with you and if you trust the process you will see an incredible improvement in your pain, mobility and quality of life.  Its unlike any other medical process I have encountered.  Call him and get your life back!|I had knee pain for 5 or more years. It prevented me from many tasks that normally would be easy to accomplish. I started visiting Dr. Ben and I was amazed that the level of pain largely diminished and nearly a year later is 90% gone. Thank you Dr. Ben|This place is Awesome! Definitely a place to check out if you've been struggling with long-term chronic pain. Dr. Ben will make you feel heard and will be honest with you when it comes to your rehabilitation process. He isn't the type to waste your time or money, he will sit down with you and make a personalized treatment plan with honest and realistic expectations. Again I would highly recommend. Getting out of pain and getting back to doing all the things that you enjoy means everything.

column11:
Raised in central Illinois, Atit Shah, MD, is a Midwesterner at heart. Dr. Shah obtained his undergraduate degree from the University of Illinois, where he studied bioengineering with a minor in chemistry. He decided to stay at his alma mater to obtain his medical degree. After medical school, Dr. Shah did his first year of residency in a suburb of Chicago.

During his anesthesiology residency in New York City, Dr. Shah realized his passion for pain management and for helping patients alleviate their pain. Upon completion of his residency, Dr. Shah decided to make his way back to the Midwest. He moved to Ohio, where he completed his fellowship in pain medicine at Case Western University.
column38: Kristin Wilcox|Joanne Crowley|Tom G|Pam Brucker|lynn backhaus|Cecilia Weis|Jodi Heine|Lynn Backhaus
column40: Dr. Shah and his team have set the standard on how all patients should be treated! They always exceed my expectations. Everyone is always so polite and compassionate! I have seen several doctors for many reasons, and Dr. Shah is by far my favorite. Thank you to everyone from the front desk, nurses and Dr. Shah for always taking the time to treat me! I always leave feeling mentally & physically better!|All of the doctors at Wisconsin Spine & Pain are wonderful, as is the rest of the staff.  I have worked with Dr. Shah for several years and he has been very professional, patient and kind.  He has helped me in so many ways.  I highly recommend them.|Dr.Shah is a excellent pain management doctor. He has helped me with my pain issues for many years. Would highly recommend him.|I have been a patient of Dr. Shahs for 7 years. He has done everything possible to help me deal with my many pain issues. He is calm, polite and listens. Great guy. I have recommended him to several people who have been helped as well. I will continue seeing him. Grateful for all of his help.|I have placed my trust in Dr Shah many times. Over many years. He is a kind patient Dr who genuinely cares about people and has performed a vertiflex spacer and now a spine stimulator trial. He doesn't pressure to decide . And he's handsome too.|Dr. Shah has always listened to my needs and taken care of every concern that I have had. Rarely does one find a doctor that will accommodate and listen to your request and not have their own agenda. I really appreciate his bedside manner as well as his professionalism as a doctor. I have  put my 100% trust in Dr. Shah & his medical staff!|Dr. Shah and his entire staff...change lives!  They care about you on every level. They are kind, understanding,  and truly have created such an amazing environment that makes going in for appointments almost enjoyable!   I had been to many, MANY other facilities over the years...before giving up....and then I was pointed in the direction of Dr. Shah, and I found my lucky star.  After my 1st office visit..I had HOPE, and that was something I hadn't had in at least 5 years! After my 2nd visit (a procedure which they do on site as well), I cried.. because for the 1st time in almost 10 years, I was not experiencing "that" pain.  Don't hesitate to go...they can help, TRUST me.  I am so indebted to them all!|Dr Shaw is very good he put a vertiflex spacer in my back and now im feeling so much better. He cares listens and asks questions. Very nice skilled doctor!

column40: I was a patient for 8 years. Dr Hasan is personally involved with every patient and takes the time to treat you as an individual. She often gets backed up with this hands on approach so extended wait times are not unusual but knowing this at your appointment will ease the anxiety   I have had to move on and will greatly miss her|This establishment is in the archaic times. Their manners, customer service, wait time, its all chaotic. My clients appointments be at 10 am, for example, the called physician doesn't see the client until 12:30 or beyond.  The whole day is wasted, and I feel for my clients. They only see the patients for 10 minutes. The whole time interrogating them on if their pain is really affecting them or not. Places like this need to be shut down.|The staff is great with the kids.  My son goes to this school, and I absolutely love how patient the staff are with the students and they take their time with the students like my son who is a special needs students.  They take the time to talk to you about what's going on.  If there is a problem they don't just say this is something YOU need to work on, instead the staff say this is something WE all need to work on as a team.  The after school program is excellent as well.|I went to this clinic trusting that in my condition they really cared. Every time I went in there was a problem with my meds. I was discharged due to a issue I believe they just came up with to discharge me cause I always disagreed with the doctor Michael. I was functioning much better on my meds. My stability was much better when walking. I was able to function and get out more often with much less pain. You can see the pain I am in when I walk, yet I was discharged for what I believe to be a made up reason. People come into this office walking like they are in much better condition, and much younger yet they don't get discharged. Not a fair place. I even had a friend help me pay to come here for months for my meds when they barely had business.|I was a patient with this doctor before she moved from Wheaton on highway 100 and bluemond. Its was a more pleasant professional experience then. Now since she has moved on 62 and Center Im treated with no respect the staff takes weeks to answer the phone or return messages. They are rude and everytime im tested for meds there is always a issue. I complained to the doctor about how im treated and how the staff is unprofessional and I got repimanded as if i work for the doctor. Hold your staff accountable ....so now i think my test are being sobatoged so the doctor can discharge me because i complained about the lack of professionalism. Im a Medical Assistant and I am a true believer in your staff acts according to how management behaves.|Not sure what everyone else is talking about.  I have a feeling they were not abiding by the rules and did not like the consequences... Maybe i am wrong but If you abide by the rules and are polite to them,  i have had nothing but a good experience.  She actually helps people who need it (as much as she can since the government has started to get involved and TELL Doctors what they can prescribe and put a LIMIT on it)  They also offer a lot of other options like Botox for neck/TMJ spasms, Trigger Point injections right in the office.  She is very knowledgeable and reasonable.|I was her patient for almost 14 years and out of the blue she turned on me. She had me taking almost 500mg of opiates DAILY for many years. This supposed "doctor" has damaged my frontal lobe, I am not who I was. Now, with the "opiate crisis" she can't make money on the medications so she disposed of me. She will dispose of you also......|The people at Center for pain management is total and complete garbage the office looks ghetto the nurses there are rude I've been with dr. Hasan 4 about 3 years and I have been treated like I was a common Criminal I really wish that that clinic will get shut down and Dr Hasan would lose her license she discharges people even if you if you look funny I do not recommend going to this pain clinic and I do not recommend having Dr Hasan as your pain management doctor this place is trash and ghetto

column11: The most important aspect of treating chronic pain is an accurate diagnosis. Without a diagnosis, you are simply treating the symptoms--not the source of the pain. Our physicians are specialists in interventional pain management and are  dedicated solely to evaluating, diagnosing and treating chronic pain. Our physicians are specially trained to perform the latest minimally invasive spinal interventions to help manage and alleviate pain.
