column40: I have been a patient for over 10 years. Dr Priyani is the best medical thing to happen to me in a really long time. He really cares about his patients and the staff is amazing! Can't imagine life without them. THANKS SPINE PAIN DIAGNOSTICS|Everyone at Spine Pain Diagnostics has been pleasant to work with from the start.Dr Piryani is very straight forward, and he listens. They seem to really care about your problems. I just had an epidural procedure in July and the experience was so much better than I had feared/built it up to be. Very simple, professional, and done with great care. I don't want just anyone messing with my spinal cord! I highly recommend these folks if you need help. My issue is spondylolisthyesis. So far the improvement has been noticeable.|I had an overall great experience with the spine pain diagnostics associates. The staff was courteous and attentive, Dr. Piryani explained everything in detail that would go on and made me comfortable. The procedure I had performed exceeded my expectations. I would definitely recommend Dr. Piryani and the spine pain diagnostics associates, and all of the staff.|My husband had been going to Aurora pain management for 5 months and they did not manage his pain. We came to Dr. Piryani, he gave him a thorough examination, reviewed his MRI and x-rays and scheduled him for a cortisone epidural within 2 weeks, and prescribed him the appropriate medication. Dr. Piryani called him twice after the epidural to check his progress. His staff is also very attentive.|Dr. Piryani is an amazing pain doctor. He is very compassionate and listens to your questions and concerns. He and his excellent staff are so kind and supportive! I was in pain for over a year ( could barely walk without being in tremendous pain) and Dr. Piryani literally gave me my life back!  My quality of life has improved greatly.  It's great not to have pain take over your life! The pain I had even stopped me from taking vacations. It's a huge relief  to me and my family that I have found a doctor that helped relieve my pain! Sincerely, Ann Becker|I have experienced back pain for a number of years now and my most recent treatment performed by Dr. Piryani is by far the most successful.  I was able to resume normal activities in just one day.  I used to have to rely on an ice bag to help numb the pain but no more.  I sleep better and have the best mobility in a long time.  I highly recommend this clinic.|I have been with this office for a while now. I deal with Dr. Piryani and he is a most helpful doctor, I trust him completely. His staff are also very helpful. All of the staff and doctors are very personable and know their jobs inside and out. Whenever I have had injections, I can easily trust them to keep me safe. I recommend this office and doctors over anyone I have dealt with.|3 TIMES A WINNER!!!  Back in 2020, I was referred to Dr. Piryani for intercostal rib pain, which was severe! He did some nerve block shots and to this day, which is over a year ago, I still do not have any residual pain. Then in May of 2021, I had hip and groin pain. Again, he administered some cortisone injections and the pain was gone. Recently, I was having mid-back muscle issues, in which my muscles were severely tight that I couldn't move real well. Once again, he administered steroid injections and again I am pain free! Dr. Piryani will go above and beyond to help his patients and so will his staff. They all are kind, knowledgeable and professional! I wouldn't hesitate to refer anyone to Dr. Piryani! He will always be my choice for pain management! Thank you Dr. Piryani for helping me not once, not twice, but three times!!!

column40:
They send out date and time through texts, would not answer the phone, needed the address, and
were were different ones listed, poor management
Bryan|Very pleasant place to go for pain management. Staff is very nice and care about how you feel. The doctors and physician assistants are knowledgeable and also care about the patient themselves. Insurance approval does usually take a couple weeks to go through! That is not the fault of the clinic. I am very happy to be coming here because they try to fix the problems and not just mask the pain with meds.|I saw the nurse Practitioner last week and before that visit I thought that my depression about my pain was getting better but now I feel like there is no hope that I will ever get any better. I was told that I had been given a procedure for the wrong area and not where my pain was located. I was told that there wasn't much else they could do for me and that I was bad for taking pain medication for my years of unending severe round the clock pain. I feel that I have nothing left to live for except pain.|They wouldn't listen, and became defensive when I asked questions. I was spoken down to, and dismissed. My son who's 5 asked why the doctors were so mean. All I want is to be a better mom and not just observe my son. I haven't been below an 8 on the pain scale in months, yet with extreme fatigue they want to put me on a muscle relaxer during the day with awful side effects. ( drowsiness being the least of the worries now) they also said I just need to cope with my worsening pain, since (without trying anything) all options are apparently exhausted. With increasing neuropathy on my right side they won't even have an MRI done of my back, they just assume it's okay.|First off,  I was treated as though I was a heroin addict or something in my first visit.  It took 6 weeks for them to schedule a follow up vist to see the results of my urine sample.  Prior to the follow up visit I was told that I had been approved to take pain meds.  Then, when i get there and see the dr..who was actually sympathetic (she was from CO) I was denied pain medication since I had taken CBD oil and it had traces of THC.  I am trying to stay away from pain medication but have 3 herniated disc in my back and one in my neck.  Sometimes it just helps me to sleep.  If I were to go back in for a follow up to take another urine sample it would take up to 2 weeks to get it back.  I get that the gov has a lot to do with this but they don't manage how you treat people.  If you want to be treated with dignity and empathy and are going through serious pain don't go to this place.  I would give zero stars if possible.  If you are already a patient here , remember that you have the freedom to change providers.|This is the worst medical facility ever! First, they told me AS I WAS GOING IN FOR A PAIN INJECTION, that I'd have to pay thousands of dollars out of pocket! Then when I asked for an insurance review, they took months, gave me a huge run around, and then gave me incorrect information. I switched doctors, and now it's taking me weeks, and more hoops, to get their reports over to him! Not only that, they are rude, abrupt and impatient, liabilities when dealing with people in acute pain. No humanity, no efficiency, no care. Stay Away!|Dr Endrezzi  warning dont see her. Most uncaring, cold, rude doctor Ive ever been to. Told I had to be off pain medication in 2 months, after 20 plus yrs of use for extremely painful conditions. Then radio ablation done took 6 months for for 2 test blocks then actual procedure. Then when needed more hip injections,  told I needed an office visit first. Why??? Already had had those done before. They just want money for extra visit. Terrible practice!!!!!!|Dr. Kirchin is skilled and personable, but the communication skills of the office and staff leave much to be desired.  They don't tell the patient what to expect beforehand, they are abrupt on the phone (a hang up by a staff member), they made an appointment with an APRN for me and I found out about the appointment via MyChart.  One would expect the would call and ask what would be a good day & time and tell me why I was meeting with a new person.....Nope!  Very disappointed.

column11:
Paul Bruhnding DO at OSMS is a Pain Management Specialist in Green Bay and is board-certified in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation (PM&R) and completed his fellowship in Pain Medicine.

He treats conditions including arthritis, headaches and migraines, back and neck pain, post-injury pain, post-op pain, joint pain, shingles, sciatica, among others.

column40:
Dr Bruhnding is such a compassionate, caring doctor always looking out for the well being of his patients. He has such a warm and friendly personality toward his patients. Dr Bruhnding enters the room knowing about his patients medically and eager to find better solutions for relieving their pain. Always has a plan. The staff is also outstanding!!|Professional attitude, attentive, shows genuine concern and respectful in his analysis of your issues. Went to him for a second opinion of my issues. Went in a different direction from previous care. It has been only a few days now but pain is gone and am sure the prescribed medication and physical therapy will only keep me in a good place. So far very happy with my results. It only shows that a second look at the same problem can reap benefits.|I appreciate this doctor's outright honesty -- not to mention is very dry sense of humor!  After my third visit, we had established a course of action for my treatment, thus he said I did not need to continue to come see him until our course of action treatment was completed -- which could take months!  If the treatment ended u being successful, then great!  if not, there would be a Plan B to look into at a later time.  My particular case would remain open and I could call to ask any question I may have.  You can't beat that.  He is professional and yet fun, honest and efficient.  I have been very impressed by him.|Dr. Bruhnding has the most pleasant, reassuring bedside manner. His explanation of treatment and desired results comfort the anxious mind. His staff of nurses are angels in disguise who answer questions compassionately and make you feel valued and important. Overall, my visits as a recovering hip replacement patient to OSMS/Dr. Sullivan & Dr. Bruhnding have proven successful on my path to recovery.|Super Doctor! Caring, compassionate, explains things where you understand it. My injection was successful. Very personable. OSMS has a way of getting the best doctors. I have nothing but the highest praise for your practice!! Try and get a neurologist.|I have searched for 8 months for answers to the source of my pain.  i have had 6 mri's, been to 6 different doctors in my small town.  one visit with dr bruhnding gave me answers and relief.  I almost cried during the visit.  the 3 1/2 hour drive was well worth it.|Dr Bruhnding is a very clean cut, professional gentleman. I appreciate his patience, honesty and transparency. I had steroid injections for l4 and l5 and he answered every question I had. His nursing staff is beyond polite and caring and Im grateful to be treated at this location, every step of my visit the staff treated me with kindness and honesty.
I have no issues whatsoever with returning for treatments and guidance here.
Update 10/18/24- went for a second set of injections and everything was just as pleasant and simple as the first time!
Thank You!!!|I was referred to have a consultation with Dr Bruhnding, a Pain Management Specialist, by DR Avery my Rheumatologist. Both physicians are providers at OSMS in Green Bay. Dr Bruhnding is a breath of fresh air. Everything about him is very special. He was prepared about my case. Presented what the options were to treat my ailment. Addressed what should happen with the two options I have. Plan "A" at the initial visit. Follow-up in a month. If no result, then what the plan would be for Plan "B". My husband an OD, and I both agreed that Dr Bruhnding receives an A+. I recommended him for your pain management needs.

column11: Interventional Pain Specialists of Wisconsin, S.C. is dedicated to diagnosing and properly treating pain-related conditions with compassion and expertise. With offices located in Rice Lake, Hudson and Eau Claire, Wisconsin, our clinics specializes in a broad range of services, combining both traditional and innovative alternative therapies to develop a personalized treatment plan. We are committed to providing comprehensive care that aims to pinpoint the pain source and alleviate the discomfort, as well as, restore function and improve overall wellness. #painmanagement, #interventionalpain, #minimallyinvasivespine, #regenerativemedicine, #ketaminetherapy, #spinalcordstimulation, #peripheralnervestimulation

column11:
Innovative Pain Care is a privately owned and operated clinic, giving the providers the opportunity to treat patients as individuals. We understand that not all pain is the same and that there is not a one-size-fits-all answer to various complaints.

The providers at Innovative Pain Care have cultivated relationships with various providers in the area, allowing the ability for a wide variety of referrals/ recommendations should a patient need additional care outside of our scope of treatment.

Being an independent clinic gives us the opportunity to treat patients within both the Aurora and Ascension system. We are not confined to one specific hospital system.

column11: Dr. Vishal Patel is an interventional pain medicine fellowship trained anesthesiologist. He offers a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that focuses around individually tailored medication management, interventional procedures, minimally invasive surgical options, physical therapy and integrative medicine. Conditions treated included spinal arthritis, disc disease, spinal stenosis, compression fractures, joint arthritis, cancer pain, muscular pain and headache. Dr. Patel offers treatments such as radiofrequency ablation, epidural steroid injections, joint steroid injections, minimally invasive lumbar decompression, vertiflex spacers, spinal cord stimulation, intrathecal drug delivery and other interventional techniques.

column40: I attended this office today early this morning at 9 o'clock just for reference on how long I waited later on and seen Dr. Quintana Along with his nurse, George. George was extremely rude throughout the entire visit, although he tried hard to hide the fact that he either had a reason to dislike me after immediately meeting me the first few minutes or just doesn't like his job very much I'm not sure but he was very rude very short very curt with me and I seen the doctor for maybe a total of two minutes where he spoke very fastly. I'm 100% not exaggerating that he was in my room for a total of 3 minutes. This is all happening before my surgery mind you so I have a ton of questions. I'm scared. I don't know what to expect. The doctor told me that he had to go call my surgeon to touch base and he would be right back at that time I was taken to go do labs. I thought I was gonna go back to see the doctor after that because I had tons of questions and then the nurse George, set me in the waiting room and says I'll let you know if the doctor needs anything else from you. I expressed to the nurse that I still needed stuff from him. I have questions. I need to talk to him and he rudely interrupted me and spoke to me like a child "that is why I'm going to ask him if he still needs you" was his exact words not OK I'll make sure he knows that you still have questions for him , I was also promised a call back because again they did not give me any follow up instructions or any instructions at all. I had questions about the day before the operation on what medications I'm supposed to take and not take now I have no idea of any of that because he wouldn't call me back and it's Friday. I stupidly went home and fell asleep before it was early enough to call him back so that on my part is my fault but I am very unhappy with the treatment I received , I'm a person, I'm scared and they did nothing to help ease that. Now I see my surgeon Monday and I have no idea if he got any of  the answers to questions he wanted either. I don't know if I'm supposed to take my normal medication's the day of surgery, nothing. This is a surgery that can't be put off much longer before my bones are healing the wrong way. I don't feel like I was treated like a person today. I literally feel like they just shoved me out as quick as they can and I understand it can get busy but each Doctor should spend as much time with a patient as the patient needs within reason. He sent some random lady out and told me to leave by the way not even the rude nurse George so I could look at George and say well I still have questions. I'm gonna wait. I have no idea who the woman was or and when I explained to her while I still needed to talk to him. She said well he's going to call you again. I never received a call. I would not recommend this to anyone if you can avoid it. This was my first encounter and they made me feel so bad about myself And left me still scared I was hoping for answers today because I've been terrified about the aftermath of this surgery as I will have rods and screws put in This doctor couldn't even give me five minutes of his day to let me know what he was going to do.|

column2: Arpan J. Patel, MD - Edgerton Hospital Pain & Spine Center
column11:
The Edgerton Hospital Pain & Spine Center provides a balanced approach to pain treatment that focuses on restoring patients' function for their daily activities.

Dr. Patel offers a range of pain management services, including treatment of the following pain conditions:
Back and neck pain, including sciatica and work-related injuries
Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)
Nerve damage and muscle spasm pain
Shingles pain
Arthritis pain
Headache pain

Our balanced treatment plans include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy and other services, as needed.

I found the office staff really nice and extremely helpful.
I liked Dr. Patel but I don't feel like he truly listened. I get it, he's the doctor and the one with the medical degree. However, this is my body.
I was told about an App and a book.
This was literally the worst thing you could have given someone in the state I was in.
My body is not hyper aware, I do not have fibromyalgia, this is not in my head, it's not a mystery illness that no one can see, the pain was caused by an accident.
Finally I found a doctor who confirmed the pain is coming from the torn muscle. Not anything else.

Had the doctor listened to his patient my life would have drastically improved.
Not every patient is a text book case. Being open minded and listening is the key to medicine.

column38: Carolyn Bultman|Teresa R|Shannon Clark|Mr Exclusive|Michelle Just know|Kim Welch|Angel Flennory|Eli Lee
column40:
Dr. Purewal and his staff are wonderful!  I have been seeing him for lower back pain.  Clair, his NP, saw me first and reviewed my symptoms and x-rays.  She brought Dr. Purewal in and they both agreed that steroid shots for my back would help.  They were very professional and took the time  to listen to me about my concerns.  We were able to get those shots scheduled in a timely fashion.    I was back to feeling better in no time.  Thank you to Dr. Purewal and his staff for helping me.|I had an appointment with Dr Purewal on 1.23.23. I was told that masks were optional for patients. However, it was mandatory for staff. After meeting with the medical assistant and the NP, a man walked in. He introduced himself as Dr Purewal. Should I believe him??? A man walked in with scrubs on, no lab coat, and no name tag.The scrubs looked like he slept in them. Not very professional. I was most impressed with the fact that he walked in carrying a mask, which he never did put on his face. He asked me where the pain was. I told him head to toe. He said, in your back. The NP began to explain my back problems. The NP and the Dr were talking as if my spine wasn't bone on bone, as described by my spine Dr. Then, Purewal began to discuss steroid injections. I told him that my throat closes from steroids. I had told him about an episode that I had experienced in the hospital. I had received a steroid injection through my iv and shortly after, I couldn't breathe. My throat was closed and I was choking. The nurse had called my Dr and was instructed to put my bed at a 90 degree angle. I sat that way for hours. There was nothing that could be done. I had to wait for the steroids to work their way through my system. Purewal said that was impossible. I had said that all medicines are preservative free??? He said, don't tell me how to do my job. I said that I'm asking. He said that all steroids that are injected into the body are safe and there are no possibilities of side effects. He also said,I must have been nervous when I received the steroids. Which explains my breathing issue. There are plenty of side effects with steroids. Purewal didn't like the fact that I said no to steroid injections. Then, he had said that I was in the wrong place. I said, I guess that I am in the wrong place and grabbed my purse and jacket and walked out.

Per internet search:  "Hypersensitivity reactions to steroids are divided into two categories. Immediate reactions, such as Anaphylaxis, which occur within an hour of drug administration and Delayed Reactions, such as Contact Dermatitis, which occur after an hour of drug administration."

Just because I have a reaction to a medication that Purewal never heard of, doesn't mean that it doesn't exist. He wasn't there with me when I had trouble breathing. I know what happened. For all I know, the reaction that I had was a one in a million chance. No physician of any specialty should disregard what a patient reports has happened to them, regarding a medication. I will never return to Purewal for any medical reason. Hopefully, whoever is reading this review, will think long and hard before choosing Purewal.|Dr.Purewal was unprofessional and not concerned with patient care at all.  The nurses could not find a vein to insert medication and had to hit my fiance's wrist which shows how uneducated his staff is (over a week later his wrist is all bruised up).  We scheduled a simple injection for back pain caused by two botched back surgeries in the past from doctors at St. Luke's Hospital.  We have gone through chiropractors, acupuncture, physical therapy, medications, cortisone injections, etc...Purewal stated after the procedure when we asked what the next step would be and after speaking with him it was so hard to understand his ENGLISH that he cut us off and said he does not make a lot of money and spending 20-30 mins was all he had time for so we should schedule a follow up appointment.  There was NO WAY we were coming back so we had to tell the 2 giggling girls on their phones to please cancel any appointment that was scheduled and they laughed and said "bye".  This is not a joke and this dr. and his staff were not at all interested in comprehensive PAIN & SPINE treatment.  Save your $ and time.  Two days later we went to see our PCP and he laughed at Dr.Purewal and told us to NEVER return to him again.  He had an attitude from the moment I read his lips to understand  him and was so negative it was depressing.  I warn anyone going to the clinic off of S. 20th Street between Oklahoma and Morgan.  The only reason for the 1 star was the initial intake reception area had nice ladies working the desk.  All the rest of the staff FAILED.|Every appointment is very informative he's understanding, he also takes the time to listen.. I've always felt welcome from the staff. with that being said I'm thankful and it's at the top of my list for recommendations.. the doctor and facility as a whole.  D.S|I have been a patient with Dr Purewahl for over 10 years. I highly recommend him. He has a great personality and he is very thorough in his practice.|Doctor & the entire office staff are respectful, polite, extremely helpful & friendly.  My husband & myself have been going to this office for years & we don't have enough good things to say about them. We would recommend this office to anyone in need of pain relief.|He Was Mean To Me. Wanted me to Change My Insurance.Only Gave Me Half A Prescription & I live too far for that. Talked to me Like I Was Dirt Because I Answered his Question as to Why I Left My Previous Doc. whom He Obviously knew & Loved ! Talked So Rough & looked So Mean at Me  there Was No Way I was letting. him Enter My Spine or Render Me Unconscious--NO THANKS!!!|Have to say I've called there more than once I came in for an appointment never got to see any doctor she took the street from me cuz she said whatever it was busy and I got charged my insurance company never got paid backb are you telling me that the doctor didn't couldn't see me or ria making up excuses

column40:
Finding Select Pain Care was life changing for me.

Over the past year, I have struggled with pain in my hip/sciatic area and it has completely taken over my life. I am an active and athletic person! I saw two different chiropractors, a sports medicine doctor, and even did physical therapy. None of it gave me relief that lasted.

I found Dr. Scott through a friend on social media and I knew I had to give it a try. I am SO happy I did because I can finally say I am on the right path and have been CLOSE TO PAIN FREE. I am almost to my "taper" point in my sessions and I couldn't be happier. I can now do my workouts daily with no pain and I haven't been able to say that in over a year.

Thank you to Dr. Scott and his team! They are amazing and make you feel so comfortable when you come into the office. It is worth it. TAKE THE CHANCE if you have tried everything, like me!! (:|I found Select Pain Care while on Instagram. Having played college, pro and high level amateur soccer my body has been beat up pretty good. I had shoulder pain in both shoulders for some time and found some relief from PT but not as much as I would have liked. Since coming to Select Pain Care both shoulders are feeling great! It's been a great experience. Thanks|Select Pain is an outstanding clinic.   I'm an active person (hockey, cycling, running, gym, etc.) I started developing lingering knee pain that persistently worsened.  It got to the point where I thought I wouldn't be able to do all the activities the enjoyed.  I thought I was just getting old and that's what happens.  So, I went in and had the consultation with Dr. Scott.  I'm not going to lie, I was a bit skeptical, but was at the point I was willing to try anything.  I started noticing the improvement immediately.  He was honest and said it would take multiple seasons to fully fix the issue and symptoms could return because of my active lifestyle. It took time, but I continued to see improvement and today I'm moving better than I was prior to when the pain started.  I'm going to continue to do my part and stick with exercises Dr. Scott showed me.  I'm writing this to say thanks to Dr. Scott and his staff for their expertise and effort. Great work!|Scott and Team are truly amazing at what they do! He is able to pinpoint the nerves that need attention based on where I'm having pain & I've seen so much improvement. Very happy I was recommended here - didn't think it was possible to not have pain, but they are showing me it is possible!|Strongest recommendation for Dr. Scott and Select Pain Care - this place truly is the answer to all your pain issues and it's shocking that this type of health solution is not more widely known or available.  Dare I say, magical?! I had a lingering running injury that extended from my glute through entire leg that rest, stretching, massage, balls, rollers, therra gun, you name did not fix.  Within ONE MONTH, JUST ONE MONTH, I was pain free.  Not only am I pain free, but Dr. Scott educates you on your injury to help with prevention.  This place and the people treat you with respect, care and dignity - do yourself a favor and truly get cured without endless doctor fees and prescriptions.|Would give 10 stars if I could!  Dr. Scott and his team worked around my schedule to make appointments easy and convenient for me.
Dr. Scott diagnosed and provided the first treatment for my pain in my right arm right away.  Appointments always started on time and were informative, I appreciated the fact that he explained what was happening, and why he was doing the things he was doing.
Select Pain Care is an excellent place to get treatment for pain.

I have been a patient three times now.  When I came in previously for knee and left arm pain, Dr. Scott recommended exercises to prevent future injuries/adhesion, and sure enough years later no new issues in those spots!

Thank you Dr. Scott and team!|Dr. Scott and his whole staff are truly lifesavers. I have dealt with lower back/sacrum/hip pain for over 5 year resulting from a work out injury and have honestly tried everything from PT, Dry Needling, Chiro, massage and so on to only have temporary relief. After one month the pinching that I have struggled with for years went away (I was shook...) and I am forever grateful. I have also worked with Dr Chris and both docs are truly the
real deal and actually listen to you. I was also amazed at how the initial consultation was a hour and everything was so thorough. Ketsy, Calliva and Haley are also so sweet and wonderful. Highly recommend the Select Team to everyone I know looking to get pain relief!|Before seeing Dr. Scott I was laying on the floor each night with nerve pain and getting zero sleep. I tried Accupuncture, physical therapy, dry needling and more with no help. Dr. Scott helped me sleep again leading up to a back surgery.

I now can sleep through the night and they are helping me recover from my ALIF surgery.

No one else Ian doing what they are in the Milwaukee area and I'm glad I found them. Stanley the emotional support dog helps as well :)

column40:
I've had back problems for years. I saw Dr. Zaidi in Interventional Pain Management and he is very thorough and explains procedures he'll be doing for me to understand. I've had spinal injections done and my back is finally feeling better. I also see him to get trigger point injections for other muscle pains and am getting great relief. The nurse and staff was also very nice and accommodating.|"Emily L" nurse or PCR incorrectly and deliberately lied in our interaction/charting. After being a patient with Lawal for 4 years- I am tired of feeling unheard. After being advised to hold off scheduling the injection, and advised to go into the ER- I did just that. I then called Monday, and was told the soonest in clinic and Out of clinic appt was  3 weeks away. Though, tried scheduling the injection the previous week. I never refused the given date, but instead wanted both an in-clinic visit scheduled along with the existing ESI INJ. Appt. Called today to find out I wasn't even on the books for a back shot. Went into MyChart & realized the nurse I spoke with incorrectly worded and described a completely different interaction... though my mother was present during everything.

Being with this clinic for 4+ years, I feel that often times a patient's problem is dismissed, unheard or ignored.... I'm simply tired.  With my lupus chronic pain & my bulging discs, I simply just wanted to see my doctor in person to discuss the recent ER visit. Very disappointed with the clinic, the doctor and whomever handled Dr.Lawals scheduling team on 20th street.|I came with my Mother today at pain management for her appointment with Igwe, it seemed like a pleasant appointment at first then she asking why my mother was wearing dark sunglasses when she has a doctors note for.  After we got home she put a lot of negative remarks about her both me and my mother were not too happy about it either.  Igwe seems more concerned about the PHA Caitlin's notes and history with my Mother there than my Mother herself.  My Mother needs to take a muscle relaxer and pain medication for her degenerative discs in her neck and spine. she has completed both physical therapy and chiropractic requirements and will try to find other formsof care. she is physically unable to take Nsaids and a various number of narcotic pain medications due to vomiting and intolerance, and needs to make physician aware of.she also has received trigger point injections twice this year, and under interventional pain wrote yes refill of gabapentin ? which she doesn't take due to allergic reaction. Also my mother did not ask for a TOC from caitlin, caitlin said she put a TOC and referral from my mother to igwe. just can't understand why the whole focus is on caitlins previous care of my mother and the things my mother didnt do years ago during a time of grieving the loss of her husband ( my dad) and to just focus on the present?|The reception team are all racist!! Do not get services at this LOCATION!! If you want to be treated equal. This isn't the office for you. The only male receptionist was very rude & negative towards me about coming late for an appointment that I was told it was okay for my late arrival. I was kicked out the office & treated like a criminal. Please don't do any business with this office. I have never been treated so low. I've been a patient for 15+ years and never had this issue happen. Please do letter Aurora with how you treat your patients.|Had to reschedule a pain management appointment, I spoke with someone who transferred the call. Someone named Shawn came on and I could barely hear and I was speaking he told me curtly if I'd let him speak I responded if you spoke in a manner loud enough for me to hear perhaps communication would be better. He got an attitude and told me he spoke with Kate and I wouldn't be getting another appointment until November..I said what about a wait list however I'm doubtful he's placing me on one. Very poor service....|Used to go to this pain clinic a couple years ago, and because of them, I gave up on pain clinics and luckily my primary doc took over prescribing my narcotic which I have taken for years, is pretty low dose, and I use extremely responsibly. It's what's kept me off disability.  The people here are cold/indifferent, borderline rude.
They prescribed high doses of ibuprofen for me, which caused me side effects of my heart. Come to find out that due to my 2 heart conditions, I am not supposed to take NSAIDs. They weren't helping either.
When I went back for follow up, they pretty much called me a liar and said there was nothing more to do. I stopped going.
My primary is now going to wean me, so I did Google search for PM clinics and when I saw rating of here, decided to give my warning to others also.|Nobody seems to understand your pain other than yourself. They took away the one pain medication that I can actually tolerate and helped my pain. They won't give you medications you've been taking for pain relief but they will give you a stronger medication that can be just as dependent on and could cause harmful side effects worse than your previous medication just cannot understand the difference? And then the withdrawals from your previous medication that they won't prescribe for you that your using for pain is enough to make you go to the emergency room for. I guess they just don't understand or care about your unique situation or make exceptions. I mean I could see an adolescent or young adult but an older adult that is in dire pain and needs the medication and takes it responsiblely it just doesn't make sense. It's something to consider if you plan on going to this clinic.|My mother went today and received really bad care. The nurse Caitlin had a bad attitude and disrespectful to my mom and I don't like that.  how can I go about reporting her because it's almost every visit that nurse gave attitude and they don't use gloves when they touch her medicine. They don't even have a glove dispenser.

column2: Interventional Pain Specialists of Wisconsin, S.C.: Altoona
column11:
Interventional Pain Specialists of Wisconsin, SC, which has locations in Hudson and Rice Lake, Wisconsin, is dedicated to providing compassionate and comprehensive care to those suffering from spine and pain-related conditions. Our approach combines traditional interventional techniques with innovative therapies, ensuring that each patient receives a personalized treatment plan tailored to their specific needs.

Our team specializes in a broad range of services designed to alleviate discomfort and restore functionality.

column11:
The goal of the our pain treatment team is to help YOU live YOUR healthiest life possible by easing pain symptoms and restoring function and movement. Our pain management physicians are anesthesiologists, interventional radiologists, and physical medicine and rehabilitation specialists.

Together, our board certified pain management clinical team are the "backbone" of our non-operative spine-care program. The team uses state-of-the-art techniques - including medication and innovative procedures - to help ease pain symptoms caused by a number of different conditions. A wide range of precision diagnostic tools, advanced procedures, and innovative therapies are used to design treatment plans that are customized to our patients' specific needs.

column38: Sean Mitchell|Brooke|Rickety Crickz|Paula Mikkelson|Alan "Al" Johnson|John Sprague|Cory Collette|Brody Bostwick
column40: I never saw or heard from the doctor.  It even sure there was one there. I was seen twice by the worst nurse Practitioner I've ever met in my 57 yrs in this planet. Her judgemental attitude towards me was very off putting. This person continues lyrics tried to sell me on surgery which is; as I had told her over n over, not an option for me at this time. And then after telling me in the most entitled and condescending way possible they were not going to prescribe any opioid and that there's nothing they will do for me I walked out. The judgmental attitude is my reason why I left. Beware if you need help this place is not the place to go. If ya want your insurance to get billed for redundant BS then sure this is yer place. I highly recommend you find another place for pain management.|Where to begin this nightmare. My last 2 visits ended in tears because I have never been more frustrated and more upset at the lack of empathy and compassion from a healthcare provider in my life. I have had severe debilitating back pain for 5 months. It has clearly interfered with all daily activities and work. I was first prescribed a steroid pack and lyrica (a nerve pain pill) when these didn't work I called the office sobbing in pain. I was told there was absolutely nothing they could do until I came in for a follow up- which the earliest appointment was a month away. In order to do ANYTHING to help control the pain while I waited 30 days I took large amounts of OTC pain med (Tylenol, Advil, aleve etc) it was my only option. When I had my follow up I was honest and told them how much OTC pain meds I was taking, hoping to convey exactly how much pain I was in because I was repeatedly getting the feeling they did not believe me. Amy gave me a stern lecture about it and when I asked what was I supposed to do, that's when she said "you should have called" WHICH I DID. But as I tried to tell her that, she cut me off and did not allow me to speak. It took over a month to get my MRI results. Which were available in 6 days through my portal. At my next visit, in severe pain, Amy scolded me and told me to "sit up straight" twice when I could barely manage the pain from sitting and that was the only way it felt semi ok.  Who says that to someone in severe pain? She then took me off the pain reliever that was helping- due to high blood pressure- spoiler alert, my blood pressure was high because of extreme pain for 5 months and also anger and frustration dealing with their office (it was normal and documented at my annual visit with my PCP a week prior to this and I have an at-home cuff to monitor), so she put me on a different pain reliever. The new one gave me extreme headaches and when I consulted with a second opinion they were shocked I was placed on the new medication because it had even HIGHER amounts of cardiac side effects than the first medication. In your appointment there is no room or safe space for you to communicate your questions or concerns. If you have a differing opinion or challenging questions you are met with a higher-than-thou attitude and it becomes incredibly awkward. As soon as I mentioned I was getting a second opinion and would do some research, the vibe changed real real fast. Do yourself a favor and seek care elsewhere.|I started seeing Amy Maass to manage my pain care, she had prescribed me Belbuca without telling me about the warning for tooth decay. I had a med check and was going to be bringing the medication with me to be disposed of. I have several health issues and cannot drive. I forgot to bring the medication and was told if I do not get it there in the next 2 hours (when they close) that my account would be permanently flagged, I would not ever get opioids or controlled substances again, and if it wasn't there by Thursday, they would file a police report. My extreme frustration was met with anger from Dr. Maass when I stated "I don't understand how doctors have all this wiggle room, but patients who have documented health conditions that even cause memory problems, aren't given the same understanding" she yelled "don't you group me in with those doctors when I've been trying to help you!" Not realizing she is just another one of those legal drug dealers that wanted to push opioids that I quit taking because of the side effects. She is another reason patients are slowed down from receiving proper health care.|Every one has their own story as to what brings you looking for a place to go when you are suffering with chronic pain. First and foremost, you are exhausted emotionally and physically from the pain. Secondly, you're probably just exhausted from not being believed your pain is that real it has depleted who you once were and you just want a little bit of "normalcy" to feel anything but just pain your in day to day. I have been through all the ups and downs from before Dr Sohn started the clinic through the growing pains as Wisconsin Spine and Pain started up. I know everyone will have different experiences but I can only elude to mine. I have never felt like I have been treated like I didn't matter or at the same time like I was lumped together in a pool of "just another chronic pain patient looking for medication".. I have seen many doctors with all I have been through and Dr Sohn is one of the kindest at the same time most attentive of them all. Remember you go into a dr visit listing your symptoms but also listening to what the physician has too say in options too help. Dr Sohn has done that vehemently! But, I continue to be more and more blessed that I get too see and be a patient of Amy Maass his PA who has continuously listened too me and help suggest procedures to help calm down my pain and symptoms! She has been an emotional boost in listening and believing me and more so believing in me to help continue to help myself stay the best course I can to living as full of life that my body allows. And her demeanor and positivity only bolsters my mental health all the more as well. I am honest with them and they are honest with me and it creates a wonderful relationship between any Dr. and patient. The whole staff in Appleton has been kind and considerate. There is a branch in Green Bay but since the one has opened in Appleton I prefer to stay closer to home. Yes, it has been a long road to find a the drs I could trust and believe are truly there to really help me and put me and my health first and foremost- again with kindness and compassion from all the staff.|Amy and staff are very professional and like to have fun while working.|Visiting Wisconsin spine and pain yesterday was like reading the glorified brochure to Disneyland and ending up at the Schitts Creak Motel, I planned my trip with filling out all the forms beforehand on line and was extremely accurate, I had hopes of lowering my daily pain first and foremost and working on measures to help in the future, the moment I mentioned pain medicine the conversation changed to "we use interventional pain care" and will not prescribe opioids, so after all the time I wasted getting the referral, filling out all the paperwork and having hopes to live a better quality of life without pain were dashed like a dirty smelly pool at a dirty window operation, I was extremely disappointed but then realized that this will be another operation that will go bankrupt with misrepresentation and double billings in a blink of an eye, I would stay away if given the choice.|The staff is what makes it so wonderful for me|

column2: Advanced Pain Management: Jeremy Scarlett, MD
column38: Jenny Sam|Laura Warren|Barbara Edwards|Jenny Buelow|Rachelle Margenau|Sue Lefeber|Mary Jo Kupsch|Ken D
column40:
**TL/DR** medical negligence leads to Scarlett dropping me as a patient and I'm filling a formal complaint against him**

I've been a patient for nearly 7 years. I came in in May as the recent treatment didn't work and I had to quit my job as I was not physically capable from the pain. It wasn't until August (no pain management in the meantime) that NP Mary discussed a Facet injection. Her inaccurate notes that omitted the fact the recent procedure was ineffective caused my insurance to deny the injection.

I made a follow up with Scarlett and discussed my concerns about inaccurate notes. He assured me that she's since retired and there was no further cause for concern. He then agreed to order an epidural for my back. During our discussion, I brought up that I like aqua classes at the YMCA but couldn't afford a membership. He asked if I wanted a referral to aqua therapy also. I agreed. I specifically asked if I needed to contact Wisconsin Spine and Pain about the epidural, he said no. They would call me within a week.

5 weeks later, no call. I contact the nurse line, and he didn't even put the discussion about the epidural in our notes!! I told the nurse I needed to speak with Scarlett. There was no call back, but the director, Ruth called me to tell me that Scarlett was discharging me as a patient because of this. She refused to take my complaint and refused to provide her email so I may file my complaint with her. Additionally, she said I stated that I would be filing a complaint against Scarlett's license. I told that was untrue and I had a recording of the conversation to prove it. The letter I received discharging me as a patient listed my need for recording as the reason for the break.

THEY DO NOT WANT TO BE HELD ACCOUNTABLE.

I guess he doesn't want to be held accountable for medical negligence. I'm now definitely going to file a formal complaint to the board after this action. There's much more, but it would be a lot to quite.|Dr. Scarlett and his staff are extremely knowledgeable with up to date procedures to help relieve pain. I have been his patient for many years after several unsuccessful surgeries. They are always helpful with any need and extremely compassionate to your individual issues.|Excellent doctor. He is the best. I cannot say enough good things about the Sheboygan surgery center and West Bend office. Pain  management is there for you to get help with your pain and that is what he does best above and beyond. Carrie his nurse is his right hand girl. She goes out of her way to help me. Kate is another nurse who is on point. Virginia is anesthesia she is wonderful in Sheboygan. Michelle is desk reception kindness greets you at door. So many more. West Bend office Tracey is anesthesia, great at her job. Amy is the schedule and nurse checks you in always a smiley face. Lois is West Bend office always helps me get my appointment to work. Then Christa a wonderful PA who is professional and sweet words filled with  compassion. All of these people help him run his ship. Dr. Scarlett  is an intelligent doctor who has your best interests at heart always trying to keep me painfree and give me more time with my son. My spine is a mess and he has worked with me for over 5 years. I truly appreciate everything they all do for me and many more that I didn't even mention. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.|Dr. Scarlett is one of the best Doctors I have ever seen , he listens , and genuinely cares about each patient.  Is up to date on all new and innovated things .|Dr Scarlett is skilled in assisting in reducing a persons pain level at his NEW facility called 'WISCONSIN SPINE & PAIN' same location just a NEW NAME. You can find contact info online, just Google the new name or your doctor.|I feel completely satisfied with the treatment result I received at this visit as well as each previous treatment. The staff at Advanced Pain Management is excellent. They are professional, well trained & courteous.|Dr. Scarlett listens to me and makes me feel I am part of my treatment plan. I would highly recommend Advanced Pain Mangement.  I only wish they came to Manitowoc more.|Went there at the request of my surgeon. Dr. Scarlett is a great Doc. Really down to earth got right to the point and helped me straight away. 2 thumbs up.

column40: Dr Noto is a joke. His bed side manor is down right insulting. I saw him ONE time and he told me he couldn't help me. I had so many questions and concerns and he just didn't care to listen. How is he still in practice if he down right ignores a patient?|Dr Noto has treated both myself and my husband for our herniated discs, also implanted a spinal cord stimulator in my husband's lower back so we have seen him quite a few times. His nurses are kind and compassionate but also thorough and responsive. If you're struggling with pain, you should go see Dr. Noto. If you're struggling with CRPS pain... you need to go see Dr. Noto. No one or any where I've gone is as knowledgeable and experienced.|After trying to work with Dr.Noto 2 spinal injections later, I've come to the heartbreaking realization that he's only concerned more with his ego as opposed to listening and working with his patients for the best results for pain management. Go elsewhere, you're better off.

column40:
Dr. Meier exhasutingly attempted to help me with severe back pain. He provided an honest diagnosis, was transparent and helpful about second opinions and provided real treatment options. He truly cares for his patients and that was evident throughout my experience.  Ultimately I was referred to a spinal surgeon by Dr. Meier and received excellent care. column40:
I am 71 and both my hips were painful if I walked more than 3 blocks.
I am active with 3 bowling leagues, water aerobics and dog walking duties.
I started treatment in June and finished in November.
The pain in my hips is very much diminished.  The reaccuring pain in my groin and back are also diminished.  I was excited to hear today that the stem cells are still working and that the healing process will extend another 6 months. The Green Bay/Appleton crew was great to work with.|Could not recommend QC Kinetix enough! I received bilateral knee injections that have improved my quality of life tremendously. I can now sleep through the night without knee pain, go up and down stairs with ease, and don't have constant knee pain.|My back was killing me, I could barely get out of bed and stand up straight.  That went on for about a month until i tried QC Kinetix.  Shortly after my first injections and Lazer treatments, my back started healing.  4 months later my back Is better than it was before.  I'm feeling 100% with no arthritis.|The staff was highly qualified and very knowledgeable about what they were doing. This doctor is biased against men. She refused me simple effective relief through nerve blocks for 12 years because I mistakenly trusted her. Subsequent pain clinic doctors upon hearing her treatment of me would shake their heads, gave me nerve blocks, and put me on the road to recovery. But if a patient is female Bratanow can even overprescribe. I saw this myself in the reception room. Secondly, she left me in an exam room for 90 minutes before coming in with another patient. She has a nice smile, but it is a put on. She screwed me out of 12 years of my life. BEWARE!|Always ran out of medication because no one ever was in the office to approve refills. Consistently ran 1-2 hrs late for appointments, often waiting there long enough to have to cancel and reschedule. During a scheduled procedure that was scheduled for my neck, she tried to inject my lower back. She didn't know what I was even there for. After telling a friend of this (she is an x-ray tech who has worked in the room with Dr. Bratanow), she informed me that when the doctor gives injections, she orders general anesthesia so that you don't know she is only injecting you just underneath the skin, not actually hitting where the affected nerves are so you need to have procedures/injections more often.|I cannot say enough good things about this doctor. She was assigned to me while I was in the hospital for my Crohn's disease. She had successfully been able to find some good alternatives to the traditional opioids that typically would cause constipation, which is not good for someone with stomach issues like me. She is very smart, and will be starting to work with her to manage my migraines, as well.

The largest thing that was important was the time she spent with me, explaining each of the medicines, as well as her wonderful bedside manner. She really truly cared for me while there, and did what she could to manage my pain... which is wonderful to feel validated when you don't feel well at all. I would recommend her in a heartbeat!|If you want and have to get off opiates she cares and can make it happen !! I'm soon to be one of them, after 12 yrs for back pain were going to make it happen in around 7 months !!!|No one answers the office phone and they don't call you back. column2: Midwest Sports and Interventional Spine: Cyril Philip, MD
column9: Anesthesiologist|Pain control clinic|Pain management physician|Sports medicine clinic|Sports medicine physician
column11: Searching for pain management near Lake Geneva, WI? At Midwest Sports and Interventional Spine in Franklin, Wisconsin, Dr. Cyril Philip, MD, provides expert interventional pain management solutions for patients throughout the Lake Geneva area. Dr. Philip is double board-certified in anesthesiology and interventional pain medicine, specializing in minimally invasive treatments and non-opioid therapies to address a wide range of pain conditions. With advanced training from Loyola University and a Pain Management Fellowship at Harvard's Brigham and Women's Hospital, Dr. Philip brings unparalleled expertise and compassionate care to each patient's pain management journey.
column38: Nancy Parrish|Robert Bowers|Nisarria Castellanos|David Yep|Kevin Parker|nitin joneja|Varda & Company, LLC|Neil Gupta
column40:

So happy our primary physician referred us to him.|Dr Philip has successfully treating my wife for several years and has been the only Dr. to help her with her lower back pain.  Dr. Philip and his staff have always been very caring and helpful.|I had the most excellent experience getting treated by Dr. Philip. The staff is also very welcoming and professional. I have been getting epidural injections for many years. A few years ago Dr. Philp was recommended to o me. What a difference! More aggressive trying to relieve my pain.
On 11/5 I had the Milds procedure. Wow. Day 1 I was able to walk up the stairs without pain.
Dr. Philip, Kay and entire staff at both locations are very compassionate and professional. They understand. Thank you|Dr. Phillip, Kay and the rest of the support staff at Midwest Sport & Spine does an excellent job of listening to my concerns and recommending treatment options.  Highly recommended!|I have bursitis in my left hip which would not respond to stretching, OTC pain relievers, or topical treatments.  It became aggravating and disruptive enough that I brought it up to my primary care doctor who in turn referred me to Dr Philip. I was evaluated and scheduled for a cortisone injection which has provided the relief I was seeking.  I am able to sleep on my left side without discomfort and am walking virtually pain free.  The minor aches and pains I still have are not in my hip but are likely attributable to the change in my gait from when my hip was the issue.  I expect them to resolve in time now, or maybe not since I'm 73 and if I don't wake up with something aching I probably died. In any event I was very pleased with every aspect of my experience with Dr Philip and gladly recommend him as a pain management specialist.|Dr.Philip and team will work with you to heal/ relieve pain with skill and safety. They are personable and friendly,  can't ask for more!|Dr. Phillips is amazing! He always takes the time to talk with me about my chronic pain and my overall care plan. He explains things in A way that I understand. I don't just feel like another "number". He makes me feel comfortable and has amazing bedside manner!|I was being seen for my disc that's been causing me pain for years. Shortly after my procedure I was able to do more than I've done in over 2years the first month. Highly recommend Dr.Phillips office and I love the rest of the staff! They all work well together and create a positive atmosphere for healing. This was my second time working on a PT plan there, once for my knee and now for my back.  Both were successful!  Thank you all for your great support, encouragement and professionalism!
Deanne|I received physical therapy from this amazing care provider. Throughout the process, the entire team was extremely helpful and kind.

I would recommend this place to anyone who needs physical therapy.|I've been to multiple physical therapy places and this one is by far my favorite. They are a great group of people and the facility is very clean and organized. The front desk staff are always super friendly and helpful. Dr. Robinson and the team are very knowledgeable and personable. If I am in need of physical therapy again I'll definitely be going back here.|Wow. I was desperate for help with the very first severe back problem I ever experienced. They got me in that day and I literally went in with a wheelchair. They helped enough that day that I was slow but walked out. From there I made progress every visit. 6 weeks later--no pain.
There is no place I've ever been that had all-encompassing treatment. From chiropractic to massage. Red light therapy and ultrasound to STEM to PT and various other medical treatments to help healing. Lots more that I can't remember but all good stuff if you need it.
The team works together under one case manager so all disciplines are cohesive.
Love these guys!! Thanks again to my team of pros!|My visit with ACS was a very good experience. I walked in limping and a pain level of 9. And walked out without a limp and pain level of 2. column38: Kimberly Spillers|Paula K Starr|Martin Nystrand|Tim Melka|Julie Stafford|robin rouby|Maureen Ryan|Larissa Root
column40:
Dr. Faull is an arrogant, rude, and condescending doctor. My Dr. retired and I was transferred to Dr. Fault. First visit, he was undoing my long term controlled care from my older Dr. because he didn't approve of the meds I've been on for a decade. He wouldn't listen to anything I had to say. It put my MS into chaos. He tortured me for 5 years. He disregarded my neurologist when she tried to explain to him what his actions were doing to my body. I was seeing his PA monthly, as he wouldn't see me personally. When the PA, told me to make an appt with him about my issues, he would have his receptionist call a couple days before and ask what the nature of my appt would be. Then he would ultimately cancel the appt. He did this several time. Even his PA would apologize. Just a coward of a man.

I finally switched providers and found another pain Dr. I've been with him 2 years now and I'm back on track.

The clinic I go to now has inherited a lot of Dr. Faull patients that he did the same thing too. I won't repeat what those Dr's say about Dr. Faull but they knew exactly what he is about and what he was doing. I'm a very hard case and he didn't want to deal with me. That was obvious. He should've just said that instead of torturing me to leave. He's just a very rude man.

I have nothing good to say about him. He shouldn't be working in this area of medicine period.|Dr Faull is an exceptional doctor. Where other doctors were perfectly willing to just leave me in horrific pain in both knees, barely able to walk and sinking rapidly into despair, Dr Faull proposed a plan. Nerve blocks to see if they help and if they do then do a nerve ablation. Now I will be the first to admit that I am afraid of needles and unknown procedures, always envisioning a painful experience. Now some very busy specialists of his caliber have little to no patience when it comes to such nervous Nellie patient's. Dr. Faull was most compassionate and gracious. He knew I was ready to jump off that table and run. His two lovely assistants who helped with the procedure were equally compassionate. Those young professionals learned that skill set from someone and I'm going to guess it was Dr. faull. What an amazing team. The nerve blocks gave me sweet relief for a couple of weeks from a devastating pain. I now look forward to the ablations and a longer period of pain relief from this pain. Dr. Faull is the Best of the Best. I am ever grateful to him for his expertise.|I've seen Dr. Faull several times and have a good sense of his skills. Nearly all my experiences have been negative. Treating my spinal issues, he injected an epidural, which failed. He next proposed the very same injection, which SSM rejected because he had done it before with poor results.

I most recently saw Dr. Faull for a morphine injection, first calling attention to my MyChart records, which lists morphine as a problem for me. Furthermore he failed to assure me that a new lower dosage of morphine would not cause the same problem as I had experienced the first time.

Finally, he ignored or failed to read my Med list to see that I take ambien at bedtime. Morphine reacts negatively with Ambien - taking both drugs can be a dangerous combination. Dr. Faull must not have checked my med list.

To sum up, in my case, Dr.Faull ignored both my medical history as well as his own treatment records, and he is unfamiliar with the research literature on dangerous drug Interactions.

Dr. Faull can be rude. When I flinched and said Ouch during an injection, he told me the problem was my attitude!

I'm moving on to a new doctor.|Caring, compassionate, knowledgeable, thorough are all qualities of Dr. Thomas Faull that I have experienced first hand. He is always thorough and compassionate with me. I never leave an appointment with him with a single question, or with any of my concerns unanswered. He looks for solutions and doesn't offer BS. He's simply one of the best physicians that I have ever had, bar none. I highly recommend Dr. Faull for finding answers and solutions to pain issues.|I want to thank Dr. Faull for everything he has done for me.  I went to him when I was in so much pain from rear end car accidents.  He worked with me every step of the way to finally become almost pain free.  The last Mild procedure was the ticket followed up by PT.  He listens and explains things so I could understand and never once did he ever make me feel like I was crazy and the pain was in my head!  You gave me back my life I cannot thank you enough.|dr faull was wonderful helping me with neuropathy caused by a neuro-stimulator implant at another healthcare provider. i would highy recommend him.||

Dr. Zhou's unique integrated approach combines traditional Chinese medicine techniques with modern therapeutic methods to address a wide range of health concerns.

At Dr. Zhou's Acupuncture & Pain Management Clinic, patients benefit from a carefully tailored combination of acupuncture, herbal medicine, and medical manual therapy. This multifaceted approach allows Dr. Zhou to address not only symptoms but underlying causes of discomfort and disease. Each treatment plan is customized to the individual's specific needs, health history, and wellness goals, ensuring the most effective path to recovery and optimal health.

Services Offered

The clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions, sports injuries, stress-related disorders, digestive issues, and women's health concerns. Dr. Zhou's expertise extends to helping patients with anxiety, depression, insomnia, and fatigue. Many clients report significant improvements not only in their primary complaint but in their overall sense of wellbeing and energy levels.

Patient-Centered Care

What sets Dr. Zhou's practice apart is his commitment to thorough assessment and personalized attention. New patients receive comprehensive evaluations to understand their complete health picture before any treatment begins. This holistic perspective ensures that all aspects of physical and mental wellness are considered in developing effective treatment strategies.

column40: I struggled for 10 months, saw 2 orthopedic surgeons and a sports medicine doctor trying to find relief from my severe knee pain.  Finally an orthopedic surgeon told me there was nothing structurally wrong with my knee and recommended I try alternative medicine.   That same day, I made an appointment with  Dr. Zhou.  After the third appointment I noticed a great deal of relief.  The inflamation was greatly reduced and I could walk with no pain.  I am currently in Physical Therapy  and can bend my knee 115 degrees.  I have no pain and for the first time in almost a year, I have hope for a normal future!  My only regret is that I didn't go see Dr. Zhou sooner.|Dr Zhou has been my saving grace for years. He has fixed so many things on me that most doctors have either tried to medicate away or had wanted to do surgery on. From what felt like lightning, tingling, and numbness in my arms and hands, to when I lost the ability to lift my arms from shoulder pain, and then a bacteria that messed up my guts from overseas, he has fixed it all. Most recently, it feels like he saved my life and my sanity and gave me another chance to live and function again. I was in a car accident that gave me such a bad concussion that it affected my speech, vision, and hearing, made my tinnitus worse, and I could barely be touched without pain. It caused a deep depression and anxiety, severe nausea, and memory issues, and left me with problems being able to comprehend and utilize information I was reading or hearing. I have been seeing Dr Zhou for a few weeks now and I really wish I could have made it to see him sooner, I can only imagine how much better I could have been feeling but I am so glad I started seeing him when I did, because my reading, speaking and thinking is so much better already, my body doesn't hurt no where near as bad anymore, everything just feels so much better! Dr Zhou is definitely a gifted man, and I am so grateful to have him looking out for my health and wellness.|Dr zhou is absolutely incredible, I have been dealing with back pain for the last 3 years now, stemming from high school sports and being a concrete laborer. On top of that car accidents. I have been seeing him twice a week after my last accident and I have to say I would be no where near the level I am at now if it wasn't for him. Just today I told him I had a sharp pinch in my back when I would bend down or bend backwards. While I was standing he had poked one spot and said okay bend, and it was unbelievable the pain was gone just like that. He really is a gifted and talented man. If you've ever been on the fence about acupuncture or want to give it a shot Dr zhou is your man.|Dr Zhou has helped me and my family tremendously. I have long covid and have tried everything American medicine has to offer with no relief. Dr Zhou has been helping me get better and has given me hope. We have been doing acupuncture and cupping one week a month. We have been coming here since 2008. We are from superior wi so it is a 5 hour drive that's how amazing this place is. I also had been blacking out when turning my neck on my motorcycle. So I was able to get on my motorcycle for the first time in 4 years this fall. With no incident of blacking out. My mom has multiple herniated disc's throughout her spine and in renal failure. Dr Zhou and his team have been able to help her tremendously with her pain with great improvement. We are so thankful for all the help.|I am sleeping so much better after seeing Dr. Zhou. I had not been able to sleep at night, which was causing me a lot of anxiety and stress. Thank you so much Dr. Zhao!|Dr Zhou has helped me every time with muscle pain. After trying to walk it off and chalk it up to getting old I decided to try Dr. Zhou.  One week and four sessions later I played a round of golf pain free today. Very disappointed in Dr. Hord. My mom was a long time patient and was dismissed by Dr. Hord on mychart. My mom found out by reading her chart. column40: I was very disappointed with my last appointment. My Doctor left and they gave me a replacement. While the appointment was fine I was very disappointed that a 10 minute conversation cost me $490.00. My former doctor only charged me my $25 co-pay. I have been on the phone with 4 different parties. This appointment was simply a follow up regarding my herniated discs. I decided to go off of a medication, was advised that that would be fine and was given a new 5 day prescription. I do not understand why this is nearly $500. When I was told my original doctor was no longer there the front desk did not inform me that the new doctor might not be on my plan. I feel lied too and basically screwed over. This is not the way to treat patients. All my doctors are Aurora doctors and this was a shock and a huge disappointment. I might be ok with even half this as I understand seeing specialists can cost more but nearly $500 for a 10 minute conversation??? This is incredibly unfair.

column38: Joan Wangelin|Roy Debruin|Peter Garvey|sherri Burgess-olson|Kelli De Ruyter|Jackie Reardon|Jim Fulcer|Ann Grischow
column40:
Dr. Ziegler did a wonderful job on my knee!!! Had my surgery 10 weeks ago so nice to walk without a limp or any pain.|I had Dr. Liebelt replace both of my knees 6 weeks apart and I'm extremely pleased with the results. It's been 4 months since the first one and 2 1/2 months since the second and I'm fishing, golfing, climbing ladders, and getting a start on all my projects I've been putting off.
Every step of the process was easy from scheduling appointments to the physical therapy after surgery.
I saw Luke Pan for my PT. He is an amazing therapist that knows exactly how to motivate and help you to get the best possible results.
I will recommend the team I had to anyone who is considering knee replacement surgery.|Hip replacement by Dr Liebelt and his team. Went very well and after three weeks I was more comfortable than before the surgery. Rehab has been steadily positive. Gave positive recommendations to any I talked to and two people I know have gone through the same procedure with only positive results|I had an injury from a year ago on my ankle and was referred to Dr Michael Kozanek!
I was scheduled for a MRI after seeing him  hee proceeded to call the same day with results and options. Because I had suffered this injury last year, I had already done physical therapy and immobilization so the next logical step was surgery.
My expectations day of surgery were beyond any scope that I ever experienced before!
Dr Kozanek took  the time, before surgery, to explain to me what he was going to do and where the incision was going to be, what to expect, etc.
I have never been more pleased with a doctor and his team!
I will tell everyone I know they need to see him and his team. Thank you so much all of you!!|I was hesitant to go forward with my hip surgery in March 2024, but it was long overdue. From my initial contact with Dr. Liebelt and his staff, it has been a very positive experience. Even when the follow up didn't go as planned, Dr. Liebelt and team rectified it quickly!  I would not hesitate to recommend this team. The medical assistants, nurses, PA's, surgical teams and Dr. Liebelt all made me feel comfortable and continue to follow up. I am excited to be able to all things I couldn't do before!|I had a total left hip replacement three weeks ago by Dr. David Liebelt. For 22 years I walked with a 5/8 inch shoe lift on my left shoe. Dr. Liebelt stretched my leg out so I no longer need a lift on my shoe. For 22 years I walked in pain. Today, Thank's to Dr. Liebelt and his staff I no longer have that horrible pain. I swear it's a Miracle!  Thank You Dr. Liebelt!  You are Simply the Best!|I am writing to share a great story. I had to have emergency hip replacement surgery. My Doctor is Doctor Liebelt.  He is awesome!!  He came to the ER on Sunday at 5:30AM to see me and call his team together for surgery on noon on a Sunday.  He was absolutely brilliant in fixing my hip!!  He explained everything in detail, and made me feel important and confident.  I have never before been treated this great during a difficult time.  I can not recommend Doctor Liebelt highly enough.  He, and his amazing team work very hard and so well together!!  Best medical experience in the world - then you add in a wonderful Physical Therapy team in a state-of-the-art Medical Facility (Thedacare Orthopedic Spine & Pain) ... there is just nothing else like it in the Fox Valley Area.  Thank you very much to the entire team and kudos to Doctor Liebelt a special man and brilliant doctor/surgeon!!!|I was referred here for physical therapy for my chronic neck and back pain by my physician and I can only say positive things about my PT experience at Thedacare. I worked with Kelly and she was the most understanding and kind PT I've worked with! She made the sessions very educational and was very easy to talk to! I am more motivated and believe that I have the resources to continue living pain free. I would recommend them to anyone and would go back!

column40: (Dr Jennifer junghen) I've NEVER had such a horrible experience with a medical professional!!! When I decided to see another Dr. instead of Jennifer, I made an appointment. The appointment was booked out aways and I had an upcoming appointment with Jennifer to refill all my meds. So the morning of the appointment I received a call from Jennifer's nurse asking if I had planned on seeing if I had planned on seeing the other doctor in the future? I said most likely yes. She said Jennifer said don't bother coming into seeing today the, she'll just refill your gabapentin until my visit with the other doctor. I said ok great and thanked her. But then I thought about my other meds? I thought she probably meant she'll refill them all. WELL- I WAS WRONG! She refilled only my gabapentin and a one month script was split into 4-week individual fills. I was wondering why she did this but then I realized it was out of spite! She was upset I was going to see another doctor so she was making things more difficult for me!!! AND WHY DID SHE NEVER FILL ANY OTHER OF MY OTHER OF MY SCRIPTS ??? What a ....! All out of spite/ BE CAREFUL ABOUT THIS ONE!!!!!|Stake was arrested in 1999 along with his wife for buying and distributing cocaine. Take anything he says with a grain of salt. His staff are the real ones who run the business. Sad commentary for a little man.
